prompt: more and more jobs and tasks are done by machines Nowadys,more and more jobs and taks are done by machines which invlove hard physical work.Do these effects of this trend outweigh the negative effects?
essay: There was a conspicuous tendency that high-technology machines implemented in a variety of industries in recent years. Some people hold a passion opinion about this, but I believe that enables people to live in a more convenient life. Ċ Owing to the fact that lots of physical hard works were undertaken by the machinery,promoting people a bigger space in innovation and creativity. As for individuals, people are free up in the repetitive and body-harm physical works, which saves them much time and energy. From the community side, their management can become more efficient and convenient through the labor-saving machinery,another case in point is that these machines save their labors costs a lot. In the development of industry, after the machine finishing the basic work, people are able to devote in intelligent area,such as projects produced,engineering design or liberties writing and so on. Ċ As a proverb goes, there is no garden without weeds. Seen from the negative aspect, some potential problems we cannot deny. Relying on the high-technology for a long time, people may cause a sense of dependence. Besides, with the increasing of losing the jobs which replaced by machines, the employment will be more competitive. However these results are also unavoidable in the process of society developing, which forces people to acquire advanced knowledge and skills to meet the requirements constantly. In short, these competition that results in machines undertaking more tasks can make people to work hard to keep a dominant position. Ċ In conclusion, the proliferation of the machines is a two-edged sword. But I believe the employment competition also brings some positive influence to some extent.

prompt: Nowadays, people travel to other countries for a holidays. Ċ Why people do so? Ċ is this a positive or a negative development for the countries they travel to?
essay: Tourism gains its popularity all around the world, except for paying abroad visit. The reason for this trend is still a difficult question to discuss while some people believe that this development brings lots of negative effect on the countries having a large number of visitors. However, this essay will show some clear explanations and a huge benefit for the nations with tourism evolvement, with an appropriate conclusion. Ċ Concerning that humans choose a distinctive destination for their break-time and going abroad is always the best choice. Foremost and first, travelling to other countries brings visitors a peculiar feeling and sense of exploration. For example, Australia is famous for its modern infrastructure with fabulous forests that appeals to tourists from several nations to relax after a hard-working time. Moreover, researchers and students have opportunities to gain interesting knowledge about other cultures and traditions. It is quite useful for them to acquire great information to supply for their project or future career. Ċ Travelling abroad development brings a wide range of significant advantages to this country's economy and social reputation. Firstly, tourism industries supply an extensive profit to this nation's financial system. A recent survey reveals that approximately 50% of interests came from visitors around the world in 2020 in Korea. Additionally, this gives good chances for each authority to advertise their custom widespread through travellers without any campaigns. An illustration of this is that the Vietnamese know general information about Japan which is well-known as the peach blossom place or Italia's delicious plates. Ċ To summarize, although visitors might damage the environment in which they choose to go. The motoring development, meanwhile, the merits outweigh all the small demerits if governments publish strict regulations for travellers. In the near future, I have a tendency to believe that the progress of tourism would play a vital role in each countries' economy.

prompt: In today's very competitive world, a worker has to possess multiple skills to succeed. Among the skills that a worker should possess, which skill do you think is more important, social skills or good qualifications? Explain the reason and provide specific examples to support your answer.
essay: An employee needs to be multi-talented to compete in the job market nowadays. In my opinion, academic degrees ought to be preferred over personal qualities while recruiting the employee for a certain profession. Ċ The academic qualifications are considered to be a major determinant by employers while recruiting a staff member. In other words, the modern education system has led universities to update their syllabi and teach students the latest and advanced knowledge. Moreover, the addition of soft skills and social aspects like team building and developing better communication skills in the degree programmes have largely obviated the need for pre-hand work experience and learning management skills. This is because many entrepreneurs are now focussing on the academic degrees of the applicants, that has, for instance, resulted in the toughest competition amongst students to enter the universities. Ċ Another important factor due to which the formal qualifications get precedence over an individual's trait is because they help in broadening the horizon of a person. For example, a less educated person may perform a task more smoothly than a newly appointed highly qualified individual, but often the former is unable to think out of the box due to his tunnel vision. This is seldom for a literate staff member who can always come up with new ideas with his vast background knowledge, which are often rewarding for the companies. Furthermore, it is difficult for a person to improve upon his education level while staying in a career, however, it is much easier to learn social skills while at work. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that academic qualifications are vital in securing a good employment position because they not only provide the basic background knowledge that is mandatory to perform a certain job, but also help in broadening the vision of an individual.

prompt: Some people fail on their school but achieve success in their adult life. Why do you think this will happen? What causes/reasons may lead to a person's successful life?
essay: It is noticeable that although many individuals who had poor performance academically in their school time,they become very successful in terms of their career or other part of their life. This is due to the fact that information and skills acquired from our education systems are not enough for a promising life in the modern society. Ċ It is undeniable that even a well-designed education model is just focused on giving a majority of young people to acquire some basic knowledge and skills for earning a living in their adult life. These school courses and trainings are just a foundation and beginning of one's life, people need to work hard and use their resources, such as family background and talent to achieve a variety of goals throughout their life. Ċ There are different kinds of reasons that may result different kinds of success. First, having a clear target and working for it diligently are always essential. A person need to set up a clear plan and achievable goal when they trying to obtain an achievement. People's talent and personality is another importance on their way to success. We can notice that many individuals doing similar things with different results in terms of success and failure, not because of making more or less effort but resulting from these two facts mentioned above. There are also a number of other elements, which include family background, chances and even technological development that affects one's life. Ċ To conclude, in my perspective, better performances at school do not necessarily lead to succeeds in our life and vice versa. Because there are countless causes that lead to a successful life. But I insist that working hard for a reasonable goal is always the road for a success.

prompt: Good facilities can be found in cities but not in the countryside. Therefore, new doctors and teachers should be sent to the countryside. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The issue of whether allocating well-trained facilities such as doctors or teachers to rural areas is a controversial one in society nowadays. The transfer is welcomed, albeit with reservations, despite the need to transfer doctors and teachers voluntarily. Ċ The transfer of the good facilities to rural areas is to improve the detrimental conditions of lacking of well qualified workforces. As the result of being understaffed, the countryside suffers the negative chronic effects on the well-being of rural people. Distributing doctors and teachers to those sites helps the residents there enhance their living standard and life prospect. An illustration of this is that if the rural people are well educated, they have the ability to gain more opportunities to change their life. That also assists government in dealing with the problem of improving rural people's life. Ċ It is obviously recognized that the doctors or teachers, who graduate freshly with a degree only, have potential to gain experience in the rural areas. In the city, the opportunity to apply successfully to a job is relatively scarce because of the fact that there are numerous people are in the race for a single position. Ideally, the new doctors and teachers take advantage of chance to serve people in rural areas to gain experience and then, when they return to city, they have more potential to find a job. Ċ Despite these benefits, the place of working should be chose voluntarily by the doctors and teachers. It is not ethical to stop individuals' desire to have more satisfying quality of life. When moving to rural areas, there are increasing problems such as housing, transport, salary. As the result of this, the employees who volunteer to work in rural areas deserve to have a better pay as well as the recognition of their contribution to society

prompt: People are consuming more and more sugar-based drinks. Ċ Why? 	 Ċ What can be done to reduce sugary drink consumption?
essay: Nowadays the consumption of sugar-based drinks has been increasingly popular among people of all ages. Due to the huge variety of drinks available in many different places, people consume them on a large scale which has become damage to people`s health. This essay will discuss why people are consuming more and more sugar-based beverages and what could be done to reduce the consumption. Ċ Firstly, sugar drinks are present everywhere, because of this the access to them is even easier and frequently. The reasons for this current issue could be explained not only for the low prices but also for the celebrity endorsement. Although health organizations try to keep the population loop with negative sides of sugar overdose, social media and large companies make the opposite, in other words, they promote consumption with a low price and misleading information about the product. For example, at a supermarket, a place where the price is written in big and catching letters, but the information with calories, fat, sugar and so forth is reduced in minimum letters to be overlooked by the consumers. In sum, the use of sugar in huge quantity in some beverages has been present among the individuals which result in an uncontrolled overdose. The more social media endorses the use , the more society believes that it is ordinary and healthy. Ċ Secondly, the government should create laws more severe about uncontrolled use so that companies must be punished for unrespect them. These laws should be about the misleading information given by companies and perhaps about the prices. In other words, society should be informed about the real effects of sugar in their body before they have access to the product full of unreal and unhealthy information. For instance, an aware person about the cons of sugar certainly would be a person more prepared to make good choices about sodas and foods, which results in a society more healthy. In short, if there were laws more rigid about the disadvantages of sugar, the population should not consume sugar sodas on a large scale. Ċ In conclusion, there are many sodas at supermarkets with an excessive quantity of sugar, which leads to soaring high consumption by the population. This essay argued why individuals are consuming this kind of liquid with more frequency and what could be done to stop the overdose.

prompt: Some experts say for road safety cyclists should pass a test before being allowed on public roads. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Almost every individual has a bike in The Netherlands. Because of this, sometimes it can lead to dangerous situations on the public roads. Therefore, some experts want cyclists to pass a test before being allowed on the public streets. I will outline to what extent I agree with this group. Ċ Firstly, we all learn how to cycle in The Netherlands. They have mastered cycling at a young age because their parents have taught them. Besides, at the primary school will they be subject to an unofficial travel-safety exam. Thereby, the general level of cyclists on the road is very high in, for instance, The Netherlands. This results in fewer accidents. Ċ Furthermore, we also stimulate people to go by bike. This is because we want to think more about the environment. If we introduce a test for a cyclist, the incentive to leave the car will be reduced. Nevertheless, there are also states in which it is not common that you practise how to cycle at a young age. Arising from this can be stated that it will lead to more traffic casualties. For example, in Spain is it not a regular activity to ride on a bike within the city. They often look at these people like they are tourists. In those countries will it be more dangerous on the road. Ċ In conclusion, it is unnecessary to require someone to take an exam before they are allowed to cycle in countries where the general level of cyclists is already quite high. However, in countries where is it not usual that individuals go to their destination by bike, an exam can be used to make the traffic safer.

prompt: Topic: Mobile phones and the internet are very useful. However, it is rare for old people to use them. What ways could mobile phones and the internet be useful to old people? How does the old people to be encouraged using this new technology?
essay: There are many great inventions of the 20th-century. Among the inventions mobile phones and the internet are widely used in our life; nevertheless, old people rarely use them because they have not realized the benefits of mobile phones and the internet. Ċ Obviously, mobile phones and the internet could be useful to old people in various ways. To start with, both of them are convenient. For example, if old people carrying mobile phones encounter difficulties outdoors, they will call for help immediately instead of finding a booth. In addition, the internet can help old people to collect extensive information. There is no doubt that searching for news online is effective and time-saving. Furthermore, people using the internet can save their money. As is known to all, online shopping provides a platform for individuals to purchase cheaper products. Ċ As mobile phones and the internet are helpful, it is necessary to encourage old people using them. Firstly, to help old people get familiar with the new technology, our government can offer some elementary courses about using mobile phones and the internet. Secondly, the fees of network services can be reduced for seniors so that they will be willing to use them. Last but not least, we can propagate the ideas that using mobile phones and the internet can better our life. Once old people are aware of the advantages brought by the new technologies, they will start to use mobile phones and the internet intentionally. Ċ In conclusion, old people should not stay away from the new technologies and they should be encouraged using them.

prompt: Traditional Food Vs International Fast Food In many countries, traditional food is being replaced by international fast food. This is having a negative effect on both families and societies. To what extent do you agree or disagree? The Processed Food Deluge
essay: In recent years, International fast food companies have spread their branches to some countries. It causes negative impacts not only in the issue of health but also in cultural identity which replaced the traditional food. I strongly agree with this opinion that International fast food will lead to negative impact both on society and family. Ċ First, junk food produced by International Companies will directly affect to the local cuisines in the particular area. It makes the sales of Small Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) in that country will decrease due to loss of customers who move to modern fast food. While it hard to avoid International fast food entering into one country, traditional food cannot easily be forgotten as it has cultural values to the country. Second, in terms of healthy, according to current research, junk food contains unhealthy ingredients that cause a number of different diseases to the human. For example, a substance called MSG that mostly found in junk food caused slow thinking for those who consumed often. Other chronic diseases such as high blood pressure will impact to the most of the people. Ċ In the family scope that usually consumes fast food, will disadvantage by losing their family closeness due to the less of time spending together with family members. For example, mothers who not cooked in their homes will unlikely to have a good relationship with their kids because they invest less time to their kids or other family members. Ċ In conclusion, it seems to me that junk food obviously leads to several problems both in society and the family. All stakeholders should rethink about the strategy to solve and prevent this problem for a long-term objective.

prompt: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Attending a live performance (for example a play, concert or sport event) is more enjoyable than watching the same event on television. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
essay: There is an argument that people may get more pleasure by observing a live show than watching it on television. While I accept the fact that overwhelming amount of people prefer to watch a performance on the TV, I completely agree with that statement for two reasons. Ċ First of all, people on a live performance are more involved. Have you ever seen an exited face of a boy who was invited to assist a magician in a circus, for example? Actors often work with the audience, talk to people, try to conduct a link with them. Moreover, producers may organize an extra show for the audience. For instance, I saw how children were involved into a little competition before a hockey game and a child who scored more goals got a prize. Ċ Second, such a pastime is a good way to cement relationships between relatives. For example, my wife and I frequently go to the theater or concert. After a show we discuss it and share our impressions. At home we hardly spend an hour together because of children and grandparents. Besides, attending a live performance helps to develop a special bond between a father and children. For instance, I take my son with me to see an ice hockey game and during the game I discuss with him various topics such as the ice hockey rules or importance of a nice behavior in society. Ċ To sum up, I totally agree with the argument that observing a live performance is more delightful. On a live show people are more involved and it is an appropriate way to improve relationships with relatives.

prompt: when cars and cyclists use the same roads, there are often problems. why is this the case? Ċ what are the solutions?
essay: Problems on the streets are increasing day by day because people use these for their movement from one place to another. But, mostly, issues are arising with cars and cycles using the same roads. Let us discuss why this is happening and what can be done to solve this for a better understanding. Ċ To begin with, roads are not wide enough so that, cars and cycles could run comfortably without creating any problem. In other words, cycles are slower than cars and it becomes difficult for both passengers using the same road. For example, when overtaking cyclists, car drivers have to wait for a long time to clear the other side of the road filled with cars for their safety. In addition, Car drivers must follow some regulations applied by the government while, for driving a cycle, there is no rule. There are some roads where drivers must not pass other vehicles like cycles, rickshaws and so on. If they do so they will be fined and create traffic jams. Ċ However, To solve these problems the governments have to think of building separate tracks not only for the commodity of the vehicles but also for the safety of riders. For instance, they could build small streets alongside the big roads as they are already for footpath passengers. Therefore hazardousSuggestionTherefore, hazardousTherefore hazardTherefore hazard hazardTherefore hazards on the roads will not be created by these vehicles. Ċ To conclude, Same roads used by the cars and cycles generate many problems due to the insufficient width and rules for the commuters. But, these can be combatted with the help of the street authorities.

prompt: Some old people today struggle with the use of modern technologies such as smart phones and computers. What is the cause of this and what are some possible solutions?
essay: In the Past-faced life, technological advancement is developing rapidly and becomes an essential need of humans. However, few aged persons, including our elderly, face problems using technological gadgets like laptops and smartphones, appearing as an obstacle these days, eventually. The upcoming article will discuss the reasons and the appropriate solutions that need to apply with the help of relevant illustrations. Ċ Firstly, the primary cause behind this impediment of hardship in using technological assets that comes under consideration is probably the generation gap. In other words, the old-aged public is habitual of using older gadgets that were prevalent in their times such as landlines and other items and the advanced level assets need many knowledgeable skills to use them so, it is pretty difficult for them to change their monotony suddenly and make themselves comfortable in using that stuff. For example, a smartphone of various brands is trending these days that indulge so many functionalities including application software, which seems extremely hard for an old age person to use as he is not aware of them indeed. Thus, new technological material is updated enough to handle for an old-age public. Ċ Nevertheless, there are possible solutions to resolve these issues, including advancement awareness and change in the environment. Specifically, children need to guide their parent about using upcoming technology-based items. Similarly, the authorized personnel should help their employers attain these items by introducing new computers into the official premises. For instance, in the banking sector, all paper works need to be done with the help of virtual data storage devices used in laptops and personal computers; as a result, employers can enhance their knowledge according to the new advancement with determination. Ċ Lastly, after discussing the causes and looking forth of possible solutions, everyone has the right to learn about anything regardless of age; therefore, a family member and as well as colleagues in a business corporate ought to take responsibility to help an elderly and business persons in getting knowledgeable matter about uprising technological gadgets, which they use daily.

prompt: Many people have now a poor memory. What is probably the reason and what should we do to improve? "In the modern world, poor memory arises as a prevalent human condition. This essay will explore some probable causes for this brain degradation and its feasible solution. what affect our memorizing skills?
essay: As the technology develops, people don't particularly need to memorise anything anymore. A human brain can no longer store as immerse data as a computer do. The technology makes it even easier when any social network like Facebook has now a function of reminding automatically the user of his friends' birthday or events. The dependence of technology weakens, therefore, human memory capacity. Ċ Besides, the increasing pollution makes this condition more universal. Research shows that people live in a heavily polluted area are more likely to struggle with memorising numbers and person's name than their peers in a purer region. Air pollution particles could attack anyone and happen to damage slowly brain functions. Ċ Solving these two main issues would be the key to recover intellectual health. While it is really difficult to change living area or individually mitigate environmental pollution, anyone can change their habit toward technology. Like physical body, the brain needs practice to function effectively. They should start with trying memorising important things like upcomming due dates or list of follows-up activities. Beside, finding a strategy to remember seems to be a long-term solution. Visualising the relationship between things could really facilitate the memorisation process. Ċ In brief, the modern life is seemingly creating a new generation of poor memory. However, with regular practice and an appropriate strategy, people would at least prevent themselves from the possible embarrassing situation where they would forget to celebrate their own birthday just due to Facebook disconnection."

prompt: Everyone has taken a risk at some time in his or her life. Write about a risk you have taken. Discuss why you took this risk and whether it was worth taking.
essay: Some people are eager taking risks on their life, feeling great for overcoming with the obstacles. Others deny taking risk for their own safes. As for me, riding a motorcycle in Vietnam without a permit was my tremendous risk. Ċ I remember last summer I took a vacation trip to Vietnam for visiting my grandmother's hometown. Motorcycles and bicycles were the mainly transportation in Vietnam. Unfortunately, international driving permits and the U.S drivers' licenses were not valid in Vietnam; nevertheless, the processing for applying a driving permit was complicated, so I decided to rent a motorcycle for my transportation without the permit during my staying. Ċ Riding a motorcycle in Vietnam was extremely dangerous. The traffic was chaotic. There were poor road conditions with uneven pavement. I was almost making an accident when I bumped into a big hole on the road. I didn't even see any speed limit or yield signs on the way. In addition, motorbike riders and pedestrians didn't obey traffic's rules. The traffic moved on the right, but drivers frequently crossed to the left to pass other vehicles and pedestrians who crossed the road illegally. Paying attention and concentrating were very much to do for my riding. It was highly anxious when I had to prepare to break frequently because other drivers sudden stop anytime. Ċ Consequently, everything that I had done was a risk and it wasn't worth taking. Yet, the possible outcome could be harmful to my safety. I might end up my life in a motorcycle accident or I might kill a pedestrian with my inexperience driving.

prompt: In many countries it is now illegal to advertise alcohol. Do you agree or disagree? Advertising alcoholic should be banned
essay: Smoking is one of crucial social problems, but alcohol also becomes major concern because many countries have prohibited all the ads of that. It is agreed to ban the companies to promote alcohol due to the detrimental effects on our body and the power of media to influence consumers. Ċ Advertising alcoholic should be banned because it is harmful to human health. Drinking to much causes some serious illness such as liver cancer, diabetes, and heart diseases. Despite the utility to warm our body, most people consume alcohol only for entertaining and finally have terrible end. For instance, Indonesia has huge problem with alcoholism and many men were dying because of it, but after the government restrict the promotion of alcoholic at television, newspaper, and internet, it is resulted a significant reduction of such cases. Ċ In addition, it is inevitable that ads could persuade someone to buy more alcohol. This strengths of promotion could danger innocent people who might try alcohol as well as the addict ones. The main goal of any advertisement is to sell more, and the irresponsible part is when they distort the fact by only mentioned the positives and cut the drawbacks. I often saw billboards with a picture of handsome guy who drink beer accompanied by pretty and sexy women to show that drinking alcohol is cool and enjoyable in many billboards for example. The ads never talked about the danger impact for long term huge consumption. Ċ In conclusion, if a country want to drop the number of drinkers, they should restrict the alcohol ads for the sake of community health. So, what can society do? They could support the government, and be critical of exaggerated promotion.

prompt: Learning English at school is often seen as more important than learning local language. If these are not taught many are at risk of dying out. In your opinion, is it important for everyone to learn English? Should we try to ensure the survival of local languages and, if so, how?
essay: Nowadays English has gained popularity in schools which, to some extent has overpowered the usage of vernacular. If such a practice is not checked, local languages may go to the verge of extinction. In my opinion, learning English is vital in today's era. Nevertheless, at the same time, we cannot ignore the importance of our mother tongue. Ċ To begin with, there can be a number of reasons for everyone to study English. The first reason could be, it is universally used as a means of communication in major working industries. For instance, a person with having knowledge of the language can be eligible and could opt for a job anywhere across the globe. Moreover, a great amount of information is written and accessible in English. Knowing the jargon, an individual can get access to a vast amount of data. Ċ Despite the fact English is favoured by many as a means of communication, one ought to try to protect the waning rate of native vocabulary, not only for its verbal usage but also to preserve its rich heritage. The local speech is a part of national treasure and identity. Thus, its' state cannot be ignored and should be under control. For example, in the past, many nations lost their identity and disappeared because they started speaking only in a foreign language. This potential threat could be prevented by effective policy from the authorities. Firstly, the medium of instruction in school should be in local accent and English can be treated as a subject. Secondly, a person who is linguistic should have higher priorities in the labour market. So, that more and more people can be motivated to learn their local language. Ċ To conclude, bearing in mind the above information and deliberating all facts, it can be deduced that although it is believed that English is necessary to succeed in all walks of life as it makes one more confident; however, both international as well as native languages, need to be respected equally. Equal efforts should be made by the public to learn both languages either international or local.

prompt: Many office authorities impose a restriction on smoking within the office premises. Some governments have even banned smoking in all public places. This is a good idea but it takes away some of our freedom. What are your opinions.
essay: Considering the health of smokers, governments and some corporations are taking steps to restrain people from smoking publicly and in work premises. A few sections of society think that this is a positive movement of authorities, however, others argue that such initiatives will curb their freedom. In my opinion smokers should be allowed to smoke in designated areas away from public and this essay will discuss various reasons for my standpoint. Ċ Firstly, smoking significantly affects the fitness and is the biggest cause of oral and lung cancer. Even the secondhand smokers, people who inhale smoke release by smokers, are equally prone to the diseases. For example, in a country like America, designated smoking areas are built and smoking in public places is banned and fines are imposed if anyone is found using cigarettes in public place. Therefore, looking at the enormous risk, smokers and non- smokers should be segregated. Ċ However, some believed that restricting people from smoking in public and office places is an unfavourable regulation and has taken away some of their rights. Smokers argue that cigarette smoking has direct relation to their workplace performance as a result, such restrictions will disturb their daily life. For instance, it has noticed that many employees just leave the organization just because it puts high rules for a smoker. Hence, the compete restrain should not be implemented all of sudden and the smokers should be given the chance to quit the smoking habit. Ċ In conclusion, due to various health related problems, the regulations bring by many authorities will put a positive impact on society. On the other hand, if alternative smoking location made available, smoking can be banned at all public locations without making any controversy.

prompt: a new job - consider the money only? It is sometimes said that a high salary is the most important factor in choosing a job.Do you agree or disagree?
essay: In modern time, looking for an excellent job can enhance one's quality of life. Most people believed that hight salary is the key element in all reason. I disagree with this point. The statement will be addressed Ċ One of the most controversial issues related to high revenue can not enough afford the extra expense. This is due to the fact that lots of enterprises concentrate in the business zone of the city which offers high payment to absorb competent staff from other places so that people's expenditure will increase in traffic, rent of house and price of a commodity. In addition, it is difficult to save the deposit for other plans in the future. According to the news, some employee who lives in the city should spend 15years to own house without eating and playing. As a result, their income almost equal to livelihood who live in there. It is a challenge to balance a successful career and a comfortable life. Ċ There is no doubt that a wide range of development of career is more critical than a high salary. The main idea behind this is, the company's culture and regulation affect their talent and value in the workplace. Furthermore, strong resource and personal training is an invisible wealth to increase their profession. It is common to see that a successful company gives staff more opportunity to express their mind and accept innovation. They not only earn money but also obtain achievement. Ċ Given the above statement, it is reasonable to conclude that choosing the job is not just consider the money. In my point of view,I believe that saving and development will affect one's ability in workplace.

prompt: TASK:In many countries, the young generation has lost interest in the teaching profession. What are the factors and what would be the solution.
essay: Since the dawn of time, teachers have proven their importance in the area of education. However, as generations have passed, it is apparent that for some reasons students have lost their interest in pursuing a career in teaching. Ċ Ever since technological developments were made, the roles of educators were gradually replaced by the provision of computers. Many internet users have felt greater convenience on learning lessons through online materials. Thus, this has led most people to believe that the teaching profession would become obsolete in the near future. Apart from that theory, many have also regarded teaching as a low-paying job compared to other careers. An instance of this is commonly observed in countries like Philippines, wherein most of the graduates from educational courses end up having jobs in the call center industry. They took a course in education for the sake of having a higher qualification, and then aim a profession from a different field which has more attractive incentives. Ċ In the goal of preserving and renewing the teaching profession, the state should consider in implementing some amendments to rectify the situation. First of all, salary levels of educators should be raised not only to motivate the existing teachers, but also inspire the students. Secondly, teaching methods should be revised to incorporate modernization of technology with the role of educators. With the use of advanced machines, teachers could focus more on other areas to further improve the standard of learning. Ċ Although many things may have changed in the modern world, it is still an undeniable fact that society still needs the help of teachers. Moreover, it is yet too far that their purpose would be replaced by machines. Therefore, any possible means should be taken to encourage the young in taking up this profession.

prompt: In some parts of the world, people have become more focused on themselves than their communities. What problems can this situation cause and how can they be solved?
essay: In the contemporary era, the public only thinks of themselves rather than their surrounding population as everyone has their own world of responsibilities or work. This trend has myriad negative ramifications such as antisocial community and globally affected societies.This essay intends to discuss these reasons followed by some viable measures for the same with relevant illustrations. Ċ The first and foremost problem of this issue that an individual focus only on himself these days is advancement in technology. Everybody is busy with their own devices without having a knowledge of surrounding areas and people living around them whether relatives or neighbours; hence, lead to the rise of the isolated nation. Moreover, there are some activities that society perform often; however, they do not realize that they can be dangerous. Smoking tobacco, for example, there are millions of folk who smoke every minute and throw its ashes butt away, which, in ,turn produces an inordinate amount of toxic litters on our planet. Consequently, it not only harmful to the present generations but also a bigger threat to the future of the earth. Ċ Some steps should be taken to mitigate this problem to diminish the above-mentioned effects. The prominent one is gathering with the family members as well as friends. In other words, the events should be held in societies where a group of people can interact and get a chance to socialize with the different communities. Celebrating festivals, for an instance, the western countries, celebrate their popular festive together regardless of having regular communication among them. Another considerable step is that law enforcement agencies should make stringent laws on the harmful habits that humans perform unintentionally or intentionally so that they could not affect our population and environment. Ċ To conclude, although some human beings are more persuaded by the advancements in technology and their excess usage which leads to the isolated community as well as they are into negative traits which affect our earth and the people residing on it, some effective steps such as implementing harsh rules and social events can lead to family cohesiveness and harm-free environment.

prompt: I am planning to take the IELTS test. Here is one of my essay. I really need to improve my writing skills in order to get the best preparation for the IELTS test. Topic:It is generally acknowledged that families now are not as close as they used to be. What are some possible reasons for this and what can be done to reserve the trend. deteriorated family bonds
essay: Given the over-increasing pace in modern life, it seems common in many places that family bonds have been deteriorated. In my opinion, some possible ways could be done to minimize the downside of the issue. Ċ To start with, there are many ways in which this unfavorable situation could occur. The primary factor probably is the intrusion of modern technology into family life. In the past, family members were more likely to interact with each other as there were fewer technological diversions. However, in today's life, each member within a family could easily be distracted from family conversation by many hi-tech devices such as smartphones or tablets. Another factor leading to this trend probably is the over-increasing pace of the modern life. Given the fact that people tend to rush through things to ensure an advantageous position in the face of stiff competition, therefore, the closeness between family members would eventually suffer. Ċ However, it is true that many ways could be done to tackle this matter. One of the most promising ones could be ensuring that family members spend sufficient time together and enhance healthy interactions among them. For example, parents may try to reduce the time spent on technological devices at home, such as setting time restriction for Internet usage or arrange more time to chat or play with their child. More importantly, parents should always remember that they are working for a better life with their loved ones, not living to work. Ċ In conclusion, although there are many reasons for the undermining of family's closeness in today's life, I believe that great efforts from both parents and children are likely able to reserve this trend.

prompt: Foreign languages are taught in all levels of schools and other educational institutions. Do you think this is a positive or negative development? What can we do to prevent the loss of our mother tongue?
essay: Nowadays, we can learn foreign languages in all levels of schools and some educational institutions. Personally, I agree with the idea that it is a positive development thought it may impact our mother tongue, and I believe that various we can do to prevent the drawbacks. Ċ Learning foreign languages can benefit people a lot in modern world. To begin with, every language brings its own culture and it is an asset of human beings, learning other languages can help us to enrich our horizons and develop our intelligence, imagination and creativity. People who speak more than one language can have a better career development. They have more chances to get a job in the international companies or work in different locations around the world, which also motivate them to be success in their career. As a result, it is a positive development that foreign languages education is spread among the people. Ċ However, if one language is dominant, the other languages may disappear, we should protect our own languages though we are encouraged to learn foreign languages. The government should develop some polices to ensure mother language is used in schools and the mainstream media. Besides, we should preserve our own culture and strengthen the ethnic cohesion through education. For instance, school can hold some activities, like visiting the historical museum, to let students to learn more about the history. The last thing we can do is to make our country stronger and improve the economic strength. Ċ In conclusion, it is a good trend that foreign languages learning are spread among the people. To prevent the drawbacks of the foreign languages, we should protect our own languages as well as the cultures through government policies, education and the economic strengthen.

prompt: Many people believe that the world’s most urgent problems can only be solved by international collaboration. Ċ Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Some people think that most serious issues can be only resolved by international collaboration. To my mind, by uniting our best minds we are more likely to achieve considerable progress. So, it is agreed with the provided statement and this essay will discuss two main reasons why. Ċ Firstly, I would like to show the UN's impact in stopping armed conflicts throughout all its existence. Many bloody and relentless wars are being stopped by this well-known international organization because opposing and neighbouring governments are not always able to do that. For instance, the war in Yugoslavia was ended due to constant negotiations between more than 500 influential peacemakers from all over the world. UN members' initiatives and cooperation always constrain us from ending up killing each other. Ċ Secondly, let's discuss climate change and how politicians from different countries are fighting against this now. Great success was achieved in cleaning the Earth's atmosphere and world ocean by acknowledging the international standards of manufacturing and recycling. For instance, European ecologists state that the air became clearer by the end of 2021 for the first time since 2000 only after the European countries established some strict regulations. This fact shows that the best minds should work together to make our world a better place for everyone. Ċ To conclude, I would like to say that global issues require professionals from every state since they are called that way. It can be clearly seen that the more we unite the better society we will build for future generations.

prompt: Nowadays schools should not use textbooks because children get bored with books. Using games, computers and TV is a better way to give them new information and knowledge. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: At the beginning, there is no doubt that we should introduce an effective method to teach children. In this regard, some people believe that digital learning processes and games are the best way to guide the pupils. However, personally, I believe that these kind of methods can be additional materials for the studying process, and there are cannot substitute old teaching method, which is based on textbooks. Ċ On the one hand, it is handy and comfortable to conduct lectures on textbooks. They provide us with valuable learning materials throughout the academic year, and they do not depend on electricity and internet. Furthermore, paper-based training materials are available for almost the entire population of the Earth. For instance, there are many regions, such as Africa and Asia, where citizens have not an access to the internet. In this regard, many individuals are not keen to choose them. Ċ On the other hand, using games, computers and interactive whiteboard may envelop children's cognitive development. They can increase school pupils' interest in subjects, because it is an effective way to deliver information. Moreover, during the games, they may find it easy to gain knowledge about the specific topics. For example, many developed countries teach their students, using the methods, such as e-learning or distance learning, and in this sense it is comfortable to use new technologies for them. Ċ To conclude, it is true that the modern world is developing faster than before, and advanced technologies and intellectual games may replace our paper-based study process. However, I believe that textbooks are beneficial to guide the students, as universities are willing to develop students self-study process.

prompt: Technological developments leads to lots of environmental issues. Some people think a simple life style can preserve the environment. While others argue technology itself can solve it. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
essay: Advancements in automation create plenty of climate problems. Due to this reason, many opine that simple policy of living deter this issue, while others contend that by using technology in a positive approach solve this problem. I will like to articulate my view in further paragraphs along with a rational conclusion. Ċ To commence with, Rise in machinery leads to many losses to the climate as the new innovation in the fields of transport stimulate the individuals to purchase captivating vehicles which eventually result in the loss of natural resources and surging pollution levels through the gases released by petrol or diesel. Moreover, an increase in the temperature level due to the continuous cutting of saplings for the construction of roads and bridges leads to global warming. For example, research by the University of Punjab address that in upcoming years, there will be no land available in Delhi due to the increasing population as numerous people from all over India has migrated there in search for the job provided by new advanced hi-tech companies. Thus, the local village area might be used to construct buildings. Ċ On the contrary, the persons who opine to conserve the surrounding with the aid of automation often say that, firstly, some of the improvements in machinery sector protect the surroundings in many ways such as better and environmentally-friendly types of equipment are created which provide prevention from the harmful gases which come from the industries. Secondly, the new water-purification programs have developed which facilitate pure-drinking water to all the nation. For instance, the government in Punjab initiated a scheme in 2018 to distribute the chemical-free water in all areas which directly comes from the dam. Ċ To conclude, I opine that technology amelioration has might lead to many outcomes which affect habitation in a detrimental way and which stimulates some people to adopt a simple lifestyle. although, if it may be used in a positive way then surely it will help to conserve the environment.

prompt: The main purpose of public libraries is to provide books, and they should not waste their limited resources and space on providing expensive hi-tech media such as computer software, videos and DVDs. Ċ Discuss both views with example.
essay: The 20th century has come along with numerous developments such as the digitization, IT revolution and the internet, and these phenomena have upgraded the educational support system such as libraries. Traditionally, the libraries used to keep the books, but now due to lightening-fast internet services modern libraries have more multimedia resources namely, CDs, DVDs and computers. Some critics assert that books should be the primary source of knowledge in the libraries, whereas the others believe that they should be equipped with laptops and computer devices. The essay will discuss both these aspects followed by a conclusion. Ċ The most compulsive reason for enhancing the libraries with the multi-media resources is that the space occupied by them is very less as compared to books. In other words, a single computer or laptop can store the contents of all books in the form digital information; consequently, the operational cost will be lower. The public library of Delhi, for instance, drastically lowered its cost of operation by swapping one rack of books by laptops with internet connection, in addition to this the number of visitors doubled in a month. Furthermore, as the books become older they start to catch the moisture and dust, thereby the content becomes difficult to read, whereas the digital content on the hard drives of desktops is safe for a lifetime. Ċ On the other hand, since the modern concept of libraries came in the last few decades, therefore the laptops or desktops cannot be used by older age groups as proficiently as by the younger generations. For example, the public library of Chennai as an experiment closed the books section for a month and opened a free internet section. They found that the number of people with age group greater than forty decreased by 90%, while the number teenagers doubled within that month. Moreover, excessive use of mobile phones or laptops for activities like games or studies has an adverse effect on the eyesight, so the book as a medium to study is still a crucial component of one's academic life. Ċ To conclude, one must adopt the most suitable way to study depending upon his requirement. The digital transformation can help the quick and easy access to the latest developments around the globe. So, one must adopt new methods to gain access to upcoming research.

prompt: Playing a musical instrument is one of the most important achievements for any child. To what extent do you agree with this statement? Learning how to play a music
essay: The role of music in our life is widely debated, with some people claim that every child should master at least a music instrument. Personally, I agree with this viewpoint, and I will explain why in this essay. Ċ Firstly, playing music acts as a precursor to a child's mental development. It is true to argue that learning any musical instruments, let alone mastering one, is time-consuming, tedious and requires constant efforts. Hence, through the learning process, children may inadvertently acquire patience and diligence, making learning more complicated things such as subjects much easier. Secondly, playing musical instruments is a healthy way of entertainment. Compared to children who spend hours straining their eyes at computer or mobile phone screens, other who consider playing music a hobby are proved to rarely have to suffer from any types of eye disorders. Finally, strange as it may sound, when it comes to one's adolescence and adulthood, the ability of being master in any musical instruments can make him stand out of the crowd and draw admiration. Ċ I do understand the opposing view that getting a child to learn such tough thing as musical instruments from an early age may cause mental damages. Long tiring days of hard training with an instrument without any likelihoods that he would be able to master it may render loss in confidence and self-belief. However, this does not always happen and can be fixed by a loosened timetable or consistent encouragements from teachers and parents. Ċ To conclude, I believe that the ability of playing musical instruments is conducive to any child and should be acquire from an early age. Above all, though, I think that the learning instrument process needs to be a gradual process, based on careful support rather than undue pressure.

prompt: Nowadays, most large companies operate multinationally. To what Ċ extent those companies should have responsibility towards local Ċ communities in which they operate?
essay: In recent years, there has been a trend of offshore expansion of multinational corporations. Although, this will create many employments for the local citizens, their responsibilities towards environment must be the highest level. Ċ It is true that the responsible corporate behaviours contribute to broad-based benefits towards the countries in which they are active. Firstly, since these corporations have had the responsibility towards the habitat, which lead to beliefs of the local people with these brands. For instance, if a company have steps to disposal wastes then the citizens enjoy their new products without concerns with environment. Secondly, the multinational companies should be more active in charitable activities that are the opportunities for them to save the lives oversea. In fact, many nations all around the world do not have the resources to deal with the problems, such as poverty or hunger, so they need a lot of helps of the companies. Ċ On the other hand, the foreign companies can substantially benefit from being socially responsible. By actively protecting the habitat that ensures their sustainable long-term growth, especially manufacturing and mining factories. For example, the coca-cola company had many campaigns of improving climate, therefore they are received such supports from the locals and government. Furthermore, the multinational corporations should be very conscious of their track records when it comes to local responsibility, as these are directly tied to brand names. As a result, if the brand name is remained and enhancing, which is conditioned conductive to increasing the profit and sales. Ċ In conclusion, the corporate responsibilities towards local communities should always be high. This benefits not only the countries in which companies operate, but the companies themselves.

prompt: We are becoming increasingly dependent on computer–based technology. How do you think it will change in the future? Is it good for us to rely so much on computers?
essay: An extremely significant topic today is related to the dependency on computers and other technologies. Even though computers are relatively new inventions, they have become an indispensable part of our lifestyles. In this essay, I am going to elaborate on the future prospects of technology and whether we can benefit from using it. Ċ To begin with, in my opinion, technologies have a promising future. The majority of people today use not only household appliances but also some modern devices such as smartphones, the Internet, etc. This can serve as a proof for the fast pace of electronics development. New occupations are created, for example, programmers and software engineers, who are making innovations in the sphere of computer science. Even so, the dependency of technologies is already detected by many psychologists and many of them are evolving their knowledge of how technologies are affecting our neurological system. Therefore, in the future, they will find a way to treat our digital dependence. Ċ On the other hand, it is not acceptable to rely on computers all the time. Computers provide us with information and knowledge. Nevertheless, recently conducted research shows that they cause us “digital dementia”. “Digital dementia” is a term used to define our disability to remember information, which we could do if we do not overuse our modern devices. For instance, the overuse of the World Wide Web makes us too dependable and we are less likely to think logically. This is because the information is given beforehand and we take it for granted. By doing this , we decrease our memory and concentration abilities. Ċ To summarise , I firmly believe that although computers give us numerous benefits, eventual revolutions will certainly exceed our expectations. However, even if those prospects are extremely appealing to us, we should remain responsible and never use them too much.

prompt: We cannot help everyone in the world that needs help, so we should only be concerned with our own communities and countries. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: It is often believed by some that helping others should be restricted to one's own community or nation, as it is not possible to help each and every one. I completely disagree with this notion and I believe efforts should be made, to provide help to as many as possible. Ċ On the one hand, I agree we always find people, around us, who are in need of help. Assisting them and providing help to them in any form would mean a world to them. These days, even the wealthiest nation have homeless people and any charity or volunteer work would benefit them a lot. For example, people in many countries donate their old clothes and other belongings to various homeless people or even to certain non-profit organizations. As the problems persist locally, I can understand why some people give more priority to local charity. Ċ At the same time, I believe we shouldn't limit ourselves to the national borders. Today the world consists of many rich and poor nations and the richer nations should take a step forward by helping the impoverished lot. For example during various natural calamities, poorer nations could benefit a lot from the aid or help received by the richer nations. This would not only help them to recover, but will also help them in getting back to their feet. Ċ In conclusion, the whole human race, first are citizens of planet Earth and then of any country. Thus, helping someone in need, shouldn't be differentiated on the basis of international borders.

prompt: In many countries, the number of animals and plants are declining. Why do you think is it happening? How to solve this issue?
essay: It is true that the population of plants and animals is decreasing in many countries. There could be several reasons why this is happening, and I believe that technology and human activities are the main causes. Ċ There are various reasons why plants and animals are decreasing in number. Firstly, deforestation has some critical effects on both plants and animals. As human-kind constructsAdd a comma,constructsIt appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase As human-kind constructs. Consider adding a comma. Ċ show examples more buildings and consumes more wood, the trend of deforestation has boomed in recent decades. As a consequence, the living areas of wild animals have shrunk and this has resulted in lowering the number of animals. Secondly, climate changes are a threat to both animals and plants. For example, global warming is the main reason for seasonal fires that happen in the North of Iran. Finally, hunting and capturing wild animals has a direct effect on their population. Ċ In my view, using green energies instead of fossil fuels could be practical in controlling global warming. Car companies had to engage new technologies and made the use of green energies like Solar energy be practical. Moreover, governments should set more severe laws against hunters and companies who cut the trees illegally. Unfortunately, in third world countries like Iran, there are many bands that trade the trees freely while it is against the laws. Also, public awareness should be increased through education, TV programs or celebrities' efforts. There are many figureheads like Bill Gates, who is trying to inform people about endangered plants and animal species. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that via some basic activities the population of both animals and plants could be controlled.

prompt: Some findings have revealed that cities around the world are growing large. Could you outline the possible causes and predict consequences?
essay: In recent years, there has been a growing tendency that the urban sprawl is a common phenomenon in many countries. Therefore, it is essential to evaluate the forces behind this trend and its consequences. 34 Ċ To begin with, population growth is widely accepted as the primary reason. Nowadays the space in the city centre is unlikely to provide sufficient housing availability to accommodate an ever-growing population. Besides, in order to offer lower-density living environment to local city residents, an ongoing land development towards surrounding suburbs is deemed as an preferential solution. Moreover, another problem that has intensified in the inner city is infrastructure shortage and poor conditions of buildings. Lack of amenities such as water supply and waste disposal have left no choice to urban dwellers but to resettle in the suburbs, where they have easier access to new facilities. 104 Ċ However, the sustained expansion of cities will make a marked impact on the society in several dimensions. Firstly, a high traffic volume between outer city and downtown causes severe air pollution and reduce the lands suitable for farming. Also, the enlargement of cities requires massive developments which make some areas to lose its unique qualities and traditional characteristics. Secondly, from the economic perspective, the relocation of a large population towards suburbs will pose adverse fiscal impact on the local government's infrastructure overhead. Furthermore, from the individual aspect, for those who are usually reside in suburbs, the inflow of new inhabitants will damage the community sport and make relations between neighbours fragile. 109 Ċ In conclusion, urban sprawl is a trend which exerts several negative effects. Therefore, the government should organise detail planning and sustainable development to minimise its demerits. 26 / 273

prompt: We can not help everyone in the world that needs help, so we should only be concerned with our own communities and countries. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement ? Prioritize most important issues
essay: Nowadays, many people have problems with discrimination, poverty and health care... so receiving help from others is very precious to them. From my point of view, I disagree with the idea that we should not help people in other countries since those problems still exist in our own society. Ċ Although only one person cannot manage to deal with every problems of other people from the rest of the world, co-operation of many individuals can create enough strength to tackle global issues,and that helps promote not only particular country but also the entire society. There is many counterexample against the notion that one cannot break national boundaries to help neighbours and fellow citizens. Take Nelson Mandela as an example, he is though to be a failure before succeeding in abolishing the racial prejudice and fighting for justice with the help of the color community and soon became a symbol of peace to South African people and also residents who live beyond his national border. Ċ As a consequence of globalization , considering the purpose of a nation to be a priority can only separate itself from others. Instead of that, our dedication and contribution should reach the common goals at an international level in an attempt to achieve sustainable development. For instance, poverty tends to appear more in developing countries so it is a responsibility for governments from developed nations to come up with a measure that helps the poor raise their living standard regardless of nationality. Besides, most of the social issues do not belong to any specific country so it is our duty to help each other for the sake of a better world. Ċ In conclusion, I believe even if we are not able to help everyone in the world who are in need, it is selfish of us to only care for people nearby where we are living.

prompt: The international community must act immediately to ensure all nations reduce consumpation of fossil fuel (gas and oil). To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is often said that one of the most important responsibilities for the international community is ensuring all nations reduce the consumption of fossil fuels such as gas and oil. From my point of ,view, I completely agree with this idea. Ċ Firstly ,one of the conspicuous reasons for this argument is ,to conduct this operation by the international community the amount of pollution to be diminished. For example ,in most industrial countries such as India which is one of the biggest producers of coal in the world ,we all know in most of its cities there is a high pollution level also ,people regularly suffer from respiratory problems. This means that to conduct some activities in order to reduce the use of fossil fuel these problems can be diminished. Also ,they will disappoint in the near future. Therefore ,this makes it clear why the consumption of fossil fuels should be reduced in addition to stopping. Ċ Secondly ,another reason is protecting animals ,especially those are endangered species such as Cheetas and Lizards. For instance ,most of the population in the world prefer to use their personal vehicles instead of exploiting bikes and public transport systems. This could create a dire situation for all animals because of burning fossil fuels by our cars. This would cause they will become extinct. As a result to legislate a rule that consuming fossil fuel should be diminished international community can create a place for all creatures to live on the Earth safely. Ċ To summarise ,I strongly believe that exploiting gas and oil should be reduced even halted. It is predicted that to do this operation our world will proceed to become a suitable place for living without any trouble in the near future.

prompt: Nowadays people around the world are choosing to self-medicate rather than seeing a doctor and using conventional medicine. What are the growth of self-medicate could be a serious issue all over the world.
essay: Today, many citizens in the world often self-medicate at home instead of going to the doctor and using conventional medicine. This essay will give the cause and effect of the problem. Ċ There are many reasons why people believe in self-healing at home. Firstly, people often don’t want to minimize costs. Because if the people go to the doctor, they will pay double hospital fees and drug bills. So they choose to go to the drug store near their house and buy medicine. For example, the citizens only pay 10$ for drugs when they self-medicate but going to the doctor, they will pay 20$ for the doctor and 20$ for drugs. Moreover, they want to be inconvenient in commuting. Because when sick people are too tired, they often just like to lie down in one place and sleep. From those reasons, it can be understood why they often choose self-medication. Ċ However, those causes also have a great impact on their health. To begin with, they may buy the wrong drugs. Because the patient doesn’t know their exact illness and buys the right medicine to use. For instance, if they feel a headache, just buy headache medicine without knowing it was the symptoms affecting the nerves. Next, when they are sick and just want to lie down will make their illness worse. Because if not functioned and treated properly, it will make the body more and more weak and tired. So, the effect of not going to the doctor is small, but it can have serious health consequences later in life. Ċ In conclusion, the growth of self-medication could be a serious issue all over the world. It could be the result of minimizing costs and inconvenient commuting, which adversely affects their health and makes the illness worse.

prompt: Music is played in every society and culture in the world today. Some people think that music brings only benefits to individuals and societies. others, however, think that music can have a negative influence on both. Discuss both these views and give your opinions.
essay: In the modern era, music has become one of the most conspicuous trends for almost every culture and society. My essay will discuss both positive and negative perspectives using a pragmatic approach. Ċ To commence with, singing helps someone to relax and to get peace of mind especially when they are depressed or disturbed by unexpected realities of life. Several societies in today's world are using lyric in their religions for case Christianity. The latest research conducted by Western Sydney University revealed that 90 per cent of participants acknowledged that they listen or attracted to lyrics when they want to divert their attention or to swing their moods. Listening to singing in other languages can help to increase your ability to understand that specific language. This can also help to get familiar with the art and culture presented by singers. Ċ On the other hand, songs have some bad impact on the listeners in different ways. Some persons relate singers lyrics and videos with their real-life and start assuming the things in a wrong way which consequently change the belives of the community about life and make them hopeless. Furthermore, Listening to songs for long periods can distract someone from their studies or work which can lead to other problems for example infection in the ears. Moreover, Music has a great variety so it can bring a person to loneliness or sadness if they had experienced something bad. When most humans are doing such things definitely it leaves the worst impression on society. Ċ In my opinion, if we maintain a balance in listening to the melody and keep it away from our personal lives, its a good thing. For instance, we should listen to songs in our free time only as fun. Ċ To conclude, as the melody plays a vital role to get relax and peaceful mind. However, this can make someone feel sad as well.

prompt: In countries with a high rate of unemployment, numerous pupils should do offered only predominant education. There is no point in offering secondary education to those who have no hope of finding a job. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement.
essay: Job scarcity has remained a significant issue of numerous nations to concern with high unemployment percentage. The authority considered if the action it could staring soon will save more money, stopping investing and supporting secondary schooling after the public completed primary training. I am afraid I disagree with this view. Because educational institutions always play a vital role. At the same time, situations and circumstances may vary. The state should encourage and engage with as many populations as possible to complete high schools and universities. If this action is successful, the whole community will get in worse. Ċ First, future discipline is a crucial way to improve association moving to high efficiency and effectiveness. For instance, the community can, through knowledge, develop new technology to enhance population from a varied way to computing science even human intelligence improved nation work skills to enhance effect created max contribute for society. Moreover, better learning can encourage more and more social to become entrepreneurs or businessmen. Such as those entrepreneurs and the business crowd could create more job opportunities and positions to help the state improve the public’s life quality, even government tax income. Namely, The authority could use those TAX to continue investing and supporting secondary schooling to engage with numerous societies starting to study. Therefore secondary improvement is imperative for the whole state. Ċ Second, the educate has used their recognition to contribute to the community. And it is enhancing society in particular fields to help the population far away from criminal and health problems. For example, the educate could use their observation to teach the nation how to save capital through investing to earn more wealth. Also will be constructive to help the public get in better health issues. Convincingly without a second educational background, when the outlook is terrible, the government can save bills. It may be true in the short term. Nevertheless, it leaves the long-term issues of an undereducated and underdeveloped nation. Indeed this is not a sort of reliable solution. Ċ To summarize, secondary education is typically essential for the whole society, not just for someone who can not finish primary schooling. The authority often takes short-term sacrifice and investment to achieve long term prosperity. After all this analysis, therefore, It must not take shortcuts to enhance everyone receives a proper secondary culture. It is the surest way to create a better future for everyone.

prompt: The best way to get deep understanding about foreign cultures Some people think that it is necessary to travel abroad to learn about other countries, but other people think that it is not necessary to travel abroad because all the information can be seen at TV and the internet. Discuss both opinions and give your own opinion.
essay: Considering the ongoing diversification in our society, people are now more interested to broaden their prospects about cultures of different nations. While many beleive that with the digital age, one can learn a lot about other countries without visit them, I would argue learning is possible but to a certain extend, it is required to visit the nations to fully learn about them. Ċ On the one side, with the rise in vlogging culture and the international Television Channels, it is possible to have first-hand experience about the life in any foreign country. The reason for this is, many vloggers record their whole day and post on the social platforms for others to experience their life. Especially within students, they can experience their whole day in foreign universities in advance without even visiting them. Furthermore, it has become a prevalent idea to install a 360 Degree on a tourist location and broadcast the feed on internet, which, as a result, allows people around the globe enjoy a virtual experience. Ċ Nevertheless, I would argue that although watching video's and reading blog is convenient but one cannot learn enough until they experience it in the real life. For illustration, it is not possible to learn a language by just reading books and listening tutorial, a pragmatic approach, such as interaction with native speaker's is required. Besides, internet lacks emotions. Argument goes that, eventhough their is plenty of information and clips available about nine-eleven, world trade center attacks, but you will only experience the real-pain and destruction after standing around ground zero. Ċ In conclusion, Despite the avalaibility of number of resource on internet to learn about any foreign destination, I beleive, physically presence is required to have the deep understanding about cultures and incidents.

prompt: Some people think young children can have better education in a boarding school far from home, while others claim that a day school is a better one.  Discuss both these views and give your opinion.
essay: Some people stated that by sending young pupil far away from their home to boarding schools could help them learn better. Ċ In contrast, there are also parents that prefer day schools. This essay will discuss both views and give my own opinion on this issue. Ċ There is no deny that going to day schools could let children have more time spent with their families. Additionally, the tuition fees of such schools are often cheaper than boarding schools, which many families could afford every child to access to knowledge. However, the daily transportation cost might be high. Furthermore, it'd be also extremely time-consuming if the student has to travel between school and home twice a day. Ċ On the other hand, children of boarding schools could save their time for further studies as they don't need to travel around every day. Moreover, boarding schools usually provide various activities, such as cricket and netball, even after class. Such sports games could strengthen their spirits as well as their social skills. Despite having a chance to win both pride and honour, teaching the participants the correct attitude toward games or even life would be more important to pupils. Although boarding schools could help students form a stronger friendship between them, it may also cause serious homesick problems. However, I believe that the technology nowadays could reduce their anxiety by simply making a phone call back home. Ċ As far as I have concerned, studying in a boarding school or day school has both  advantages and disadvantages. Nevertheless, my opinion is that a better education is directly basing on the time students could devote. Therefore, boarding schools, which do not need to consume time on transportation, would be my preference.
