prompt: prevention vs treatment Question: The prevention of health problems and illness is more important than treatment and medicine. Government funding should reflect this. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is argued that preventing problems relevant to health is far more crucial than curing these problems. Basically, I side with this standpoint, however, the role of treatment can never be ignored. Ċ On the one hand, I believed that measures of avoidance are better than medicine in term of long-term benefits namely physical and mental health or economy. In general, using prevention not only help patient to avoid diseases or problems, but also enable them to reduce side-effect of drugs as well as incidental damages. Especially, operation in internal organs like brain or heart has a very high risk of disordering function of them in the future. Added to this is sense of disturbing for medicine user because vomiting and anorexia usually occur after taking pills. Furthermore, some kind of problem will require you to pay enormous expense if you are re-infected, meanwhile, vaccination has permanent effect. Ċ On the other hand, treatment has always been considered as an only choice when it comes to certain circumstances. Firstly, not every problem can be avoided with current technology. Taking "Yasuo" for example, it is known as an inborn disorder relevant to impairment of bones and the only way to prevent is fixing the original gens of human, a novel solution, therefore, studying medicine is more possible. Secondly, in fast-paced modern lifestyle, people are more incline to have poor diet and not to take periodical examination. As a result of lack of time and serious attention, avoidance is less effective than treatment, which is instantly powerful. Ċ In conclusion, government should invest money into both of prevention and medication due to the different of situation.

prompt: Topic: Smokers can cause themselves serious health problems. The choice to made freely and with knowledge of danger. Smokers should therefore, expect to pay more for medical treatment than non-smokers. To what extent do you agree with this statement?
essay: Any person has the choice of being smoker or not. But, smoking is harmful for our health and may cause to damage themselves. Due to this smoking habit it may cause mainly respiratory problems and heart problems. This effects of smoking is educating through the media such as television, news papers, magazines etc., Hence, people who are involving this habit is already know about this danger, but they still enjoying with their habit. However, I do not entirely agree that these people should have to pay more to receive all the medial treatment they need. Ċ There are some situations, that do not have any relationship between the smoking habit. Then I believe that smokers should not be required to pay more than the non-smokers for their medical treatments. Car accident as a example, have no any connection with smoking, but people who injured from these type accidents may cause to serious injuries, also they might spend lots of money for recovery. Viral infections, another good example, any infected person needs to get the treatments and it is do not consider this infected person is smoker or not also the treatment charges are also same for both types. Ċ On the other hand, any smoker may have high possibility to take a treatment, which may cause to his smoking habit. These treatments need to pay lots of money than the non-smokers, because most of the cases of smokers are carcinoma cases. This is very harmful and have high possibility for death. They may have to suffer during their life time due to this smoking habit. Therefore, smoker have the responsibility for what he/her has been doing. Ċ In conclusion, I believe smoking persons should pay more in cases related to smoking, but in other cases they have to pay same as the others.

prompt: Nowadays, most people are not as fit and active as they were in the past. What are the main causes of this situation? Suggest some possible solutions
essay: There is no doubt that the role of being physically adept and active plays a crucial role in people's lives. However, in recent years, most of the individuals have not been fitted compared to people from the past century. This essay, therefore, will explore a couple of reasons that might cause this above-mentioned situation and highlight pertinent measurements accordingly. Ċ First and foremost, many urban and sub-urban residents have been leading a comfortable life, whereas their ancestors had to engage in manual activities to meet the basic necessities, following the hand-to-mouth strategy. This is indeed unfortunate cause the technological disruption has erased the scope to involve in productive activities not only mentally, but also physically. To give an illustrative example, a recent Harvard University study revealed that a myriad automated sewing machine have curtailed South Asian garment workers' manual working hours by almost half in the last decade. So, formal organisations ought to mandate a particular hour of exercise or so that public and private employees are bound to follow in order to keep themselves fit. Ċ Another concern is that a number of citizens are getting addicted to their electronic gadgets, which are demotivating outdoor activities. This is because many popular games, such as football, cricket, and so forth used to be the primary source of entertainment and now the recreational sector has been captured by technology companies. For instance, many professional players are strictly prohibited to use their smartphones during any series or campaign because of their much-needed concentration on the game. Thus, a culture of rules and regulations in a community would force people to revamp their tech-based mentality. Ċ In conclusion, numerous people are getting used to their safe and enjoyable life, which is even limited to, electronic devices and this attitude has been gearing towards the unhealthy lifestyle and more health complications. This is why strict policies, both from institutions and communities might trigger some fruitful outcomes for this generation.

prompt: Some students like classes where teachers lecture (do all of the talking) in class. Others prefer classes where students do some of the talking. Which type of class you like? Why?
essay: In the last few years, there have been many reformation in my own country' education system, and one of the most outstanding changes is in teaching method. In stead of lectures where teachers talk all time, there are now always some presentations made by students during the class. Personally, I thinks these reformations have made education system in my country better, and this new teaching method is not good for me, but for most students. Ċ To begin with, when students attend tuitions, they can have more chance to upgrade their own capabilities. In order to finish the topic which their teachers give them, they have to work in group, read many kinds of different material, collect data for their presentation. When they work together in group, they can learn skill for working together, which very useful for them not just during college, but after school. They also can improve their reading skill and technique to gather information. Ċ In addition, making representation front of crowd help them become more confident. For example, when I was a student at high school, I always became nervous whenever speaking front of class. However, thanks to new teaching method, now I do not mind speaking in front of crowd. Ċ Last but not least, the new teaching method make lecture more interesting for students. In class, students can discuss some things involved subjects, they have more chance to express their own ideas.

prompt: Topic: In many countries, when someone gets old, they often go to live in a house with other old people where there are nurses to look after them. Sometimes governments pay for this care. Who should be responsible for our old people? Use specific reasons and details to explain your choice.
essay: Retirement homes appear to be the intriguing place for seniors in several develop countries like America, Australia, Britain, to name but a few, and this is sometimes at the expense of the government. Up till now, this issue has aroused a wide range of considerable debates. Some viewers believe that the expenditure incurred on this should be born by the government. However, in my view, the responsibilities should belong to young people in the families. Ċ Seniors are the young's parents who bring children up, so they deserve to be paid back in appropriate manner. In fact, caring for the aged is the natural rule that every children must take because as we are infants, those are our parents who spent and sacrificed their lives for the betterment and the upbringing of them. They give us love, knowledge and they teach us the first thing of the new world. Hence, it is obvious that the elderly should stay with young people. Ċ In addition, senior citizens are able to help their children in looking after grandchildren and doing housework. Albeit being old in age, their health is still high-quality and the brain also is astounding. In contrary, the youthful are not familiar with those advantages, they put their parents into old folks' house. Afterward, they take someone else who is so-called baby-sitter into their home. Naturally, they must to pay expenditure for them. Ċ Briefly, the families should take the responsibility to oversee old people. In this way, we are not only keeping them happy and satisfied but also teaching our young ones some good moral values.

prompt: People who have original ideas are of much greater value to society than those who are simply able to copy the ideas of others well. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: I certainly agree with people who come up with new concepts. In other words, I think, those who have an ability of invent or discover new things are very pivotal to society as a whole. However, I also think there are some advantages of good imitators. Copying the ideas or new material which are invented by inventors or scientists is not good job, but, in my opinion, if it is useful for the locals then we need to copy it. Ċ The first thing I would like to mention is that no-one can that inventors and discovers must be thanked for providing us with acceptable items that we utilize every day. For example, without basic items such as the washing machine, the television and more recently the computers we cannot imagine our life. Ċ On the other hand, nowadays, the world we live in has become alarmingly oriented for consumers. Today, a lot of basic things are becoming constantly up-to-dated and improved. However, not everyone can buy them because of the price of these innovations. Moreover, not everyone lives in lands where have accessibility to the up-market items. That is why, it is more preferable to copy expensive materials to cheaper ones. Ċ It is valuable to add that certain innovations such as medical drugs have a serious impact on our lives rather than consumer goods. In my opinion, it cannot easily be replicated. For instance, vital medicine drugs such as penicillin and drugs against dangerous disease also invented by people with making great efforts to develop them. Ċ To sum up, I would like to say that scientists and innovators work extremely hard to make comfortable life for us. Furthermore, if people copy their ideas it helps them to get enough benefits.

prompt: Some people say that public libraries are an important public resource and should be free, others say that they are just a waste of public money.  Discuss both views and give your own opinion. Keeping public libraries open
essay: It is commonly believed that libraries are essential public places and therefore should be no charge for people when entering these locations while some argue they only squander public money. In my opinion, government should continue to spend money on public libraries so as to ensure the distribution of knowledge for all people. Ċ Opponents who assume funding public libraries are kind of wasting money because they only see few people coming to these places. For example, Aksara library, state-owned library located in south Jakarta, opens from Monday to Saturday at 10a.m - 5p.m. But, the average number of people who come is merely 40 to 60 per week, which is very few people coming. As a result, they believe that it does not give any significant impact and solely squanders government's money. Ċ However, I would argue public libraries must be preserved regardless whether or not they waste public money. The problem is not about squandering money, but how government improving the interest of reading due to the fact knowledge is rights for people. By preserving public libraries and improving reading interest, it will vouch the equality in education for all people and generate many well-educated people that will be useful for the future government or country itself. In addition, if government does not support public libraries, it maybe causes such places have to close and government keeps struggling with the same issue, which is educational equity. Ċ To sum up, I do not believe spending money on public libraries is a waste. Therefore, another measure, such as enhancing reading interest, should be implemented in order to create educated people. Keeping public libraries remain available to all is the most appropriate course of action to maintain rights of people in education.

prompt: Women are better at childcare than men therefore they should focus more on raising children and less on their working life. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: There is no doubt that raising the children is a laborious task and it needs undivided attention. While many from the older generations believe that women should be focusing on their upbringing, current generation argues that it is gender inequality and a combined effort from both the parents are necessary. I support the latter view, and, in this essay, I will elucidate the reasons for my argument. Ċ First and foremost, women are as successful as men at their work. There are many powerful women CEO’s who holds the fort for many successful multinational corporations. Therefore, the notion that only men are good at working and is not supported by relevant facts. For example, one interesting study conducted by Canadian Society on Women leaders shows that woman leaders tend to be more successful than their male companions. This shows that women are equally potent as men in any field of work in this modern world. Ċ On the other hand, the common belief that women are better suited for childcare is completely baseless. In other words, there are many families in this modern world, where men could successfully take care of the little ones. For instance, a survey conducted by a leading US newspaper shows that families are more successful where the workload is shared by both partners. Also, there are many daycares successfully run by men. Ċ To sum up, the upbringing of the children used to be wife’s chore in the previous century, but in modern societies, both parents share this responsibility and hence, I believe that it is more of a gender-neutral task now.

prompt: Human activities have had a negative effect on ecosystem, animals and plants across the world. Some people believe this can not changed while others feel that we can still take action to protect living things and the environment. Ċ Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay: Over the last few decades, anthropogenic has detrimentally affected the environment resulting in water, land, and air pollution. Some people insist that it's too late to alleviate the disastrous consequences of human activities, while others optimistically believe that the world can still be healed by several approaches. In this essay, both points of view will be discussed in detail, and my opinion to support the latter statement will be illustrated. Ċ On the one hand, it is apparent that the world has been decimated for many decades by human's hands including deforestation, contaminating soil and water with chemical substances from industrial and agricultural sectors, and releasing tons of Carbon dioxide from burning fossil fuel to generate energy. Therefore, it may be too late to replenish natural resources. Moreover, approximately 90 per cent of vehicles including cars, planes, and ships still need fossil fuel for feeding the engines and driving the world economy, which is very difficult to change these things in reality. Ċ On the other hand, presumably, I believe that the world still have hopes and there are several approaches to alleviate the impacts of human activities. First of all, nowadays we have technologies and innovations which are eco-friendly such as electric cars and ships. Furthermore, the renewable and green energy generated from solar cells, turbines, and nuclear stations has recently been promoted in many countries. Additionally, cultivating more forests is one of the promising solutions that people recently implement for paying back the environment. For example, the authority of China try to expand the forest in desert areas called the great green wall to reduce soil erosion, and to promote carbon sequestration. Ċ In conclusion, as the aforementioned remedies including the advancement of technology and afforestation to mitigate the consequences of anthropogenic, I believe that it's not too late to recover the world's environment and we still have the natural resources for the next generation.

prompt: Rising university fees and limited employment prospects for graduates have led some people to say that universities should not teach arts subjects, like philosophy and history, and should only offer practical degree courses that maximise chances of employment. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Because of University fees increasing more and more and lower opportunities to find a job after graduation, some argue that arts subjects, such as philosophy and history should not be included in the offering of universities, instead they should only teach courses that give the best employment prospects. While it is true that having a degree does not mean one will find a job, I do not agree with this. This essay will discuss the vital importance of these subjects and demonstrate the practical use that sometimes people fail to recognise. Ċ First of all, studying the arts, history, philosophy or any other discipline, help and promote self-expression, offering alternative tools to communicate and create, which can boost confidence and encourage individuality. For instance, it is well known that art classes give students the chance to be themselves, and the freedom to create without having to follow strict rules. This allows the expression of different personalities and the use of people's full potentials that would be lost otherwise. Ċ Secondly, the study of philosophy and history helps develop critical thinking and the ability to analyse events or any other thing from the past to understand better our present, cultural differences, enjoy the beauty of a work of art and find the answers to the questions and doubts we have. For example, by learning and discussing historical events we make sure that mistakes already made by those who lived before us are not repeated. The ability to make sense of things around us that we acquire are good enough reasons to continue teaching them.  Ċ To conclude, I do not agree with those that say that universities should stop arts subjects courses, because they are a vital font of knowledge, they encourage people creativity and enables individuality and self-esteem.

prompt: Topic: Human beings do not need to eat meat products in order to maintain a good health because they can get all their needs from meatless products and meatless substitutes. A vegetarian diet is as healthy as a diet containing meat. Argue for or against the opinion above.
essay: It is undeniable that at present time, a good health can be maintained without consuming meat products. In clarifying, people can fulfill all their needs by means of meatless foods. Many scientists hold an opinion that when it comes to vegetarianism, it can be considered as a healthy diet. However, others tend to think that meat products can be beneficial when it comes to avoiding monotonous type of diet. To the best of my opinion, it is more practical which is worthy of being paid attention, and it will be known within the scope of my essay. Ċ For a variety of reasons many people consider vegetarianism as a harmful trend. Firstly, people claim that vegetarians do not eat a balanced diet. As human organism is in need of organic food as well. Secondly, in many cultures, meat is the paramount ingredient in traditional meals. "Kebab", for instance, is one of the traditional foods of Uzbekistan, which consists of only meat. Finally, meat-eaters argue that animals are below humans in the food chain. Ċ On the other hand, there are some benefits of a meatless diet that can easily overwhelm its potential pitfalls. A majority of people choose vegetarian diet for moral and health reasons. It can reduce the risk of disease like cancer. Therefore, people claim that it is unnecessary to kill animals when it comes to getting food. Ċ Given these evidences, it can be clearly said that both vegetarian and meat-containing diets are to be kept when it comes to maintaining a good and stable health.

prompt: Some believe that people will purchase a product based on their needs and advertising is not needed. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The question of whether advertisement serves no real purpose has become progressively contentious as some argue necessity is a driving force for all purchases. In my opinion, while their viewpoints seem legitimate, adverts help consumers develop needs for novelty. Ċ On the one hand, the most frequently cited rationale for the unnecessary ads is that consumers understand their demands when it comes to shopping. This argument rests on the fact that advertising can be rather a nuisance than a motivator influencing people's buying behaviours. For example, this can be most apparently seen in myriad supermarkets, which organise a wide breadth of product launches that spontaneously disturb their shoppers with obsolete goods. Most supermarket-goers know their needs when they enter the store and attracting them with a list of sponsorship deals could make them annoyed and refuse to come back again. Thus, the accumulated evidence has reasoned why ads should be solely present when consumers reach out to them. Ċ On the other hand, albeit conceding that customers are often aware of what they want, I would still contend that advertising does not simply meet needs but creates them. To begin with, this is predicated based on the assumption that people can have more fulfilling lives with innovative products which would benefit them in their daily activities. For instance, one of the salient illustrations of this is often indicated in the advent of Apple products dating back 10 years ago, which has brought in the frenzy for electronics like smartphones, tablets and earphones. Had they not utilised the role of advertising, they would not have fostered their dominance in the market like today and the desire of the citizenry worldwide to become part of the Apple community. Therefore, marketing campaigns play a pivotal role in stimulating people's buying habits, providing high-quality products and services and improving the diversionary experience of consumers overall. Ċ In conclusion, whilst the use of adverts should be limited to a certain degree, it confers a valid standpoint as it does wonders for the shopping experience of the general populace. In my final thought, retailers and advertisers should jointly propose a more holistic approach in order to promote appropriate products that meet the authentic needs of buyers.

prompt: Topic: Wearing uniforms is popular in schools, but some people argue that it might cause damage to children's individuality. What is your opinion?
essay: Uniforms are often regarded as an integral part of various educational institutions today. In my opinion, far from eliminating individuality, students can derive huge benefits from wearing uniforms. Ċ To begin with, one obvious advantage that wearing uniforms brings about is the lower rates of bullying problems linked to clothes. There is no doubt that each school consists of a myriad of students from different family backgrounds, of which those from affluent households are able to show off the most stylish outfits. This has led to the fact that less fortunate students feel inferior to others and sometimes they become the victims of bullying due to their ordinary clothes. Thanks to the use of uniforms, bullies are effortlessly tackled and the economic discrepancy between students seems to be no more a thorny issue. Accordingly, uniforms contribute to promoting unity amongst children. Ċ Meanwhile, some children claim that wearing uniforms would limit their individuality and by wearing regular clothes are they entitled to express their personality. However, it is academic knowledge that should be placed emphasis on when it comes to school rather than expression of egoism. In fact, if children are allowed to wear any kinds of clothes, then there is a rise in the competition for becoming the trendiest one in their schools and their academic performance is likely to be sacrificed as a consequence. Briefly, wearing similar clothes enables students to focus on their main targets of going to schools rather than other external factors. Ċ To sum up, I would have to reiterate the importance of school uniforms. On the grounds that they encourage a sense of unity and concentration of school-goers, I believe that wearing them should be maintained as a rule.

prompt: role of museums in today's world Some people think museums should be enjoyable places to attract and entertain young people. Others think the purpose of museums is to educate, not to entertain. Discuss both two views and give your own opinion
essay: In modern world, there has been much discussion revolving around the issue of whether the local authorities had better refine the initially educational function of the museums by means of additionally recreational purpose. From my perspective, I think a combination of both preferences will absolutely facilitate the youngsters' enlightenment. Ċ To begin with, museums with tremendous collection of variously historical pieces of arts, culture, science and geology as well preserved and exhibited to general public has played such an importantly everlasting role of reminiscence in historic events to disseminate human civilization and experience towards today generations. Visiting the museums, the young can not only gain educational acknowledgement with historical records but also encourage their patriotism and respect for the liberty and sovereignty the previous generation protected by scrutinizing a wide range of relics and several devastated exhibits in wartime considered as the witness of history. Ċ This may be true to some extent because museums should concentrate on representing their educational aims. However, in regard to the regretful lack of sufficient visits museums are believed to organize additionally entertaining sightseeing so as to either arouse teenagers' attention and curiosity or depict the ancient time authentically and interestingly rather than displaying antiquities boringly. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that a blend of educational and entertaining purpose will improve the indispensable role of museums in current society.

prompt: Globalization is positive for economies but its negative sides should not be ignored. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The benefits of globalization are numerous when talking about technology and the economy, however, people ought to give some attention to its drawbacks when talking about cultural habits, and traditions. As far as I am concerned, this is completely true and I will discuss each of the two points of view thoroughly in this essay. Ċ On the one hand, globalization helps companies to infinitely grow in the market. In other words, It allows international firms to open new branches all over the world. Not only that but also, it can help stakeholders to benefit from the different labour prices throughout the world. For instance, a company like Vodafone has branches all over the United Kingdom and Egypt. When Vodafone decides to open a customer service centre, they definitely choose to open it in Egypt even if it will serve UK customers. Because in Egypt the hourly rate of customer service representatives is almost half the hourly rate of the UK employee. Which in turn benefits the company. Ċ On the other hand, social media platforms participated in an immense amount of issues for the new generations. To put it simpler, nowadays most adolescents carry a smartphone and they use it to check TikTok, youtube, Instagram, and Facebook. These websites drive them to see and get exposed to other cultures, and social classes that they should avoid at this age in order not to get depressed. For instance, If a fourteen years old boy saw on social media that it is normal for boys at his age to have a girlfriend, and most of the students around the world do have girlfriends at this age. He will feel lonely and might get depressed. However, If he only deals with his colleagues which are from the same culture and same background in school, this will not happen. Ċ To conclude, despite the financial benefits of globalization, it is clear that it has some drawbacks when used in the wrong way. Hence, it should be monitored carefully especially by parents.

prompt: Some people consider price as the most important thing to consider when buying a product such as a cell phone and services like medical treatment. Do you agree or disagree
essay: Nowadays money is an influential factor in everyone's life. Therefore, some people ponder over the price to be the vital thing to consider while buying a mobile and services like medical care. I would argue that this is not necessarily the case always which will be discussed in detail in the forthcoming paragraphs. Ċ To begin with, there could be a number of reasons to bethink about price before buying a product. Firstly, some individuals prioritize the price of an article to be the most important factor for procuring because of their financial condition. For instance, people who are not monetarily stable can never think of purchasing an iPhone which is the most costly phone in the market. Furthermore, due to globalization, services like health care facilities are available at a higher rate than yesteryears which is becoming unaffordable for the common mob. Hence, they are always worried about the budget for treatment. Ċ On the other hand, numerous individuals may not be concerned about the rates while purchasing. For many, their social position matters because of their status in society. For example, a rich dude might buy an iPhone because of its brand value and the service they provide while not considering the cost of it. Another reason could be that in life-threatening illnesses like kidney failure, a person probably will not reckon about the bill for the treatment but focus on saving his life and never mind paying a little more for the medical care Ċ To conclude, although money plays a part in the decision of buying, it depends on the buyer's mindset what they value more, either goods and services or the rate at which they are offered.

prompt: The prevention of health care and illness is more important than treatment and medicine. Government funding should reflcet this. Ċ To what extent do you agree?
essay: In the past few months, due to the unexpected Coronavirus outbreak, health care systems have been pushed to their limits. As a result, governments all around the world are increasing their funding in order for hospitals to be operational. But, should these funds be used to prevent these situations. I personally feel that, this view would be profitable to an extent for most countries. This write up will attempt to debate the above opinions. Ċ Firstly, by being cautious about your health, by taking extensive test and being closely monitored, you lower your chances of suffering from a deadly disease. While this is not possible for all illnesses, it could probably decrease the percentage of people in the population, that would need extensive care. To illustrate, if most people that have cancer realised it in its first stages, they would maybe avoid chemotherapy, reducing the government’s expenditure on therapies. Lastly, some countries has tried to implement measures for preventing such as the sugar tax in the UK and have seen a positive outcome. Ċ Regarding funds spent on treatments and medicine, secondly, there should be an adequate amount available. The reason being, that while we can prevent some illnesses and find ways to exterminate them, some are impossible to treat. This means that extensive care and medication must be offered for these people to survive. For example, from my own experience, my granddad had a stage 1 lung cancer, but due to his age it could not be stopped, so he had experience therapies for several years, until he passed away. Finally, while being cautious is easy for some individuals, not all of them can comply. Ċ In conclusion, if the governments pointed their funds in preventing there could perhaps be a decrease in illnesses. But, it's my firm belief that, in our society's structure this is impossible to achieve.

prompt: In some societies, it is increasingly common to try to achieve good health and fitness through physically demanding sports, special diets, or preventive medicine conventional or alternative. Some people, however, believe that the best way to stay fit and healthy is simply to lead a normal life. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay: With increasing awareness of health, more and more people tend to make extreme changes to improve their health on a daily basis. However, some approve that keeping a normal life is a key to stay healthy, In my opinion, the most important thing for one's health lies in the definition of normal life. Ċ First, a proper attitude for keeping fit should take one's body condition into account. The standard of normal life differs from people to people and should pay attention to it that wether has caused harm to the body. A typical instance is that many people have a sedentary lifestyle and unregulated schedule for bedtime. In this result, although people who with the irregular routine consider that as a normal life, both physical and mental condition are impaired day by day. Ċ Second, with both medical and technological development grow rapidly, it is not a negative manner to modify people's lifestyle slightly by compound with them. In addition, the environment is highly contaminated and polluted after industrial development which increased the potential risks for human to get fital diseases. To prevent people from being ill and unhealthy, taking the preventive measures, such as routine check from hospital, diet plan from nutritionists and exercise guidance from consultants, are necessary. Ċ In conclusion, although staying in a normal life may have merits in some aspects, I still disagree with its ambiguous concept, and I regard people's health would be improved effectively by combining with the high technology which is used properly.

prompt: People like working for a company rather than starting their own business. Ċ Why is this the case? Ċ What can be done to encourage people to start their own business?
essay: Nowadays, instead of venturing into business, people choose to work and stay in corporations. The reasons behind the fear of people in entering business are related to the risks involved and professional background, but there are also solutions that can be done. Ċ 	There are several reasons as to why people do not want to go into entrepreneurship. Firstly, many think that starting a business can be risky. Many people in the past, for instance, invested a huge amount of money in this, but were not able to have enough profit. Staying in a stable company job was the first choice for many, as they can work and save money at the same time. Secondly, professionals who went to school for their chosen jobs want to ensure that they use their education in the proper field of work. Staying in a company would benefit them as they can gain more related experience while earning a decent salary, therefore improving their living conditions and professional growth. Ċ 	However, there are steps that can be taken to encourage the population in starting their own businesses. One way that governments can do is to increase the level of awareness about the process of Entreprenuership. Many are not aware of the steps in partaking this idea which decreases their interest to begin investing. Another step that individuals can take is by starting in small ways, depending on their preference. Artistic people, for example, can sell crafts that they like to do such as paintings or pottery. They can then start selling it to their friends and family, and later on to the local market, enhancing their skills and also their social connection in the society. Ċ 	In conclusion, discouragement of individuals to start businesses are due to some causes, but the ways to improve it are manageable by raising awareness of people and including the interests of the individuals.

prompt: Some people believe that pressures of modern life are having negative effect on family life. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: The modern life has blown a new trend of working and living in big cities. However, some people blame its pressures for negative effects on family life, with which I partly agree. Ċ It is clear for all to see that a number of families have suffered from spiritual burdens it brings. To keep up with the rat race of life, parents are supposed to execute enormous workload to earn for living, which takes up most of their time. Especially, some businessmen who usually leave home early and come back late have no time to see their children, let alone to gather and relax with the family. Besides, heavy stressful workload also leads to depression and exhaustion for cities dwellers and mental and physical deterioration is more likely to happen. Moreover, focusing on their own work makes people desperate and less close, resulting in reduce in family sentiment. Ċ Nonetheless, such drawbacks are not unavoidable. It is possible to find some urban residents that live happily in modern environments of cities. Those persons know exactly how to manage their time budget efficiently and balance between life and work. Some of them are willing to give away a part of work to have more time for taking care of their children, which brings them peace in the noisy life. Equally important, they succeed in taking advantage of modern life, say, information technology and entertainment, to relax themselves and their family. As their regards, stress of modern life is not considerable in compared with the joy it brings. Ċ All in all, modern life has both positive and negative effects on family life. Therefore, people should have reasonable time management to balance the both impacts.

prompt: Some student work while studying. This often results in lacking time for education and constantly feeling under pressure. Ċ What do you think are the causes of this? Ċ What solutions can you suggest?
essay: Pursuing education along with earning has become a trend these days which is negatively impacting the academic achievement and mental well-being of students. In this essay, I will provide the causes of this situation and put forward a few solutions to overcome this challenge. Ċ To commence with, there are two main reasons for pupils to opt for employment: education loans, and obtaining work experience. At present, there are banks that provide loans for the students to support their learning, leading to a mortgage. As a result, individuals are subjected to employment to pay their debt. Graduates, for instance, take capital from the bank in order to pursue their dream of higher education in the United States and start working right after their admission. In addition to this, various organisations are seeking candidates who have experience in the field due to which the pupils are prioritizing to attain corporate exposure before completing their degree. Ċ However, here are a few ways forwards to help individuals who are pursuing their learning together with employment, such as scholarships and flexible hours. Proper research has to be done to identify any scholarships programs before submitting an application to any university. Being aware of such programs might help to increase the chances of obtaining funds to cover the cost of the studies. The government, for example, have introduced several policies to sponsor individuals who are applying for specific countries or courses. Furthermore, most organisations have started providing opportunities for flexible hours, consequently, helping individuals to manage both studies and earn a living without impacting their quality of learning and mental well-being. Ċ In conclusion, after a thorough analysis of the topic, although it might seem challenging to educate themselves and manage a job at the same time, it can be achieved by seeking various ways to cover the expenses fully or partially to avoid debt along with working for firms that provide alternate options.

prompt: In certain countries, unemployment is so high that some have suggested children should stop their education after primary school to learn skills necessary to join the workforce. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: In some countries with high joblessness, there is a common assertion that children's giving priority to learn essential skills to meet the demand of labor market after their elementary level is of paramout importance. However, I personally disagree with this suggestion and this essay will shed the light on justification why I am not in favor of it. Ċ To embark on, it is undisputable that abolishing children's access to upper academic programme leads to the significant shortage of fundamental knowledge and intensive expertise which prevent them from satisfying the speciality of their future job . For example, if you wish to apply for the post as an accountant, you have to cultivate relavant job skills regarding the ability to analyse financial data, the comprehension of Computer Science and the impressive command of English language which are significantly attributed to formal schooling .Additionally thanks to high-level education, you are assured to attain quality qualifications which are considered to be chief determinant that the employers are inclined to assess whether you are qualifed to work or not. Ċ Futhermore, schooling system offers students subjects like sports and music which are regarded as indispensable soft skills . While they may not be directly useful in securing employment, they indirectly make a candidate more employable. Apart from technical expertise, firms currently attach greater attention to credentials such as adaptability, originality and communication skills and to some extent they are ground-breaking elements which makes you superior to other candidates . These attributes are likely to be attained in experiences like playing sports and music. Hence, attending school after primary level is terribly justifiable due to its potential to make people's employability higher and higher. Ċ In conclusion, I firmly believe that stopping children's education after primary school does not improve the uneployment rate , however, it even worsen the situation .

prompt: Putting criminals into prisons is not an effective way to deal with them. Instead, education and job training should be offered. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: When committing a crime, anyone, no matter who he or she is, should be penalized by legislation and then prisoned for a certain time. This is a widespread phenomenon in most countries for the sake of upholding an ordered society. The policy, however, is not advocated as an efficient method to curb crimes. Ċ One of negative outcomes is that the operation of jails needs to be funded by revenues mainly because it is non-profit organization, while it also causes financial burden or even deficit to some extent. When released, criminals rather revenge society, not in terms of burgling, but more seriously, in murdering and trafficking. What governments should consider is how to combat this situation in root. Ċ It is argued that those who fall into the victims of criminals either sustain domestic violence in their childhood or are lack of formal education in their adolescence. By contrast, when practiced by relevant training, parents prefer to create a harmonious atmosphere in family rather than spark conflicts. Children in this circumstance tend to be more friendly, which lays a sold foundation for them receive moral education and then distinguish between virtues and evils in the middle school, avoiding juvenile delinquency. Ċ Of course, there is no denying the jail is an indispensable department in which justice can be guaranteed and sufferers can acquire certain compensations. To maintain a stable society, capital punishment still exists in many countries. But overall, all of these merely happen behind offenses. Ċ Overall, education and job training are more advisable than direct punishment to prevent offspring from going astray. When sent to prisons, offenders also should receive further education to avert recommitting the same mistakes.

prompt: In the future, we will have more leisure time as machine replace many of our tasks we do at home and at work. Discuss the benefits this will bring and also the problems it will cause.
essay: It is safe to say that robots and other intelligent machines will accompany humans even more in the future, they are thought to carry duties that were historically belonged to us and so we will enjoy more time-off. To my mind, this evolution has its pros and cons which I aim to analyze in this essay. Ċ On the one hand, it is undoubted that people will receive countless benefits when robots take over their usual tasks. With the massive span of free time, people can have many recreational activities that they could not fulfill in the past like travelling for longer periods of time. This tendency is expected to come along with the development in the service industry that accounts for a high percentage in a country' GDP. Additionally, the workforce is facing contentious problems regarding their mental and physical health, once robots and smart machines come under usage, the workers will no longer be worried about those illness which will reduce the burden on the medical system as well. Ċ On the other hand, all the drawbacks can not be contained easily, it has been proven by science that humans only survive by working, while they are working on their jobs, their body parts are also working, that is what keep them healthy and physically controlled. But if our tasks are fully done by robots, we will become lazy and it is extremely negative for our health. People also find happiness in their jobs, which means if they have too much time relaxing, they might end up felling bored rather than satisfied. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that robots replacing humans in daily tasks can be positive and negative at the same time. Humans should try to balance the amount of robot-completed work with self-completed work in order to terminate all the shortcomings.

prompt: Question: Many employers are now offering their employees the option to work from home. As a result, employee will have much flexible working hours in the future. Is this a positive or negative develpoment? work from home - the great innovation
essay: Nowadays employees are provided option to work at home instead of in office. It is believed that employees' working hours will be more flexible in the future. The advantage of working at home that will be discussed in this essay is that, it makes employees more convenient to work at home. The disadvantage, however, is that employees are not able to join face-to-face discussion. Ċ Work at home can bring a lot of convenience to employess because they can accompany their family member while working, especially for those who have to take care of their small children. It can also improve relationship between family members. For instance, parent can prepare breakfast for their children before sending them to school and spend time with them after school. Ċ Hoewever, there is also disadvantage when employees working at home. Sometimes there will be soome urgent meetings that all employees must present and discuss about it. Although the employees who works at home can join the discussion through phone or Skype, it is still problematic in communication when network connection is poor. This may result in missunderstanding and some urgent problem could not be solved immediately. For example, other employees might not hear clearly what the other talking about when there is transmission delay. Ċ Notwithstanding the possible occurence of misunderstanding, in my opinion, it is still good to allow employee to work at home because the relationship between family member are more valuable in compare to the missunderstandiing that might occur during a discussion. Ċ In conclusion, it is clear that an option to work from home can benefits employees, including flexible working hours and also strong bond between family member. For those who have bad network connection at ome should find solution to solve their problem in order to work at home.

prompt: Machine translation (MT) is slower and less accurate than human translation and there is no immediate or predictable likelihood of machines taking over this role from humans. Ċ Do you agree or disagree?
essay: In the modern era, an increase in the number of Machine translations is a major concern across the countries. With each passing day, human spend a lot of time while dealing with translations that really made their lives complicated, there is enough chance for improvement. A huge number of people do react differently because of ample freedom. The present essay will discuss the topic in a broader manner. Ċ Firstly, this profession holds an important business value. Message and translation balance pattern used widely in most countries now. They are a sign of improvement. We must ensure that every media has access to them. For instance, Social media, Newspapers. But undoubtedly, one of the benefits of this is that they are less stressful. Ċ Secondly, there is a rise and fall in quality issues. Accuracy is another area where governments and individuals or private groups can share responsibility. Developing countries are more likely to suffer Machine translation issue at a great level due to multiple languages. However, developed nations have always been ahead in the terms of solution. In fact, they mostly get credit for it. For example, Asian people do spend a lot of time in human adaptation. Ċ In conclusion, even though time changes and people may vary in their opinions. I think only positive efforts can bring more benefits. Computer engineers and citizens to play a vital role to track this subject. There are many ways to get the things done, but one should remember there are hidden issues. Therefore, I agree with the statement and believe that Machine translation is slower and less accurate than human translation and there is no immediate or predictable likelihood of machines taking over this role from humans.

prompt: GM food : benefits and drawback Some people think that GM crops are a positive development. Others argue that they are potentially dangerous. Discuss both views and give your own opinion
essay: With the fast development of technology, GM crops are prevalent in modern-day society. Some people argue that these crops are a significant advancement while others claim that they are associated with potential problems. Both viewpoints will be discussed and critically evaluated before a final conclusion is drawn. Ċ On the upside, there are plausible reasons why people advocate the development of genetic modification. To begin with, it provides the food security for people all over the world. Recently, while many cities are now facing with worldwide problems such as overpopulation and catastrophe, it is essential to cater the sufficient amount of food for the underprivileged who struggle with disastrous effect and impoverished conditions. In addition, transgenic crops can promote food quality and hygiene at desirable attributes m. Since the modernization and industrialization society is developing rapidly, GE food is beneficial from enhancing higher nutrition, productivity and having longer storage time. Therefore, the standard of living considerably improves. Ċ On the downside, there are strong arguments against the use of GM crops. Firstly, they are potentially dangerous for human health. In spite of an abundance of strict testings, scientists can not guarantee the safety of these bio-technological products. People are at long- term of risks which can raise the question of food quality. Furthermore, biotechnology can pose threat to the environment. The use of these crops can reduce the variety of strains which banishes the nutrition in soil. As a result, there is a imbalance in the ecological system which causes catastrophic consequences and other serious problems. Ċ In conclusion, it is true that GE food is a double-edged sword that may enable or hinder development. In my opinion, people should find solutions to maximize the advantages and alleviate the disadvantages.

prompt: Some people think that a person improves their intellectual skills more when doing group activities. Ċ To what extent do you agree? Ċ Use specific details and examples to explain your view.
essay: These days, many believe that studying and playing in a group rather than alone is extremely beneficial for the overall development of an individual. In my opinion, I completely agree with this notion because of its numerous benefits. Ċ Firstly, group games and activities always provide a platform where one can learn from others. This is because, any topic or problem will have arguments and opinions from different people, and this will certainly give everyone a chance to look into the problem from a different point of view, which will further refine their understandings. As sometimes it is not possible for an individual to think each and every perspective of a problem. However, through group studies, one can overcome this. Many studies, for example, have shown that a person who takes part in team activities is certainly a better performer than his counterparts who do not. Therefore, preferring team level studies or games definitely has its own advantages. Ċ Secondly, working in a team is also beneficial in improving mental abilities and thinking capabilities. Since, in a group, all members play as a team, not as an individual, which helps them to think quickly and take action along with some logic to be implemented. These action items will surely aid them to apply different mathematical calculations within a short period of time. For example, in cricket, players have to measure different angles to take any wicket along with the calculation of running speed to take a myriad of runs and all these combinations are not possible in isolation. Hence, I wholeheartedly agree that group-level activities are far more effective in enhancing different abilities of a person than any other game to be played alone. Ċ To conclude, after analyzing all the positives of any group activity or game, I completely agree that young students should always be encouraged to perform in teams because it always helps them in learning and improving their skills.

prompt: Some people think that you can never become fluent in a languange unless you have spent time living or working in that country. To what extent do you agree?
essay: A large proportion of people are desired to speak a foreign language fluently, like a native speaker. In addition, Some people consider it necessary to live in the related country, so that they can achieve it. Obviously, this is possibly a viable solution, but I do not agree this is the inevitable option. Ċ There is no doubt that people living or working in a foreign country are able to have a better understanding of the language because it is environmentally required. Furthermore, they have to communicate with local citizens when they need to consult some problems. For example, they might need to ask the directions when they go somewhere. If they are unwilling to talk with others or even refuse to speak, it is really hard for them to survive in that country. Therefore, to avoid this consequence, they will choose to talk more and master the it gradually. Ċ Despite the potential outcome of the above method, it may not be essential when the learners are determined to study hard and with the help of plenty of useful resources. As we know, it is impossible for everyone to go abroad to learn, to put it in another word, a majority of people can’t afford the expensive fee. However, it is possible to grasp or learn well, even without travelling abroad. For instance, they may meet some foreigns in local areas and try to communicate with them regularly. Another important thing to remember is that there are different kinds of approaches that are provided for every person, such as online courses, specific programs in the smartphones, relevant books and so on. They can easily find a suitable way for them to learn. Ċ In conclusion, If someone takes learning as a normal part of their life, he or she would engage in the practice without living overseas.

prompt: Some believe that advances in technology are increasing the gap between rich and poor while others think the opposite is happening. Ċ Dicuss both sides and give your own opinion.
essay: Nowadays, many believe that technological advancement is interconnecting the world and inequality among the upper class and lower class is declining. Although , in my opinion, the development is dividing society and discrimination has been shown between wealthy and impoverished individuals. This essay will highlight both statements before reaching the conclusion. Ċ First, many discoveries in information technology and the availability of the internet enables wealthier persons to assist financial victims. A tragedy, when posted on social media, grab the attention of people, which results in cooperation and aid for the poor, within a community or outside the nation. For example, by watching a video on Facebook, a textile businessman in my area gave a ten lac cheque to a widow. She had a chance to get the funds with the social platform. It proves that the technological revolution brings poor closure to the rich. In addition, farmer revenues have upsurged by modern technology allowing them to equalise socially and economically with the well-off members of society. Ċ However, I believe that the revolution in technology enables rich students to use advance devices for their study. On the contrary, needy students cannot afford such devices- even they don’t have access to the internet. As a result of inequality, one part of society flourishes, while other is left behind. Undoubtedly, it has seen at the international level also, where the developing counties, like Africa and other Asian countries,lack technological advancement and economic inequality is growing drastically.The reason is that digital marketing is crucial for growing a country economy and it’s unavailability often results in bankruptcy. Ċ To conclude, I have the argument that the advances in technology divide the people locally as well as internationally. Nevertheless, the revolution has many benefits , which cannot be denied.

prompt: It has been proven that smoking is bad for one's health. Some people claim that it should be completely banned everywhere. To what extent to you agree or disagree?
essay: The harmful influence of smoking has recently been established. The comprehensive interdict of smoking everywhere is supported by some people. In my opinion, I totally do agree with this positive decision being able to protect public health. Ċ First of all, though it is true that the number of jobs created by the cigarettes - manufacturing industry is quite remarkable, we should also bear in mind that the negative influence of smoking can contain much more dangerous results. In case of a banned - smoking regulation happening , people who worked in some fields of cigarette industry could lose their occupations, but the value of time or health dilapidation caused by smoking can sustain much more people to have better lives. For instance, many Europe countries do not allow smoking in the public areas and the percentage of people getting diseases related to smoking decreased gradually. Ċ Secondly, while it might be argued that smoking could assist intellectual officers to release stresses, the truth is that each cigarette they smoke cause extremely serious impacts to people around them in a passive way. For example, according to recent studies, passive - smokers could be affected five - times higher than the real smokers therefore their risk of having diseases related to smoking such as lung cancer or pneumonia might be increase. On the other hand, people having problems with stresses can use many other positive methods such as playing sports or yoga to avoid smoking risk for the community. Ċ To conclude, there is no doubt about the danger of smoking and the necessary of a disallow smoking regulation , however I think that it should be considered with some different aspects to reduce unpredictable results to the unemployment trouble of society.

prompt: Some people feel that manufacturers and supermarkets have the responsibility to reduce the amount of packaging of goods. While others argue that customers should avoid buying goods with a lot of packaging. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Recently, every product or good have covered with excess packaging. Whether most of them argue that the plenty of packaging of goods is the responsibility of industries or customers should try to do not buy these products. However, I strongly believe that both industries and customers play leading role in this issue. Ċ Manufactures and supermarkets present their good with a great deal of packaging in order to attract attention of citizens to purchase it. They tend to use none-biodegradable material such as plastic or styrofoam to package their products for preserving the products. In contrary, these materials are inorganic waste which cannot be recycled, and it can cause the environmental issue. Therefore, the industries have to use organic materials which can be recycled and do not pollute the environment for their packaging, like green cardboard. Nevertheless, I argue that the customers also take a part to have the responsibility to reduce the plenty of packaging of products. Ċ The customer should play role to help reducing the amount of packaging. When they go to shopping, they have to bring their own plastic as a final place to put their groceries. As a result, the shopping places do not need to provide another packaging for the customer's purchasing items. Moreover, if the customers purchase the product in small amounts, the people do not need the special packaging from industries, because they can carry their goods with their hand. Ċ To sum up, the industries have the responsibility to reduce the amount of packaging. Yet, I believe that the customers also have to participate to tackle this issue. Furthermore, the government should take a part to overcome this issue like making regulations for the use of plastic packaging.

prompt: Shopping is the favourite free time activity for many young people today. Why do you think this has happened? Should young people be encouraged to do different activities in their free time rather than shopping?
essay: Admittedly, shopping is now considered as a new favourite pastime most adolescents pay attention to since it gives them pleasantness. There are immense factors why this circumstance happens including the influences of media and celebrities. However, excessive shopping will bring about other problems later so, in my opinion, they should be encouraged to do other beneficial activities. Ċ To begin with the causes, it is no denying that the power of currently various media and eminent people certainly affects teenagers' notions. These days our trend changes almost all the time which is a result of constantly launching new products of a lot of brand names. Moreover, superstars also play an essential role in influencing youngsters. For instance, the more juveniles see numerous advertisements or celebrities wearing a new collection of brand names which will become a trendy fashion, the more there is a tendency they would like to own ones. Ċ Even though shopping may not be harmful if it is at a moderate level, I still believe that adolescents should spend this time participating or doing other useful movements such as playing sports, hanging out with friends, or engaging in public service. These actions are advantageous to teens as they are able to improve new useful skills. For example, when doing civil service, they will gain communication skills, responsibility, and leadership. Ċ To summarize, it is clearly seen that the power of media, as well as prominent people, dominate how teenagers purchase goods. Thus, from my perspective, except for this hobby, they should find other avocations which benefit themselves and the community, like doing exercise and civil service.

prompt: Some people prefer to be self-employed, whereas other like working for companies or institutions. Which is a better approach?Give your opinion?
essay: Many people endeavour to set up their corporation or desire to secure the employment in multinational companies. Some folks prefer to become self-employed, whereas others rather favour having a job. As per my opinion, being an independent owner is far better than working for someone else. Ċ Having a private company is more beneficial because the opportunities for growth are enormous as compared to jobs. If the individual comes up with a million-dollar idea and gets successful in it, then there is a high probability of becoming a billionaire within a few years. For instance, Warren Buffet is a self-made billionaire who became rich by starting an insurance company and doing the trading. Starting an independent firm does ask for extra hard efforts, but the results are fruitful. In addition to this, the owner is responsible for all the company’s decision without anyone interference and can perform all tasks from home in his convenient hours. Ċ Conversely, some people support doing a job because it has less uncertainty in the prospect of future and provide more sense of security. In a workplace, the working hours are fixed, not like an owner who works, day and night. For example, the employee has 9-6 shift every day, as well as receive holidays on the weekend, but for the boss 365 days are working days. Moreover, being employed under someone is a lot less risky as compare to having own enterprise because the chances of failure of the independent business are comparatively high. Although I believe in working for myself instead of working for others and make them richer from my hard work, it has risks, but it rewards for taking it. Ċ In conclusion, being a boss is better than being employed for others. If sufficient efforts are served the chances of having a successful business is higher. Even having a job provides certainty, it will not accommodate sufficient growth opportunities and the growth of individuals become stagnant in the future.

prompt: Some people believe that using animals to test the safety of human medicines is cruel and unwarranted, whereas others feel it is a medical necessity. Ċ Discuss both views and state your own opinion.
essay: Every life is precious and should be treated as such. However, when a new disease appears on the scene, finding the right medication might mean experimenting with animal life as a means for testing. There are arguments for and against this idea of using animals for this purpose with many suggesting that it is unnatural to do so while others concur with it. Personally, I agree with the use of animals as laboratory rats. This essay will discuss both of these views and reflect my opinion. Ċ To begin with, some people feel that the use of animals as a testing medium leaves much to be desired as the following reason will prove. Since every life be it that of an animal or that of a person, should be considered sacred and receive equal treatment. In other words, if no medicine meant for animals can initially be tried on humans before it is used on animals, then the opposite should not happen as they are both considered vital. Take, for instance, swine flu that claimed millions of animal life no human trials were conducted to check the effectiveness of the vaccine before using it on affected animals. Despite that being the case, I still believe disagree with this notion. Ċ On one hand, other individuals believe that animals should still be used for medical trials before being administered to humans due to the following reason. Although both animal and human lives are important, humans should be given priority since their bodies unlike those of animals, do not have certain abilities to fight off illnesses. To put it in perspective, animals have the ability to fight off countless diseases without the aid of medicines and so if they are first tried on, they are less likely to die as opposed to humans. For example, the venom from a snake that can easily kill any human can not do so when introduced in a horse since this animal has the ability to fight off the effects of poison from a snake. For the foregoing reason, I believe animals should be used for this purpose. Ċ In conclusion, in as much as others might argue that using animals is unfair because their lives are just as precious as human's, it goes without saying that human bodies are incapable of fighting off illnesses that animals can. Henceforth, I strongly agree with the sentiment that animals are best used for such.

prompt: Is gaming good for kids? Essay: Many parents complain that computers games have no value to their children's studies. On the contrary, those online games have produced a lot of negative effects on the mental and physical development. What is your opinion?
essay: In the modern digital age, regardless of the widespread popularity among young teenagers, computer games have confronted numerous parents' criticism of seriously detrimental impacts on their kids' development including major problems like cognitive and physical impairments. From my viewpoint, I strongly agree with the advice on limiting children's access to those harmful online games. Ċ Beyond their main purpose for human relaxation and entertainment, the fact that game players incline to suffer from the overexposure to the virtual world of online games has proved their highly hazardous addiction. More particularly, that adolescents spend many straight hours sitting in front of computer screens could spark several health problems like short sightedness or headaches possibly caused by their untold harmful radiation, obesity due to the lack of sufficient exercise and being unsociable because of fewer hours for extracurricular activities. Furthermore, several games with sexual and violent scenes should be banned for those in early childhood. Ċ This may be true to some extent because the entertaining method through computers can be beneficial to the kids' mentality after schooling. However, the misleading way of excessively getting indulged in game missions has resulted in the children's neglect of their school assignments. That they usually fail to meet their exercise deadlines not only damages their study results and face the risk of losing such preciously social relationship like friendship but also leads to unnecessary worries and disappointment of their parents. Moreover, gamers are often possible victims of cyber-bullies when they join in such a virtual world with thousands of anonymous users. Ċ From the above evidences of physiological and psychological damages, I reach the final agreement with the idea that parents having a great concern about their young teenagers' health development had better discourage their children from gaining access to this dangerous software.

prompt: Some governments spend a lot of public money training individuals to be successful in international sporting events. Some people believe that this money should be spent on things that will benefit the general public instead. To what extent do you agree or disagree.
essay: Community's funds are being spending by the authorities on individuals to impart some coaching to get success in sports competitions globally. Although this notion is favoured by one part of the society, others have a counter-argument that there are numerous problems are facing by the local inhabitants and the government should solve this issue with this wealth. In my opinion, public funds should be spent on the residents first. This essay will discuss some ideas to support my viewpoint in the upcoming paragraphs. Ċ To begin with, public funds are not only helping to develop the nation but also spread prosperity among people. To elaborate further, with this resource authority can improve roads, bridges, railways and the standard of public transportation. This progress leads to the improvement of local sources and their users. For instance, a recent survey conducted by BBC News has revealed that authority must give priority to develop basic requirements to build a robust society. Moreover, by paying money to any sportsman to take part in sport and attain victory, only can deliver happiness to him/her rather than the whole community. The well-being living lifestyle of common people only can be maintained with the support of raising sufficient funds by the administration. Hence, this finance assists in various ways to solve plenty of issues. Ċ Besides, several other improvements also can be done through public wealth. Firstly, there are major and crucial ameliorate require to achieve in primary necessities such as education and health institutes. Secondly, the government ought to invest more in the public section to increase the number of employments among their citizens. To illustrate, in the UK 30% of jobless got their job after raising the money to public sections. Additionally, after getting success in any international sports it cannot change the future of the local public, It merely depends on how their own authorities are paying attention to them. Thus, social and personal development rely on this fund. Ċ To conclude, I unequivocally believe that the government have the ability to tackle myriad problems with public money which will be profitable for the community and the nation. Therefore, paying public fund to sportsperson is squandered of the valuable resource of the nation.

prompt: In recent times, economic growth has helped many become richer, both in developed and developing countries. However, those in developed countries are not as happy as they were in the past. Ċ Why is this? Ċ What can be learned from this?
essay: In the present day, the economic growth has been soaring compared with the past once that people are accumulating a vast quantity of money. Although they have been worked a lot to save a fortune, some are not still satisfied personally and mentally. This essay will discuss why these individuals are presenting this feeling and what can be learned about this situation. Ċ Nowadays in the fast-paced world, the population is increasingly busy and overwhelmed not only with work pressure but also with personal pressure, both of whom are responsible for this feeling of sadness so present in the lives of people. Even though they already have worked a lot, they strive to go the extra mile and because of this, individuals are becoming ill mentally. For instance, a businessman working in a large and famous company has a good salary and an excellent reputation but at the same time, he is suffering from anxiety and depression. The more worn out workers are, the more unhappy they will be. Ċ Certainly, to tackle this situation, health organizations and companies should encourage a healthy life with a work-life balance. In addition, this actual perspective shows the population how essential is to have an organized schedule with leisure time for family and friends. For example, pieces of international research demonstrate people happier are much more productive and know how to separate time for really necessary functions. From time to time is of paramount importance to recharge energy, to get better results. In other words, having money at the expense of happiness does not worth it. Ċ In conclusion, make money is pivotal to have a good life but at the same, mental health is much more crucial to the welfare of individuals. This essay argued why the affluent population is not happy and what can be learned from this fact.

prompt: Companies use different way to increase sales. What different ways do companies use to increase sales? What is the most effective one?
essay: With the development of global commerce, enterprises, nowadays, are using a variety of methods of boosting their sales, depending on their strategies, budgets, and targeted customers. No matter what sale strategies each company are applying, they are aiming at the similar target, for the increase in revenues. Ċ Corporate's owners can apply numerous increasing - sales strategies after analyzing thoroughly their strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats. For small and medium companies, their budgets may be limited and have to be allocated economically to lots of departments. In these cases, they tend to choose sales solutions which do not cost too much money. Online companies, for example, opt for marketing campaigns on social networks or third party's platform to boost their sales in lieu of marketing on media, which often charges bunches of money for each advertising minute. For large corporates whose budgets are sufficient for launching long term sales promotions, they will approach targeted customers by diversified methods, such as advertising on televisions, setting up signboards, or co - operating with key opinion leaders. Some luxury and exclusive brands, though possess themselves huge financial resources, choose to not advertise in common ways, but their sales always rise significantly because of their insightful knowledge about customers. Lamborghini, for example, does not spend any money on broadcasting their products on communications and media, yet this brand still become one of the hugest auto producers by virtue of their quality and rare products. Ċ There exists no clear answer for which sales method is the most effective because of the difference amongst companies' aims and their customers' characteristics.
