If one company targets to become the lead in retail market, discount campaigns will work to some extent. On the other hand, If another company aims to increase sales by exclusive products, it will hardly choose to cut down the prices. Ċ To conclude, enterprises have many options to boosting their earnings. However, which option is the most suitable depends on companies' orientation and resources.

prompt: In many countries there has been an increase in social problems involving teenagers in recent years. Many people believe that this is due to modern lifestyles because parents spend more and more time at work and have less time to supervise their children. To what extent do you believe this is true?
essay: There is no doubt that adolescents are increasingly involved in criminal activities. A vast majority of folks blame their working parents for this unprecedented rise in youth illegal acts as the father and mother does not spare enough time to keep an eye on their children. In my opinion, the whole family unit is responsible for this rising community matter. Ċ Young fellows spend more time on non productive acts than their prime focus- studies They have access to smart phones with web capability. Many teenagers like to chat on social websites which expose them to criminal minded people. It is commonly reported news that teenagers with their online chat partners get involved in crimes just for the sake of adventures. Moreover, with easier access to recreational drugs, these young fellows become addictive to these drugs. They start stealing money first from home and then from others just to be able to buy more drugs. Ċ Parents, on the other hand, work long hours so that they could buy better home and cars. Instead of spending time with their children, they prefer to work two jobs for their next luxurious vacation. They believe it is the sole responsibility of school to teach their kids on traditional as well as moral education. Ċ I believe raising a family is a team effort. There is nothing wrong to work hard to upgrade your living standards but not at the cost of neglecting your children. Parents should allocate enough time to nurture their progeny with love and good guidance. Similarly, children should consider their studies as top priority and avoid bad company of friends.

prompt: As computers translates quickly and accurately, learning of foreign language is a waste of time. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Nowadays, language translation has become easy due to technological advancement, which makes some people believe that learning different languages is not necessary, where I tend to agree partially with this argument. Ċ On one hand, the advancement of the internet has brought various benefits for mankind. One of them is the ability to translate any language with ease. A person would simply rely on a smart device or an application to get the meaning of the word they are looking for. In addition, this allows humans to travel without fear of knowing the dialect of a country. Furthermore, most of the applications provide a great user experience and is available for free. For example, the Google translator application is available on every smartphone and provides a huge library of dialects. Ċ On the other hand, relying heavily on technology might reduce the critical thinking element of a person. Learning a different lingo needs to be looked at as an additional skill, which further helps to build a valuable experience. It will also help to provide job opportunities for someone who knows how to speak in multiple ways. For instance, in my country, there are plenty of job openings for those who can speak Mandarin, which is considered a niche skill. In addition, knowing the dialect of others will help to build good relationships as humans are generally comfortable conversing natively. Furthermore, it helps to strengthen the bond by getting closer to the culture and tradition of various people. Ċ In conclusion, learning foreign languages is definitely beneficial, which needs to be emphasized among every individual and I think we should make proper use of technology to gain more knowledge from it rather than using it as a tool for specific tasks such as translating languages.

prompt: Some believe that people today have no interest in maintaining the traditional culture of their country or region. Other believe that it is still important to people that we preserve a traditional way of life. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
essay: In today’s modernised civilisation, while the general public believed that humans are more and more indifferent to preserving the traditional culture of their nation, others claim that traditional lifestyle conservation has been indispensable. Personally speaking, despite both arguments have validity, I would lean towards the latter. Ċ To begin with, it is understandable that maintaining the folklore of a country is not as crucial as before due to an influx of contemporary and novel subcultures from all around the globe. What I mean is there is a plethora of different civilization from diverse regions or nations in a country. For instance, it has Chinese restaurants, European hotels or even Thais markets in Viet Nam. Moreover, the Internet and social media are places in which shared art appear pervasively, which has a considerable impact on humans, especially teenagers. As a result, a lot of Asian countries are partially affected by Europe, and vice-versa. Therefore, having a lack of concern for ethic or fashion maintenance is agreeable and acceptable to people today. Ċ On the other side of the argument, traditional way of life that has been presenting valuably and vitally, should be kept and conserved. Not only does the indigenous art promote a sense of belonging but also makes the younger generation respect their ancestors. For example, traditional Vietnamese New Year, on which people always go back to their home for family reunions and hope for a better forthcoming year, has been preserved. In addition, sustaining belief is considered to be absolutely crucial for all people because it is not only their birthplace’s experience but it is also their soul and heart. Each country has its own people and science which is unique, and protecting them is a way to make people special and different from other foreigners. Ċ From my perspective, despite the fact that people are freely influenced by any different cultures due to a globalized world, it is still indispensable and vital to maintaining our region or nation’s myth which might be partial instead of getting rid all of those. In conclusion, traditional perception, which plays an important role in our soul and daily life, need to be conserved.

prompt: Many companies offer their employees the opportunity to work from home. Ċ Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of working from home for the company. Ċ And give your own opinion
essay: The rate at which technological advancements has improved is quite intriguing. Many institutions now offer the opportunity for their staff to work from their residence. While this progress should be applauded, insights into the cons of relinquishing this freedom should be discussed. This essay will give insights into the merits and demerits of working from home. Ċ The world is advancing in technology which has completely made communication much easier. One advantage of working from home is the ability to get more duties done. For instance, the distance one needs to cover to go to the place of assignment could be used to complete an assigned task. In addition, some persons can personally choose to extend their office hours in other to accomplish a milestone which might not have been possible if we were to go to the firm, majorly because of traffic. In fact, operating from home gives an additional time to complete a project. Ċ On the other hand, one possible disadvantage of allowing employees to work from their place of abode is the lack of proper monitoring as many individuals tend to relax and not have their function carried out. For example; currently, because of the prevailing virus, many folks work from their residence, while some persons try to meet up with tasks assigned to them, others may ignore them, even after multiple reminders on emails, therefore, delaying the completion of the job. Also, many staffs are distracted by their kids and other house chores, they eventually get carried away with personal matters, thereby giving little relevance to the job. As a result, many companies lose out on profits. Ċ In conclusion, in the world today, telecommunication is advancing quickly and as such, organizations tend to move with the trend. In my opinion, in as much as we tend to close out on task assigned, the disadvantages of working from their place of abode outweigh the advantages.

prompt: Animals should not be used for the benefits of human being, unless there is evidence that the animals do not suffer in any way  To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Animal testing has become a debatable issue in recent years. While some scientists have stated that testing on animal should not be restricted, I believe that this method should not be overused and other alternatives could be applied. Ċ On the one hand, there are several benefits that animal testing may offer. Firstly, this plays a crucial role in scientific research. Many medical tests on new drugs have been undertaken on animals before human experimentation. This may help in advancing medical and scientific knowledge without costing people's lives. Secondly, in some certain extent, researchers aim to minimize suffer that animals have to experience. Taking cosmetic industry as an example, this testing has been banned as its unjustified uses of animals. Ċ On the other hand, animal testing have many drawbacks that need to be considered. The first drawback is that its inhumane and immoral image. In other words, the lives of animals should be respected because people no ethical rights to use others for their sakes. Another drawback is that many other alternatives, which are non-animal based, should be taken into consideration. For example, some of animals' DNA has been computerized; therefore, scientists could be able to use these data instead of the traditional testing approach while the outcomes might be almost identical. Ċ In conclusion, animal testing should not be banned but its usages need to be minimized. It is suggested that an approval of animal testing should be given by the Animal Ethics and Care committees before the test could be used.

prompt: Nowadays, most people try to achieve a balance between work and other parts of their lives. Unfortunately, not many achieve this balance. What are the problems which prevent them? Suggest some solutions.
essay: The balance between work and other aspects of lives is something that many people recently desire to gain. Moreover, there are issues that tend to stop individuals from actualizing it and the essay below will elaborate on that, as it also highlights on the possible solutions to them. Ċ Firstly, many companies set a very high target for their employees. People strive on not losing their jobs because of a failed goal and so, they are willing to give up on other parts of their lives like the socialization in order to achieve their aim at the workplace. For instance, many bankers are known to miss social events like birthday parties because they are busy trying to make ends meet at work. However, if the employers give the workers less targets, they will be able to create more time to attend to other aspects of life. Ċ In addition, promotions at the office has become a thing of competition. Also, to get promoted, most managers expect the juniors to put in more working hours. This will greatly affect the other sides of living since it will create a less chance for it. A good example is how more people are ready to take up extra time in the production industries just because, they want to appear very committed and thereby getting a promotion. This will deprive them of enough time together with their loved ones. Again, to discourage that, industries should base their promotion on the quality and not the quantity of job that is done by their employees. If this is done, it will reduce the pressure on the people for taking more extra hours. Ċ To conclude, the ability to handle effectively the work and life balance is important. Therefore, most factors hindering its success like the fight for promotion and targets should be better applied in order to increase the chance of a positive outcome.

prompt: Some people believe that governments should pay for health care and education, but there is no agreement about whether it is the government's responsibility. What is your opinion? healthcare and education accountability
essay: Education and health care are two essential aspects of human life. Without proper education and health care system, no nation can develop. It is the government's responsibility to ensure the quality of education and healthcare service to its citizens and I strongly agree with this view. Ċ On the one hand, I believe that education and healthcare service should be funded by the government. To begin with, most of the people fulfil their tax obligation, therefore, they should definitely get some benefits from the government in the form of free medication and education for their children. Moreover, from my perspective, education is an essential factor for the development of a country. By providing free education to the residents, it is hoped that more skilled and educated workers would be created. As a result, these potential workers could boost the country's economic sectors. Ċ On the other hand, I also think that people should also be responsible for their own life. One of the reasons is that free medical service makes some people irresponsible of their health condition. It is believed that expensive health care would force people to follow a strict lifestyle and quit smoking and drinking. Additionally, in my view, private fund for education makes the schooling system more effective as guardians are more conscious of taking care of their children's learning. For instance, many private schools are doing better in developing countries than the state funded schools and parental involvement made the difference. Ċ In conclusion, I support that the government has the responsibility to ensure that those services are available and affordable. However, it is not to say that the government should bear the costs of all health care treatments and educational services that the citizens currently enjoy.

prompt: Some people believe that studying online is more effective than studying on campus while others disagree. discuss the advantages and disadvantages of online learning
essay: There are competing views in society regarding both physical and virtual learning. This essay will discuss the advantages and disadvantages of online learning. Ċ First, a virtual study is advantageous for its flexibility but it also permits multi-tasking. Students, as seen in the COVID-19 era, can easily open their devices and attend lectures or tutorials from the comfort of their homes and hostels as long as there is internet service. Furthermore, those that are employed or nursing little babies do not have to suspend their studies but follow classes online. For example, it was reported in a study in the USA that there was a 20 per cent increase in the number of mothers of children less than 3 months old enrolling for a college education because of this flexibility. Ċ On the other hand, however, people from poor backgrounds suffer from the steep expenditure associated with data and those living in peripheral areas cite poor network coverage. Lessons done in virtual spaces require massive investment in laptops, cellphones, Ipads and related service charges that are usually difficult to shoulder. Secondly, not all places are covered well with good internet and this clouds the mentioned benefits. For instance, I have personally struggled to attend serious meetings and presentations in Hong Kong because of the erratic internet-delivered at home; this is despite the fact that I pay a whopping HKD 300 per month for the service. Ċ In summary, therefore, schooling online has its pros and cons such as favouring those employed and being a challenge for the poor. So many other factors apply besides those discussed in the essay above.

prompt: You should spend about 40 minutes on this task. Ċ Write about the following topic: Ċ Some people feel that paparazzi should not follow celebrities and invade their privacy by taking pictures of them everywhere, while others believe this is just the price of fame. Ċ Discuss both sides and give your opinion. Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. Ċ You should write at least 254 words.
essay: Each celebrity enjoys a wide recognition from their fans and public. Most often these celebrities' personal lives and privacy are invaded by paparazzi. Some people think it should not be allowed, while others perceive it as a cost of their popularity. In this essay both of these views will be discussed and an opinion will be provided. Ċ On the one hand, public's invasion of celebrity's personal life is unethical due to a few reasons.Which primarily includes, the fundamental right of privacy, where each individual can and should be allowed to exercise their personal life hidden. For instance, as per the civil law, it is illegal to invade in private places unless permitted by the law. Furthermore, celebrities are artists and they are employed for their skills and they should not be disturbed or obstructed during their private time. These artists have their own life and just like any other person they should not be criticised, interviewed or clicked without their permission. For example, recently, Salman Khan, a famous Bollywood actor, was stopped by journalists during midnight to ask when he will be getting married. In short, every human has rights to keep their lives after work as private. Ċ On the other hand, it could be considered fair to invade celebrities' lives because, firstly, their fame and popularity has been given by the fans. Therefore, they are interested in their favourite figure's whereabouts. Very often popular artists willingly give their own interview to keep their fan base engaged. Secondly, popular people have a lot of followers, who assume a right to know about their favourite personality's daily routine. To illustrate, I am an IT engineer, hence I love to read and know more about Bill Gates' habits and hobbies. In other words, being famous has its own price that many pay by way of compromising their privacy to satisfy the curiosity of fans. Ċ In summary, although it is unfair for famous artists to be followed by paparazzi, as it is an invasion of their personal space, it is still inevitable. Most celebrities will always be followed due to it public interest. As a result, I agree with the later belief.

prompt: In the past, lectures were used as a way of teaching large numbers of students, but now with the development of technology for education, many people think there is no justification for attending lectures. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Education is a crucial part of people's lives. For several years, classes have been used to display knowledge to many students. However, thanks to technology improvements, some may believe that there are no reasons for attending lessons. I completely disagree with the statement due to the benefits related to face to face interaction at schools. Ċ Firstly, by attending lectures in an academic environment, many students would secure accurate information. Since some subjects are more difficult than others, several individuals could face specific doubts. For instance, while delivering a lesson in a classroom, lecturers can give immediate feedback. Also, those who do not understand the entire information would have the opportunity to make questions. Otherwise, taking online courses would not allow this significant interaction. As a result, many professionals would make dangerous mistakes. Ċ Secondly, many academic areas such as biological sciences and engineering have practical compounds. Thus, undergraduates should attend universities to have laboratory access. For example, a biology lesson about how to combine chemicals to create products should be taught by a professional in a laboratory, which is the safer and proper environment to develop it. Although technology has allowed the use of online applications to learn, it is not the best option. If a person tries to mix dangerous substances by itself, the result would be extremely dangerous. Ċ To conclude, even though technology advents seem to be a better option than professors lessons, it is not the reality to all areas of knowledge. If students want to be sure about their understanding, they should attend schools.

prompt: Even in today's advanced era, many people believe that bicycles are the best way to commute from one place to another. Ċ How far do you agree or disagree?
essay: In this day and age, technology has made transportation more efficient and convenient. While many individuals argue that bicycles are still the best mode of commuting, others disagree. In my opinion, I strongly concur with the former view, as cycles are the most efficient way of travelling because of its convenience, health benefits and environment-friendly. In this essay, the aforementioned view shall be elaborated further. Ċ Firstly, the pollution levels are rising at an unprecedented rate these days, and it is high time that something should be done about it. Bicycles are the most accessible form of transportation because of its size and weight as it is easier to carry and get through narrow spaces. Secondly, travelling by cycles promote a healthier lifestyle. For instance, it often reported that people nowadays have little or no physical activities in their lives eventually leading to obesity and other health-related issues. As a result, cycling serves as a form of physical activity that keeps an individual fit and active. Ċ Furthermore, another benefit of cycling is that it is ecological-friendly because it does not have any fuel emission or cause traffic congestion. For instance, In Japan, the government has installed special lane and parking facilities to encourage and motivate people to use cycle. Consequently, the traffic, air and noise pollution have plummeted drastically in such regions. Ċ To summarize, had it not been the rise of pollution and health problems, bicycles would not have been considered as the ideal mode of transportation. Therefore, I completely agree with the statement that cycles are the most ideal way for commuting.

prompt: In some countries family and friends who care for the elderly do not find time to look after them. What are the reasons and solutions?
essay: In many parts of the world, most people find problems looking after their elders. There is various reasons behind this and steps are needed to ensure that masses find a way to care about their old family members. Ċ The reasons why some people neglect to look at elderly people. Firstly, nowadays, everyone is busy and has a hectic schedule, they have a job to do that need time due to this they come late from the office, in that case, they do not have time to look after their elderly members. Secondly, children are their first priority to look after. To illustrate, many mothers have twins and few have triplets therefore, newborn babies need more time with their mothers because they need proper time and food. Ċ Although, there are steps to overcome this issue. To begin with, some time masses should take work from home when their elderly parents need them in owning this they both get some quality time with each other. Furthermore, the caretaker is one of the options that are helpful in difficult times. Whereas,Remove the commaapplyIt appears that you have an unnecessary comma after the subordinating conjunction Whereas. Consider removing the comma. Ċ show examples an individual visit to another city or country of their job then they could contact with nurses or caretakers to look after them in their absence For example, in India in a recent survey, the figure of caretakers are increasing for elderly people because their children are lived in other cities and countries for job and proportion is raised up to 20% . In addition to this, they should teach their elders to operate smartphones due to this they can contact at any time and order from the online market when they need something. Ċ To conclude, " every lock has its key." However, the young generation should understand this elderly person just want to spend some time with them and it should their responsibility to look after them later age.

prompt: Some people think that teaching methodology in the modern classroom should be based on experiential learning while others believe that traditional approach is still the best. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Give your opinion.
essay: Although there are many proponents of a traditional approach to education, some now believe that in the modern classroom, the methodology of imparting knowledge should be based on experiential learning. This essay explains that even though I believe that experiential learning is the way forward, traditional techniques are essential in certain cases. Ċ To begin with, experiential learning includes the recreation of real-world simulations of certain concepts or situations in front of students. Firstly, with this, they grasp concepts faster and learn in an innovative way. Moreover, learning is fun with such styles rather than being stuck in a classroom. For example, while teaching gravity and weightlessness, modern classes can use augmented reality (AR) to simulate the scientific concept. This would help the pupils understand the physics behind it in a more convincing manner. Also, enacting scenes out of World War 2 would be a better alternative to retaining the chronology of events than reading it from a textbook. Ċ Even though this might be true, there are certain subjects or instances where the traditional approach of using the chalk and the board yields better results. For instance, it is futile to waste resources to teach a primary school student the letters of the English alphabet using modern practices and the Socratic teaching method works better in these places. That is because these are a few instances where the focus needs to be more on practice rather than experience. Ċ To summarise, though I partially agree with this viewpoint that modern teaching theatres should be based on experiential learning because they offer certain distinct advantages, I still believe that traditional methodology works better at certain places. Thus, in my opinion, modern teaching practices should incorporate both techniques of teaching.

prompt: Topic: Some people think that zoos are all cruel and should be shut down. Others however believe that zoos can be useful in protecting wild animals. Discuss both opinions and give your own opinion.
essay: People have differing views with regard to the question of whether or not zoos need to be maintained. While some say that zoos are merciless and should be closed, I personally believe that they would keep animals safe from extinction. This essay will discuss the two viewpoints. Ċ On the one hand, there are two main reasons why zoos are considered immoral places and should be banned. Firstly, zoos are often aimed to entertain people and earn money from them, which means that zoos held animals not because of conserve, but because of making profits. Secondly, from a moral perspective, many zoos limit the freedom of their animal by providing poor-quality environments and facilities. Research has shown that the house of animals in zoos is far smaller than that of them in nature. This prevents animals from doing daily activities the same way as they do in the wild, which is likely to make them feel depressed and develop mental illnesses. Ċ On the other hand, I would argue that zoos play an integral part in preventing animals from extinction. The fact that excessive hunting and poaching have led to numerous animals' disappearance, which is because their body parts are seen as luxury items and status symbols. Take rhinos as an example, they are killed or held in captivity because their horns are highly valued on the black market, pushing this species to the brink of extinction. As a result, Zoos act as shelters to protect them from poachers and these immoral behaviors. Ċ In conclusion, although some people believe that zoos must be prohibited, I am of the opinion that Zoos can help protect wild animals from extinction.

prompt: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Ċ Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they know how to do well. Ċ Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
essay: To begin with, some people believe trying new things and taking risks are not easy tasks, so they differentiate between successful and unsuccessful people. I personally incline toward this thought for two reasons that I will explore in the ensuing essay. Ċ First of all, new things mean a great opportunity to get new information in different fields or the same field. To become a successful person, there is no way to escape knowledge. For instance, when I was a little kid, I remember that my father used to look at different tasks carefully, such as gardening, cooking, marketing, speed reading, making mini-crafts, and many other subjects. For this, he went for different things, but my mother didn't like his opinion as he was not able to make much money through this. Nevertheless, a couple of months later, I discovered that my father had created a training centerChange the spellingcentreThe spelling of center is a non-British variant. For consistency, consider replacing it with the British English spelling. Ċ show examples, where he taught various kinds of stuff to others. After a few days, we found that he really had huge success through his motto. Ċ Secondly, when you take risks, you will give yourself a chance to know a situation in-depth, which will help you generate practical skills. It is not hidden from anyone that becoming an expert in a practical field can give us more opportunities to flourish in an area. My personal experience is a compelling illustration of this. For example, ten years ago, one of my uncles opened his business, and he was quite reluctant to take chances in his trading policy, taking the traditional route. However, he was able to get a survivable profit, but not as a successful one. So, he planned how to make a huge bounty from his business. Later on, he found that he could take a risk by shifting his trade to an online basis. It is worth mentioning that in his area, online marketing didn't take place in its full swing. As a result, he gained new experience and created new strategies, ultimately achieving success. In light of the foregoing, if he didn't take the opportunity and did his work as a general trader, then he would not be able to achieve his goal. Ċ To summarize, doing different tasks and taking chances are needed to reaching your goal because it will enrich your skills and give you practical knowledge.

prompt: More and more animal species are becoming extince by human activies in land and sea. What are the reasons and solutions? saving endangered species
essay: Nowadays, a variety of animals is killed by people so they are standing in danger of extinction. The essay below will analyze some major reasons for this stituation, and measures to tackle this problem will be presented. Ċ One of the main causes of this problem is that people have the demans of using animal's parts for many different purposes such as producing medication, cooking the nutrious meals or manufacturing luxury products, etc. This leads negative effects on wildlife, making them stand in danger of extinction. For example, every year in Japan, a big amount of whales is killed to serve luxury restaurants. Hundreds of elephans or rhinors are hunted and taken ivory or horn to produce jewellery such as rings, or medication. In addition, strong development of sea tourism also makes sea environment become seriously pollute. In particular, visitor who could threw away litter into the sea and oil released from boats carrying them are also the other reasons of the extinction of marine animals. Ċ Some measures are suggested to mitigate the stituation. That is the government should further provide strict punisment to prevent the illegal hunting and trading of animals. In addition, it should have many educational programs to heighten individual's awareness in the protection of animals. For examples, people should be taught about how to protect sea and land environment and animal species living there when they were children. As a result, they can understand about the importance of animal species and have a better awareness to preserve the natural environment. Ċ In conclusion, the risk of the extinction of a variety of animals is current urgent problems so that people needs to have effective measures to protect them.

prompt: Nowadays, people believe that the environment influences their accomplishments. Some people think their success and accomplishment were influenced by the places where they grew up. Do you think the environment does or does not affect people’s accomplishment and how it affects? Please give an example of a famous person to support your statement.
essay: These days, there is an ongoing debate among people that success depends on the environment. Whereas some are in the favour that places place an indispensable role in order to get success, while I do not advocate this given notion and this essay will discuss the reason behind my view point. Ċ On the one hand, there are several reasons why an individual advocates the grew up area for their achievement. In which, guidance and facilities are the major factors can be taken into this account. For instance, Abhishek Bachan, son of Amitab Bachan, is an actor because he was influenced by his father, who is also an actor. Consequently, Areas, where people grow up affects a lot. Ċ On the other side, it is possible to make the opposing case, where the environment does not affect the mankind in order to achieve their goals. First and foremost, internal passion could be the substantial factor. For example, Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam, who was the 11th president of the India was not inspired by the surrounding but internally he was having passion to do something for the country. As a result, it can be seen that sometimes growing up places does not affect. Ċ To conclude, it is likely to say that sometimes humans are not influenced by their guidance, however, they set their goal and get success with their hard work and passion. I personally strongly support the people, who actually have internal intensity in them to do something different in the society.

prompt: It is generally accepted that families are not as close as they use to be. Give some reasons why this change has happened and suggest how families could be brought closer together. Include any relevant examples from your experience.
essay: It is generally accepted that families are not as close as they use to be. Give some reasons why this change has happened and suggest how families could be brought closer together. Include any relevant examples from your experience. Ċ With the advancement of the technology has certainly revolutionized many sectors. This will lead to the diversity in the social connection with the peer member of the family. The essay will discuss causes for this change and measures that are taken to make stronger bond; are discussed in below paragraphs. Ċ To begin with, the predominant reason for people having less connection with their family members is that they become materialized. Due to that, they are giving more priority to their work as this will provide money to satisfy their needs. As a result, they are spending less time with the family members which create a distance between them. Moreover, people are travelling to foreign countries for their growth. This will become a major factor to destroy the family bonding. For example, in the recent times children will grow in the nuclear family never get the support and love from their grandparents and cousins. Ċ On the other hand, this family separation can be solved by taking precautionary steps by individual and the government. The first measure is that an individual can start to meet their peer one on the regular interval. This will help to create the bonding between them. Furthermore, another measure is that the government should introduce the awareness program which shows the benefits the person will get and provides the shelter. However, having good family relation will deliver the happiness and maintain health. For instance, showing the advertisement on the television create a great impact on the society. Ċ In conclusion, the modernized world is the main reason behind the distance between the family members. This will be removed by taking steps by an individual and the authorities show the benefits of having strong family relationships.

prompt: Nowadays many people believe that children should be taught history in schools, however, others argue that children should learn subjects that are more helpful for modern everyday life. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: These days, there has been a debatable argument about school courses. There are individuals that prefer that offspring be taught history, while other people claim that students should have more modern subjects. This essay discusses both sides of this argument and why I believe that school should always be about history. Ċ There are many reasons why people believe that educators have to replace history with modern courses. The first reason why tutors should go with that replacement is that will have taught students new approaches to life. This is to say, these subjects usually tackle topics that we can relate to. For example, these days, schools have been training their students with soft skills such as time management, critical thinking, and leadership. Moreover, the second reason why this group has this point of view is these topics about everyday life would inspire kids. Not to mention, that these topics will broaden children's horizons. Ċ On the other hand, there is a consensus that prefers kids to be taught history modules. There are several reasons why there is an opponent that wants to substitute everyday prompts with a history-oriented curriculum is due to existential reasons. Furthermore, this consensus believes that life repeats itself; therefore, events will reoccur again. Winston Churchill, for instance, once said: "People who don't learn from history are doomed to repeat it". Another reason why this group holds this belief is because history modules enrich a student mind. Thus, a student gains knowledge, wisdom, and a plethora of insights. Ċ In conclusion, I believe both sides have merits. On balance, however, it is my opinion that history courses are extremely vital for any learner. This is because I think that these subjects will help someone to not repeat the same mistake someone did in the past.

prompt: People buy good products that work, therefore, advertising is unnecessary and is no more than a form of entertainment. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: It is often said that advertising is not essential and this is a lesuire for the population in the world. Because these days people prefer to purchase products that work. From my point of view ,I completely disagree with this idea. Ċ Firstly ,one of the main reasons for this argument is the power of different advertisements. For example ,we all know in most cases big brand names are investing all of their annual budgets to sell their products by showing adverts on TV and social media. There is no denying that these investments are answering because apart from these products' quality ,the population commence buying them without any attention. This probably would be for a thing that we habitually call a plan for purchasing all our items by just advertising. Therefore ,this makes it clear why humans can not ignore the power of commercials. Ċ Secondly ,another noticeable reason is the influence of ads on people. For instance ,in most countries around the world communities prefer to have Apple mobile phones rather than other brands. It would seem that most of them did not possess this kind of brand as a mobile phone ,however ,adverts that are related to them are encouraged and persuaded humans to choose this brand of mobile phone. What we should say now ? We can not deny there are many reasons that ads are necessary for 21 century. As a result ,it becomes apparent why people prefer to buy a commodity that they saw in its ads. Ċ To summarise ,I strongly disagree with this idea. I also believe humans do not purchase items that work. It is predicted that to continue common positive beliefs related to advertising this trend will be increased in the near future.

prompt: Nowadays, many people use the Internet to get medical advice instead of going to see a doctor. Why is this? Do you think it is a positive or negative development?
essay: In this day and age, a number of people prefer to consult with doctors via the internet rather than provide their physical presence in hospitals. I consider that this positive trend has great potential to rase due to the development of modern technologies. Ċ To begin with, It is true that in the Internet age we can barely find any people without gadgets and especially with phones. Furthermore, innovations such as the internet, computer or iPad have changed the way in which people operate in their everyday life; studying, socializing and working. The medical consultations are also affected by this revolution. The seniors like grandparents have direct accessibility to communicate with doctors and nurses without even going out from their home. Therefore, during coronavirus pandemic, a great number of elderly people had an urgent need to come into the contact with hospital staff in order to undertake their health condition. Some of them were in a risk-category of people, who can easily be infected, so it was extremely important that they would be provided with all supplements and instructions from medical staff. Ċ On the other hand, computers also have a tremendous contribution to medical advancement. People, in fact, find the communication through the computers much more convenient as they do not even require to drive to the hospital, waste their time to stand in rows and undergo the appropriate administrative process until the doctor will finally be able to meet them. Moreover, the assignment includes just a few fields to complete namely personal information or identification, and client's health complaints as well. Thus, technologies and recent innovations have a pivotal role to play in people's lives. Ċ To conclude, I believe that medical consultations will be modernized as their necessity will probably increase among the community in the future.

prompt: Illiteracy continues to be a concern for many countries in the world today. What are the causes of illiteracy in the modern world, and what effects does it have on the people concerned and on society as a whole?
essay: Literacy plays a significant role in various aspects of life, and the ever-rising rate of illiteracy has worried the educational systems of many countries. There seem to be two leading causes and some effects that will be discussed in the following. Ċ Perhaps the main cause is the overwhelming cost of education that people who reside in less-affluent countries could not afford. Due to poverty and the increasing inflation rate, families can only provide their basic needs, including food, clothes, and housing in such countries. Their economic condition makes the education of their children a low priority. The ever-present danger of decreased motivation for finishing academic courses seems to be the second well-known cause of illiteracy. Some children, particularly those who live in developed countries, start school; however, they lose their motivation to acquire advanced knowledge and thus abandon study without graduation. This phenomenon could stem from the new advances in video games, social media, and internet-based applications that have distracted children from homework. Ċ The effects of illiteracy could be observed in all aspects of individual life. An illiterate person cannot read, understand even simple signs, and find the correct directions that regularly happen in everyday life. Therefore, these people constantly experience weakness that influences their communication. A noticeable impact of illiteracy would be unemployment or having low-paid careers. In today’s modernized world, people should have at least a bachelor's degree to be hired in order to avoid difficulties. Otherwise, they tend to commit a crime like burgling that threatens community security. The final but the most significant effect of illiteracy would be its irreparable damage to the economic and political conditions of a country because both terms need a highly-educated nation to preserve and progress the country following other developed countries. Ċ In conclusion, poverty and decreased motivation are the leading causes of illiteracy that negatively impact the quality of life of an illiterate person, the number of skilled employees, the economy, and the security of a country.

prompt: The most important decision young people have to make is about choosing their career. Do you agree or disagree with this statement? Give your own opinion and examples.
essay: The idea that what individual wants to do as a job is not important seems at first glance a fair statement, nevertheless it may make the assumption that there are many other crucial issues about which individuals have to make decisions. As I shall argue there are compelling reasons why choosing what career for young generation may direct their education, place where they will live and information acquired. Ċ To begin with, their major in university is what can be affected by the future occupation. When young adults go to university and study for four years, they acquire directed information and learn skilled craft. Therefore, they try to become prepared for the future careers. Ċ The other root of such a grave idea is that choosing workplace for the rest of their lives, adolescents try to gain much more information of certain workplace. For example, young generation try to know about not only employees who works in specific workplaces, but skills which are needed for these workplaces, as well. Ċ Moreover, if teenagers have clear description about their future jobs, they will choose where to live for earning more money. They may be encouraged immigration to country or city in which their majors have huge high paying job opportunities. Therefore, they can earn the huge amount of money. Young adult like their jobs and live in the high standard of living. Ċ In conclusion, I once again would like to argue that deciding which job may be chosen by young generation helps him/her in other fundamental issues in their lives for example, Choosing their majors, finding the best place to live and gaining requisite skills are affected by which occupation is interested by young people.

prompt: many automobile manufacturers created self-driving systems for their vehicles. discuss advantages and disadvantages of releasing cars with these system.
essay: As the advent of modern technology, there has been a common belief that automakers of smart cars may cause some adverse issues to the society and pose a threat to the old generation for not updating these new high-tech equipment. However, from a personal perspective, I do believe that auto system obviously brings more merits than the bad ones. Ċ There are many compelling reasons why peoples consider automobile manufacturers as a complex system. On the individual level, the old seems it is hard for them to learn how to use these transportations and apparently transforming into this new trend must cost an arm and a leg on a wide scale. In addition, technological advances in self-driving automobiles can reduce the security of their owner's privacy. For instance, to keep track of users destinations, auto system can hold a host of informations which can be served as detrimental purposes if there are any hackers want to use it. Ċ Nevertheless, automobile vehicles will help us reduce remarkably accidents and become one of the most convenient devices according to its self-driving program. The system based on algorithms designed to overcome human errors by working orderly. In fact, a recent survey has shown that about 60 percent of automobile accidents can be prevented by using self-driving systems. This is because they can monitor the paths more carefully, keep a safe distance from other vehicles. Extrinsically, they do not depend on personal emotions and work efficiently without human's cognitive. This can lead to a decrease in human error and accident rate so everyone can drive safely and minimize negative consequences. Ċ To sum up, although community still has some controversial prejudices about applying self-driving system for their transportations, it is evident that using this process will properly increase the life standard of citizens and create a number of advantages.

prompt: In the future it may be necessary for us to live on another planets. For this reason, some people believe that we should spend money now researching planets that could be possible home, such as mars. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The searching for the unknown is human nature. There are many people who consider it is crucial to conduct cosmos studies since one-day mankind may be relocated to another planet for a better prospect so spending for this is justifiable. In my opinion, I firmly think the fund can utilize for the development of the needy. Ċ To begin with, relocating to other planets can be impossible due to its complexity; therefore the fund, which channelises to carry out such research, could be provided to resolve the much pressing sectors. In other words, with the help of the fraction of the spice investment can improve the standard of the underprivileged ones. For instance, India, a developing country, which invests a great chunk of its national income into space excavations; however, this can be better if the authority spends the amount for the betterment of its citizens. Thus, it is clear that how futile the cosmos research. Ċ Another point here is that space exploration is in the rudimentary form, it would require thousands of years experiments are required before moving to another part of the universe. Moreover, the predictability of the studies is unclear . For example, it has been noted that the majority of the initiatives to Mars have been failed some point of the mission . Human activists think that , instead of wasting various resources, the lives of the human need to be assisted. Ċ In conclusion, allocating national income for the exploration of outer space is regarded as a useful act by some. I think it is waste money as the experiments are in the elementary stage and chances for a successful mission accomplishment is slim.

prompt: Which would you choose: a high-paying job with long hours that would give you a little time with family and friends or a lower-paying job with shorter hours that would give you more time with family and friends? Explain your choice, using specific reasons and details.
essay: In this modern era, competition is rising rapidly and as a result, people are opting for jobs with long working hours and higher wages to survive. Although working day and night helps them earn money, it leaves them with no leisure time to spend with family and friends. Personally, I feel I will always choose my family before anything else, so, I will opt for low paying job with shorter hours to spend time with my family. Ċ Firstly, more than money mental peace is important to me. If I am not happy with my workplace, and I am stressed out for most of the day, there is no way I can enjoy my salary. Perhaps, I will be spending more on my medical bills due to this. For instance, with busy schedules, I may not get enough time to sleep and exercise which can make me sick. Secondly, with work commitments, I will be missing most of the family events and I will be juggling between both work and social life. What is the point of earning money, if I cannot enjoy any free time with my family? Additionally, in long run, it will only distant me from my people. Ċ On the other hand, with jobs demanding short working hours, it becomes easier to balance life. Like, I can spend evenings with my family and friends; I can go on holiday. Moreover, I can take better care of myself too by doing exercises and other extra-curricular activities. Even though with less money, I feel I will be in a more happy and satisfying space. For example, if I am giving time to my kids, they will value me more and maybe this will make them more aware of what real happiness means. Nowadays, children have become distant from their parents because of their busy schedules. Ċ To conclude, we cannot deny the fact that financial stability is important but ignoring social life because of work can be harmful in long run. It can lead to depression and many other psychological health conditions. A person should try to strike a balance between the two in order to have a happy and fulfilling life.

prompt: Very few school children learn about the value of money and how to look after it, yet this is a critical life skill that should be taught as part of the school curriculum. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: A small number of youngsters are aware of the importance of finances and how to manage them, even though, they are used in every aspect of our society. A commonly held belief is that management should be included as a school subject. In this essay, I am going to elaborate on this topic and show my approval. Ċ To begin with, management is a crucial life skill. The majority of people are taught how to work with technologies and how to solve difficult mathematical equations. However, a truly valuable experience , which money managing undoubtedly is, is out of the curriculum. Thus, in the future, a student won't be able to look after their credits. For example, if a person studies abroad, they will be unable to look after their expenses. Therefore, he will need to take credits, which can become a future burden. Ċ Secondly, a lack of experience in finances is sure to prevent those who wish to continue their education in the business sphere. Since children are not taught business at school, they do not have enough experience in it. This will lead to a variety of disadvantageous circumstances ,such as learning basic concepts at university. As a result, one's education will be immensely intruded and an individual will need to study twice as much, in order to catch up with the curriculum of higher education. Ċ To summarise, I firmly believe that the value of money should be taught at school. By doing this, the government ensures that young adults can deal with everyday financial problems and there won't be prevention in their career path. Consequently, a bigger part of the population will acknowledge the power of money, which will lead to a more peaceful life.

prompt: Countries should try to produce all the food for the population and imports as little food as possible. To what extent do you agree or disagree? I DISAGREE WITH THIS TO A LARGE SCALE
essay: Due to the recent development in food industry worldwide, many people argue that countries should push their domestic food industry and import fewer food products from foreign countries. However, I am not in favour with this idea to a large degree. Ċ It is understandable that not every countries can have the ingredients available to produce particular food for their population due to differences of climate conditions. For instance, farmers in countries with perennially cold weather can encounter great difficulties in cultivating crops and producing food such as rice. This is why the government are reluctant to import rice products from countries where the weather patterns are compatible for agricultural development. As a result, this helps to meet the demand for agricultural products and increase food security. Ċ Nevertheless, there is a belief that food imported from foreign countries is not guaranteed in terms of safety and standards, which I think is not a reason why countries must switch to producing their own food. This situation can be tackled with stricter food quality monitoring. When a food product is delivered from an international source, it is imperative for the government to reassure the quality by examining its current condition. In case this product is considered a violation to safety standards, the authorities can immediately put a ban on commercial distribution, thus preventing dangerous food consumption in the public. Ċ In conclusion, I am not an opponent of encouraging countries to produce their own food and restrict imports, as the different climate conditions make it nearly impractical. Although imported products can cause problems related to consumers' health, it can be solved with stronger law enforcement, such as quality examination.

prompt: USING MOBILE PHONES Anybody can use a mobile phone to answer the work and personal calls at any time or 7 days a week. Does this development have more positive or negative effects on both individuals and society?
essay: In recent years, the population of mobile phones has been making a great deal of public controversy due to its substantial impacts on human lifestyle. Although the idea that mobile phones do more harm than good appears reasonably, they bring more positive effects overall. Ċ There are a number of reasons why the mobile phones are necessary to the individuals in daily life. First, using mobile phones is one of the most efficient and inexpensive ways to communicate with others. Before the appearance of mobile phones, delivering a message from a location to another would require the physical travels, costing unnecessary time, efforts and money. Second, people can use mobile phone as a convenient tool to caught information and news worldwide faster. For example, mobile phone users easily read news on their devices, reducing fee and time for buying a newspaper or magazines. Ċ Another compelling reason for using mobile phones is that they bring a number of advantages to the society. In fact, mobile phones have functions that enable users to keep contact, thereby promoting the social behaviors and strengthening the social connections. For instance, people are more likely to lose important contacts or even forget one another if they do not use cell phones. In addition, since the industry of mobile phones has been creating more jobs and new positions, it plays a significant role in the development of society. In some countries, this industry has an extraordinary innovation and expansion, contributing to a large part of GPD and the income of citizens every year. Ċ In conclusion, the upsides of mobiles phones still outweigh their disadvantages. Everyone should learn to use mobile phones efficiently instead of apperceiving them.

prompt: Throughout history, people have dreamed of living in a perfect society, but they have not agreed on what an ideal society would be like. What do you think is the most important element of a perfect society in the modern world? How can people work towards achieving an ideal society?
essay: Every individual tries to live in a society which is perfect in every aspect, but they are not aware of what a perfect environment is? In my opinion, honesty and a positive attitude among individuals are the key elements of an ideal community. Furthermore, the approach to achieve a perfect society to thrive is to follow the rules set by the government. Ċ The ideal habitat truly depends on the inhabitants, because they must help each other to settle well in a particular community. In addition, they must accept each other values, regardless of their differences, whereas honesty is needed for the prosperity of the general population. The inhabitants must show their loyalty to each other and the country. As an illustration, the locals must not support any international invasion and they must discourage the evil intentions such as betraying their own people. Thus, the motivation to help others and the loyalty among them are the key elements. Ċ Nevertheless, the governing bodies must play their role in setting an ideal community by implementing the strict rules and regulations for people to follow and the people must abide the rules set by the higher authorities. For instance, the government of Pakistan passed a bill in the national assembly which states that no one is allowed to sell or export drugs. Due to this policy which is followed by the masses, Pakistan is considered as a drug free country. Hence, the combined efforts of the higher authorities and individuals can lead to formation of perfect societies. Ċ To sum up, in my view, the intentions to help each other and the loyalty among people are the significant elements of an ideal society. Moreover, the people can work towards achieving such an environment by following rules implemented by the supreme authority.

prompt: In conclusion, contacting an employee may prove fruitful in certain situations, it may have a bearing on employee happiness and health. It could even lead to attrition.
essay: In today’s competitive world, employers want to be able to contact their employees no matter where they are in order to maintain smooth operations. This approach may have many positives, but it does have a few negatives as well. Ċ To start with, it is important to be able to contact an employee especially during difficult times at work in case of an emergency. For example, hospitals need to be able to contact their staff in case of patient emergencies, trauma and calamities. This may help save a life or many lives. In times of troubleshooting certain tasks, a phone call or email may save a presentation, project or win a deal for an organization). Certain organizations, call centres,for instance, need their staff on-call throughout the year. Any failure to do so may lead to loss of business and revenue. Ċ Contacting employees does not always benefit employers. To begin with, no representative likes to be contacted by their employer when they are at home or on holiday. This may invoke a feeling of resentment towards the employer. Some individuals are forced to work round the clock. They even take their work home. This leads to overworking, which may further lead to health risks and other related issues. Moreover, the staff member may feel unhappy at his workplace and may even consider seeking job opportunities elsewhere. No employer benefits from an unhappy workforce as it may affect the growth and success of an organization. Ċ In conclusion, contacting the staff may prove fruitful in certain situations, it may have a bearing on worker happiness and health. It could even lead to attrition.

prompt: Some believe that in many nations, it is necessary to spend a lot of money to build new railway infrastructure for fast trains between cities. Others feel that the government should spend money to improve existing public transportation. Discuss both of these perspectives and give your opinion.
essay: In many countries, the government finance lot of money to construct a high-speed railway in cities. Some argue that that fund should use to maintain the existing transport system.I firmly believe that both of these views have their own benefits. In this essay, I will present some analyses that support my opinion. Ċ Firstly, while flights consume a number of fossil fuels, taking fast trains for long-distance journeys would be more likely to save much energy. The result will protect the environment from the greenhouse effect. In addition, the passengers who use trains for travelling do not need to spend much time waiting and checking in as in airports. Building high-speed trains could not only connect the areas but also save time in transportation which foster economic growth. For instance, in Japan, with a high-speed train system called Shinkansen, office workers can visit customers in other cities within one day period. Ċ Moreover, nations should invest money to improve the existing transportation because the fund for modern trains is an extremely big amount that sometimes needs to be borrowed from other countries such as the ODA fund or a loan from the World Bank Group. That will make one nation increase its debt on other foreign countries. In a recent announcement, in order to build infrastructure and the Metro system, Vietnam's foreign debt is nearly 40% GDP , meaning that it is a 40 million Vietnam dong debt for each citizen. Ċ In conclusion, constructing fast train systems is essential for the country's economic demand. However, it should be considered based on the nation financial status.

prompt: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Sometimes it is better to be dishonest. Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
essay: There is no shortage of opinion that the moral values of the world have decreased over the last few decades. In my opinion, I personally agree that honesty should be followed even in case of trouble situations. I feel this way for two main reasons, which I will explore in the following paragraphs. Ċ First and foremost, honesty creates a complete man. A few years before, in our childhood, it was taught that ‘honesty is the best policy.’ Consequently, this is embedded in the thoughts and activities and the best version of a person is made. A person without honesty feels guilty about the dishonest act he had done and will have to live in disguise. For instance, a study done by a famous psychologist suggests that a serious act of being dishonest, affect a person’s mental status. Eventually, he may become distressed and frustrated. For this reason, honesty is a value that is very crucial in making out the best human being. Ċ Secondly, the social life of a dishonest person is often problematic. In particular, he is often socially isolated and people look at him as an unjust and inhuman person. This, in turn, affects his family life and work life. Furthermore, even if he tries to be honest, society will still think that he is lying. This can be better demonstrated by a personal example. When I was doing myChange the pronounmeIt appears that the pronoun my should not be in the possessive form. Consider changing it. Ċ show examples under graduation, I had a classmate who cooks up irrelevant and unnatural stories to impress people. A lie cannot live indefinitely and the truth behind all these unreal stories was revealed. From then, he is noted as a dishonest liar and all his fellow friends kept a distance from him. He is left isolated in the class as well as in the hostel. Even though he tried to correct himself, the class as a whole did not accept this. So, it is clear to say honesty is important in a society, Ċ In conclusion, honesty is a pillar of a person’s character and should be followed always. This is because honesty creates a perfect man and also being dishonest is a threat to a person’s societal life.

prompt: In the past, important knowledge of culture and history was stored in museum. Nowadays information is freely available on internet, therefore is no longer need for museum. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree ?
essay: With the invention of technology, the popularity of museums is decreasing. Presently, information about the ancient times are readily available online, therefore, some people believe that there is no need to visit the museum anymore. Though it is true that some of the materials in the galleries can be found on various websites, I completely disagree that ancient showrooms are needless. Ċ The availability of different data on the computer today makes some people believe that exhibitions of the olden days way of life is not necessary. This is because it is cheaper to go to the net and gather the necessary knowledge about a period of time or any particular set of people than it is to buy a plane ticket and book a hotel to visit an exhibition that is kilometres away. For example, the annals and the practices of the Yoruba tribe of Nigeria can be studied on google without visiting the ancient town of 'Ile-Ife' where the monuments and old remnants are preserved. Nonetheless, seeing the pictures of past life and culture on the net cannot be compared to when it is seen directly. Ċ However, visiting old collections of a particular place is still crucial and cannot be overemphasized. Going to museums is an avenue for parents and children spend time together as a family, as well as serving as a way of educating the young ones about the cultural heritage and thus preserving it. For instance, parents who accompany their children to the Calabar exhibit in Nigeria often serve as tour guide as they explain every little detail to their kids and thence bond together as a family. In addition, the memory of seeing this ancient archive face to face last longer than viewing it on websites, and also they can be touched and seen from all angles. Ċ In conclusion, even though some people find online information easier to access and less costly, the importance of going to the museums should be encouraged. I agree that the internet cannot replace the several archaeological materials and knowledge that the museum preserves.

prompt: Some people think that the best way to improve road safety is to increase the min legal age for driving a car or motorbike.To what extent do you agree/disagree
essay: A recent study suggests that improving road safety can significantly lower down the accident rates, some people think that increasing the legal age for driving automobiles is the best way to tackle the problem. I completely agree that this is the best way to improve it owing to the security of the drivers and pedestrians. Ċ Firstly, many accidents can be avoided by strictly adhering to speed limits as suggested by authorities. However, many youths are seen flouting these rules and have been directly responsible for any accidents which could have been easily avoided if not for their rash driving. For instance, a 16-year-old with a speeding car crashed into another car resulting in the death of 4 elderly persons. Had he been careful with his speed those people wouldn't have met this terrible fate. Ċ Secondly, youth don't take safety measures seriously as sometimes having just a helmet can be a lifesaver for a motorcyclist. Keeping the head safe from a crash can save the life of the wearer. For example, a 36-year-old who met with a major bike accident on a busy highway has escaped serious injuries because of the helmet. As kids like to be adventurous they neglect devices like a helmet and invite unnecessary troubles. Ċ In conclusion, As drivers in their youth are rash with their driving, increasing the legal age can drastically improve road safety. They become more careful and mature as they age which improves their driving skills resulting in fewer accidents than being recorded annually.

prompt: There is an increasing trend around the world of married couples deciding not to have children. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages for couples who decide to do this happy family without a child?
essay: The number of married couples who opt for a child-free lifestyle is becoming a rising trend around the globe. Although the primary advantage of this decision making is that the families' well-being will remain stable, the main drawback of this is that it might result in a lonely life when the years to come. Ċ Maintaining a family's happiness and health appears to be the evident benefit for couples deciding not to have children. Since these couples barely tackle family pressures from being a parent, they can avoid unnecessary arguments deriving from the parent's responsibility and education fees. As a result, not only can child-free parents maintain the quality of the family, but they also are free to pursue their life expectancy. For instance, more than 129 couples asked in a survey in 2010 admitted that they had proactively chosen to be child-free parents to minimize family pressures. Ċ However, being the lonely elderly reflects the main downside of opting for a child-free lifestyle. When married couples decide to live without the appearance of a child, they might confront a lonely life when their spouse passes away. Inevitably, they could live alone by themselves in either their house or in a nursing home where they are taken care of by the government. For instance, Singapore authority has recently allocated more than 30% of the government budget to construct more nursing homes since the number of the elderly is rising over the years. Ċ In conclusion, although being a child-free parent has promoted the benefit of a healthy and happy family, it could negatively affect the couples in the future concerning the lonely aged.

prompt: Some people think that to be successful you need to get in university education whereas others say it is not true Discuss both ideas and give your own opinion
essay: There are varying opinions on success. Some believe that a higher level of education is required. On the other hand, others argue that it is not necessary. I agree with the latter, which says that a degree is not a determinant for wealth. Ċ Some person opiate that for an individual to be rich, he or she has to further their studies and have a profession. They make this claim on the basis that second level training is not adequate, therefore, the need for tertiary learning in order to acquire a fortune. For instance, they believe that studying more and become a doctor ,for example, guarantees the person's comfort. Although I agree that studying to have a profession is absolutely right, I disagree with the view that it makes the person rich. In addition, there are lots of graduates today who has no job and has no money at all for example. Ċ Furthermore, some argue that attaining the highest heights of education is not an important factor to be wealthy. They make this argument with their points based on the fact that there are a lot of influential men today who dropped out of high school. Despite this popular individuals never completing their studies, they are now employers of labour. I support this side of the argument with my reason that skill also could be sufficient. By comparison, these well-known persons have something in common and that is they had a skill they were good at. All they did was to improve what they know how to do best and commercialized it. Thus, generating income, well enough to even employ the brightest of minds who excelled in school. Ċ In conclusion, the essence of formal education cannot be argued, however, it is not determining importance to achieving financial security. Therefore, I reiterate my support for this claim.

prompt: Nowadays, people try to change their life by changing their clothing styles, wearing jewelers, changing their appearances through cosmetic surgery. Why do you think people are doing this and do you agree or disagree this behavior?
essay: In contemporary society, cosmetic surgery has become one of the most pervasive issues, especially among women. They began to focus on external beauty rather than internal beauty, and try to change their life by changing their clothing styles, wearing jewelry and appearances. Some argued that this phenomenon has beneficial impact on people's psychology. Personally, I believe their views have both pros and cons. Ċ Basically, there are some reasons why human begins intent on changing their appearance permanently. First and foremost, the most appealing and seductive exterior can refine a physical trait that feeling complete and confidence, moreover, fashionable dress with superb jewelry can reflect a person's taste and be a pioneer of fashion. Last, presenting a good appearance can change our way to life and encourage people's creativity. Ċ Take movie star as a typical example, great appearance reveals a person's attitude toward the role they are acting. Stars as public figures are desired to present themselves to the utmost in front of the camera. Although an unkempt appearance may not affect their life, but it would have negative influence on their public image. In this case, I agree good appearance could enhance their opportunities in workplace. Ċ However, changing people's life by suffering cosmetic surgery can bring about more cons. It is a drastic measure, unexpected or unsatisfied transformation may cause them to undergo psychological as well as the physical effects. To conclude, people could focus on changing external appearance such as changing their clothing style and wearing, rather than suffering cosmetic surgery.

prompt: Eating a balanced diet is the most important factor for a healthy life. Ċ To what extent do you agree?
essay: It is observed that the consumption of nutritious foodstuff is the most significant aspect to live in good condition. In my opinion, I agree with the statement because it helps to reduce the health problems and protect the environment. Ċ To begin with, consuming a meal with more nutritions will minimise the health issues such as obesity, diabetes, heart attack and so on. That is to say, half of the people in the world are lagging in physical fitness because of sedentary lifestyles and fast food consumption. Therefore, taking the balanced diet will reduce or avoid their illness and aid them to live longer. For example, the lifespan of people in Japan is higher than any other countries in this world because they consume appropriate proportion of eatables to extend their life. Hence, proper diet will improve their health to be active and heal and prevent all the ailments they have in their body. Ċ Another point to consider is that it will help to save the surroundings. In other words, by eliminating animal products will improvise the biodiversity and it will naturally prevent from environment hazardous problems. Also, consuming the vegetables grown in local farm aid to prevent the deforestation. For instance, in India, most of the people prefer to eat organic foods and minimised the intake of meat or other animal products which help them to stay fit and healthy. Thus, people consuming farm grown things and eliminating animal items will prevent the atmosphere for them to live happily. Ċ In conclusion, I wholeheartedly agree that consuming nutrient food is a crucial thing for vigorous survival because it not only lowers the physical problems but also rescue the natural resources.

prompt: Does the advent of internet change the role of teacher? To what extent do you agree? the importance of teachers in internet era
essay: In the tech savvy era, some argue that the existence of technologies like Internet may have altered the role that teachers play.
