While Internet has definitely its place in the society, teachers should not be marginalized as they still play an important role in supporting their students mentally. Therefore, I partially agree with the statement and so will be pleased to discuss these two reasons in more details. Ċ On the one hand, Internet has allowed individuals to study and learn at home at their convenience which means they no longer have to attend classes to acquire new knowledge. This is not at all surprising, considering that Internet has made any kind of information accessible to the vast majority of people. For example, David, one of my friends, believe it is not necessary for students to communicate face to face with their teachers to learn and understand new concepts and principles. Ċ On the other hand, Internet can never replace teachers entirely in the sense that it cannot motivate and encourage its users to learn. Just like students, teachers are human beings and they are capable of motivating and persuading their pupils to explore and acquire new knowledge. For instance, most of my friends find it arduous to self-study online as although they have access to all the relevant and accurate materials, it is relatively tedious to study on their own; most of them would rather have their teachers explaining new ideas to them instead of looking at the monitor. Ċ Having discussed the importance of both teachers and internet, it can be concluded that teachers still have a place in this society. In other words, the development of Internet has not impacted the role of teachers to a great extent. Consequently, I only agree with this statement to a small extent.

prompt: Some people tend to study a subject on intensive way over a short period of time,while others tend to study a subject constantly or long period of time. What is the better way to of learning ?
essay: Some people hold the opinion that they should study a subject constantly over long period of time. However, more importantly, people who intend to study subject should study in a very intensive way over short period of time for the following reasons. Ċ The first reason that people who study in a very intensive way over short period of time will save the time , thereby increasing the profound the knowledge. To illustrate this, there is very persuasive example. The students who study the English in full time at the English language institute can pass the TOEFL exam faster than the students who study the language constantly in part time in the same institute. Ċ In addition, the studying a subject in very intensive way can be allowed to the people to study more subject compare with the people do not. Now I still remember that my friend Ail who could get two degrees in short time by using the intensive studying in the university. Ċ Further more, The studying a subject constantly over long period of time is somewhat important as well. It can be helped people who can not understand the topis quickly, or need more time to figure out the complex topic. For instance, some student at the math science need three to four year to graduate from the college. Ċ Nonetheless, I still prefer people who study a subject in a very intensive way over the short period of time I am sure that they can save the time and can study more than they do not.

prompt: Some people think that traditional culture can be destroyed by using it as money-making attractions to tourists. However, others believe that it is the only way to save traditions. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: As the development of tourism, more and more traditional culture districts are open to tourists, which has triggered a hot debate Some people think that the traditional culture is destroyed while other claim that the traditional culture could be protected by using it as money making attractions. Personally, I believe moderate opening of traditional culture sites to tourists is an effective way to protect the local culture. Ċ Admittedly, taking the traditional culture sites as money-earning machine would absolutely destroy the traditional culture to some extent. It is obvious that the vicious cycle would happen without reasonable management and controlment along with the arrival of increasing tourists, not only the environment of traditional culture districts would be destroyed, but also dissatisfactions and conflicts would be produced. There are not a few of such cases from the current reports or news. Ċ However, we can not deny the functions and effects of opening them to the public. Most important of all is that it is the most effective to protect the culture itself, only when the culture is known and spread by the common people, will it have a long life span. Besides that, another effect that can be ignored is the economic income; the traditional culture building could be renovated and protected better by using them. Ċ Personally, I think it is wise to more effective way to allow the tradition culture to be open to the public, but what I think is the most important is that the aim of opening it to the public should be spread and protect culture while not to earn money.

prompt: In the past, most people used to travel to their place of work. With increased use of computers, the internet and smart phones, more and more people are starting to work from home.
essay: Over the centuries, a majority of people had left their workplaces apart from their homes. However, today’s popularity of IT devices such as computers, the internet, and smartphones leads more people to work from home. This advancement has benefited from the loss of commute cost and drawbacks from a situation in isolation. And more specifically, its pros and cons are as follows. Ċ On the one hand, individuals can get many choices for spare time and residential areas without commuting. Instead of spending 1hour per day inside transportations, they can afford to learn something new or take care of family members. In addition, urban areas with costly properties are not an option for their home, but the countrysides are also one, due to being free from travel to offices. According to research on employees’ lifestyle in the IT field, approximately 50% of them answered that they started working from home lately and were satisfied with their after-work lives than before. And it showed that many of the respondents moved to dwell abroad like nomads. These are groundbreaking innovations from the way one works to the location one stays. Ċ On the other hand, digital devices can limit authentic communication among colleagues. In other words, internet messengers and meetings require only immediate responses regarding the tasks, whereas face-to-face interactions built up trustful relationships at workplaces. Then workers easily feel lonely and depressed. For this reason, that many companies introduced the work way to provide their employees with mental healthcare services. Ċ In a nutshell, since many companies instituted a work from home policy, many workers have chosen it because it has given them more free time and habitation choices. Nevertheless, it should not be underestimated that individuals can often find themselves gloomy because of a lack of direct connection to peers.

prompt: PARENTS AND CHILDREN RELATIONSHIP TOPIC: In many countries, young people are granted certain privileges and responsibilities at the age of sixteen. Clearly parents have a responsibility to both care for and prepare their children as they approach this important milestone. To what degree should parents intervene in the lives of their 14-15-year-old children?
essay: All citizen of a country are fair in law as they are entitled to do something when they old enough. If they are a child, they will be protected from danger by the government. In my opinion, there are two ways to ensure that the rights of young people are respected. Ċ Through school, mass media, people's rights are widely disseminated. By putting posters along the main roads, moreover, writing books, song and short films about halls of power as the main topic should be encouraged to produce and give free to students. In addition, the online social network is another way to convey the human rights to the young people. This could educate young people about the importance of their rights so that they seek to help to defend themselves. Ċ The government also has a responsibility to protect the young people's rights. Polices should take the interests of young people into account. In certain circumstance, they will appoint a young people's commissioner to sorority new legislation for compliance with the framework such as the Vietnam Convention on the Rights of the Young. This method results in ensuring young people are continuously represented in the hall of power. Ċ All in all, to ensure the youth rights, the whole society must give their hands. It is clear that respecting the youth rights is not just for benefits of the young, but also for highly security of society.

prompt: You should spend about 40 minutes on this task. Ċ Write about the following topic: Ċ Some people think that hosting an international sports event is good for the country, while some people think it is bad. Discuss both views and state your opinion. Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. Ċ You should write at least 250 words.
essay: Several individuals believe that bearing international games such as football or tennis has more benefits for society. However, others argue that it brings disadvantages. Personally, I advocate the first view opposing the second one owing to the fact that international sports provide regional visibility. Although it is a financial resources spending. This essay will shed light on both sides of the view and provide evidence from the UN investigation and the University of Oxford to prove the arguments. Ċ On the one hand, arranging worldwide events give the nation visibility. In others words, these ceremonies come with press coverage, becoming the region more visible to stakeholders, entrepreneurs throughout the planet. Let's take South Africa as an example, the UN scientific study in 2011, pointed out that this land becomes 10 times more famous due to the FIFA world cup of 2010 . As a result, it soared tourism attractions and businesses. Moreover, it became the main fountain of revenues for three consecutive years. Ċ On the other hand, partaking in a world sport is a wasteful resource. Because of incalculable financial expenditures used in stadiums construction and mesmerising accommodations these events divert citizens opinions. Furthermore, to provide a secure environment for all people coming overseas, a huge amount of money is needed to be deployed. For instance, scientific research carried out by Oxford University in 2007 after the Germany world cup in 2006 showcased that more than 15% of Germany PIB were utilized in solely one game city, the money enough to build 500 schools and pave 3000 German roads. Hence, the event was regarded as a failure by a plethora of critics. Ċ In conclusion, despite international sports being considered as taxes spending, it has undoubtedly more benefits than drawbacks. Therefore, I recommend the local ruling power organize these types of events in their lands for sake of economic growth and national visibility.

prompt: Some people believe that the responsibility for the protection of the environment is by a transnational organization, rather than by each individual country. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is certainly true that few individuals think that the onus of protecting the environment lies with an international organization and not on each state separately. I do not concur with this school of thought and in the essay, I will provide my point of view with examples.  Ċ To begin with, those who advocate that it is the duty of an international organization to protect the ecosystem may argue that this mechanism will work even for nations who do not have any funds to support it. For example, a poor nation like Kenya who does not have enough money to feed its own people, will not be able to spend anything on saving the natural habitats and let it die on its own. Here the united-body will be able to assist since it will have bucks pooled up from rich countries as well. Moreover, this body will also be able to oversee and help in cases where two countries are in a conflict to work together for a bigger cause. Hence, the transnational institution is the need of the hour.  Ċ On the other hand, in my opinion, it is better if every country is free to safeguard its environment on its own since it will be the best judge of the magnitude of the problem faced. For instance, Australia is the best to understand the gravity of the issue of the coral reef. It will hardly be understood properly by a landlocked nation. Additionally, if in case a global institution is given the duty to preserve the biosphere, it will lead to many conflicts over the sharing of funds. Every state will ask for equal distribution and non-lobbying states will be left out. Alternatively, if a province fails to protect its natural resources, united-nations can plan to put restrictions on it. Ċ In conclusion, despite the benefits of funds being available to poor nations and united body helping two countries at conflict to work together in case of a worldwide institution fulfilling the duty, I believe that every country is the best judge to understand its natural habitat and its associated problems and a global body can have conflicts for the distribution of funds. Hence, a system of an individual nation managing its ecosystem is more just, and justice in my view is paramount.

prompt: All young people should be encouraged to try new sports, including extreme sports Extreme Sports - Do You Dare?
essay: Sport is very important, because thanks to sports people are healthy and active. Extreme sport is also necessary, because it gives new experience. Often young people don't know what is an extreme sport and why it is important or dangerous. Ċ On the one hand, I agree, that young people should to do sport, and try new experiences, Every new activity is experiencing. However, these are playing football, dancing or doing extreme sport. All new look as try extreme sport is interesting and of course new experience. Example, when young people do Benji jump, she/ he know that it is good or bad for them. And if she/he likes it, then can do it more and more. All new experiences are good, because people learn herself/ himself. Ċ On the other hand, I disagree that young people should try extreme sports. It is everyone's personal choice, if she/he want to try it or not. As well extreme sport is dangerous and there are a lot of accidents, when people do extreme sport. When encourage people to do extreme sport and show videos and pictures about this, then young people think only that is fun. and do not think that is dangerous also. Ċ In conclusion, I think that sport is very important and all young people should to sport. But this decision if to do extreme sport or not is everyone's personal choice. Of course, should talk about extreme sport, then young people know, which sports, there are, but also take the consequences, when do extreme sport.

prompt: Nowadays, food travels thousands of miles from the farm to the consumer. Is it a positive or a negative development?
essay: Nowadays, as the modern civilization takes place, a model of supplying directly from the farm to supermarkets in the cities has formed. To my view, despite the benefits it offers to people, it is still largely a negative development. Ċ It is true that there are many advantages brought to city people by this development. People are presented with more diversified choices constituted by food from all over the world. Take cherries as an example, people do not have to travel thousands of miles to enjoy those in the farm. Thus the benefit of convenience can be enjoyed. Also, as the environment in metropolitans is greatly polluted, people, by doing so, are still able to enjoy pollution-free vegetables. This prevents pollution to exert further effects into people's diet. Ċ However, there are tradeoffs to these benefits. First, with thousands of miles of travelling, fruits and vegetables can hardly be kept fresh without chemical additives which could cause serious harm to human body. Even worse, in order to prevent vegetables from corruption, some farmers crop them days before maturation, causing a large proportion of nutrition to be lost. Ċ Second, increased use of transportation means could worsen the existing environmental problems. More specifically, fuel that cars and airplanes use contributes greatly towards Global Warming by releasing carbon dioxide into the air every time it is burned. Eventually, in the long-term, there would be no pollution free site even in the countryside. Ċ To conclude, although supplying food directly from farm exerts some obvious benefits especially to city people, these benefits, in the long term, does not seem to justify its costs and threats it brings.

prompt: Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
essay: People attend University for many reasons. For example, new experience, to increase knowledge, career preparation and etc. Ċ First of all, when students present at lecture or class they can get more knowledge. To be more precisely, the lecture which is instructed by professor is valuable. For instance, when I took "peoples of Africa" class our professor shared with his experience and it was so interesting and motivated a lot of students to learn more about this region. Albeit, our professor gave us a chance to go to fill trips I am sure which a life-long memory. Ċ Second of all, compulsory classes allow students to develop their social and communication skills. For example, studying in a team-work will help students to cooperate with the other students. Also, it gives opportunity to learn how to listen and respect others opinion .Furthermore, it would be a good chance to prepare students to their future career. Ċ Last but not least, another reason that classes should be mandatory is to experience both motivation and competition source. While being required to attend classes you would be able to work with other students and for sure there will be competition among them. As result, it will lead to success and achievement of goals. Ċ To sum up, having three reasons which are valuable knowledge, career preparation and rich experience allows me believe that attendance must be compulsory.

prompt: The worldwide population of children aged 15 and younger is rising. What are the current and future advantages and disadvantages for countries with this kind of growth?
essay: In recent years it is noticed that the population of children has increased all over the world. Therefore, countries take benefit from this change. However, this change has some dark side which effects after a few decades. Ċ On the one hand, there are a lot of o advantages to the younger generation. The youngsters are always a part of the country’s economy and they play a vital role in their incline by their contributions. For example, 65 per cent of Pakistan's population are young people where age are not more than 25 years that's why in a few years Pakistan's economy grow continuously. In addition, the adults have accepted changes very quickly because they are on their learning faces. Thus, nowadays, children interested in science and technology subjects rather than art subjects. Ċ On the other hand, those countries face more problems after a few years where the whole generation getting old at the same time. The authorities will have to spend money on their look after. For instance, according to the report of the BBC. The Thailand major population are base on elder citizens where minimum age is 40 years, therefore the 20 per cent of their budget they have spent on those people and give other facilities. Moreover, at the same time, a generation retires from their jobs. Therefore, countries also face economic crises. Ċ To summarize, young adults creates a lot of thing for this world and contribute to their country's economic development. Whereas, when they turn into old citizens of the country than the authorities should be able to help them and that is a big problem for the governments.

prompt: Exposure to international media, e.g. films, TV and magazines, has an impact on the local culture. Please discuss whether the advantages outweigh the disadvantages.
essay: Today, the local cultures compete strongly with the emergence of foreign cultures through the media. I believe this development triggers an impact on the existence of local culture. Nevertheless, I will discuss this issue further in this essay. Ċ Media is one of the facilities that publish any information around the world which is accessible for people all ages. Furthermore, media can enrich people's insights through magazine or newspaper they read or TV program they watch. Take for instance a healthy American life style article, it is the way of media to foster the readers in order to adjust their life style. Thus, the local people possess a good life long expectancy. Ċ However, there is evidence that not all media presents beneficial programs or articles particularly for youngsters and children. For example in terms of entertainment, such as girl bands or boy bands and drama films published in TV programs. Generally speaking, these shows influence the student's performance in the school because many students have been addicted to watch them. Nowadays, the emergence of foreign culture presented through media such as apparel style disposes people to ignore domestic products. As a consequence, the local culture will erase by the time if the societies do not aware of it. Ċ To sum up, it is true that media has allowed people to see other cultures that can inspire them. However, this phenomenon has threatened the prevailing local culture wherein as a distinction of a country. Therefore, the government should take into account this issue for preventing the eradication of local culture.

prompt: Some parents allow their teenage children to live independently, away from home. Other parents don’t want their teenage children to live away from them. Which do you think is better and why? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
essay: Currently, when children grew up, they have choice living away from parents' house or living together. Some parents think than it is useful for their future living separately while another part think differently. I totally sure that teenagers should live away from the their homes, and I will explain why. Ċ As you know, living the separately has many benefits. Firstly, if people live far away from their parents it can help being independent. Sometimes, they should make a decision in different situation. Moreover, this time parents cannot help them. Of course, children may make several mistakes. Consequently, if they go through this situation, it is can develop their mind to the good way. For instance, after school some students should choose when they continue their education. As a result, they have to decide which one is the best for them. Ċ Secondly, living far away from home can teach us the invaluable lesson of living in harmony with other people. We learn to live with many roommates, and sometimes, bear with their bad habits. We learn to tolerate, as well as respect others. Apparently, it is like we are living in a small society, and this will help us a lot in getting along with people later in our career. For example, students who live in the university’s campus noticeably different from the students who live with parents. Ċ To conclude, from the above arguments, live from the parents can change their live very strong. It is a very good choice for the mind developing and being independent.

prompt: Some people believe that the government should support the funds for the arts, while some other people suggest that money should be used for public health and education. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: A particular issue about social funds has raised quite a concern at home and abroad. Some individuals consider that governments should spend more money on public health and education while others believe it is more useful to support the funds for arts. In my opinion, it is necessary to look at the inherent details on both sides and leads to a plausible conclusion. Ċ On one hand, unlike science that focuses on and emphasizes figures, art offers people more faith and optimism that could turn the tide of the dark side of humanity. Modern people have nowadays accumulated pressure throughout their daily work time. However, art provides opportunities to deal with the suffering that needs to be addressed. For example, whenever people feel moody, they might seek shelter in music and drawing- either by singing, performing, or painting, through these art activities, which may help humans alleviate their stress. Moreover, it escalates not only people's mental situation but also generates more energy for the society and leads to a positive influence on human-beings. Ċ On the other hand, those individuals who focus on spending funds on public health and educational systems consider a more practical aspect of society. For one thing, public welfare provides people's basic living needs. Therefore, the more governments focus on the public welfare system, the more likely will it influence the substantial aspect of citizens' life. For instance, governments should allocate some budgets for instituting educational sectors, public transportations, and public facilities. With these policies that emphasize more on materialistic aspects of life, the more possibilities will give rise to an elevation of public living standards. Hence, leading to a profound impact on the community. Ċ To put in a nutshell. I consider that both art and public welfare are inseparably interconnected. That is to say, art and public welfare effect on either the mental and physical sides of humans. Thus, it is an essential issue for modern society to learn to tip a balance between art and public health, ranging from encouraging people to appreciate the beauty of art to instituting more public facilities.

prompt: Cyclists and car drivers sharing the same roads causes some problems. What are the problems and what can be done to reduce them?
essay: Contemporarily, in several countries, bicycle and car users have a tendency to travel on the same tracks. There are galore problems caused by this propensity as well as some achievable contrivances for authorities and roadsters to diminish those route issues. Ċ In general, cyclists and car drivers using the same roadways certainly leads to two main points. Firstly, the more various vehicles on one thoroughfare are, the higher the mortality rate is. To be more specific, when there is a variety of transportations, it is a threat for bikers to be crashed by four-wheel means. For example, in Vietnamese national highway 1A, the average mortality rate is 10 victims per year, which most are caused by motorcycles crushed by cars. Moreover, not only does the mortality rate increase but also the velocity of cycles is likely to hinder steersmen. For instance, helmsmen have to wait for people who ride their bikes to pass through the way that sometimes makes them late for an appointment. Ċ However, to deal with those problems, some procedures should be taken into consideration. To tackle the great number of road accidents, the governments should consider limiting the maximum speed of automobiles. To illustrate, if they commute slower, they will have more time to be aware of the existence of people who ride bikes in their surroundings so as to keep a safe distance between them. Furthermore, we probably deal with the inconvenience that automobile controllers have to face by separating automobile laneways and bicycle routes. Thus, commuters can go on their own since they do not have to wait for other transportations. Ċ In conclusion, sharing the same artery by cyclists and chauffeurs may bring some encumbrances that travellers deem not to expect them. Nonetheless, we absolutely deal with those drawbacks by using lots of obtainable methods.

prompt: “ Many people think that men should go out to work while women’s place is in the home. To what extent do you agree or disagree?”
essay: Gender roles have always been the topic of heated dispute. It is believed by many that women should play a more active role in society, while others oppose this idea, and advocate the traditional mindset that obliges men to work outside and women to remain as housewives. I strongly support the latter view for the following reasons. Ċ First and foremost, promoting gender equality benefits both society and individuals alike. Women and men may have different biological attributes, but suppressing either gender with social pressure does not help them flourish. For instance, female political leaders such as Angela Merkel are among the most powerful and progressive leaders globally. If these strong women were forced to stay at home to do house chores, the world would be deprived of such iconic characters. Therefore, these popular gender norms do not apply to today's world, and we need to rethink them. Ċ Moreover, some men may be better at staying at home instead of working outside. In other words, the opposite is also true about gender roles. To illustrate, in many developed countries, it is now common for wives to work regular jobs, while their husbands take care of children and other domestic errands. These men report being extremely satisfied with their situation. Hence, not all men are built to work under stress for long hours and prefer to have a more subtle lifestyle doing tasks that require more patience. Ċ In conclusion, regarding the issue of male and female roles in society, I hold the opinion that the dynamics are changing around the world. Thus, we should accept the transformation of previously common notions. Although both genders may hold certain inherent abilities that differ from one another, each individual ought to be able to determine his or her own destiny.

prompt: Some educationalists argue that non-exam, art-based subjects, such as music, drama, art and craft, should be compulsory in the secondary-school curriculum. They believe that activities such as these can improve overall academic performance.  To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Nowadays many educationalists come with their new research on art influence in student academic improvement. Some say the compulsory subjects should not only depend on science and language but also arts might hold in these considerations to improve student academic performance. While it is true, I tend to argue there more likely to consider the reserve. Ċ Obviously, school has been ruled to represent in compulsory subjects; language and science, and it is main subjects which should be taken examination in secondary school. However, there are some additional curriculum which are used to stimulate student activity such art, music, drama and craft. Ċ Generally, language and science have a longer schedule than additional subjects, but most of students are prefer to do subjects that they are good at. Moreover, researchers believe that additional skill could encourage student interesting to improve their academic performance. Ċ It is true that commonly, students are pleasure to do art or drama for a long time in school, because that subject might be their hobby or talent. Doing art or drama will attract their attention because they can play it together with other friends, and they could do experiment on their hobbies. But to do these subjects, school should prepare more time, and it means student will not focus on their main subject. Ċ Accordingly, educationalists think that making additional subject to be compulsory subject is a must. I think it could be possible because improving talent in someone life could bring much exercise in their talent and it is better than only knowing a general knowledge.

prompt: Topic : Many people support the development of agriculture, such as actory farming and creation of new fruits and vegetables. Others oppose to the idea. Present both sides and give your opinion .
essay: The investment of agriculture has become a wide dicussed topic in our society recently. Some people believe that agriculture should be taken as a main energy part of life while others think technologies should be encouraged instead. In this essay, I will elaborate on this controversial phenomenon. Ċ All people know that health and decease always have an important impact on agriculture process. Goverment recently take care so much about the quality of agriculture product such as food anf vegetables because people can not live without these. Moreover, buisiness related agriculture reaches to improve the economic in a country. It motivates the labor market and to reduce the unemployment happening in modern life. For example, some poor countrien where many farmers are the most living uses more than 75% for developing fields instead of growing advanced technolgies. Ċ However, there are some other people who conclude that putting a lot money to agriculture is waste. It is essential to study and to find out many new facilities in order to adapt people's interest. Furthermore , the deficit of national budget in some poor countries where agriculture activities are developing appear clearly. The productivity is ineffecient. For instance, some products such as coconuts and annatto seeds have to be grown over ten years before harvesting. Ċ In conclusion, some people are very convenient and happy with support agriculture while others are incovenient. In my view, I hope that agricultural activities always be one of crucial role the thrive their own countries.

prompt: Psychological illnesses may not be as obvious as physical disabilities or illnesses, nevertheless they are just as disabling in their own way. Society, however, is more accepting of those with physical than psychological illnesses or disabilities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is true that mental illness being is not as visible as physical sickness, in spite of this, they affect badly in their own way. Nonetheless, the society seems to accept more of those with body than mental diseases. For some reasons, I believe that mental disabilities should be taken seriously. Ċ On the one hand, it is understandable why physical issues are more priority than mental illnesses. The main reason of this is that people who suffer from physical disabilities can see all the problems that relate to their body. As a result, they would most likely go to the doctors and then issues can be treated and diagnosed easily. In addition, it is a mindset of society that when considering to illnesses, people often think of physical issues. Ċ On the other hand, I think that people who suffer from mental illnesses are at risk as those of physical sickness. Statistics show that the number of people who have psychological disorders are the same as those have physical problems. In fact, the number of this is much higher because the data do not show the amount of people who keep silent about their diseases and do not go to the doctors. Moreover, it is difficult to treat the psychological illnesses. This is because the symptoms of these diseases are vague for any particular issues. They take a long time to be treatable for example years of therapy and medicines, sometimes these diseases even come back. Therefore, they could put a strain on people’s budget because of years of treatment. Also, the society is lack of the number of hospitals and doctors who have profession about the psychological issues. Ċ In conclusion, even though mental disorders are not obvious as physical diseases, they are harmful to human health in the their ways and there should be more priorities for these kind of diseases.

prompt: healthy lifestyle - IELTS writing task 2 some people say that the government should ensure that people lead a healthy life, while others believe individuals should have their own choices. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: The healthy lifestyle is important because it has a direct bearing on our dignity and well-being. Some people believe governments' regulations are needed to lead a healthy life, while others think it is a personal choice. From a personal view, I do not believe people will actively engage in it unless governments take some actions. Ċ On the one hand, the authorities' requirements can increase the number of people who have a healthy lifestyle. In this case, governments are likely to conduct a series of restrictions on goods which have adverse impacts on people's health, such as imposing high taxes on alcohol and cigarettes. Some punishments may also be taken to prevent people from not doing exercise. As a result, an increasing number of people will join activities which can improve their health. Ċ On the other hand, people should have rights to choose what kind of life they want to have because they can be happy in this way. People who have always been enjoying healthy fruits and vegetables will keep doing so. However, if governments put compulsory regulations on these people's life, they will suffer from massive pressure and may no longer enjoy the lifestyle that they used to have. Ċ In my opinion, it is more important for governments to guide people about how to lead a healthy life. Many people may not aware of the dangers of bad living habits they are having at the moment. For example, office workers will do more outdoor activities if governments advertise a concept that sitting for a long time will reduce people's lifespan. Ċ In conclusion, people can benefit the most from governments' advice on how to have a healthy life.

prompt: Some people think that schools should stop teaching students by using books, because students find them boring and that children can learn from films, TV, video games and computer instead. To what extent do you agree?
essay: School is a platform that enlightens the path of a child in a prudent and pragmatic way. Due to rapid modernisation and digitalisation in the last decade, certain researchers have now vehemently suggested that educational institutes should stop inculcating bookish knowledge in a student and teach them through various digital platforms. I am in partial agreement with a given statement as both play a vital role in the overall development of the child. In a subsequent ,paragraph I intend to shed light on the given topic with proper illustration and an appropriate conclusion. Ċ Analysing the statement and explaining further, the first and foremost reason is that periodicals are cost-effective and their shelf life is more as compared to films or computer games. Secondly, books cause fewer ill effects on the eyes as compared to digital screens. To vindicate, recent research by WHO has proved that children who use mobile phones at an early age are more prone to have stress and strain on their eyes, as the chance of them wearing spectacles are on the higher side. Ċ On the other hand, there is an exponential rise in audio-video learning as it helps in developing cognitive and analytical skills in a child. Moreover, infants find it more attractive and creative as it uses various visual effects in teaching. To exemplify, BYJU's online platform to teach various lessons uses 3D models and diagrams to explain various theories. Furthermore, they are more entertaining as compared to written publications. Ċ To conclude, one cannot ignore the benefits of both methods in modern schooling structure. Therefore, a proper balance between the two should be maintained.

prompt: The dangers and complexities of the modern world have made the mobile phone an absolute necessity for children. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The threats and complexities to the children of the modern world have made the mobile phone an absolute necessity for them. I completely agree with this statement and this essay will explain further on the same. Ċ To begin with, children are not fully aware of the real dangers that exist in the current world. Their innocent nature can make them potential victims to grave scenarios like robbery and kidnap. In such cases, a mobile phone can be of immense help in ensuring that those youngsters are safe at all times. For example, A third-grade student was recently abducted by a group of men while he was returning from school last week. Although the chance to successfully trace him in such a situation was very low, the police were able to track him using the location tracker feature of his mobile phone and save him as well.Thus, smartphones can be a great benefit to children while facing dangerous situations. Ċ Additionally, children can become demotivated due to various circumstances in life. In such situations, if a child is away from his immediate family but still wants to talk with them privately, then mobiles can be of great help. For instance, last year, my 5-year-old niece suddenly felt emotionally alone while she was travelling on a bus. So she called her mother using her mobile to share her thoughts and she felt comfortable after that.Therefore, mobiles can help children reach to their close friends and family from any place for emotional support. Ċ To conclude, in addition to the examples and reasons provided, I would like to reiterate that children should compulsorily have mobiles to ensure that they are safe physically and emotionally at all times.

prompt: Some people believe that governments should spend the money from taxes on healthcare services, while others think that this budget should be invested in other fields. Ċ Discuss both of these views and give your own opinion.
essay: There has always been an argument on how the tax fund is mismanaged by the central government. Some suggest it should be invested in better healthcare infrastructure, while others propose it should be utilized for other fields like sports, education, housing and many more. In my opinion, I do not agree with money getting spent only on healthcare. However, both sides of this argument will be discussed in this essay before drawing a reasoned conclusion. Ċ To start with, The sole responsibility of a good functioning government is to properly distribute the allocated funds among the various department of the administration. For instance, the finance minister is one of the most important positions within the cabinet, their role is to manage the public fund effectively and allocate it to required sectors. Thus the people of a country are assured that their tax money has been properly dispursed for the welfare of the public. Ċ On the contrary, If the administration decides to focus only on public healthcare and infuse a major portion of the money from the nation's budget into it. This will help in creating better hospitals and state of art medical facilities, which would directly increase the life expectancy of people. For example, The Indian government has increased the healthcare budget from 3% to 6% from the upcoming financial year , this has indirectly helped authorities to establish public hospitals in an interior region of India. Moreover, this proves that villagers who had to travel towards urban cities for better treatment can now get diagnosed in their own village. Ċ To summarise, a good administration has to consider the various aspects of people's requirements. After thorough analysis on this subject, it is predicted that all the fields should be evaluated and the money has to be distributed based on the necessity.

prompt: Some people believe that professional athletes should be free to use performance enhancing substances if they wish. Do you agree?
essay: Over the past two decades, performance-enhancing substances, have become more and more widespread. Profound professional athletes have been caught using them, in order to overtake their competitors. But, should athletes have the choice of taking or not these substances? In my opinion they should not and in this essay I will discuss why. Ċ Firstly, every athlete has the right to choose what he does with his body. In a free society, nobody has the authority over the substances he takes. Although, when competing at high levels, he must follow the rules. Moreover, they give the athlete the ability to achieve astonishing records. To illustrate, the university of Cambridge, conducted a study, and found out that steroids improved individual’s performance by a percentage of 30%. On the other hand, the drawbacks of using these drugs are numerous. Ċ At first glance, long term use, destroys the athlete’s health and, in most cases, leads to a premature death. Moreover, it can have a tole on the athlete’s hormones, which can result in sterilization. For example, the Worldwide health organization, issued a study, showing that more that 20% of people that have used these drugs are not able to have children. Lastly, enhancing athletes, revokes the purity from sports and makes them unappealing. Ċ Taking everything into consideration, illegal substances are tearing down the sports industry. Thus, people from a young age should be informed about the possible dangers of these and governments should do their best to stop their distribution in order to sustain the value of athleticism.

prompt: Television dominates the free time for too many people. It can make people lazy and prevent them from socializing with others. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Currently lazy activities, like watching television take a significant part of the free time of many individuals. This tendency could decrease people’s activities and undermine socialization processes. In my perspective, persons should have the right to spend their free time as they want and if watching television enjoyed them, they might watch it and any the social opinion should not have an influence on them. Ċ According to the psychological research, during, pandemic Covid 19 most people had overviewed their life position and understood that everyone should live according to their rules, do what they want to do, because their life is their responsibility, and the thought of other people should not have an effect on them. Before this period, a social reaction had had a significant impact on human life. Persons had lived in this order, even though it did not give them satisfaction, just only because it was right. For instance, Britney Spears had lived over twenty years under the conservatorship of her father, and, according to her statement, had not stopped this case only because frightened from a public reprimand. However, after rethinking all her life possessions, she had decided to go to court. And, finally, she has won it and has obtained independence. This is an example when despite public views, a person does the right thing when it comes to him/her. Ċ Meanwhile, watching television does not have so negative consequences on human health, rather than unhealthy food, smoking, or drugs. This habit cannot destroy social links, because currently, it is not necessary to go out from the home to support the socialization process, modern gadgets could provide communication process in any convenient way. For example, WhatsApp, Twitter, Facebook, other social networks can bind individuals, who are living from hundred miles from each other. Thus, if this analyzed question does not have so bad effect, as it is commonly believed, there are not any other reasons which can prevent it. Ċ In conclusion, human beings must consider their needs first, any other public opinions do not should influence them. Only this position can bring satisfaction to the human’s life. In my opinion, television is not so bad thing, from those which are existing now, and we do not have any reason and the right to restrict it.

prompt: some people believe that entertainers are paid too much and their impact on the society is negative, while others disagree and believe they deserve money they make because of their positive effects on others. discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: Some argue that celebrities do not contribute anything valuable to the public, although they earn a colossal wage through this profession, whereas others object this notion, saying that they are productive enough to be paid in the such manner. My personal perspective is that entertainers should be receiving a great amount of the money because they deploy their unique talent to entertain the society, despite some provide wrong guidance and an inadequate service. Ċ To begin with, even though celebrities are highly paid, they do not grant a direct service to the state other than entertainment which is non-essential compared with the rest of the profession such as medical, engineering. In fact, they use their popularity and the attractiveness in order to value their demand and some misguide the society through becoming brand ambassadors in socially unacceptable domains such as alcohol, smoking. For an instance, in the UK, the richest category of people are entertainers because they are paid millions of dollars for a single project and some of them even earn through participating advertisements of the brands of alcohol and cigarettes. However, I disagree with this notion because there is a plethora of other ways that they become productive to the population. Ċ On the other hand, entertainers are unique in terms of their inborn skills which they utilize to provide a pleasure to the community. In fact, they relieve stress and provide joy, satisfaction to the people and their own expertise cannot be achieved by the everybody. Moreover, they devote a lengthy duration and make many sacrifices, hardships to cater a successful creation. Therefore, it is indeed justifiable to pay them adequately because their job is not comparable with other careers. For an example, the cricket team of Sri Lanka devotes all their time and dedication to win the Cricket world cup and bring a triumph to the nation. Hence, I agree with this school of thoughts because entertainers represent a whole community. Ċ In conclusion, paying high to celebrities is fair enough because of their unique talent, colossal sacrifices and dedication to entertaining the society, although in some circumstances, their service is not productive and commendable.

prompt: Some people think visitors to other countries should imitate local custom and behaviors. Some people disagree, they think the house country should welcome cultural differences. Discuss the two views and give your opinion. respect for locals and their culture
essay: It may be true for some people traveling overseas have to follow behaviors and values believed by local society while others believe that the home country should appreciate different cultures brought by travelers. This essay will discuss the two points of view. Ċ It is good for foreign people to imitate local custom and behaviors when they travel to other countries. It is a sign that they appreciate what local people believe and it will help them to mingle with everyone who lives there. In addition, it is undeniable that international tourists who behave locally can prevent themselves from conflict with local people because there will be no cultural clash between the local culture and theirs, and they will enjoy their traveling more. For example: to be accepted by the native, European people traveling to Islamic countries should not drink alcohol in public area because it is against Islamic values which forbid Muslim to drink it. Ċ Apart from previous explanation, it is believed that a visited country should accept cultural differences due to several reasons. Foreign travelers may have a hard time and need to take a longer time to adjust to the local culture which is totally new for them so that native people cannot force them to behave as they do. In addition, appreciating new culture shows that local people have high tolerance level and are friendly to welcome anyone who has different behaviors and values. It will be beneficial to boost the number of tourists to that country. Ċ In conclusion, while foreign people are required to appreciate and follow local values because it will help them to mingle easily with natives and have a more enjoyable visit, local people should also welcome other's cultures in order to make them comfortable to live in and increase the potential of their tourism sector.

prompt: in many countries, small shops are closing. why is this happening? is it a positive or negative development.
essay: The business represents an organised effort of an individual or strata of the population engaged in making a living. Due to the advancement of technology, the majority of micro sellers subsequently forced to shut down their enterprise. There are multifarious reasons why small enterprises winding up such as competitive price and constraint in stocking the variety of products. I propound that it is an advantageous process for the development of a country. Ċ One of the foremost causes of diminishing the sole traders is the liberalization of the economy and foreign investment. To gain a customer base multinational companies triggers a price war with local vendors but due to reduced profits micro-merchants are enforced to lock their businesses. For example, Amazon gave big discounts on their website to expand their market reach which hampers the growth of small shops owners. Hence, economic development has certain repercussion on micro industries. Moreover, due to hectic lifestyle people prefer to visit a store where they can find different items under one roof. Ċ As sole traders are diminishing due to the rise in multinational brands ultimately boost the production and maximize the utilization of resources with minimum wastage thus making a product more economical. For instance, China has reduced the input cost by increasing productivity. Therefore, shutting sole enterprise has certain benefits in a longer perspective. Furthermore, micro industries are mostly unorganised so its reduction will uprise the organised sector and help governments to increase tax revenue which could be further invested in economic and social causes. Ċ To conclude, small and big businesses have their own pros and cons. However, promoting the organised sector helps to raise the economic structure and individuals standard of living.

prompt: Many people think it is important to protect environment, but they make no effort on it themselves. Why it is the case and what can we do to change this situation?
essay: Protecting environment is a human obligation, yet it is important as well. Unfortunately, many people less care on it. There are some reasons underlying, why they are to do so. Nevertheless, some possible solutions could be taken into account to address this issue. Ċ In many countries, majority of people are lack awareness upon environmental matter, yet the earth's condition deteriorates over the year. They do not know even the consequences of their careless, towards the entire creature living in the earth. In fact, there are still furthermore, people who throw the garbage everywhere, since they think it is not a big problem as long as their litter will be taken out by cleaning service. Moreover, this bad attitude will influence other people to do similar deed, particularly the children who are sensible. Hence, for these reasons people make not effort to preserve the environment. Ċ Turning to the possible solutions, firstly, the government should campaign regarding environmental issue and foster their societies, especially children and youngster to preserve the environment. A further instance of this, is by giving them an education, such as recycling the items, economizing the electricity and so forth. In addition, the government had better to strict regulation of the waster produced by the companies. These sovereign steps, will lead people to be more sensitive to the environmental issue and encourage them to take care of it. Ċ In conclusion, protecting the environment is a human duty as inhabitant within it. Hence, people are supposed to spread the positive habitual in their daily pursuits to the others to be greener, so that rising people awareness to preserve the environment.

prompt: Some people say it is OK to use animals for our benefit, others say it is not good to exploit them. Discuss both points of view and give your opinion. how people treat animals
essay: Several persons believe that something is not wise to exploit animal, opposite that some human society trusts, we can take benefit from the animal. This writing will discuss both of statements. I totally agree if human take advantage from an animal because one of utilizing animal is created for help human being to survive. Ċ On the one hand, the animal could be utilized for aid sustainability of human life. Some animals are created to assist human such as horse, chicken, cow, and others. Taking an example in my village, local who has a horse, he will be easy to do his daily activity. Go to market, garden, and another place could be reached by a horse. So the animal has an essential position in human life. Ċ On the other hand, mostly people who keep animals even tortured him. They think keeping animal is help their life with giving drink, eat and nursing them. Actually, people keep animal has a good intention but they do with the wrong way. For example, they keep a bird and they were thinking, they help to find food and drinks. The impact the bird will be stressful spend the time merely in the cage. Ċ I agree if we could take benefit from an animal but we have to keep their freedom. In this case, we have to regard and think a good way to treat them. So, their life could be saved and they can get a happiness. Ċ To sum up, keep the animal is good if you can treat with the right way. This article tells us about 2 mindsets human about the the animal. I suggest for government to make a new rule to manage this issue.

prompt: Large companies use sports events to promote their products. Some people think this has a negative impact on sports. To what extent do you agree or disagree ?
essay: Recently, commercial advertisements have proliferated in a variety of television channels, newspapers or magazines as a result of fierce competition in the market. Thus, there is a growing trend in which major companies popularise their products by approaching sports events. Whether it slaves or liberates sports has been a subject of debate. In my viewpoint, I do not lean towards this trend and below is my discussion. Ċ On the one hand, it is widely believed that collaborating with huge companies enables sports events to meet a high quality of facilities and standards. To illustrate, companies are likely to donate money just for the appearances of their logos, brand names or products at those events. Consequently, sports producers can afford high costs of accommodation, devices or lighting. Additionally, watchers can also be beneficial by not having to pay for tickets thanks to sponsors. This means people can have equal opportunities to attend sports events. As a result, this can create a healthy partnership that gains profits for both sides. Ċ On the other hand, I side with those who advocate that advertising can cause unexpecting harm to sports leagues. First of all, there are some misbehaviours of watchers and fans when it comes to unhealthy products. For instance, football fans who are adolescents will be encouraged to consume alcohol or tobacco if they see these products are used by their favourite players. In fact, Tiger-a famous beer company usually appears on sports channels. Secondly, having too many advertisements may offend some audiences since they are easily distracted from watching and as a consequence, some of them tend to lose interest in sports. Literally, they regard sports nowadays as nothing but a tool for the money. Ċ In conclusion, the disadvantages outweigh the advantages. I do believe that everything needs a limitation so sports should not rely too much on advertisements.

prompt: children's educational investment. Task 2: Children's education is expensive. In some countries, the government pay some of or all of the costs. Do the advantages outweigh its disadvantages?
essay: In current years, governments allocate their state budgets for supporting partly or totally children's education due to its expensive fees in some corners of the globe. While I accept that this has negative effects on individuals and governments. This is more likely to have outstanding influences Ċ On the one hand, spending a great deal of money on children's education will affect either economy or society. Focusing on children's instruction impact directly on the expenditure on other important aspects. For instance, the healthcare system or infrastructure are not concerned by the government, which is held back from development owing to the lack of attractive investments. Families without children feel unfair when this taxpayers contribute a lot of money for national budgets, which links to social instability. Ċ On the other hand, the above demerits are outweighed by merits. Children's education brings well-educated citizens because children are nurtured in great conditions. Children are encouraged to engage in other fields such as musical instruments, art, dance, ...which help children comprehensive development both physically and mentally. The government creates favourble condition for poorer backgrounds being able to attend to schools equality. In addition to that, parents' s financial burdens are relieved that they can have more money to spend on food, medical care for them. As a result, illiteracy rate will be reduced, and it may significantly contribute to the development of the country due to better workforce. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that the advantages of children's educational investment are more considerable than the possible disadvantages.(250 words)

prompt: Nowadays we see an increase in social problems involving teenagers. Many peope believe that it is because parents spend more time at work and less with their childern. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Delinquencies among juveniles are increasing day by day. As both parents are working nowadays, they do not get enough time to look after their children and it is commonly believed as a main reason behind increasing social issues. I firmly agree wit this reason and my inclination are explained in trailed paragraphs. Ċ To start with, children need unconditional love, care and attention in their formative periods of life. As both parents spend long hours at work in this success-oriented world, children's psychological needs to love and to be loves are not fully satisfied, which may compel them to become an antisocial. Moreover, now most of parents connect with their children through electronic gadgets only, which gradually reduces the warmth from the relationships. For example, a survey conducted by a local newspaper, revealed that most of the crimes by teenager are committed in their own home and in the absence of both parents. Ċ Furthermore, if there is no parent at home for a child, he/she may feel isolated and become introvert. Sometimes, children may suffer from depression due to lack of socialization. In addition, such teenagers increase the usage of video games and the Internet. Playing violent games so frequently, can also encourage children to enter into crimes. Therefore, it is the responsibility of parents to keep an eye on their kids, whether they are on the right track or not. Ċ To conclude, as teenage is the turning point of any kid's life, all they need is the proper guidance from their parents. Understanding this phenomenon by every parent is the need of the day.

prompt: People should be responsible for the pollution problems caused by transportation, while others think the government should be held accountable. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Nowadays, pollution to the environment is increasing at alarming rate throughout the world and there is number of serious factors affecting to this cause. One of the main factors to contribute the air pollution is the transportation. Some people argue that individuals should have responsibility for pollutions caused by their cars, while others hold a different opinion saying the government should handle this issue. However, ignoring the individual's responsibility for air pollution is not correct, I think government should introduce regulations to reduce the pollution from vehicles. Ċ As some people say, the pollution from cars could be reduced by giving responsibility to the owner. In order to reduce the air pollution, people should not use the cars which omit much pollution to the air comparing to other environment friendly transportation types. If people feel their responsibility to keep the environment clean and safe, they would not prefer to use the cars. Unfortunately, most people do not care about the impacts from cars to the environment, therefore, some people consider that governments should take this into a considerable account. Ċ To reduce the air pollution from vehicles, governments should introduce some major steps to reduce cars which omit high pollution to the air. One of the steps to reduce air pollution from cars is to decrease the numbers of cars people use. In order to achieve to this goal, government should encourage people to use an environment friendly transportation types. Also, governments should require car owners to pay tax for their responsibility to the air pollution. In some countries, for example in my country, this regulation is started being used in practice. Ċ In conclusion, air pollution becomes a danger for everyone. Therefore, to reduce the air pollution related to human activity, such as pollution from transportation, governments should take some important steps such as collecting tax from cars and promoting people to use environment friendly transportation.

prompt: Some people argue that history is of little or no use to us. Others believe that studying history gives many benefits. Discuss those views and give your own opinion.
essay: There is a belief that it's useless to spend time on studying the history, whereas the counter argument states that it has got many benefits. I support the latter idea, as it is necessary for the growth and prosperity of the society. Ċ On the one hand, some people think that it's a waste of time and resources to learn what our forefathers did in the past and how the civilizations developed. Secondly, they are of the view that the old models have nothing to do with the current era. So, they believe that instead of reading the old tales, it's better to focus on the subjects of science and technology. Moreover, the concept of living has changed so much that the previous experience is of no use. For instance, the same concept is being practiced in the Thailand and they have banned the subject of historical science in the current syllabus. Ċ On the other hand, there are many individuals who are of the idea that nothing can be achieved without studying the lifestyle of previous generations, and I also back the same. The origin of mankind, the developmental stages of the world, the economic growth and the urbanization has to be looked into detail for a better future plans. Furthermore, the problems and their solutions can be found by peeping into the past and learning from the experiences of previous races. For example, the European nations have preserved their heritage as they know that old is gold. Ċ To conclude, the evolution of this globe has to be studied, as it has many hidden road maps which will not only solve many of issues, but will also help in the progress of the nation.

prompt: ALTERNATIVE energy RESOURCES Topic: Fossil fuel such as coal, oil and natural gas are used in many country. The use of alternative source of energy, including wind and solar power is encourage. Is this trend a positive or negative development.
essay: Nowadays human beings are facing the shortage of essential natural resources as coals, oil, which forces us to explore the new ones to provide promptly growing demand of society. Green energy is a wonderful solution addressing the serious problem in terms of there incredible features. Ċ To begin with, conventional fuels hold significant economic cost. A wide range of industries have to spend to much on exploiting raw materials. Moreover the budget of processing domain a large rate on manufacturing cost resulting in inflating selling price and decreasing competitiveness. At the same time, that the fuels are transported from mines to factories also costs much that corporations should attempt to reduce and control this logistics process. Thus, people waste time and money in paying for complex things. Ċ Equally importantly, the utility of non-renewable resources causes serious climate change. Take the case of Shanghai, China as an example. Its residents definately suffer from breathing toxics for numerous factories release contaminated airon generating product from traditional fuels. Unless people use face mask or other protective clothes, they could not go outside whether it is day or night. Ċ Last but not least, Using alternative energy allows society to take full advantage of natural power and maintain our environment balance and health. It is simple for us to acknowledge renewable energy ranging from solar system, heat-themal. Not only do they cost as less as conventional ones but it also impulse the related technology. Furthermore, once being taken into production, green fuels will contribute significant parts into reducing environmental problems. Ċ By way of conclusion, while people are facing the diminish of non-renewable, demand for energy keeps growing. Alternative resources is a effective solution that should be encouraged to use in the near future.

prompt: In some countries, there is not enough recycling of waste materials (e.g. paper, glass, and cans). What are the reasons and solutions?
essay: In some nations, people do not recycle their waste materials as much as they could. There are several reasons why people do not recycle and some approaches should be taken to change such a scenario. Ċ One of the reasons is that people are ignorant about the importance of recycling. They don't know about the process of recycling or the close relation between recycling and environment protection. Furthermore, people are too busy on their own lives to pay enough attention to it. They are used to dispose the rubbish directly for time saving or for convenience. In these situation, government plays an important role to take actions for fear of more harmful behaviors to our environment. Without doing so, it is difficult for people to aware the importance of recycling. Ċ To deal with above problems, several steps can be taken. Government can plan for some advertising campaigns on TV or Internet to teach some tips about recycling. These promotion will catch the public's attention and change their behavior gradually. Otherwise, the education about recycling must be carried out in the school, which can build children's sense of responsibility to protect our environment at their early age. With these efforts, government can not only raise more concern about recycling among people, but also boost the recycling industry because of the potential profits. Ċ In conclusion, the environmental issues are more and more importance. Government around the globe must implement some related policy in order to raise the awareness among people.

prompt: Some people feel that the cost of space exploration is far too high for the benefits it brings while others argue that we space programmers should continue no matter what the cost. Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
essay: There is no doubt that the space is still unexplored and unknown. While some argue that these explorations cost more than its advantages, I believe if we want to expand our knowledge beyond our planet. We should continue this effort. This essay will discuss both sides of the argument. Ċ On the one hand, many feel the budgets of interplanetary missions, such as finding water on Mars, are significant. This is because the technology used in these missions is very expensive. For instance, the rover builds to navigate the Mars' surface was around $10 million. Furthermore, we should also take into account the valuable information it is sending back. Although it might not be useful today, but this can be used as a basis of many researches in the future. If we had this mentality a century ago, we would not have landed on the Moon and Mars. Ċ On the other hand, the rate at which we are ruining our Earth. We will soon need another one. Keeping this in mind, the government should double their efforts toward finding new habitable planets. For example, every country should set up divisions for space exploration. This will create a sense of competition among nations, and will benefit people as a result. In addition, with increasing population. We are running out of land and fresh water. Therefore, spending on these programs is justified. Ċ To conclude, I think this is the right time to increase spending on space programs. With the amount of data that is collected for future use, and the danger of vanishing drinkable water justifies how essential they are.

prompt: In many places women are taking jobs which are traditionally done by men. What do you think make these change happen. What's your opinion about it.
essay: There is currently a contentious argument over about for what reasons females are filling positions which were usually occupied by males in the past. This essay will examine some root causes related to this trend and present my opinion about it. Ċ The main reason for this new behaviour is due to globalization. Nowadays, people are more connected than ever before, which includes the sharing of information in any place; therefore, it is extremely common to spotte women doing some activities that society was not used to see before. For instance, some positions call for a new workforce in the field as a bus driver, that was mainly occupied by men. However, it is normal to see that women accept taking this sort of job since they can not be harassed for being female anymore having no difference in comparison to men's rights. Ċ A second point that shows why the number of women doing these duties has increased is because of society's evolution. The work environment and customs have changed in the last decades regarding the women assessment. As a consequence, the way of thinking of people has changed and the world calls for a society less conservative. If the world has not changed, it would have serious consequences for human being's flourish. To illustrate, it is known that the number of women in the world surpassed the number of men, which means that the environment in different atmospheres tends to change according to each new chapter of history, otherwise, the world would suffer from consequences such as its extinction. Ċ In conclusion, there are a couple of reasons for females have been more acceptable in the labour market. The most important of them is the globalization which bridges for the world's evolution were constructed as well as the society's new evaluation since individuals are having a new point of view on this topic.

prompt: Topic: Education is recognized as vital to the future of any society in today's world. Government throughout the world should make education compulsory for all children between the ages of 5 and 15. To what extend do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: Many people claim that the education is considered as the main key to open a bright future of the world. Considering this, current governments are trying to seize such considerable opportunity by designing a mandatory curriculum for all children from 5 to 15.In my perspective, this method would benefit greatly to both the students' long-term success in career as well as their roles as a good citizen in society. Ċ First and foremost, there is no denying that such educational pattern has made it feasible for the children to form the basic knowledge as a firm background to have a good job. Apparently, at this age, students are likely to acquire the lessons more easily due to their sensitive brain cognition. Hence, the approach to higher education would be highly probable, leading to bright employment prospects. For example, well-educated students tend to be applied for leading company rather than those who are not allocated any. In short, the application of the compulsory curriculum has a positive impact on the students' future. Ċ Likewise, this mandatory schooling performs a very crucial role in imposing ethics in students' behaviors. Children are easily influenced by social factors and therefore the schools' responsibility for adjusting their attitudes must be addressed. In particular, teachers are the supervisors who assist the students in being a good citizen by organizing a subject called civic education. Otherwise, without any morality at this initial stage, these pupils are likely to have a false conception in behaving, resulting in the severe consequences such as school violence, drug abuse and more. Ċ To conclude, I have to reiterate the significance of compulsory education in opening up opportunities for students to have an ideal career as long as improving the moral standard in students' behaviors.

prompt: sedentary lifestyle in urban areas Topic: It is difficult for people in the cities to get enough exercise. What are the causes and solutions?
essay: There has been an ever-increasing trend that citizens from urban areas are less likely to take up enough exercise. This issue can be ascribed to a wide range of reasons and it must be addressed with feasible actions. Ċ There are two main explanations why people are leading a sedentary lifestyle in metropolitan cities. One of the main reasons why people do not spend sufficient time on exercising is due to the typical hustle and bustle of living in cities. Commonly, young adults are snowed under exhausting computer work and deadlines in hot pursuit, which prevent them from making a thorough plan for doing exercises. As a result, they feel obligated to sacrifice their time working out at the gym in order to gain better job prospects. Another reason paving the way to reduced exercising hours is the rapid advances in technology and the tremendous growth in amusing TV programs. Particularly, a technology-orientated lifestyle has become increasingly popular among adolescents, which acts as a deterrent from enjoying outdoor recreational pursuits. Ċ A wide range of definite actions must be implemented to combat an idle lifestyle stemming from insufficient exercising hours. One effective solution is to enhance public awareness of the benefits of taking up exercise. For example, citizens will be more mindful of doing exercise daily if they are encouraged through the mass media. Furthermore, the government should consider healthcare as the top priority and provide public subsidies on the construction of sports facilities.
