Newly-equipped essential sports gear will therefore increase the chance of people getting involved in physical activities by making it more accessible and affordable. Ċ In conclusion, fast pace and technological innovations mainly contribute to lack of exercising in cities, and thorough preparation is key to avoid this negative trend by a number of remedies such as heightened awareness and government sponsorship.

prompt: Film stars and celebrities often share their views on public matters that have little to do with their profession. Ċ Is this a positive or negative development?
essay: It is common for famous figures with large platforms to share their viewpoints on various topics. In my opinion, though there is potential for abuse, it is positive overall as they can contribute diverse perspectives. Ċ Critics of the publicity celebrities receive for their comments argue they are not always well informed. There are experts in every field, ranging from politics and science to sports and the arts and yet stars in the entertainment world possess outsized platforms. For instance, many actors, athletes, and singers have become part of the anti-vaccination movement. The views of health experts and epidemiologists are often subordinated to celebrity comments more likely to generate online traffic and ratings. However, this argument is undermined by research showing that professionals are notoriously poor at making predictions concerning their own areas of expertise. Ċ Moreover, celebrities in film and music engender diversity. The entertainment world, relative to other professional spheres, is made up of a wide variety of ethnicities and socioeconomic backgrounds. Most actors move to Hollywood from a different part of the world and then later become stars. In the music industry, listeners actively seek out new voices, styles, nationalities, and personalities. These individuals can then provide the average person with an insightful glimpse into another part of society. The most recent example of this would be the awareness raised related to environmental issues by various singers and actors when they accept awards. Ċ In conclusion, although there is a risk that celebrities will be uninformed on a topic, their opinions are still important as they are typically candid, authentic, and diverse. In this era of inclusivity, it is important to value all viewpoints.

prompt: More and more people are using internet nowadays for their personal thing such as shopping and paying bills. Does advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: These days people have been using online facilities for their convenience. While an increasing number of the public have been ordering products and paying invoices online, I agree with this statement, and I will discuss how e-shops are beneficial and unsafe to the community in this essay. Ċ The benefits of e-commerce are significant. Firstly, it is widely applied in shopping a varied range of items simply by sitting home; however, time for researching the products is required. In other words, customers can order any products by going through their reviews by staying back at home. Additionally, they can pay any invoices by website portals; consecutively, they save time and transportation expenses. For example, I usually spend my water bills and mobile recharge on legal outlets of their company. Hence, e-shops are more advantageous to humankind these days. Ċ On the other side, there are fewer drawbacks to be considered on e-commerce. The First and foremost reason is that customers have a higher chance of getting cheated by hackers through illegal websites of their business. That is to say; web criminals are more competent these days to misuse the internet facilities when innocents order through fraudulent networking websites. Besides, adolescence and adults are becoming inactive because of more convenient shopping with the help of e-stores. To illustrate this, for instance, one of my friends have never shopped traditionally for the past five years; eventually, she became more obese because of her sedentary lifestyle. Thus, people must be cautious about unsafe links and health issues that internet facilities cause. Ċ In conclusion, though e-shops have fewer drawbacks in money safety and health problems, it provides people with the benefits of convenience and less time consumption. Therefore, I believe that the advantages outweigh the disadvantages.

prompt: essay about the tourism industry TOPIC: International tourism has become a huge industry in the world. Are the problems that international travellers cause greater than the advantages they bring?
essay: It is true that the international tourism industry has become more popular than before. Although there are those who may argue that this is a negative trend, I hold the belief that the advantages behind this trend far outweigh its drawbacks. Ċ From my perspective, environment protection is the first and foremost issue nowadays. However, we all know that the fast development in the tourism industry would bring some problem to our society and there is a dilemma between development and environment. In the past, people could go to a beach and appreciate the beauty of sunset happily but now we seldom have a chance to do that because of the pollution. Many tourist attractions have been destroyed and lose their colourful scenery due to the prosperity in the tourism industry. Ċ In spite of the above arguments, I still see this is a positive trend. The foremost reason for my point is that the development of international tourism improves our economic growth and even creates more job opportunities than before. Some traditional stores near a tourist attraction mainly depend on travellers to survive, and also many people work as a tour guide or offer a service to visitors. Moreover, governments could not only make more money from the tourism industry but also promote countries around the world. As a result, the development of international tourism is a positive evolution. Ċ In conclusion, there are some pros and cons to this development, and I believe that this is a benefit in our lives.

prompt: Young people spend less of their free time with their family nowadays. What at the reasons for this? Are there more negative or postive sides to it?
essay: Family values have been sacrificed under the impression of western countries and the race of wanting more forces each individual to pull their best in their field; consequentially, they have lesser time to spend with their loved ones. There are other reasons too that contribute to this happening are explained in the following paragraphs along with the positive and negative impressions of the aforementioned statement. Ċ The first and foremost reason for this is that a highly competitive environment pushes citizens to work from head to toe to achieve excellence and desired position in their field; the tremendous outside pressure enforces youngsters to think out of the box. In other words, adolescents have less time, nowadays, to share their feelings and prospects with their caretakers. Apart from that, the exposure of international cultures and establishment of global firms in their home country lure teens to enjoy freedom, thereby, instead of spending their leisure hours with their family, they opt to go out with their friends to watch movies and other fun activities. Ċ This phenomenon has more negative impacts than positive outcomes. Firstly, teenagers could not understand and respect their family's culture as well values; they might be refused to follow their forefathers' traditions. Eventually, the customs could be lost if they are followed. Secondly, the parents or grandparents feel lonely as their offspring have no time to communicate with them and parents try to arrange something special so that they can spend some seconds with their children. For instance, in most of the western cultures, especially grandparents have arranged parties for birthdays and anniversaries that they can get a chance to talk to their family teens. The only positive outcome of this is that youngsters could be more independent as they choose to make their decision by themselves. Ċ To conclude then, the outside tremendous pressure and experience of western societies keep teens busy and they have less time for their family, but juveniles could lose the importance of their culture and parents could feel lonely if adolescents run at the same pace.

prompt: Some of the methods used in advertising are unethical and unacceptable in today's society. To what extend you agree or disagree. plethora of advertisement nowadays
essay: It is often said that plethora of advertisement nowadays make use of inappropriate and improper contents. Although commercials play an important role on product marketing, I completely agree with this argument and I believe that such immoral and unethical propagation approaches shall be regulated by laws. Ċ To begin with, it is undeniable that random calls and junk mails are disturbing to our daily lives. People receive cold calls from many companies, especially cosmetics and insurance industries. Overwhelming advertisements are about irrelevant products' promotions. Such widespread phenomenon is extremely annoying and adversely influencing people's livelihoods. For example, Hong Kong citizens receive more than 10 random calls about promoting goods every day, while corresponding regulation has been imposed to govern the abuse of cold calls. Ċ Equally importantly, false contents are usually displayed to exaggerate the product's effectiveness. Cosmetic companies, for instance, often overemphasize the product's effects on beauties. As a result, customers would be misled to purchase such items without desired changes. Ċ Last but not least, numerous companies deliver the deceptive images of their products. Cigarette is a case in point. The tobacco companies usually invite some famous movie stars to smoke in front of the camera. As a result, teenagers would imitate, and be addicted to smoking consequently. Ċ In conclusion, there are considerable numbers of advertisements adopting immoral and unethical approaches to attract people's eye. Random calls create unnecessary nuisance to the public, while the images and effectiveness of tobacco and cosmetic goods are reshaped in order to enhance their popularity. Thus, stringent legislation shall be imposed to govern the practices of advertisement.

prompt: Some people say language courses using the internet and allowing you to talk to somebody is a good way to learn. Others, however, believe that study in classrooms is still the best way of learning. Give your opinion on these views and include your own experiences and examples.
essay: Nowadays many people try to learn new languages for the purposes of higher studies as well as for immigration to foreign countries. Some people feel that learning a language using internet and talking to someone online is a good way to learn whereas others believe that conventional methods of studying in classrooms is the best way .Both the opinions will be critiqued before a reasoned conclusion is reached. Ċ It is felt by many that learning a language using internet offers a wide range of data pertaining to vocabulary and accuracy of the language. Further, an individual may learn a new language without an extra effort of going to classes. For instance, many Asian students who aspire to pursue their higher education in English speaking countries such as Canada, Australia and England choose distant online courses for learning English. This saves their time as they can learn new words and their meanings just on the click of a button. Thus, it is clear why this argument has garnered a lot of support. Ċ However, learning a language in classroom offers different benefits. Students can do group discussions and further discuss their own problems with the teachers. Moreover, teachers can cater to the needs of individual student. It is reported by many students that even if they choose online courses for learning, eventually they join classes for better understanding of the language and its practice. Thus, it is seen clearly why classrooms are still the best way of learning. Ċ Therefore, to conclude it can be said that although learning online offers comfort and access to wide range of data but learning in a classroom has advantages such as group discussions and motivation by teachers. So, it is opined that classroom learning has greater benefits than learning online.

prompt: People should choose their course of study not on the basis of their own interests, but based on the kinds of jobs they can get. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement? Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. Ċ You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
essay: Although many people argue that choosing study courses should be in line with the desired future careers, others are convinced by selecting the curriculum on the basis of their interests, which I support. In this essay, I will explain the main reasons for my perspective. Ċ On the one hand, some people prefer to choose study courses, which are matched with high-wage jobs. This is because those who support this idea tend to increase their future income. Medical college, for example, in Egypt, is the first choice for the majority of pupils owing to its high profit. However, there are some difficulties to achieve this dream. Firstly, those colleges, due to its high demand, they require a high score in secondary schools. Secondly, if most students tend to pursue in those colleges, the workforce market will suffer from the lack of other disciplines. Ċ On the other hand, I hold the notion that students should select their colleges based on their skills and capabilities. The main reason is that some colleges may require a unique talent, which may not suit everyone. Faculty of fine arts, for instance, demands special skills such as painting or drawing. Another valid reason is that if anyone masters a profession, he or she can find a job. To illustrate, abstract artists are in high demand in the labour market due to their talent, and many companies are paying high salaries to them. Ċ In conclusion, despite the interest of some students to choose courses to earn a high income, there are some problems may face them in terms of skills, aggressive entry requirements, and it is quite possible to find better jobs if you the practical experience.

prompt: Topic: Some say that today's life is better than it will be in the future, others disagree and say that the future life will be better than now. Discuss and include your own opinion.
essay: Some people doubt about whether future life would be improved or not. Some people imagine the future life as like a scenery of movie named "Travel to Future" in which it shows a flying car in the sky. However, other sees the life in the future as a pessimistic view in which people tries escape from natural disaster and moves to Himalayas mountain. In this essay, i will examine a both sides of view and present my personal view on this matter. Ċ On the one hand, there are number of people holding a view that the world would be catastrophic. Due to the fact of a increasing change of climate and high frequency of natural disaster like hurricane, tornado, flood and earthquake, discomfort of living will increase in the next coming centuries. Moreover, as the world population rises, a increasing need of food supply rises among the nations, particularly among developing and third nations. Therefore, rate of famine and hunger increases and level of food safety deteriorates. Ċ On the other hand, much optimism about the future with technological development is hold among people. They anticipate the future life with clean energy, clean electricity and clean environment. The world would be totally green then ever before due to the initiatives of green technologies. Pleasure of life will increase with introduction of new technology into our daily life like travel to outer space and so on. Ċ In the conclusion, i am totally convinced with the view that in coming years, your generation will live in much dangerous condition. Due to a increasing level of various kind of pollution, health concern will arise among them and cost of health will stagger dramatically.

prompt: Should a city try to preserve its old, historic buildings or destroy them and replace them with modern buildings? Use specific reasons and examples tosupport your opinion.
essay: A change should be done effectively if we want to progress more in the future. There is a burgeoning question in regards to changing old, historical infrastructure with modern building. There are two facets in this issue. In my opinion, the degree of modernizing a city lies on the effectiveness of a project in projecting its significance in the future. Ċ Old infrastructure should be destruct if we find any significance for this change. If the building begins to obstruct a street and causes a lot of traffic then it is prudent that we should torn down this building regardless of its significance. Moreover, most of old infrastructures have a poor fire safety and the immediate treat from the neighborhood is in question. This in turn also may give a significant reason for a building to be destroyed. Ċ However, We should not destroy them entirely just because we feel that we need to change these to a new building. Most of the historical buildings have significant values in the city development. Losing it will deprive education and appreciation of our younger generation. However, destroying an infrastructure is not a sole option for modernizing a city. Most of the technology today can aim on relocating this building to other site, which can also preserve its values. Ċ In my opinion, as we aim to develop a futuristic city we should still take account on the marvelous artifacts that we have in the past. Technological breakthroughs have made these possible for us.

prompt: Topic: In some countries older people are being encouraged to work longer and not to retire. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of working beyond retirement age.
essay: Across the globe there is a growing trend of increasing the retirement age or working after retirement. People are cheered to work longer. Every coin has two sides ; Similarly, working longer has its own Pros and Cons. In this essay, I will be presenting my views on advantages and disadvantages on prolonged working. Ċ There are positives of working longer not only to individual but to the society and country as well. Socially, with age comes experience and people are motivated to work longer so that their experience can be best utilized and may help in development of the country and its economy. On the personal front, people who work at an older age remains active and does not feel aloof at home. From economic point of view, people are less dependent on others and as they are working , they pay tax and contribute to country's economy instead of becoming a drain to the economic system. Ċ However, there are many negatives of working longer. First of all, increasing retirement age may lead to more job requirements for youth and finally result in more unemployment for young generation which is a serious problem in almost every developing and under developed countries. Secondly, at a higher age people may face health issues and their degraded health may create serious problems for them .Last but not the least, at an higher age humans cant be as productive as youngsters and would contribute to a less efficient and less productive system which is not desirable in this competitive era. Ċ In conclusion, Working longer has its own advantages like self-dependency , contribution in country's economy contrarily that may cause problems like unemployment for youths; less productive and inefficient system. I believe, citizens should consider both sides of the coin and then decide how long to work.

prompt: Some people think that boarding schools are an exellent option for children, while other people disagree for a number of reasons. Consider both sides of this debate and reach a conclusion boarding school? not for all
essay: In recent years, many young people study in boarding school where they live and stay at the school environtment during the term. It is often said that parents benefit from sending their children to other place to study. However, the issue is not entirely straightforward, and arguments can also be made againt the idea. This essay will discuss the debate, and give a conclusing view. Ċ On the one hand, those who support their children to study in boarding school cite the various advantages that the activity can bring to a child. First, pupil can learn about how to live independently. Obviously, it will useful for them in their future to solve many problem by theirself. In addition, children who live in one place with their friends can discuss about the learning that they just got in school. Therefore, some parents think that boarding school is an exellent option for children to study Ċ By contrast, opponents of this view point out that not all children want to stay far away from their parents. A large number of parents believe that they have responsibility to teach children by themself until become adult. They think that it can be harmful for kids to stay in another place without their supervision. As an instance, children could be more lazy to study without motivation from parents. Thus, the drawbacks should be consedered as well. Ċ In conclusion, it seems advisable that the decision to send children to boarding school should be based on child's capability and interest, an also the quality of the boarding school itself to guarantee proper life and supporting environtment to study.

prompt: Some people believe that schools should reward those students who show excellent academic performance while some believe that only the ones who show significant improvement in the grades should be rewarded. Ċ Discuss both the views and give your opinion. Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: For many decades education institutions have been encouraging students by rewarding them. Although some may argue that schools should only be rewarding school children who are excelling academically, I believe they should be doing the same for pupil who are improving. This essay will discuss both views of the statement. Ċ Students who are doing well academically need rewarding as it takes a lot of hard work and sacrifices to achieve high grades. For instance, a student replaces hanging out with friends and other leisure activities to study. This group of children is self-derived and therefore, need to be rewarded for putting in extra time and replacing relaxing to work harder. Ċ On the other hand, not all students do well academically. This is either because of other interests such as sports or learn differently. Most schools teach traditionally, while new generation schools are now taking a new approach. Take the UK for example, some schools are educating weaker students with a different approach which has led to improvement in grades and consequently, giving out certificates for students who put in the effort. Though this notion is motivating students to carry on working hard as their effort is working while not everyone is invested to change the traditional way of learning. Ċ To conclude, undoubtedly high scoring students do not need any motivation as they are self motivated, while underachievers do need motivation in the form of rewards to stay on the right path to success. I do believe, schools should investigate their way of teaching and use more visual tools for helping students.

prompt: Many people are doing their shopping on the internet nowadays. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages if shopping online and give your opinion.
essay: With technological advancements, online shopping has opened doors globally, where infinite articles can be purchased by customers in a finite ways with just a click of a button. In this essay, I will discuss both merits and demerits which will be discussed in the latter part. Ċ Firstly, with cut throat competition amongst competitors, the prices are slashed in order to keep their potential customers intact. As a result, the consumers are benefited in monetary terms. Lastly, one hectic task in traditional shopping is that, layman commutes to different places where they can purchase according to their tastes and preferences. But, by sitting at home E-commerce segregates valuable commodity from a wide range of varieties with relevance to pattern, size, fabric and brands which save time and avoids stress. For example, an article being published by Hindustan times that 80% of beloved customers of Amazon are satisfied with bumper offers and filtered options available in selecting goods or services. Hence, reliable sources of shopping will have a record sale through online shopping. Ċ On the contrary, the delivery system of goods is absolutely tedious. The goods will not be delivered within a given time period and sometimes inappropriate articles will be dropped at the door steps. In addition, buyers often use credit or debit cards for transaction payment. If, the hacker hacks customer account, personal details and passwords can be misused for stealing money. For instance, snap deal delivers wrong items 5% of the time, particularly cash payments and Flipkart sells stolen data to banks for a ransom figure. Hence, cash on delivery and net bank payments should be avoided at all costs. Ċ To conclude, as online shopping has numerous examples which serves the sole purpose of purchases because customer is always king. However, the disadvantages can be overlooked with security updates in the mere future.

prompt: The prevention of health problems and illness is more important than treatment and medicine. Government funding should reflect this. Ċ To what extent do you agree?
essay: It is acknowledged that prevention is better than cure, which means that preventing health issues and diseases is far superior to curing them. In my opinion, I firmly agree with the notion that the government should allocate healthcare funds that will help people prevent themselves from health complications. Ċ To begin with, there are two major points for people to defend the view that prevention is better than cure. First of all, it is a well-documented fact that it proves more sustainable. Scientifically, human health can be reinforced and maintained effectively in the long term via varied approaches like dieting, exercising, and even spiritual therapy. If people remain vigilant to avoid severe ailments, they stand a lower chance of contracting them. Furthermore, this strategy appears more time- and cost-effective. For instance, once a patient is diagnosed with cancer, he or she will either pour their fortunes into immediate treatment. All this money can be well-saved, and time can be lengthened because of proper preventative schemes. Ċ Further, an individual should treat themselves according to diseases and illnesses in order to stay in good health. Subsequently, the government should also spend more funds on medical research that would protect humankind from diseases. With the help of research, scientists will be able to find the cause and cure of many diseases that would apparently cost a fortune for the treatment. For example, scientists could not find a feasible treatment or cure for the fatal coronavirus disease, despite strong technological advancements. Due to the outbreak of the Covid-19 virus, countries across the world witnessed a high death toll with many fatalities and mortalities. Ċ In conclusion, I certainly believe that the government should invest funds appropriately in the healthcare system as a priority and motivate people about preventable measures to stay healthy and save on bills.

prompt: Some people think that the best way to improve road transport safety is to let the driver test each year. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In this day age, the number of road accidents has increased exponentially the world over only because of reckless driving. Consequently, there has been a growing body of opinion that road transport safety can only be improved by conducting a driving test every year. Being a rational mind, I, too assent to this notion, for I am of the view that this will help drivers to update themselves about the latest rules and regulations, and to check their physical capability for driving. Ċ Among the ratiocination to buttress my stance, the one that deals with the significance of driver testing as a way to test the drivers know about the updated roads’ rules. In other words, governments of every nation try to impose new regulations constantly by charging the old ones in order to increase road safety. So, if drivers could not know the latest laws, it would be impossible for them to obey those statutes. Therefore, drover testing ought to be conducted each year so as to ensure safety. To cite an example, an empirical study conducted by Oxford University reveals that 95% of drivers can drive properly on roads if they give a yearly exam on driving rules and regulations. Ċ Another critical rationale in reference to why drivers should give a test every year is necessarily synonymous with checking their physical fitness. To be more precise, an individual’s health can deteriorate any time down to having some disorders, such as cardiovascular disease, poor eyesight, to name but a few. Thus, if a person could know his physical weakness by giving a driving test, it would surely reduce the chances of accidents. To exemplify, researchers around the world have found that 30% of road accidents occur because of drivers' heart failure during the driving time. Hence, it is inevitable to check physical well-being at least once a year by giving a driving test. Ċ In conclusion, each year, drivers should test their capability with a view to updating themselves about new things and checking their fitness.

prompt: With a fast pace of modern life more and more people are turning towards fast food for their main meals. Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: Whether going for unhealthy cuisine or home-made foodstuff is a controversial issue in the contemporary world. People are divided in their opinion regarding fast feed as a healthy meal. However, I believe that fast cuisine may have numerous drawbacks that can be detrimental not only for the present generation for also for the coming generation. I wholeheartedly believe that this trend should be changed and will discuss the demerits in the following paragraphs with supporting examples. Ċ To embark on, it is obvious that the daily consumption of fast food can lead to various health issues such as obesity, diabetes, and blood pressure.In addition to this, modern society may have an issue in retaining the stamina for a long moment which will have an impact on their personal as well as professional life. To elucidate, a recent study demonstrates that nearly 91.46% of individuals are relying on junk snack as they consider making cuisines at home as a waste of time. Moreover, masses may lack various factors that play a vital role in the growth of their body most notable nutrients from healthy foodstuff. Ċ Similarly, there is no doubt that consuming fast food have advantages as well such as it is time-saving. In other words, people can save their time by intaking junk food as it does not demand preparation. It is widely accepted that individuals spend lots of money on quickly based foods as they are expensive as compared to non-readymade foods. To illustrate, professionals buy foodstuff either online or from the restaurant due to pace inefficiency. Furthermore, this can have an adverse effect on their body and mind that can have an impact on their life. In other words, Nutritains claim that masses who adapt unhealthy meal in their life may be a patient of Cancer. Ċ To conclude, taking everything into account, I believe, intake of the unhealthy meal should be reduced and people can replace fast snack by preparing a healthy meal for a week and can consume it throughout conservative days by freezing the preparation in order to say time.

prompt: Some people think that young people can learn useful skills by playing electronic and computer games. Others argue that people who play electronic and computer games are wasting their time. Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: Nowadays, there are enormous fun activities in which a child can participate. Some people claim that young individuals should get involved in playing electronic and computer games. While others assert that these interests only waste the time. In this essay, I will discuss both the views. Ċ On the one hand, supporters for engaging children in electronic devices and playing on a monitor believe that these interests help a young individual to think in a rational way. Furthermore, playing a game on the PC requires lots of different visual perspectives and only with a correct decision, to enable a player to win the game. For instance, in many puzzle play, or brain stimulation words games could be a better option to help the child to increase their vocabulary and keep their brain active. Thus, such gaming can cultivate a wider perspective in a child which is certainly a vital skill. Ċ On the other hand, society opposes that children should not play games on the PC and electronic devices, they explain in their favour that young people should more concentrate on their academics than on gaming. Indeed, there are a plethora of other activities like sports,exercise and yoga classes, in which a minor can take part to spend his leisure time. Moreover, PC games are addictive in nature which can have a detrimental impact on his/her life. Hence, due to these reasons, people emphasize more on other activities rather than the aforementioned. Ċ To conclude, although involving in computer activities can promote the cognitive abilities in the young one, the side-effects of these recreations cannot be ignored. I believe young individuals should not only play games on the computer because of their negative consequences on their mind and behaviour but also there are more ways that children can learn similar skills in other activities.

prompt: Private companies that support and carry out scientific research are spending more than governments in these days. Do the advantage of this development outweigh Its disadvantage..? Explain and give your reasons.
essay: Private companies provide significant contribution in scientific research. Government are insufficient to provide resource to all scientific research because it has to allocate budgets for the entire field. IN this essay, I will explore both advantages and disadvantages about private company contribution in scientific research. Ċ Private companies contributes larger amount to discover medicines for new diseases. For example, medicines for AIDS, polio, chicken box vaccinations, etc., are very useful to mankind. Moreover, scientific research in test tube baby by private organization is a great revolution in medical field. It helps parents who are infertile enables to get baby from their genes. Ċ On the other hand of the coin, separate companies can sell copyrights and procedures of the medical scientific research like cloning, genetics, etc., to terrorist groups which would be a great disaster. Furthermore, private companies may involve in anti-human scientific research for great profit. For example, anthrax, highly infectious disease which Americans are feared to attack by bio-terrorist in last decades. In addition, private companies research and develop in different new types of nuclear weapons, chemical bombs which can be sold to terrorist. Ċ For instance, a report claimed that Pakistan terrorist used chemical bombs in karkil war on Indian military which is illegally mad by the private research company sold to the terrorist. Ċ By analysing both advantages and disadvantage about wealth contribution by private research organization was, helpful for both human and anti-human researches. Government should take necessary action to prevent anti-human scientific research by the private companies. So that future scientific research would be substantial assistance to human race.

prompt: In the modern world it is possible to shop, work and communicate with people via Internet and live without any face-to-face contact with others. Is it a positive or negative development in your opinion
essay: There is no doubt to say that people, in recent years, have witnessed the prevalence of Internet-based communication, shopping, and transaction activities. In my opinion, This development has shown both positive and negative aspects equally. Ċ On the one hand, unrestricted access to the Internet has brought great benefits to the public for its convenience and comfort. Firstly, telecommunication tools including email, instant messaging or social networks facilitate people's interaction, bringing them closer together. For example, if an international student wants to contact his family, it will be convenient to deliver a message only at a click regardless of geographical barriers. Secondly, this improvement of technology allows shoppers can seek out items or services of the finest quality without engaging lengthy commutes. As a result, this might prevent them from bad conditions, such as traffic congestion, torrential rain while they are moving. Ċ On the other hand, certain detriments can be associated with excessive Internet use. This is because the over-reliance on virtual communication is the primary cause of the decline in social skills which are crucial for real-life contact. To clarify this point, there is a heavy number of social network users tend to feel awkward while trying to strike up conversations with strangers. Thus, these people would gradually become more socially alienated and suffer from a great sense of solitude. Furthermore, This trend can be detrimental to persons' physical and mental health. If humans were overindulgent in the online world, it undoubtedly triggers a sedentary lifestyle, which consequently leads to some health-related problems such as obesity or sleep deprivation. Ċ In conclusion, although the online network contributes several benefits, I think negative impacts on lifestyle and health should be taken into account for uncontrolled online use for shopping, working and communication purposes.

prompt: hectic pace and pressure of contemporary lifestyles Some people believe that the fast pace and stress of modern life is having a negative effect on families. To what extent do you agree or disagree ?
essay: A highly controversial issue today relates to whether family life is being detrimentally affected by the hectic pace and pressure of contemporary lifestyles. From my point of view, I totally agree with this opinion due to the two main reasons. Ċ First of all, I would contend that families have less time to gather around because of the high-speed modern days. This may result from members being preoccupied with work and their social lives. These days, people are often so busy updating their social status or chatting with friends that they forget to spend time with their beloved, Ċ not to mention the fact that they only have about six hours in the evening to meet their family members. Ċ Another reason why I support the notion is that people are more likely to argue with each other under great pressure. It is concerned that when getting tired, humans stand bigger chance of being easily annoyed and therefore, quarrel. In the actual world, some married couples eventually choose to get divorced and leave an irreplaceable position in their offspring 's growth. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that the fast-moving and stressful nature of the current competitive world are ruining family relationships. This is owing to family members having less time together and hence, feeling less relaxed. The best prospect might be that the family members try to be more supportive of each other and meet more frequently.

prompt: Some people are of the opinion that children should be rewarded for good behavior. Others think they should be punished for bad behavior. Discuss both views and give your personal opinion and reasons.
essay: It is often considered by many people that young kids ought to be rewarded for their good deeds, whereas other argues that punishment should be given for the misdeeds of a juvenile. Although,Remove the commaapplyIt appears that you have an unnecessary comma after the subordinating conjunction Although. Consider removing the comma. Ċ show examples discipline may act as a deterrent towards bad nature, I believe that the most effective way to achieve a good attitude could be to reward teenagers. This essay would discuss the above arguments in detail. Ċ Firstly, rewarding a good act immediately signals a positive sign in the kid’s brain which encourage the adolescent to want to behave again in the future. Failure to recognize such behaviour leaves the youngster with the feeling that they had not done anything. Thus, rewarding the toddler consistently for the good deeds motivates the child to repeat those things over and again. Ċ Secondly punishing your child is also necessary, failure to discipline could result have serious consequences in the future. For instance, if a toddler has no clear concept of respect for elders or authority it is quite possible to encounter more serious issues later in life. It is essential to immediately discipline the infant whenever witnessing an unruly act so as to enforce the correct behaviour from an early age. In my view, any positive actions should be recognized by the parents and vice versa for negative conduct. This balanced approach makes for a more positive outcome for both the infant and family. Ċ To conclude, recognizing both bad and good actions immediately and dealt with them immediately to correct or encourage future actions.

prompt: The internet has made traditional libraries unnecessary. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Discuss giving examples from your own knowledge andexperience.
essay: Some people adhere to the view that with the extensive use of the Internet, libraries are no longer necessary. They believe that the Internet offers every information anyone can search. Ċ Furthermore, through the numerous websites available in it, students and researchers can presently obtain tremendous resources for the completion of their paperwork. Additionally, its accessibility can be reflected by the infinite availability of various websites. Tremendous sites for newspapers, magazines, journals and encyclopedias are equally accessible. Moreover, a researcher can have the opportunity to enjoy a complete multimedia experience through the presence of texts, videos, interactive features, audio, hyperlinks and graphics in one place. Ċ On the contrary, libraries can bind a unique part in the hearts of some people. It is because, libraries frequently bring nostalgia and a particular feeling, while touching the bounds of the books and smelling their pages. Aside from that reason, the organization of the tremendous resources in a library makes it easier for someone to explore into a specific reference. That is made possible through the universal cataloguing system. Apart from that, libraries offer free Internet connection and other electronic resources, like CD-ROM. Consequently, impoverished students can access the Internet, without spending even a single penny. Ultimately, knowledgable reference librarians are employed to assist researchers. These professionals have the ability to locate a vast number of literary works from a broad range of categories. This, being mentioned, represent the utmost factor, which is missing on the Internet. Ċ In my experience, during my college years, I always prefer conducting my research studies in our university library. I found it immensely practical since I could perform my study both with books and a computer with unlimited Internet access. Throughout my four years of studying, its convenience was a vital aid for my time management and monetary allowance. Ċ In conclusion, embracing modernization does not imply that traditional sources should be disregarded. Therefore, I believe libraries can be of the same importance as that of the Internet.

prompt: Nowadays, most information is available online, whereas in the past knowledge was used to be stored in books and on paper. Do you think the advantages of this situation outweigh its disadvantages?
essay: Nowadays, it is commonly believed that philosophy plays an important role in social development and no one can deny it. However, in recent years we have witnessed that science is more accessible online rather than in paper form. I personally believe that this issue has much more positive effects than drawbacks. Ċ First of all, one of the merits of this matter is the number of articles which could be attained. In fact, if the datum is online much more materials are available. Therefore, the more material provided, the more comprehensive researches are achieved. As an instance, when I wanted to start my academic research, a various array of statistics was acquired using the internet. Ċ In addition, data transferring velocity could be considered as the second benefit of a knowledge network. In other words, not only is the datum accessible widely but also the process is so fast. Consequently, by applying the search engines, by far faster the data could be approachable. To illustrate more, as soon as a subject is entered in the Google toolbar plenty of reports is prepared only in a few seconds. Ċ Furthermore, the last upside of the web-based extension of know-how which could be highlighted is its easier accessibility. To be more precise, only by having a smartphone with an internet connection there would be an ocean of diverse features available, anywhere, anytime. As an example, when someone is waiting at the bus station he can search and read a special topic on his cell phone, even if he is not in a university library. Ċ In conclusion, by considering the aforementioned reasons, available goods amount, data transmission pace, and easier approachability, I hold the view that virtual science availability has numerous positive impacts on scientific advancement.

prompt: Our planet covered by rubbish. It is generally agreed that the amount of rubbish created by humans today is a worldwide problem. What do you think are the main causes of this situation? What measures used to tackle?
essay: Rubbish is created by humans all over the world, which is gradually increasing, especially over the last decades. Although a myriad of reasons and methods is provided by activists and scientists, the problem has become a global issue, which should be solved as soon as possible. Ċ There is an abundance of reasons for this issue is a global problem. Firstly, a huge amount of trash is one of the major reasons causes environmental problems such as air pollution and climate change nowadays. For example, since burning plastic and chemical rubbish creates a huge amount of carbon dioxide, which is emitted directly into the air which contributes to global problems including air pollution. Moreover, if rubbish is dumped into the river systems, it will destroy the marine animal system there. For instance, by throwing trash, such as plastic bag and non-recyclable trash, away to the river system, which causes death to many fish and other aquatic animals. Ċ Today, some measures are now used to combat this problem. The most effective way to fight climate change is reducing the dependence on plastic bags and other rubbish in general. This could be using paper bags and another kind of recyclable material instead of plastic, which reduces rubbish is created by humans. Furthermore, since alleviate environmental problems is caused by rubbish, we can collect trashes and use alternative energy sources. Ċ Trash and issues surrounding it is a global problem, which impacts on every person all over the world. I believe that to decrease the greenhouse effects people should be aware of tackle environmental problems.

prompt: In some countries, schoolchildren wear a uniform. In others, they can wear whatever they want at school. What are the advantages and disadvantages of having school uniforms?
essay: In some parts of the world, wearing a uniform is mandatory for students, however, pupils living in other Ċ nations are free to put on any clothes at school. While putting on this might reduce discrimination in our society and recognize easily which school children are studying, it also has negative effects which need to be taken into account. Ċ Firstly, one advantage of having school uniforms is that there will be no discrimination between the rich and the poor. Indeed, school uniforms tend to be cheaper than any casual or trendy clothes which wealthy students want to wear to show off with their peers. Take those living in poor housing conditions, for instance, they can afford them easily without worrying about their prices. Secondly, another benefit is that it is easy to identify schools' names in the public instead of investing money in media advertising, this practice helps to advertise schools' reputation to everyone, and also gives schoolchildren a great sense of pride about their schools. Ċ On the other hand, it is worth mentioning the disadvantages of wearing this. From the perspective of fashion lovers, it is inconvenient and annoying for them as putting on uniforms seem to be unattractive and not elegant. Besides, wearing uniforms make them less confident whenever they go to school. In addition, another issue is that it affects schools' profiles when badly-behaved students who are wearing uniforms bully, hurt other weaker people in the public areas. This causes detrimental impacts on the success of these schools because parents are reluctant to send their children to schools having these bullying and poorly educated pupils. Ċ In conclusion, although wearing uniforms brings benefits, but this might sadden school children who loves fashion, and have negative consequences for the reputation of schools in some cases.

prompt: As computers translate quickly and easily , learning a foreign language is unnecessary. Discuss both the views and give your opinion ?
essay: It is argued that since the advancement in technology makes translating simple, it is of no use for one to learn a language of another land. I disagree with this because at certain times these devices can be unreliable to depend on. Ċ One plus point of using a computer as a means of learning a foreign tongue is that one can do it without much effort. Instead of memorising and mastering words of the alphabet for the language which a person is learning, computers can store that information effectively and accurately. Take, for example, a language application called John's language that has more than 2000 words of the German language. This application enables its owner to translate any German word into his mother tongue without the need to memorise. Hence, computers do make life easy when it comes to learning. Yet, despite that being the case, I believe it is still not a reliable item. Ċ The disadvantage with using a computer for something as vital as language is that it can not be relied on. To put this in perspective, all the programmes that a computer uses to translate a language is fed into it by humans who are prone to errors. For instance, in a survey conducted on the effectiveness of computers as a language guide, it was determined that due to the fact that it is man-made, it usually broke down and made countless mistakes. Therefore, in order to avoid any problems, it is just necessary for one to learn a foreign language instead. Ċ By way of conclusion, I reaffirm my statement that even though computers may offer the easiest way when it comes to translating, they tend to make too many errors thus proving unreliable. Henceforth, it is always a great idea for a person to learn a new tongue.

prompt: The increase in the production of consumer goods results in damage to the natural environment. What are the causes of this? What can be done to solve this problem? eco-friendly world?
essay: The increase of consumer goods has brought about a myriad of negative impacts on the natural environment. This essay will present the underlying cause and workable solutions to the problem. Ċ Obviously, there is no denying that overpopulation is the root of the problem. With over 7 billion people around the world, the demands for basic necessities like food, clothes and shelters have been on the inexorable rise. As a result, rainforests have been cleared, especially in developing countries, for industrial, residential and productive land. Factories, which emit harmful gases to the air and toxic wastes to water source, have been opened in every parts of the world to produce various kinds of food, drinks, clothes, etc. This has put unprecedented strains on our finely balanced ecosystem. Ċ In order to solve the problem, both government and individuals should take actions immediately. Firstly, government should put forward a stricter regulation to control the overpopulation issue. Secondly, individuals should adopt a more eco-friendly consumption habits. For example, people should buy biodegradable packaged products, support organic food or avoid overusing plastic bags. Another feasible action is that all industrial and domestic wastes like paper or glass should be sorted out and recycled. By taking all these actions, our living environment would become better and greener. Ċ In conclusion, overpopulation has created undesirable effects on the natural environment. It is the responsibility of both government and people living on the planet to protect it before it is too late.

prompt: Some people think the cheap air flight gives ordinary people more Ċ freedom. However, others think the cheap air flight should be banned Ċ because it pollutes the air and brings many other problems. Ċ Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: The question about what cost of air flights is fair in our days is under discussion. A part of people believes that low prices on tickets are giving to average person opportunities to see the world. However, another one supposes that the damage caused to climate change is higher than any possible privileges. I am of the opinion that the affordability of flights should be saved with a strong concern for the environment. Ċ On the one hand, the quantity of air flights has been enormous raised for the last couple of decades. For sure, it becomes the most valuable reason degrading situation with the environment. For instance, carbon footprint. The aeroplane fuel is toxic and taking into account the low number of passengers it makes unsustainable this kind of transport compareChange the form of the verbcomparedIt appears that your sentence or clause uses an incorrect form of the verb compare. Consider changing it. Ċ show examples to, for example, the railway. The increasing cost of tickets could partly solve this problem by decreasing the number of trips. Ċ On the other hand, banning low-cost flights could lead to stagnation of economic development in a lot of touristic countries, such as Italy, Turkey and The United States. A significant part of people will lose their job which could lead to huge social and economical consequences. In addition, the freedom of movement is a basic right of folks. From my point of view, humanity is not ready to give it up. Ċ In conclusion, although we have a certain risk with this frequency of flights I believe that we need to leave the prices at the low rate, but invest more in decreasing the hazards of it.

prompt: Some people believe that the purpose of museums is to entertain, while others argue that museums are built for education. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Some museums tend to focus on entertain, while others are more educative. Personally, I believe that museum can and should synthesis the aspects of entertain and education. Ċ Clearly, a great number of museums, especially the kind of art, attract visitors through some entertain activities. There is no doubt that people have got sufficient theoretical knowledge in the text book and suffer from much pressure in study; therefore, few of them prefer to visit a boring place, just like extra schooling, in leisure time. In this case, providing different activities related to the exhibition, museum is more adorable towards individuals. Ċ However, it offers a chance for people to obtain knowledge in terms of the educative kind of museums. The initial purpose of museum is showing something that visitors did not previously know and expending their outlooks. For instant, teachers will organize students to go to special museum, such as history science and finance museums, for sake of educating students by complemented knowledge. Ċ On balance, the combination of entertain and education can best achieve the main goal of museum. It is unnecessary for people to obtain information mechanically in museum during free time. In other word, museum can attract visitors by building a relaxing atmosphere, a methodology bringing about the same result-enriching people`s knowledge. Moreover, visitors will easier to remember the information related to the activities they experienced in the exhibition. Hence, the combination caters the initial purpose of the museum more successfully, allowing people to obtain knowledge in a more easy way.

prompt: Some believe that people will purchase a product based on their needs and advertising is not needed.To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Marketing and advertising have always been an integral part of the sales process. While many argue that advertisement serves no real purpose as necessity motivates all purchases, others are of the opinion that advertising has an impact on sales. I agree with the latter view as advertisements offer many other benefits to the manufacturers. Ċ To begin with, it is undeniable that advertising increases profits as it plays a major role in convincing people to buy the advertised product by giving the feeling that life with it can be happier and more comfortable. For example, studies have shown that even if a particular product is widely consumed, using adverts will spur more people to make the purchase, which of course ensure the success of the business. In addition to that, adverts are essential to illustrate the benefits of the product and explain how it functions. Ċ On the other hand, advertising encourages loyalty among customers and increase their trust in the company. This would restrict any competition from other manufacturers who wish to produce similar products. For instance, the engaging and continuous advertising of Pepsi cola has made it the dominating soft drink brand even though several other companies are trying to make a name in this industry. Thus the role of advertising extends beyond providing entertainment. It builds brand value and recognition. Ċ In conclusion, after analysing the previous points, it is clear that promoting products is vital as many positive merits are drawn from this practice. Therefore, it is recommended that all companies launch advertising campaigns that allow their products to reach the widest possible market.

prompt: People buy good products that work, therefore, advertising is unnecessary and is no more than a form of entertainment. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: Determining the impact of advertisement is an ongoing debate among consumers. Some advocate the idea that advertising is simply entertainment because almost all customers know which products are efficient. On the other hand, others argue that advertising is still useful to persuade them to buy the goods. I completely disagree with the idea that advertising is not important because it can help the public to know about good items. Ċ First, people always try to make a good purchase. For instance, if someone wants to buy a smartphone, they will opt for a model that has various functions and a cheaper price. However, they may not find a mobile phone that suits their needs if several companies did not advertise to them the other models that they have already developed and produced. Advertisement will be useful in that case because it can deliver some information about functional phones to buyers. Therefore, publishing advertisements play a crucial role in helping purchasers make a better purchase. Ċ Second, consumers not only buy products that they really want but also want to purchase some items that were broadcast on TV. For example, some people want to try alcoholic drinks after seeing their advertisements on TV. To satisfy their curiosity, they purchase the product and find out whether it has excellent quality or not. In this case, advertisements can still influence people to buy products even though they are not certain about their quality. Aside from that, companies continue to make sales and generate profit thanks to such commercials. Ċ To sum up, every person is not only a reasonable consumer but consumes to satisfy their curiosity. Hence, advertisements can deliver information about good items to purchasers who find good products as well as a useful method to draw the interests of consumers.

prompt: Nowadays there are many online courses offered by universities. Do you think that the advantages of online learning outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: In modern times, a lot of distance learning courses are provided by colleges. Although communication is absent in this form of learning, they will gain significant benefits like attending classes from home and also flexibility in timings. In my opinion, students benefit largely from studying online despite the challenges they inevitably face. Ċ Learning in class offers the advantage of clearing doubts in studies related to the particular concepts which the class finds difficult. On the contrary, this is not possible in the case of e-learning which acts as the most crucial demerit. For example, my friend is enrolled for a science diploma programme online and she finds it very challenging to perceive the concepts virtually. Therefore, this type of education is not beneficial at all times as when the queries arise there is no teacher to explain them. Ċ Conversely, offering courses on the internet has several positive points. Firstly, there is no requirement to commute to the institution as classes can be attended from any convenient location and this saves ample time and money. For instance, my colleague is attaining a master's degree in communication technology through means of web learning. Consequently, this assists in saving transportation costs and precious time. Ċ Secondly, Flexibility is a key feature of virtual learning as it allows the pupils to choose any hour of the day to attend the session. Hence, this provides the flexibility to people to work and study as well which is a great advancement in the education field. To illustrate, my husband does a full-time job in the daytime and during the night he does his learning from home. Ċ To conclude, the enormous numbers of courses online given by universities are carrying a lot of plus points for the public. From my perspective, this is the best method of teaching and learning and the benefits of e-classes overshadow its drawbacks. Therefore many people prefer taking classes online.

prompt: Some people view teenage conflict with their parents as a necessary part of growing up, whilst others view it as something negative which should be avoided. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Adolescence is a difficult stage of everyone's lives, thus conflict between parents and teen might happen in the process of growing up. Critics may view this in the negative light, however other assert that it is a part of maturing into adulthood. Ċ The arguments in favour of this would generally based their view that the clash between teenagers and parents is inevitable in the early adulthood stage, This is because teenagers are starting to think independently at this stage, so the conflict of interest with their parents are unavoidable. In the west, this is seen in the positive light - as opposed to the negative view of many Asian cultures. Western culture depict this clashing as a way which teenagers try to 'break free' from their parent's clutch, and their wanting of living independently. Ċ However, there are strong arguments against this view because others perceived that it is rude and insolence toward their parents. Those who hold these views are typically Asian cultures. These cultures practises the submission of teenage to parents as a way of showing respect, and of course, this means no conflicting of interest between both parties. This is because 'conflict' is seen as being rebellious, as opposed to being independent in the Western cultures. Ċ In conclusion, I personally think that teenagers should not be in total submission to their parents as it will kill the trait of thinking independently. Children should communicate closely with their parents and accept their view points as a guideline. Furthermore, if children were isolating themselves within the narrow confines of their age group, it would only limit their view of the world and preventing them from growing up in the best possible way.

prompt: Today, more and more students are deciding to move to a different country for higher studies. Do you think that benefit of this outweighs the problem?
essay: In this present time, a plethora of undergraduates wants to travel in a various country for their higher education. I think its a good and a bad idea for student to graduate from their dream university. Ċ I believe, on one hand, it’s a good idea that youngster wish to proceed their further education in another state. Several nations lack the new way of teaching technology conversely as numerous countries are offering best schooling system to their students with advanced features. For example: Australia offers the better education consequently a number of children wants to graduate from recognized universities which will helps them to get superior job. Moreover, teenager will get chance to learn new language and culture from various background. It will help them to understand the culture differences between the people. Ċ On the other hand, pupil may not wish to go back to their home provincial after finishing their study, as a result, their motherland will lose them. Similarly, to get admission in reputed college is not an easy task. It will take a lot of time and effort. Many people will lose their time if they don’t get visa. For instance: if undergraduates want to continue their schooling in different country then they must go through a long process and their visa might be rejected afterward thence they will behind. Ċ In conclusion, even though it has got is positive and negative side. Teenager should do whatever is best for them and put their best version will doing it.

prompt: Nowadays, a lot of charities and organizations have set up a number of days name the special day to attract people's attention, like National Children's day, National Non-smoking Day. Why do they have to do so, and what will the effects be?
essay: These days, many charities and organizations have created the special day's name, such as National Children's Day and National Non-smoking Day to appeal societies' attention. There are some reasons and impacts of such these special days, which I will explain further in this essay. Ċ There are some purposes, why charities and organizations have set up a special day. Take, National Children's Day for instance, it is a day, that aim to emphasis the societies to take care of children. In fact, quite a few children nowadays become the victim of their family or teacher, such as sexual abuse, human trafficking and so forth. Therefore, with this special day, the charities or organization could give the knowledge to societies regarding the children's right, and how to treat them with well-behaved in order to prevent children abuse. Furthermore, with such these special days, the charities and organizations are able to contribute to the society actively. Thus, for these reasons, the names of special days are created. Ċ In addition, the impacts of these special days could invite the societies to be more pay attentions upon issues occurring these days. Special days campaign that arranged by some organizations and charities about what they fight upon certain issues, will influence people to be better individuals. Non-smoking Day for example, this special day, will enhance people awareness towards the dangerous of smoking to health. Hence, effect of the special days can repair moral values in societies as well. Ċ In conclusion, it is clear that, the name of special days have contributed to societies positively. These special days possess an own purpose as reflected in the day's name itself. With host of special day's name created, it shows that there are still, people in this world that care towards each other.

prompt: Television dominates the free-time of too many people. It can make people lazy and prevent them from socialising with others. Ċ Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Technology has proven to be a blessing in a disguise. Television is one the blessings that initially thought as a source of entertainment has now become the most preferred activity by all the kinds of people to kill their leisure time. Watching television all day-long has made people lethargic and inactive and completely cut off from socialising as well. I agree with notion to a greater extent and will shed some light in following paragraphs. Ċ In today's time, teenagers would like to sit all day long in front of TVs and watch various series or other things.This affects them adversely by making them lazy, not willing to go for outdoor activities where they can actually make some friends and have fun and develop their skills. For instance, earlier they used to play different games which helped them to remain fit and malady free, whereas, today the scenario is completely changed. They sit whole day around, having junk food which leads to many diseases like heart problem, obesity and others. Moreover, they have more of virtual friends rather than real ones upon whom they can relay at the need of the hour. Ċ Adult people are also no less than the younger ones. They too prefer to spend their free time watching serials and other stuff on the electronic machine. They find talking with friends of less interest, rather than watching melodramas of greater joy which results in many issues that they even do not pay attention to. For example, earlier people used to go for a walk after eating which helped them to digest their food and helped them to stay healthy and have a chat with friends around, whereas, today adults like to watch TV even while eating and after that they just lay down without doing any physical activity that can help them to burn their calories and maintain their cholestrol levels. This habit is developed to such an extent that it is difficult for them to leave it. Ċ In a nutshell, Tv has led to the increase of maladies rather than just being a source of joy.Let it be kids, teenagers or adults, no one can care about their health that much which in result leads to weakness, laziness and even socially inactive. This not only affects their health, but also stops them from developing their social skills as well. They should try to limit their timing to watch TV and interact with people around.

prompt: Some people have great ambitions in life, others don't. Do you think ambition is important to succeed in life? Is it a positive or a negative quality to have?
essay: It is true that ambition motivates you to make one's dream true. Although ambition has a dark side of it, I strongly think that ambition is needed for anyone who wanted to excel in their chosen field. Ċ In many situations, ambition is highly regarded. First of all, ambition helps us in self realisation of our own strengths and how better we are in this world. It lays down the path to success in our personal, family and professional lives. An example is Steve Jobs who is ambitious and extra-ordinary visionary who made people to believe Apple products are better than long run rivals in the market. Secondly, it teaches us resilience to overcome the problems in this competitive world. For instance, Japan is the best example to the world which regained its economy after the atom bomb attacks and repeated earth quakes. Finally, being ambitious makes us adaptable and tolerant in a team and by adding more people to one's ambition makes everyone to move forward. Ċ On the other hand, ambition is often associated with greed, intolerance and drive for power. In the movie Wall Street, the character Gordon gecko preaches Greed is good. There is no limit to how much money one can make and how much one can expand the business. Another wrong perspective of ambition is ruthlessness or merciless. It can block human emotions like friendship, respect for others or compassion. Finally, ambition is regarded as individual goal to achieve power, money or fame by paying any price to achieve it. Ċ In conclusion, while ambition may be portrayed negatively by those who failed themselves, it is much needed for life otherwise it would be mechanical or meaningless.

prompt: question: In some country, owning a house rather than renting one is very important for people. Why this may be the case? Do you think this is a negative or positive situation?
essay: Nowadays, people reckon that an adult person should have a home for on their own and that is a pivotal thing in their life. There are some factors to people think which have a considerable effect in their thoughts . Ċ From my perspective, The advantages of possessing an apartment for people are rather significant . Firstly, in Asian culture nations, One of the decisive element of getting married of a man is have a home for theirselves to start up a home .if they have not, it is hard to persuade parent's their wife-future to accept their marriage ,but some people argue that it is not necessary house , it may be true for some others. However , I still believe that owning a flat for a man is easier for them to settle in a new life. Secondly , the day-by-day expenses of living in the big cities as well as rural areas is ridiculously expensive . If an individual get the expenses of paying money to landlord , even it can be a half of their salary. A lack of money can lead to enormous problems in their life. For instance, because of food in the end of months or expense for electricity , they can get into debt as a result. Ċ Nonetheless , there are also the benefits for hiring a accommodation. The renter can move in to anywhere they desire to live or have a trip business in foreign suddenly for a year or more. They will be free to go aboard and work without any ties or hesitation. Ċ In sump up, admittedly, some may struggle to have a apartment for the demand of society and theirselves , having said that. This is no deniable that living in the accommodation can give freedom for them. In my view, this is a positive argument.

prompt: Instructions Ċ Read the question below and write an essay dealing with Advantages and Disadvantages.You should spend no more than 40 minutes on this task.Remember to write down a clear thesis statement followed by your essay plan.Only then attempt to write this essay. Ċ Many companies offer their employees the opportunity to work from home.Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of working from home for the company.And give your own opinion.
essay: Organization are now allowing their employees to work from home or remotely. Adopting this step is a huge success for every corporate , as this gives more space to its workers to think rationally at their native place. As every idea has its own advantages and disadvantages which I will discuss in below paragraphs. Ċ Firstly, As technology has reached in every nook and corner of the world, its helping organization to adapting working from home and with flexible timings. This gives employees to balance their work-life , as there is no commute time involved. For example, due to urbanization affording a place in downtown or city would cost more rather on the countryside , so public travel to reach their office for at least 1-2 hours and often getting tired due to tight schedules and this leads to giving less time to the family. To add further, eating fresh food at lunch and preferring fruits over junk which is easily available in the office. These are the main points which are certainly giving an edge to working from home. Ċ However , there are negative points as well to this idea such as the public is not getting connected socially. For example, when in office team goes for lunch together, or have fun activities in breaks while these are getting limited. In case accommodation is smaller, sometimes it’s tough to adjust. Most importantly, people don’t have a track of time and end up working more than usual hours. Ċ To conclude, in my opinion working from home should be given, but it should be restricted for the number of hours on a monthly or annually basis. Also , I believe every company should be ready for giving its employee this opportunity as its proving to be good in case of a pandemic situation.

prompt: Some people point out that there will be less international travel in the future. Do you think it is a positive or negative trend? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.(can you give individual scores based on criteria?)
essay: Cross-country travelling is quite debatable topic and many people believes that in the upcoming future international travel will become less over the period of time. So, it needs to ascertain whether it would be positive or negative sign for a nation. Well, I am of the both view that it would be positive trend as well as negative trend. Ċ First of all, if inter-country travelling will be less in the near future then it is beneficial for a country as it will help in saving the outflow of domestic currency to other nation. For example, if people go for holiday trip internationally then they end up spending handsome amount on adventure activities, souvenirs etcetera, so it is an indirect loss for the native country to which travellers belong. Moreover, persons who travel abroad much frequently become habitual to adopt the culture of destination country which is not at all good for a nation since it will start losing their culture values gradually. Ċ On the other hand, tourism industry plays a vital role in uplifting the economy. Any country will be able to earn major chunk of income through tourism sector, therefore, if foreigners people will not visit internationally then a country will not be able to earn foreign exchange. Various researches have shown that federal government earns humongous amount of revenue in the form of taxes through international tourism.
