Furthermore, many sectors which are directly associated with the tourism will have drastic impact on their growth i.e. hospitality sector, entertainment zones etc. Ċ To sum up, I understand that international tourism is integral for a nation by which we can maintain the good relationship with other country and can earn revenue but we should not forget the cultural values of one's own country by visiting other nation.

prompt: Some people argue that space exploration has had more to do with national pride than national effort. To what extent do you agree with this? How do you think space exploration will change in the future?
essay: In the globalisation era, the development of technology has spread in all aspects. One of them is in the space exploration. Some people believe that with this mission, it can make a nation proud of. Because of that, this needs great effort to prove it. In my view, I strongly agree that in the next future a space journey become prominent. Ċ Furthermore, the inhabitants who know the technology. They will search novel methods to break the limit. As example, a new discovery of space travelling to the moon which done in July 21, 1969 by three Americans. This is proved that the USA has an immense ambitions of special purpose. From that moment, the USA had been a superpower country since it showed the different performance and become fame state. Ċ Nevertheless, all that inseparable from the country which included in the project. Aerospace organizations contains people all over the world. On account of this, Americas cannot claim that they commit their experiments clearly base on their struggle. In addition, regarding the financial aspects, this project needs much cost and requires loan of money from other countries. The nations which helped this invention should be appreciated and become famous as well. Ċ For several years later, in my point of view the travelling of outer space is predicted become the extraordinary one because until present, solely few of inhabitants who can go there. For instance, only 3 Americans, namely Niel Amstrong, Buzz Aldrin, and Michael Collins in 1969 then, this was followed by Russia in 4 years later. This is because for this project requires high financial and much time for preparation. Ċ The aforementioned evidence reveals that although space exploration is difficult journey for people now, the scientists continually make an endeavour to achieve a life in outer space. Then, in next several decades, the era is predicted to face outer travelling.

prompt: Homeschooling is becoming increasingly popular as more and more parents are choosing to educate their children in this way. why do you think parents might chose homeschooling rather than traditional schools. Do you think homeschooling is more beneficial?
essay: Parents nowadays believed that homeschooling is better rather than traditional schools. It is becoming more popular among them. As the generational change, the situations and the requirements change, so as it happens with schooling system. However, as per my view traditional school system is still better than taking classes from their premises. There are various reasons for adopting the private tuitions by the parents that I will discuss in below paragraphs. Ċ To begin with, the concept of accepting the homeschooling by the parents, is the convenience for them of not wasting their hours or more in pick and drop of children from the campus. For instance, As per current scenario, both mother and father are working and they both have to go to an office. At the same moment, they need to get their children ready in the morning and drop them to school. Therefore, the process took a long time for them. But if they prefer private tuitions for their children, then they can spend their time by doing other work. Another reason is the low expenses have to pay for it. Because there are many facilities that schools are not liable to charge if parents are adopting for home tuition. Due to above reason it is becoming popular among parents. Ċ To continue with my views on schooling system, There are lots of things that children may miss in homeschooling. For example, Without attending school, they do not get a chance to interact with other children. Moreover, it teaches children the values, respect, manners interact with others. Further, they learn the values like to get up early and get ready to reach there on time. Other than these, it provides a playground where they can play with their friends and stay connected. Whereas, in homeschooling the children will get rid of these facilities. Consequently, the traditional systems is must for child growth and development. Ċ To conclude, there is no doubt that home tuition gives relaxation to both children and parents. On the other side, it makes them stay flat from other facilities that are essential for child development.

prompt: Nowadays, the use of animal testing in medical research has become a hot topic. Some people believe that animal testing should be banned, whereas others claim it is necessary. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Some individuals commented that the use of fauna in the medicinal investigation should be abolished. However, others argue that it is crucial and scientists should continue. Personally, I advocate the second view opposing to the first since the research analysis benefits all. Although it is against the fauna protection rules. This essay will shed light on both sides of the view and provide evidence to prove the argument. Ċ On the one hand, the animals' used in pharmaceutical experimentation produced reliable results. In other words, this sort of research has shown robust information in the past, thus, it is vital their application today. For instance, the coronavirus vaccine was initially tested in monkeys, once the wild species body has a similar functioning mechanism to human beings, and the antibiotic was produced in a record period of time. As a result, trustworthy and appropriate medicine is made. Furthermore, it is the overriding reason for pharmaceutical field development these days. Ċ On the other hand, the utilization of zoos goes against protectionism laws. Because of the necessity to safeguard terrestrial or marine species, there is a misalignment between the environmental activists and the medical researchers making their dispute over whether it is the right or bad thing to use guinea pigs for example. Hence, there are one-side communities that are critical and others are in favour. Moreover, the therapeutical use of wildlife is pointed out as the prime reason for heated debates nowadays. Ċ In conclusion, notwithstanding some critical ideas concerning the utilization of zoos into scientific overhaul, it is pivotal to continue the saga because it results in extremely advantageous scoops not only for supporters of the ideas but for every individual. Therefore, I still advocate the animal application.

prompt: The advantages of English spreading as a global language will continue overweight the disadvantages. To what extent do you agree or disagree? the global communication tool
essay: Nowadays, learning English is one of the most popular practices among Young people. Some people hold the opinion that English should be the language every people must speak. With the fast increase of this language use in the world, seems obvious that its benefits overweight the drawbacks. From my perspective, this idea is not completely accurate owing to the consequences this could have for society. Ċ On the positive side, the implement of English as the global language for fields such as business, university studies, research, and science has improved the communication and exchange of information. Scientists from all over the world are publishing their studies and papers in English and thus their research are reaching most people around the globe. Trade transactions among executives from different lands have been empowered by the Shakespeare language settled as the primary language in this sector. Ċ On the other hand, this positioning of English as the number one peaking language these days has significant consequences for several professions. Foreign language professional for instance French, Spanish, Korean or Chinese teachers will become rare as well as foreign language studies will lose relevance in the future, narrowing the variety of university programs. In addition, diversity among countries will be affected by this one-language trend. Non-English-speaker nations will be forced to switch languages and will lose their identity in language matters. Ċ To conclude, despite the fact that English as a global language is constantly increasing due to the advantages of this tendency, the negative side should not be dismiss. An appropriate balance between both sides could be the proper approach to deal with this phenomenon.

prompt: Do you agree or disagree with the sentence: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today? Give specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
essay: The human transportation always changes with the development of society. In another words, the useless or old vehicles will be replaced by new ones when time go by. Therefore I have several reasons to agree that the car-using will decrease in the future and it will the focus on my essay. Ċ First, one of the reason make car-using declines is it has negative impact on environment. The energy which supports car machine comes from the burning fuel and diezen oil which creates a lot of harmful gases. Those gases cause air pollution and greenhouse effect. Moreover, it also creates a lot of serious diseases for the healthy of human. Therefore, it is necessary to supersede car by another vehicles which does not create negative effect for environment in the future. Ċ Secondly, with the development of new material in the next decades, the scientists will create more modern vehicles like airplane and electronic cars-it makes the use of car will decrease. New type of vehicles will be more convenient and safer. For example, airplane is the type of transport which is faster and safer than car. People can go through a long distance within few hours by airplane while car will take few days or few weeks. Moreover, new transport will helps people save time and money. Thus, the use of new vehicles will make the consumer of car reduce rapidly in the future. Ċ In summary, although some people still believe in the important role of car today, I still believe that the disadvantages of this transport outweigh the advantages. In fact, with the growth of science and technology, people can create more type of transport which is better and helpful than car.

prompt: The education of young people is the main priority in countries around the world. Some people believe that educating adults who cannot read or write is essential for the society and more funding should be made available for it. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Many argue that countries must prioritize mainly the education of children. However, others opine to have societies start funding illiterate adults to learn. I agree with the view and, this essay will explain the reasons for adult schooling. Ċ Firstly, when a person struggles with reading or writing, social impacts are profound. Over a while, they develop low self-esteem, feel emotions such as shame and fear. For example, being illiterate, the individual would avoid situations where they have to communicate and make decisions. Secondly, unlearned adults are more susceptible to live destitutely. In developing countries, people living in poverty are either unemployed or work in low-skilled jobs. As a result of unemployment and to make ends meet, children are sent to work, while others get involved in theft and other crimes. With the funds, they can study in vocational training schools to develop skills to earn a decent living; and literacy training which raises reading proficiency. Ċ Lastly, uneducated individuals are prone to health issues. Due to the fact, they have trouble reading and understanding safety protocols, tend to have more workplace accidents and prolonged recovery period. Crucial information like the inability to read prescription labels and drug overdose is more common among these people. We can ask them to repeat instructions and assess their baseline information about their health before proceeding further. Ċ In conclusion, I reiterate that it is immensely vital for adults to be literate in today's society and, we must take urgent measures and invest more to educate these adults.

prompt: .People these days watch TV, films and other programmes alone rather than with other people. Do the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: It has been pointed out that people have been becoming to watch TV series or movies solely. Personally, I opine that this situation brings out several dangerous problems in terms of personal skills and health issues compared to one benefit it might bring. Ċ Admittedly, watching TV shows alone increases individuals’ quality of life. This is because TV-watchers are able to appreciate the content regarding their interests and hobbies instead of considering their companions’ thoughts, thus contributing more convenience and ease to their lives. For instance, a vast majority of housewives say that they had to watch sports games that they did not interest in with their husbands previously. However, due to their lifestyle changing nowadays, they can binge on dramas that are their favourite shows, which leads to freedom and flexibility for them. Ċ Nevertheless, despite the benefit above, I believe that individuals are facing a huge number of dangerous detriments from watching multimedia alone. The reason is that communicating with their relatives and friends while watching movies provides people with chances to improve their social skills and enhance their sense of belongs. By contrast, as those who watch TV shows alone are less likely to have a considerable amount of time to talk about with their friends and family members, they may lack intimacy and connection and feel lonely, thus raising devastating emotional and mental problems and impairing their communication skills. As an illustration, most office-workers living alone and watching multimedia sole state that they are suffering from serious emotional issues nowadays since fewer people they can interact with while they watch TV shows. They also feel that their social skills are no longer strong. Ċ In conclusion, although binge on TV programmes alone has one minor advantage, a massive proportion of obvious drawbacks with regard to social skills and health problems should be taken into account.

prompt: Better driver education for better driving habits is more effective than heavier punishments for driving offenses. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Nowadays, as you know that social development leads to the demand for transport is increasing. Consequently, there are many transportations which run on the road escalate more frequent traffic accidents. It was suggested that the education of people using vehicles is better than punishment, but in my opinion, I suppose that is unreasonable. Simultaneously, I also give some of my own explanations for this essay. Ċ As we know, accidents involving vehicles are happening all over the world today and the extent of these accidents is from mild to severe and can be related to human life. Therefore, it's better to have very serious penalties with the target is a deterrent for drivers to avert catastrophic accidents. For example: In developed countries, if drivers violate traffic rules, besides compensation for damage, they could lose their job and could be gone to jail. So, it is necessary to educate carefully before granting diplomas for people such as increasing the difficulty in handling the real situation. Ċ Although better driving behaviour education is what we should do, it is not the best enough method to minimize the number of people get injured in transportations. At that time, the driver will no longer fear fines and accidents can occur at any time. In addition, learning primarily depends on the human factor, so it will not be objective. For instance: a person may obtain an excellent driver's license, but being distracted can cause a problem. So, besides increasing the level of sanction, we also improve the quality of training to ensure safety for participants. Ċ In conclusion, I think that sanctions are still one of the most effective solutions to reduce traffic accidents and it has been proven all over the world.

prompt: Global environmental issues are the responsibility of rich nations not of poorer nations. Do you agree with this opinion.
essay: Depletion of the environment has become a grave issue for the whole world. Many people think that only rich countries should take up the responsibility to work for conserving the habitat. However, I do not agree with this approach and find it as an absurd solution. Ċ To commence with, richer countries can take up this responsibility because they have the resources. Firstly, developed countries has much more knowledge because they have multiple scientists and researchers working in the newer areas of study. Thus, there are greater chances for them to find substitutes of existing resources to produce energy. Secondly, the developed countries have the financial resources to fund the establishments of projects for energy production with lesser harm to the environment. For example, the USA has spent a great deal of money on the projects to extract solar and nuclear energy. Such projects have reduced their dependency on coal for power. Ċ On the other hand, the underdeveloped nations do not have enough resources. They want their manufacturing industry to bloom and hence, they concentrate only on the their economy without any consideration of environmental damage. But, this way they will end up nullifying all the efforts put by the richer countries to conserve the habitat. Therefore, it is necessary for them to take some steps as well. For instance, they can create an awareness about the importance of preservation of the surroundings, so that their citizens can contribute as well. India has started giving subsidy on the installation of solar panels for meeting the electricity needs. Ċ To conclude, in my opinion, the protection of the environment is the dual responsibility of both richer and poorer countries. Even if the poorer nations might not be able to contribute financially like richer ones, but they can spread awareness among its citizens to take some small steps.

prompt: IELTS TASK2 ESSAY QUESTION: Nowadays, many people go shopping in their free time. Shopping has replaced many other activities that people choose as their hobby. What are the reasons for this? Is this a positive or negative development? ANSWER:
essay: Shopping is unavoidable to everyone in this modern world. There are various reason people visiting retail as their leisure activity than other activities. In this essay, I will explain reason for buying as hobby and its positive and negative improvements. Ċ There are various reasons behind shopping as their free time activity. People want to be attractive so that everyone will have to look on their costumes and accessories. Moreover, they want to try different clothes, food, cosmetic products etc. The other reason is to search for missing piece of their wardrobe. Many buy gifts for deer ones on their birthday and anniversary. Most of the family on weekends visit restaurant to dine. Youngsters are passionate to change their mobiles to new upgraded features. It gives happiness and best pass time. Ċ Some of positive progress of shopping is people aware about new products and prices in the market. It boosts their negotiation skills. Helps acquire profound knowledge about the each product. It improves communication skills with the strangers. It is best fitness activity moving one shop to another searching for specific product. On the other hand, people become negative growth of shopping are addiction results more expense and time. Psychological problem arises due to not satisfactory of the product. Ċ In a nutshell, there is strong reason behind for people frequent shopping as their hobby. By analyzing both positive and negative advancement of shopping advantages outweigh the disadvantages of shopping. People are more enjoying their shopping in their spare time.

prompt: At present we rely on oil for most our energy needs. However, oil is a fossil fuel and causes air pollution, and it will eventually run out. Nuclear energy is the only practical and clean source of energy for the world. In what extent do you agree and disagree?
essay: The world now have recently faced serious air pollution and power shortage. The statistics shows that fossil fuel such as gas and oil is reaching the exhausted peak. It is argued that nuclear power is the most feasible alternative source which can solve pollution issue. However, I strongly disagree with this view. Ċ First of all, although nuclear energy can deal with the exhaustion, lots of great dangers lie behind this source due to the fear of contamination. Statistic illustrates that the number of disasters which are caused by radioactive waste in the recent decades is not small. Take for example, the latest disaster Fukusima. The whole large area was severely contaminated; as a result, the citizens were completely moved to another place. This raises the question of the safety of nuclear power. Ċ Then what are the alternative forms that are more comparative? Many other sources of energy such as solar and windy as well as biofuels power are possibly potential to exploit in the near future. Despite relatively large setup costs, these source are evidently proved to be cost-effective and sustainable in the long run. In addition, as they are definitely endless, we never mind that one day they will ultimately exhaust. These source can also solve the environmental issue which is the biggest drawback of the nuclear power. Ċ The facts outlined above, when taken together, are in the favor of the view that nuclear is not the future energy alternative. The question is now whether government policies is strict enough in order to encourage power companies to invest more in new sources of energy.

prompt: Some people say that children with different abilities should be taught in different classes at school; other; however , think that streaming education has more disadvantages than advantages, and that all children should be taught in one and same class.  Discuss both of the views. which do you support? give reason for your answer.
essay: A much debated issue these days is whether youngster with assorted capacities ought to be educated in dissimilar level at school. Many people are of the opinion that we should implement this, while some opposite opinion suppose distinctive classes bring more drawback. This essay will analyse both pros and cons of this idea. Ċ First of all, classifying dissimilar students to suitable environment can help talented students who always want to prove themselves have chance to develop more quickly. Indeed, with favorable programme, they can abridge the time need to complete every grade. Not only that, these classes also support students have lower capacity. When teacher have adequate time to care them, they will not feel inferior, as study with superior others., Besides, owing to categorize level of students, educators have more opportunites. What appropriate syllabus and agenda for their class may enhance aptitude for white-collar youngster. Ċ However , specialized education also bring a lot of fault . The fight for justice and democracy in class is an essential prerequisite for youngsters. But, if streaming classes are enforced , this may be difficult to implemented . Beyond , less intelligent children do not have chance to interact with smarter partner. In young generation, exchange relations between pupils have reversed level are really crucial . Evidently, this education system will make to increase self-conceited and self-abased children. Ċ From all things considered, although a great many people hold firm to their beliefs that we need to eliminate specialized education , I am convinced that this is very necessary for us, especially, in changeable world today.

prompt: Some young children spend a great amount of their time practicing sports. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
essay: there are a lot of young children how practice sport. Some of them practice the sport they love such soccer or basketball, others practice the sport that their parents have obliged them to. Whatever the reasons for what the young children practice sport, practicing sport has some advantages and disadvantages. Ċ Sport is one of the most important thing that help young children to stay healthy. By practicing sport young people can stay far from being obese which lead forward to some diseases such as heart disease or diabetes. Also ,it is well known that sport release pressure from the young children who attend daily their schools. So they can spend their free time in practicing sport to have some pleasure and fun. Another advantage of practicing sport by young children is that sport teaches them how to face their fear. This skill will be useful for them to solve their problems and issues with brave and responsibility. Ċ On the other hand , spending much time in practicing sport by young children has other consequences that can negatively affect the entire life of the young child. The child at this age can be influenced a lot by the sport. Thus, the sport will divert them from focusing in their studies. Also, when children spend much of their time in practicing sport, it leads to be less sociable. They will miss the opportunity to share some time with their families or their friends. Progressively, they will lonely and lose contact with people. Ċ It is good and important that young children practice sport , but it will be dangerous for them if they become possessed by it. The right thing is to give each thing the adequate time.

prompt: Some people like to try new new things, for example, places to visit and types of food. Other people prefer to keep doing things they are familiar with. Discuss both these attitudes and give your opinion.
essay: Some individuals have their own interests and there has always been a debate around the globe that whether or not should try out new things. It is often believed that many people prefer to explore new places and new food. However, others argue that the things that are known are always a better option. In my opinion, I believe that people should explore as much as they can. Ċ On the one hand, the ideas that are already familiar, a person becomes an expert. Firstly, doing the same thing over a period of time results in getting expertise that has certain benefits. For instance, most of the developed nations, tend to offer higher compensation to the employees who are the experts. Moreover, many people get comfortable with the situation and become tasteless to try new sorts of ideas such as places, cuisines. In other words, many individuals never desire to get out of their comfort zone as they fear that it will require a lot of hardships. Ċ On the other hand, although many citizens globally are exhilarated to explore something new. To illustrate, they figure out the ample number of opportunities to know about the different cuisine, taste and lifestyles when they plan to visit new locations. For example, in a recent survey, it was reported that 50% of the tourists were highly satisfied with their experience when they explored a new country and new restaurants. Furthermore, trying out various things may turn out to be a great source for finding out someone's passion. It is considered by many that they found their true passion while exploring multiple tastes. Ċ In conclusion, although following the same conventional way insists on mastering that skill, being flexible to accept new ideas has numerous benefits such as enhancing their preferable knowledge about the cuisines and finding their own passion.

prompt: Fewer and fewer people walk on a daily basis. What are the reasons and how to encourage them to spend their time walking?
essay: People’s tendency in walking regularly is decreasing. There are a few reasons for this, but particular solutions can be taken to tackle this problem. Ċ There are several causes for this trend. Firstly, modern life has brought many pressures in daily schedules, and people are up to their neck in work. When individuals do not have enough time, instead of walking they have to choose vehicles such as cars to go to their workplace or other destinations. Secondly, Doing the same activity on a regular basis could be boring. Take the case of employees, who have to walk to their offices through the same streets every day without any novelty or company. Ċ Nevertheless, various possible actions could be taken to address the above. In the first place, the government should set new laws for employers to postpone the starting time of workplaces. This increase the free time of people, which encourage them to consider walking as an alternative way to go to work. Additionally, popular companies like Nike could create international mobile applications in order to encourage people to walk more. These companies can investigate the individual reasons why many people do not choose to walk in order to design useful Apps with the purpose of making walking easier for them. For example, an App can be beneficial for individuals who do not like walk alone to connect and match them to another person to walk with. Ċ In conclusion, various factors have led to a decrease in people who walk daily, but this could be tackled by possible solutions.

prompt: Topic: Today, there are many books to read. In your opinion, what kinds of books should we read?
essay: Books are one of the best tools to help people approach the world. Nowadays, many books are established, it leads to difficult for readers to choose. The issue of whether choosing books has been debated widely. Personally, I think there are two kinds of books we should read: Science books and Skill books. Ċ There are positive reasons for reading science books and skill books. First of all, science books provide us general knowledge about not only natural but also artificial phenomenons on the World. For instance, science books can help mankind understand water cycle, the essence of disasters such as vocalno, storm and so forth or it gives us the information about how to make clay, vihicles. Therefore, human being can understand clearly essence of each appearance which very helpful for them to avoid bad things or develop their life. Ċ The second kind of book we should read is skill books. Skill books have many types such as: living skills, business skills etc. All of them are likely alternative programs for people who don't have enough time to take part in skill courses. Thanks for skill books, people know how to live, communicate and deal with problems more. Take for example, the book "How to win friends and influence people" help readers to perfect themselves and get more love and respect from the others. One more example is the book "Diffentiate or Die" which decribes many strategy to get success in business. As can be seen clearly from those examples, skill books help people live effectively. Ċ In conclusion, there are many advantages that science books and skill books bring to us. Let's read them in negative way to improve and perfect ourselves.

prompt: When students move to a new school, they sometimes face problems. How can schools help these students with their problems?
essay: Students who move to a new school often confront with many problems; it is very important for them to get accustomed as soon as possible. Some students find it really easy; however, others' adaptation is not as good as their friends'. Consequently, schools should help them come through this experience successfully. Ċ To begin with, in the first weeks, schools should give some orientation course which help freshman get involved with new environment. Advisors or administrators should take them on a tour of school and show them around should. Advisors should tell them about the school' history, how to access facilities in the school such as gyms, library, access computer, carteen, the rule they have to follow, and so on. Ċ Besides, schools should help them find accommodation. Most new students wonder that whether they should live in hostel or rent a flat outside the school campus; therefore, School advisors can show the both advantages and disadvantages of these kinds of accommodation. School should arrange place in campus area for students who want to live in school, and help others who prefer living outside school to find place for living. Ċ Last but not least, schools should constitute clubs, outside activities to make a good environment for students participate. When these students attend, they have more chance to make friend with others. Ċ To sum up, the role of school is very important to help new students get accustomed to new environment.

prompt: Some parents are worried about the increasing level of violence in tv, video games and other type of entertainment for children's leisure. How does this effect children? How do you think problem can be tackles?
essay: Nowadays, children's recreational activities likewise gaming and television are influencing roughness on the child's behaviour while certain parents are disturbed with the increment on savage entertainment. In my perception, leisure activities are vital in the early childhood despite the parental control is obvious. Ċ On the one hand, there are positive and negative effects on modern recreational. To illustrate, television programs like Discovery Science and Animal planet nourish the knowledge, but adult movies and wrestling reacts in contrast. Also video games help to keep the young's occupied and improve their thinking speed. Besides children can get addicted to this activity, resulting with hyper behaviour problems and lack of interest in studies.To put it simply, electronic recreational activities have some benefits with parental guidance. Ċ On the other hand, thoughtful eliminating methods to tackle the flawless creations of recreational's incline with parental and necessary legal restrictions, indeed. Particular TV channels, suitable for children's would stop them going through adult or violent materials. In addition, a mobile application where parents can intrude into program history or restrict unsuitable programs. At the same moment, merging video games with the mobile phones will help to control the gaming time and stop violent games from playing. In a word, sheer parenting on children should be present at any moment. Ċ In conclusion, fathers and mothers have become very busy in their career development for the financial incentives. Despite than children being neglected by parents should allocate some time for their kid's physical activities like involving them in sports and athletics.

prompt: Traditional schooling is out of date, boring and stifles a child’s natural talents, various professionals have pushed for an education revolution. Are there alternatives in the education system? Is traditional education doing more harm than good?
essay: The conventional rote method of learning is often considered to be so dull as to discourage the full development of young people’s innate abilities. This essay agrees with the view that the current pedagogy is outdated, and will consider an alternative to traditional schooling. Ċ While ordinarily, adolescents are expected to retain pre-approved information dictated by a teacher, a self-directed approach can be more beneficial. In spite of the fact that holding all juveniles to the same standard will necessarily have a divisive result, with some offspring believing themselves to be intellectually superior, and others feeling inadequate, perhaps for life.Moreover, in systems in which achievement is relative, such as in Finland for example, young people graduate from discipline each feeling as if they have completed their own unique path, and knowing deeply and without ,prejudice their own capabilities, reducing or even eliminating the feelings of inequality that conventional learning creates. Ċ Furthermore, under the current system, students who lack aptitude in core subjects such as mathematics and the sciences are seen as having less intrinsic value to society. These youngsters not only spend their lives believing that they are inadequate, but also many may have valuable talents that were never explored. It is in the only way that conventional literacy does the most harm, by ignoring niche abilities in favour of skills with more mass appeal. In contrast to the traditional training with the Finnish system of self-direction, we can see that the former is certainly causing harm to a significant number of pupils. Ċ To conclude, changes are urgently required in education systems around the world. We should focus more on a child’s interests and innate abilities in order to maintain their engagement, and allow them to direct their own learning to achieve the best outcomes.

prompt: Today many children spend a lot of time playing computer games and little time on sports. Why is it? Is it a positive or negative development?
essay: One of the most conspicuous trends in today's world is teenagers playing video games instead of playing in the outdoors. Many parents are worried with the decline in daily exercise and cognitive skills. As such, there are both merits and demerits for this trend, this essay will explain the drawbacks of this development and explain them in detail. Ċ Firstly, students have a lot of leisure time and playing interactive computer games can kill the boredom. In addition, youngsters have the tendency to accept the challenge and break personal records and this is the major reason for virtual gaming addiction. For instance, a recent survey suggests that to gain instant fame and easy money console games is the easiest option available. Needless to say, to challenge opponents and to create personal records without physical stain are the reasons for gaming addiction. Ċ Secondly, there are some pitfalls that can overwhelm the potential benefits of this trend. Most of the parent's are worried about their children's decline in daily physical activities and social cognitive abilities. Moreover, virtual reality has been taken over by augmented reality and every individual, enjoys the virtual gaming more interactive compared to the physical games. For example, console games like Xbox and PlayStation increasing in demand after introducing virtual games. Hence, young students are more attracted to console games and enjoy the creativity of designing their own games and rules. Ċ In conclusion, one can clearly understand that innovations in gaming have gone from reality to Virtuality and this leads to decline in socializing skills in peer school goers. Finally, the role of virtual reality is too dire to ignore in this trend.

prompt: Topics: Some people say university students should pay for their tuition fees. Some others say the government should pay for the tuition fees. What is your opinion?
essay: In the long history of human education, there exists a long-term discussion about the tuition fees. Some people hold that university students should pay for their tuition fees, while others think that tuition fees should be afforded by the government. Both of their opinions make sense in some degree. However, I prefer share the former one which can be held by certain raisons. Ċ In the first place, we have to admit that paying tuition fees by government would be beneficial to the public. However, it puts, at the same time, heavy financial burden on the government. The government has already paid for the expenses of the infrastructure building and public welfare. Moreover, all of which have cost huge amount of money. So affording tuition fees will cut other budgets down, because the amount of money is stable. Ċ Secondly, although, at present, the government does not spend money on tuition fee, it has already taken some effective actions to solve the financial problems of students from poor families, such as scholarship and educational loan. So students should pay for their tuition fees in order to share responsibility for the public education and to diminish government's burden. Ċ Last but not the least, if students pay their tuition fees, they will do some part-time jobs to earn money and therefor enhance their awareness of finance and practice their ability. Furthermore, university students, above 18 years old, have been adults, should take bills for their own behaviors. And this measure would let them know how precious money is and cherish the opportunity of attending university. Ċ To sum up, I believe that students should pay for their tuition fees, which alleviate the government's financial pressure and strength students' financial awareness.

prompt: All over the world, societies are facing a growing problem with obesity. This problem affects both children and adults. What are the reasons for this rise in obesity. How could it be tackled.
essay: Since the last few decades, the severe health problems are escalating in the certain demographics of a society. It is, therefore, the obesity has become a major concern in the people of all age groups. This essay will discuss the root causes of the condition, including sedentary lifestyle and poor diet along with tha,t some preventive measures will also be mentioned to mitigate the effects. Ċ It is seen that these days people are working longer than ever and due to their working conditions they have very little time for themselves which ultimately drag them towards the detrimental condition of putting on weight. As a result, presistent health issues arises. Moreover, unbalanced diet and the exorbitant consumption of ready-to-eat meal is contributing to make the people obese simultaneously as due to their hectic schedule, people tend to choose frozen food over the home cooked food. For instance, there have been some recorded instaces of people, who are gaining their weight due to prolonged sitting and unhealthy meals. Thus, above-mentioned are some factors which are causes of making people fatty. Ċ There are some potential ways which could be adopted to solve the rising problem such as work life balance and improvement in one's diet. If the people enable themselves to maintain a strategies to keep the balanced between their personal life and workplace environment, then at a large extent their health will be sustainable. Furthermore, to eat the nutritious food with less calories could be improved the overall health of an individual and the issue of obesity will be alleviate eventually. For example, according to one research article, in Japan 70% of the total population is in the trend of fittness as they are quite health conscious. Overall, the solutions could progressively work in a long term. Ċ To conclude, the vast majority of people are adversely affected by diseases and to put on weight is one of them, which is common in people of all stages of life. The essay has discussed the reasons behind it and the solutions of the problem are twofold: the stability in professional and personal life, and to change the dietery pattern.

prompt: Some people think that dangerous sport should be banned while others believe that people should be free to choose.Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: It is thought by certain individuals that the sporting activities which have danger involved should be abandoned and I also endorse the aforementioned statement while others believe they should have the freedom to make their own choice. Both sides will be discussed in the essay below with the relevant examples. Ċ To begin with, some hold a view that ban should be imposed on the sports that are dangerous as when people try their hands on these activities, they might not be aware of the risk involved, hence, making themselves land in problems that might be harmful to their lives. For example, while performing scuba diving if the pressure below the sea-bed increases and the person is not able to withstand that then, he/she may fall for the situation of bends along with some respiratory issues. Moreover, there are times when all cautious measures are taken in order to avoid any mishappenings but uncertain circumstances such as bad weather or sudden currents in the water during a water-sport can bring worse conditions of breathlessness, increased heart rate and much more in the above cases. Ċ However, it is felt by few individuals that they should have the freedom to make a decision about the sporting activities that they want to perform as various personalities believe in trying things out of their zone of comfort and bestow themselves the chance to challenge themselves. For instance, one acquaintance of mine wished to fly in the hot air balloon from a slanted cliff of a mountain which was considered unsafe but he wanted to test himself and experience it. Furthermore, it is believed by a part of the population that these kinds of sports help in imbibe fearlessness in themselves, therefore, they should not be devoid to choose them, an example of it is my own getting away from the fear of height when I did paragliding. Ċ In a nutshell, In my and some people' viewpoint, the sporting activities that are dangerous should be stopped by banning them as they might be risky to the life of many individuals, nevertheless, others feel they should be free to make their own choice as they are the best evaluators of what they wish to try in their lives.

prompt: Young people are often influenced by their peers. This is called peer group Ċ pressure. Ċ Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: In our society, people face peer pressure which means that children are influenced by their friends, who are of the same ages. Generally, it has both positive points and negative aspects simultaneously, while I believe that the advantages are more than drawbacks. Ċ The two main positive aspects of being impressed by their friends are learning new skills and trying to acquire a high level of software skills. That is to say, young generations have passion about their life; moreover, they learn a plethora of skills namely various languages, and sports if they have a communication with other students regularly. For instance, when adult students are interested in sport including football, the younger students are being influenced by them. As a result, they make a suitable curriculum to engage in sports constantly. On the other hand, because of acceleration in using of technology every person should improve their digital knowledge, therefore pupils will be impressed by the adolescence if they are sophisticate in technology. For example, in 2019, it was reported that the number of students, who had a tendency to learn a diversity of software increased in the US. Ċ However, there are some disadvantages when it comes to getting impact. Firstly, there is a number of students with different attitudes. As a consequence, pupils can learn hazardous skills from them. For instance, if one of them smokes, the pupils will appeal to them easily, and it can be harmful to both individuals and the school’s community. Secondly, the demand for new facilities will be increased, thus they put their parents into trouble. Ċ In my opinion, by guiding students, they can learn how to control themselves from their peer's temptations, and gain a positive result from them to reform their lives in a correct way. To sum up, all students have confronted this issue during their life. If their parents had taken appropriate schedules, they would encourage them to learn the benefits of this subject.

prompt: Obesity is an increasing public health problem in some parts of the world. Explain some possible reasons for this problems and suggest some solutions
essay: An upward trend is seen in public health due to fatness This essay will discuss the possible reasons for obesity, including lack of exercising and stress-eating due to work or personal problems. Fortunately, although these issues have led to a rise in corpulence, there are ways we can solve this problem, including gaining an active lifestyle and adopting stress management techniques. Ċ People are working more hours than before nowadays, which leaves them with a very little amount of time for personal development activities. In addition, this work pressure leads to stress-eating in some people. People place themselves under such unfavourable environments because it is a competitive domain. People are not aware of what they are eating in these stressful hours. For instance, A recent study found that people in the USA have stressful jobs that lead to eating junk food and stress-related sicknesses. This often results in people getting fat because of the stress and the lack of time to exercise. Ċ Maintaining a stress-free life and improving one's attitude towards exercising are both critical to mitigating heftiness problems. People need to adapt to a healthy lifestyle and exercise regularly as a routine. For example, Recent research concluded that people that exercise daily and have a healthy diet do not suffer from being heavy. Ċ In conclusion, people are increasingly suffering from obesity. This essay not only discussed how obesity is caused by the absence of exercises and thereby a bad diet, but also suggested that the solutions to these problems are twofold- to maintain a good and healthy diet and to work out daily.

prompt: IELTS WRITING TASK 2. ESSAY THROW-AWAY SOCIETY Many people say that we have developed into a "throw-away society" because we are filling up our environment with so many plastic bags and rubbish that we cannot fully dispose of. To want a degree do you agree with this opinion?
essay: It is argued that humans have been in a "throw-away" lifestyle. And it's become worst as we have been dumping a large amount of non-biodegradable rubbish. I find myself in complete agreement with this opinion for the following reasons. Ċ To begin with, there was a dramatic increase in the use of plastic bags. Those which are non-biodegradable will have existed a thousand years in our habitat. Therefore, a long time later, humans and other species will not have abode. More specifically, plants can not grow up with a large amount of plastic under the land. Ċ Furthermore, according to the nearest environment research in a reputable university, the number of garbage climbed exponentially including domestic, industrial, and medical waste. This situation makes an urgent issue for human society that effective and timely solutions to dispose of them. If not, it will become the main culprit of increasing environmental problems. For instance, many residential areas have been polluted air and water because their living locations are near a huge landfill. Ċ That is not to say that plastic bags just bring disadvantages to human life. People tend on single-use or disposable plastic because they believe that these items are cheaper, more convenient, and hygienic. However, the drawbacks of them causes are far greater. Ċ In conclusion, I would concur with those who believe that human effect leads to creating a "throw-away society" by filling up our habitat with so many plastic bags and garbage that we are not able to process all.

prompt: Topic: in many countries, good schools and medical facilities are available only in cities. Some people think that university graduates who become new teachers and doctors should work in rural areas for a few years. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
essay: The issue of whether students who majored in education or medicine should work in rural areas first is certainly a contentious one. Despite there are valid arguments to the contrary. I personally believe it is better for them work in cities after graduation. While working in rural areas should just be one option among other options. Ċ From my perspective, teachers and doctors should go where there is the greatest demand for them. With the current trend of rural depopulation and uncontrolled growth of cities, countryside is no longer the most urgent place that keen need teachers and doctors. Instead, some regions in cities such as suburban districts and slums (in less affluent countries particular) often have a huge demand for education sources and medical care. Rather than serving the minorities in remote areas, I feel that fresh graduates should devote themselves for the sake of the majority population in urban areas. Ċ Yet, perhaps the strongest argument in favor of young teachers and doctors working in cities is that of human rights. Even if rural dwellers have the same right to obtain high quality education and medical care as some of their counterparts have in cities, new graduates also human beings, they also have the right to determine where to live and work. Given that most young people tend to find job in cities, dispatching new teachers and doctors to work in rural areas would be a violation to their civil liberty. Ċ In conclusion, I once again reaffirm my position that fresh graduates should work in cities because they can help more people there. As choosing workplace is a human right, we should only encourage those people who willingly serve in rural areas.

prompt: Sports which are violent, such as boxing and wrestling have no place in a civilised society and should be banned. Do you agree or disagree ?
essay: Sports are a great means of portraying one's expertise despite it being violent or gentle. Games such as boxing and wrestling bring out the true potential in a person. It has given us many famous and strong personalities who have created histories like Muhammad Ali, Mike Tyson and many others. Hence, I completely disagree with the statement that boxing should be banned in a civilised society. I will explain my reasoning in this essay. Ċ Firstly, people participate in athletics like wrestling because they are ardent about it and enjoy doing it. It also helps to remove young boxers from poverty when they find themselves in a situation where all other doors are closed. Apart from that, it teaches young folks to look after their bodies. For instance, if someone really wishes to be successful then they need a high degree of physical fitness. It teaches discipline. As well as things like exercise and diet and furthermore informs players when and when not to fight. As a result, establishes mental and physical control. Ċ Secondly, it educates youths about self-defence so that they can protect themselves in need. To illustrate, if a person falls prey to some goons then he or she can use the tactics learnt to save themselves. On the contrary, there is no general intent to injure the opponent in this athletic. Rather, the primary aim is to score the most by hitting strictly defined regions of the body. And at the very least, it can provide a sense of self-respect. Ċ To conclude, pugilism involves fighting but it is not physically aggressive like rugby or ice hockey. As mentioned earlier in the essay, I totally detest and oppose the statement regarding the ban of this sport. People play it because they enjoy doing it and besides it increases self-esteem.

prompt: Could anyone kindly help me edit my essay? Topic :  Do you agree following statement: "For becoming well-informed, people have to review different news resources."
essay: After internet has become available to all over the world, people are capable to access to various information from different regions and fields. Many have concerned that modern citizens would be overwhelmed by the ocean of information. Meanwhile, people hold opposite opinion cite that getting message from different news resources would help people to understand events under more objective perspective. As far as I concerned, I agree to the latter statement for following reasons. Ċ Most of time, readers have to get the messages from different areas for fully grasping the events. Nowadays, many media present news in the perspective of one specific field, such as economy, biology, finance etc. People could be half informed if they only read one newspaper. For instance, when scientists invent a new electronic device, The Economist may public an article to discuss about its influence on international trade. While, other media, such as Biology Magazine, may question about its negative effect on human health. People need to collect all of info from different expert for fully understanding the new device. Ċ In face, sometimes collecting information from range of areas is not even enough. Occasionally, it is necessary to listen to ideas from two opposite views. Take the Senkaku island event in July 2010 as an example. After Chinese fishermen were captured by Japanese authority in the disputed island, Senkaku, both local media started to defend their own countries efficiently. If a person only reads news report from one side, it is highly possible that he/she will be misled. In such extent, people who want to know the fact will benefit from listening to the argument from both sides or even the third media. Ċ In conclusion, I believe people will be well-informed if they get information from different news resources. Although most of media report events from their narrow perspective, but people could receive more objective views by collecting different type of news.

prompt: Some people say that children given pocket money every week will have Ċ fewer money problems when they become adults. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Money has become an important issue among family members. A number of people think that giving pocket money to children weekly will reduce money problems in their future life as an adult. I completely agree with this view and I believe that children should learn how to manage a budget which is given by their parents. Ċ First of all, it is thought that allowance received by parents does not contribute children’s life when they become adults. However, children learn about cash management in their early life if parents give them to a bit money per week. Moreover, children improve their money management skills by experiencing to spend their allowance. For example, research says that children can develop self-awareness to spend money, and it can be taught effectively how to handle a budget. Therefore, parents give pocket money to their children. Ċ Secondly, children can learn how to spend a money wisely, and how to save money for their needs. Such childhood experiences teach children to put their money aside weekly and save their money, which is beneficial for them in the long run. For instance, today, many people, who did not learn to manage finances in early ages, suffer from more a high amount of debts than those who had a knowledge of cash management. Thus, pocket money given in early age is a useful tool to improve financial management. Ċ In conclusion, a knowledge of money management requires an early experience of expenditure and savings. I fully agree with the idea that pocket money is an effective learning tool in associated with managing money in order to reduce future financial problems.

prompt: Young people these days tend to be less polite and respectful than in the past. Whatare the causes and give your solutions?
essay: The upbringing of a child has been a contentious issue for decades, and many parents and countries try to introduce new ways to improve the quality of life for them. Some people complain that younger generation these days are disrespectful and arrogant, which has grown concerns among parents and nations to scour for the reasons behind it, and the steps that could be undertaken to resolve these circumstances. In this essay, we shall discuss the causes and the possible solutions to it. Ċ In the modern world, not everyone is fortunate enough to have a decent background or the correct environment, rather, many individuals are born in poverty or unacceptable surroundings. Moreover, due to lack of education most people reside in a difficult lifestyle which eventually leads them to bad influences. Similarly, the scenes shown on television and other media platforms portrays an awful image to the society, for instance, violence and criminal activities are more profound and uncensored in films and series which has a direct impact on people’s mind especially teenagers. Lastly, parents lack of attention also leads children in a wrong direction. Overall, certain measures can be taken to rectify this problem. Ċ First of all, the main aim should be to educate children at an early age, because at a tender age, an individual is less repulsive and more understanding. Secondly, parents should sit and explain their offsprings about the value and importance of being generous and kind. Thirdly, local communities and governments should foment programs for such youths, for example, people who were arrogant and impatient in their lives and learnt lessons from it should be able share their stories and explain these younger generations about the damages of having such attitude. Additionally, friends and families should bond with each other in order to dissolve this behaviour. Ċ To summarize, there are two sides to a coin, hence, although the reason of these problems are many, it is evident that certain measures like the ones mentioned above could resolve this matter. Nevertheless, it is essential for an individual to have manners and etiquettes to be prosperous in life.

prompt: Some people think watching TV and films makes children more creative. Others think that it can actually lower their creativity. Ċ Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Several individuals imagine that observing television programs causes kids to be innovative whereas the other outlook is that it reduces their innovativeness. I tend to conform to the first view but both will be discussed in this essay. Ċ Firstly, when children watch TV, they can learn and copy fresh skills for doing many things like art, music, language and so forth. Furthermore, certain shows on the screens are actually dedicated to harnessing creative skills. For example, SABC has a program that teaches kids how to make crafts. Many learn craft-making as early as pre-school and sell some of their products in the streets of Cape Town with the assistance of their parents. Ċ On the other hand, however, TV sets can hinder children's creative development because when they spend time on shows, all they want to do is to copy what they see instead of developing independent innovative aptitudes. Secondly, some of the films are addictive, leaving young people with less and less interest to learn other things. For example, I started preventing my daughter from watching Pepper Pig because I realised that she was no longer interested in learning English accents other than those used in the cartoon. When I did this, she suddenly became comfortable speaking in Irish and Canadian accents. Ċ In conclusion, therefore, I concur with those people who think that watching televised and filmed content makes children more creative. I am basing my opinion on the factors discussed in the essay above. Nevertheless, the other perspective cannot be overlooked.

prompt: Topic: Nowadays, artificial intelligence is being used to drive car. Why is this happening? Is it a positive or negative development?
essay: Recently, automobile driven by artificial intelligence is becoming more and more popular. This is due to the need to cut cost of transportation industry. The progress should be viewed positively as it will make our life more convenient. Ċ Self-driving car appeared to satisfy the demand to reduce expense of transportation industry. Recent surveys showed that an average taxi service business spends 40% of their expense on driver wage and human resources management cost. Saving this cost to invest more in vehicle and customer services will result in higher income for the company and better experience for customers. This can be done by replacing the traditional vehicle by driverless car. By doing this, business will no longer need to hire drivers and manage them, thus, a lot of expense can be saved. For example, autonomous buses used to take workers to work are being tested in Texas, USA. They helped solve the problem of driver shortage and cut off labor expense effectively. Ċ Self-driving vehicle should be considered a good development as it makes human life more convenient. In order to travel by car, we have to spend time and money to learn driving skill or hire a driver and depend on him to take us to where we want to go. On the contrary, autonomous cars give people the freedom to travel anywhere anytime without acquiring driving skill. It is estimated that an average person in Vietnam spends at least 3 months and 2000 US dollar to learn how to drive. By owning a vehicle driven by artificial intelligence, we can save this cost to spend on other things. Ċ In conclusion, vehicle driven by artificial intelligence appeared as a result of the attempt to reduce labor related expense. As this invention help improve our living standards, we need to see it as a good development.

prompt: The news has no connection with most people’s life and it is therefore a waste of time for most of us for reading newspaper and watching television news program. What extend do you agree or disagree?
essay: Someone argued that it is unnecessary for us to read the news due to it is isolated from our lives. Personally, I strongly disagree with this statement. In this essay, several benefits of learning news will be listed to prove the importance of becoming aware of surroundings. Ċ To begin with, it is quite wrong to believe the news is far from our lives. On the contrary, most of the events happen around us. For instance, it is universally known that nowadays Coronavirus is popular in China. Thanks to the rapid spread of the news among all the media platforms, more and more people attach more significance to staying at home in order to prevent the infection. It is obvious that the news becomes an essential avenue to inform the public about events which may affect them, keeping society safe and ordered. Ċ In addition, the news is a broad category: we find the news catering to diverse interests, ranging from sports to fashion. It is a kind of source where your viewpoints stem from. Meanwhile, the news greatly shows not only those unknown things occurring on the opposite side of the world which literally opens your horizon, but also those advanced researches which do huge benefits to your lives. There is countless valuable information in the news and it is definitely a pity for you to ignore them. Ċ In conclusion, the news provides plenty of useful resources which closely link to everyone over the world. Therefore, in my opinion it is advisable to access to the news regularly, which helps you move outside the narrow zone of your personal affairs.

prompt: QUESTION: Some people believe that countries should invite foreign companies to open their branches, offices and factories in order to develop their economy. Others think countries should invest in their own companies instead. discuss both views and give your own opinions.
essay: It is argued that to boost a country's financial system, the authority better expand branches and manufacturers with oversea institutions. Personally, I agree with this suggestion. However, it seems to many that spending on domestic firms is more preferable. Ċ Investment in local companies might assist a country to develop independently. In other words, it is obvious that given enough national funding, enterprises are more capable of producing things to serve the whole nation, as well as to export. Therefore, the domestic economy will be promoted and the quality of products will also be raised without being influenced by other nations. For instance, by applying advanced technologies and paying more attention to each technical stage, numerous fresh Vietnamese fruits, such as litchi, mango, etc. have reached many European countries with rigorous testing requirements. Ċ Having said that, I believe that cooperation with external businesses should be encouraged as it brings about several well-paid job opportunities and a better working environment. That is to say, if people want to be accepted by an international company, there may be a need for them to fulfil strict requirements, such as being fluent in English or owing specialized degrees. As a result, staff in these firms have all the right to receive high payment. That aside, foreign partnerships often offer workers state-of-the-art equipment, which is advantageous in increasing productivity. Also, local employees may have the chance to work with well-educated and professional colleagues in a multilingual atmosphere, thus enhancing knowledge, both practical and academic. Ċ In conclusion, even though internal companies have some noticeable advantages, I suppose bigger effort should be focused on inviting oversea businesses. Consequently, not only the local economy but also residents themselves benefit from it.

prompt: Environmental problems are so big that they cannot be solved by any person or country alone. Instead, it should be solved at international level. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this view? Who is responsible for pollution?
essay: Environmental problems exist in most of the countries in the world. Due to the problems are not geologically isolated, such as water pollution and air pollution, it is necessary to solve in an multilateral way. Ċ Many people support global-cooperation to solve environmental problems. one reason is that pollutions are not geological limited.for instance, the water polluted in one country can flue into another country along with river or underground river. nations need to cooperate to pass some multilateral contract to solve these issues. Another reason is that some less developed countries have no enough technique or capital to deal with complex environmental problems, so they need other countries' help deal with some issues. Ċ Another voice of solve environmental problems by country alone also exist. firstly, if some pollution or ecological balance deterioration only appear in the nations which only care about economic benefits and don't try to stop this phenomenon spread,it is absolutely to solve this kind of issues by the countries alone. Secondly, if the pollution only have severe impact on one country's people and environment and they can't find the country who want to help them, they have no choice but to solve the pollute issue alone by themselves. For example, some inland countries produce many pollute water and draw it to inland lake, because the pollution sites are far away from other countries, so the other country have no necessary to interfere with the problems. Ċ In conclusion, solve the environmental by any person or country is welcome, but national cooperation is more important.

prompt: Some people say that government should focus on reducing environmental pollution and housing problems to help people prevent illness and disease. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
essay: It has been argued that the state should pay attention to environmental deterioration as well as accommodation related issues, in order to prevent illness and disease. I totally agree with the aforesaid notion. In this essay, I will discuss, in the first paragraph, how it would be feasible for the government with the support of levy paid by the community and in the second paragraph, the needfulness of huge infrastructure and a large number of efforts which are only within the reach of government fundings. Ċ To commence with, the taxes paid by citizens of a nation are crucially significant and this collective amount which directly goes into the government's bank account should be utilised for people's benefit. In other words, almost every nation collects legal taxes from their citizens such as property tax, water fine, housing contribution, business tax and taxes on the purchase of gold and allied elements. So, it is a moral responsibility of a country to look after the basic necessities such as a proper and livable environment along with housing facilities, especially for the people of the lower economic groups. For instance, in India, the city called 'Chandigarh' is the most well-organised city which is planned and monitored by authorities as far as environmental pollution and dwellings are concerned. As a result, the population in Chandigarh are more healthy and living in a spacious and clean atmosphere than the rest of the places. Ċ Secondly, to control pollution from various modalities and to provide decent living place needs extravagant resources, which are within a reach of any national fundings and it is not possible for a single individual or a group of people. To make it clear, I would like to exemplify that, air pollution can be controlled by applying stringent rules, to next water pollution can be controlled by providing excellent sewage control channels, then noise disturbances can be minimized by no horn policies or setting appropriate regulations, after that farming which is the largest industry providing food could be supported with infrastructure, knowledge and subsidies to farmers. Finally, the slum areas could be converted into neat and clean apartments with basic amenities like electricity and water. All these things can be only done by democracy as it requires huge money. Ċ In conclusion, a country should be responsible for providing a clean atmosphere and a healthy living place to their citizens. In my opinion, I believe that it is absolutely within the capacity of a nation and the taxes paid by people should be justified by giving them facilities.

prompt: Reading fiction such a short stories and novels, is more fun than watching motion pictures. Do you agree or disagree ?
essay: Nowadays, there are many sources of entertainment but most people prefer to read books, novels and watch movies for entertainment. A 'fiction' is anything that is invented or imagined Ċ by writers. i disagree to this statement and present my point of view in forthcoming paragraphs. Ċ There motion pictures gives relaxation to people because in modern-era life is too hard to live. Besides this, movies provide more entertainment and fun in the life of humans and by watching pictures people able to know about all colors of life within a less time. Moreover, movies gives positive impact on the life of a nation and it also reveals the importance in life. There are many videos responded for spiritual and moral values and it shows the high standard of social life. Furthermore, it is a good source of spending leisure time and by watching movies people can able to understand the value of their life. Ċ On the other hand, some people thinks that reading imaginary stories and novels is good for fun because by reading , the thinking of people becomes more stronger and creative. Moving further, people can develop their imaginary power by reading and it is a better way to know about the information. It also helps to improve vocabulary and it is more interactive medium than movies. Ċ In a nutshell, it can be stated that there are more people who prefer to watch movies rather-than reading books and novels.

prompt: Some people think that buildings such as flats and houses should be designed to last a long time. Others believe that it is more important to provide accommodation quickly and cheaply. Ċ Discuss both these views and give your opinion
essay: Nowadays, the population is increasing rapidly, thus more houses are needed. Some communities have enough money or excess to design or buy high-quality dwellings that last a long time. Others just want to find cheap accommodations to live in. I believe that the houses should be built carefully before using. Ċ On the one hand, almost all the properties were carefully designed by architects, so every unit has a different style. A good building is usually made from good raw materials to give the occupants a rather impressive feeling. But, good quality buildings often come at an expensive or reasonable price. Big investments result in comfortable living as well as the least problems. For example, if a host wants to design or buy a good quality house, the host and architects have to invest more time and money. Then the host will have a high-quality house to live in for a long time. Ċ On the other hand, some people want to stay in a cheap house which has a fast process of construction because they have low income or they just want a place where they can live, so cheap and quick accommodation is the best choice for them. Additionally, cheap and quick accommodation will provide them with more living options to choose from. Although the accommodation may be cramped or of poor quality, it provides low-income people with a safe dwelling. For instance, many students or workers stay in a cheap place and in my country (Vietnam) many buildings were erected to serve the poor people to live in. Ċ To sum up, I believe that having a high-quality house is likely to be better in the long-term. Cheap and quick accommodation is a better choice for people who have low income.

prompt: Games are as important for adults as they are for children. Do you agree or disagree with the above statement? Give your own opinion on the issue. Use your own experience or an example to support your idea. You should write at least 250 words
essay: Entertainment is necessary for all individuals to keep going in life. It can be in various forms and one of the types is playing. From my perspective, they are vital for both grown-ups and youngers. I completely agree with this notion and will be supporting this with my own experience. Ċ To begin with, primarily, playing sports is a great stress buster and it is obvious that in today's modern world there is hardly a human who is completely tension free. Hence, enjoying some games can help in diverting the mind from the regular routine. Secondly, there is always a child hidden in each soul, which needs some sort of fun, relaxation and appreciation. Moreover, playing with each other can help the person to showcase their hidden talent and getting prizes in competitive games can boost confidence. For instance, I was really fond of playing badminton in my school years but as time passed on I got accompanied by my studies, family and work-life which was making me depressed and stressed of regular schedule. Then got an opportunity to join a sports club nearby, I attend this regularly at the weekends and this one day keeps me going happily throughout the week. Ċ In addition to this, there can be numerous benefits of having recreation even at older ages. Firstly, a plethora of people are having sedentary jobs so if they choose to play athletics, this can be helpful to maintain a healthy lifestyle. Also worth mentioning, playing indoor games with family especially with children can really develop a healthy bond between them, consequently, parents can utilise this time to teach many things in a playful manner.
