In another way, daily spending of a couple of dollars to eat outside will end up with the huge amount in a week. However, that amount can be used to serve the whole family for the month in a hygienic environment. For instance, University of India has revealed that 80% of money can be saved by preparing dishes at home rather than going in cuisines. Ċ In conclusion, some people believe that eating in restaurants makes their lives easier and less stress, but it gives rise to lots of health problems and diseases, and it is more expensive in comparison to preparing dishes at home.

prompt: Every day, millions of tons of food are wasted all over the world. Why do you think this is happening? And how can we solve this problem? identifying the reasons of food waste
essay: In recent years, food waste has been becoming an emerging issue around the world. Given that the problem causes some significant environmental impacts, identifying the reasons is key to finding the solutions. Ċ There are a number of reasons why this issue exists. First, a large of leftovers are thrown out into the environment every day over the world. as a result, this food can not disintegrate themselves, which contribute to global warming. Second, since each type of food has its own expiry date, after this date, food become inedible, they need to be disposed of. In fact, if people try to eat this food, they would get food poisoning, which makes them have to go to the hospitals. Ċ However, there are also a variety of solutions to diminish this problem. First, governments and corporations can produce other productions from food waste to use for many other better purposes. For instance, some nations have taken steps to turn organic materials from food waste into biogas, generating electrical power at very low cost. Second, by raising awareness of people about the food usage, it can improve this problem. For instance, if a person knows how to use food properly, he or she can decrease the leftover. Ċ In conclusion, even though food waste seems serious in today' s world, there are various ways to recycle it. Raising awareness and generating energy can be two of the most useful ways to tackle food waste.

prompt: Do you agree or disagree with this statement? Vehicle technology is advancing rapidly and cars that drive themselves have already been developed. In the near future, most people will use driverless cars
essay: In this day and age, transportation play a vital role. With the development in technology, it is applied in automotive industry. Many numerous schemes are carried out in order to innovate for various users, especially in self-driving auto. From my perspective, i entirely agree that driverless cars will be used widespread in near future. Ċ Primarily, one of the major reasons which encourage the invention of driverless cars is the safety of passengers. It is believed that driver try to lie them in cabs fee. Besides, adults want to guarantee the carefulness of their childrens. For instance, people in my country especially parents always worried about their kids if they are alone with stranger, thus, the self-driving car is a effective solution to mitigate this problem. Moreover, using virtual driver contribute to reduce stress for many drivers when they have to concentrate for a long period. Ċ Additionally, traffic congestion is also eased in certain aspect. For the public transport, driverless cars will be arranged in a contemporary system which manage vehicle logically and rigorously. As a result, transportation can be distributed reasonably especially in rush-hour. Individuals who use own driverless cars have to pay a large charge to maintain the uninterrupted operation. Whereby, public transports are well-received because of the saving and the convenience. It is also followed by reducing CO2 emissions. Ċ In conclusion, it is indisputable fact that technology has creates a revolution in all fields of life. Driverless car is a ground-breaking in the auto manufacturing industry which can improve our life quality. The faster technology is advanced, the more driverless cars are developed.

prompt: television dominates the free-time of too many people. it can make people lazy and prevent them from socialising with others. do you agree or disagree?
essay: Television has been the most popular choice of many people to enjoy their leisure time. As a consequence, people have become more indolent and they are no longer socialising with others. I strongly agree with this opinion. Ċ To begin with, concerning the matter of individuals are getting lazier because of watching television excessively, it is a fact that if years ago people used to use their free time with outdoor activities, nowadays being in front of the screen is the most convenient choice for the majority. For example, people have a busy lifestyle and are unable to take the time to go out for any kind of entertainment. In addition, the innumerable channels and programmes available are very attractive. Therefore, people tend to be home watching their favourites programmes. This behaviour gives rise to laziness which might also lead to health problems. Ċ It must also be pointed out that television means being indoors most of the time and no social activity is involved. For instance, I remember that in my childhood I used to spend my free time doing sports or socialising with my friends. However, nowadays children are more and more addicted to television, which leads to them turning into introverts and losing social skills. Ċ In conclusion, taking these factors into consideration, I am inclined to believe that television has made people physically inactive as well as limited their social skills. Although other factors such as the Internet contribute to this behaviour, the popularity of television is one of the main causes.

prompt: Some people believe that studying abroad is important because it expands a person's knowledge and understanding of the world. Others feel that it is better to study at home because that is the best way to prepare for a career in the student's own country. Discuss both these views, and give your opinion.
essay: Overseas education has become widely renowned in today's globalized world. There are numerous reasons which motivate students to pursue their studies abroad. Although some argue that studying in a homeland can be more beneficial, I strongly believe in attaining a foreign degree will be more advantageous. This essay examines both the perspectives and concluded with my opinion. Ċ On one hand, pursuing overseas studies broaden the opportunities for one's career. Also, it is a chance for anyone to understand and mingle with different customs and cultures. To illustrate, my close friend visited the homeland after his first-year majors from an international university and his parents were elated by the way their son has transformed with good qualities such as patient listening and respecting others. Thus, it is evident that the more we get exposed to the world, the better we mature. Ċ While on the other hand, it is undeniable that it has some demerits as well, like a distraction from studies and get abused to drugs, etc. For example, one of my cousins has spoiled his career by addicting to consuming excessive alcohol. Consequently, he failed to complete his masters. Admittedly, this is alarming to see students ruining their career with such addictions. Ċ All in all, studying abroad has enormous merits provided that have to be followed by certain rules and regulations. However, it is up to us to decide whether to opt for the right direction or to get addicted to unwanted distractions. Finally, it is evident that following the right direction will lead to success though it is difficult to travel.

prompt: prevention is better than cure The prevention of health problems and illness is more important than treatment and medicine. Government funding should reflect this. To what extent do you agree?
essay: As for health issues, some people argue that prevention is better than cure, so governments should allocate more funds on preventive measures. Personally, I strongly agree with these views. Ċ One of the primary cause is that prevention is the only way to dealing with many diseases for which no cure has been found. The concept of prevention represents opportunities to avoid many diseases if we take proactive steps before a problem forms. For many uncurable diseases like tobacco-related cancer, patients have to count down the rest of their life when receiving the result of a cancer diagnosis. In this regard, research shows that smoking makes cancers more likely, so doctors urge people to stop is an indispensable step to help them prevent it. Thus, perhaps prevention plays more significant impacts for many incurable diseases. Ċ Apart from the argument above, I also believe that it is realistic that government spend more funds on the prevention than the cure. Medical system using public funding is impossible to afford all people's demands concerning treatment and medicine. It is costly to buy effective drugs, and facilities and equipment also come at a massive cost to the government. By contrast, it is manifestly cheap that governments spend money on launching campaigns to encourage a healthy lifestyle, including a balanced diet and regular exercise. So there are manifested benefits to government spending on prevention. Ċ In conclusion, I would like to reiterate that influence by prevention is higher than cure. Therefore, there are reasonable arguments that require more funs on the prevention.

prompt: some people believe that the internet has brought people closer together by making world smaller. others disagree, claiming that the internet has made people and communities more isolated because they no longer need to leave home and interact with others. Ċ Discuss both the view and give your opinion.
essay: Development of technology has changed human lives. The internet is one of the most innovative inventions of telecommunication. At the viewpoint, of some people, the internet has brought people closer, while others are of diverse opinion. Before presenting my view, I intend to examine both sides of the argument. Ċ Advocates of the web suggest that, it has managed to bring the citizens of the world closer by providing several means of communication. Not only, has it made it feasible for friends and family members to connect with each other conveniently, but also, has made it cheaper. To cite an example, thanks to the net, one can chat or video call with anyone, residing in any part of the world, merely through clicking a button.In addition to this, it has enabled businesses, to operate globally through websites, which has brought professionals closer. For instance, there are numerous online sites, where one can find a pro in any field ranging from a doctor to a lawyer. Ċ On the other hand, the cyberspace has made the society antisocial. More and more human beings today, prefer online tools to maintain relationships with pals, instead of meeting face to face. Furthermore, this trend has resulted in people suffering from mental disorders such as anxiety and depression, due to isolation as well as loneliness. An illustration of this is, a survey conducted by WHO in 2015, depicted that the number mental health patients have been surging up, since the advent of socialising apps. Ċ To conclude, the web has provided paths, for societies, all round the planet to stay connected. However, it has administered solitude among people too. In my opinion, if proper precautions are taken, it can prove to be a boon for the humanity, and help convert the earth into a global village.

prompt: Healthy food education, is it necessary? Scientists agree that people are damaging their health by eating too much junk food. Some people think that the answer to this problem is to educate people. Others think education will not work. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: It is believed that people are suffering from loads of health-related issues because of excessive consumption of unhealthy food. Some people hold the thought that education should take responsibility for this phenomenon while others have little faith in this solution. This essay contends that education is such an applicable solution, and it will discuss both points of view. Ċ On the one hand, educating people and raising their awareness towards the hazard of unwholesome food are believed to yield some auspicious outcomes. Firstly, general education can provide people with adequate knowledge of nutrition and food safety. As a result, people would have the competence to distinguish between domestic commodities and junk food which contain lots of detrimental substances. Secondly, knowledge of health-related issues seems beneficial to encourage healthy habits. People would have a nourishing diet if they have opportunities to take part in some extracurricular activities like cooking with healthy ingredients. Ċ On the other hand, it is suspicious that health education is not a one-size-fits-all solution because of the following reasons. To begin with, nobody can deny that junk food has its own good characteristics. For instance, hamburgers or pizzas are considered the best choices for their convenience and delicious tastes while it seems to be time-consuming to prepare for a proper nutritious meal. In addition, some people who experience financial difficulties find it difficult to afford a three-course meal; therefore, they eat junk food on a daily basis despite being aware of its potential consequences. Ċ In conclusion, there are many different opinions about whether education could help to reduce people's consumption of fast food. In my opinion, I do believe that education can be a worthwhile measure with careful consideration of other impediments.

prompt: Many young people choose to take a year out between finishing school and starting university in order to gain work experience or to travel. The experience of non-academic life this offers benefits the individual when they return to education. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is true that nowadays there are some youths who decide to take a gap year between their school and university studies to travel around or work somewhere. In my opinion, there is no hesitation that living those types of experiences has a positive impact and will benefit them while coming back to education life. Ċ On one hand, gaining some work experience before going to university can make a difference as will undoubtedly broaden your mind thus having a wider perspective when making decisions. Moreover, the possibility to meet new people and either improve or learn new skills is absolutely open-up within this scenario. For example, the fact of going to work on a farm will push the individual into the countryside lifestyle where values such as discipline, respect and effort are essential. As a consequence, it is simply true that a need to thrive and keep forward to better adapt yourself to the unknown environment will urge. Ċ On the other hand, in my view, travelling abroad certainly enhance creativity and creates different neural pathways. By visiting different countries, a wide range of cultural information can be provided, hence gaining educational knowledge which will induce new brain connections. For instance, visiting another country and meeting someone who brings us closer to local food and nutrition, could potentially unblock our aim to discover more tastes and nutritional properties. Overall, all these experiences may be really practical to acknowledge your current interests. Ċ To conclude, I think coming to a decision on how the future should be managed by the age of eighteen might be quite tough. This is why while finishing school many people feel very lost as they do not know what studies fit them better and consequently end up choosing something in which they are not really interested . Being aware of the existence of these other possibilities can be helpful for clarifying ideas.

prompt: Over consuming sugar is unhealthy. Some people think that governments should take responsibility to control it. Others think that individuals should take responsibility for sugar intake. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Eating carbohydrate in an amount more than necessary is not healthy. According to a few individuals, the state should take care of this matter.While, the rest think that people should take control of their own sugar consumption. In my opinion, I believe that everyone should keep a track of their carbohydrate intake. However, this essay will discuss both views. Ċ To begin with, the excess amount of sweetness in food items harms our energy. Likewise, if anyone is practicing this, then he is at a risk of serious well-being problems relating to heart and moreover, it leads to premature aging. Therefore, it is very important to limit sugar going inside our body. For instance, a diabetic patient should monitor and curb the carbohydrate and carbohydrates he is including in his diet and he should know the consequences of not doing so. Ċ Contrastingly, the government should also take the initiative in this matter in order to save the fitness of its citizens. Since it has the power to reach a mass crowd, it should organise awareness campaigns to create a sense among people regarding this issue. This should be done often in order to create a sense of awareness among a maximum number. For example, they can organise health programs to educate people about nutrition and obesity and the dangers it can cause. Ċ To conclude, I opine that although government should take measures to decrease the usage of this substance, I believe that it is self duty to eat well and maintain the soundness of the body.

prompt: Internet or printed news? Some people think that in the future, printed newspaper will still be the most important source of news. However, others think that news provided on the Internet will play the most important role. Discuss both views and give your opinions.
essay: These days, opinions differ as to whether Internet or printed news will be the most crucial source of news. Some people believe printed format will retain its significance, while others think it will gradually be replaced by online news. From my standpoint, I tend to agree with the latter. Ċ It is understandable why people believe in the importance of printed format. The publishing industry has existed for hundreds of years employing millions of personnels all around the world. It is often depicted as "too big to fall" as the failure of such may leave some detrimental effects on any national economy. Besides, reading daily newspaper has so long been established as a die-hard habit for some. Such people adhere to the traditional form of news as they gain the distinctive joice flipping through the pages. Ċ However, I strongly believe it's the online news that makes the future of journalism. The speed of Internet is undeniably faster than ever before, facilitating live-stream coverage of sport events and music concerts. Moreover, the online multimedia platform equips journalists with ample ways to report news such as: infographics, animated videos or interactive discussion. Those creative methods can never be feasible on a printed format. Another reason to reinforce to the growth of online news is our over-reliant on the Internet. It is not an exxageration to say that we have been so inexorably linked to the Internet that it is hard to live without it. Online articles, news that spread through various platform of the Internet, will surely benefit from this trend. Ċ In conclusion, although there are evidences to suggest traditional newspaper is still favoured, I strongly believe online format will be the most important source of news in the future.

prompt: Q. Not enough students around the world choose to study science subjects at university. What are the reasons for this? What impacts does this issue have on society?
essay: Amidst an overwhelming array of hundreds of programs in university, it is noticeable that just a small proportion of students would like to pursue a science degree. This essay will highlight the contributing factors as well as the consequences of this trend posed to society in the coming future. Ċ Not like a career-oriented degree, studying science is considered as an interest without a clear end goal. It is undeniable that many graduates with business or engineering-related degree are more capable of securing a job with a competitive salary and a better career development. Graduates from Science School, however, are often struggling to land a job upon graduation. For example, there is only a limited range of jobs with low starting salary for biology students such as research assistant and laboratory assistant. This may affect the willingness of students to choose a subject with a higher competitive edge. Secondly, lack of support to the industry is another reason behind. There is no denying the fact that not enough resources and money have been allocated from the government to the science field in order to support several researches. Consequently, this may trigger many talents to lose interest in joining or staying in the field. Ċ The results of getting not enough scientists are tremendous, not only put our future generation in jeopardy, but also hinder the discovery of several scientific theories. The number of scientists may drop significantly and the new inventions fall correspondingly. It is worth mentioning that the swift development of society requires the assistant of technology, which highlight the importance of presence of scientists. Artificial Intelligence, for instance, is certainly essential to reduce the cost of operation in some social activities. Ċ To put it in a nutshell, I pen down saying that limited resources distribution to science development and money-orientated society are the main causes of this phenomenon, which might lead to a negative result in the society.

prompt: Many of the world's children consume far too much unhealthy food. What are the causes of this problem and what can be done to solve it?
essay: Unhealthy food consuming among children is a tragedy of the present age. The problem is best explained by parents' influences and the development of food industries, but can be alleviated by changing children's attitudes toward food and placing tight regulations on junk food marketing. Ċ It is difficult to argue with the idea that parents play a strong role in their children's eating habits. Due to work circumstances, people routinely resort to unhealthy eating options. Parents are more likely to skip cooking family meals and feed their children with take-out meals or prepared entrees. As a result, children follow their parents' patterns. Another reason for children yearning for junk food is excessive pampering by the parents and always allowing children to have their ways in consuming junk food. Ċ Junk food advertising is also a culprit for the obesity and bad eating diets among children. As food companies spend more to promote their food on social media, children tend to see more food ads. The main issue of most viewing junk food ads is that it depicts junk food in a delicious and tantalizing form which acts as boosters for increasing appetite for them. Ċ The best way to deal with the regrettable situation at hand is to train children about food and their eating habits. If children are taught properly, they are more likely to make healthy food choices and minimize the intake of junk food themselves as well. Parents also need to try cooking regularly at home and serving home-made meals. Another measure is that a ban on junk food during peak children's viewing times should be applied.

prompt: Some teachers prefer to record the lecture in advance so that students can familiarize themselves with it first, and practice what they have learned from the lecture in the class. Do you consider this is a good way to teach?
essay: In contemporary, it is convenient for modern people to use techniques to work. The professors and teachers also benefit from advanced technology. So some of the earnest teachers would like to help students preview their classes before starting. Using some ways to benefit students to study from the videos they record. However, in my perspective, I don't think it is effective for most of the students in school. Ċ To begin with, it is impractical for all the students to watch the previewing lecture before classes. If only some of the students have taken the previewed videos, the class' students will have a degree gap after the class started. The more classes they take, the bigger the gap gets. A good course and a good teacher demand to make the whole class to get a better level after the course ends up. Ċ Furthermore, it is unnecessary to put more pressure on the students' backs. Nowadays, students get a lot of courses and homework from school. Most of the teachers put much pressure on them. They study in school and doing homework after school. Giving an extra video lecture for homework is going to take the leisure time they merely have. Ċ By the way, if the students are interested in the subject they study, they would like to surf the information on the internet. It is convenient for teachers to teach students with computers. Hence, it is also comfortably for students to learning information with computers. On the other hand, modern students are "technology natives." Morden students usually use "Google" to replace many sides of teachers. Ċ In light of the above arguments, I believe that is needless for teachers to record the lecture before class. It is neither efficient for students nor a good way for students to learn.

prompt: Nowadays communication technology is developing rapidly; people communicate in different ways. Is it a positive or negative development? Give your opinion and examples from your own experience.
essay: Technology gives us a great deal of chance to communicate with people in various ways. Some people believe that modern devices have many demerits, while others have positive opinion about new ways to communicate with each others. Both situations have their own pros and cons which I shall discuss in this essay. Ċ To begin with, technology provides many gadgets to communicate. By increasing the use of computers, many software programs are developed to chat. People can see and speak with each other simultaneously. This situation increases many flexibility to communicate, for example many classes can be online, therefore, students and teachers do not have to be in the same places. Also, emerging mobiles helps people to connect without considering where they are. People can send messages to friends and families in different places including at work places, at cars or even at street. Ċ On the other hand, using electrical devices decreases face- to - face communication. In the past when people wanted to speak to each other, they had to go to other houses or places where they could visit others. However, these days individuals can stay their home and use electrical gadgets to say hello. What is more, using new electrical devices reduces people's attention to others who are around them. The tendency to speak with individuals who stay in the same places decreases considerably, since people use mobiles or ipads to speak with own friends. In restaurants or public transportations, I have seen many teenagers or adults speak by their cell phones all the time. Ċ In conclusion, technology helps people to communicate with each other very easily. audio and video communications become more popular among different people.

prompt: Some people think that fittest and strongest individual and team can achieve success in sports, while others believe that success depends on mental attitude. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: In the modern world, many people are reckoned to think that the key element of success is a mental attitude, while others feel that the physical strength and well-being can lead to the prosperity. After pondering this phenomenon, I believe that the balance between the mental well-being and physical training can lead to the success. Ċ On the one hand, it is true that being strong is crucial for the sportsmen and sportswomen. In this regard, they should be well prepared to become a champion or a winner. Furthermore, many types of sports, such as wrestling, martial arts and taekwondo, require being physically strong and durable. To illustrate, ordinary people cannot run for 3 km in 12 minutes, and they should train every day in order to get this accomplished. Ċ On the other hand, the key ingredient of prosperity is mental health. In this case, sportsmen should know how to beat their opponents and counterparts. That is to say, they should plan their every step in advance. Moreover, internal health is essential for being a champion in many types of sports such as boxing, jogging and swimming. To illustrate, these kinds of sports have many emotional moments and situations. Accordingly, the people should keep their emotion in such kinds of situations in order to not show their weaknesses. Ċ In conclusion, although many people tend to think that the fittest and strongest individual can be a winner, others feel that the internal health is vital for being a champion. However, in my opinion, I believe that the people should be efficient and productive in order to beat their opponents.

prompt: One of the prime times for advertising on TV is when children get back from school. Some people think that advertisements aimed at children should not be allowed. What is your opinion?
essay: Advertisements play a major role in influencing the buying decisions of customers. Most of these ads are aired in the evenings when children are back from school and sitting in front of the television. Some people opine that commercials targeting young kids should be banned. Therefore, I agree with this view to a great extent because in my opinion, excessively promotional ads have a devastating effect on children. Ċ Firstly, children are easily manipulated by the adverts which take them to the virtual world. As a result, which coax them to purchase products that are not always worth their money. For example, Since 2010, toys of the Star Wars series are very popular among teenagers and sales of these toys are very high in the market. Secondly, the advertisements are delivered in such a way that children start pestering their parents to buy those products. For instance, the fast food chain McDonald’s promote their Ads to attract more and more teenagers to eat fast food which is not good for health because it contains high levels of fats and cholesterol which cause obesity and diabetes in children.Thus, these adverts should not be allowed to be shown in mass media Ċ Thirdly, another reason to restrict ads is that they may even put the lives of children at risk. In other words, Children imitate the dangerous stunts performed by celebrities in commercials and often lose their life or cause themselves serious injuries because they are not aware of the consequences. Take, for example, a report conducted by the US, stated that these adverts are subconsciously shaping our shopping habits very badly. To finish, Adverts that target children, be it on TV, billboards or the internet, should be completely banned. Ċ To conclude, most ads targeting children are overly promotional and have a negative impact on children. Hence the government must ensure that they are not aired during prime time.

prompt: Education is not a luxury but a basic human righ and as such should be free for everyone irrespective of personal wealth. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is true that education is not necessarily a luxury thing ,however, the space of free education should provide for all humans around the world without considering personal wealth. From my point of ,view, I strongly agree with this idea. Ċ Firstly one of the conspicuous reasons for this argument is to create appropriate opportunities for all people to receive a high-quality free education. For example countries such as Germany that have done this are often regarded by other countries. Education for all degrees is free in this country irrespective of personal wealth,economic situation and their ethnic. This would create an equal occasion for humans to reach their goals and follow their choices. This makes it clear that free education and courses are essential means to accomplish humans their basic rights. Ċ Secondly ,another significant reason for this is increasing the number of people who are literate. For instance ,when education has been free for all humans in a country the statistics of those who decide to continue their education in universities has been jumping. This would cause a dramatic advance in the worldwide literacy rate in comparison to countries that receive tuition fees. It becomes apparent that there is no reason to receive money for providing complimentary education for people. This would definitely be crucial to provide an equal opportunity education for all of the humans around the world. Ċ To summarise ,I completely believe that education is a fundamental right for all people who live in the world and should be free for the poor and rich. It is predicted that the positive effects of the debate on free education will always be greater than the adverse effects.

prompt: Due to the development of the internet, public libraries are no longer necessary. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is argued that since the digital technologies has developed so fast that public libraries are completely redundant. I totally disagree with that point of view because public libraries are always reliable source of information and socially important for every community Ċ The First reason why public libraries are vital that it is reliable. It is irrefutable that as digital technologies are becoming advanced, more and more people became dependent on the websites which made easier the way of people’s life. Online libraries are not exception that most people use to read e-books not only to get entertained, but also for the research of their academic purposes. However, online resources cannot be used as reliable source this is because one may get unreliable data which was incorrect as the online websites are not able to filter false info, but public libraries can store the most reliable tip since the publication of books are checked thoroughly by publishers which make them more reliable than the modern web resources. As an example, the book which is called “The Lord of the Flies” by William Golding was rejected 21 times before it had been published. Hence, it seems to me that public libraries are still essential to be preserved. Ċ The second reason is that public libraries provides communication. These days the ubiquity of online platforms, particularly, social networking sites is prone to take people’s precious time, which may eventually lead to isolation from the society. While, Public libraries serve as a provision of gathering place for everyone in person. What I mean here is that if citizens interact with each other who have the same interests, they will have a sense of community. Furthermore, it is likely that the youth can improve their social skills which will definitely help them this virtue to apply for a job by attending to the libraries instead of spending their whole time on the online platform. For instance, Bill Gates have read more than 100 books in the library by dint of attending to the libraries. Thus, it does make sense to have libraries. Ċ In conclusion, Although there are some people who are of the opinion that libraries are not needed, I believe that libraries are an essential asset to provide resources which are trustworthy and to make people more sociable. Hence, It is highly advisable to keep libraries open to public.

prompt: Advocating the school system Some people feel that boarding schools are an excellent opinion for children, while others disagree for a number of reasons. consider both sides and reach a conclusion
essay: Boarding schools have been popular among many countries since the past. there have existed endless comments on whether this kind of school is the ideal choice for students. this essay will debate both sides of this topic and reach a concluding view. Ċ Advocates of this school system would argue that this is an excellent paradigm for children to comprehensively develop. Obviously, living with peers and without parents can train kids into self-reliant, independent, confident and sociable civilians who can manage things by themselves in most situations in life as well as have a wide net of friends and better communication skill. In addition, this can also benefit busy parents having a little amount of time for their families. Saving time driving kids from home to school and back, preparing quality meals and helping kids out with loads of homework can exemplify this advantage. Ċ In contrast, there are reasons to disapprove of this syllabus. Away from family has never been easy, even with adults, let alone the premature. Without parental guidance and surveillance, children can suffer from insufficient nutriented dietary plan, as well as some can be spoiled by heinous people provoking them to take drugs, alcohol and neglect their study. Combined with peer pressure and stress gained from studying, students may find it desparate and hold a pessimistic view about life. Ċ In conclusion, although boarding school forms a brilliant environment for children's development and bring several benefits to busy parents, it appears that this school system's drawbacks outweigh its advantages as students may be disoriented during their school years.

prompt: Many people make friends through social sites and chat rooms. Others believe that it is not a good idea to make friends without meeting them face to face. Do you agree or disagree with this statement? Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Communication through the internet has become an essential part of our lives. It is common to have a pen-friend living in another country without even meeting them. A segment of society is convinced that these kinds of friendships can lead to adverse consequences. Others, however, believe the opposite. The following paragraphs will analyze both views and explain my support of the latter view. Ċ The internet makes it possible to find like-minded people and build lasting relationships. More specifically, in online group chats of certain topics, individuals have more chances to meet someone who shares their interests rather than at the workplace. Because the internet connects people from all around the world. As a result of communicating with like-minded people, individuals will less likely fall into depression and feel lonely. Moreover, it is a good opportunity for disabled people to make friends. Later, people engaged in these kinds of relationships can meet each other and become best friends or even a couple. For instance, my friend met her husband on the internet 3 years before meeting him in person. Ċ On the negative side, people are different, some may have bad intentions. For example, individuals may become victims of cyberbullying, identity or personal information theft, and etc. It is difficult to identify the bad intentions of others without seeing them. Nevertheless, I believe that vigilance and intelligence can effectively help to tackle this issue. Therefore, people should take basic precocious measures to ensure their financial, mental and physical safety. Ċ To conclude, although making friends online has some potential threats, it gives more opportunities to meet good people from other countries. People should be cautious.

prompt: Some people believe that it is a good idea that older people continue to work if it is possible for them to do. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Many argue that it is better if senior citizens continue to employ themselves even after the retirement age if they are capable of it. I completely agree with this opinion and think that this will aid to the national income of the nation and elderly people will have enough funds to spend on their well-being and earn living. Ċ Firstly, if the old community performance even in their old age, they will contribute to the economic growth of the country by way of paying taxes. For example, they will be a less burden on the government and also on their families as they can look after themselves with the salaries they will earn. Not only that, the expert work advice helps the new employees to learn their job. Therefore, they are the total asset to the country. Ċ Secondly, when people reach their retirement age, they undergo stress and become emotional. However, continuing to work even after a certain age keeps their mind busy and help them to forget their worries. A survey conducted by Indian Aaj tak revealed that individuals who do not leave jobs after 65 years of age have a high life expectancy than the ones who resign their job at retirement age. Hence keeping themselves busy at work leads to the advantage of good health and happiness in elderly people's lives. Ċ To conclude, it depends on several factors whether a person wants to continue working or wants to spend time with families at an older age. From my perspective, I strongly feel that it's the best option for older people to carry on working if they have the ability to do so. If this trend goes on then both the elderly and society will benefit from this.

prompt: Research has shown that the transportation of products and people are the main source of pollution. Some people believe the Government should be in charge of this, while others believe it is the fault of individuals. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: According to studies, the primary source of pollution is the transportation of goods and people. While some believe the government should be in charge, others consider that it is the responsibility of individuals. In this essay, I will discuss both views and state my opinion. Ċ On the one hand, people who put the blame on the government may cite the carelessness in collecting data on how polluted the environment is due to all kinds of transportation as the main reason. Indeed, by collecting and publicizing it, the citizens can be aware of the risk that the entire nation has to face. Additionally, when analyzing the statistics of pollution, the government can also come up with proper strategies. For instance, if there is a great amount of carbon dioxide released into the air, then a reduction in vehicles is required. Ċ On the other hand, although it is partly the fault of the government, it is undeniable that this escalating issue is closely related to individual consciousness. Specifically, the government’s remedies will be useless without the coordination of people, which means that the people must follow the government’s lead in order to address this problem. Take Japan as a prime example, when the encouragement of using public transport came into effect, a majority of citizens then took the buses and subways in lieu of private vehicles. Consequently, Japan is now a country with the lowest emission in the world. Ċ In conclusion, there is no doubt the government plays a crucial role in solving the environmental pollution problems. However, the population’s consciousness is also equally pivotal.

prompt: There are many people who go to live in different countries. To what extent should people be allowed to move freely between countries and live where they choose? What are the benefits and drawbacks of this? Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: There is currently a contentious argument over whether immigrants should be permitted to shift between different nations with no restrictions. In this essay, I will examine some advantages related to this as spreading cultural diversity as well as the downsides like lack of safety. Then I will explain why I believe that country immigration restrictions should be tightened. Ċ Admittedly, to accept any individual to a particular country helps to flourish its diversity. Accordingly to some governments having open immigration politics make their peoples' average age raises. Therefore, there being no restrictions to immigrants can allow these countries to develop themselves, thereby, they could take advantage of this subject. For instance, countries that have the majority of ageing people like Italy, Spain and suchlike would be able to stand for their next generations. Ċ On the other hand, there is a drawback that far outweighs any benefit which is peoples' safety. Some countries had already tried this measure of the open border to anyone which did not end well. Thus, when a nation accepts anyone to land across the border without previous background checking it would certainly open doors to terrorism or international diseases. To illustrate, most cases os terrorism around the world in the last decades were triggered by individuals in countries with low restrictions as France, Italy and German. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that any country should have strict regulations when it comes to accepting people from other countries, especially in regards to immigrants mostly because of the country safe. However, it is also a truism to say that diversity helps different nations to survive in the years to come.

prompt: Some people think modern technology is making people more sociable while others think that real life interaction is better. Discuss both views and give your opinion. social interaction switch from real to virtual world
essay: Nowadays people started to switch their social interaction from real world to virtual world, which have impacted the way we socialize with each other. Ċ First of all, technology began to create social virtual platforms for people to communicate and exchange information rapidly. By interacting with persons all around the world in one second, virtual social networks started to be more effective and easier to use. However, real-world social life is practical in the side of effectiveness and time managing, for example, if I want to ask the boss to clarify the new project for me, I will easily call him and ask him. Scientifically speaking, a research paper published in Harvard University's press shows that 90% of worker choose email to talk with their partener rather than real life communication. In conclusion, technology started to make us more close to each other, and makes the social interaction faster. Ċ Secondly, real life social interaction is fruitful in the level of human contact, which means, when we go outside and talk to people, friends or family, we are creating a deep social link with other. Moreover, Taking in mind that a huge part of our communication in nonverbal, real human interaction is more powerful because it makes us understand and feel each other deeply. Furthermore, researchers suggest that a strong social network provide us with a healthy relationships, which strongly makes our life longer by making us more and more happier. Ċ In my opinion, I feel that healthy life matters. Real social interaction makes us more sociable and strongly connected with each other.

prompt: Capital punishment (the death penalty) is necessary in order to control the amount of violent crimes in society. To what extent do you agree or disagree ? Inhumane and Absurd Capital Punishment
essay: Capital punishment is a controversial debate in many countries. In a world where brutal crimes need to be deterred, it may be true that the death penalty is an efficient retribution to admonish the violence. However, as the society grows, human rights become more highly respected, "murdering" criminals is therefore immoral and hard to accept. Ċ First of all, it is recognized that every human being has the right to live and no authority is empowered to deprive one of life. Although what criminals cause to the society, specifically to the victims, is indeed significantly offensive, they are humans and their lives need to be valued. In addition, execution does not resolve the consequences of crime, not to mention it could put the criminal's family through hardship while the pain of the victim's kin is never to be consoled. Ċ Secondly, capital punishment is certainly not the only option to control the amount of crimes, life imprisonment is just as effective by detaining the criminals in prison for the rest of their lives. Moreover, in terms of punishment, living a miserable life with restriction to the world outside and sustaining the feeling of guilt every day in a dark bounded room are much more obsessing than being killed right away. Ċ The third reason why the death penalty should be banned is the chance that innocent people are wrongly convicted. Juries are also humans, they may lack of discretion. Thus, many people are executed for the crime they did not commit, which leads to a question of fairness in judicial system. Ċ In conclusion, although capital punishment presents an extreme warning to the community, I firmly object to it because it is absurd and inhumane. Furthermore, it can be replaced by a life sentence.

prompt: Although most people are richer than in the past, modern life seems very stressful, and the number of people suffering from stress is at record levels. Ċ What are the main causes of stress in modern life, and how could stress be reduced?
essay: Stress is a ubiquitous phenomenon in today's society and everyone suffers through it as compared to the past, even people are more affluent in these days thenconjunction used in comparativesthan the past, still their lives are too complicated. An unexpected increase in individual's desires, expectations and busy lifestyle are the primary causes. By utilising time and keep unwanted desires in control could be the main solutions of this unfortunate dilemma. The essay will further discuss both facets of a proposal with appropriate examples reaching to a logical conclusion. Ċ To begin with, our enhanced desires are the main cause of it in our life because when a person starts thinking to achieve more goals to be wealthy, after that he or she start putting burden on their mind, and that excruciating pressure could cause an intense strain. Additionally a busy daily routine generates the stressful situation too in one's life, while working for long hours one would not spare a time for exercise that creates a physical and emotional burden. These both reasons are interrelated to each other. While focusing on desires a person forgets to take care of their self. For example, according to various studies, our ancestors hunting for food only and their lifespans have been usually longer and without any types of diseases, but in today's era, people run behind a plethora of things, that made their lives indirectly worse. Ċ On the other hand, there are lots of possible solutions of it, first of all persons should focus on necessary and approachable things, by doing it their mind releases an extra tension. However, they should allocate their time for an exercise to feel fresh and energetic for a whole day. Even though extra curriculum activities can reduce the pressure from one's mind and finally, a person should meditate every day because it mitigate the atrocious effect of stress from the brain. For instance, a study conducted in the UK, showed that people tend to be healthier by exercising and meditating each day, other than, people who are not doing any kinds of exercises. Ċ In conclusion, it is absolutely true that modern growth brings more stress for humans that produce horrible Troma, but still, it depends on us too that how we manage things to be stress free and relax. Therefore, various solutions exist to ameliorate these drawbacks, nevertheless an indefinite solution yet to be found.

prompt: Too many old historic buildings are in danger and destroyed in many countries. What are the main reason? How to protect them?
essay: As the development of modernization, ancient buildings are gradually disappearing around the world. They were the places where containing stories in the past. However, number of reasons that lead to people destroy those historic buildings. Ċ First of all, historic buildings are not safe for people live in anymore. The frame of ancient buildings could be corrupted by various weathers, mice or worms. Especially for those wooden stairs in old buildings, they were weak when people step on the wooden pieces. In additionally, historic buildings rarely have fire alarm system. Fire event is most likely happening in these high risk buildings. Ċ Moreover, ancient buildings are obstacles in the development of modern cities. There is a continuous mitigation of urban planning. Roads are broaden due to the significant increase of car uses. It is a pity that ancient buildings have been sacrificed in human development. Ċ Nevertheless, people are struggling to preserve old buildings and there are numerous ways to protect them. Regularly maintaining the ancient buildings is a conserve strategy to extend the life-time of historic building. Furthermore, exterior appearance of building can stay old-fashioned while interior structure is changing. Such as State Library of Victoria has been refurnished only inside of the building. Fire alarm system is placed in this ancient building. It is still a popular landmark that attract thousands of tourists and local residents to visit everyday. Ċ In conclusion, historic buildings are precious legacy to human development. Although it sometimes hinder the urban development, there are numerous of alternative solutions to protect historic buildings.

prompt: i really did hard for making this kind of structure for my essay. Any how sorry to say but 14th of december is my test for Ielts I have confirmed the date. Could you give me Bands score for this essay? Does Advertising Force People to Buy Things They Don't Need?
essay: Nowadays, many famous things have been selling out just because of the advertisement, even there are such kind of things included which is not necessary for the society, this writing will examine the both side of the issue, Ċ I can endorse my proposition with the help of the following reasons that, well known equipment sales have been went up recent years with the help of the advertisement. There is no doubt advertisers mostly attack on the children and then children put pressure on parents to buy them things. For example, burger, biscuit and chocolates have reached at the high stage of the selling, behind of this phenomenon there is a hand of the expert advertisers as well as they make some attractive adds and then show it on the television. Ċ On the other hand, some unwanted and vulnerable things are also part of the famous sales in the market. Fore example, there are some local or international companies in the market those are investing million dollars for advertise their clothes, laptops,mobile phones and more other things by posting on the roads and using the internet websites. Ċ Furthermore, such as companies use the well known and successful people to make the add. For example, they use actors, actresses for the advertisement. Ċ So eventually, in the light of the above stated fact we reach to a concrete and conclusive paragraph by saying that, there is a big hand of the advertisement behind of the unnecessary things, and in my opinion I advertiser can use this tool but not for faq or incredible things.

prompt: Eating a balanced diet is the most important factor for a healthy life. To what extent do you agree? every individual should develop a habit of eating healthy
essay: Our eating habits greatly affect our lifestyle. It is said, that for a healthy life eating a balanced food is crucial. In my view, negligence in eating can lead to health problems and diseases, which ultimately badly affects the lifestyle of people. Ċ Undoubtedly, trend of eating fast food is profoundly prevailing these days. Especially youngsters are eating more junk food, which leads to non-curable diseases such as obesity, hypertension and diabetes. This is because youngsters prevent themselves from the hassle of cooking. Moreover, due to busy lifestyle, people do not have time for cooking and they do not even take proper meals, which, therefore, is immensely affecting them by making them weak and deficient of important nutrients. Hence, due to poor diet habits people are becoming prone to unhealthy conditions and diseases. Ċ Admittedly, consuming fresh, nutrient rich and healthy food makes an individual healthy and he can obviously lead a better lifestyle as compare to people following bad eating habits. Ċ For instance, a person eating food containing all essential nutrients such as carbohydrates, fats and proteins would definitely be getting adequate nutrition and will be less likely to suffer from disease conditions. In addition, he will stay active and healthy. So balanced food is vital as it aids to maintain a healthy life. Ċ In conclusion, People eating food with inadequate nutrients are at greater risk of carrying diseases while individuals consuming healthy food with equal proportions of necessary nutrients can enjoy a healthy life. Therefore, I totally agree with the fact that every individual should develop a habit of eating a balanced diet as it guarantees you a better life.

prompt: Recently published figures show that the wildlife population around the world has decreased by around fifty percent over the last fifty years. What can we do to help protect the wildlife around the world? faunae and florae population have been decreasing
essay: Wildlife population has been diminishing around fifty percent, according to recent public research, in comparison to the last fifty years. In order to secure animal species, plants, fungi or other organisms in an enormous scales, the municipal government ought to publish hunting and fishing law as well as encourage people to plant more trees and forests to prevent the wildlife from being detrimental. Ċ Illegal hunting and fishing should have been strictly monitoring, by issuing the law to which it pertains. It might thwart smugglers from smuggling products abroad lawlessly because this must have lead to fatalistic consequences, the wildlife population diminishing. Currently, some countries are conducting this law such as Canada, the US, or many Europe countries. Individuals who violate the law, are withdrew hunting or fishing license and banned from those activities for a few years. Ċ Besides, environment recreation is believed to have been an immediate solution so that plenty of wildlife's homes could be saved sufficiently because forests and trees are the home base for most animals and plants. Nature disasters such as volcano eruption, flooding, fire, or human activities including farming, demolish the home of fauna and flora ubiquitously. These species lost their homes and were unable to survive which triggers the declining of population scales, as an inevitable result. Hence, planning to grow forests, trees, and plants, at which it was devastated, are a contemporary paramount method. Ċ In conclusion, wild faunae and florae population have been decreasing every year, so humans should protect it strictly by monitoring a law to prevent hunting and fishing illegally and build many forests and plants.

prompt: There is a such tendency in the world that wealthier nations aids to poorer and underdeveloped nations as financial ,food,educational aids etc...In the times of crises ,revolutions and dissatisfaction the question always arises that why do rich countries not help the poor? Why do they not share their wealth to make the world a better place to live?
essay: Citizens of both wealthy nations and poorer nations are human beings and we are all living together in one world so we cannot be careless about the situation of people in poor countries. In a globalizing world all nations become more dependent on each other.Problems which have occurred in poorer countries are spreaded and influence to others and this in turn becomes a more global problem.Such humanitarian aids prevent mass migrations and future civil wars from this part of world. Ċ At the same time supported countries may be turn to one of the biggest consumer of wealthier nations .This in turn can be considered as strategical aid. Ċ On the other hand these supported countries must seek ways for development and become independent from other countries' money.For instance: Austria and Japan had been financed after World War Second for reconstruction and development of destroyed countries under the Europian Recovery Program which had been created by the government of USA and better known as the Marshall plan.In the result of these countries' determination , at present, they are well- developed countries . Ċ All facts considered,I think that wealthier nations should help poorer nations but only by letting them help themselves. Teach them how to grow crops instead of just giving them food, show them how to get clean water supplies instead of just sending them trucks of water, and to try opening dialogues with their governments on how to improve their school systems. As the proverb says 'Give a man a fish, he has lunch for a day. Teach a man to fish, he has lunch everyday.' In my personal opinion is that this way will be much more helpful to poorer nations than just sharing their profits.

prompt: social revolution Many people think modern communication technology is having some negative effects on social relationships. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Online communication technologies have revolutionized how people interact with each other. I agree that these technologies have adverse impacts on interpersonal relationships. Ċ Social apps may make communication shallower and thus make relationships more cosmetic. First, people, particularly the youth, may trade off face-to-face communication for online messaging. In this way, they would miss important non-verbal information including facial expressions, tones, and body language. Relegating face-to-face talks to exchange of texts could result in a lack of deep understanding between people. Also, the "like" feature on social media cannot strengthen interpersonal ties. This is because "likes" do not carry any information further than general appreciation. On the contrary, spending too much time on liking posts could mean that no time is left for quality communications. Ċ An equally worrying effect of online communication is that it may spread jealousy and anxiety. Fascinating travel pictures, photos of perfect bodies, and impressive update on profiles are abundant on Facebook feeds. On seeing these posts from friends, one may feel jealous and anxious. Some may even feel like a failure in comparison to their friends. To avoid this sense of defeat, some may alienate themselves from their friends. As a result, online communication tools could make their users more isolated. Ċ To conclude, modern messaging tools could degrade interpersonal relationships, although they were designed to forge communication. Main impacts include shallower interactions and a sense of alienation.

prompt: We live in a world in which we are constantly exposed to advertising. To what extent does advertising influence our choices as consumers, and what effect does it have on our lifestyles? Ċ Discuss this issue and give your opinion.
essay: Highlighting products an influential method to attract customers. A great deal of goods is displayed worldwide by several companies. I believe that it has vital impacts on our choices. Furthermore, it has both positive and negative influences on our daily lives. Ċ There is a host of point as to why our products-selection is dependent on various handbills, posters, TV advertisements. Firstly, we are always looking for the latest manufacturings. Therefore, whenever companies produce any goods, they demonstrate those things on satellite channels, newspapers for appealing purchasers. Furthermore, sometimes, they guarantee. As a result, we believe their commitments and buy them. For example, a survey was conducted in India about a couple of months ago concerning how people choose their shoppings. Those Indians replied that they always followed the instructions of advertisements and commitments. Ċ On the other hand, although advertisements play a significant role to determine our necessities, it brings some conveniences and disadvantageous effects on our lifestyles. The prime opportunity is that we can cope up with the fashionable and technology-based world. Because, producers inform us regarding the most widespread and popular products. However, the principal drawback can be that individuals have the probability to be deceived. Because, there are a number of industries who supply second-hand products wittingly for more profit. So, if people buy them because of mesmerizing, they will be definitely abortive to posses their expected products. For instance, statistics demonstrated that, in Bangladesh, a quarter of citizens are happy to buy products according to advertising, but ten in one inhabitant is regretful for not having original products. Ċ To conclude, if we select products with validation, we will hardly be cheated. The essay discussed the view and put forward evidences why buying products in terms of attraction by company's advertisements will be advantageous as well as inconvenient impacts on our citizens.

prompt: The major cities in the world are growing fast, as well as their problems. What are the problems that young people living in cities are facing with? Give solutions to these problems.
essay: Majority of the cities have been developing rapidly. This growing, leads to the problem that made the young people struggle. Nevertheless, there are some possible solutions that could be taken into account to address this issue. Ċ High standard of living is a main problem of youngster living in the cities. All of the costs, such as foods and accommodations are higher than in the urban areas. This is due to the competition of business among city dwellers is firm. In addition, another major problem is the traffic jam. As the city is the most densely occupied area, many of them prefer using their own vehicle to using public transportation. Thus, it is undoubtedly that the bottleneck is the problem that make the youngster struggles. Ċ Turning to the possible solutions, the young people ought to live economically and manage their money efficiently. For instance, they not buy unnecessary items, more often eat at home rather than at restaurant, and so forth. Therefore, they are able to save deposit for a rainy day. Another possible solution is, they are supposed to use public transportation in their daily pursuits. If the distance of destination place is nearby, walking is the best way to decrease the number of transportation in the street. Hence, the problems of traffic jam could be diminished. Ċ In conclusion, living in the big cities leads to the troubles for the young people. However, the problems they facing are a challenge, in order to they become a good citizen who are able to adapt in every hard situation.

prompt: People argue that raising children in today’s society is more difficult than in the past. Others believe that it is much easier due to all the innovations. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Whereas some argue that raising children in our modern society is harder than in old times, others claim that it is much simpler because of new inventions. In my opinion, while in the past children were not so exposed to strangers as today, raising a child nowadays is easier due to innovations in health system. Ċ First of all, innovations in health care have helped people to give proper medical assistance for their children. Thus, it is cheaper than ever to take care of an infant on his or her early stage of life. For example, not only vaccination costs dropped consistently due to recent innovations on medical methods, but also medical equipment has been modernized leading to cheaper exams. Consequently, child mortality has declined significantly over the past decades, especially in developing countries. Ċ On the other hand, new technologies have made easier for children to access the internet. Hence, increasing the danger of exposing them to strangers, since children are easily fooled by strangers, and parents are not always monitoring their conversations as they should. For instance, a stranger can either convince a youth on meeting him willing to do to do some harm or induce the youth to hurt someone else or itself. Therefore, restricting children's online communication can mitigate this risk but will not solve the problem completely. Ċ In conclusion, while improvements in the health care system have made the task of raising a child easier, internet access presents a risk at the moment children can get in contact with strangers. Then, in my opinion the innovations in medical area outweigh the risk of exposing the children on the internet.

prompt: Some people think that zoos are cruel and should be closed down; however, others believe that zoos can be useful in protecting wild animals. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: It is currently easy to find a zoo as there are many of them around the world. However, it is doubtable if they treat animals well or just want to make money out of it. As it is hard to be known, should a place be trusted to protect wildlife in danger or not? Let's analyse both points and I'll give my point of view to conclude it. Ċ On the one hand, it is possible to find sanctuaries which usually claim to have the duty of caring for injured pets and afterwards place them back to nature. Although, when some animal suffers an injury as being hit by a car for example, and not completely recover from this, it consequently cannot survive if left into the jungle. Moreover, take the risk of getting into another accident. Ċ On the other hand, there is a range of zoos with a business purpose only. Sadly, in this case, animals are just a kind of attraction. Allegations of mistreatment, lack of hygiene and bad living conditions are unfortunately common about these venues. They pretend to treat creatures fairly when public come to visit, but that might be totally the opposite while no one is seeing this. Ċ To sum up, briefly, the pros and cons are easily found in keeping those places opened. Even though knowing some of them just have the intention to help, there are still others taking advantage of it through bad treatment, and that is the reason why I truly believe the government should shut zoos down and take full responsibility of watching and caring for wildlife.

prompt: In the past, most people used to travel to their place of work. With increased use of computers, the internet and smart phones, more and more people are starting to work from home. Ċ What are the advantages and disadvantages of this development?
essay: These days, the capabilities of the Internet have been changing and the vast majority of the population embarks to work from home. I tend to think that such a tendency has both positive and negative sides. Nevertheless, I believe that if household offices are employed for the right purposes, their benefits outweigh their drawbacks. I advocate strongly with my own views and am going to provide some arguments, which would be confirmed my position. Ċ On the one hand, we can observe some advantages of the online occupation. In my opinion, one of the main reasons why society wants to stay at home during the day consists of convenience. For instance, staffers can not waste their time when going to offices. In addition, employees, who perform their duties from home, can start their workday earlier in contrast to employees, who must be able to a workplace at a certain time. Ċ On the other hand, experts would argue that online work is composed of various flaws. For example, some people undergo difficulties in order to organise themselves. Besides, they can not concentrate on work entirely if others reside with them at home and often concern them throughout the day. In spite of these issues, the minority of people prefers to visit offices in lieu to stay at home for occupation. Also noteworthy is that online work is so common during the current outbreak. Ċ To summarise, I would stress that having made these points, it is true that household offices receive some criticism, and perhaps this is a delightful idea. What employers should do is composed of providing handy and comfortable conditions for the online and offline occupations respectively.

prompt: Today's children are living under more pressure from the society than in the past. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion.
essay: In this modern era, competition among children is getting tougher. So, the kids' life is not as enjoyable as in the past to satisfy their parents' desire. I really believe that they get more stress than children in the previous generation, and there is suggestion to make comfortable situation for them. Ċ This is no doubt that parents more enforce their children in order to reach the good future. They decide the children future based on their experience and society condition. Get a good score in school become a measurement, so student have to learn as much as possible every day. Besides academic achievement, join extracurricular and some courses is done by kids to improve soft skill also enrich the capability. These all parents do without asking their children, they don't know what the kids really want to do, it makes they can't enjoy their childhood. It was different with people in previous era which the competition is not as tight as now. Ċ Although parents pressure their children, it is all they do because they want the best of the kids. Parents think that study is much better than do online activities such as social media and games. They don't want to their child access the bad sites or becoming a game addict. So, parent trying to keep their kids away from danger possibility by extending their child's positive activity. It is also to prepare children for global competition in future. Ċ To sum up, although parents pressure their children for the child goodness, I totally agree that kids today's get more enforcement from their parents. Impose the parents desire is bad for children, so parent have to care about their children enthusiasm to maximize their ability which can support their future.

prompt: people obsessed with looking young - why? Many people try to look younger than they really are. What are the reasons for that? Is it a positive or negative development?
essay: People, nowadays, have a strong inclination towards appearing young as compared to their real age. Factors such as social acceptance and attainment of good health can be attributed to this phenomenon. This essay intends to look at these two factors and following this look, an opinion will be discussed regarding its impact the society. Ċ To begin with, looking youthful has become a social norm in the society. This attitude has been deeply ingrained in people's minds as they are continuously bombarded with information by various marketing companies. For example, it is common to see the cosmetic advertisements of many good looking models on the television, which put great emphasis on looking young and beautiful and thus influence the minds of people. Therefore, people may want to appear young in order to meet the society's expectations and fear that they will be considered as outcasts if they donot follow such norms. Ċ Further, another reason why people want to look young is because they may want to keep themselves away from the serious health issues namely diabetes, obesity and to name but a few, that the old age brings with itself. As a result, they try to follow various fitness and health regimen to look young. Ċ Following this look at the causes, it is felt this perception of people has positive impacts on the society. An advantage worth mentioning is that people are encouraged to form good health and eating habits. In addition, appearing young can bolster the confidence among the people. Ċ In conclusion, it can be said that the social mindset and achievement of physical soundness are the reasons why people want to look younger than their real age. Also, it can be agreed that this attitude is advantageous in terms of the personal development it brings to people's l

prompt: People today move to new cities or new countries more than ever before. What challenges do they experience? What strategies are there to meet these challenges?
essay: Throughout the world an immense migration through cities raise a pace than decades ago. Obviously, some challenges are related to such phenomenon which will be faced immigrants as an exercise to treat their toughness. However, some strategies should be prepared in order to increase immigrant readiness before turn onto the real migration. Ċ Different living habit challenges a city migration. Also, modern cities are identically with individualism as their personal task fulfillment forces them to reduce socialization time. Engaging with such habit can be triggered a culture shock for city newbie. For instance, working habit in Japan takes high rate of individualism among inhabitants. In case, a new worker coming from highly socialized place which cannot express the togetherness feeling, loneliness will be very suffer. It is also important to talk about different taste of cuisine. While newcomer cannot adapt with serving cuisine, they might be got a health problem as insufficient nutrition intake. For instance, West Sumatra region identically cooked spicy taste. When Javanese people refuse to eat such identical taste, they might experience a gastric as their favourite is unavailable there. Ċ On the other hand, best preparation brings best adaptation. Therefore, observing the destination places entirely may be the best advice. For example, Getting LOA from University in Canada, My uncle collects all of living habit there in order to increase his readiness before class started. Also, try to simulate local habit is another best preparation. While Canadian University requires their student to make 5 essays a day, it is good to write with similar quantity as their struggle with happening challenge. Ċ Having said that, experiencing the challenges always engage in new immigrant. Even though sometimes it is hard to be an immigrant, the best preparation will be benefitted especially for immigrant's mentality. I believe that well prepared brings good live in a new place.

prompt: In countries like Japan, the population is getting older, are the effects of aging population on society is negative or positive. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: It is no doubt that aging population has becoming a global challenging issue that many countries in the world are facing right now. In general, with the help of modem science, people are now having a longer life expectancy. Even though longevity is a gift, it might come alone with potential risks and unexpected impact on the society. Ċ Admittedly, there are some issues that have already appeared in the society as a fact with the aging population. First of all, the government have to spare more financial budget for pension benefit each year as the amount of aged people are growing.
