Moreover, as a large portion of the population is facing deteriorating health, it will induce more medical expenses and social welfare. As a consequences, either the government would suffer a financial deficit or the burden will fall onto the younger generation as the states will need more tax revenue. Ċ However, the effect of an aging population might not be all negative. One of the most obvious benefit is that the older employees can be extremely productive and efficient and this can help the company to succeed. Another positive effect is that the rising demand for aged care industry will create millions of jobs and opportunities for young people and reduce the unemployment rate. Last but not least, it is common to see that a lot of grandparents help out with domestic duties including taking care of their grandchildren to spare up the parents to work. Ċ To sum up, it is probably better for a society to achieve age equilibrium in the population. However, if the population has already lost balance, we need to be ready for more actions and changes to adapt to the circumstances and create opportunities as to embrace longevity as a gift but not as a threat.

prompt: it is common these days to see celebrities advertising different products. do the advantages of this development outweight the disadvantages. Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant example from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: In this modern era, it is said that multifarious companies get the assistance of famous persons to advertise their products in the market. In this essay, I will explicate both merits and demerits with the relevant instance in the upcoming paragraphs. Ċ To commence with the benefits, promoting various kinds of commodities by celebrities has become popular in this generation and there are ample of positive sides of this trend. In other words, organizations aware that advertising any product requires trust and honesty so they opt for famous personality to give ads to their brands. For instance, time of India newspaper has conducted a survey that India's prestigious companies obtain help from popular Bollywood actors to advertise their upcoming brands. In addition, the new generation follows their lifestyle and purchase all the brand and things whatever they buy. As a result, the company's economy becomes strong due to products which are launched by celebrities. Ċ Despite these positive sides, there are few negative sides which can lead to personalities bad image as well as reduction of the business economy. To elaborate, some brands seem very effective during the promotion of them but when people start utilising it on the daily basis then they realise it was wastage of money and people do not trust on celebrities and do not spend their finance on new products. For example, India's prestigious company called 'dantmangan' launched toothpaste in 2011, and multifarious singers have given ads on this new paste without using it and received money from companies. Also, when people opted to use it was ineffective. As a result, company and advertisers got bad comments on their profiles and lead to a lack of money and reputation. Ċ To conclude, I think that there are many pros as compare to cons so, promoting a new product makes an organization and promoter financially strong but sometimes it is risky without using advertising material prior to showing it through the ads.

prompt: Some people think the government should stop putting money in art programs and put the money in more important fields such as sports facilities, medical care or national defense. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Nowadays people start concentrating on their own country's investments as they increasingly realize that it links to their future life. Consequently, the aim of such investments becomes a hot-debated topic of discussion when people try to find out the better places where the money goes, for example, art or infrastructure such as sports facilities, medical care or national defense. Ċ Obviously, all governments are supposed to meet their people's basic needs at first. Especially and certainly the highest priorities for developing countries are to resolve the poverty and guarantee the safety and health, which surely requires a huge amount of money to invest in. Compared with those developed countries, developing countries do not constantly have solid financial support, so they should target the comparably short-term achievement to improve people's daily life, most of which is spent pursing basic requirements rather than art programs. Without adequate food supply, healthy bodies and peaceful environment, individuals would not have any interests on painting, singing or dancing. Ċ However for other developed countries, they probably already do not need to worry about the materials to survive through hundreds of years' development. And even importantly, they have consistently healthy financial system so that they are able to grow the art programs and stimulate people's further needs on spirit. In other words, the developed countries may invest in the higher level of what people need with the stable base of materials. Ċ In developing countries, prioritizing infrastructure is not the same as that they are deprived of the opportunities of developing other things beneficial to the people, in fact, the governments should be fully responsible for the development targets on each stage that adapts to each country's real situation.

prompt: Some people believe it's wrong to keep animal in zoos while other think that zoos are important for both its educational and ecological value. Discuss both views zoo still plays a crucial part in protecting endangered species
essay: In this modern world, there has been an ongoing debate on the controversial roles of the zoo. Some believe keeping animals in cage is morally wrong wwhile others emphasize on the preservation and education roles that rest upon the shoulder of the zoo. In this essay, I shall put forth my arguments to discuss both perspective to get the impartial view of the problem. Ċ There are several reasons to implicate that it's unethical to nurture wildlife animals in captivity. Confining animals in small spaces has been scientifically proven to assert some detrimental effects on their behaviors. Predators raised in the zoo lose their instinct to hunt while small creatures do not feel threatened by their hunters. The disappearance of these traits, which keep them alive in the wild, put their existence in peril. The dependant on human for food and care, in addition, worsen the above problem. Ċ The zoo offers some crucial benefits despite of the downsides. It is, first of all, a sanctuary for some endangered species, which should have perished if left alone in the wild. Take dodo birds for example, if it had not been for the relentless effort of the Australian Zoo, this distinctive bird could have been wiped out. Scientists at the zoo work their best to provide an environment that is predator-free and with stable temperature so that the bird and its offspring can thrive. Another factor to demonstrate the significant role of the zoo is its ample educational value for children of all ages. Zoo is the ideal place to instil the awareness to preserve the environment into young generation's mind. Ċ In conclusion, although facing with several criticisms for its moral issues, the zoo still play a crucial part in protecting endangered species and education young children.

prompt: Some people prefer to watch movies at the cinema, others like watching their movies at home, as home theaters become more popular. Discuss your opinion.
essay: I agree with the statement that people are becoming more interested about home theater to watch movie rather than going to cinema hall. From the increasing popularity of home theater it seems that there might have some convenience in it. Ċ At present swift pace of life and hectic schedule pushes people to be busy at any time. As a result, it has been quiet difficult for men to go to cinema for enjoying a movie due to time limitation. In addition, we are bound to watch a movie in cinema that is being displayed at the moment whether we like its story, actor-actresses or not. Moreover, we may have to wait in a line to get ticket. Very often we may not get required number if we desire to get a large numbers of tickets. Sometimes, seat, allocated by hall authority may not satisfy us. Ċ Conversely, at the end of a stressful day, one can get pleasure from a nice movie sitting at home during leisure. At home we can enjoy movie casually, either sitting or lying or walking during doing something. For example, dinner can be prepared as well through watching a movie. Even he can review some more attractive portion of the movie, or can have a movie taking break if necessary. Occasionally, at family party, home theater offers us much entertainment. Ċ However, we can go to cinema with friends and family members during vacation. It's a kind of outing that energizes us. Ċ To recapitulate, I would appreciate home theater for the ease it offers us. Due to scientific breakthroughs, we are always shifting away in doing things from the way we did earlier. Home theater can be considered such a development that helps us to cope with modern way of life.

prompt: TOPIC: Companies use different ways to increase sales. What different ways do companies use to increase sales? What is the most effective one?
essay: During these days, enterprises have high demand for raising brand awareness and this trend has led to a variety of advertising strategies. Some of the most common ways are via visual illustration and word of mouth but celebrity endorsement is considered to bring the best result. Ċ To commence, advertising through visuals is synonymous with approaching customers by providing them numerous images and related information about the brands. Examples include banners and leaflets which are continuously distributed in public places or even large screens hung on high- rise buildings around crowded streets. As a result, consumers are gradually instilled with the products, facilitating their desires to possess them. Ċ Moreover, the technique of spreading the brand's reputation through word of mouth is also favored by many companies. Nowadays, people religiously chat with their relatives such as families and friends so that should anyone recommend a product even if it is not necessary, it could still win trust from others. Ċ Even though there are several ways to improve profit, affiliation with celebrities, especially young influencers, is being chosen by the majority. Along with the advancement of social platforms, the youth is easily affected by their idols. To be more specific, teenagers seem to buy things that create moments with famous people or choose the products shared by them. For example, from luxurious brands such as Channel to lower ones, they all have celebrities become their ambassadors, promoting their sales to a larger scale of customers thanks to their huge fans. Ċ In conclusion, it is evident that there are a number of ways to increase sales and collaboration with famous influencers might be the most ultimate one.

prompt: Young adults should contribute to their communities by doing unpaid work in their free time. Ċ Do advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: Adolescents can do a community service without getting a salary in their leisure time. The disadvantages of this notion outweigh the advantages because youngsters will not be able to earn for expenses, views related to this will be discussed in the subsequent paragraphs. Ċ To begin with, the main advantage of doing a public task during free period is that it causes a decline in educational performance of adolescents. To elaborate, youngsters will not be able to get sufficient rest after doing the work. This often contributes to lack of concentration on studies which leads to poor academic grades. For instance, young adults who mostly do public work for free rarely spend enough time on their education. Thus, adolescents' academic score might get adversely impacted by doing community work without any salary. Ċ In addition, financial problems usually arise when youngsters provide services to the society without any charges. To clarify, as young adults cannot earn hard cash, personal expenses such as clothes, education fees cannot be afforded. As a result, financial dependency on parents increases. Hence, adolescents will not be able to earn for themselves if job done in free hours without payment. Ċ On the contrary, community service without pay in free time leads to the holistic development of an individual. To substantiate, since youngsters often interact with enormous people, communication skills and cooperation quality will be improved. This leads to an interactive social life. To illustrate, youngsters often develop moral values while doing public services without any pay. Therefore, the personality of young adults builds up after doing free social tasks. Ċ In conclusion, social services without pay reduces education grades as well as putting financial burden on youngsters. However, ethics can be learned while doing neighbourhood tasks.

prompt: Technology is very much a part of modern life. Many people see technology as a force that has escaped from human control. Others feel that technology has improved the quality of life. Do you think that the contribution technology has made to modern life has been positive or negative? State your position on this issue and support it with appropriate examples
essay: I believe that contribution the technologies made to modern life have been positive because they connect humans from around the world. Some believe that technologies have escaped humans' control as they damage the environment. On the other hand, technologies have created a better place for humans to live in. Ċ Thus, I believe that the technologies have been positive to modern life. They connect people from around the world using modern communication devices, such as internet, cell phone, and social media. These devices also allow people to talk face to face, although they are at different places. This is very helpful for those that live far away from their families. Ċ For example, I used to feel lonely and homesick because I was away from my families. Although my parents called me once a week by phone, I still felt sad because I was unable to see their faces. But now, the new modern communication devices, such as Skype, Lines and so on have allowed us to see each other through a video call. In other words, these new technologies have brought me closer to my family, even though we are physically away from each other. Ċ In conclusion, technologies are created to improve humans' life. Technologies help humans with their works, and they have been important keys in humans' civilization. That is why I believe that technologies have contributed positively to modern life because they are able to connect humans from around the world.

prompt: We cannot help everyone in the world that needs help, so we should only be concerned with our own communities and countries. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: In some previous years, assisting each other is not an activity aiming for personal benefits only. Among people around the world, this trend is growing positively. Especially, the field of action is widened from community into worldwide range. Ċ When doing a charity, we should not distinguish between our nation and these others. The reasons for that are absolutely simple: we are of the same race even if we come from different nations and the important meaning of help lies in what you have given. Did you bring the poor what exactly they want? Did you really sympathize and feeling their hurts? And whether you do these work with your heart? Those are what you should concern about. Ċ Moreover, helping each other is the lofty and beautiful behavior that can improve the relationship among nations all over the world. For instance, in 1970, Vietnamese army helped Cambodian subvert Pon Pot government, which is return the peace life toward Cambodia. Vietnamese do that without weighing the pros and the cons. Above all, they understand deeply the meaning of solidarity and friendship that they received. In the modern world, if one nation just tends to develop itself but pays attention in these others, it will be isolated and lose the friendships. Ċ To summarize, helps should be done with our honest heart. We can start with assisting people around us and then broaden in some distance locations. Although, people have limited abilities, I ensure that with the enthusiasm and desire of helping each other there will not any barriers between us./.

prompt: Tobacco, mainly in the form of cigarettes, is one of the most widely used drugs in the world. over a billion adults legally smoke tobacco every day. The long term health costs are high- for smokers themselves, and for the wider community in terms of health care costs and lost productivity. Do governments have a legitimate role to legislate to protect citizens from the harmful effects of their own decisions to smoke, or are such decisions up to the individual?
essay: It is debatable if government should create laws to prohibit smoking. On one hand where such laws can be beneficial for citizens but at same time they are invasion of individual rights too. This essay will firstly examine the benefits of making such laws followed by discussion of disadvantages before arriving at a reasoned conclusion. Ċ The are mainly two advantages of having a ban on tobacco and its products. One is that the government will not have to spend money on health care costs associated with diseases linked to excessive smoking. It is well established fact that smoking leads to a variety of diseases and makes people unfit. Other advantage is that healthy citizens are useful asset to a country as they can be productive and earn enough to support themselves, their families and others in need. Ċ Having considered the advantages, it is equally important to examine the disadvantages associated with having such laws. Firstly, such a law is invasion of individual rights. A democratic government gets elected to safeguard the rights of its people and such a law can prove very unpopular. Secondly, the governments usually earn a lot of money by taxing tobacco products heavily. By banning these altogether, government will lose a significant source of revenue. Ċ In my opinion, government can make policies to encourage people to give up smoking. For instance, there is a ban on smoking in public places in India. I disagree that a government should put a blanket ban on tobacco products as it will not be correct both economically and democratically.

prompt: Some people think that the crime among teenagers is increasing because of violent video games. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The effect of aggressive video games on youngsters has been a debatable issue. I think that video games play a significant role in diverting the mind of young ones towards anger and fights but it is not the only factor to be blamed. Ċ To begin with, it can be strongly argued that the growing minds are strongly influenced by what they see and do. Family issues can affect their brains to a large extent. For instance, if they see debates and arguments between their family member they will definitely grow up like them. Additionally, Action movies and Tv serials involve violent weapons and dangerous stunts. Teenagers try to perform these in real life which can lead to violence and accidence. Ċ On the other hand, video games involve winning by harming the other side. This builds a feeling of hate and dislikes for others. For example, Pub G had led to the death of many children as they tried to do the things they learnt from the game in real life. Further, the overuse of these computer games also decreases the social connection of kids and they face stress and depression as they stop sharing things with others. Ċ In the conclusion, I would say that PlayStations are responsible for bringing violence among youth to some extent. But there are other reasons like family issues and action movies which can be equally blamed. Young minds can be compared with mud pots which can be shaped as we want. Therefore, parents should take care of what their children see and do.

prompt: TOPIC:-Some people argue that cars should be banned in city centres while others are against this idea. Discuss both the sides and give your opinion . no access for cars to the downtowns
essay: Nowadays, cars have become an efficient means of transportation. The invention of cars has provided comfort and reduced travel time, but at the same time has caused serious environmental threats, like noise and air pollution. Some people are in favour of banning the cars in city centres to solve these issues. However, there are a few who share a different perspective. Ċ The growing popularity of the cars has caused serious traffic problems and environmental issues. Some people think that abandoning this four-wheeled vehicle will reduce congestion. This would further reduce the stress level of the people caused due to the daily traffic jams. Furthermore, this will be a significant step to tackle environmental threats by reducing air and noise pollution. As these cars run on fuel, like petrol, diesel etc. The harmful gases are released due to the constant burning of these fuels, resulting in the rise in air pollution and several hazardous diseases amongst individuals. Henceforth, forbidding the motorcars would lead to a healthy environment and preservation of the non-renewable fossil fuels. Ċ However, there is a flip side to it. Restricting the four-wheeled vehicle would negatively impact the overall economy of the country. Automobile industries significantly contribute to the growth and development of the country by providing a wide variety of employment opportunities. Casting out these vehicles will drop the production and hence resulting in the shutdown of several car manufacturing firms. This would further lead to unemployment and other redundancies. Ċ In my opinion, banning the cars is not a wise resolution to tackle the environmental issues. However, the government should encourage the people to restrict the use of it by providing an efficient and economical means of public transportation. They should roll out awareness programs to encourage the individuals to car-pool and explore other means of transportation.

prompt: Eventually, technology will solve the most important environmental problems the world faces today. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Our dependence on technology on a day to day basis cannot be understated. Some people believe that the latest advancements in tech are pivotal in answering environmental concerns. In this essay, I will go over why I partially disagree with this narrative and why I believe that technology is causing more problems than it is solving. Ċ To begin, the introduction of the latest technology like hybrid vehicles and special vehicles to clean the water bodies has seemingly taken over and become an answer to the ecological crisis. For instance, the special battery used in hybrid vehicles is widely known to reduce carbon monoxide emissions caused by vehicles. Therefore, there is a good reason to believe that the more of these vehicles we have, the lesser the damage to our echo system. Ċ Furthermore, the introduction of electronic fuel cells was seen as a major step in the right direction to curb air and noise pollution because these special electronic engines do not need gasoline. However, the production of these electronic fuel cells is known to cause more damage to the environment compared to the average lifetime of a vehicle that runs on gas/diesel. This means that the more of these fuel cells we create, the more we damage the environment. Ċ Finally, I disagree with the notion that tech has become an answer in answering the environmental crisis. The focus should be on finding alternate sources of energy to sustain the demand and find ways to make electric fuel cells that are not harmful to the echo system.

prompt: Sports which depend on violence for their entertainment, such as boxing and wrestling, have no place in a civilized society and should be banned. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: With the pressures and bustles in modern life, sport is considered as one of the best form of entertainments. In recent years, the popularity of sports containing violent factors has led to the heated controversy over the question whether they should be banned or not. Many people hold a strong view suggesting that combat sports cannot be existed in a civilized society. However, from my point of view, it should be made illegal due to the reasons presented in this essay. Ċ To begin with, in a well-organized and developed society, people have the rights to decide which sports are suitable to practice and entertain. In other words, the prohibition can be used to illustrate for fossilizing human civilization to the past and restricting the development of human's rights. Furthermore, if boxing and wrestling are not allowed to play, law systems generate the unfairness between them with other sports which also cause some serious injuries or even death such as extreme sports and contact sports. Ċ Similarly, combat sports benefit society in many ways. In specific, it is a suitable method for improving health's communities when people do exercise reasonably. Moreover, people can use it to defend themselves in may dangerous situations. Whilst women, for example, use it to against criminal rapes, men can protect themselves in a society where violence is increasing considerably. Last but not least, by imposing taxes on sport entertainment industry, government can get money for social budget, using for charity and succour purposes, or improving the living condition of residents. Ċ All in all, the is no denying that fighting sports have advantages for both individuals and socities. Therefore, I would like to emphasize and reiterate that instead of banning them, we should permit them in controllable scales.

prompt: Solving environmental problems should be the responsibility of an international organization rather than each national government. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: In recent decades, environmental problems, such as global warming and natural resource depletion, have been receiving a great deal of media attention due to their substantial impacts on human life. As a result, many environmentalists believe that multinational organizations are better than national governments in addressing these problems. I completely agree with this point of view. Ċ On the one hand, many local governments have no interest in solving the problems for a variety of reasons. First, it is true that most of these governments do not realize the necessity of environment protection. Therefore, if the responsibilities are handed over to them, they will end up doing nothing, which is detrimental to both the local and global environment. Second, since the costs, either financial or non-financial, of dealing with environmental problems is extremely high, most countries are not willing to trade their resources for small returns. For example, many nations, especially developing ones, do not invest money in reducing carbon footprint even though they are affected by climate change. Ċ On the other hand, it is more reasonable that global institutions should in charge of global issues like environmental ones. First of all, by enacting international laws, these institutions ensure that each national governments have to take actions to protect the environment. For example, if there are strict global laws on carbon emissions, the number of countries contribute to global warming will decrease significantly. As well as this, many places on Earth, such as the North Pole and the South Pole, are affected by global warming but do not entirely belong to a single nation. Therefore, if there are no multinational organizations take responsibility for this problem, these places will be damaged significantly. Ċ In conclusion, global institutions should hold accountable for environmental problems instead of local governments. However, each country should support these institutions to combat the issues.

prompt: Some people think that children should be raised by all the family members (eg: uncle, aunt and grandparents) rather than only parents. Give your opinion.
essay: Raising children has become an important aspect of anyone's life. There are sections of society who believes that the kids need to be brought up by all family members and not just their parents. In this essay, I will discuss the benefits of it and the limitations of raising the young minds by the parents alone. Ċ In fact, there are a few disadvantages of raising kids by only their mother and father. Firstly, the kids only get to learn from their parents, which limits the amount of their social interactions. For example, it is widely known that the kids with greater social interactions in their childhood grow up to become individuals with high social skills and good communication. Secondly, they would rely upon formal training to develop their skills rather than seeking advice from their immediate family. Ċ On the other hand, there are huge benefits that can be derived when kids are raised by all the family members. Not only does it increase their social interactions in their earlier ages, but also enables them to become well rounded people. Additionally, it helps the family members in overcoming financial woes, which enables the kids to grow up with all the required resources. For instance, it is an accepted matter that in large joint families, members are able to effectively overcome monetary issues with the help of their relatives, thus bringing about a better quality of life for themselves and their children. Ċ To conclude, when kids are brought up by all the family members together, they tend to learn a lot more than being raised just by their parents and hence more beneficial. However, with the advent of corporate culture and modernisation, families are shrinking and people are increasingly depending upon training programs for learning to raise their kids better, rather than depending upon their own parents.

prompt: 9.Large companies use sports events to promote their products. Some people think this has a negative impact on sports. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It has been pointed out that promoting their items in several game events has been carried out by large organizations, and some individuals opine that this trend is detrimental to athletics. Personally, I completely disagree with this idea as advertising products through campaigns is beneficial to the development of sports and the quality of matches. Ċ First of all, the top level of companies promote their goods via several well-known pastimes matches benefits the advancement of pastime itself. The reason is that a huge number of people who are massive fans of products can be attracted to watch the sports tournaments that are supported by famous brands, which increases the popularity of tournaments. For instance, during the Australia Open period, Country road as a sponsor is permitted to establish stores at the entrance of stadiums. A vast majority of fans of Country road who would like to purchase limited clothes need to buy a ticket to enter the Melbourne arena, which contributes to the promotion of tennis. Ċ Furthermore, inviting large companies to advertise goods on campaigns can bring economic benefits to tournament committees. This is because if companies are allowed to put their commercials in the middle of matches, they need to give a huge amount of money to athletics organizations. As a result, committees are less likely to worry about their funding and have sufficient funds to arrange matches, which increases the quality of competition. As an illustration, the members of the committee of the NBA say that as most of our sponsors need to spend 10 million every year promoting their products in basketball games, we are able to pay ample attention to other areas such as maintaining facilities of courts, leading to providing more exciting matches to audiences. Ċ In conclusion, although people may vary in their opinion about whether being allowed to promote goods in sports matches has advantages or not, I am opinion that this situation results in more benefits in terms of the development of athletics and the quality of competitions.

prompt: Now that computers can very well translate all kinds of languages in the world, do we really need to learn more languages in future? Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: It is a universal fact that 21st century is the era of machines. From calculating, recording, online shopping, browsing to even translation of different kinds of languages in the world, there is nothing which a computer cannot do. One wonders, do we really need to learn languages in future. One needs to analyse both sides to come to a conclusion. Ċ Computers, complex yet highly useful can do anything, in which humans consume a lot of time.They can do it within seconds. Moreover, they can convert spoken language of one region to another. Which has made our work simpler and does not require us to put effort in actually studying and understanding the scripts of different parts. Especially, the ones who have related jobs, but do not have the space to study it. For example, many of the travellers do not have the interest in learning it, but just convert the dialogue whenever they want to. Ċ However, Human, being a social animal has taught himself to speak and converse in various ways with time. Language is the form of human behaviour which not only leads to the sharpness of the brain, but also helps in spreading knowledge by mastering the linguistic skills. Additionally, helping in understanding the origin and culture of that particular nation. For instance, history students take a deep interest in grasping the nuances of the various regions by first learning their language to understand about culture. Ċ If one relies too much on devices like computers for every art related work. It will lead to losing personal values of society in future. Ċ In conclusion, I would say, no matter how advance the world becomes, it cannot replace the human touch. Therefore, it is vital to learn languages of different countries which will keep our old civilisation alive.

prompt: Many claim that the fast food industry had negative effects on the environment, eating habits and families. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The prevalence of fast food is widely deemed to be detrimental to Mother Nature as well as key aspects of a healthy life, including diets and domestic relationships. Personally, I am an ardent advocate of the mentioned viewpoint. Ċ That convenience food adversely affects what one eats is readily apparent. A rise in red meat, salt and calories intakes is witnessed for virtually all people embarking upon the consumption of fast food on a regular basis, compared to their previous self-cooked meals with fresh ingredients bought from the market which might be more of an organic nature. In other words, owing to fast food being easily accessible to them, these individuals switch from a more or less healthier home-made diet to quick meals want of nutritions and high in substances that give rise to severe health issues such as hypertension, obesity and cardiovascular diseases. Ċ Opponents of fast food also point to the fact that the constant use of it contributes to family aloofness, with which I consent. Ready meals of this kind deprive husbands and wives, as well as parents and children, of the opportunity to prepare and have dinner together after working separately for a whole day. This absence of family activities could, over a long period of time, induces a frosty atmosphere and a lack of mutual understanding among family members. Ċ In addition, there are environmental concerns raised with regards to the increasingly expanding junk food industry. Hamburgers, one of the most celebrated types of fast food, have beef as their core component. The significant demand for such ingredient encourages the farming of beef cattle, whose excrement releases methane, which is an even more potent candidate than carbon dioxide as a culprit behind global warming. Ċ To conclude, I am convinced that the expense of fast food brands thriving is the public's dietary plans and domestic happiness, as well as the environment, Earth's atmosphere in particular, are all negatively impacted.

prompt: Stores should sell local food products and not imported food products. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is thought by Some people that stores should stock with local food items, while others are of the view that they should keep meal products from other countries too. In my opinion, it totally depends on the customer choice but stores should be ready to serve the need of the customer. Ċ There is no doubt that grocery stores will take care of the needs of the local people by providing them with fresh meal at a reasonable price. Moreover, the local meal stuff is healthy. In other words, people are easily aware of the brands within the nation. Apart from this, shops are at low risk as the local brand items will have more selling and would be easily available, if the store is left short in number for any specific stuff. Ċ Although there is no compulsion for stores to keep the imported foodstuff products, they are equally important for the business as well as for the public. For example, people who have migrated they are always searching for products and brands from their native place. Imported food is of such a good quality as they go under the government and helps in building business profit too. In addition, the products from another country will, also increase the economic factors and many crops are hard to grow within the country, so in order to meet the demands of the public it is necessary for shopkeepers to buy foreign items. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that imported foodstuff is as important as local foodstuff products because people do not miss those products found in their native country. The imported also help in building healthy relationship.

prompt: this is my first writing in this web . i'm an arabic education and i try to learn english, i have been learning english since 8 months, i have problems in writing and i hope someone to correct my mistakes. My university classified me in 002 level . i wrote an essay about current technological innovation
essay: The needs is the mother of innovation.In the past,people need ways to take them from place to another place .A machine called car was invented to make the transportation easier than before .Nowadays,cars are developing,it becomes faster ,better mileage and more security for people and nature. Ċ The first car was very slow ,it took many days to transport among the cities,whereas in the last century, it has been faster than before .The motor becomes big and has a best quality.The world gets small day after day that related to the developing of cars. Ċ Cars is created to give better mileage that contribute to save money.Hybrid car is an automobile that is powered by two sources, an internal combustion engine, and an electric motor.It has a small pumps that reduce the dependency on oil.Saving money at the pumps or doing their small part to reduce our dependency on oil.The far distance becomes cheaper and less expensives. Ċ Developing cars lead to the safety of people and nature.Normal cars emit a lot of pollution from their tailpipe.New cars avoid the global warming for such hybrid vehicles contribute 80 to 90 percent less to air pollution than conventional vehicles.They are a lot of accident caused by cars .The speed of new cars become deadly.New cars become more safety .New cars stop automatic if it will shock anything .New cars have a senser to avoid the accident .They are developing the security to be more comfortable and more safety for people. Ċ Cars are the most important in the life . People used to use cars from ages .It becomes the hand and the jumb of people .Finally, all the inventions were created For people's happiness.

prompt: In many countries, people like to eat a wider range of food than can be grown in their local place. Therefore, much of the food people eat today has to come from other regions. Do you think the advantages of this development outweigh disadvantages.
essay: These days, globalization is occurring everywhere in the world. Therefore, local residents have a chance to enjoy the international speciality of cuisine. Gradually, they prefer eating imported feed to consuming local cuisine. As far as I am concerned, the trend brings more backwards than benefits. Ċ On the one hand, imported goods can meet various needs of local people and encourage the national economy to develop. Firstly, consumers would have more choices to meet their demands. This is because the market is so busy, consumers not only find the local food, but also international cuisine in the retail. For example, America cannot plant tropical fruits, the American people can have an opportunity to taste new foodstuff by importing. Secondly, the producers have to be more creative to improve their products which are able to compete with imported goods. If local foodstuff can satisfy the needs of consumers, they will not use international food. Ċ On the other hand, the development also brings challenges to the local economy. This is because the weather only allows farmers to grow some certain plants. If they cultivated other plants, they could not have the expected harvest to serve the market. For instance, Ben Tre province is the most suitable place for growing coconuts, or Daklak province is the best place for cafe seeds grown. Moreover, as long as more residents like to buy international goods, local products will gradually disappear from the market. In other words, the farmers would change their career path to work in factories as blue-collar workers which they can earn more money. Ċ To conclude, consuming more imported foodstuff bring both advantages and disadvantages to consumers and the state economy. In my opinion, its backward needs to be considered more seriously..

prompt: Some people think that keeping pets is good for children while others think it is dangerous and unhealthy . which opinion do you agree with? discuss both view give examples
essay: It is true that a host of people nowadays especially kids tend to own a companion as a friend or because of their love for them. While some individuals believe that this trend has a positive effect on a child’s behaviour, others argue that playing with a pet is not safe and may bring some unexpected threat for the owners. I am personally of the opinion of the former. This essay will prove some logical reasons as to why the benefits of owning an animal can outweigh its drawbacks. Ċ On the one hand, having a pet comes up with various advantages for children. For instance, taking care of their furry friends such as taking them for a walk, grooming them, and feeding them teaches them to be more responsible not only with animals but also with every acquaintance. Furthermore, teenagers can consider their pets as their comrades when they have any disorder emotions due to their vulnerability at their age. Additionally, some researches indicate that youngsters at a very young age exposed to and who grew up with dogs and cats tend to have a better immune system compared to those who do not. Ċ On the other hand, parents have reasonable consideration to allow their offspring to nourish a household animal. One of their concerns is their aggressive behaviour which is dangerous for babies or youth who do not have a full cognition about animals. For example, those furry members can be triggered and attack their kids if they unconsciously bite or chew their bodies. Besides, household pets may spread disease and allergies to minors because they are normally a source of bacteria, pathogens, and viruses which are risky for children’s vulnerable physical health. Therefore, it is not secure if adults let pet with their sons and daughters and their furry companions are not cleaned and groomed every day. Ċ To sum up, whilst owning an animal may cause some negative consequences, I believe this does better than harm for juveniles because they can learn many things from having them as well as they will have better health from an early age. Consequently, it is advisable to let children contact with pets.

prompt: Some people believe that environmental problems are too big for individuals to deal with, while others think that that individuals should take some action. Discuss both views and give your opinion. BECAUSE ACTION SPEAKS LOUDER
essay: Currently, there are some issues toward the environment should be noticed by the individual, because several problems of the environmental impacts have rapidly appeared in the society. As a contributor of the impacts, each individual should take some actions to reduce the environmental problems. It would not become too big for individuals instead of doing nothing for their own environment. Ċ First and foremost, there are some environmental problems which have to be faced out by the community today, such as flood which occurs every year and pollution particularly in the big cities. These problems would rise significantly time by time if there is no one has initiatives. The most important thing is individuals should take some actions together to solve the environmental problem. Each individual should contribute in many ways, for instance in health aspect, individuals who have been practitioners in health service have a responsibility to communicate and persuade the community to prevent their area from waste in order to avoid the flood. Ċ In addition, environmental problems would be easier to solve if the government support the society as well. Individuals can be more enthusiasts to face the problems. It would be a good way to educate youth generation because they become pioneers for change of the environment. Ċ In conclusion, it is clear that the best solution for solving the environmental problems that individuals should take some actions continuously. It would never become too big for individuals to get and live in a better environment, because action speaks louder than anything.

prompt: Most countries have traditional celebrations that occur annually. In your opinion, what benefits do these celebrations have for societies?
essay: Tradition is a belief, behavior, and custom inherited from the past, which either has symbolic meanings or significant importance to society. Therefore, a great deal of traditional events is celebrated annually around the globe. However, the more modern our world becomes, the more these special festivals degenerated. This problem can obliterate the many benefits traditional celebrations have brought about to one's society. Ċ Celebrations of culture provide individuals a sense of identity. They not only answer the question of citizens' origins but they also remind citizens of what or who have shaped their lives. The people in my country, Vietnam, for instance, take great importance in celebrating the Hung King Temple festival. In this special event, everyone will commemorate Hung Kings-the founder of the Vietnam nation and after that, getting involved in a diversity of folk games such as bamboo swing, rice cooking competitions, or lion dance. Vietnamese people are reminded that owing to Hung Kings' efforts and labors, they are able to lead a well-of life in this day and age. Ċ Another sizeable value of cultural celebrations is that they educate us on things like freedom and benevolence, and help us pass on our cultural or religious history. In this aspect, Vietnamese people have Giong Festival, which is to commemorate Saint Giong, one of the four Vietnamese immortals. This event helps us remember the heroin battle of Saint Giong and his people, Van Lang, against foreign enemies in order to protect Vietnamese's freedom and rights. Ċ To summarize, no matter how diverse traditional celebrations are, they all serve the same purpose: being the underpinning of one's society. Thus, disregarding them can bring about severe problems and disadvantages.

prompt: Some people spend their entire lives in one place. Others move a number of times throughout their lives, looking for a better job, house, community, or even climate. Which do you prefer: staying in one place or moving in search of another place? Use reasons and specific examples to support you opinion.
essay: The thriving development of technology has brought along all kinds of transportation medium that allows human to travel a long distance in just a blink of an eye. However, some people just like to stay in one place, while some like to move from places to places, looking for a more conducive environment and community. Personally, I prefer moving in search of a better place. Ċ Life, as we see it, could be compared to a storybook. Without a climax in the story, there is no way that the storybook can be a good one. Similarly, people should live their lives to the fullest by constantly pursuing the things they want.For instance, a better job, house, community and even climates. Life will be meaningless if we just stay in one place, watching the sun rises and sets everyday without a single minor changes in everything around you. Ċ Besides, the technology nowadays has brought us all kinds of transportation whether through air, sea or land. Consequently, it will not be a burden to travel from places to places as the contemporary transportation system has constrained the, huge wide world before, into a much smaller one, where people can just travel around the world in, approximately, 80days. Ċ People should learn to live their live, exploring and experiencing different kind of circumstances. To sum up, I prefer moving from continents to continents in search of another place because there's still a whole new world waiting for me to be explored.

prompt: Many management interviews are based around assessing not only a person’s level of experience and knowledge but also their personality. Is leadership an innate skill? What other characteristics do companies look for in a manager?
essay: A good leader must possess multiple qualities. For this reason, most of the companies need managers with qualities such as good personality, knowledge and experience in their work. Leadership is an acquired skill and heredity can help a person acquire this skill. Ċ Firstly, leadership is one of the most important qualities for any managerial role. People who believe it is an innate skill, give reasons that a person needs to be optimistic and jovial and both these qualities are inherited. However, a person can be a good leader only if one is trusted and respected by team members. It takes effort from the manager, to gain the trust and respect. Hence, it is not just an innate quality, but an acquired one as well. For instance, most of the people feel comfortable in working with a chief who is trustworthy and optimistic. Ċ There are quite a few other qualities that companies look for in anyone with managerial role. Managers must have good communication skills because they need to communicate with the clients and the team members. It is a must to establish a good rapport on both parties to run a project smoothly. For instance, if someone has good relations with a client, then he/she will be able to convince them with the soft skills about the minor delay in the delivery of the project. They need to be as transparent as possible, so that they can set a good example for their teammates in terms of professionalism, dedication etc. They must possess good time management skills. This factor ensures the client of the timely deliveries without putting pressure on the in house teammates. Ċ To conclude, leadership is both innate and acquired in nature. Other than knowledge, personality etc., companies believe, managers must have qualities of soft skills, time management, transparency, optimism etc.

prompt: Parents should take course in parenting, in order to improve the lives of their children. To what extend do you agree?
essay: Parenthood is the most important role of mankind. While some may argue that parents should take training exercises, others may disagree. In my opinion, though I believe that basic training is essential, I do not agree that everything can be taught by such courses. Thus, this essay will discuss both the positive and negative parts of parental training programs. Ċ To begin with, being a parent is not an easy mission. Regardless of previous experiences in being a father or mother, there will still be heaps of dilemmas. To help tackle some of these issues, these courses might come in handy. For example, in the case of new parents. these programs help them to gain an understanding of what all vaccines a newborn child needs to take and when exactly to get them. Therefore, it can be said that parenting lessons can assist the guardians in protecting their infants from ailments and health issues that are easily preventable. Ċ On the other hand, being a parent is a natural phenomenon and thus, the skills needed to be one will come with hands-on experience. Furthermore, every child has their own unique character and behaviour. Hence, classes that give generalized coaching on how to raise them might not prove effective. For instance, a silent introverted kid needs special care and attention compared to an active extroverted one. With the above-expressed view, it is quite clear that, unless individually focused classes are given, the parenthood training might end up being inefficient. Ċ In conclusion, considering the above-mentioned points, I strongly hold my opinion that parenthood coaching though useful to a certain extent is not one hundred per cent efficient in giving proper guidance to raising young ones.

prompt: Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
essay: The main purpose of educational system is to educate students in order to enable them to obtain professional skills. Consequently, common wisdom says that a college student should attend classes, which function as specific passages between professors and students. This is because teaching in classes is how most professors deliver and spread their knowledge and ideas to students. However, some people do not believe that it is necessary for students to attend every class. As I see, absenteeism is inappropriate for students most of the time unless under certain unusual circumstances. Ċ College professors are the experts, who are far more experienced and proficient in the academic fields compared to students. Thus, attending classes is the most effective and efficient way for students to learn. In other words, nonappearance to classes usually hinders students from learning. Clearly, most professors reveal or demonstrate their expertise in the classroom rather than other places. Students who do not come to classes will lose their opportunities to interact with professors. Of course it is possible that a student figure out some knowledge without others' assistance, but this process must be more arduous than learning directly from specialists, who already know the critical concepts and crucial theories in this subject. Ċ Nonetheless, for some special situations, I believe students can be absent from classes only if they can guarantee that they can maintain their progress. For instance, if there is an emergency, or a speech addressed by a renowned scholar, students can decide whether they want to go to class. However, when they make their own choice, they have to understand it is their responsibility to put more efforts in their homework and academic performance. Ċ In a nutshell, I argue that attending classes is of paramount importance for students' education. Even though sometimes, for certain reasons, absenteeism is unavoidable, students should not eschew their learning progress.

prompt: Some people believe that the internet has brought people closer together by making the world smaller. Others disagree, claiming that the internet has made people and communities more isolated because they no longer need to leave home and interact with others. Discuss both views. (No opinion)
essay: The invention of the internet has definitely changed our world. Some people believe that it has changed for the better, bringing humans closer together, whereas others think that the situation has only worsened since nobody really interacts with others anymore. Ċ Firstly, part of our society thinks that the internet has multiple benefits. The web has indeed brought humans closer together since it allows you to contact anyone instantly, even if they live on the other side of the world. Moreover, there are multiple social media where you can post photos, share memories and interact with your friends and family. For instance, if some of your relatives don't live close to you, social media like Twitter and Instagram represent a great idea to keep in touch with them and keep them informed on how you are doing and what you are up to. Ċ On the other hand, the web has surely lead us to become antisocial. Having the opportunity to contact everyone through texts means that we have become lazier and we don't like to meet new people or even old pals and interact with them face to face. Furthermore, the extensive use of smartphones and other technologies has made us suffer from mental health problems like anxiety, so chatting with other members of our society in person feels more like a chore than a pleasure. For example, this has worsened with the pandemic and right now several youngsters feel pressured to go back to how things were before because they're too used to speaking to their peers through a screen. Ċ In conclusion, there are contrasting opinions regarding new technologies. While it's evident that the internet has helped us communicate better, in my opinion, it's undeniable that it also has led to several problems and difficulties.

prompt: Computers are an essential feature of modern education. Some people believe that certain subjects, such as mathematics, are better taught using computers. Others, however, think that there are aspects of education in which computer use is adequate. Discuss both these views and give your opinion.
essay: Nowadays, the use of technology has become a vital part of our lives. some people believe that we can make usage of computers in schools to provide children with better comprehension, innovative style, and consistently available resource to students. Others claim that there is no substitute for human souls. Therefore, Classes led by men are more interactive, so kids can learn better and faster. In this essay, I will share both perspectives and highlight why the blended approach is the best for our children. Ċ There is ample evidence to suggest that a smart technological way of teaching is beneficial. It can help students to have the material 24/7. Moreover, A child can make the value of automation in studying through games and simulated techniques rather than the traditional way of education. Thus, they will be more engaged and productive while studying their lessons. A recent study by Harvard University confirmed that using novel ways of learning can help the learners to be more focused and absorbed so they will retain information better. That's why scholars suggest the use of machinery in our educational system. For instance, Schools can rely on automation in checking answers. Furthermore, online learning can be a good solution in certain times like pandemics. Ċ On the other hand, some researchers believe that education is more than a transfer of information that can be done through technology. However, it's a complex of human interactions that must be led by a real teacher. Since immemorial time, tuition has been done through mentors and scholars. So, the next generation needs such real communication rather than the virtual one. For example, How a student can learn properly if he doesn't have a true role model in the class? Ċ To conclude, it's undeniable that technology has become an essential part of our lifetime. some people welcome it in the schoolwork while others believe in the human-human connection. I feel that the mixed strategy between humans and robotics is what we truly need. Using computers will help kids to evoke imagination while tutors can handle emotions and behaviours in the school.

prompt: In many countries, the rich are becoming richer and poor are becoming poorer. Why is this a problem? What solutions are there to tackle this problem?
essay: Undoubtedly, it goes without saying the lavish people are living a luxurious lifestyle while the destitute people are being suffered from poverty. This disquisition delves into the details of why this kind of development is not welcoming and subsequently will advance some panacea to halting this menace. Ċ To begin with, one of the main issues of in several nations economy is controlled by large corporate houses hence, they only distribute all amenities and welfare to opulent society instead of destitute community consequently, still now this problem is increasing. Another problem is the lack of employment opportunity among impoverished people because wealthy folk can get any job easily than an indigent person due to the opulent have a quality education. For example, according to the survey said that more than 75% of folks are being suffered from poverty in the world. Hence, this trend should be decreased in the future days. Ċ Conversely, could there be any wonder drugs to solve this peril? Certainly, it follows that the authority should take the strictest measures by enforcing laws and punishments to strike a balance between the poor and rich standard. Another possible solution is the authority should be focused on the poverty-stricken person because they are also part of the nation hence, the government should provide all the amenities such as quality education, modern hospital and a plethora of employment job opportunity. For example, the government of Pakistan has been introducing enormous new plans to dwindling down the underprivileged folk's standard of living. Hence, the ministry should be arranged many facilities for the poor. Ċ To conclude, having explored both standpoints, this predicament should be diminished to using the possible solution. Nonetheless, executives should insist on unbreakable rules to dwindle down the discrepancy between poor and rich.

prompt: It is a common aspiration among many young people to run their own business, rather than work for an employer. Do you think the advantages of working for yourself outweigh the drawbacks?
essay: Nowadays many young people seem to have aspiration after running their own business instead of working for a company. This essay strongly believes the advantages of working for yourself can't not outweigh its drawbacks because if they don't have enough experience, they won't be able to conflict with risks and challenges. Ċ One of the prime evidences supporting my idea is the lack of experiences of youngsters. Clearly, being an entrepreneur requires a lot of tactics and personal skill to either confront problems or develop their company and obviously, those, who haven't worked anywhere, don't have this ability. For instance, working for a period of time for a company firstly will help pupils not only learn managing skills from their bosses, get used to the pressures but also comprehend multiple knowledges in a specific domain. Therefore, there will be fewer risks and un-wanted circumstances when they decide to be self-employment. Ċ Although, running an entrepreneur gives them the opportunities to do whatever they want and also create a sense of autonomy rather than following rules, this may cause severe damages. Solemnly, they may be involved in to rivalry with other associations with no capability to compete against due to not having enough competence for facing burden and a wide vision. For example, in Vietnam, there are a vast number of people who want to be affluence by opening coffee shops, restaurants or buying stocks, but apparently, majorities of them have gone down the drain or even failed at the last hurdle just because they can't excel their opponents. Ċ To conclude, running a private company brings lots of dangers and uncertain potentialities. In spite of giving you independence and large amount of income, it could make you be insolvent and indigent. Ergo, it is encouraged for youngsters to contemplate gravely before venturing on staring up.

prompt: Some people suggest that children do not understand the world of work and schools should make teenagers spend a short time working as well as studying academic subject. To what extent do you agree ?
essay: Professions plays an essential role in a mature person's life. However, a lot of youngsters are not able to understand the world of work after graduate, according to some people. Personally, I completely agree with this viewpoint and to my way of thinking, schools should offer teenagers to spend a certain amount of time to work along with studying academic subject. Ċ For a variety of reasons, I firmly believe that it is crucial for students to gain insight into the world of work during schoolyears. Firstly, when students know about how money is earned through hard work, they will be more grateful for what they have at the time. Some children, due to the pampering of their parents, do not understand the value of money and they just expect their parents to provide them with luxurious items. So to my mind, if those children have opportunities to work for a short amount of time, they will understand profoundly the value of money and know how hard their parents have to work and become more appreciative. Ċ Secondly, as being an adult, I aware of the difference between going to work and going to school, and in my opinion, the world of work is a cruel world where people have to be responsible for their work, where mistakes costs fortune, ...Therefore, I think teenagers should be provide with the chance of working as well as studying in order to not get shock in the future when they join the working world. Ċ In conclusion, according to the given reasons, I firmly agree that students should be facilitate to work during schoolyears and that would be a precious experience. However, students should balance between working and studying as spending too much time working can affect adversely on their academic performance.

prompt: The only way to improve safety on the road is to punish drivers more harshly if they break the traffic law. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Traffic safety problems have long been the headlines in agendas for most governments around the world. Some people argue that in order to make road travel safer, stricter punishment should be stipulates for transgressors by the governments. I agree with the view that punishment can succeed in curbing road offences but it should not be taken as the only solution. Ċ Admittedly, a harsh punishment is vital considering its deterrent effect on those who are likely to disobey road regulations. For example, Australia is one of the countries with the safest traffic all over the world. In there, traffic violators are fined more seriously than some other countries, such as people will be detained if they found to have drunk driving and a severe fine will be applied for over speeding rather than just verbal warning in some other places. Therefore, drivers and pedestrians become more aware of traffic law and comply with it better since they know the serious consequence after taking risk. Ċ However, despite the importance of imposing harsh regulations, the authorities should not overlook other options that may sometimes achieve better outcomes. For instance, rising the legal driving age could contribute to the improvement of road safety. Young people are legal to drive motor vehicles after 16 or 17 in some countries, such as Philippines and United Kingdom. However, teenagers are usually more impetuous but less mature than adults that are more likely to disobey the traffic regulations. As a result, postponing the legal driving age, for example to 21.5, in countries with high traffic accident rates could enhance young people's awareness of traffic law since they have more time for receiving education before driving legally. Ċ In conclusion, the apparent effectiveness of the harsher punishment measures on traffic law offenders should be acknowledged. However this is not the only way that achieves better and safer usage of roads. An integrated approach should be adopted such as rising the legal driving age.

prompt: In some countries, young people are less polite and respectful to the old. What are the causes? What can be done to solve this?
essay: Nowadays, it is expressed that in many countries the respect for older does not exist. In this modern life, the youngest are less educated and polite some of them do not have any respectable behave in the old. For this purpose thus essay will be demonstrating the reasons why this is happening. The solution to solve this problem is parents educating their children, teaching them to respect the oldest and young with limits and discipline. Ċ Firstly, teenagers shown patterns of education received into their houses. For example, if the parents educated their children and taught the importance to respect older people, when teenagers, they will do this because they learned this. So the disrespectful and impolite behave of the younger is a result of the education they received in their homes. Ċ Secondly, the actual younger do not have any limits. They think that everything is allowed and everything can be bought. This is a consequence of the education they received in their lives. For instance, if the parents do not teach their children correctly in the future they can not complain about it, because their prospective children are a consequence of their today decisions. Ċ In summary, the responsibility for teaching the children and younger are the adults and parents. Further, if the adults are not available and wish to teach the behave is expected to the younger and children, they cannot complain about in the eventual. Hence today's children are tomorrow adults. An advice is the parents teaching, raising, and educating their children like they want that be treated in a prospective, like to do to other want you to want the other to do for you.

prompt: Nowadays for many people the Internet is replacing regular books. What do you think will happen in the future and what is your opinion about this trend? No Need For Book Stores?
essay: This era has made people rely on the internet heavily in obtaining information. It seems that many individuals have lost their interest in using books as their main reference because the web has many features to offer. Nevertheless, I believe that there will be still some individuals who will regard books as very important source of data in the future. Ċ Internet has become ubiquitous and essential in many aspects of people's lives because it offers many features. Evidently, the net plays a big role in many individuals, may it be in schools, offices or at home. For instance, generally, students first rush to internet cafes instead of going to libraries to do research. Majority of the students prefer searching the web because it is faster and offers latest news and ideas. Moreover, compare to carrying heavy books, many people find it comfortable to bring small gadgets with internet access. Ċ Nevertheless, many bookstores are still productive with their sales because some individuals find books to be important. For example, many best seller book authors choose not to put all information on the web for their books to profit. Moreover, some people love to collect their favorite series of books which they can read over and over again while others prefer giving self-help books as presents. There are also many history books that gives concrete and more accurate information, especially if the authors are reliable. In addition, unlike books, with technical problems,web information that are saved in computers can be erased and not retrieved. Ċ To conclude, the trend of using the internet more than books has become popular nowadays; however, I strongly believe that books will not completely vanish in the future. Many people will still prefer using printed data because it offers complete, accurate and reliable information.

prompt: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Laptop is a thing that is the most necessary for students to help their learning process. Use specific reasons and example to support your answer.
essay: Most of students think that laptop is the first thing that should they have to help their learning process at formal educations or non-formal educations. They should have a laptop even they live in cloistered villages if they take on learning process, but not all of do them have enough financial to buy it. So, how they can be finishing their duty if to finish it needs laptop? Well, if they do not have laptop to be finishing their duty needs laptop they can go to warnet or they can borrow it with their friends. Ċ First of all, laptop can make easy students to get information, theory, knowledge, sharing, etc. It is one of functions as reason why students should have laptop. For instance, if we need to know about anything like what is the simple way to improve and easy to understand what we learn, and no one knows about it. If you have laptop, and yours connect with internet you just need to type what you want to know in search engine of Google, Yahoo, Bing, Wikipedia, Encyclopedia, etc. Ċ Second of all, students can read e-book in laptop. Not only general e-books that are provided by provider, but there are also kinds of e-books of school or campus subject that we can get. Furthermore, students no need to bring many books if they go to school or campus, but they just bring their laptop. Ċ All in all, laptop very will help everyone especially for students to help them in learning process and to load less that they bring when they go to school or campus.

prompt: Establishing good relationship in the workplace is not important, as the primary goal of person is to focus on work. Ċ To what extent do you agree with this statement?
essay: It is commonly argued that the primary goal of everyone is to focus on his/her job duties, while, being on good terms with colleagues is not essential. Although I agree that being productive is more important than trying to befriend at work. I think that is advantageous to have a few friends in the workplace. Ċ On the one hand, maintaining good relations with all co-workers is often hard and even counter-productive. Firstly, it is emotionally demanding to forge friendships with office colleagues. It is almost impossible to cater for every colleague’s needs and interests, be nice even with people who irritate you while work and put you in trouble. Moreover, sometimes it is wiser to eschew the niceties in the favor of productivity. For instance, if everyone tries to build good relationships with co-workers at the job, there are chances less work would be done. Ċ On the other hand, there are many certain reasons to get closer to your teammates. First of all, it will be beneficial to build warm relationships with those who surround you all the time. Many full-time employees spend their time with colleagues than they suppose to do with their families. And thus, they are usually happier than their solitary peers. Secondly, good interpersonal relations results in good teamwork. It is often believed that team members who like and respect each other tend to collaborative on projects more efficiently. Ċ In conclusion, I believe we need to find a healthy balance between being productive at work and forming a social bond. The ideal option is to find friends in the workplace, but not at the cost of our own productivity.

prompt: It has been noted that many people who had a big impact on the world gave themselves completely to their work and did not bother with the idea of “work-life balance”. To what extent should people try to have a good work-life balance?
essay: One of the most conspicuous trends of today's world is a colossal upsurge in the number of people believing that by spending too much time on the work leads to an issue of work-life balance all over the world. There is a wide range of factors that accounts for why this is happening. Although, this has a plethora of reasons yet this situation can be remedied provided that effective measures can be taken. Ċ There are myriads of reasons for this soaring concern, unlike everyday problems which can be dealt with easily, shortage of time , which is extremely perilous that can lead to an array of issues as the growth of children and relationship problem. For instance, nowadays, in cut-throat competition in corporate sectors, employees spend much their time in office. Consequently, they are not able to sit and enjoy with their families which leads to relationship problems. Thanks to the aforementioned predicaments, it is not only people but can society suffers immensely. Ċ Steps to deal with this problem are many, but most ones in fact that not only remote and complicated but practicable and accessible. The primary one stems from the facts that by ensuring the implementation of facts and policies, government authorities can help a nation thrive. Besides, international organizations and local authorities should take all necessary initiatives cumulatively. To exemplify it, when convergent efforts from all the sectors are enured, only then we can see the progress in curbing the problems. Ċ To conclude, dealing with work-life balance is the most effective prevalent that faces people in all parts of the world. Nevertheless, concrete steps discussed above can effectively strengthen the fight against and alleviate this growing complication. Its potential impact is too dire to ignore.

prompt: In many developing countries, there is an increasing movement of workers from rural areas into the cities. Ċ Why do you think this happens? What problems can this cause?
essay: Movement of workers from rural to urban areas is becoming a very predominant phenomenon in developed nations. I believe the concentration of employment opportunities is the principal factor causing this relocation of people who are in search of jobs. Due to the mentioned issue, the members of the many families suffer separation. Also, villages do not get further developed with enhanced work possibilities since the people who can really contribute move to towns. Ċ Firstly, in cities,there are widespread job availabilities in all possible domains because of the ever-changing lifestyle and high competition.
