Competing with counterparts, people set up businesses and hence, to proceed forward with their venture they need skilled as well as unskilled workers. Since it is really hard to keep moving with a few shoulders while expanding. The business owners even become ready for good pay which in turn becomes a great attraction for people moving from villages to cities. For example, according to a statistical survey in 2019, the number of villagers who moved to the urban areas were recorded to be 40% of the rural population. Ċ The movement to make ends meet may sound essential,however, leaves many children separated from their parents, moreover, they can not enjoy the parental care which should have been bestowed on them and therefore, they feel the sense of being left out. For instance, According to a Social science department study,it was revealed about 25% of the families got separated as a consequence of such migration. In addition to the aforementioned , because of people relocating from rural regions, the development of work opportunities is impacted due to the lack of minds and labour. Ċ To summarize, I opine employment to earn drives the migration from rural to urban leaving aside the families apart and villages undeveloped in terms of job avenues.

prompt: Some people say success in a person's life as an adult is the result of the way he was brought up by his parents. Do you agree or disagree? father's and mother's contribution to a child success
essay: The success of a person's life is regarded to be a result of the way he was brought up by his parents. In my opinion, I personally agree with this idea, and I will explain why. Ċ On the one hand, regarding the importance of parents, it is undeniable that these mothers and fathers play a vital role in children's development, both mental and physical aspects. To ensure their children having a bright future, parents these days are taking their son and daughters to many academies, including mandatory schools, talent institutions and sports clubs, resulting in pushing the process of seeking for their strength. These talented abilities, ranging from playing musical instruments and sports to be excelled in mathematics, are proved to have significant effects on a person's successful career. It is notable, for example, that there are numerous people are capable of utilizing their strength to make way for success, as we see in Mozart, the pianist with talented skills denoted by his father, and Shinzo Abe, the vice president of Japan who is persuaded by his parent to be a politician. Ċ On the other hand, though, a person's living environment is sometimes believed to have impacts on his future. For example, if a child grows up in a neighborhood where citizens are members of criminal crews, he will likely end up a gangster. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that parent is crucial to a person's successful life, since fathers and mothers help to find their children talents.

prompt: The consumption of the world's resources ( oil, and water, etc.) is increasing at a dangerous rate. What are the causes and solutions?
essay: Natural resources over-use is a challenging problem in today's world that need to be put into consideration. There are a variety of reasons behind this, yet there are viable measures to mitigate this resources over-consumption phenomenon. Ċ First and foremost, the advancements in technology, development and research in the contemporary era increase the exploitation of minerals and raw materials. In addition, a rapid and consistent increase in the population expands the needs for resources; as a result, the resources would also be excessively exploited for business purposes. Finally, the forest areas which are the source of valuable materials for medicine and food are being cleared for farming industries. This would lead to the extinction of many wild species and also responsible for natural disasters such as flooding and drought. Ċ Measures should be taken in order to deal with this severe problem. One possible solution is that the government should educate people with the sustainable use of natural resources. Furthermore, renewable energy such as solar and wind power can be explored more and utilized to reduce the dependency on fossil fuel which can also reduce the amount of toxic emission into the environment. Last but not least, conservation projects such as growing trees or Earth hour should be often held to spread the messages of natural resources preservation and raise awareness of people. Ċ To summarize, the depletion of natural resources is the human being's problem that needs to be resolved. However, it can hardly be solved by only the government's work. It takes a great deal of effort from both the authority and individuals.

prompt: Some people claim that many things that children are taught at school are a waste of time. Other people argue that everything that children study at school is useful at sometime. Ċ Discuss the both views and give your opinion.
essay: What should and should be not a part of school curriculum, has always been a debatable issue. In the viewpoint of some people, certain subjects like history and art taught to the students, have no practical use in real life and hence should not be included as a part of the education, while others are of diverse opinion. I, believe that every course learnt at a younger stage, adds value to the kid's life in one way or the other. This essay will analyse both the views as well as provide a logical conclusion. Ċ On one hand, opponents of history, art and similar subjects, believe that pupils already have enough on their plate and therefore, the courses that are unlikely to be useful, in their future, should be excluded from the syllabus. For instance, the social studies mainly contain information about the past life of the man on the planet and the wars that took place in the yesteryears. However, today's theme is totally different from the last few decades, and wars are almost impossible, which makes the learning quiet irrelevant. Additionally, according to this group, creative courses like art and crafts, are only useful to the young minds, talented in that area, as they can pursue a career in the specific field, sometime in future. But, making these subjects mandatory for everyone, just increases the academic burden on the pupils. Ċ On the other hand, the individuals who opine that everything learnt in school, is helpful to the minors at some stage, argue that even though the facts and figures learnt from any topic might not be directly applicable in real circumstances, they might be useful indirectly. To cite an example, even though reading about the battles between the Mughals and Sultans, seems a waste of time, it enlightens a child about the disasters, humankind can face due to the wars. Moreover, it also gives an idea about the culture as well as the traditions of the nation to him/her. To illustrate it, often the books describe the Kings, queens and their kingdoms before the anecdotes, which is an insight into the ancient day rituals. Furthermore, painting and drawing, assist the younger ones in channelising their negative emotions, such as jealousy and frustration, which can reduce incidents of bullying in schools. Ċ To conclude, all subjects taught in educational institutions, help in the all-round development of the kids in one way or another. In my view, it is baseless to believe that certain things are a waste of time, as each topic imparts knowledge about different areas and aids the curiosity of fresh minds.

prompt: Some people believe that electronics should not be allowed in school until after the pupils have mastered mental arithmetic. Others believe that calculators save pupils time, especially with complicated calculations. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Indeed, nowadays counting is not a complicated thing to do, because technology has provided electronic way which is called calculator. While some people believe that calculator could help children's study, is it a helpful thing for a student in the school? I believe there are some benefit or drawbacks which are needed to see further. Ċ Generally, calculator is human's best friend. This device could solve calculation faster than manual fashion by using machine which has formula. That is why students also tend to bring calculator to school to help them in arithmetic or mathematics subject. Some schools believe that calculator is modern fashion which has a helpful formula to do student task. However, I believe this is not a good thing to use, because students will attract them to be a lazy pupil, and this tool could influence them to have no curiosity to do exercise and homework. Ċ Obviously, learning arithmetic is needed. This is because when a student could master the arithmetic, they could be smart people in basic calculation which could create a new formula which could be implemented in technology. Moreover, I think because final exam or national examination is forbidden to bring, so it is good for student to study and practice more arithmetic further, then they could pass the final or improve academic performance. Ċ In conclusion, I presume that although calculator is a helpful thing for student, but it is not appropriate to be used in school, and it is better to enhance arithmetic further. I also think that arithmetic also could be a challenge for a student to be more creative.

prompt: More and more people are leaving the countryside and moving to cities. Do the advantages of this trend outweighs the disadvantages.
essay: A growing number of people are moving from rural to urban centres. Although relocating to cities has its own downsides, However, I believe the upsides which include access to adequate amenities and employment opportunities far outweigh the disadvantages. Ċ The benefits of living in urban areas cannot be overemphasized.To begin with, one of the advantages is that there are diverse jobs in Metropolitan.In other words, there are vast companies and organisation where people can work ,so that they can earn a living for themselves and their families.To illustrate this, A Recent report in Adelaide Company in Port Harcourt showed that 80% of their employees are from remote areas. Another important advantage is that there is access to good infrastructures in urban centres.These include standard health facilities, a good transport system, proper water and waste disposal ,clean water and good education. Thus,all this would bring about a good standard of living for the residents. Ċ Turning to the downsides,the challenges one can encounter include a lack of housing. This is because the centres are overpopulated, so the houses are not sufficient enough to accommodate the larger proportion of people. For instance, a lot of people living in Lagos are without accommodation, so most sleep at the bridge side and other available places after the day work. In addition, there could be widespread communicable diseases in city centres .This is because it is overcrowded, so there is inadequate ventilation for the urban dwellers. Ċ In conclusion, an increasing number of individuals migrate to urban from rural areas.While there are demerits to this trend, In my opinion, the merits which include accessibility to proper facilities and diverse occupations supersede the drawbacks.

prompt: Nowadays artificial intelligence is being used to drive cars. Why is this happening? Is it positive or negative development?
essay: Over the past few years, self-driving cars have been becoming quite common by dint of the emergence of artificial intelligence. It is due to the advent of futuristic technology, and it denotes a welcoming developmental as it immensely improves road safety. Ċ In contemporary society, modern technology has excelled in all fields, including the automobile industry. Scientists have designed computer systems that can control different functions of cars. To be detailed, specific data is installed in the core systems, which not only monitors its smooth drive,Remove the commaapplyThe comma before the conjunction but also appears to be unnecessary. Consider removing it. Ċ show examples but also continually provides updates via the global positioning system for the chosen route. Besides, intelligence demonstrated by machines can think instead of a human and select an appropriate algorithm by analysing the best efficient solutions for driving purposes. Therefore, several car companies tend to avail of artificial intelligence. For instance, a famous car brand named Tesla has designed automated self-control vehicles that are becoming desirable for their precision, accuracy, and safety. Ċ Machine intelligence should be welcomed owing to the possibility of reducing the number of road traffic accidents. It is scientifically that most collisions are in light of human mistakes, but with the help of AI devices, people will probably eliminate the potential of involving in accidents. This means incidents, such as drunk driving, falling asleep at the wheel and speeding, become a thing of the past. Hence, drivers will not be nervous and feel a sense of protection. For example, most of the Tesla autonomous cars' drivers state that they feel comfortable and have never been in trouble related to car accidents. Ċ In conclusion, the emergence of computer-controlled transportation has been inevitably becoming the new standard in the car industry. Because the technologies are developing in the right way, I uphold the conviction that this trend is a positive impact as it would improve traffic safety standards.

prompt: Technology has changed the way people communicatr today. Some people belive this is making our relationship stronger while others believe it is harming them. Discuss both points of view and give your own opinion.
essay: The current technological advancements have altered the process of sharing information among the crowd.In this context, a few individuals believe that these are helpful for companionships ,whereas, others opine that they are giving a negative impact on the community.I am inclined towards the former view. The aim of the essay is to review both the standpoints and elaborate on my opinion. Ċ To begin with, I support the prospect that modern scientific inventions are helping to strengthen our relationships due to the following reasons.Firstly, it is because of the modern science outputs that we are now able to maintain a smooth companionship with our distant relations.Thus we are able to be in touch with me through these electronic devices.For instance, mobile has decreased the distance and improved the communication mechanisms with our far relatives.As a result of this, we can now call anyone in the world anytime.Secondly, Internet has become a platform to message our childhood friends.In other words, without this technological enhancement, it would have been impossible to get in touch with the public who are almost vanished from our lives.Therefore I am in support of this view. Ċ On the other hand,some opine that current updates in science are outsourcing many threats to public relations.This is because many of the public are being trapped in false friendships on social media and making their life hell.For example, the internet is a global media and anyone can easily contact the other and start a companionship.As a consequence, the population is sometimes getting dragged into narrow-minded and dishonest relationships.Hence, some individuals feel that technology is harming the population. Ċ To conclude, the essay has discussed both viewpoints and the people's objectives behind those statements.However, I feel that technology is helping us to strengthen our relations.Overall, I am more inclined towards the people holding the former view.

prompt: children's excessive habit of gaming Topic: Today many children spend a lot of time on playing computer games and little time on sports. Why is it? Is it a positive or negative development?
essay: Children nowadays dedicate a significant part of their time to video games instead of physical activities. This phenomenon stems from a host of factors, ranging from the improvements in game design to the negligence of parents. I opine that this development would be detrimental to a child's growth. Ċ Game designers are striving to keep their players online for longer and parents appear reluctant to address this. Online games now have great visuals, a fascinating storyline, and a reward system, which makes playing games more appealing than playing sports. Specifically, gamers can gain instant rewards without going out and draining their bodies. Parents are also to blame as they give their offspring the permission and the tools. For example, Vietnamese parents are being heavily criticized for permitting their children to use smartphones nonstop, in return for their obedience, such as finishing their meals. Ċ Excessive gaming impacts children negatively. Firstly, they may not engage in healthy social interactions, hence their lack of social skills in the future. Studies have suggested that real-life interactions help to hone children's soft skills and adapt their behaviors to social norms, which is critical to their competence in adulthood. Additionally, spending to much time on games adversely affect children's health. Heavy focus on computer games instead of working out would not only impair the body's growth but also severely affect mental stability. Ċ In conclusion, parents' carelessness and sophisticated game technologies are the culprits for children's excessive habit of gaming. Young individuals should be restricted to playing games less and be encouraged to engage in sports with their peers, as it benefits their social life and wellbeing.

prompt: Some people says that the universities must only accept students with high mark. Others believe that universities must accept students off all ages regardless of their previous grades. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: University education has become a popular topic among people. While many people believe that the educational institutions must solely admit top-scorers, others think that all ages students irrespective of the previous grades which they held must be accepted. As well as offering my personal opinion, this essay will discuss of these views, and shows why universities must ultimately give priority to high-achievers, but why the accessibility of university education has its benefits. Ċ On the one hand, there are growing number of people who believe that only students who have higher grades must be accepted by universities. Students who are with high mark spend their valuable time to enter into a top university instead of playing video games, watching TV. Worse, they suffer from physical and mental problems during this preparation process. For instance, today, many students, who desire to get into a university which has a reputation, cope with a high level stress, anxiety, posture problems, losing weight, parental pressure and more, which cause of excessive studying. Therefore, undoubtedly, only the top scorers must be admitted by universities. Ċ On the other hand, universities must be made accessible to all, irrespective of their previous marks, according to some. The main reason behind this idea is that they think that a fresh graduate who holds a diploma can easily find a job. For example, 30% of British graduates are currently working in jobs that require a degree. For these reasons, there are a number of people who believe that universities must be accessible to everyone. Ċ In conclusion, having a degree is a common desire among people. This essay clearly has discussed why only the top scorers must be ultimately admitted to universities, and why these educational institutions should be accessible to everyone. In my opinion, universities must only accept students with high grades because these students strive to get into universities after a high level of determination as required by the competitive nature of the job market.

prompt: Educating young people is naturally important. However, some think governments ought to invest more education for adults in need. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Some people believe that state government should allocate their budget to educate the young generation while others argue that oldsters should become a priority target who receives the learning process. I am completely convinced of the former argumentation since youngsters take a crucial part in the development process of the nations and have many chances to explore many new-fashioned fields. Then, I would elaborate on these rationalizations in the forthcoming paragraphs. Ċ To begin with, the future of the countries is fully determined by juveniles who are growing nowadays. Furthermore, they would be a leader in their chosen sectors. So that is why authorities should prepare their human resources appropriately by providing many suitable programmes to encourage them to be an expert in their various subjects. This phase will lead them to obtain many-valued experiences which can elevate human resources in their countries. Research conducted by the University of Helsinki in 2018 showed that the Scandinavian countries are known as educationally focused states in a lot of diverse levels attaining the economic goal quickly rather than other developing nations. This result elucidates that education held a vital role in the advancement of a region. Ċ Moving to another reason, teenagers have many new chances to develop themselves in the cutting-edge era. Moreover, advanced technology acquires world societies to be suitable in the abrupt alterations so that the communities who do not fit in this situation will fall behind. In addition, adolescents can explore up-to-date knowledge to enrich their specific abilities where they can fill the difficult challenges in the upcoming years with their skills. Hence, it will offer a bright future to their homelands. For instance, the youngest can learn deeper about data science to operate artificial intelligence where it is projected will replace humans to do their occupations. Ċ To sum up, the public has different ideas about giving education to the mature and immature. However, I totally vote for adolescents who are gained more grants to study instead of old people due to the fact they will be flourished in various ways and answer the obstacles related to technology.

prompt: Over the last few decades, the media has projected the image of women as young and thin. What problems has this caused? What solutions can you suggest to this? a pattern of beauty and its impact on women
essay: Nowadays, the beauty of woman is measured by how young and slim their body are. This is led by a massive advertisement using woman as an object. Overall, it will lead woman to follow the trend and create health issues. Thus, there should be some aids from all around to solve these issues. Ċ It is noticeable that due to the artificial perspective of beauty, more and more woman want to be skinnier and less-aged. They put effort to follow the beauty standa by plastic surgery, cosmetic medicine and many more. This demand has become an obsession, and this is not as simple as we think because obsession come with a consequence that if it is not fulfilled. Cintia, an actress from my country always be forced to be beautiful by netizen, trapped to follow trend and has gotten her nose job for over five times in order to get a younger shaped face. Yet, instead of become more beautiful, she is now depressed as she fell ashamed to her fail surgery. And this phenomenon happen to other woman all over the world. Hence, an education about self-confident and loving ourselves the way we are, must be done in this crucial level. This will minimalize the dissatisfaction of the way they look as they are getting older. Ċ It is also evident that more women face health issues due to the overused cosmetic as they want to be beautiful. Even woman in young ages, practice unhealthy diet in order to be thinner. My friend is suffered from anorexia as she consumes dietary medicine. I believe the parents must carefully watch and keep their children from this phenomenon. Ċ To sum up, I really urge a careful education and support from family to tackle these effects of the media's designed-beauty standard.

prompt: Question Many shops work for 24 hours a day 7 days a week; some people see it as a good idea, while others don't. Compare different views of customers, shop workers and the whole society of this subject and give your opinion about it. Answer
essay: Nowadays, shops work for twenty four hours and seven days a week to get more profit. Some people think that is a good notion and others discord with it. In this essay, I will explore the statement based on customers, shop workers and whole society. Ċ According to customers view, it is immense advantage for customers if shop opens for twenty four hours a week. In emergency, they can buy medicines at the midnight. For example, recently my cousin infected with wheezing problem and he struggle for breathing at night and prescribed medicine is over at home. On that time his father went to medical shop and buy medicines for him. It is an enormous advantage in emergency period. Ċ On the other hand, according to shop workers view, it is a great disadvantage for shop workers if they work for more hours that result in stress and anxiety. Moreover there will not be much customers result in more use of man power electricity and it lead to loss of the company. For example, my neighbor shop works all twenty four hours due to greediness and there is no profit at night time result in close of shop due to insufficient fund. Ċ In addition, based on whole society it is useless to open shops at midnight there will be less or no customers for the shopkeeper. People will sleep at night so no one comes for shopping. Ċ In a nutshell, by comparing customers, shop workers and whole society view it is unnecessary to open a shop at night it will be a significant loss to the shop keeper. Only at emergency time need a shop but if people should buy their items in advance at the day time itself which result in wealthy and prosperous world.

prompt: WRITING TASK 2 The ownership of cars should be restricted to one per family in order to reduce traffic congestion and pollution. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It might be true that private automobile owner reflect wealth status of individual. A number of private automobile has soared since a decade ago, yet it has produced traffic congestion and some pollution. Based on that issues, I totally agree if the number of own car per house is limited and I will discuss the reasonable reason in the following paragraphs. Ċ The first, the overwhelming number of private automobile is not synergy with the large of roads. It becomes the primary factor of traffic jam since the roads being overcrowded, which contributing most of people spend their time in the road. The capital city of Indonesia, for instance, has occurred increase of traffic congestion annually due to individual car possess. In consequence, traffic jam is able to make late either for students or workers. Indeed, it takes up amount of their energy. Therefore, it is vital to strict the number of car in a house (a car per house) in order to reduce the traffic congestion. Ċ Look at to the other consequence, the high number of car private contributes the amount of pollutions, particularly air pollution. As people know that gas emission from fuel are contain numerous gasses which is dominated by carbon dioxide. Breathing carbon dioxide up is eminent in case human's organ damage. Moreover, pollution is capable of accelerating the human's aging, making people seem like older than the actual age. So, limitation of car owner is the one of ways to make a fall the amount pollution. Ċ To sum up, people are able to save their time effectively in the road if there is no traffic jam anymore, also they can enhance longevity of life. I absolutely agree if the government create the rules about restriction of number of car per home.

prompt: Some people believe that technology has made men more sociable, and others think that it has made us less sociable. discuss both views? Technology and Socialization
essay: Many people believe that technological advancement has made humans less sociable. Others believe that the opposite is true. Although technology is causing the growing loss of physical communication between people, this essay argues that technological progress has given us an unprecedented number of opportunities to become more sociable. Ċ On one hand, innovations in technology allow us to get anything we want without the need of physical communication to anyone. Various online shopping applications offer a simple click of a button which results in product being delivered to our doorstep in no time. Numerous dating websites have led to the decreasing number of real life dates, where people are too scared to interact with each other face-to-face. A recent research has shown that only 28% of single men agree to go on a real date after getting to know the partner on a dating website. Ċ However, technology now allows people to socialize more, because it removes the variables of distance and time out of the equation. Whereas in the past a person could only send a certain amount of text on paper, because it was costly and it took a long time to be delivered, now one can send an electronic letter of any length. Various social media and websites are aimed at connecting friends and acquaintances together, therefore, building and improving their social skills. My mother, for example, who always refused to attend school anniversary meetings, loves to chat with the same classmates via an online chat. Ċ Some would argue that technology makes us fail at being more social due to the lack of physical interaction, while others believe that it makes us communicate with each other even more. I believe technology helps us socialize better, because it has created so many effective means for it.

prompt: Some people think that strict punishments for driving offenses are the key to reducing traffic accidents. Others, however, believe that other measures would be more effective in improving road safety. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
essay: Nowadays, the vehicle ratio increase dramatically than ever before at the same time way casualty is increasing. A fair amount of society thinks that a severe penalty can decrease shipment disaster while others say that take other actions would be more successful in order to develop line safety. I believe strict laws should be there to punish the driving offenders whereas a combination of other methods would bring better results. Ċ To begin with, the severe penalty can diminish the driving crime because the folk can only be afraid of the punishment otherwise is not possible. Some society consciously and subconsciously follows the line rules because they clearly know the fine and punishment when an accident might happen. For example, some western countries government should follow the shipment rules and regulations as a result, the route casualty dead decrease than in Asian country. Ergo, this is the best way to reduce route hazard. Ċ On the other hand, there are already severe punishments for driving offenders including ceasing a driving license, monetary fines and imprisonment. Despite this, the number of lane casualty is increasing every year. This why I believe that only punishments can not ensure lane security and safety. A combination of other initiatives is also required. First, we need to aware of the consequence of the violation can bring our life. Secondly, the requirements of passing the driving test should be standardised and made more practical, especially in developing countries where folk can use the advantages of corruption. It is often noticed that many juveniles are given driving licences without scrutinising their experience and skills. This should be completely avoided and after a certain period, each driver should be retested. Thirdly, unfit vehicles should not be allowed to run on the roads as their cars cause more hazard according to the recent path Transport Authority report. Finally, the transportation system of a country should be modernised and more surveillance cameras and speed test cameras should be there. Ċ To conclude, a penalty to reduce lane violation is a good way to make the path safer whereas the combination of other steps would bring more desired results. In my opinion ,about , both the transportation punishments as well as other actions should be combined to avoid roadway hazard and path safer. This trend is conducive for harmony life.

prompt: You should spend about 40 minutes on this task. Ċ Some educationalists say that every child should be taught how to play a musical instrument. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Ċ You should write at least 250 words.
essay: Teaching connoisseurs throughout the world have debated whether youngsters should be provided musical devices training such as guitar and piano. I strongly agree with the view owing to the fact that it boosts their mental development. This essay will shed light on the matter and provide evidence to prove the arguments. Ċ Several reasons take experts to believe that these skills are fundamental to teenagers. First and foremost, musical apparatus helps children mental and psychological development. In other words, these devices build brain emotions such as emotional imprint, feelings, and desire. For instance, recent research carried out by Cambridge University showcased that 70% of teenagers who experienced guitar playing in earlier stages of their lives were more emotive than those who did not. As a result, it increased their probability to be well-succeeded in future pursuits. Furthermore, it is the overriding motive for increased children intelligence worldwide. Ċ Secondly, sound instruments are the way out to overcome life's challenges. Because of employment shortfall in a plethora of nations, this orientation is seen as the refuge. Let us take African lands as an example, recent investigation by the University of Oxford pointed out that 70% of children followed the branch for surviving reasons. Hence, they encountered a way to suffice their needs and increase their family's income. Moreover, the overwhelming majority of musicians today are in the area solely to sustain their families. Ċ In conclusion, indeed, sound apparatus is worthy for youngsters. For this motive, I strongly agree with the statement. In addition, I would recommend ruling power throughout the planet introduce it in all levels of education and provide assistance for those who certainly want to come into the field as professionals.

prompt: Some people think taking care of one's health is not only for individual benefits. It should also be a responsibility for society. To what extent do you agree?
essay: In the present age, keeping individuals' health are playing increasingly important role in our lives. But at the same time, controversy has arisen whether society should take the responsibility for keeping citizens' health. Someone would argue that maintaining their own health is not only their own responsibility but also society has responsibility to do it. Personally, I think this view overlooks the important factors of this issue. Ċ Convincing arguments can be made that society bearing all responsibilities of their health may carry out some potential risks. First of all, it seems that society may have financial crises. There is ample evidence suggesting that individuals may be overly dependent on the society, which may lead to large amount of expenditures. Moreover, keeping healthy body is their own responsibility. Obviously, people have right to determine that what goes into their own body and their lifestyles. Society is not about to deter their own decisions. Ċ On the other hand, it is worth pointing out there are arguments supporting the opinion that society necessarily takes responsibility for individuals' health. The major idea is assisting impoverished families. It is evident that in terms of health problem needy families are not able to pay for better quality of foods. Therefore, they require society to supporting them, thereby keeping a healthy physique. Despite this, an apparent problem with this opinion is that it may levy higher taxes. Consequently, we should not overlook the fact that in order to cover this huge amount of expenditure, government need to impose high taxes to meet citizens' needs. Ċ By way of conclusion, regarding this issue, my own view is that although it may have a responsibility to help needy to maintain a good health, I firmly believe that keeping healthy physique is the best interests of them. Also, I would argue that it seems highly advisable for individuals to choose healthier lifestyles rather than sedentary lifestyles.

prompt: Topic: "In certain cultures old age is considered to be more important while in others it's the opposite, children are thought to be more important. Discuss both views and give your opinion."
essay: Every cultures and society consist of varied mixture of different age group people.Since many years, it has been a controversial topic to identify what age group rendered most towards society welfare. Some people think that young people is indispensable for the development of the society. Whereas, others, whilst may content that older people's contribution towards better society is colossal. Ċ Admittedly, old people holds galore information and invaluable experience in many spheres of life. The fact that they are exposed to the real world for a good amount of year, make them perfectly capable and eligible for upholding the overall responsibility to make the society a better place to live in. Ċ Furthermore , it cannot be denied that old people not only carry imperative qualities such as good morals and ethics, truthfulness, sincerely and respect, but also act as a pristine source in imparting or inheriting such qualities to young people. Moreover, it is also true that adolescents maintain discipline and decorum because they are being controlled and guided by elders. Ċ However, young people are the future of society. It is excepted that younger generation are very assertive in nature, physically and mentally stronger and dedicated to their goals and aims. Since they are recent graduates from colleges, their mind is fresh, capable of innovative and out of box thinking and updated with the latest technological skills and information.Such important qualities are obligatory to boost the society's economy. They are boon to the society. Ċ To sum up, I would concede that people from all age group is important to society.Each age group people has their unique role and hold equal shares of responsibilities towards the progress of society.

prompt: Some believe that younger family members should be legally responsible for supporting older family members when they become physically, mentally and financially unable to look after themselves. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The majority of the population think that elder family members ought to be catered to legitimately by younger family members when they do not look after themselves independently. I do not advocate with the opinion of the majority and am going to reflect my own view. Ċ On the one hand, humans may be gaga or doddery when they become old because of various negative influences and so they do nothing individually like babies. Older people depend on the help of the young generation. In this case, the government should care about the life of older ones. Likewise, the authority should implement new rules that young individuals must be responsible for sustaining their older family members and so special privileges should be created for these family households. Such as, they should be released from different taxes. Additionally, they should be given a certain amount of money. Ċ On the other hand, younger family members should not be legally responsible for looking after older households. Because, if families are poor and do not have enough money to cater to older mankind. They cannot care well, as a result, the quality of older people life may be worsening. Hence, the government should create different entertainment facilities for older mankind. For example, different clubs should be built for older individuals , in this way, they can interact with other their peers. This can help to lose the different health problems. Moreover, older people forget all of their issues and feel more cheerful. Ċ In conclusion, I would stress that I support definitely the statement and my arguments confirm this.

prompt: bioengineered food consumption evaluation Topic: Recently, genetically-modified foods becomes a new solution to agriculture productivity. Discuss the advantage and disadvantages.
essay: In light of technological development, genetically-modified foods which were considered as a substitute to conventional ones have gained prevalence among consumers these days. While these bioengineered foods may offer some disadvantages, I am convinced that these are outweighed by its advantages. Ċ On the one hand, foods produced through genetic modification might exert some negative impacts on both individuals and society. Primarily, people tend to suffer from various health issues when consuming bioengineered foods. This means genetic engineering techniques could trigger abnormal gene groups in food, resulting in some diseases including food allergies and genetic disorders among people. Additionally, genetically-modified foods would require not only diligent research but also testing by scientists to make it safe for human consumption. Such a time-consuming process along with exorbitant expenditure appears to put a great economic burden on society. Ċ However, my view is that there are more benefits associated with these genetically-engineered foods. The fundamental one is that the technology of genetic modification would enable plants to become resistant against diseases and adaptive to environmental changes. As a result, the crops these days are likely to yield a larger quantity of output, thereby ensuring a more sustainable food supply when compared to the past. Another positive aspect is the high nutritional level brought by just a small portion of bioengineered food consumption. For example, in Vietnam, genetically-modified rice with high levels of vitamin A would not only help vitamin deficiency but also reduce the risk of diabetes due to consuming a sufficient amount of rice on a daily basis. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that despite some negative aspects, more positive aspects could be seen in genetically-modified food consumption.

prompt: Computers today can quickly and accurately translate languages, therefore, it is a waste of time to learn a foreign language.To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The computer is the most powerful and successful invention in the history of human history. These days, computers translate non-native languages without any error and within fractions of a second, that is why many believe that learning a foreign language is a lost cause, I disagree with this notion for the following reasons. Ċ Firstly, Learning a foreign language is very crucial for the advancement of technology and globalization. This is because computers can not be used for every human interaction. For Instance, a computer can't speak on behalf of human beings and this purpose can only be served when one knows that particular tongue. If one wants to travel to a foreign country then they can't carry any translator or machine with them unless they are aware of that countries' mother tongue. Ċ Secondly, Even though computers can translate texts but they can not serve the purpose of writing any content. The reason for this is that a computer is just a machine that has been designed by us to function as per our needs. Additionally, it can't fulfil the purpose of any corporates dealings where each and every word matter. For example, when multi-national companies sign a business deal, all legalities and other cultural aspects need to be considered very carefully and that can only be done by linguistics. Ċ To conclude, in my opinion, learning a foreign language not only is very important for global trade and the growth of any country but this is also beneficial for citizens to understand others values and cultures which might help them to overcome existing issues.

prompt: Healthcare should not be provided for free regardless of a person's income. The health of an individual is in their own hands. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The notion of providing healthcare based on a person’s income is one I do not agree with. Although a person’s health is their own responsibility, basic healthcare needs to be made available to the public. I do not believe in a free healthcare system, but instead, one which is subsidized by the government, thereby protecting the middle and impoverished sections of humanity, whilst at the same time providing equal and fair treatment to the wealthy. Ċ 	To begin with, in many developing countries there are many people living below the poverty line, who are unable to buy basic medicine for treating even the simplest of problems. The main reason for this is the fact that many people are uneducated, and are working low-paying jobs. For example, in Moldova, The rationalization of duplicated specialized services, therefore, remains a key challenge facing the health system. Other challenges include health workforce shortages (particularly in rural areas) and improving equity in financing and access to care by reducing out-of-pocket (OOP) payments. Ċ Secondly, my opinion is further bolstered by the factor that the good health of working employees defines the growth of the nation as employment sectors are largely responsible for proliferating the economy of the country. In this modern and hectic lifestyle, people are working relentlessly in various sectors such as education, health, agriculture, and information technology, as a consequence, the productivity of these areas leads to the development of the nation. Henceforth, to produce a healthy workforce for the betterment of the country, it is important for the government to provide healthcare facilities. The free medical coverage for the native people of the USA serves as the best example of this approach. Ċ In conclusion, while everyone is responsible for keeping themselves fit, in my perspective, the provision of medical subsidies by the government is vital not only for the financially poor people but also for the working professionals to uplift the economy of the country.

prompt: The world is changing rapidly. An increasing number of people change their jobs and the places they live frequently. Is this a negative or a positive development?
essay: As the rapid changing of the modern world, more and more people make their decisions to alter jobs and even their residence currently. This phenomenon, however, has shown more demerits than its merits, as far as I am concerned. Ċ It is undeniable that the popularity of changing jobs and living places has contributed to the whole society greatly in various aspects. For one thing, companies are likely to benefit from the different ideas, advanced techniques and innovative management methods brought by the new employees. For another, moving to another place to live can also encourage the local residents to be more tolerant and promote the cultural communication in social or global dimension. Ċ However, there are apparently wide ranges of negative impacts in terms of frequent changing, which cannot be ignored. In the first place, a great number of corporations loathe losing, hiring and training employees frequently. One of the manifest reasons is that the ripple effect of job-hopping can be quite costly and time-consuming. What is more, losing an employee in relatively high and crucial position may even cause vicious competitions amongst companies in the industry. In the second place, many people moving in and out of an area too often is likely to give rise to a lack of sense of community. Consequently, the local residents may lose the feeling of safety living in this area, which can be regarded as one of the causations of social instability. Ċ To sum up, changing jobs and residences frequently is more likely a negative development in current society than a positive one. Therefore, people should be aware that changing is not an excuse of escaping the reality. It is reasonable only when it can bring a better job or life.

prompt: People should follow the customs and traditions when people start to live in a new country. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Life in a foreign country bring some principles
essay: Some people argue that living in a new country is means that people should learn the customs and traditions of new place. I completely agree with that opinion. Ċ People who live in new country without understanding the customs will have more problems. Firstly, it is difficulties for new residents who do not follow customs a traditions of host country. For example, when people want to start their own business, they have to know local business custom in order to be successful. Secondly, some actions will be illegal in the host country and will make local people anger. For instance, Singapore is the best country about the clean. If new individuals throw the trash on the street, they will be punished and have to pay the fee. Ċ On the other hand, there are a lot of benefits of following local customs and traditions. First of all, it is easily to make friends when new comers understand local customs and traditions. Furthermore, new immigrant will enjoy the traditions and be able to take part in community life. For example, they can participant festival with new friends when they have mutual understanding. Ċ In conclusion, for the reason I mentioned above. I strongly believe that live in new country, people have to know and understand local customs to blend into the host country.

prompt: The gap between the rich and the poor The gap between the rich and the poor is getting wider. The rich are getting richer but the poor are getting poorer. What is the reason for this situation and what actions should be taken to fix it.
essay: In recent years, currency has become a broad issue to the general public. As society advances, there exists a bigger gap between the rich and the poor. Although noticeable, the impact of this issue has not been realized by many residents. Discussed below are several reasons as well as solutions to this phenomenon. Ċ There are some main reasons for the fact that exists a gap between the rich and the poor. To begin with, globalization has affected the world economy. This means that some multi-nationals like McDonald, KFC, and Lotteria which have joined the trend, would earn much more income than others. Therefore, the poor would lag behind and the rich would earn more money. What is more, education is the second reason. This is because of the fact that rich people enjoy various levels of the taxonomy of thinking. They have good live conditions while the poor do not. For example, people live in many rural areas in Vietnam could not afford to go to school. Ċ In order to solve such problems, people should take some certain solutions. One of the most primary solutions is that governments should create job opportunities for poor people and teach them how to survive financially. Furthermore, they should receive some scholarships for empowering their capacities. Admittedly, such solutions would not be implemented in the near future. Yet, they at least deserve our consideration. Ċ In conclusion, the above-mentioned facts have outlined the reasons as well as the measures of this phenomenon. The given suggestions would be a good step towards solving them. Therefore, authorities should have further consideration on this issue.

prompt: Many jobs that are done by people are now done by machines and computers. Some people that this is a positive development while others feel this is a negative for society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Due to the advancement of technology, many jobs can now be achieved by the use of machines and computers. This development has a great impact on our society and it is good to know whether this is a positive or a negative tendency. Some people feel that this is an advantageous trend, while others believe that this has negative impacts on our community. Personally, I tend to support the latter approach. Ċ This innovation has made people's life much easier and more convenient. Since robots have replaced many manual labours, employers have the chance not only to save valuable time as the machines do not require any further training, but also to increase their revenues because machines do not demand monthly salaries like humans do. For example, in many grocery stores in the UK, customers can now scan and pay their shoppings in vending machines, resulting the save time on waiting in the queue. This is a clear benefit for the community. Nevertheless, this innovative method can cause dire problems. Ċ Looking on the other side of the coin, robots have significantly increased the rate of poverty and unemployment. Many jobs have been limited due to this innovation and therefore it's more difficult to get employed compared to a few decades ago. For example, from vending machines have been invented many cashiers have been unemployed. Furthermore, these machines consume high amounts of electrical power in order to operate. As a result, this tendency has definitely a negative impact to the environment since electrical power industries pollute the environment for the generation. Ċ To conclude, this innovation has great benefits for our society in one point, but I believe that the disadvantages of this trend outweigh the advantages. High rates of unemployment cause massive problems for the humanity.

prompt: Some people are of the opinion that children should be rewarded for good Ċ behaviour. Others think they should be punished for bad behaviour. Discuss both Ċ views and give your personal opinion and reasons.
essay: The debate over a child’s moral education is difficult because of the various viewpoints each party holds. The question of discipline is exceptionally important, moreover whether to treat good behaviour with a neutral attitude or to just focus on correcting incorrect actions. My personal opinion is that any positive actions ought to be immediately recognized by the parent and vice versa for negative conduct. This balanced approach makes for a more positive outcome for both the child and family. Ċ Firstly, rewarding a good act immediately signals a positive reaction in the child’s brain which should encourage the child to want to behave similarly in the future. Failure to recognize such behaviour leaves the child with the same emotional feeling as if they had done nothing. For instance, research shows that children who were given a treat for good behaviours tend to repeat it five times more than children who weren't. Therefore, rewarding the child regularly for good behaviour enforces the action making it more likely to repeat itself in the future. Ċ Secondly, punishing the son or daughter is also necessary, and failure to discipline could have serious consequences in the future. For example, if a child has no clear concept of respect for elders or authority, it is quite possible to encounter more serious problems later in life. This pattern is prevalent in marginal neighbourhoods throughout the world. Thus, it is essential to immediately discipline the child whenever witnessing an unruly act to enforce the correct behaviour from an early age. Ċ To conclude, both bad and good actions need to be recognized and dealt with immediately to correct or encourage future actions. Failure to do either of these could result in a less fortunate life or youth who rarely performs any good acts for anyone. Hence, it is critical that both types of behaviour are recognized and dealt with accordingly for the benefit of the child in the future.

prompt: Setting into a new culture can be extremely different. Although some culture shock is inevitable, there are a number of ways to make living overseas much easier. Discuss what might be potential problems people might face in a different cultural setting and provide solutions for them.
essay: Every year millions of people all over the world change their locations for several reasons. Some of them migrate to another countries, some visit their relatives and acquaintances and other just travel to see the world. Unfortunately most travelers inevitably have problems with adaptation and face with "culture shock". Although it takes a little time to get accustomed to new places and traditions, it can cause some problems and dissents. Ċ Culture shock causes multiple problems both for guests and for hosts. One of the essential problems travelers face with is diversity of religions. For instance, most wide spread religions such as Christianity, Islam and Buddhism have different attitudes to animals and their meat. Christians have no objections to all kinds of animals' meat, while Muslims and Buddhists do. While pork is prohibited in Islam, most Buddhists eat no meat. The only solution is here, it seems, to be more tolerant and not take it serious. Ċ Another concern is disturbance. Most Asian and Latin American people do not pay heed to this situation. They are accustomed to visiting and disturbing for any reason and at any time. Since Americans and Western Europeans are more serious and responsible for receiving guests. They allot special time and if one wants to visit them, he should call them beforehand. In order to evade some troubles and nuisance, travelers ,before traveling, should learn some information and tips about foreigners habits and customs, to watch guide shows or read guidelines. Ċ In conclusion, travelers should be more tolerant and comprehend that every place has its own rules. During travelling respect and appreciate hosts' traditions and customs.

prompt: If you could change something about your hometown, what you would change? Use specific reasons an examples to support your answer overcoming environmental issues
essay: I'm from this city in X called Y. This place is very close to me as I was born and brought up here. I have fond memories associated with this place. However, just like every other city, my city also has some drawbacks, the major problem being the lack of attention paid towards environmental issues. This could be due to several factors such as lack of awareness among people, the rapid increase in population, etc. Ċ Air pollution is one of the major concerns of the city. The city is highly polluted which has severe impact on the people. For instance, due to the high population, the number of vehicles on the streets is also high, that is, each family uses their own mode of transportation mostly. The government should make a solid and better transportation system, by which people will find it easier to transport using public transport instead of private vehicles. They should also educate and bring about plans and agendas to make the public aware about the importance of sustainable development. Ċ Moreover, higher the number of vehicles, higher is the traffic and the noise on the streets. The incessant noise caused by these vehicles can seriously affect our system and cause long term effects. Ċ In addition to that, the system for garbage disposal should be improved. The public should have a sense of awareness and responsibility for proper disposal of waste. Most of the wastes that are thrown are burnt. This includes plastics as well, which further, causes air pollution. So a system has to be brought where people can differentiate between biodegradable and non- biodegradable waste and can ensure proper separation of the wastes so that they can prevent water, soil and air pollution. Ċ In conclusion, if the public and the government put enough effort on their side we can ensure that the issues can be resolved.

prompt: Today, people think that attraction of foreign investment is necessary and important for the development of the economies of the host countries, while the others think that attraction of foreign investment has negative impact on the society and not only on this sphere. Discuss both sides and write your own opinion. Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: Some argue that the international influence on the local industry has been a constructive step in the development of the country. However, others disagree by highlighting its detrimental impacts on society as a whole. I hold the point of view that foreign capital is extremely crucial for the progress of a nation and I shall elaborate on it further in the essay. Ċ First of all, according to some, foreign investments bring significant funds inside a country which opens new ways of earning. For example, it creates more job opportunities for the youngsters and also provide opportunities to establish their personal business, as basic necessities are always fulfilled by the locals to run an industry. Additionally, a huge amount of money comes in which could stabilize and support the economy in the long run. Hence, it is absolutely obvious that such involvement of foreign bodies holds a myriad of benefits for the nation. Ċ On the contrary, others emphasize that the money from these sources would damage the culture and the traditional ways of manufacturing goods. which means to say that the modern ways of manufacturing and producing products could affect the local business. For instance, the automation industry could diminish the demand for locally produced products and handicrafts as the latest machines can produce the same in a lot faster way. Furthermore, the externals might be the ones using the local resources and earing from it, rather than the citizen of it. Thus, the long-term effects of it could be deteriorating for society. Ċ In conclusion, the people's opinions on the consequences of extern investments had been discussed in this essay regarding its importance in the progress of a country and its negative impacts as well. I believe that the contribution of the businessmen from outside is always beneficial in a plethora of ways, namely, ease of doing business and providing the employment opportunities to the locals.

prompt: Topic: Fashion trends are diffcult to follow these days and it is widely believed that they primarily exist just to sell clothes. Some people believe that we should not follow them and that we should dress in what we like. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay: In modern society, the increasingly amounts of clothing advertisement and model show imply that fashion trends is going to be an essential factor in our life. Personally, it seems to me that it is only a promotion strategy and we should dress in what we like rather than simply follow it. Ċ Socially speaking, everyone should have a sense of self-awareness before deciding to follow any popular trends. In other words, it is people themselves instead of designers that should choose what they wear every day. Because fashion designs primarily exist as a form of creative artistic expression of the designer. Obviously, they are not designed for a particular person or community. If one ignores this important truth, he/she would likely be a victim of fashion. Further, from a perspective of individuality, everyone has his/her own personality, identity, and preference, which leads to a diverse world. However, this diversity will significantly lose if people follow the same stylish trends and hence choose similar colour and clothing. Also, economically, following fashion trends frequently means put a heavy burden on people's budget, which is absolutely not a smart idea in today's recessionary conditions. Ċ Admittedly, some people still believe that stylish clothing is a necessity in daily life. They argue that people should dress their up-to-date suites for formal occasions such as wedding and theatre. Also, they particular believe that fashion clothing is requirements for all singers and actors because themselves are symbols of fashion. Ċ In conclusion, I would argue that it is unnecessary for most people to follow the latest clothing trends in their daily life. They only need to prepare several popular clothing for particular occasions. In terms of megastars, however, I believe their careers require them to put emphasis on current clothing trends.

prompt: You should spend about 40 minutes on this task. Ċ Boxing is a blood sport which often results in physical injury. It is inappropriate for this sport to exist in the modern age. Ċ Do you agree or disagree? Ċ Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. Ċ You should write at least 254 words.
essay: Arguably, boxing is regarded as a blood game several times ends up in body damage. Yet its critics contend its existence nowadays. Personally, I disagree with the view since those who practice the sport freely choose the game. Albeit, many are in the sport solely for money and fame. This essay will shed light on both sides of the view and provide anecdotal evidence to prove the arguments. Ċ On the one hand, the practitioners are not forced to follow the field. In other words, despite its injuries seriously the athletes, it is not an obligatory game. For instance, the international boxing federation provides written approval for gamers to consent to their participation as well as handle the aftermaths. As a result, criticising the development is a waste of time and no one has the responsibility to deal with it. Moreover, the foremost accountable for it are sporters and no one else. Ċ On the other hand, A significant number of sporters are in the game solely because of a huge amount of money in it. It undoubtedly threatens them since many of them shortfall of quality causing several injuries. Furthermore, a plethora of boxers is seriously wounded and found on the brink to die due to this. For example, 3 out 10 pugilists undergo surgery every seasonal fortnight. Hence, rather than earning big money, they end up in intensive care. Ċ In conclusion, notwithstanding some participants being in the game simply because it pays well, the critics should be aware of the rules, which keeps the freedom of choice for the athletes. Therefore, I still disagree with the view. In addition, I recommend that the world-ruling power allows the practice today.

prompt: Very few school children learn about the value of money and how to look after it, yet this is a critical life skill that should be taught as part of the school curriculum. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: A small number of youngsters are aware of the importance of finances and how to manage them even though they are used in every aspect of our society. A commonly held belief is that the management of money should be included as a school subject. In this essay, I am going to elaborate on the topic and show my approval. Ċ To begin with, the management of money is a crucial life skill. The majority of people are taught how to work with technologies and how to solve difficult mathematical equations. On the other hand, a truly valuable competence , which worth managing undoubtedly is, has been left out of the curriculum. For example, if a person studies abroad, they will be unable to look after their expenses. They will need to take credits, which can become a future burden if they haven’t acquired the skill of managing bank credits. Ċ Secondly, we cannot neglect that children should be taught about taking responsibility for their own finances. For instance, if a child does not acknowledge the importance of wealth, they will grow into an unresponsible adult who spends money without considering the circumstances. This is a huge problem in our society even nowadays. Many people are involved in high - priced addictions such as shopping spree, hazard playing, etc. However,this can be prevented or at least reduced provided that children are taught about how to look after their expenses. Ċ To summarise, I firmly believe that the value of money should be taught at school. By doing this, the government ensures that young adults can deal with everyday financial problems and that they can take responsibility for their actions. Consequently, a bigger part of the population will acknowledge the power of wealth, which will lead to a better understanding of important financial skills.

prompt: Many parents give jobs to their children to do around the house in order to develop their characters and self-sufficiency. Ċ Discuss this idea and give your opinion. Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.
essay: Nowadays, the offsprings have been trained on household chores to become self-reliant and a great human being. In my opinion, this is the best way to nurture a child to face future challenges and plus develop the trait of being caring and tidy throughout life. Ċ The moral duties need to be inculcated in the offsprings from their childhood; not only help them to become a responsible citizen but also educate them about the importance of being clean and hygiene. These elements are essential for any human being to fulfil their social responsibilities. For example, the Quen Elizabeth III had taught her son "Prince Charles" to clean the floor and do your own dishes since childhood to make sure he realized the vitality of the household assistance they get from their servants. Hence, to make your youth a true gentleman or gentle lady, it is vital to let them learn the real realms of existence. Ċ Not only that, the majority of the adolescent from average income family group, migrates to big cities for better career opportunities. They can not afford daily maids or domestic help, as these services are even more expensive. Henceforth, the childhood learning they received from their parents has come to rescue in these situations such as cooking, cleaning, mobbing, and others. It is quite a challenge for them if they are not being trained in these areas, but if they being through life-chapter in their young age then they can easily overcome this rough patch of livelihood as they had developed a skill of how to be self-reliant and self-sufficient in an early age. For example, a survey conducted by the " Oxford University" had stated that 80% immigrants from rural areas are youngsters those who are in search of jobs and majority of them doing their domestic work of their own to save money. Thus, it is proven that once self-trained, they hardly need any domestic-help. Ċ In conclusion, most of the guardians get their home task done by their youth. It is essential in my opinion to make them understand that no work is small or disregarded and more so, allow them to overcome the constraints in their life.

prompt: computers are becoming an essential part of education discuss the advantages and disadvantages and give your own opinion. write at least 250 words.
essay: With the development of telecommunication devices, computers are gradually used as a necessary tool for a part of education. By taking advantage of technological services, students will extensively utterlise computers as a partner during their educational career, though there are several drawbacks to consider. Ċ The greatest benefit of using computers for education is that students have more opportunities to expand the research network for their thesis. Instead of reading a plethora of books related to topics for many days, now computers make it possible for them to approach many useful sources of information in a flash. By this way, students somewhat have more time to focus on and do multiple tasks at the same time that is otherwise impossible if they chose to read. Ċ However, spending such a long time using computers in education may cause some students to do sth wrong with the purpose of teachers and gain bad marks then. Some students may be tempted into social networking sites and browsing the Internet while teachers do not pay attention. For example, when studying Computer Science, my friends are always playing games behind their teacher's back, which oftentimes they become addicted and perform badly on their exams. Ċ To sum up, using computers in education has become incredibly common around the world. While most people make use of them as a great tool, there are in fact some disadvantages that stop the development of these equipment. In my opinion, it is the hardship that applying technological devices to education is much more advantageous than disadvantageous.

prompt: Some psychologists think that the best way to overcome stress of everyday life is to spend a portion of the day doing absolutely nothing. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Who does not want time to relax and chill out? US famous article stated that the best method to relieve daily stresses is to have a break time to relax and do nothing. Although calm and relaxation have a positive impact to overcome stresses, I believe that there are other ways to relieve them. Ċ To begin with, there is no doubt that everyone needs time to relax and relieve daily tensions in his or her mind. One reason for this is that stress can jeopardize our bodies and mental health. For instance, if a person works constantly and there is no time to settle down he or she will be affected severely. Our bodies and minds necessitate a break time from life strains. In addition, setting down and doing absolutely nothing for hours can intensify stress. To illustrate this, when someone does nothing for hours daily that will affect him negatively. one friend of mine used to set after work do nothing that affected him and he is now seeking a psychiatrist. Ċ However, one of the most effective methods to overcome stress is exercise and workouts. Exercises do not only have health benefits also, can improve mental status drastically. For example, when you do different types of workouts your mind will be distracted and blood circulation increases that lead to thinking better. Furthermore, meditation and recreation as well are helpful. Studies show that meditation and observation have a precious impact psychologically. Ċ In conclusion , despite the positive impact of spending a portion of the day relaxing and doing nothing, we should do other methods to overcome our stressful days such as sports, cooking , and meditation.

prompt: Some think that it is better to get information or advice from other people, while others believe one can get any information or advice from the Internet or books. Discuss both views and give your own opinion
essay: Getting information from the masses regarding some significant matters is recommended by a few people, while some argue, that attaining awareness online as well as from academic records is more efficient. Although, experienced individuals suggested to others by their own personal facts, I personally believe, that the data which is collected through the internet is widely known. Let's delve into detail. Ċ To begin with, sometimes a person needs assistance in their hard time period, then a lot of human beings provide ideas to get out from that critical situation, in that cases if the most valuable thoughts would be implemented, then the majority of hurdles would be reduced. community health centres, for instance, are providing a plethora of treatments to their patients, there is no need to go to other hospitals for tertiary level treatment, indeed that kind of information is only given by those who go through such kinds of ways. Moreover, during the time of choosing the carrier, most of the students discuss it with their tutors and select a better line. Thus, assistance is demanded by an experienced creature. Ċ Secondly, no doubt mankind plays a significant role in advising, but the contemporary sources of knowledge could not be denied. There are ample sources ,for example, U-TUBE, is a medium through which a lot of people share their experience and serve a wider knowledge. If we need information regarding some pivotal issues then we can approach these videos and solve our solutions. Furthermore, instead of minor knowledge, we can believe in hyperspace data. Ċ In conclusion, whilst our elders' proposals are helpful, According to my perspective, we should give more preference to online data, where huge hints could be seen and one could be selected, which is high on the rating scale.

prompt: It is a common aspiration between many young people to run their own business rather than work for an employer. Do you think the advantages of working for yourself outweigh the drawbacks?
essay: Being an entrepreneur is an ability to run a business with successful strategy implementations and bringing profits to the organisation. It has become a dream for many individuals to run a business themselves instead of employing a company. There are considerable merits and some demerits of this decision, which will be discussed in this essay coming forth paragraphs. I will provide supporting reasons and examples to back up why advantages are higher than disadvantages. Ċ Owning a business first in place has two demerits to consider at a high level. It needs strategic planning in all perspectives of business like funding, operations, profitability and returns on investment to start a business, otherwise, might incur a large number of financial losses to the owner. It was evident that 28% of businesses newly emerged in the last two years are closed without running for more than a year as per the latest Indian economical statistics. Adding to this, it increases insurmountable stress on the founder of the organisation to withstand this competitive market, which is not in the case of an employee. This leads to major health problems like blood pressure and heart attacks at times. Ċ Keeping the drawbacks aside, there are two important benefits of being an entrepreneur in society. It gives greater visibility on the market needs, consequently, increases the decision making capability to arrive at the unique selling point for the organisation with the previous failure experiences that an individual has learnt. McDonald's founder, for instance, has failed 68 times in his life to get success finally at the age of 62. Exponential financial benefits can be assured if the invented idea has a uniqueness, which cannot be achieved by an employee in his lifetime. An out of box idea like establishing the simplest messaging platform, for example, Whatsapp has made Mark Zuckerburg one of the world's richest businessman. Ċ In conclusion, it's a dream for many individuals to run an organization rather than work under an employer. This has certain disadvantages, however, in the form of increased stress and incurring financial losses if it fails, but the merits of being a founder of a company with a vision to succeed and earning money outweighs the drawbacks.

prompt: Many companies use advertisement to increase the sales. What are the main reasons that make an advertisement effective ? Is it positive or negative develkpment
