Ċ One year later after I finished the second year in high school I was convinced that the literary section wasn't for me so I started thinking about the pros and the cons of going to the scientific section . I was stuck between a rock and a hard place because I have finished one year on the literary section and if I went to the scientific section I will have to study one more year . however if I enter the scientific section , I will be able to find a good job with a lot of money ,so I can get married and settle dawn. Finally I made up my mind and have decided to go to the scientific section. Ċ If I had only listened to my family I wouldn't have wasted a year of my life . Of Corse I don't regret my first decision . I had learned a great lesson from that experience. I should always listen to my parents .

prompt: Some people have great ambitions in life, others don't. Do you think ambition is important to succeed in life? Is it a positive or a negative quality to have?
essay: Today some people have their lives with great ambitions, others don't. Human being may be greed if the embrace exceeded ambitions, by contract, it is beneficial if citizens process proper ambitions. Ċ Once a person have enormous ambitions, it is available to reach the goal which they are struggling for, they must be passion, energetic, then they have more chances to get what they want. For instance, a man who are the only person to earn money for his family, a strong ambition is got by him, he has been fought for any opportunity to meet his aim of gaining the manager position. Eventually, he gets what he was admiring, that's because of his powerful ambitions. Therefore, ambitions has its positive side. Ċ However, ambition also does harm to the individuals with a over ambition., It is necessary to got the ambition under control. For example, residence who are too crazy about accessing the approach of getting the particular score or a great amount of money, he will fail to control his greedy, then everthings are change, The purpose isn't the initial purpose. Ċ In conclusion, I believe ambition is vital to be successful in life. A proper ambition do help us in the way of searching succeed, but remember it is dangerous when we ask for too much. Meanwhile, we will lost and forget the preference what we fought for in the beginning.

prompt: Some psychologists think that the best way to overcome stress in everyday life is to spend a portion of the day doing absolutely nothing. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is undeniable that people have faced stress problems from their affairs. Psychologists recommend that doing nothing is the best solution to eliminate this concern. Personally, I argue this statement with many reasons that will be discussed in the following paragraphs. Ċ First of all, people can eliminate the stress level by better methods such as exercise or doing their favourite hobbies. Working out not only the beneficial mind but also the physical. Pleasure hormones named Endorphine will be released during doing this activity in terms of mental health while they can get stronger bodies. In other words, finding something to do that can have more advantages than staying inactive. If they are obsessed with the art field, they will be able to try a new work or improve their skill during this period. Meanwhile, some people who don’t have the kind of activities that they can start at this time too. Ċ Secondly, they have their own ideas about anxious feelings. Few societies believe that being idle can create some negative behaviours like laziness whereas some groups are guilty of their actions because they waste time without doing benefits. In addition, they can be judged by their community for being a person who is not productive. As a result, they need to be active throughout the day to feel comfortable. Ċ To conclude, I strongly disagree that allocating a part of the whole day to be passive is the greatest choice to get rid of anxiety. The reason why I have this opinion is that they have other useful ways to solve this problem and their own thinking.

prompt: Some people with good education and experience in their field decide to move abroad to work. Why do you think that is? What problems does this cause?
essay: Nowadays, people from developing countries equipped with valuable knowledge and skills in their professions are willing to move to developed ones for several reasons. In this essay, I will explain the causes and the results of this movement. Ċ To begin with, most of the professionals migrate abroad, since they are provided with a high standard of living such as strong legislation, clean environment, huge income, good working atmosphere, and more job opportunities. To illustrate, most of the capable students in Azerbaijan desire to go to the EU or the USA for education and career. In addition to this, some scientist also wants to change the country, because organizations in there create better conditions for scientific activities. For example, NASA offers the most improved technologies to engineers working for it. Ċ However, it has negative impacts on the home country. The movement of educated people leads to the shortage of skilled workforce and it kills the competition in the local labour market. Also, it affects wages in jobs that require well-educated workers. As some students leave the country due to the undervalued of their professions, the government has to invite specialists from abroad at a higher cost. For example, last year, BP in Azerbaijan brought two engineers from Italy to repair the oil rig due to staff shortages and the money spent on them in 12 days was 76,000 manat. Moreover, this scarcity can cause a recession in the economy, in more details, it can lead to fewer taxes. It is fact that the main source of the governmental budget is tax, therefore, if it decreases, the investments of the state in sectors that serve social and economic welfare will decline. Ċ In conclusion, although the migration of well-educated people to developed countries has a positive effect on their personal well-being, it brings about a brain drain to their nation and lagging of their economy.

prompt: The cost of living is higher in many countries. What is the effects of higher prices to individuals and society? What is the best way for people to deal with this problem?
essay: Wages of citizens in many countries cannot cover spendings owing to cost-of-living is higher than a salary rate that occasionally are pushed into poverty, and leads society to ambiguous aftermaths. Thereof, many people cut back their purchases, and no matter has debts, in account of one the best way to deal with this problem is not exist. Ċ First of all, the undeniable fact that the high cost of living demands equal a salary rate, or citizen became poverty that lead to harmful effect on both society and individuals. In Ukraine, for example, prices outrun a wage rate that leads to many debts and increase a criminal level. Moreover, people preserve money by purchasing cheaper and less quality products that lead to many problems with health. Thus, if a country has a high price that a wage can cover for people and society itAccept comma additionsociety, it is not a big deal, whereas when price outrun a salary it has devastating effects on both. Ċ Thereafter, society in a country, where the price is higher than a salary, every day figure out a new way to cope with such problems, although the best still is not exist because every single day people have different problems that draining their budget. Many families, for instance, apart from basic needs have sometimes problems with health or clothes, especially if they have children. Therefore, such people endeavour preserve money, and have a job in two places as way to manage the shortage of capital; however, it has not always helped. Consequently, people many years try to find out the way that solve problem with the shortage of money, nevertheless one and the best is impossible owing to different situations demand various solutions. Ċ To conclude, cost-of-living is higher than wages in many countries that has devastation chain effects on individuals and society because push people to controversial decisions. Furthermore, nonetheless all efforts people cannot find the best idea to cope with such problems due to society presently lives in the turbulent time there every day are happening something bad that drains the budget of everybody.

prompt: higher fuel and petrol cost Topic: The burning of oil for transportation, especially in private cars, is wasteful and environmentally irresponsible. Taxation on petrol and diesel fuel should be increased to very high levels to discourage the use of private cars.  To what extent would you support or reject this idea?
essay: There is no doubt our life has had a change for the better since cars were introduced. However, cars themselves, especially private ones, have exerted severe pressure on the environment and economy for wasteful oil consumption. While many believe that petrol and diesel fuel should be charged with the highest taxation, I strongly disagree with this notion. Ċ One can not deny the fact that if petrol and fuel taxation are raised, people might hesitate choosing a personal automobile. Taxation may have tackled the environmental issue simply by diverting people to public transportations such as trains, buses or ferries. Additionally, for those who have already afforded a car, there is a likelihood it is restraint from usage on long journeys or to crowded cities. Ċ However, taxation on flamable resources might backfire by conducing to inflation. To be precise, the more costly petrol is, the higher the price of necessary product: rice, meat or even vegetable. Consequently, people have to turn to cheaper alternatives, which might cause the abundance in goods and later on, economic crisis. Ċ Another point that should be taken into account is countries that import oil will be more dependent on the exporters, both politically and financially. Suppose that the those countries cut down on its oil support, other nations will have to pay more as well as release beneficial policies for them. America, for example, has recently drawn its intervention in Russian crisis only due to the influx of oil. Ċ To summarize, higher fuel and petrol cost has its own pros and cons. However, it disadvantages may outweigh its advantages with regard to economic and politic issues, making it advisable to seek another options to reduce the use of personal cars.

prompt: Q.  Newspapers have an enormous influence on people's ideas and opinions. Is it a desirable or undesirable situation?
essay: Newspapers nowadays have become an indispensable part to acquire information compared to other resources in the modern life. Some people advocate that it is beneficial for people to accumulate knowledge, while others consider that it will deprive people of their thoughts. Indeed, in my stance, there are some drawbacks of the newspapers. Ċ The first and most important reason is that people's thoughts are easily influenced by newspapers. That is, people are passive to absorb the information and tend to mimic the opinions from newspapers. For example, people with hustle and bustle lifestyles are too busy to verify the truth of the topics in newspapers. Meanwhile, those information are widely use in every field which has a strong impact on every age. In the long term, people are likely to lose their judgement. Ċ Another reason is that most of newspapers are controlled by political parties and served the authorities. It is easy to provide biased reports and manipulate the reader's prospectives on the vital issues. Furthermore, it is common to use entertainment news or celebrity secrets to divert public's attention away from the government scandals, economic problems, unemployment, crimes and so on. It allows people hardly to focus the main issue and may be harmful to country's development. Ċ In conclusion, newspapers have been integrated into our daily life and has a strong impact on the way people gain knowledge. There is no denying that people will lose their thoughts and ideas if they passively absorb the information from newspapers. For the great regret in lives, people should cast a discriminative eye on it.

prompt: Some believe that people should make efforts to fight climate change while others think it is better to learn to live with it.Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: The issue of climate change was always debatable and has become more controversial. Many people claim that people have more responsibility to fight climate change, while others reject this notion. The substantial influence of this trend has sparked controversy over the potential impact in recent years. In my opinion, we should work more to fight against climate change to be more rational. This essay will elaborate on both points of view of this issue and thus lead to a logical conclusion. Ċ There are myriad reasons that will further explain this argument. Still, the most predominant one stems from the fact that the environment has significant influences on our wellbeing, and hurting the earth means hurting ourselves. The Covid-19 pandemic has vividly demonstrated this. The virus can spread due to our poaching of wild primates' nature. As a result, many countries took damaging blows to their economies and the life of their citizen. Furthermore, many prominent business chains do not have to spend significant money on carbon emissions. In that situation, if citizens do not raise their voices against pollution, the government does not follow the legislation to protect the environment. Ċ On the other hand, some others believe that global warming is most appealing for economic practices. Poor communities are unable to afford environment-friendly methods of production. For example, from 2020, The tech- giant company Apple did not provide charging adapters with iPhones upon purchase. Because they have avoided mining a significant amount of materials from the earth and conserved copper, zinc, and many metals used for manufacturing a charging adapter, this decision by the technology giant had caused a furore among buyers. Another pivotal aspect of this argument is that people use lots of fossil fuels for their everyday work, detrimental to the environment. Ċ In conclusion, according to the arguments mentioned above, I feel that to save our planet and secure our next generation, scientists, policymakers, social workers, and the government should take several steps to overcome the situation and make the world a better place.

prompt: Young people these days tend to be less polite and respectful than in the past. Discuss the causes and give solutions.
essay: It is often seen that the young generation have a lack of moral values than past generations. This essay will discuss two major reasons behind this kind of nature and suggest some possible solutions to mitigate this issue. Ċ Lack of parental supervision is the main factor affecting the nature of young people. This is happening because unlike past, parents today are working around the clock and when they come back at home from work, they feel too exhausted they do not try to impart the moral values to their children. As a consequence, young people show less respect and are less polite to others. Furthermore, another culprit is the violent TV shows and computer games. To illustrate, due to lack of supervision, children are spending their most of the time on serials which might portray the bad activities of a superstar, and on the violent games such as Pub G. Moreover, by watching such shows, they also feel that it is perfectly all right to behave badly and arrogantly to others. So, these are the problems which are associated with such kind of behaviour of the younger population. Ċ Fortunately,Nevertheless, there are some potential solutions to eradicate these causes. Firstly, parents should spend time with their children to pass on some family values to ensure they behave better with society members. Secondly, parents should make some restrictions on watching violent television channels and playing games. For example, channels which are using vulgar language have to be restricted by parents to stop the youngsters behaving in the same manner. Ċ In conclusion, lacking politeness and respectfulness are the root causes which are found among the young generation. However, to address this, parents are the best teachers who are responsible for shaping the nature of their children to react politely toward others and also shows respect.

prompt: Some people believe that entertainers are paid too much and their impact on the society is negative, while others disagree and believe that they deserve the money they make because of their positive effect on others. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Entertainment is becoming a very important part of our lives. The significance that the entertainers are being paid too much has always been debatable. Although some people are of the opinion that individuals who entertain are paid a huge amount of money that has a negative impact on society, others are of the view that this has a positive impact on human beings. In this essay, I will be discussing both the views and state my opinion, that is the benefits outweigh the drawbacks. Ċ To begin with, these days entertainment is playing a very essential role in the industry. Additionally, entertainers help in making the individuals happy by creating a positive atmosphere that helps the audience forget all their sadness and brings joy in their life. For instance, men after their long tiring day at work and women after completing all the household chores, sit and relax by watching programs such as cricket, TV series, movies etc that makes them feel calm and tension-free. As a result, celebrities deserve the price they are paid to make the audience satisfied. Ċ On the other hand, it is undeniable that jobs such as doctors, teachers, engineers and other community workers are paid less when compared to the amount the entertainers earn. Moreover, people who entertain also enjoy a comfortable and luxurious life. For example, doctors pursue their studies for almost 10 years to become professionals to save the life of society, which involves a lot of hard work but they are paid less. Subsequently, this has a negative effect on individuals. Ċ By way of conclusion, although there are many disadvantages for the celebrities to be paid more, the benefits outweigh them, in order to keep humankind happy and cheerful.

prompt: With internet improvements, people can share views or opinions on certain goods or services that they have purchased. Ċ Is this a good or a bad thing? Ċ Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: By the advance of technology,and the invention of the internet people can freely share their point of views about specific products and services which they have received and paid for which can be considered as a positive development.In this essay, I will discuss both advantages and disadvantages of such an improvement. Ċ On one hand,the internet has positive effects on the way consumers can express their opinion about certain goods or repairing services given from each brand or company.This can provide a source of information which will lead other consumers to make better decisions about what they have a plan to buy, by reading reviews within a few clicks.For example,when a person decides to buy an electronic device ,whether online or in the store,beforehand he can search the intended products’ brand directly on the Google website and immediately can read recommendations of people who have had and then if they were mostly affirmative ,it would be logical to buy.In my opinion, such technology-related developments aid us to enjoy a better quality of life due to a wide variety of information can be gained from it. Ċ On the other hand,as an increasing number of people have access to the internet, lots of data found there might not be valid.This unreliability might be not only due to bad intention but also variations of different people’s taste.Firstly,some people might leave comments about a specific product or service while they have never purchased it.They do such false data because of their bad intentions or personal animosity.secondly all buyers do not expect the same things from what they want to buy,therefore others’ opinion Might not be useful for them. For instance,People might have different taste in colours,designs and this can vary their expectations of goods from one to another so negative comments in such things should not be taken into account . Ċ To conclude,it is undeniable that the evolution of the internet has helpt people to express their ideas about what they pay for,such as goods and maintenance services.Even though this freedom in sharing views might not be beneficial sometimes,I believe that this is a positive development and make the decision making easier for people.

prompt: Ielts writing task 2 - Aging population I have tried to improve some mistake from the last work. Hope you guys can give me advice for this piece of writing Some people believe that aging population is good for business, the economy and society. Others, however, disagree with this view. Discuss both view and give your opinion.
essay: These days, the percentage of older people in the population structure has been increasing rapidly. This trend leads to both positive and negative effects that will be discussed in this essay. Ċ On the one hand, the aging population brings about numerous advantages, economically and socially. First of all, senior workers have loads of practical skills and experience, which can be passed on to their counterparts. Take the teacher as an example; a senior teacher with a long time working has more experience in dealing with problematic children and the teaching method. Moreover, in a diverse working environment, the collaboration between the young and old helps improve productivity, increasing profits, and boosting economic growth. When it comes to the social aspect, older people are more likely to attend community service projects and voluntary activities, such as the local environment campaign. Ċ On the other hand, it is believed that the aging population somewhat can prevent the nation's development. Older workers tend to be less creative and innovative than younger colleagues. They often find difficulties keeping up with the latest technology, which impacts companies' productivity adversely. One more problem is the higher proportion of aging working people, the higher the unemployment rates. The youth have little chance to have a well-paid job when many jobs are full-filled by senior workers. For this reason, a large number of young people are forced to be unemployed and take a low-paying job that is below their abilities. Ċ In conclusion, regardless of some drawbacks, In my opinion, the advantages of the aging population outweigh the disadvantages, and there are various ways to take advantage of the older population to gain benefits for the society.

prompt: Individuals can do nothing to change society. Any new developments can only be brought about by governments and large institutions. How far do you agree or disagree?
essay: In the past history, a large number of changes and developments were brought about by big organizations, governments, and institutions. These actions led many people to believe that individuals are incapable of becoming agent of change among society . I believe that both individuals and governments have their own function to bring influences or changes to society. Ċ First, looking back to history were almost most important matters solved by the organizations, governments, and institutions. In my opinion, it is understandable and natural due to they have great power to make policy or decision. For instance, when Indonesia was under the leadership of former President Soeharto, there was a large number of changes and developments especially economic development. He divided this economic development into three periods: economic recovery, rapid economic growth and increasing government intervention, export-led growth, and deregulation. Indeed, the economy grew rapidly and brought some improvements in its social development. Unfortunately, due to his dictatorial and authoritarian power, there were many people have become powerless, frustrated, and less respect to the government. Ċ On the other hand, a revolution started by minor or poor people who were recognized to be powerless. For instance, many student activists among universities in Indonesia united to protect and ask for Soeharto resignation.  The latest example is story about a young schoolgirl from Pakistan who stood up to the Taliban, Malala Yousafzai. She was shot in the head by Taliban due to her struggle against them to defend her right to an education. Ċ In conclusion, I do not think that individuals are incapable of bringing influences and create changes among society. I personally believe that individuals, like governments and organizations, are also part of society. Therefore, both individuals and governments or organizations can do something to change society in their own role.

prompt: Your city has decided to build a statue or monument to honor a famous person in your country. Who would you choose? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
essay: Many famous people have been living in my country who all of them possess their own great characteristics. In my point of view, one of the most honorable persons which were living in my city is professor. Mahmud Hesabi that I think his statue should be built in my city. Prof. Hesabi was not only a famous scientist in my country but also he had eminent personality with great beliefs. Indeed, this person is one of the best epitomes for all people in their life. As far as I'm concerned, here I enumerate some of my reasons for this choice. Ċ Professor Hesabi was the greatest physicist in my country who was teaching the quantum physics in Tehran University, the best university of my country, and he was famous as the father of physics science in Iran. He was one of the best students of Professor. Albert Aniston and afterwards he trained many eminent professors in this field. Ċ Additionally, as I said above he had great thinking near his teaching. He believed in many ethical principles in live and always was teaching these worthwhile beliefs to his students. Today, his valuable statements are followed by many students and other people. Ċ Moreover, Prof. Hesabi put many efforts out to improve the graduation status in my country. For example, he was cause to build new buildings and laboratories in universities, and increase the amenities for sending students to abroad for reaching more knowledge and technology. In result, all of these activities lead to remarkable progression in science and technology in my country. Ċ In conclusion, by noticing to my explanations if to be supposed to build a statue of a famous person in my city, I think Professor. Hesabi, because of his great characters both as a scientist and as an open-minded personality, will be the best choice.

prompt: Many different countries have most shops and products as the same. Some consider it a positive development, whereas others consider it negative. Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay: Without any doubt, it has become evident that society is divided into two groups as per the distinct mindset of different people. Therefore, this has become a debatable issue whether the effects of globalization such as the same products and shops are detrimental or undeniably beneficial. This essay will shed light on these stated perceptions and discuss my point of view in conclusion. Ċ On the one hand, owing to the availability of different stock in terms of varieties as compared to the past, the reach of the common public has increased. This is to say when ordering from abroad, only wealthy families were able to buy imported things because they were sufficiently capable of paying the extra charges incurred in terms of shipping and tax. Apart from this, import and export business has dwelled between countries, thus, making the economy of involved nations prosper in a positive direction. For example, a report published by the “Economic and Finance Department” cited that the export-import business helped the economy of India to boost by 7% after the great recession period occurred in 2007. Moreover, it also stated that this booming economy created 45% more job opportunities which further helped it to rise. Ċ On the other hand, globalization caused local vendors serious problems. To simply this, the society took less interest in local brands in contrast to the merchandise from foreign companies, thus, due to the continuously diminishing popularity of native items, lots of shops got closed and people went jobless. To cite an example, a survey conducted by the “Employment and Grievance Department” in 2018 in India reported that approximately 4 out of 10 people’s had lost their work due to more inclination towards western produce. Ċ In conclusion, according to my perspective, it has widened the reach of the community as well as helped the economic segment of a country to boom.

prompt: The increase in the production of consumer goods results in damage to the natural environment. What are the causes of this? What can be done to solve this problem?
essay: These days, there is an ever-growing number of product manufacture that brings about environmental problems. In this essay, both causes and feasible solutions will be analyzed. Ċ Consumer goods are attributed to various factors. One main cause of this issue is that the factories would release toxic wastes into the air due to their production materials such as plastic or chemical emissions from the manufacturing process. Thus, the contamination could invade our nature and health visibly. Furthermore, some disposable goods become one of the most indispensable reasons leading to the living habitat threats because they are often made from long-term decomposing materials which have no way to completely deal with. Therefore, when utilized products are dumped into land or ocean, resulting in the deaths of many marine and terrestrial animals. Ċ There are a number of viable solutions to help tackle this problem. To begin with, governments should encourage the citizen to the 3R action (reduce, reuse and recycle) since it could be in the cable of minimizing the released wastes for the environment. In addition, companies and factories had better not utilize the chemical by-products or chemical emissions in their manufacturing process like bamboo and paper in order to prevent out life from negative impacts. Moreover, actions must be taken as soon as possible by decreasing the use of the unalternative and unreusable materials, instead, we could apply eco-friendlier facilities on our accommodation for the fresh green atmosphere. Ċ In conclusion, there are main contributors to the problem and several measures are suggested to put an end to the situation.

prompt: Topic：Many deseases can now be prevented through the immunization and the governments make law to force people ger immunized. Should people be made by law to get immunized?
essay: Recent years, many diseases have broken out and spread around the world. Because of this, governments of different countries have to force people to get immunized and even make law that people should obey. In my opinion, I think it is acceptable that the government immunizes people compulsively for the following reasons. Ċ First of all, no one can deny that the governments are protecting the interest of the public. Immunizing people can decrease the infection and the probability of people getting ill can be lower. Besides, government wants to disroot the virus so that no more people will suffer from the sick feeling given by the illness. The most important thing is that government tries to prevent people from being carelessly infected with the virus and people from a lower class can also get immunized because the government covers the expense. These people don't need to worry about the cost. If everyone gets immunized, the virus can be destroyed effectively. Ċ On the other hand, many people worry about the by-effects of the immunization, especially the negative reactions afterwards. But there is no need to worry, because government must have considered the negative reactions that may occur to a small number of people after the immunization. What's more, scientists and doctors must have precautions before the public take the immunization, so the probability of by-effects is low. Also, if the person has these harmful reactions, government will be responsible for it. Ċ Obviously, as long as the safety of the immunization is ensured, more and more people will obey the law to get immunized.

prompt: Pollution of air, water and soil has become critical serious in last years and it takes millions of years to recoup. What are the main causes of pollution? Ċ How can we tackle this problem individually and globally?
essay: In recent years, there has been a drastic rise in the pollution of the atmosphere, water and land leading to an overall impact on our planet that might take millions of years to restore. This essay will present the main causes and a few solutions to overcome this challenge on an individual and global level. Ċ To commence with, one of the major causes that contributes towards our air, water and soil contamination is the waste disposal of manufacturing factories along with the harmful gases emitted from them. These gases pollute the air leading to air pollution. Similarly, the harmful chemical waste disposed of these enter into the water bodies contaminating the water that is utilized by both humans and animals. In addition, improper dumping of garbage in random places instead of landfills and recycling centres lead to polluting the ocean, rivers and agricultural lands. Ċ However, there are a few solutions to tackle these concerns. Firstly, proper dumping of trash and garbage into the landfills and processing centres prevents them from entering the run-off water and impacts the soil fertility, resulting in erosion. This practice also helps in the prevention of contamination of our water cycle. Furthermore, we can opt for public transport to mitigate the pollution of our air. In terms of global efforts, the government of various countries should replace unsustainable resources like fossil fuels and replace them with renewable sources of energy, such as solar, wind and hydroelectricity to reduce the pollutants in the air caused due to these emissions. Moreover, they should impose certain strict laws to encourage reprocessing in our society. Ċ In conclusion, the main causes for all the three kinds of pollution appear to be the result of our negligence, hence, it is vital for us to put necessary efforts to sustain our planet and safeguard it by taking measures, including opting for public transport and following reprocessing methods diligently along with the global measures like introducing laws and encouraging sustainable sources of energy.

prompt: Nowadays it is easy to apply for and be given a credit card. However, some people experience problems when they are not be able to pay their debts back. Ċ In your opinion, do the advantages of credit cards outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: The credit card is a ubiquitous advantage of the banking sector of the modern community in these days and it is a peace of cake to get it for an individual, who works in any field on a decent amount of pay. Sometimes it becomes a real hurdle for a person to repay the overly used money, but we cannot count it as a drawback of the card because it depends on a user. In my opinion, these cards are superbly helpful for someone in need, so advantages of it outweigh the disadvantages. The essay will discuss both facets of a proposal with appropriate examples and reaches to a logical conclusion. Ċ To begin with, the term of credit card started by the banking sector in all countries to support people with an extra money. Moreover, the bank issues a it after checking applicant's debt history and financial well being that does mean that applicant is eligible to repay their debt. Additionally, when we urgently need money in case of an emergency, so it helps us to pay our bills while the user is unable to work and manage their expenses. For example, in Australia, if someone may have an accident and not have any savings to pay their rent or bills, so they use it. Ċ Furthermore, on the other hand, some people think that it is a significant issue to pay their debt but it is depend their usage. However, people who do not know the purpose of it using their cards excessively, and then struggle to repay. Even though we know that excess of everything is bad, same as this overuse of an amount is horrible for person's debt history. For instance, some banks, give a period of repayment, if someone fails to make the payment could have an adverse impact on their financial profile. Ċ In conclusion, I think that credit cards have more advantages than disadvantages and these are an integral part of the banking to support people while their hard time, therefore people's usage reflect its effect on individual's life, nevertheless, it has too many benefits than side effects.

prompt: Some people believe that individuals who earn a lot of money are the most successful. Others say that the individuals who contribute to the society (such as scientists or teachers) are the most successful. Ċ Discuss both views and give your own opinion. Ċ Write at least 250 words.
essay: Being successful has always been the main motivation to move forward for humans. Also, it has always been a debate if whether the concept is defined by the amount of money someone makes or the impact that somebody might have on others by contributing to the community. In this ,essay a closer look at this topic will help in understanding different sides. Ċ Earning money would certainly be a result of various factors such as hardworking and discipline in existence within another essential characteristic. So, it is likely when someone starts receiving a considerable wage, years of experience and talent play a role behind that amount of money besides, it demonstrates responsibility. All those mentioned features shape successes as they should be achieved and maintained through an assemblage of different pieces rather than accident. to sum up, making huge profits equally means providing your exclusive needs as well as, in some cases helping others too. For this being wealthy is known to be fruitful and fortunate . Ċ Clearly, not everybody in society interprets prosperity in a materialistic way instead, they value flourishing through selfless serving to the public. Take educational tutors and teachers, devoting their life, to nurture their students to be the best of themselves as an example. In this case, the priceless action makes effective. Similarly, scientists accomplish their time in the same manner as their invaluable work and discoveries improve the quality of life and serve all sorts of people whether it is saving someone or finding an answer to a question. Ċ In conclusion, in my view, being successful derives from the most intimate contemplation and state of meaning and it has diverged from each soul. Additionally, it is deeply rooted in ambitions and desires therefore, it can not include a general explanation to operate for all classes of the public.

prompt: Many people today are choosing to travel to other countries. Ċ Why is this happening? Ċ Is this a positive or negative development?
essay: It has become progressively common for the general populace to travel worldwide. In my opinion, the key catalyst for this positive development is a rise in middle-class income and advances in aviation. Ċ The most frequently cited rationale for people opting to visit foreign countries is the convenience of travelling. This argument rests on the fact that over the last century, we have experienced a concomitant increase in wages of companies and the global middle-class. For example, this can be most apparently seen in myriad working-class employees with disposable income, who are now able to go on holiday in different countries at least once or twice a year. Furthermore, thanks to cheaper airfares, which have complemented this reform and consequently, individuals nowadays are not afraid to fly. Thus, the accumulated evidence has reasoned why increasing numbers of the citizenry can afford international travel. Ċ Conceding the cause for this notion, I would contend that the ability to travel outside the homeland brings in several opportunities. This is predicated on the assumption that most of our former generation in the past lived and died to where they were born and lacked broad knowledge of the world. For instance, contrary to this is a salient illustration in youths, who now can effortlessly understand the world around them and set foot in numerous global attractions like the Louvre Museum and the Old Trafford Stadium. Moreover, with the advent of commercial flights and widespread coverage of social media, the youngsters can access a tremendous amount of information about airlines, accommodation, where to eat and what to do while on holiday. Therefore, being able to visit new destinations other than the home country confers a valid standpoint as we have witnessed the positive and tangible impact on the young generation. Ċ In conclusion, international travel is a sign of improved prosperity of a nation and we should be grateful for its contribution. In my final thought, governors and aviation regulators should propose a more holistic approach in order to prevent any potential threats to the environment due to an excessive amount of travelling internationally.

prompt: How to improve public transport? Some people think that the best way to reduce the number of traffic jams is to improve public transport.How could public transport be improved and to what extent do you agree or disagree with those people?
essay: Many people believe that the ultimate solution to minimise the number of traffic jams is to enhance vehicles communally. In my opinion, I agree with that because of many reasons. Ċ Frist and foremost, The spaces of the road are opened by improving public wheels, for example, one bus's size equal six motorbikes size but the bus can take 45 people however the motorbikes just can take 12 people. The amounts of traffic congestions are lessened by expanding blank of the street. Besides that, the society is developed by boost mutual transits due to we will talk more when we are on the buses, trains, and planes. Ċ Second of all, the air pollution is decreased by update communal transport by cause of reducing exhaust gas. We will have a better life because we can breathe in fresh air. Many people, who don't have enough money to buy personal transportation, are helped by modern public transport, which will be improved. We will be safer by using urban vehicles because they run slower and more careful. Ċ Finally, The way some country update their communal transport is not good, for example, in Viet Nam, we decided to build the subway in HCM city to solve traffic jams but I don't think it can help us because it so late to develop subway system in 21 century. We have to update our public transport by the right way because it will waste a lot of money to build something can't be used for all. Ċ To sum up, I think to improve public transport is the best way to solve traffic jams because we have more blank in roads, the better society, and the better emotionally.

prompt: Topic: Nowadays, there is a trend that woman want to get married late or some even choose to live alone. Discuss both advantages and disadvantages of this trend. GETTING MARRIED LATE? SHOULD OR NOT?
essay: Recently, woman doesn't want to get married early or some even decide to be a celibate is becoming more and more popular. There is no doubt that this trend has its own benefits and drawbacks. Ċ It's obviously thatgetting married late or living alone has some advantages. First of all, woman can feel more comfortable, independent and focus on her career. This means she will not be tied up with family, relatives and children, so she can spend more time concentrating whole-heartedly on her occupation. Therefore, she will be in control of her finance and life. Another benefit is that the proportion of divorce as well as the evils of family violence will be decreased. The majority of the divorced is result from not understanding the partner and don't integrate with married life. If getting married late, woman will have more time to comprehend her companion and realize who is right man for her. Ċ On the contrary, there are some disadvantages of this tendency. First and foremost, in Vietnam, the traditional customs still have a strong influence on the thinking of parents, so they will worry and create pressure on their daughter when she married late, which makes her faded and bored. For instance, my sister is 27 year-old and has steady job but not married, so her parents feel anxious and find a lot men to matchmaking for her regardless of her hostility. In addition, choosing celibacy will lead to the population reduction as well as gender imbalance. If a woman decides to live alone, the rate of marriage and childbearing will flop in significant way. Ċ In conclusion, getting married late or choosing to live alone in woman has above positive and negative aspects. Hence, we should consider in each situation to make a right decision.

prompt: Some people like to try new things, for example, places to visit and types of food. Other people prefer to keep doing things they are familiar with. Discuss both these attitudes and give your own opinion.
essay: There are many individuals preferring to experience and discover new things such as places to visit and food, while others would like to keep them as is and stay in familiar circumstances. I support the first group of peoples' attitude because it brings a positive approach to life in general. Ċ To begin with, the majority of us like discovering new countries with their culture, cuisine and even style of living as it provides more emotions, positive way to various situations and sometimes it assists generating new ideas. For example, my brother, an engineer, after returning a trip all times invents some efficient electrical things . He says that those emotions he received while travelling support and inspire him to new actions and ideas. Therefore, I believe that experiencing new activities help individuals for broadening their horizons and change the way they live. Ċ However, those people who continue doing the same things have relevant reasons for that. For instance, they might be afraid of being disappointed. Probably, a person has or know an unsuccessful experience that makes him or her scared to try new stuff. And now this individual prefers to stay in familiar circumstances and do affairs for confidence. I personally consider this behaviour as missing opportunities and chances to find new ways of interesting and saturated life. Without discovering and trying new stuff living turns into a routine and becomes boring. Ċ In conclusion, many people support active and full of adventures life as it maintains a positive attitude and inspires to new ideas. I totally agree with such type of lifestyle, whilst others keep being in familiar situations to avoid disappointment, and thus, deprive themselves of chances to improve their existence for the better.

prompt: Topic: "In many countries today, increasing numbers of young people studt at univesity. Students, who will probably earn higher than average salaries after graduating should pay for their own higher education, rather than state. What are your views?"
essay: The concept that students should pay for their education is gaining popularity as more young people opt to go to universities. Although I have some sympathy with this idea, I believe that state funding is good investment for the future, not only for the students themselves, but for the students who can afford it should make some contribution to their university fees. Ċ Firstly, there are young people who cannot afford higher education but are very ambitious and talented. Instead of entering universities they begin working and the talents are wasted. Funding them is a good Idea as it brings equality to people and have a opportunity to study in universities irrespectively of their financial state. Ċ Secondly, student who have the financial state that grant them to pay for the fees, it should be obligatory for them to contribute for it as provides an opportunity for those who cannot afford it and be funded by state. This idea would provide more people with a higher deegre who have the professional skills that would not only be beneficial for them but for the counties development as well and boost the different field of jobs that are in failure. Ċ In conclusion, it is obvious that not all young people who plan to enter universities cannot afford their education, funding them is beneficial to individuals and brings a social quality. Under this conditions the country the country would flourish and even number of crimes will decrease as more people will be engaged by their jobs and studies.

prompt: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Telephones and email have made communication between people less personal. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
essay: There are many advantage of these invention, telephones and email. Communication between people by using telephones and email made my life easier. I personally disagree with this notion that these types of communication, telephones and email, made people less personal. I will give several reasons to support my opinion. Ċ To begin with, telephones and email help people, who live far away from other people, to connect each other. Unlike email, send message by using mail service could be lost and could be sent to wrong address. I can using telephones and email to talk or write directly to people I want to connect with. For example, right now, I am in the U.S. It is not possible to have conversation in person with my parents, who live in my country. Consequently, I can make a phone call or write email to my parents whenever I want. Telephones and email made me feel close to my parents. Ċ Second, Using telephones and email could express some important words better than face-to-face communication. For instant, sometime when I argue with my friends, I cannot express my self to my friends at that moment. So, when I have a time to realize what had happened, I could explain the real thought that I want to express without emotion. Thus, these types of communications make me feel personal. Ċ Telephones and email make me feel personal because I could directly connect with people that I love. Beside, I could express my personal thought through telephones and email. As a result, I believe that telephones and email do not make communication between people less personal.

prompt: Today, the younger and older generations are in the same workplace. Is this more an advantage or more disadvantage?
essay: Seeing young generations sharing the same working environment with the older ones have become more common these days. This essay will argue that such development brings huge advantages to the workplace. Ċ The increase in productivity is the prime reason to let people from different generations work together. While the creativity of the young blows new air to any business projects, the rich experiences of older workers help solve any problems or difficulties occurred. Their coordination, therefore, will significantly reduce the time required to finish the company's project while maintaining a high level of product quality. For example, thanks to the cooperation of the senior and the junior workers in the software department, my company has successfully delivered the final product to our customer two weeks before the deadline. Ċ Moreover, the co-existence of workers of different ages will make the atmosphere in the office less boring and dull. Many people admit that they tend to avoid conversations with their colleagues in the same age group because the topics to discuss quickly runs out. This tendency will eventually turn an active and lively office into a silent retirement home where no one talks unless it is about work. Hence, a multigenerational office will be able to promote communication between co-workers as there are always things to talk about. For instance, junior workers can share their modern lifestyles while the seniors can remind the young generation of how peaceful and tranquil life was in the past, and the list of topics goes on. Ċ In conclusion, putting workers of different ages together is definitely beneficial to any office as this development improves productivity and working atmosphere.

prompt: Parents with undisciplined children should be made to follow compulsory 'parenting skills' classes where they can learn from professional teachers how to be a good parents. Do the advantages of this approach outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: Some people believe that parents of trouble-maker kids should be taught 'parenting skills' from professional educator in hope that this would reduce the number of undisciplined children in a society. The advantages and disadvantages of this method will be discussed thoroughly in this essay. Ċ The main benefit of this approach is that it allows the government to fix the issue from its root of problem. To be exact, parents are child's first exposure to the outside world, therefore, it is believed that parents with good attitude will pass them to their children. As a result, children with responsible and disciplined parents will be most likely to grow into a disciplined adult and vice versa. Ċ That said, undoubtedly there is also drawback to this solution. One important disadvantage is that this solution does not address the problem since there are many contributors that causes a child to be undisciplined. The attitude of their parents is only one of them, along with bad media, culture and friend influences. Therefore, forcing parents of undisciplined child to take up 'parenting skills' classes would only waste the government resources and money and not solve the problem. Ċ In conclusion, the advantage and disadvantage of this approach are equally important and that the government should investigate the matter more deeply before deciding on a solution. One possible solution could be to make undisciplined child to take up 'disciplinary classes' instead of 'parenting skills' classes for their parents.

prompt: Some governments spend a lot of public money training individuals to be successful in international sporting events. Some people believe that this money should be spent on things that will benefit the general public instead. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Nowadays, there has commonly been a huge amount of debate regarding this matter, a certain segment of society assumes that governments are wasting their money to organize sporting tournaments while some individuals think contrary. I fully agree that the general folk’s needs are more vital than sporting events. This essay will elucidate my views considering this trend as an adverse advancement for the community. Ċ Firstly, to train an elite athlete, authorities hire world-class fitness trainers as well as coaches, moreover, they build various expensive playgrounds and luxury building for the players. To cite an instance, a survey was conducted was by the Discovery channel states that the U.S.A spent 50 million dollars in the last Olympic games to provide special training for their players. In addition to that, another 10 million also spent to reward players who won medals. This wealth could be used for feeding poor persons or building shelters for the homeless crowd, and there are a plethora of individuals in the nation who are unable to feed their tummy. Ċ Secondly, sometimes these sporting events can cause tension between the two countries due to the fact that everyone desire’s that their country’s team should be the winner of the game. To illustrate that, when there is a cricket match India vs Pakistan then the situation between these two nations gets very dangerous. Furthermore, residents of these nations start posting bad content on social media which clearly make the situation worse. Same story we can see when the FIFA football cup starts. Ċ To conclude, in my perspective, spend a country’s assets on few players is not a wise thing because our priority should be to reduce the poverty but this trend swift the rate of poverty in undeveloped nations.

prompt: Nowadays some professionals such as doctors, lawyers and engineers are paid much higher than ordinary workers. What do you think of this trend? Are there any jobs which you think should offer higher salaries?
essay: Recently, some experts remuneration such as health professionals,lawyers and engineers, outweighs other professions. These are high earned vocation that works in detail, they pay a lot in schooling ranging from school fees, textbooks, handouts etc. In my opinion, these avocations should be reimbursed more than any other career options. Reasons will be explained herein. Ċ To begin with, people refer to these adepts as "career for life" because you can either choose to practice privately or work in organizations or companies. For example, being a medical doctor has helped me a lot in several ways that I would have imagined. Patients entrust their lives into my hands because they believe I am capable to cure and heal them of their burdens and diseases, they see doctors as gods who can do and undo things, I will go the extra mile to make sure nothing happens to them. Sometimes when things go wrong, doctors suffer the most ;they are blamed for a patient's death because they have this notion they have been mismanaged or used as drug experiments. we go through and face a lot in the course of practice. More so, the salaries health professionals receive should compensate for the kind of jobs they do. Ċ Furthermore, a lot of people go into these occupations because there are better job opportunities in comparison to others like performing art. Due to the risk and job intensity, there are flexible and good payment plans associated too. For example, my cousin is an engineer who works in an oil firm, his job involves him staying in the ship on a sea for 2 weeks before they sail to the chore, this is very in-depth. He has to be paid to compensate for the risk he goes through each time he goes to work, compared to a front desk worker who only sits from morning till when he/she closes and goes home. Ċ To conclude, professionals like doctors, nurses, lawyers and engineers should be recompensed handsomely compared to other professions.

prompt: Employers should give longer holidays to employees to encourage them to do their job. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: One of the most conspicuous trends of today's world is a colossal upsurge in the number of people believing that by giving longer holidays to employees to encourage them to do their task efficiently. There is a widespread worry and this will lead to a myriad of concerns in one's life. However, I do not entirely accept this and I will explain in this essay. Ċ There are a number of arguments in favour of my stance. The most preponderant one is that work pressure, due to tough competition and tight deadlines in corporate sector. Therefore, they have to do job in late nights and the employees do not have enough time to unwind and feel relax. Moreover, there is a rat-race between colleagues for the office promotions. Needless to say, if employers allow them a break for some time, it is good for their health as well as they feel more energetic, and they can focus on the assigned task by which the chances of company growth will increase. For example, the CEO of Microsoft company limits the working hours and they saw the progress of their worker improved within a few months. As a result, there yearly turnover is increased by 25%, said Google. Ċ There are, however, some pitfalls that can easily overwhelm the potential benefits of longer holidays. The primary one stems from the fact that by observing the aforementioned trend, people have not realized its gravity, but also gauged the magnitude of its repercussion when it comes to today's ever-changing lifestyle. Besides, its impact on the economy of the country is far-reaching indeed. Hence, it is apparent why many are against allowing the job half-term. Ċ To summarize the arguments outlined above, one can conclude that despite some drawbacks the benefit of the holidays is indeed too great to ignore. Because, the workers feel happy and courageous by having a rest from their work.

prompt: Topic: Some people strongly oppose animal experimentation, believing that it causes pain to animals, while some other people consider it necessary. What is your opinion?
essay: People hold different views towards the necessity and humane feature of current animal testing. In my opinion, both human and animals are capable of deriving enormous benefits from this sort of experimentation and thereby, it is suggested to be enhanced. Ċ To begin with, the advantages of vivisection to human are most prominent in the field of medicine and education. For instance, various types of animals such as pigs and mice have been significantly used in testing new kinds of drugs by dint of possessing similar biological features to those of human. Some drug prototypes are theoretically effective but whether there are any side effects in reality is rather unknown. In these cases, the use of animals in checking pharmaceuticals is essential prior to applying in persons. Additionally, many animal-based researches have been conducted inside educational institutions have provided new insights into the evolution of animals. Briefly, animal testing helps to advance our medical and scientific knowledge. Ċ Equally importantly is that, animal testing are beneficial to wildlife species for many reasons. Firstly, by carrying out genetic experiments do scientists potentially offer some solutions for the endangered species. It is true that a wide variety of animals are on the verge of extinction owing to the loss of natural habitats or increasing pollutants. With the results of animal research, this issue will probably be tackled. Furthermore, examining ethology will provide an outlet for controlling some species in particular patterns. For example, nowadays it is applicable to increase the likelihood of animal survival in natural environment. Accordingly, animal experimentation has a positive impact on animals themselves. Ċ To sum up, animal testing plays a significant role in the well-being of both human beings and animals. Therefore, animal vivisection should continue rather than being suppressed in the future.

prompt: [TPO7] Essay Topic Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
essay: Although many people believe facts have more practical effects than abstract words, I think ideas and concepts have more potential force that will affect our whole life. In my opinion, the value of understanding ideas and concepts is higher than learning facts. Ċ The first reason is ideas and concepts are difficult to grasp. Unlike facts, we can find it out by continuously testing. On the contrary, ideas are hard to perceive, because ideas usually contains more range of knowledge and develops for a long time. Therefore, understanding ideas and concepts will increase our competitiveness. Ċ Second, ideas and concepts are usually created by outstanding persons. Those people dedicate their whole life to specific areas and in the end they left all their efforts in their words. Those words are the ideas and concepts we learn now. Thus, learning ideas is not just learning it, but learn from those great persons. Ċ The third reason is we will benefit a lot by understanding just one idea or concept. For example, there are too many stories describing how a person succeed by being motivated by one idea or concept. Merely only one idea will create huge powers that we cannot even imagine. Hence, we will gain more by grasping relatively small amounts of ideas. Ċ In conclusion, we do nothing without any fact; nonetheless, if we want to achieve something great, then merely holding facts is absolutely not enough. We need the help from ideas, concepts, and those brilliant people.

prompt: Question : Some people argue that strict punishment for driving offenses is the only effective way toward improving safety on the road. Do you agree or disagree? Road safety improving
essay: Nowadays, increasing number of Traffic accidents is a growing concern in developing and developed nations. While some opine that strict actions should be imposed on the offenders who violates traffic norms is the most efficient way to reduce road accidents. I agree that strict rules should be implemented for the road safety Ċ The first and foremost benefit for imposing harsh punishments on violating traffic laws is that it will Inculcate discipline and responsible among citizens. In addition, People will always think twice before breaking the traffic laws, otherwise they have to deal with hefty fines and imprisonment. To illustrate, in Singapore, traffic accidents were reduced exponentially after their government taken action against traffic law breakers. Ċ Secondly, safe driving will help to reduce financial overheads on the state. This is because less number of accidents will result in reduction in damages to public properties, thus authority will have to pay less for infrastructure fixation. Moreover, Insurance companies will have to settle fewer number of claims related to accidents, so in longer run, their premium will reduce considerably which in turn will benefit the individuals. Ċ However, some people may argue that instead of implementing strict punishment, state should increase awareness about traffic rules among vehicle drivers by providing informative sessions and advertisements which will have same impact as with harsh traffic guidelines. What is more, heavy penalty on drivers may become burden on individuals. Therefore, traffic educations should be considered as an important aspect to minimize fatalities. Ċ In conclusion, although motivating people about following road safety rules can reduce accident risk, harsh punishment will force the people to follow traffic regulations in more effective way

prompt: Today more people are overweight than ever before. What in your opinion are the primary causes of this? What are the main effects of this epidemic?
essay: Obesity is rapidly becoming a stigma in our society today. This essay will discuss the reasons behind the increasing number of overweight people as well as analyse its impacts. Ċ In my opinion, the two major causes of obesity are over-consumption of fast food and lack of physical exercise. A large amount of people today, rely on fast foods, for their daily diet. These foods contain oils and saturated fats, which leads to slow metabolism rate and excessive weight gain. To cite an example, a survey conducted by WHO in 2015, found that 90% of obese citizens, solely depended on outside foods for their nutrition, which clearly depicts the contribution of quick foods for the growing cases of fatness. Secondly, the majority of adults nowadays, lead a sedentary lifestyle due to increasing facilities and changes in the work environment. For instance, everyone, now prefers taking elevators, instead of climbing stairs. Moreover, the work is becoming less demanding physically due to availability of machines. All the above changes, have taken to reduce the required physical activities for a human body, which has ultimately resulted in a huge obese population. Ċ The main effects of this trend, in my view, include increasing health problems and loss of productivity. Heftiness can lead to an array of cardiovascular diseases. In addition to this, diabetes and blood pressure are common problems among overweight people. In fact, a research conducted recently, has concluded that there is 65% more chance of developing diabetes for a fat person. Furthermore, obese workers are often very unhealthy, and hence, get stressed and tired easily. This decreases their efficiency. It has been observed that, an individual with normal weight works much faster, compared to an obese person. Ċ To conclude, the unhealthy eating habits and inactive lifestyles are the main reasons behind fatness which leads to severe health issues and low performance. Since, the consequences of these are highly destructible to mankind, steps need to be taken on individual as well as the government level to fight the problem.

prompt: Some people think that the government should increase tax on unhealthy food to encourage people to start eating healthy. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Needless to say that consumption of fast food adversely affecting the health of a human being. Some people claimed, it is essential to impose a high tax on junk foodstuff because it may discourage people from eating fast food. In my opinion, hefty charges can reduce the consumption rate but will not motivate them for nutritious food items, and I would explain some points which strengthen my viewpoint in the upcoming paragraphs. Ċ To begin with, imposing heavy levies on fast food means an increase in price on commodities which directly affect the middle class and poor people. To be more specific, junk food like burgers, pizzas and street foods available at affordable rates at various apps like zomato and swiggy. Consequently working people and students who live away from homes prefer junk food because they do not have enough time to prepare a meal. Eventually, if the government increase the tax on fast food, it will not affect the rich people they will continue to consume it. Ċ On the other hand, there some other methods through which this problem could be solved. First is, healthy foodstuff should be more affordable and accessible so that everyone, especially weaker section of the society can easily buy it and easily approachable for the working people. Because many people are aware of the ill effect of unhealthy eating habits but the availability of ready to eat food is comparatively more than healthy products. Moreover, the government ought to organize a health awareness campaign in different areas which give information not only about healthy and unhealthy food but also explain the harmful impacts of fast food. Ċ In conclusion, nonetheless imposing hefty charges on ready to eat meals minimize the consumption of unhealthy products, but it will deter low-income groups from buying them. Health fitness programme and the awareness of self-discipline towards the eating pattern could certainly reduce the consumption rate of junk foods.

prompt: Now a lot of people in college are doing academic study. Ċ should encourage them lo learn vocational skill (like plumbers Ċ electricians). Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Majority of the people are acquiring academy schooling these days.Though attending college is mandatory, some people believe that students should be encouraged to gain some other mechanical artistry such as plumbers and electricians, however,I do not agree will the given statement.I will list down the reasons for my disagreement. Ċ Firstly, students spend their majority of life period after earning the educational institution degree going through a lot of hardships.Hence, there is no reason for asking them to learn other vocational skill other than their field, undervaluing their college training.Moreover, emergency situations are not often when an individual may need plumber or electrician, in case of needy time, at most of the places, one can find technical person easily.For instance, students at college are always busy learning new things of their own branch, if they are forced to learn new job not related to their field, it may be waste of time resulting in disappointment among students.As follows, college students should be encouraged to sharpen their accomplishment and increase the knowledge-oriented to their own line. Ċ Secondly, if college students will start leaning vocational skill then, the people who can not afford the university study and employed as a technical person, be it electrician or any other,they will also have fewer opportunities to work because people are already knowledgeable and can do technical work of their own.Thusly, the ratio of unemployment will rise causing more difficulties for the technical persons to earn a living.To illustrate,If an individual gets his fan damaged at home, and he has learnt how to repair fan, he will not call the electrician as it will save money and time both for him. Therefore, vocational skill is something, which is easily available to learn for poor people, and at least those skills, people should let to someone who can not afford the higher education. Ċ In conclusion, some people may see mechanical skills as necessary and may give the motivation to learn those skills to students pursuing the university discipline, nonetheless, I do not agree with this for the reasons, that it may let students feel underestimation of the university education, as well as lead to the employment of technical persons.

prompt: Too much attention is paid to and too much money is spent on keeping pets, while people throughout the world are starving. To what extent do you agree?
essay: Some people argue that the attention and money spent on pets are a waste of money and this can be diverted to stop starvation in the third world countries. However, others believe that leading a luxurious life spending more on pets is a privilege of the well-off community. Considering the two aspects, I conclude that, both arguments carry the same amount of gravity. Ċ First of all, pets not only share life with people but also help the people, for instance, the life of the elderly living alone is safeguarded. Nowadays, pets are trained to guide their deaf or blind masters, to smell people to identify when they are sick or in danger and to provide safety in farmlands. In addition, in a broader perspective, animals are used in the police in order to catch the offenders. Similarly, they can be used to rescue those who are lost in the snow or deserts. Therefore pets are used successfully in both domestic and community based services. Ċ When the counter argument is taken into account, a huge sum of money is allocated for pets in bringing up, treatment and training purposes. It is worthwhile assessing to what extent it is ethical to keep people starved, reserving money for the maintenance of pets. It is not only the adults, but also the children are dying in significant numbers due to lack of money to spend on food. In addition, Poor immunity, lack of energy and poor working performance carry an extra burden to the existing problem. Based on these factors money can be re allocated to prevent starvation in developing countries. Ċ In conclusion, these arguments point out two different scenarios. Nevertheless, there should be a balance in spending and the excess money has to be kept for the benefit of the entire mankind.

prompt: Should we invent a new language for people from different countries to use for international communication? Do you think there are more benefits or more problems with it?
essay: Today,the role of English as a global language is indispensable.Some people are of the view that we can introduce a new language for the people to use for international activities.Although this initiative may be a useful way to create new platform that facilitates universal cooperation,I believe it would raise a number of worrying issues. Ċ Admittedly,the availability of a global language can promote international trade and also create new possibilities for the cooperation between countries in other areas without language barriers.By using a common language,people are able to handle cross-cultural communication and build business partnerships. Besides,learning a new language is a effective way to promote individual competitiveness to adapt the present society quickly;thus,under this trend,people who have proficiency in this new language are more likely to find jobs,collect information and travel overseas. Ċ On the other hand, if the world has a dominant language, it may have a damaging effect on cultural diversity and cultural identity, especially for the ethnic minorities.Languages in these countries may suffer from extinction because people should learn it to keep the pace of life with a big burden,resulting to retrogression in their own language cultures.It should also be noted that this innovation would markedly increase the governmental expenditure on creating, publishing and teaching it, so maintaining the main position of English around the world is much more cost-efficient and effective than innovating a brand-new one. Ċ In conclusion, the enormous potential risks of innovating a single international language outweigh the benefits of it.Therefore,Persuading citizens to use existing global language proficiently assists us protecting some minority languages and cultural heritages.

prompt: Some employers are giving increased importance to social skills. However, others still believe qualifications are the most important. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: With the increased educational level of workforce, there are growing number of employers seeking criteria other than qualifications such as social skills in their employee selection process. However, some employers still believe that qualifications should be the most paramount criterion. The essay intends to explore both sides of arguments and also present my own opinion. Ċ Firstly, some people suggest that qualification should be the foremost measurement to determine the value of a employer. It is of importance that workers should be well educated and trained to perform duties of their job. Specifically, people who work in professional fields such as medicals are required to have a university degree and years of experience. Social skills seem to be less important as they cannot contribute to the success of a surgery. Ċ On the other hand, it is no doubt that the importance of social skills have been recognized by increasing number of employers. It is because people nowadays are required to work as a team in their jobs frequently. Interpersonal skill plays an essential role in helping colleagues to cooperate with each other, especially when conflicts arise. Better social skills allow them to resolve disagreements in a much more harmony way. Besides, organization have been transformed to customers oriented. Excellent social skills can help employees maintain strong relationship with their clients which thus lead to a better customer satisfaction. Ċ To my view, I incline to believe qualification is still the fundamental determinant of an employee's competency of their jobs.
