Yet, the importance of social skills should not be neglected as those skills can help one to perform their job effectiveness and efficiency by facilitating interaction and communication with others.

prompt: some people believe that all companies decisions should be decided by the managers, while others view that its better to include employees in decision making. Ċ discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: In the present age, there has been much discussion revolving around the issue of whether all decisions in companies should be taken by owners or employees can have a contribution to it. Some people argue that only the managers have this responsibility to decide about the important issues, while others assert that including the employees in decision making have some benefits. Personally, I am in favour of the latter view. Ċ On the one hand, some individuals think that the head of each organization is able to decide about different subjects because they care more than anyone else about their company situation. Furthermore, during the decision-making process, they analyze everything and finally choose a way that is the most beneficial for the network. In addition, usually, managers have more experience which is a vital factor. For instance, if a company face a financial problem, they can use both their experience and leadership skills to find a solution. Ċ On the other hand, others believe that there are many advantages to participating the workers to finding a way to solve the drawbacks. Moreover, they argue that using more minds leads to having more ideas. For example, if an organization face a problem, it will be better to have a meeting with all employees and discuss with them the causes and solutions. Consequently, they will find a way faster than when only the boss does it. Ċ To sum up, I would like to say that I totally agree with the statement that everyone in a company should have the right to express their opinions. From my perspective, there are more merits than demerits such as finding a route to solve and pass difficult situations.

prompt: You should spend about 40 minutes on this task. Ċ The dangers of smoking are well known, yet many people continue with this habit. Ċ What are the causes of this? How can we reduce smoking in society? Ċ Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. Ċ You should write at least 250 words.
essay: It is argued that fume ingestion has a plethora of adverse side effects. However, the overwhelming majority of individuals do not pluck up the costume. Many causes are appointed to this as well as communities are called to solve the issue. This essay will shed light on both causes and solutions as well as provide evidence to prove the arguments. Ċ There are manifold causes for the issue, first and foremost, genetic predisposition. In other words, numerous smokers inherited the habits from their ancestors. For instance, recent research from the University Zambeze carried out last year showcased that more than 60% of cigarette smokers got the tradition from their collateral and the parental gene was accountable for the fate. As a result, no matter what their post- generation does they will fall into smoking dependence. Moreover, these sorts of toxic dependence substances are the main reason for a myriad of fume dependences throughout the world. Ċ There are plenty of possible smoke solutions, which communities should adopt worldwide such as eliminating crop production across the earth. It will undoubtedly cut the chain distribution. For instance, the investigation made by the University of Cambridge pointed out that if the world tobacco production was shrunk only to half worldwide the earth would live without smokers in less than 2 years. Hence, lung diseases could reduce as well as they should soar individuals life's span. Ċ In conclusion, amongst fair motives for a crowd smoking genetical issue is the most pivotal and societies are urged to tackle this evil inside them and cutting the chain production has shown is the most effective measure. Therefore, I encourage the world-ruling power to tussle together to eradicate this problem.

prompt: Discuss both these views and give your own opinion. Ċ Childhood obesity is becoming a problem throughout the developed world.Because of this, some people think that adverts for fast food, sweets and sugary snacks should not be allowed in schools and colleges. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree with this?
essay: It is hard to deny the fact that obesity has been dramatically increasing over the years among the children. Owing to this, it is believed by many people that fast meal ads should be banned from the schools and colleges. As far as I concerned, school and college are meant for education so adverts of healthy meal should be introduced. Ċ There is no doubt that fast food items, sweets and sugary snacks are one of the major reasons due to which adolescents have obesity. On the top of this, introducing advertisement on such items in institutes is really a big issue to be taken care of immediately. For instance, companies take the biggest advantage of the institutes to target youth in a large capacity, as it might hard for youngsters to avoid junk foodstuff when big posters are available in front of them. In addition, companies encourage the children to eat them in large groups as they always ready to give discount on order of large quantity. Moreover, many Colleges make money from these adverts by charging the companies a minimum fee. Ċ Although removing the food adds from the institute is very hard, it can be replaced by green vegetable adverts. However, it is very difficult to stop students from eating junk items, but they can be guided to eat green items. Having a cafeteria with healthy meal will result in some change among the students. For example, setting up healthy workshops for the students and by the students will also promote a healthy lifestyle. Listing of drawbacks on obesity and then sticking them to the walls of the schools will also create awareness. Ċ In Conclusion, I think it would be fair to change the junk snack advertisements with the healthy stuff. Furthermore, institutes should blacklist the companies with sweets and sugary snacks.

prompt: Present a written argument or case to an educated reader with no specialist knowledge of the following topic: There are many different types of music in the world today. Why do we need music? Is the traditional music of a country more important than the international music that is heard everywhere nowadays? Use your own ideas, knowledge and experience and support your arguments with examples and relevant evidence. You should write at least 250 words.
essay: Imagine our world without any entertainment which will exist in case we vanish tunes from our life. These sounds are the main bridge where education, history and culture travelled through every century from the beginning of humanity. Therefore, I believe that international melodies are more significant than traditional ones and they are considered essential tools for learning, healing and amusement. Ċ Presently, musical instruments are working an efficient role in many social facilities. In schools, teachers are using them to clarify difficult materials for students in a convenient way such as math courses which are recorded on musical audiotapes. Another benefit of music was discovered in hospitals where it helps patients to remain calm during and after surgeries. Finally, there are many pieces and performances that are dedicated to specific occasions like weddings, funerals and concerts. Ċ Secondly, our planet is developing at high speed with new technologies which are appearing every day, so there is no more place for traditional music. Young generations are seeking the modern trends in songs especially the one which scores a high rate of listening or views without any consideration of its originality or historical background. In addition to that, the widespread of social media such as Facebook, Youtube and Tiktok assist in the advertisement of recent singers. These artists aim to expand their audience worldwide, and they are not concentrating on the quality of their products. Ċ In conclusion, music is the principal incentive for all other occupations whatever it is educational or professional. As result, I hope that this domain will unite us as a human race known for its compassion and love.

prompt: Nowadays, people change their appearance by dying hair, buying fashionable clothes, wearing make-ups and even undergoing plastic surgery. What are the reasons? Do you think it is a positive or negative development?
essay: Many people now place more importance on their appearances by coloring their hair, being fashionable, wearing make-up and even undergoing plastic surgery. This is down to the influences of the media and advertisement. In my view, this is a negative development. Ċ One of the factors influencing people to change their appearance is celebrity. People adore some famous personalities and thanks to the proliferation of internet, it makes even easier for people to access information about famous artist. They mostly have colored hair, put a heavy make-up and wear expensive clothes. Some celebrities, such as Korean, even undergo plastic surgery to gain more popularity. People as their fans want to look like them and therefore they follow their footsteps. Another impacting factor is advertisement. People are bombarded with many advertisements of cosmetic, fashion, and make up. This is unconsciously setting up a standard of beauty in their mind. As a result, they buy products to become the image of endorser in the ads. Ċ However, this is clearly a negative development. The image of beauty should not be influence by outside factor. All women are gorgeous as they already are with their natural hair color and without heavy make up. In Indonesia, a woman wearing a traditional costume with simple make up and black hair is considered as a natural beauty. Additionally, frequent heavy make-up could lead into various skin problems, namely pimple and skins breakout. Furthermore, plastic surgery needs a costly maintenance. If people could not afford it, then they will borrow some money and they could run up a debt. Ċ In conclusion, media reporting celebrities and advertisement are the reasons people change their look. However, make-up and plastic surgery potentially bring about many problems to many problems for this to be considered as positive development.

prompt: The number of old people is increasing in many countries. Some people think this causes problems, while others think old people play an important role. Ċ Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: The Twenty-one century has been all about increasing life expectancy. However, some economic consequences are starting to become a delicate concern in many countries. While there is a common belief that the growth of the ageing population is positive to society, many people believe the cost of maintaining them is reaching unbearable levels for the active workforce. I believe that governments should come up with some long-term alternatives for retirement schemes as the current ones are likely to collapse. Ċ The elderly play a vital role in both communities and families. For instance, they are the ones in charge of keeping traditions alive, either by passing on secret cooking recipes or writing the history books that children will learn from in the future. In addition, they play an important role inside the family's organization with many parents relying on them for babysitting. The COVID pandemic is a clear example of how much damage has been done to families to keep children and grandparents apart during such a prolonged time. In this way, the importance of elders in society is undeniable. Ċ On the other hand, there are several concerns regarding the economic and financial support of the elderly. The clearest example is the retirement schemes that are widespread around the world these days. In general, the active workforce is the one holding the cost of pensioners by paying taxes. As long as the ageing population keeps up the increasing tendency, there would not be enough resources to maintain them. If authorities do not come up with an alternative model, the whole economic system is might collapse. In addition, the health system´s capacity will also be compromised. It is well-known that the older a person is, the more health issues can arise. Therefore, current hospitals and clinics might not be enough to attend to everyone´s needs. Ċ To sum up, elderlies play an invaluable role in the community and families. However, governments should design new ways of funding retirements as only relying on the active working people can lead to a significant crisis.

prompt: Because the modern technology, it is no longer necessary for people to learn handwriting skill, but others believe that handwriting is still an important skill. Discuss both sides and give your opinion base on your experience.
essay: Due to the modern technology, it is no longer required for people to learn a handwriting skill. However, others still believe that handwriting is an important ability to do different multifarious jobs. The proficiency of handwriting has been changed by computer keyboard which provide letters, and numbers. On the other hand, handwriting is extremely prominent in our daily life activity, and not only in the office, such as mothers at home or in a social gathering, students, and teachers at school. Ċ Nowadays computer has replaced handwriting for almost all kinds of job in office. For instance; typing letters, doing finance report, as well as making charts. In spite of it, not all financial statements can be undertaken by computer. Still, people need handwriting abilities to write a financial report. The major cause of this is if all accounting can be typed on computers, imposture can always happen.Whereas, if it is written in a book manually, later the one who meant to do the correction, he or she may not use correction pen, but cross out one line so that the auditor would be able to see if it is true or tricky. Ċ In contrast, the ability to have a good writing is still necessary in our daily life. For examples: parents at home, mothers in a social gathering, students, and teachers in class are required to write, whether on a paper, on blackboard or whiteboard, as well as in a book. Students who have bad handwriting might get some difficulties in a written test. A teacher or an examiner who has minus eyes will not be able to check the student's work properly. As a result, the student might get a bad score due to ugly handwriting. Ċ To come to a conclusion, in my opinion, although handwriting is substituted by computers, Nonetheless, handwriting skill will be required in any action, whether in office as well as in our daily life, for examples; in writing a financial report still better to use handwriting in order to prevent from camouflage statements. While in school, teachers and students must be able to have the ability of handwriting so that everything runs well.

prompt: Some say that it is more important for employers to consider academic qualifications rather than personal life experience and values when hiring an employee. Do you agree or disagree? What are positive and negative aspects of the issue?
essay: Company's success partially depends on employees who work there. Hiring right person for right job position is one of the main factors affecting to company's future success. Therefore, companies should pay more attention on hiring an employee who is most suitable for the position. Selection process of hiring an employee depends on several candidate-related factors. Some people argue that an academic qualification of job candidate is more important than its personal life experience and values, while others oppose to this idea. In my point of view, both of views supportable because both of them have advantages and disadvantages. Ċ In many job position the academic knowledge person gained through his education is the fundament of his future working and pursuing knowledge. For example, software programmers usually work on coding to develop the right solution by planning most appropriate algorithm. This ability usually requires individuals to be good at computing and math. Therefore, programmer's capability depends heavily on his academic qualifications. Ċ On the other hand, however academic qualification of candidate is important, personal experience and values must be consider first for some kind of job position. For example, it could not be appropriate choice for teachers of kinder garden to require best academic qualifications regardless his personal experience. Teachers of kinder garden must be good carefulness with children. In my opinion, the person who has a personal life or previous work experience with children can work, care and educate children more carefully than one without any experience with child. Ċ In conclusion, academic qualification, personal experience and values of job candidate are main factors for making decision in hiring employee. Therefore, when hiring an employee, making decision based only one of these factors might be imperfect solution for some kind of job position.

prompt: Some think that residents should responsible for keeping thier areas clean and tidy, while others say it is the government’s responsibility. Discuss both views and state your own opinion.
essay: It is important that we have to keep our surroundings clean and maintain hygiene in the life. A group of people believes that the government should take steps to maintain the area and another group argue that it is an individual's duty to clean the place. In my opinion, both the authority and individual should join and take efforts to maintain our areas. Ċ On the one hand, most of the garbages come from the houses and from the residential areas. Everyone should be aware about the impact of dumping in a public area without finding a suitable way to dump or recycle the garbage. Moreover, citizens can start segregating the waste and can accumulate it in a common area where the concern authority can come and collect the waste. For example, in Bangalore, most of the apartments segregate the waste and use bio-waste as manure for the plants. As a result of this, the environment is clean and it promoted the growth of the plants. Ċ On the other hand, the law enforcing agency can start awareness classes to the society about the collection and disposal. Additionally, they should arrange the facility to collect all the garbage from all the apartments and clean the public facilities daily. For instance, in Kerala, the authority has a group of women for handling the unwanted things from a family and they go and pick the plastics and papers from the roads, schools. This makes the city tidy and also act as a job for the women. Ċ In conclusion, maintaining a healthy life and a clean environment is the responsibility of both the individuals and the governments. By the joint effort and cooperation, we can make the environment green and pollution free.

prompt: Some people believe that having too many TV channels is good for people, while some other pole believe that it only brings some poor quality TV programs. Ċ Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: It is argued that there are interesting purposes on the broadcast TV for individuals these days, meanwhile; others suppose that it is just the low-quality channels. This essay will discuss two viewpoints and I totally agree with the first one in the following paragraphs. Ċ To begin with, there is no doubt that it is easy to watch the uncensored contents for children, tending to imitate unsuitable actions. In other words, it is challenging with parents to steer their' children to watch and enjoy it. For instance, movies in which have several violent and sexual scenarios are more likely to create bad habits for adolescents by the time their consciousnesses are flaws. Their awareness, as a result, could develop in wrong ways which lead to worse generations in upcoming years. Ċ On the other hand, I would agree that watching Television programs has huge merit for almost all residents. In particular, it is likely to do not only widen their horizons but also help them keep up to date with breaking national and worldwide news. Taking the Covid-19 pandemic as an example. Thanks to this media, citizens could update about the danger of this virus through a significant increase in mortality rate around the world. People, therefore, are aimed to know how to protect themselves and their relatives in both physical and mental health from this disaster. Moreover, a TV program is one of the best ways for entertainment. People could release stress after daily high-pressure work by watching TV with their families. Ċ In the conclusion, both views inevitably have their supporting evidence. I quite believe that the effects of TV programs are useful among people.

prompt: Many schools today require students to work without pay for companies as part of their education. Ċ Is this more advantageous to students or companies?
essay: Nowadays, several institutes have introduced an internship program in which students are required to work for a certain period without receiving any pay. This has a positive impact on students in various ways, such as gaining practical knowledge, as well as an insight of their future careers, and also an increased job opportunity. In this essay, we shall discuss the merits to it further. Ċ In the past few decades, the education system has tried to foment ways to enhance and improve children’s education and future. Moreover, internship programs are one of the advancement which has shown many benefits, for instance, it provides a different approach towards teaching system altogether, eventually serving as a platform to implement theories into practice. Furthermore, the atmosphere in jobs is different from the classroom environment, and hence these sessions provide an in-depth information about the possibilities encountered in the office. Lastly, programs like these not only help in developing knowledge, but as well in building-up the resume of the student. Additionally, it prepares them for the interviews, and notable requirements of certain employers. Ċ On the other hand, companies merely benefit through aforesaid programs. There is hardly any window of opportunity for them except that they receive employees for free. However, it acts as an investment, for example, companies have the liberty to select any potential student who shows any promising skill and talent. Overall, these points hardly match the benefits than the pupils receive through these programs. Ċ In conclusion, the merits received by students outweigh those of companies. In the end, knowledge is power; therefore, these additional programs not only gives the child intelligence, but experience as well that is equally beneficial for their future endeavours. Nevertheless, opportunities like these should be undertaken immediately.

prompt: In many part of the world there is continuous coverage of sport on TV. Some people believe that this discourages the young from taking part in any sport themselves. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: In recent years, lots of sport programs have appeared in some television channels over the world. This trend causes other people to think that the programs discourage teenagers to get involved in a sport themselves. Although these thoughts have different perspectives, I firmly argue that both opinions result in some effects to juveniles. Ċ It cannot be denied that a few television stations provide much information and news about sports so as to improve people knowledge. Kompas Sport, a sport series in Indonesia, shows audio-visual news not only about sport events which are in Indonesia, but also all around the world -international sport events-, for example. As a result, people (including the young) who watch the series will understand more about sports. All in all, sports become essential for them in the light of important information which is given by TV channels. Ċ On the other hand, many people strongly argue that sport series on screen discourage the young to join any sport themselves as they just watch the programs all the time. Taking World Cup, the biggest football competition in this planet, as an example, it is appeared on virtually TV channels and almost whole day, and it attracts much attention of many people widespread, especially young people. Therefore, they spend much time to watch the program and lack of time to get involved in a sport. To sum up, this can affect juveniles habit, sport in particular, every time. Ċ In conclusion, it is evident that the condition causes several affects (positive or negative) for young in spite of different views. It is imperative that teenagers should not only watch the program, but also take responsibility to practice the sport because they will not understand more, unless they exercise directly.

prompt: Some people think the role of parents is to discipline their children and teach them about right and wrong. Other people consider that the main responsibility of parents is to nurture their children and provide them a Safe environment to grow up in. Discuss both sides and give your opinion?
essay: Some people believe that it is the responsibility of parents to teach the right values to their children, while others think that the main duty of parents is to provide children with a safe environment to grow up in. While teaching children the right values can teach them good behaviour, I believe that parenting children in a safe environment will help children to avoid negative behaviour. Ċ One the one hand, if children are taught the right discipline and values they tend to learn social behaviour. This is to say that children do not possess adequate knowledge about right and wrong behaviour and when kids are taught from a young age, they are more likely to behave well in their teenage. For example, a recent survey conducted by the American Bullying Association revealed that the kids who were taught moral values at home did not bully other kids in school. However, I believe that children’s age should also be taken into consideration while teaching them good behaviour. Ċ On the other hand, parenting and providing children with a safe environment at home can avoid children from developing negative behaviour. In other words, when parents do not provide them with a friendly environment they are more likely to develop anxiety and depression and this will cause them to develop aggressive and violent behaviour later on in life. For instance, a research study by The Guardian showed that 23% of the children in America developed some kind of violent and aggressive behaviour as they were brought up by divorced parents. I, therefore, believe that it is very important that children should have a good environment and proper parenting in their childhood. Ċ To conclude, although teaching discipline and right values can teach them social behaviour, I believe affectionate parenting and a friendly environment are more important as it will help children to avoid negative behaviour in life.

prompt: Some students prefer to live on campus in a dormitory. Others prefer to live in an apartment or house.
essay: University students divide two place the ones whom like to live in dormitory and the students who like to live in an apartment.Students who live in an apartment think that it is comfortable to live apart from university and others think that it is profitable to live in a dormitory.If you ask me i would prefer to choose living in an apartment. Ċ Living in an apartment is always good choice for me.Firstly you do not have to worry about other people for example if you are living in dormitory you should think about others student too.I am kind of a person who like to live alone and do not like to take responsibilities of other people.Living in apartment means comfort.If you want to take a shower you go and take shower if you want to sleep you sleep.Everything is so easy if you are living in an apartment you could make your own food at home or you can order something from outside.You could make a party at home with your friends. Ċ Second reason for living in an apartment is you do not have to meet with new people from university.It is enough if you are knowing your groupmates.New people means new problems.You do not have to be with roommate with the person whom you do not like.You could choose your roommate yourself or you could live alone.In apartment you can live with girl but in dormitory you can not Ċ All in all i think that it is better for student to live in an aparment rather than living in dormitory

prompt: Topic: Is the economic development more important than protecting the environment for future generations? What is your opinion?
essay: Protecting environment and developing economy are both necessary works that human have responsibility to do at present. Anyways, I completely agree with the statement because of the reasons below. Ċ First and foremost, economy is the basis of everything. Obviously a nation cannot prosper without the economy; a developing economy brings about the advancement of other industries such as tourism and energy. Moreover, any flourish country is always respected by underdeveloped countries, which means that country holds own hands the power to govern others, even world economy, by fully utilizing the resources and abilities of alternative countries. As a result, the culture, which has economic forcefulness, is more and more prosperous and profitable. Ċ Furthermore, recovering millions of miserable people is more important than saving natural resources. It is an evident fact that every-year, there are millions of people dying because of starvation, and it continues to increase if the government does nothing. It supposes that there are more jobs created owing to economic development, the homeless population will definitely decrease since employers are able to hire suitable accommodations by earning money from their employments. Certainly the natural resources will be faded away in case there is no human support anymore. Ċ Besides it, with scientific advancement at present, the industrialization has been putting much less polluting agents on the environment. Also, developing countries afford to learn from the environmental mistakes of the developed world's industrial revolution. For instance, nuclear generating plants are able to provide more energy than coal while contributing far less to global warning. We are also exploring alternative, renewable types of energy such as solar and hydro-power. Ċ In conclusion, in my opinion, I would like to say that economic development is the most necessary issue that any undeveloped country needs to carry out immediately. What is more important than economic development now, especially to unstably economic countries?

prompt: Both government and individuals are spending a large amount of money for protecting animals and their habitat. This money should be better spent dealing with fundamental issues in society such as poverty and health care. To what extent do you agree?
essay: Because of the annihilation of animals and biodiversity, official bodies and people strive to prevent the ecosystem by allocating huge funds. It has been said by many that this distribution should be spent on to tackle the important issues in the region such as eliminating poverty and provide better well-being benefits. I, however, somehow agreed to this approach and like to give my explanation in further paragraphs. Ċ To commence with, the animals and natural resources are in quite a danger to become extinct, due to the surge of pollution, more requirement of land for the construction of buildings and so on. Therefore, it is very necessary to conserve the natural habitat in order to maintain ecological balance. Moreover, By saving the ecosystem, one can mitigate problems such as global warming, rise in temperature as maintaining wildlife lowers the temperature of the earth and accelerate the levels of oxygen. For instance,r research by the University of Punjab demonstrates that preserving wildlife is indeed imperative for humans to ensure the procurement of flora and fauna and deter the heat levels in the planet. To follow this strategy the government implement several plans in Punjab to preserve the environment. Ċ On the contrary, along with the conservation of natural life, it is also necessary to focus on matters related to reduce poverty and ameliorate fitness facilities which are only possible through the efforts of both political parties and populace. for example, the government of Helifex is implementing laws to create employment opportunities and hospitals for the needed people who are not able to spend colossal amounts of funds. In addition, better health and education services prove to be a great tool to enhance the overall status of the country. Ċ To conclude, I opine that, enough proportion of monetary sums is required to protect the biodiversity along with functioning schemes which improve health care and increase the income of persons who are not able to receive basic necessities of life.

prompt: Write about the following topic: Most people do not care enough about environmental issues. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: It is true that environmental problems are not received care enough from citizens. While there are some people who have attempted to save our environment, I believe these efforts are not enough to prevent disaster in the future. In the following essay, both these ideas will be discussed. Ċ On the one hand, environmental issues have not been tackled for a long period of time. There is a great deal of research into protecting our Earth which is widely discussed. However, it seems like people do not alarm how important these solutions are since some factors damaging the environment still continue every day. Industrial factories dump their waste into water and land; therefore, these environments become a place for throwing garbage. According to a recent survey, many beautiful rivers in the world turn into landfills. Not only factories but individuals also contaminate our habitat. For instance, instead of riding bicycle, people prefer to ride motorbike or drive a car to work and travel. The more cars they use, the more polluted the environment are. Ċ On the other hand, some people take responsibility for protecting our planet. Knowing environment play a vital key role in human life, people try to save our Earth as possible as they can. More organisations are found to raise funds for conservation program or to find solutions for environmental problems such as GEF, IPPC etc. In addition, environmental issues like global warming, greenhouse effect and so on are taught at school to raise children's awareness and encourage them to avoid affecting our environment. Ċ In conclusion, it is clear that people do not pay attention to these severe issues on a global scale. Nevertheless, if everyone makes an effort, the situation will change positively.

prompt: The increased use of text messaging using mobile phones is largely to blame for the falling standards in written English, particularly among young people, many of whom are unable to construct grammatically correct sentences. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: With the advantages of nowadays communications through mobile phones and other social networks, it is detected a bad use of what is known as the correct written English. In short, the facility of exchanging messages made a difference in sentence´s construction, particularly among young people. In my ,opinion I agree with the previous statement, there is undoubtedly a change in the way juveniles interact with each other. Not only through technological instruments but also in the way they speak personally. Ċ First of all, the new generations don´t give the same importance to literature anymore. While one can understand the other it is what matters. They actually adapt the language to a more familiar way. For example, they do shortcuts on the sentences in order to write faster knowing that the receiver will understand it anyway. Consequently, in the occasions where it is really necessary to write English correctly, they will no longer have the skills to do it well. Ċ Additionally, the automatic correction in smartphones impels us to think about whether it is right or not. Our phone does that for us. Personally, I think it is bad because instead of helping us write it, it does the contrary effect. For example, if I made a mistake spelling a word I will not gain conscience of that error. The same happens using the computer too. Ċ To summarize, although being able to reach each other 24/7 is an advantage, it is important to control it in order to keep some intellectual skills. For me, being part of the new generation is difficult. As a result, finding a balance between a more familiar communication and the correct one turns out to be a real problem nowadays.

prompt: Countries should restrict foreign companies from opening offices and factories in order to protect local businesses. Ċ Do you agree or disagree? Give reasons and specific examples to explain your answer.
essay: It is often considered that foreign companies pose a threat to local businesses and, therefore, access should be closed for them. I strongly disagree with this point of view and think that foreign investments play an important role in the economic development of any state. Ċ First of all, the widespread involvement of foreign companies contributes to a decrease in unemployment in the country and an increase in state budget revenues. With the organization of production in the host countryAdd a comma,countryIt appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase With the organization of production in the host country. Consider adding a comma. Ċ show examples there is no need to import the products from the previous country. In addition, firms that produce products that are competitive on the world market and are mainly export-oriented can significantly strengthen the host country's foreign trade positions. For instance, organizations in my home country have used this method and have received positive results. Ċ The second reason why foreign firms are beneficial to the host country is that they improve the quality of production. Their activities force the administration of local companies: to make adjustments to the technological process, allocate more funds for training and retraining of workers, pay more attention to the quality of products, their design and consumer properties. Most often, foreign investments are based on the introduction of new technologies, the release of new types of products, a new management style, and the use of all the best practices of foreign business. For example, thanks to American, German and Japanese companies and their advanced technologies, the production and sale of goods in my country has improved. Ċ In conclusion, foreign companies play a considerable role in the modern world. In my opinion, they entail many positive aspects that should give them access to doing business in other countries.

prompt: Governments should spend more money on education than on recreation and sports. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: In recent years, there has been a heated debate that money should be spent on educational purposes instead of sports and recreation activities. From my perspective, I hold a strong conviction that these aspects are equally important and the expenditure should be evenly distributed to them. Ċ On the one hand, it is admittedly accurate that public funding for education has myriad merits. Firstly, if funding is well-spent on constructing schools for suburban schooling systems, it will encourage many young learners to go to school. For example, historically in Vietnam, many children had to quit school at a young age because of the shortage of institutes, which consequently resulted in a low literacy rate in Vietnam during the 1960s. However, due to the growing number of public schools subsidized by the government, many children nowadays had an opportunity to finish and some even tend to pursue tertiary education. Ċ On the other hand, monetary resources that have been put on sports and recreational activities also show a positive impact on society in general. For instance, several sports programs on TV encourage sportsmanship among Vietnamese citizens, which have been clarified when the national soccer team of Vietnam participates in tournaments, many people join together and uplift the mood of the whole nation during the period. Moreover, funded art programs play a pivotal role in enhancing the public conscience of an issue. To clarify, inside the Contemporary Art Center, many funded art exhibitions sponsored by the authority has been shown to effectively raise awareness in individuals regarding environmental problems. The masterpiece Erosion of Land performed by Truong Que Chi about the alleviation of fertile land in the South of Vietnam is one of the most prominent examples that are worth mentioning. Ċ To conclude, public funding should be equivalently sponsored in both fields, sports and education, because each of them affects society in a different way and all advantages needed to be promoted.

prompt: Some people think that teaching methodology in the modern classroom should be based on Ċ experiential learning while others believe that the traditional approach is still the best. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Give your opinion.
essay: Recently, there has been an emerging of many other teaching methods far from the conventional ones. As a result, debates have been raised over the eminence and appropriateness of each approach. From my perspective, each method has its merit to students and the combination of both should be considered to maximize the outcome in teaching. Ċ To begin with, numerous scientific courses are beneficial when being organized experientially. Biology and physics are some prominent topics that require the understanding of a learner. Hence, an engagement session should include some experiments so that students can be involved to understand thoroughly the matter. For instance, absorbing the phenomenon in some physics fields will help the information be embedded longer in the brain because undergraduates can directly perform procedures. Furthermore, experiential learning allows performers to realize some erroneous parts during the practical session. Consequently, this would tremendously contribute to the avoidance of making the same errors in the long run. Ċ On the one hand, the conventional teaching method still maintains its staple in some specific cases such as literature and history. These subjects were proved to be dependent upon the tone and the initial approach of teachers for the assimilation of knowledge. A teacher-led method during literary periods can also be exhilarating when a teacher knows how to engage learners in the matter and provoke their creativity. For example, during kindergartens, when most of the learners are premature to perform a student-centred methodology, guidance from teachers will enhance the imagination in students in knowing the characters profoundly. Moreover, when some historical events are arduous to re-experience inside the classroom module, the tone of professors could be a catalyst to help juniors relive in those moments. Ċ To conclude, each aspect of teaching has its benefit, while teaching with experience helps scholars remember in a long term with natural subjects, some social subjects are still in need of the voice of a teacher. These methods should not be put on any pedestals because they are both prominent to humankind.

prompt: Some people feel that manufacturers and supermarkets have the responsibility to reduce the amount of packaging of goods. While others argue that customers should avoid buying goods with a lot of packaging. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: It is indisputable fact that some packaging of goods can give rise to the bad effect on the environment. Personally, I think that not only the manufacturers but also the customers should take a part to reduce the amount of the packaging. However, it is better when the government also take action to overcome this problem. Ċ It cannot be denied that the packaging of goods really helps the customers when shopping, due to the reason that bringing plenty of goods without packaging will bother the customers. Therefore, they should bring the shopping bag from their home which can be used every time. On the other side, the manufacturers should limit to produce the packaging of goods or they can produce the packaging which is sustainable packaging or biodegradable packaging. In the current era, several companies prefer to take action reducing the effect of the non-biodegradable packaging such as Starbucks Coffee and Coca-Cola. They have used the biodegradable packaging and plastic bottles which can be recycled to package their product. Ċ To reduce the amount of packaging of goods, we also need the role of the government. In the current era, there is a wide range of manufacturers and customers which do not care about this problem. They still use the non-biodegradable packaging to package their product. Therefore, the government should make a regulation regarding the obligation to use sustainable packaging or biodegradable packaging. Based on the regulation, I believe that the amount of non-biodegradable packaging can be reduced. Ċ All in all, to overcome the problem regarding using packaging non-biodegradable of goods excessive be needed the role from the manufacturers, customers and the government.

prompt: people believe that success is due to 10 percent of talent and 90 percent hard work. Do you agree or disagree? Give your opinion.
essay: The definition of success varies among the people. Some individuals believe that, the major part of accomplishments are due to their hard work and the rest is talent. This essay will discuss that the factors that mainly contribute to becoming successful are a person's effort compared to their skill. In my opinion, working towards excellence consistently will definitely bear fruits irrespective of any talent. Ċ There is a popular belief that, anyone who has an inbuilt skill will surely excel in that field. This is because they can perform tasks related with complete ease compared to anyone else who wishes to learn. For example, a famous singer Mr. A R Rehmaan is considered as the best singer in the music industry because it is said that he talented to understand music. Hence, a skilled person may not struggle to as compared to someone who is learning the skill. Ċ Despite all these factors, I believe that if continuous efforts are put to learn, it will always supersede any talent. Even if someone has the capability but does not put any effort it may never show results. On the contrary, with the help of constant practice, expertise in any field can be gained. For instance, Albert Einstein a well-known scientist was never talented but, is a known genius for his consistent efforts in Physics. Therefore, all this proves that hard work can definitely beat any gifted individual in any aspect of life. Ċ To conclude, there are many methods to become successful. Some argue that it is important to have the art while others say it is dependent on the consistent work. I opine that, without consistency any form of inborn skills will not reap success.

prompt: Some people believe famous people's support towards international aid organizations draws the attentions to the public. Others think celebrities make the problems less important. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: It is true that the question of how important the famous people's support towards international aid organizations is.  While there are some people think that celebrities would make problems less appreciable , I argue that they could attract more attentions. Ċ On the on hand, there is a variety of reasons why many people underestimate the famous people's effects associated with global aid campaigns. Firstly, there are some singers or actresses take part in international programs for the aim of exploiting without enthusiasm. Instead of raising funds and supporting strongly, they use these world organizations to attain their goals which enhance their reputations. Secondly, when the celebrities participate in these organizations, people would tend to concentrate on them much  more than the objection of plans. This makes the purpose of the support go to eclipse. Ċ On the other hand, I do believe that the famous have a great influence on the aid organizations. One reason is that they would take advantage of the well-known to spread the campaigns thoroughly thanks to a huge number of fans. Moreover, celebrities could hold many live shows or advertisements to raise money for funds and inspire to followers. For instance, My Tam is famous for not only having a great career but also taking philanthropic actions or charitable donations in Vietnam. Famous people are able to make the  international fund more confident and public, therefore, the aid aims would become successful easily. Ċ In conclusion, although there are some throwbacks when celebrities participate in the global aid organizations to some extent, it seems to me that it is more advantageous for the community by the famous people's support as well as their voluntary activities.

prompt: Some people believe that it is important to give gifts and presents to friends and family to show that we care about them. Others think that there are better ways to show affection to them. Discuss both the view and give your opinion.
essay: Gifts and presents definitely bring joy to a human being. In our ,society some people believe that giving something special to family and friends is important to let them know about our affection towards them. On the other hand, folk also think there are many different ways to illustrate emotion towards our beloved public. I will analyze both perspectives though I believe that gifts and presents are important for showing passion to the nearest persons. Ċ Firstly, I would say that an individual always expects something special or unique from his/her beloved people. Love is always a necessity but presents can be something very surprising to anyone. Thus, a person who loves his/her closest companions a lot should give them things to let them know the feelings. Gifting anything to someone can revive the relationship as well. Perhaps it may cost some extra money but it lasts great memories in their mind. Furthermore, to strengthen my point I would say a token of love can be more valuable to someone than word of mouth or a silent affection. To illustrate we can imagine a severely sick man in a hospital bed and his friend is going to visit him with a heavy heart. The friend can visit the sick man in bare hands but if he enters with a bucket of flowers, it can give that sick guy an instant smile with more joy. Ċ In other words, some people think that there are a lot of other better ways to illustrate devotion towards beloved family. In a particular situation, maybe it appears as true but definitely not all the time. People can take their closer persons to somewhere beautiful to visit, they can bring beloved ones to have a good dinner in an expensive restaurant or they can do something else expensive for them as a sign of great affection. However, all these ways are time-consuming and impossible sometimes because of various reasons. Even we lead a very rush life in our society as well. Therefore, a person can intent many ways to show affection to their beloved one and the question raises at the same time whether it is possible or not. Ċ To conclude, it is visible that gifts and presents can be a regular form of showing great closeness to the nearest people as well as there might be a lot of good ways to show the same feeling towards them but it is not as easy and effective as the gifts.

prompt: Due to the new technologies and the internet, radio is going to disappear in a few years. Do you agree or disagree with the statement? Give you own opinion.
essay: With the development of internet and other advanced technologies, some people believe that the traditional radio seems to disappear from our daily life in future. I do not agree with this view, even though I do agree that the usage of radio is decreasing dramatically. Ċ Admittedly, A large amount of audiences stop listening to radio because they tend to spend their time in other entertainments such as internet exploration, watching TV, etc.. The internet brings a different way of interaction (on demand), which allows individuals can access the information they wanted actively rather than rely on listening to radio passively. For example, people could simply search the data they interested and view them anytime they wanted. Watching TV, on the other hand, is more vivid than radio. It provides a visual feature for audience, which makes interaction become more natural and enjoyable. Ċ But there are two main reasons for preventing traditional radio from going extinct. One reason is its convenience. It provides an opportunity to listen to radio that may contain musics, stories, news, etc., while users are doing other things. An usual practice is listening and walking. Another main reason is its availability. It is its availability that makes radio service is the one of the most common media around the world. People are able to listen to radio almost everywhere, even there are no internet access. Ċ To sum up, although I agree that the number of radio audiences is dropping duo to internet and other technologies, I hardly think that radio may die out in one day. The convenience and availability of radio are going to gain some audiences so that it is unlikely to see radio disappear in future.

prompt: With the increasing number of refugees ever before most countries debating on the refugee programs/process. Does this whole process should be allowed? Discuss and give your opinion.
essay: One of the major challenges that most of the countries facing is the increase in number of refugees.If we observe the prime cause, it's nothing but growing number of conflicts across the world. Resulting, the growth in the people who abandoning their motherland in order to save their lives and their loved ones, which I believe we have to understand being humans. Ċ However, asylum seekers are more vulnerable to the situations starting from the journey from their home to the new country.They had to deal with trauma, criticism and moreover they even don't know the systems and procedures of the new country. Ċ Furthermore, the tax payers are also not happy if the government continuously accepting these people as this could eventually lead to increase the tax and effect the countries economy one day.There is always a scale of uncertainty with in the people that refugees may take over their jobs. Ċ Needless to say these asylum seekers add numbers to the census and in cases to the potential skilled employment levels.The governments could use these resources to back fill the skills short fall. Ċ In conclusion, governments should thoroughly investigate and restrict people smuggling where evidences are deliberately damaged.How often we witness the political blame game on these topics.In my opinion, every country should accept, restrict the number of refugee intake and constantly monitor the process to accommodate to the changing scenarios. After all, at the end of the day we are humans and should understand the word "humanity".

prompt: Some people believe that students should study a wide range of subjects. Others, however, argue that students should focus on the subjects they are best at or they find most interesting. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
essay: In China, students are forced to study a wide range of subjects in high school for six years and many are useless in later study or life. Some people argue that only subjects which students are best at or most interested in should be learnt. I would like analyze the both sides in this essay. Ċ Most subjects are helpful to some extent in the way they teach some common senses in real life. For example, the knowledge about human's body from biology class is helpful when you take care of your health later. Besides, basic knowledge is necessary when you want to extend your research or career as many advanced technologies are cross-fields . Above all, people can only realize what they are good at or interested in after learning a wide range of subjects. However, all the above do not mean or require people to study deep in all subjects --- general concepts and practical knowledge are enough. Ċ On the contrary, people may learn fast on the subjects they are interested in and make success in the future. For example, great scientists in history like Newton, Einstein made a big contributions to the society. Moreover, people will enjoy their work after school and do not intend to commit a crime. Therefore the whole society will be benefit from it. Finally, people should have rights to choose what they like to learn and work. Ċ In conclusion, a wide range of subjects should be introduced to students which will benefit their daily life and future career. However, students should choose one or two subjects as their majors to pursue rather than study further in all subjects. In this way, it is more possible for an individual to achieve accomplishments and for society to develop fast.

prompt: Topic:  Some people believe that to become successful in sports one should have a natural talent. Others think that perseverance and practice are a crucial part to success. Discuss both views and give your own opinions A genious is 1% talent with 99% sweat
essay: With the help of modern technology, we can always watch various sport programmes around the world as entertainment purpose. The successful athletes such as Christiano Ronaldo, the famous soccer legend, seems becomming closer to us. Some people think that talent is the key factor for professonal sport players to success. However, there are some opposers argue that hard working is the only critical concern for champions to achieve a sophisticated sport career. In my point of view, I agree with the latters as follows. Ċ Nobody will critisize on the importance of potentials. Many well known artists were found their ability on childhood. Nevertheless, a person with ability can only be ascertain a good fundation of career, to be succed in every aspect require long time practice. It is impossible to acquire new skill just after learnt it. Every sport technique takes time and progress for mastering. You may get fail for many times on practising until you use it in a real match. Ċ Some people may claim that many marvelous players are genious from the beginning of their career. That's true, but we should never forget the so called sport talents are physical conditions only. To be a skillful players, mental and phychological conditions are also important. There is no express to improve phychological conditions such as stress handling and pain overcoming but plenty of time to practise. Ċ To conclue, a sport player with talent is easy to get succed, but no players can be successful without passion and hard working. As Albert Enstinane said" A genious is 1% talent with 99% sweat."

prompt: Anyone can use a mobile phone to answer/make work calles anytime or any where.Do you this development has positve or negative effects on individual and society?
essay: Recent decades have witnessed a major transformation of mobile phone. Distance and time are no longer a problem for contacting your families, friends and colleges. In my opinion, although people believe mobile phones have an adverse impact on their personal life, it remains many beneficial impacts on people's daily lives. Ċ The main advantage of using mobile is the issue of efficiency. People can delivery messages and solve problems without face-to-face communication. It is more effective and time-saving to keep in touch with your friends and families and colleagues comparing with writing letters. Students studying abroad will be a good example for people who benefit from mobiles for contacting parents overseas. Ċ Also this new communication technology allows people take more responsibilities. They can work at home and do not need to commute to office. The mobility of cell phones enables them to do more household chores and take care of their children. This is especially the case for working mothers who have to juggle work and family responsibilities and it is also improve the job satisfaction. Ċ However, using mobile phones causes great pressure for some people. They may have to work after normal working hours. It makes them sacrifice their weekends with family and leads to many health problems. This could cause lower productivity of workforce, which it may hold back the development of whole society. Ċ In conclusion, we could reduce negative influence of the mobile phone to least extent, as it does facilitate our work and also simplify our lives in many effective ways.

prompt: When international media (including movies, fashion shows, advertisements and other TV Ċ programmes) convey the same messages to the global audience, people argue that the expansion of international media has negative impacts on cultural Ċ diversity. What is your opinion?
essay: Some people believe that global broadcasts and newspapers threaten states' cultures by delivering identical information to viewers. I agree with the idea because youngsters can be influenced by shows and motion graphics on TV and the internet, and western culture does not fit with Asian values.  Ċ One of the reasons for not internationally popularizing media is that its content might influence young people. Movies, TV shows produced by developed nations are often filled with dramatic scenes performed by attractive actors and actresses, so teenagers might get attracted and practice according to the scenes. Consequently, they might eventually abandon the core value of their culture. For example, when Saigon was colonized by the U.S, western music and movies were brought into the region. Accordingly, it resulted in the youngster falling in love with these entertainments and forgetting their own tradition. Thus, Saigon in 1975 was not much different from New York at the time.  Ċ Another reason to prevent the spread of foreign media is the difference between western countries and Asian countries. While western art embraces sensational content like sex and violence, Asian culture doesn't approve of such things. For instance, nations like China and Vietnam have special departments that focus on evaluating western films and they delete out parts that are considered to be sensitive information for the public audiences. For this reason, viewers can both enjoy foreign films and still reserve the value of their culture.  Ċ In conclusion, global publishing influences young people in many regions to forget about their own cultural believes and many foreign movies and performances display sensitive information that is not suitable for some countries' audiences, so I, therefore, believe that international media brings negativity to culture.

prompt: The average age for individuals to give birth is increasing. Some people think that it will have negative impact on family and country. What is your opinion about this?
essay: These days, people are opting to have children at older ages as compared to the past. There are various reasons for this trend including younger people pursuing higher degrees and expensive behaviour. I have a vehement view that it is having detrimental effects on the families and the countries as well. Ċ The primary reason for people to have children later is that many people nowadays are struggling to get higher qualifications because of the harsh competition in the job market. Consequently, they are taking more time to settle and start their families. For example, in the USA, it has become crucial for almost everyone to get at least a Master’s degree in order to get employed in a well-reputed organization. Therefore, people are spending more time in universities to secure their future and families have become a second priority that is actual assets for us. Ċ Another reason for this problem is that people are preferring an expensive lifestyle. That is to say, owning a luxury car and branded items are demanding people to struggle for these things and individuals are focusing more to maintain such lifestyle. It has changed the social perspective that money can be saved to live a luxurious life by having babies later which is resulting in a sharp decline in population in many western countries. Canada, for instance, is facing a shortage of young workers to support their ageing population and to maintain economic stability. That is why they have started a number of immigration programs to attract people from overseas. Ċ In conclusion, obviously, the age of individuals to give birth is increasing on average. This issue is emanating by people to obtain higher education before starting their families and luxury lifestyle. I strongly believe that it is having extremely adverse effects on families and many countries are facing population imbalances.

prompt: Essay :  All museums and art galleries should be free, others think there should be entrance fee.  Discuss both views and give your opinion?
essay: Although it is sometimes thought that museums and art galleries should offer free admission to their visitors, other people believe that there should be an entrance fee. In my opinion, I consider that such national places should not be free of charged for the public. (45words) Ċ On the one hand, some people think that entrance fee is indispensable for maintaining national places and I agree. In other words, governments do not have sufficient funds to subsidize museums and art galleries and there are other priorities for public money. Therefore, the money earned from entrance fee help these places survive. Furthermore, an admission charge provides visitors with positive experiences during their visit. In other words, an overcrowded museum would make it difficult for many art-loves to push through the throngs of people, let alone admire pieces of art. By contrast, a less crowded museum may enable visitors to stand and contemplate a work of art. (108 words) Ċ On the other hand, it is often believed that it is better if museums and galleries should abandon entrance fee. As people, we are attracted to somewhere free of charge, so offering free admission would encourage more people to visit. Another reason why many people believe that public should not be charged fee when they enter museums or art galleries is that it is an effective way to promote country's cultural background widely. For instance, visitors are possible to pay more attention to such places while getting stuck for ideas on their holidays when it is free. (97 words) Ċ In conclusion, while people may vary in their opinions, I think that museums and art galleries should charge an entrance fee for help these place work and give positive feeling for visitors. (32 words)

prompt: Most societies have homeless people. Some people think that the best way to help them is to give them money. To what extent do you agree?
essay: Nowadays, it is quite common in countries throughout the world to notice a lot of homeless people and a few citizens believe to help them by providing monetary help. However, I opine that we should help by providing moral support, education, skill development and utmost in providing employment. Ċ Firstly, in the era of an industrial revolution and technological advancement, the most common issue we all face is an economical imbalance and a widening gap between rich and poor people. Secondly, many people find it difficult to get a job and if they have a job, it is even difficult to receive the basic amenities and fulfil the need of an individual or family and because of that they have to live on the street which is the rackless picture of today's world and this can lead to a bigger issue for many developed and undeveloped countries. Furthermore, by providing monetary help, we can only address their immediate needs and can not help every now and then. Moreover, it can lead to other issues like laziness and using that money towards crime, addictions. Instead, we should find reliable help that can provide permanent and long term solutions. Ċ There are many proven support models that exist if we wish to back them and as a whole, we can make a stronger and better society and the world. For example, we should focus on boosting their cognitive health and help to develop a positive mindset. Nevertheless, to address their immediate needs, we should provide food, proper clothes, shelter and health care. Lastly, we should provide education, skills development programs and help them to provide employment which can lead to living ethically and keeping their heads high. This would lead to a long term permanent solution. Ċ To summarise, we all can make a better society if we put some thoughtful consideration, programs and backing models in place.

prompt: It's generally agreed that the amount of rubbish created by humans today is a worldwide problem. What do you think are the main cause of this situation? What measures can be used to tackle the problem? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience
essay: As we know, tens of thousands rubbish has been created by human daily. Obviously, it is definitely a terrible amount. More and more expert warned us that if human still not slow down the creating seed of rubbish, we will be face a serious problem. Yet why human still not able to control themselves? Ċ Nowadays, packaging becomes the most important part in a product. When customer choosing a product, they always look at the packaging first, even just a box candy or washing powder. It is really a strange behavior. That is why, the companies often put massive times and resources to focus on the packaging, they attempt to pack the product to be more competitive and attractive. Thus, it is increasing the products' sales volume. However, the main element of this packaging is paper, plastic and synthetic etc. All of these are refuse and really bad for environment. That is the main reason causes the problem of over-packaging becoming a more and more serious trouble. Ċ In order to prevent over-packaging keep going on, the only solution is the customer to refuse the over-packaging. Let us imagine, if everyone tries to choose less packaging product or remove the packaging and then throw into the store, it is a good way to shows that we don't need too much packaging. At the same time, family and personal rubbish also becoming a major trouble thinly. This is because they never try to recycle some of their rubbish, such as keeping take away containers, reuse plastic bottle and use shopping plastic bag as rubbish bag, etc. Ċ Finally, a further way to deal with the matter of increasing refuse is to change public and personal attitudes through education.

prompt: Topic: Today more people are overweight than ever before. What is your opinion are the primary causes of this? What are the main effects of this epidemic?
essay: Nowadays, the level of obesity is increasing more and more than many years ago. This essay will highlight some key reasons and consequences of this problem which is challenging to humans. Ċ In my opinion, the main causes of obesity would be an inactive lifestyle and unhealthy eating habits in daily life. First, people are becoming obese is that because they are consuming too much junk food, fast food which includes the amount of fat, sugar, and carbs in fact of eating healthy food. For example, about more than 50% of citizens in American have become fat by these eating habits. Second, people rely on machine excessively in today despite doing it yourself which have less physical demand at anything. For instance, in a couple of years now, most of people choose to drive a bike or car more than walking or cycling Ċ The possible effect of obesity includes physical strength and mental power of human. Overweight indeed makes people staid and slow than normal people. This problem can make it difficult for you to get or keep a job in the long run because of low productivity. Also, I Belive that obesity is one of the most common causes of stress. Likewise, because of overwhelming outside, most people will have a lack of self-confidence wen among the community and society, and it will become a cycle when they can not confidence with others, they will stress and so on. Ċ To conclude, overweight is one of the most problems that affect plenty of people today. If not taken care of, these problems could lead to an unhealthy life.

prompt: some people think that to have a succeddful life you have to have university education, while others think it's not that important. discuss both views and give your opinion based on personal experience and knowledge.
essay: Some people consider it is a necessity for those who desire to lead enviable lives to have a deeper education in universities while others arrive a consensus that it is not essential to get a college diploma. In this essay, I will discuss the two points form the following aspects. Ċ Throughout most of the 20th century, those who manage to finish primary or junior high school acquired sufficient skills and knowledge to handle most basic tasks and address working problems on a daily basis, when most large companies equipped their employees with fundamental skills through their own internal training and development programs. As a result, it is not uncommon to see employees enjoy successful careers, working in the same companies throughout entire lives. Ċ However, the world undergoes a transformation, which put an end to those traditions. As workers jump ships more frequently, more companies keep the money used to train fresh workers, which acts as a catalyst for change in job markets. Therefore, Job seekers who grasp pragmatic knowledge which suits the demand of particular companies evidently have the edge over those who do not have. A college education can well serve as a means to the end. Moreover, people attending university can also acquire what most adults will do for a living in 21st century----learning, which is the root of any success. Ċ So, although there are quite success stories in which those without a college education carve out a successful career, it is more likely to experience an inferior life compared with those who have. Ċ Hence, it is wise, if one has such a chance, to gain a college degree.

prompt: Some people think that there should be strict laws to control the amount of noise a person makes because of the disturbance it causes to people. Ċ Discuss the advantages and disadvantages.
essay: It is believed by some people that the amount of noise produced by humans should be strictly controlled by certain laws because of the nuisance it might cause. While the best thing about such a decision is protecting people from such a disturbing behaviour, the worst thing about it is the misjudgment that might occur. Ċ Despite lack of freedom, limiting the level of noise a person can make is a great solution to this troublesome attitude. Furthermore, this will prevent the mental and psychological negative effects that may result from being continuously subjected to extremely loud sounds. For instance, in Japan, a passenger who makes a sound louder than fifty Decibels has to pay a fee. Therefore, it's not only a smart solution, but also a wise one to the problem of noisy individuals and the consequent health issues. Ċ On the contrary, it might be sometimes necessary to induce a loud sound either to be heard in extreme situations or to vigorously call for help. Moreover, a person who has a valid reason to raise his voice might be inconveniently penalized. For example, if a passenger saw someone dying in the street and he started to scream out loud, he would probably be punished because he was being annoying without knowing why he was being so to begin with. It is for these reasons, a lot of details must be added when creating such laws in order to avoid misunderstanding. Ċ In conclusion, being annoying, the level of noise made by a person has to be controlled by means of specific restrictions as believed by some individuals. Although this would prevent the subsequent disturbance, it might also be unfair to be generalized to any situation. In fact, special things must be considered when applying these laws, such as the reasons behind inducing loud sounds.

prompt: It is often considered that change is more beneficial to people than trying to avoid it and have everything remain the same . Do you think the advantages of changes outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: Some people believe that the changing process has more pros than cons. I personally support the opinion that there are more points in favour, such as the good impact on our neurons even though, sometimes, it requires a big effort. Ċ To begin with, it is proved that our brain becomes stronger when constantly subjected to different tasks. For example, the process of learning a new language, makes the person improve some areas of the brain never explored before. The specialists affirm that learn new subjects is also one of the preventions of some mental illnesses. In addition, according to the neurolinguistic programming technic, traumas can be treated by changing the path that the neurons follow. A good example is when someone is afraid of being alone. The therapist will find the main reason for that and change the way your brain acts. Ċ However, the decision to learn a new activity can be stressful, due to the big effort involved. For older people is generally more challenging because they had already built a comfortable zone. Furthermore, modify a common routine, for many, can provoke mental confusion and even depression. To illustrate, a computer system changed in a company I have worked, provoked mental confusion and impossibility to keep working in one per cent of the staff. Ċ To conclude, for the majority, an update in life or any task is positively received, but I cannot assume that it works in the same way for some due to any previous condition. I used to say that the only constant in life is changing since I believe there are more wins than failures.

prompt: Nowadays people are working from home using computers and telephones. What are the advantages and disadvantages of this development.
essay: There is no doubt that nowadays' technology plays a key role to fulfil remote-working goals. This can be obtained smoothly by using smart appliances, which may help many individuals and companies to do their daily tasks efficiently. Thus, there are both merits and demerits that will be further explained in this essay.
