Ċ The main weakness point that most of the employees faced a sense of inconvenience especially during the pandemic crisis of Covid-19, which limits their privacy and relaxing home's atmosphere. This is because, on remote working shifts, employers may give tasks all over the day exceeding the time limit of actual shifts. For instance, the office-remote worker may resort to checking frequently his phone for clients' emails synchronizing to an online meeting with another client on Zoom application. In contrast, if home-based employees do not manage his daily time tables firmly, they may get tensed significantly as office-work shifts. Ċ The opposite merits of working remotely, those who argue for remote working have, are the minimum costs with the maximum productivity. To illustrate more, many companies have reported how riding out of daily transportation's hassle has an immense reflect on the competency of their home-based staff. For example, most employees now might start their workday from home calmly, and therefore consume less time in accomplishing tasks than latter. On the contrary, if companies do not supply their staff with the most updated tools such as phones and laptops, a plethora of medium-scale tasks will be rendered until their employee returns back the work safely. Ċ To summarize, although home working can provide a key benefit for both the company and its staff, it also may show some minor obstacles must be professionally faced even on long-term scales.

prompt: The movement of people from agricultural areas to cities to work can cause serious problems in both places. What are the serious problems? What measures can be used to solve these problems?
essay: Massive peasants from agricultural regions decide to emigrant and work in some developing cities recently. However, the immigration of the workers has seriously affected the regular pattern in both places. This essay will outline the main problems that the development causes and establish some feasible solutions corresponding to these issues. Ċ In terms of the problems for this phenomenon, the movement of peasants reduces the agricultural activities in their hometown considerably. Consequently, there is a higher percentage of starvation, which is caused by falling crops production. As a result, the economy of these agricultural areas would rapidly decline. Another issue is that the unemployment rates and the number of refugees will continue to rocket in the cities. For instance, the labours who emigrate to work have no speciality in areas other than agriculture. Moreover, these kinds of workers will become refugees to live in the cities and thus, governments have to allocate funds to support the jobless. Each factor attacks the economy in the places. Ċ Nonetheless, the problems could be alleviated in a number of ways. One method would be for governments in agricultural regions to introduce speciality programs for those populations who would like to learn a profession. For example, these training programs could help peasants to develop technical skills in order to perform in the desired fields. Therefore, it would raise employment opportunities for the peasants in the agricultural areas and cities. Furthermore, the government from popular cities should impose policies on limiting immigrants who are working on the agriculture field in other regions. It could be done by the cooperation of both places. While one is imposing limitation policies, another government could regulate welfare for the people who choose to stay in the region. Ċ In conclusion, the movement of peasants to immigrate to cities can have a devastating impact on both places. Therefore, steps should be taken immediately to halt the increase in immigration from agricultural areas.

prompt: Because many children are not able to learn foreign languages, schools should not force them to learn foreign languages. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Some feel that since it is challenging for children to learn a foreign language, schools should not emphasize this subject area. In my opinion, the challenge is the entire justification for supporting second language education. Ċ Critics argue that the majority of children are simply incapable of learning an additional language. The best evidence for this is anecdotal and relates to the increasingly large burden of work placed on young children. Schools in many parts of the world, particularly in high-achieving nations such as South Korea and Japan, are in session for many hours and students learn an array of subjects. They are usually taught English, the world’s lingua franca, and this is especially difficult for speakers of Asian languages, where there is little shared linguistic history. The end result is often that students waste time and may feel discouraged and lack self-esteem. Ċ However, children can learn languages better than adults and the challenge presented is itself an important lesson. If the schools have invested in proper training and use engaging materials then the lessons will not be boring and there is a stronger likelihood of success. Research has shown that language learning is most effective before the age of 7, with pronunciation becoming a stumbling block for older learners who already have fixed vocal formations. Moreover, the difficulty of learning a language encourages children to work harder and expand their ability to learn in creative ways. This applies to all subjects but languages stand out as students must seek novel memorization techniques and view the world from a completely different perspective. Ċ In conclusion, despite the low rates of success in many cases, the impact of attempting to learn a language is itself tremendously beneficial. Schools should therefore continue funding this part of the curriculum.

prompt: To be truly positive in the eyes of some, you have to risk appearing negative in the eyes of others. In about 350 words, state whether or not you agree with this statement.
essay: A number of people advocate that one’s positivity in the eyes of some could risk appearing as negativity in the eyes of others. From my perspective, I voice approval of the aforementioned, believing that no individuals could please everyone, since our beings are open to subjectivity. Ċ In the first place, it is undeniable that humans’ personality traits and behaviours are evaluated through the criteria and judgement of others. In other words, whether or not we are positive is differently interpreted in dissimilar viewpoints, while being good-natured in one’s eyes may become wicked in others’. For instance, celebrities’ doing charity work is generally regarded as morally righteous; however, dissidents refute it as hypocritical and only serves to polish their images. Hence, there are always two-faced implications for all actions humans take. Ċ What is more, whatever we do, there invariably exists someone who naturally dislikes us. That is, even if we change ourselves to fulfil their standards, these efforts will prove worthless should their loath stem from jealousy or distrust. Though, it is worth bearing in mind that as long as we do not harm anyone, under no circumstances is our positive attitude towards others hindered by haters’ remarks and criticism. For example, while there appear many artistic productions that are harshly condemned by critics, several audiences still find it valuable, at least for themselves. This means people are not born to satisfy everyone, but should only please the ones who bring out the best in them. Ċ All things considered, although humans’ essence is subjected to others’ viewpoints, our core values go far beyond those sheer assumptions. Therefore, I am supportive of the statement, claiming that our being positive towards some may risk appearing negative in others, which does not matter as long as we do not regret our doings.

prompt: many people believe that in order to have clean and tidy streets in their neighbourhoods, this should be resident's responsibility, while others think it should be government's duty. what is your opinion?
essay: An immaculate street is a healthy sign of a developing locality, and it also has far-flung effects on a nation's aesthetics. However, the body responsible to keep the lanes of an area is a contentious issue. Some say local natives should look after the cleanliness of their sorrounding area, others believe that the governing body should take charge of the same. This essay will argue why, I think, it is essential for the latter to be the controlling figure. Ċ To embark on, the government has the authority to implement a law restricting garbage disposal on the streets. A myriad of people lacks the enthusiasm to initiate the tidiness of their near-by area and instead of cleaning a pre-existing litter, many dispose their rubbish as well on the same spot making the condition even worse. Hence, the state can create a potential ripple that is constructive as well as encouraging by implementing few laws restricting garbage disposal on roads. To illustrate, the UK government has heavy penalty for disturbing the pristine conditions of the streets, and in order to avoid such fines, people help maintain these roads. Ċ Furthermore, it is the state's job to provide the basic facilities and utilities in order to have unspoiled roads, such as, public toilets and dustbins. Although these might seem as small necessities, they play a pivotal role in maintaining the locality's spotless condition. For instance, installing garbage bins at every few yards at a walkway, reduce a native's urge to throw rubbish on street as he/she spots a bin at a near distance. Ċ To reiterate, I believe that it is the state's responsibility to keep the city spike and span. This can be achieved by taking two simple measures involving implementing a no-litter on streets law and provision of garbage collecting containers and public restrooms

prompt: Television dominates the free-time of too many people. It can make people lazy and prevent them from socialising with others. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Over the past couple of decades, the involvement of television in our daily life has been increased quite significantly. These days, it is often thought that TV could possibly contribute towards unsocialized behaviour and can make them a couch potato. I personally support this notion as this piece of technology is filling our leisure time way too much. Ċ First of all, television has become an only and easiest source of entertainment after a hectic working day so spending time watching our favourite shows is all we want. For instance, no one would like to go out to meet friends after having a long day at work, instead, the most feasible option would be sitting in front of the TV and relax. As a result, this becomes a habit after a few months and one may not like to hang out with his buddies at all. Hence, there is a huge probability of getting isolated and end up in depression if not paid serious attention. Ċ Furthermore, the TV shows are getting more and more addictive due to their amazing cinematography and graphics. These entertainment media has occupied us by the means of visual attraction the thrill of what's coming next, for example, a drama serial or a season is designed a way which triggers our curious mind to think about the next episode. In this way, we end up in front of the TV every day at the same time and our social life becomes secondary. Thus, excessive use of this could destroy our social life. Ċ To conclude, It is undoubtedly obvious from the aforementioned points that television is dominating most of our time spent with our friends and buddies. Additionally, it makes us dull and lazy due to an easy source of entertainment.

prompt: The gap between rich and poor is growing. What problem does this create? What can be done to tackle them? Lowering the financial abyss between rich and poor
essay: With the growing population, the gap between rich people and poor people is steadily increasing. This trend could be ascribed to a few reasons, and definite actions must be taken to reduce the gap between rich and poor people. Ċ There are evident reasons as to why the gap between the high and low standard of people is rising drastically. The most prominent reason is the unavailability of education to people who are below poverty line. The focus of the world is shifting towards creating a global village which is highly beneficial for people in developing and developed countries, which doesn't have the major benefit of underdeveloped countries. Despite this, the mindset of poor people acts as a trigger for this wide differentiation as they won't understand the necessity of education and doesn't promote their offsprings to learn academics. Ċ To boost the economy of underdeveloped countries which in turn reduce the gap between richer and poorer nations, we have to devise some definitive plans. The action point should include offering basic education to everyone along with this there should be some kind of schemes for prospective students who are willing to pursue higher education. Furthermore, world organization should take measures in boosting the economy of underdeveloped countries and help them to grow financially. One such example is the act passed by United Nations in maintaining the peace and prosperity of Syria by imposing mandatory education for everyone in the country and providing financial aids. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that the aforementioned measures can create more peaceful communities and ensure the gap between rich and poor people is minimized.

prompt: It is common aspiration among many young peopleto run their own business, rather than work for an employer. Ċ Do you think the advantages of working for yourself outweigh the drawbacks?
essay: It is undeniable that in today's world people's preferences towards the work have been changed. It is, therefore, the vast majority of youngsters prefer to become an entrepreneur, instead of working for someone. I firmly believe that it is far more advantageous to be a businessman, but its few potential negative aspects could not be ignored. Ċ To start own business enables the person to work and grow their business according to one's own skills and knowledge which is quite suspicious in case of working under an employer. Because it is seen that people who are working on the higher posts in the multinational companies have a different kind of strength and potential and if these kinds of people will build run their own company, then definitely they will be highly successful. For instance, there have been some recorded instances of people, who are running their family restaurant with some new techniques, are getting immense profit. Thus, being an independent entrepreneur is a big option which could be considered by young people. Ċ Conversely, there are some limitations to being a businessperson, which could not be overlooked. In order to start even a small business, one needs a large number of funds and immediate avail does not happen, that's why it demands time as well as money. Moreover, freshly graduates do not have any prior experience that how a business could be handled and due to this, sometimes people have to face the loss. For example, one textile company was established by a University graduate in 2014, in India, but lack of skills and strategies were able to shut down the company after 6 months with almost 6 lakhS of loss. Overall, the above-mentioned factors certainly need to be considered. Ċ To conclude, it is evidence that the trend of becoming a business owner is escalating among teenagers. Even though the notion has several benefits which I have discussed, but its flip side needs to be addressed as well.

prompt: Some people think the technology makes life complex, so we should make the life simpler without using the technology. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Today technology has become a major part of our life without it there is not a minute of the day which can be spent other than the time you are sleeping, although, the over usage of technology is making people's life very complex and hard to go around. Each of these has its own advantages and their disadvantages which I will illustrate separately and then give my point of view Ċ Firstly, without ,technology nothing goes around in the world today.Each and everything today is wrapped around technology such as, from starting of our day when we wake up we check our mobile phones about the weather whether if it is going to pour cats and dogs or else if it going to be very sunny, then we use GPS to travel from one location to another known or unknown places without it we all will be lost. The internet helps us out in every way from suggesting to us the best movies and restaurants around us to giving us up to date information on any topic which we are interested in any other topics. It even helps us to translate manuscripts and languages from native sources to the ones which we can understand. Ċ Secondly, the over usage of technology has made people forget to have a human bond and connection with others, folk are more interested in watching videos of places than going out and check out the places. For instance, even kids these days have their own personal mobile phones, mac books. Children are not getting enough physical exercise and are sticking their faces inside the gadgets and are becoming couch potatoes. People can't even find the location of nearby stores without the help of GPS. Ċ In conclusion , I reiterate, that without the use of technology we all will be lost nevertheless, we will also be lost without human connection and bonding directly rather than through social media. Everyone should have their own limits and their own rules about how long should they allocate the time for usage of gadgets and have a real bond and to go out play, take a hike, trek.

prompt: In many countries the widespread use of the internet has given people more freedom to work or study at home instead of travelling to work or college. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: Is technology a boon or a bane? This is the most arguable issue as with advancement in technology people are able to do their job remotely or do homeschooling rather than commuting to the concerned places. However, I am of the opinion that the environment which we adapt to while working at an office or studying in educational institutions are more beneficial for the overall growth of the company and also for the personality development of a student. Ċ Indeed, there are advantages of work from home or online classes as the travel time is cut down. Especially in metropolitan cities where hours are spend commuting due to heavy traffic. This time can be utilized to be with their family members. Moreover, balancing personal and professional life has become easier especially for working parents. For example, for a working mother work from home is a blessing since she can manage time for her children and old parents and need not hire a nanny or send them to daycare. Ċ Nevertheless, there are certain drawbacks of online schools and work .eventhough it is comfortable ,employees lack team spirit due to communication gap and may feel left out and will lose interest in their performance, thus affecting overall productivity. Furthermore, in homeschooling ,soft skills such as discipline, teamwork, competitive awareness and socializing cannot be taught. For instance, while on zoom meeting employees or students are not much interactive which they can be, when they are having a face to face communication. Ċ To conclude, I believe, even though people have the independence of online education and job at the comfort of their home, the drawbacks namely, a decline in productivity due to absence of team spirit and lack of overall personality development of a child due to inadequate social skills overshadows the advantages. Hence, the traditional method of going to college and office are irreplaceable.

prompt: Topic- sometimes celebrities get invited to international aid events.Do you think such events deviate from their main purpose by inviting famous people?
essay: Collecting money through big star studded charity show is always cosidered a effictive technique.There is a both sides of this,sometimes this method is beneficial but in some cases this deviate the main purpose of aid projects.In this essay I will outline the both arguments-its benefits and also drawbacks. Ċ The most common advantage of this,celebs have used their fame to draw public attention to a range of humantarian and philanthropic activities.Take the Pulse Polio example of India,where a famous star Amitabh Bachan plays a crucial role to promote as well as to save the child's from acute diseases.As a result,their fans now come forward on highways and give the drops to all the children by stopping the vehicles. Ċ In addition,not only numbers of people increase but also charity fun reached at the climax.An obvious example of this,Taylor Swift,the immensly popluar sonstress from the USA,has donated the profits from their charity concert in 2014 to Asian public school.What is more,as funds and numbers of human's escalate,then automatically event acheives higher amount of things from public for example,Blood donation camp,where event organiser collect a large amount of blood with the assistance of philothropies. Ċ On the other hande,some celebrity takes the helps of this ais project for their pwn purpose even though the main goal of such events to emphasize addresing an issues directly related to helping people out with unpleasant situations.For example,Bob Geldof's live aid and live 8 campain,which promote their own brand with the name of charity. Ċ To conclude,i would like to say that involving celebrities in such events would certainly have postive effects.But in some events it go worse.

prompt: Because of the busy pace of modern life, many children spend most of their time indoors and have little exposure to the natural world. How important is it for children to learn to understand and appreciate nature?
essay: In recent years, how children spend their time has changed because of technologically advanced tools such as computer and PlayStation. They are more likely to sit in front of screen playing games in their rooms rather than to go out with friends exploring the natural world. While I agree that children are keen on being indoors today, I firmly believe that it is important for them to explore and to understand the natural environment in order to appreciate it. Ċ I would argue that children today intend to waste their leisure time in a room playing online games or surfing on the Internet as their parents provide all of the technology such as a set of computer and PlayStation. A study shows that more than 75% of children in Tokyo, Japan, prefer to stay at home playing the technological equipment. Although they are isolated in their rooms for a long time, they always can enjoy it because they think that playing the games has the same activity as traveling to the world. Ċ On the other hand, children should visit some spectacular scenery over the world directly as the natural environment is absolutely different from what they see on the computer screens. For example, students in Al-Azhar school have a compulsory lesson to visit a natural garden such as an apple garden in Malang, West Java. As a result, they are able to learn and to understand all about apple deeply. They know how the apple looks like and what nutrition the apple has. Ċ In conclusion, it is evident that although children prefer to spend time indoors playing games or browsing on the Internet, visiting the natural world is also essential so as to understand the environment in depth. Where possible, parents sometimes should have a trip to natural park on holiday with their children.

prompt: Topic: some people think cheap air travel brings us benefits while others believe that non-essential flights should be cut in order to reduce environmental problems caused by cheap air travel. Discuss both views and give your own opinions.
essay: Travelling by air used to be luxurious which could not be afforded even by the middle class a few decades ago. However, nowadays more cheap flights are emerging since technology has evolved. But it also comes with a price: increasing flights have been posing a threat to the environment thus some people suggest that unnecessary flights should be restricted in order to protect the environment. My view is that people should be free to choose means of transportation whichever they like. Ċ Cheap flights have made long distance trips more attractive. Tourists are always curious about the cultures or views that are different from their own, so they are more interested in travelling to a destination that is far away from them, usually abroad. Airplanes are ideal tools to reach these places as it takes less time and, sometime, are even less expensive. Spending less time on the way is not only attractive to people who have tight schedules but also is more comfortable, because people can easily get exhausted after staying in the vehicle for a long time without much possibility to move around and exercise. Ċ On the other hand, cheap flights are causing more damages to the environment as people are more likely to travel further and more regularly. Aircrafts, comparing to traditional tools such as trains, are not very efficient in using energies, which results in a high carbon footprint. Moreover, it is impossible at all to adopt clean energies like sonar or electronic cars do at this moment. Ċ In conclusion, in spite of the air pollution caused by cheap flights, I believe that low cost air travel should not be discouraged as it makes long trips more easily achieved.

prompt: Some people think schools should teach students to form good behavior in addition to providing normal education. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: In the modern world, numerous individuals believe that schools should provide attitude lessons equally with usual subjects and I partially agree with this statement. The objective of this essay is to examine the positives and negatives of integrating behaviour classes into everyday lessons. Ċ One of the strongest arguments in favour of adding behaviour lessons to normal education would be good attitude formation. In other words, building a healthy mind from a young age will lead to good relationships with other people. For example, in 2008 "Self-acknowledgement" is invented as a subject in schools, where students discuss feelings, kind actions, goods and bad of life. Consequently, the integration of behaviour teaching hours into school programmes has been building healthy-minded students who are successful in their lives. Ċ On the other hand, the major goal of schools would be destroyed, the knowledge that should be taught will not be covered. This means that time for teaching material shortens. For instance, one academic hour in school is 45 minutes, where 10 minutes are for introduction and review of content, 20-25 minutes are for new material, other 10-15 minutes are for practical work, which means that every minute is important for the teacher and students. Hence, if some academic hour minutes will be given to conducting behaviour lessons content will not be covered and students fail on the exams. Ċ To conclude, all the above-mentioned points illustrate that despite good intentions to form good behaviour, the students might face some serious problems in exams. As far as I am concerned, solutions for these problems might assist to minimize hazardous consequences.

prompt: There have been many technological developments in the past few decades, for example in telecommunications, transport and health. What technological development do you think has been the most important? How has it changed people's lives? Have all the changes been positive?
essay: Galloping advancement in science and technologies over the past few decades has taken dramatic leap forward in making our life much more convenient and easy. I believe, these substantial developments especially in the field of telecommunication which made the entire world interconnected and have been beneficial to people in many aspects. Ċ To being with, internet plays a vital role in improving telecommunication via satellite networks. There are numerous amounts of gadgets which made our life comfortable in various means. For example, online booking and reservation of tickets, bill payments, internet banking, virtual classrooms etc... are really helpful nowadays in contrast to the previous old day situation like standing in a long queue for everything. Furthermore, social network websites and blogs has cast its grip in our life which enable people to know each other and sharing information irrespective of their geographical locations. Ċ In addition, virtual classroom helps working professionals to pursue their studies after working hour just being in home with internet facility. It is common today to conduct video conference meeting from different region to do business globally. Ċ However, while discussing the positive aspects of these enhancements, we can't overlook the detrimental effects which are spoiling our younger generation. Children and teenagers seem to be addicted to computer games and social networking which cause them to be away from their day-jobs. They are all fond of living in a virtual world rather than being social in the real world. Ċ To sum up, though there are disadvantages due to technological development, the benefits always overweigh them. Hence, instead of being away from utilising the upcoming changes in the technical world, it will be better to educate our young minds to distinguish the real life significance and the virtual world.

prompt: Libraries are irrelevant in the age of the internet and should not be publicly funded. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Some people argued that, in the era of advanced technology, funding the public libraries is inappropriate.I fully disagree and think the aspect to stop financing the public libraries is completely wrong, and due to convenience and easy access to authenticate materials, libraries should be funded by the government. Ċ First and foremost, libraries offer ease and comfort to the community. Although the internet has provided wide access to online materials from the comfort zone of home, some people still prefer to use libraries because they are technophobes and do not have good command to operate electronics equipment. In India, for example, the majority of senior citizens prioritize the public because, for them, it is uncomfortable to concentrate over mobile phones for longer hours and they could not operate advanced features of their mobile phones. Hence, I feel libraries should remain in existence and properly financed. Ċ Despite the abundance of knowledge on the internet, people tend to use libraries as this provides them relevant and copyright information. In other words, there are the wide range websites available which offer the large amount of data, may be suitable or unsuitable for the user. Whereas, public libraries are only occupied by the authorized and authenticated books rather than unnecessary materials. For instance, research showed that more than 75% of data, available on various websites, are downloaded, modified and then uploaded after some modifications which are not suitable for the public use. Therefore, for reliable information, authorities should provide funds to the libraries. Ċ In conclusion, it is argued that libraries should not be financially supported due to the abundance of information on the internet. However, I believe it is essential to fund libraries because it is the source of real and relevant data. Moreover, it is easier for some people to use libraries rather than innovative technology.

prompt: Some people believe that fast pace and stress of modern life is having a negative effect on family life. To what extent, do you agree or disagree?
essay: The biggest dilemma of contemporary age is its rapid pace, which is making it difficult for people to give quality time to their families due to burden and stress it exert on them. Indeed, I completely agree with this notion that it is creating a destructive effect on family life by splitting it apart and distancing themselves from one and other. Ċ In fact, people have less time to spend with their families because they remain busy in working, most of the time, to achieve their financial pursuits. They have to work like a machine, thus, they cannot provide time for dependants either they are older or younger ones. For instance, it has been proved through many researches that the main reason behind in increased number of old age homes and day care centres is lack of time from other members of the family, on whom they depend. So, that’s why they feel it convenient to send them to these institutions. Hence, it serves as a catalyst for the splitting of the family. Ċ Stress of modern life has affected the communication among the family members, particularly between parents and children. As a matter of fact, both members are constantly working day and night to meet both ends of their children, but they forget one crucial aspect of their better upbringing that is communication. Parents tend to equip their children with modern gadgets in order to lessen their responsibility to take care of them. Consequently, they depend more on gadgets and less on parents. In addition, they are becoming more depressed and lonely due to inability to express their emotions. Furthermore, they don’t incline towards their parents in later age as well. For example, a recent study conducted on young children by the American association of psychologist proved that children who spend more time with gadgets instead of real family members become victims of mental illness easily. Ċ In a nutshell, fast speed and stress of contemporary life is bitterly deteriorating the family life in the worst possible way. People have to ponder about this fact seriously and give more time to their family life in order to make it cohesive and strong.

prompt: Many developing countries are given aid from international organizations to help them in their development plans. some people argue that financial aid is important but others suggest practical aid and advice are more important. Discuss both views and give your opinion? the economic gap between rich and poor countries is huge, any solution?
essay: To minimise the economic gap and help in the development of the poorer nations mostly world level organizations like UNO, do support the developing nations financially and in many other ways. Few individuals say that financial help is valuable while others emphasize on practical help and guidance, Both the conditions are important according to the situation of developing nations. Ċ Financial Support is very crucial and valuable for any nation to survive and support the countries economy, to minimise the poverty level in the nation and provide the basic necessity to people it is very important for a country to be strong economically, Organizations like United nations support these poorer nations to keep the surviving conditions in a better way by providing loans from world bank. Recently, United Nations have decided to forgive the loan interest of the poor nation, Nigeria to support them to sustain the life during the crises period. Ċ Looking at the second view, support in the practical terms like situations of war, natural disasters or epidemic disease are very critical situations for any nation to survive and struggle in these conditions, during this period suppport from international organizations are quite valuable for any nation, mostly we have observed during these crises time mostly all the nations come together to support their friendly nations, for an instance recently during the epidemic of AIDS, South Africa was mostly affected by the infection, during that period France made a tremendous effort to bring back South africa by providing medicinal support and medical staff to cure from the infection and eradicate the virus. Ċ In conclusion, in my opinion, both the views are equally important for the survival and development of nations, It is mostly dependent on the circumstances for the nation.

prompt: Question: Computer can easily do all the basic and advanced calculations. Do you think your children should spend more time learning basic mathematics or advanced computer technology. Give your views.
essay: Nowadays, computer plays crucial role in facilitating children to figure out the number. It can solve the problem of calculation, whether basic calculation or complex formula. I believe that focus on learning basic mathematics is very important to children because they will learn the formula and improve their brain. Ċ The complicated formula is parts of basic calculation. There are combinations of arithmetic. Teachers teach systematically in schools that influence students to learn deeper about this concept and understand the function. For instance, the arithmetic curriculum is made for them based on age to make them understanding clearly. This helps them to solve the calculation manually. So they do not depends on tools to compute the number Ċ Another fact is stimulating the brain. Counting the quantity trains our brain to memorize and think fast. They will remember some multiple numbers that has good effect on their brain. In addition, math stimulates logic and imagination. Some questions related to daily activity such as shopping and buying needs calculation need imagination to understand and push the brain to find the number. As a result, the brain works effectively. Ċ In conclusion, it is undoubted learn manually has significant improvement for the children. children should learn the basic calculation to maximize and develop brain performance in growing age, and they can count the number without having to depend on computer.

prompt: A society is based on laws and rules. The individuals who want freedom would face problems in this society. To what extent do you agree with this statement?
essay: In this modern century where every individual is democratic to live their life in own style but sometimes his living creates problem for other person then he had to face laws and rules created by society . The society creates laws and rules for safety of person who face problem from other community.The laws are made to kept Ċ to save from racism. I agree that every citizen of a country should follow the rules and laws created by society. Ċ The people live in society are of different culture, caste and even different community with different thinking try to create problem for other caste , these laws are helpful that time, for examples in India there is fight between two communities mostly between Hindu and Muslim , the can't live together, if some time there is small fight between them the complete community of Hindu and Muslim start fighting and a small fights become big riots in city so that time these laws are helpful to maintain peace .These laws are made by society to help people who love peace . Ċ Secondly every people have their own mind and thinking , sometime for fun he start beating other people to show he had so much power and courage so that time these laws help other people to get compensation or the person get punished by society.So laws and rules are necessary in society , it help to maintain peace all over the world

prompt: Nowadays in many families the grandparents are responsible for bringing up children. Is it a good or bad development for grandparents? Give your own opinion and examples.
essay: These days growing children is one of duties of grandparents. I agree grandparents can benefit considerably. Some people believe that it is very good chance for grandparents, while other contend that taking care of children by grandparents is not good for these old people. This essay is explained it is good situation for senior people to bring up their grandchildren. Ċ To begin with, taking care of young children has several demerits for grandparents. Old people can tolerate some noise and behavior. Therefore, when young children make noise, they become upset and tired. After some hours, they fight to children. Moreover, to keep young adult may cost for elderly. So, they have to spend money from their saving money. For the long run, they may lose their whole money. For example my mother always buys many junk food for her grandchild. Ċ However, being grandparents with young children has many advantages. First old people become busy by young children and are not alone. Therefore, they become less depressed. Also, children give their grandparents a huge amount of energy. Because, they are too young and do not know any things. Teaching and answering different adolescence make adult to become motivated to read and extend their knowledge. Ċ Moreover, young children may give chance to find more entertainment to grandparents. Since grandparents should go to park and amazing parks or cinemas to entertainment their grandparents, they communicate with new parents and other aged people. Ċ In conclusion, keeping care of young children has many benefits to older people. Communicating with new people, becoming motivated to increase their knowledge and reducing their possibility of depression are common positive side of these behavior.

prompt: Pets should be treated like family members .Do you agree or disagree with this statement? Give reasons to support your opinion .
essay: Although many people agree with the statement that pets should be treated like family members, I personally disagree with that statement .Maybe my disagreement depends on my personal preference which is do not have pets at all .And I will try to give some reasons to support my statement. Ċ Firstly , nearly all of the pets do not live more than ten years. Treating pet like a family member it means you need to love them as much as a family member .And at this situation death of the pets after some years will bring stress and grief to the other family members. Ċ Secondly, from the medical perspective,there are many contagious disease from pets . For example , a friend of my died recently because contacted a disease from his dog. I do not think want to have the same fate. Ċ Thirdly ,for treating pet like a family member you should have good income . Because nowadays food prices increasing day by day . For example , my friend treats his cat with delicious food but at the same time he do not have money to buy for him some clothes . I already asked him that it is not good idea to spend your money on cat . But he is convinced that he is right . Ċ In conclusion , I do not think it is good idea to treat pet as family members.

prompt: Many universities and collages these days offer distance learning programs instead of face-to-face courses. Do you think the advantages of this new approach outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: Nowadays, distance learning programs are becoming more popular than ever. There are two arguments apropos to this statement, however, I personally believe that it has more positive effects than negative ones. Ċ To begin with, distance learning program has brought many convenience as compared to the traditional face-to-face course. these types of programs usually employ the Internet as a medium to transmit education, which meant greater flexibility for both students and lecturer as they can have the access to the course material at any time. Furthermore, this kind of course structure would generally suit the working group who has limited free time at hand. Ċ Moreover, no commuting is involved as students can basically learn their course online, and at the comfort of their own bedrooms. In a way, this also would positively contribute to the cut in carbon footprint and emission. As there are numerous options for schools, students option on getting a degree would be greatly expand as choices would further include overseas institutions that provides online learning and not only confined to local universities. Not only that, students who enrolled in distance learning programs has lower expenditure as compared to others who study in the traditional face-to-face course. This is because, online learning students do not have to worry about commuting cost and getting meal plans on campus. Ċ In conclusion, the positive effects of distance learning course had generally outweigh the negative effects and I believe that more universities and employers would employ a more positive outlook towards distance learning programs in the near future.

prompt: It is not necessary for children to go to school because far more information is accessible on the Internet. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Distance education breaks the geographical constraint between learners and teachers, offering a band new way for all citizens, particularly in rural area. Thus some parents suggest that traditional school education should be replaced as children could acquire more information through Internet. Ċ Indeed, remote learning brings a couple of benefits. Instead of riding bike or taking bus to school, children save a great amount of time on the road. From the perspective of parents, they are able to devote themselves to working rather than worry about the security of their child. Further, none of teachers have capability to master various kinds of discipline knowledge. In other words, less information is taught by teachers compared with the powerful Internet. Ċ Those who advocated the new education approach, however, fails to consider the fact that distinguishing the right from wrong is a tough task for the young. Although a sea of information is provided, it is a pity that most of the information has not been proved by the authority. Children may misunderstand if lacking of proper guidance given by professional teachers. In addition, school adopts systematic way to teach children physically and psychologically. Loads of activities are held in order to cultivate the skills in communication and cooperation, which helps students access to society smoothly and gain a promising future as well. Ċ Compared with home study through Internet, traditional education still shines with irreplaceable benefits. The best way for children's education, I believe, should combine the two ways together. Mainly focus on the knowledge the teacher taught, grasping more extended information as supplement if children have enough time and interest.

prompt: please inspect my grammar usage and essay meaning. It is for TOEFL Should university students be required to attend class ?
essay: While some people think that students must be required to attend class, others think that for students, attending class must be optional. there are some chances of studying without attending class. But I think that going to class is more proper and it must be compulsory for students. The following reasons will illustrate the my point of view. Ċ Of course, there are many advantages of going to class. One of fundamental reasons is that if you encounter a confusing problem or a something which you can not make out in your study, you could solve those in a jiff by asking from your professors. Moreover, the professors lead you to the right direction and can give you more knowledge than anything which you set about exploring. Therefore, in class, only there is a great way to gain education profoundly. It seems that university's class exists so that students can educate excellently. Ċ In addition, attending class grants prodigious opportunities to make friends with many various people. There is no point of feeling alone. Therefore, in class, it is possible to exchange experiences and information with classmates. In short, attending class is a simple source of making friends and being funny. Ċ In conclusion, according to my observation, I think that in contrast to students who are not required to attend class, students who are required to attend class are able to succeed in studying more. Because of those the reasons, it is necessary, for pupils, to be required to go to class.

prompt: Many countries are experiencing serious problems with their environment, with pollution of their land, water and air. Ċ What are these problems and how might they be reduced? Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. Ċ Write at least 250 words.
essay: now, Many countries are suffering from enormous environmental problems. especially the pollution problem of their land, water, and air. This essay will examine the main causes of pollution and possible solutions to this problem. Ċ I think the reasons are using chemical pesticides, human wastes and factory gases. When farmers use chemical pesticides to control pests, some of these chemicals do not degrade and still years in the soil. For example, D.D.T, a dangerous pesticide, still exists in agricultural lands. Although, it has been used for 30 years. Furthermore, throwing human misuse into the river or seas pollute water. For instance, you can see dead fish on the riversides where human wastes are found. Also, factories and cars come out of gases that pollute the atmosphere. To illustrate, a problem of the ozone layer led to an increase in the world temperature medium grade. Thus, the world faces many serious environmental issues with contamination. Ċ I can suggest some solutions that may help. The first one is using bio-pesticides, it is safe and degrade swiftly in the soil. Such as, Abamectin is a bio-pesticide that degrades 3 days after spraying the plants. The second solution is to put new laws that prevent getting rid of waste in the water. The third solution is to use a kind of filter which reduces the harmful gases from mixing with the atmosphere. All these solutions will reduce the contamination in all three parts to the safe side. Ċ In conclusion, contamination is a big issue that needs international interest from world countries. And we can overcome it by using bio-pesticides, legislating effective laws against throwing wastes and using gas filters.

prompt: Nowadays, many people go shopping in their free time. Shopping has replaced man other activities that people choose as their hobby. What are the reasons for this ? Is this a positive or negative development ?
essay: These days populace are interested in spending time doing shopping which substitutes other hobbies and activities of the past time. In my view doing shopping is considered as negative aspect which indulges in wasting our hard earned money and precious time. Ċ To begin with, a variety of reasons can be offered to explain why shopping has a lot of demerits. First and foremost among these is that incurring huge amount of money is shopping results in unnecessary wastage of wealth, which can be used at times when extremely necessary. An individual should be wise enough to correlate and understand the basic necessity of life and get important things which are very much essential, rather than nurturing shopping as a hobby. For example, my friend spends ž of her salary buying things which are not essential for her and least bothered to help her parents who stay in the country side. Ċ In addition, shopping ideally involves commuting to a place where you can find all needed things. Therefore overall time involved in doing shopping attributes to travel time, doing shopping & waiting in counters to pay the bill. Therefore, it is certainly true that shopping kills a lot of our precious time which we can use in different kind of activities and nurture our hobbies. For an instance, people who often go for shopping almost spend one full day which is fruitless. Despite killing time in shopping it is advisable to spend time in some fruitful hobbies or activities. Ċ In conclusion, shopping should not be considered as a hobby which has several disadvantages, such as spillage of money and the considerable waste of time.

prompt: With deforestation, urban development and illegal hunting, many animal species are becoming endangered as they lose their habitat and some are even threanted to the point of extenction. Ċ Do you think it is important to protect animals? Ċ What measures can be taken to deal with the problem.
essay: Various animal species are already becoming endangered and numbers of animals are increasingly dwindling. In my opinion, it is extremely important to protect them from causes that make them threatened. There are many ways to lessen the problem which we will discuss here. Ċ First of all, probably one of the main major issues is deforestation which is caused by illegal logging and water contamination. With the recent development of technology, there are numerous factories and vehicles, leading to damaging the biosphere which brings to draught. Animals lose their habitats not only because of draughts but also urban development as people cut down trees and replace them with modern buildings. This has now become dreadfully severe because food chain disruption also makes fewer numbers of animals and even potential extinction. Moreover, another cause is over poaching without permission in animals' habitual places. This may actually lead to the ending of some species. For example, it might indeed happen to Asian tiger populations. Ċ There are in fact much more powerful measures that can be taken to deal with the problem. As a starter, Government should spread an initiative to raise awareness about the affair and take strong actions such as fine a large amount of money and even imprisonment as soon as possible when illegal hunting and selling is being reported. Furthermore, together with Government and individuals, they should build facility centres for the welfare of endangered species in specific areas and proceed with precaution. Lastly, maintaining trees so that their numbers are not declining in the future. Ċ To sum up, because of deforestation, urbanization and poaching, a certain number of animals are threatened and people should protect them at all costs.

prompt: task: It becomes more popular to find out the history of your family, what are the reasons and do you think it's a positive or negative development?
essay: Seeking the root of one's family has been gaining increasing popularity among city dewellers in recent years. This phenomenon, in my opinion, is a result of the alienation between people in cities, but can in effect help keep valuable culture of the country in this age of globalisation. Ċ Psychologically, a sense of belonging is essential for an individual to feel safe. The urban lifestyle, however, is not likely to afford people this. This is not only because of the fierce competition and poor labour relation in the workplace -- which can hardly make workers feel belonging to a team or the company, but also because the isolated neighbours in the living places rarely make the community a warm home. Accordingly, family becomes the only place where one can find this sense of belonging. They can be proud of a family member in their family tree when they learn a success story about him or her. And a closer connection may be established with a normal colleague or neighbour if a common early ancestor is identified between them. Ċ The process of discovering family history is also the process of learning stories about traditional values and culture. This gives the positive part of these traditions, which have been largely ignored by modern people, a chance to regain their role in the society. In fact, many young children in this country have started to realise the importance of and to show more respect to their elderly relatives and neighbours as a result of this process with their parents. Ċ As can be seen from the above, although the popularity of root-seeking stems from the unsatisfactory reality in today's world, its effect is in fact surprisingly desirable. Thefore, while the problems with cities need to be addressed for sure, this trend of recovering traditions should rather be encouraged.

prompt: Education is not a luxury, but a basic human right and as such should be free for everyone irrespective of personal wealth. Do you agree and disagree ?
essay: Teaching is the most powerful tool for sustainable development of communities so it should be a fundamental human right while some people think that it is a special right for a group in society. In my opinion, I do agree that education should be available for all people, not be a privilege for anyone. Ċ It is a fact that education is a significant element to gain sustainable development. Firstly, thanks to going to schools, a community could be lifted out of poverty. For example, families having the basic reading skills will be aware of the way to get experiences to plant effectively. Secondly, human health could be improved by having knowledge of providing nutrition, especially for children. Thirdly, it supports sustainable economic growth throughout the student’s qualification has been enhanced and more decent works for higher-education graduates. Ċ It is not neglected that the importance of education is to contribute to the full development of human personality. The educational institution will teach children not only knowledge but also their behaviour in life. For instance, children should treat friendly and support together. In addition, people will be aware of the obligation of state laws such as stopping at the red light when travelling or preventing illegal activities. Moreover, graduates from the university will learn the experience and effort to gain achievement in their life. Ċ In conclusion, all information and knowledge should be provided for all crowds living anywhere in the world. It is predicted that there will be common standards for all schools, universities in each country without any discrimination.

prompt: Some people think that having people from different nationalities and cultural background living together in the same country makes the country develop faster. Ċ Do you agree?
essay: There is a plethora of various cultures and nationalities from all over the world. Critics argue that grouping some of them together will boost the country’s development. Although there are two sides to this argument, from my own perspective, there are several reasons to why this suggestion might be effective, which will be discussed in this essay as well as limitations. Ċ It is claimed that having some variance in the country in terms of different nationalities and cultural background will support its development. However, culture is one of the most fundamental aspects of development anywhere, so would grouping several civilizations result in losing our own culture? It is historically proven that when different societies live together, their cultural background changes and new traditions are created by time, which is a mixture of their original cultures. In other words, it is the threat of losing our identity that makes this suggestion argumentative. It is no doubt that a country without a strong cultural background will lose its power, which might adversely affect its development. On the other hand, does this risk outweigh the possible advantages? Ċ With regards to quicker development, having some variety of nationalities and cultures might achieve this. Interestingly, it is well known that every nationality is famous for a specific industry. For instance, Egyptians and Syrians are popular for manufacturing textiles and clothing. This means that having a non-discriminatory country will allow different people from different regions to pursue their areas of specialisation. As a result, the country will have more manufacturers, which will in turn increase the Gross Domestic Product, which will lead to higher living standards, therefore, development in a short period of time. Ċ In conclusion, living with people from different origins will lead to the continuous exchange of knowledge, thus enhancing the educational and cultural backgrounds. It is also worth noting that this method will definitely consume less time, unlike other ways of developing a country which might need decades to achieve the target.

prompt: nowadays,many people have to work longer hours and they feel more stressed out than before.what are the reasons and solutions .
essay: In today's world, there are fierce competitions in every field to win this rat race. Some crowd say working prolong time is causing more physically and mentally health challenges than past, for this reason,companies should have to make some rules to sort out this problem. The following paragraphs would elucidate possible reasons for the problem and propose a handful of remedial measures. Ċ To commence with reasons first and foremost is drastically modified technology. Moreover, more and more employers are captivated with advance fruitful processing hence ,they are not only pressuring their employees to use new techniques to complete others but also bullying them to work longer hours to fulfil team unrealistic tasks.For example, scientists have proven that in '90s population were unaware about use of soft skills suchlike, excel,PDF,Microsoft word etc.having said that though in 21 centuries all employees should have to use this program's so it is causing mental stress on the job. Ċ Furthermore, several folks are working a long time because of inflation in the market. Most of the youngsters are craving for advance pace life because their desires are much higher than past such as expensive cars, flats ,big villas, clubbing and so on.therefore, they are grabbing extra shifts and become a money maker. For instance, in most developing countries youths are working 15 to 16 hours per days to earn more money then they can support their families , complete desires as well. Ċ On the contrary, there is some solution to tackle this problem. First of all, the government should have allowed organisations to give fewer hours then people can hale and healthy because they will balance task and life. Secondly, the association should have given proper training to everyone especially who are green as grass then they can handle performance without pressure and complete it on time. Last but not least, the government should give some extra allowance, incentives and leaves to workers as they can enjoy their job and life. Ċ To sum up, it can be said that some people burn the candle at both ends to accomplish their ambitions if they will maintain their healthy lifestyle and learn more advance rules to handle goals rather than costly products thus,it could help for both association as well as workers.

prompt: In order to improve a country's education system, young students should be allowed to openly criticize their teachers during class time. Do you agree with this? What are some other ways education systems could be improved?
essay: There has been much debate about how to improve education system. Some people insist that teachers should be commented by their students in the class time. I mostly disagree with this opinion because there are other improvement plans for an education system. Ċ There are some detrimental aspects of criticising to teachers. First of all, blaming teachers, most students may not respect them. As a famous psychologist in the UK states in his recent treatise, people who attempt to criticise others tend to focus on finding their weak points. Secondly, this method may lead to students and teachers fighting each other. This could make them difficult to keep good relationships. According to recent research conducted by the Japanese government, 80 per cent of student who belong to a famous law school which has good reputations in Japan say that they strongly trust their teachers. Ċ On the other hand, A much better way of improving education is to invite experts from overseas. It is generally recognised that most institutes that can provide good education positively employ scientists who advanced in their disciplines from overseas. Evidence for this is found in an up-to-date article provided in a major Japanese newspaper, Tokyo University which is well-known as the best university in Japan hired many lecturers who have expertise in certain fields in this year. another measure is that students give some lectures to other students. Adopting this method, students can learn what is important for how to learn subjects. Ċ In conclusion, I am inclined to believe that criticism of teachers is not effective in improving education system. Meanwhile, other potential plans could cause positive effect to both teachers and students.

prompt: QUESTION; People celebrate occasions such as "independence day" and "mother's day".Do you think it is important? What are the advantages of celebrating such days?
essay: Yearly in the people's calendars there are certain days which are refered to as public holidays.People have rest from their work places and come together to celebrate these days.When families come together it means a lot to certain individuals and this shows how important are these days.Thus,it brings to one of the advantages to the individuals and as to the market.  Ċ These days are for the public,where they travel and meet their families.The families come together,eat and make merry to celebrate.For example,the independance day where individuals remember the day when they gained freedom from their colonialists.This means a lot to the people celebrating as they will be having liberty in their own native countries.Therefore,it shows how important is this day and when families have the moment for each other. svantage  Ċ Further,it also brings to one of the advantages in that of rememberance of one another.For instance,"mother's day" where children appreciate and show their mothers how they love them.The children usually show this by giving them presnts or messages in means of a card.With this example it shows one of the advantages in celebrating these days.  Ċ The other advantage of celebrating these dys is that it brings rise to profits in the market area and thus an increase in production and economic stabilisation.People buy some presents and card for their loved ones .Shops make sure there is an influx of the produce.Also ,people use different modes if the transport to go and be will be. For instance, the stations are crowded so that they can get trans portcan get transport to visit once more..Thus ,it shos the advantage to the marke themaeket wen people make an effort to celebrate tjhesedays.  Ċ I In summary,why people remember these days because they are important to the people and to the market as well

prompt: Technology creates more problems than it solves, and may threaten or damage the quality life. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Technology is a double-edged sword. After several industrial evolutions, we are heading to a world that its technological power is getting stronger and stronger. On account of this, people are arguing about is technology is helping people or leading people to a wrong way. As far as I concern, I think technology brings more benefits than its disadvantages. Ċ As we all known, Internet is playing a big role in our life today. Just talk about study. People don't have to learn knowledge from the school as before. There is a big amount of information in the Internet. For instance, if you have any problems you can just post it in the Internet, people who know the answer can help you when they see the questions. For history, most of the time we get the historical knowledge from the textbook. There is a problem, the history book isn't right all the time. If you look it up in the Internet, we can know the history from different people, different views. Online shopping is more and more popular nowadays. People can just type goods name in Amazon, E-bay, etc. It will show the price and provide the delivery to where you want it to ship. You also can save money by comparing the price from different seller to get a better price. Ċ With technology developing, our transportations are becoming more and more advance, from bicycle to jumbo jet. These things highly improve the efficiency than the old period. For instance, People who want to come to the United State from the England maybe need half month to get there by ship. But since modern jumbo jet comes out, it just takes 17 hours to bring people to the United State from the Britain. Therefore, It is convenient for people who want to visits the strange countries. Ċ On the whole, I highly agree technology is leading people to a new world, a better world.

prompt: In the past children were taught how to save money, but today they only learn how to spend it. Do you agree
essay: In the previous period, teenagers were instructed regarding the method of money saving. However, these days, they are solely taught for the expenditure. I agree with the given statement. Ċ On the one hand, people can know how to save the income previously. At this time, children can get a lot of things by the little amount which could help them to save extra revenue. For instance, when they went to the markets to buy a necessary product, they could able to save some fund after purchasing all the items due to the inexpensive. In addition, they used a small box for keeping cash and broke down these boxes after a year only on the special occasions to fulfil their basic necessities. Apart from this, kids were preferred home-made food rather than fast food which could increase the saving and those who got cash as a pocket money also tried to conserve it. Ċ However, at present, the situation is just opposite to the past. All products are too expensive. When a person visits the stores by taking thousands of cash, then, they are able to buy only 1-2 items. In addition, nowadays, social media like Facebook, Instragram plays a vital role because people want to do show up their styles, dresses, food what they eat towards males and females through the internet. As a result, such activities encourage them to spend more and more salary on it rather that keeping it. Ċ To conclude this, youngsters can keep saving money in the past, whereas with the rapid development of the technologies, expenditure is increasing from sunshine to sunset.

prompt: Successful companies use advertisement to make more sales. What can make an advertisement very effective? Do you think this is a bad thing or a good thing for the society?
essay: In the modern world, advertising has become an essential part of marketing.There are several things that can make a commercial powerful. I personally believe it has more negative impacts on society than the positives. Throughout this essay, I will explain it in detail. Ċ To begin with, celebrities are the first tool that companies use to make a successful advertisement. People who follow different artists, tend to use or buy the same products for their own self-satisfaction. This trick especially used in cosmetic and perfume industries. The second best marketing master plan is, they deliver a message in a short period of time. It can attract many people withing a few seconds. For instance, in a 2 minutes YouTube video, at least there are 2 to 4 different ads can be played to promote various items. Thus, using famous artists and delivering a message within a short amount of time are the reasons why advertisements are very powerful in the modern generation. Ċ According to my personal view, it creates various bad impacts on society and the environment. Individuals tend to spend more money on unnecessary branded products since they think that is a way of measuring the status of living. Therefore, some families who earn low-income struggle to purchase some items and they will eventually lose their self-confident. Furthermore, printed flyers and posters can cause environmental pollution. For example, a study done in Colombo University found out printed posters, billboards contribute 35% of environmental pollution. Hence, it is certain that there are several drawbacks in this trend. Ċ To sum up, even though, using world-famous artists and supplying details in a very short time are the main reasons for successful advertisements,in my opinion, there are various negative impacts for society and the environment as well.

prompt: Some feel governments, rather than private companies, should be in charge of medical services. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Although some people claim governments should pay for the medical services to the population, others feel the opposite idea. Once society already contributed financially through taxes, I completely agree that expenses of health should be in charge by governments. This essay will discuss why private companies should not the responsible and I will explain my point of view in detail. Ċ Some large companies claim the population should pay for particular health services so that they will offer better conditions, but most people do not have enough money to pay for these assistances. This assumption is a complete mistake whereas the poor population has rights like any other individuals. For example, if an elderly person does not have conditions to purchase medical services, he should not be ignored because during the active life he made his part contributing with work and payment of fees, therefore at the moment in which he needs financial help, he will be forgotten. In other words, particular companies just want to profit. Ċ On the flip side, some individuals believe health assistance should be paid for by governments and I completely agree with this assumption. Governments should invest and promote a healthy life which in turn would result in many campaigns incentivizing good habits. This way they invest money in the promotion of health rather than spend a lot with many days of hospitalization, for instance. In addition, people should have their efforts recognized so that they would rest during the senescence. Due to these reasons I totally agree with governments should be responsible for medical assistance. Ċ In conclusion, adults work a lot during life as a result they should have the right to health guaranteed. This essay argued about different thoughts related to particular medical assistances and I detailed my opinion with more information.

prompt: "Tourism is always a force for good which enables people of different countries to understand each other." Ċ To what extent do you agree with this idea? Ċ You should give reasons for your answer. and include ideas and examples from your own knowledge and experience.
essay: In a would of increasing level of globalization, tourism has been playing an important role for a long period of time, and the question of mutual understanding between countries is becoming easier to answer. Personally, I am inclined to believe that tourism has a positive effect on relationships between countries, and the reasons for that will be explained below. Ċ First of all, the flow of tourists between nations facilitate cultural exchange, which results from visiting national sightseeing, museums, and historical places. Having discussions with local people helps foreigners to understand behavioural patterns and the background of the nation. As a result, both hosts and visitors gain knowledge about each other, which builds a foundation for future cooperation and long-term friendship. Not only tourism creates opportunities to find new friends, and possibly partners, but it also forces the local community to develop communication skills. For example, sellers of merchandise have to know one of the international languages, at least on a basic level, in order to be able to make an appealing presentation of their offerings. Thus, the language skills of the nation significantly enhances. Ċ In addition, if the number of tourists entering the country increases, it will have considerable effect on the wealth of the nation. As the country becomes richer, people will want to visit other countries as well. In this way, the number of economic transactions between different countries significantly growsSuggestionhas significantly grownis significantly growing, improving quality of multicultural relationships even further. Lastly, even though government's measures to attract more tourists can damage the original outlook of ancient constructions, generally, states will try to preserve cultural assets, which could have been neglected in case tourism did not exist at all. Ċ In conclusion, I am convinced that tourism is one of the most powerful tools to build and sustain good relationships among different nations across the world.

prompt: Some believe that people should make efforts to fight climate change while others think it is better to learn to live with it. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Based on research, climate change is the most essential threat for the next decades by which icebergs and glaciers are melting more and more yearly. People's opinions differ as to whether we should stand against it or cope with it. While there are strong arguments in favour of both of these sentiments, I would rather advocate the first group. Ċ There are several reasons why a proportion of humans believe we should become compatible with climate change and alter our life to this phenomenon. First, climate change is the outcome of thousands of years of human civilisation which have brought about plenty of technological and social advances. It seems inevitable to accept the trade-off between weather problems and sophisticated achievements unless we plan to live like our ancestors - without any modern technology. Second, planet Earth has experienced numerous alterations during millions of years which substituted many species in every era because of different reasons. So, it seems that we do not have any role in these changes and do not have the ability to confront them. For instance, our planet has experienced a long period of the ice age that could not be prevented by any creature. Ċ In spite of the above arguments, I support the people who agree that we have to endeavour to fight this situation because we are current residents of earth and we are responsible for the catastrophe that is going to happen soon. According to scientists, what humans have done against their habitat is not the sole but the most effective reason why climate change is happening. Thus, as payback, we have the duty to turn everything back again. Additionally, by coping with current circumstances, it is predictable that humanity will be vanished completely because of a shortage of drinking water, unbearable heat and breathing polluted air. For example, tons of hazardous gases are being emitted daily from industrial areas all around the world, resulting in the Greenhouse Effect and extreme air pollution. Ċ To sum up, although some people assert rational merits for accepting the current state and coping with it, I strongly support the ones who reckon that we have to confront it. I predict that in the close future more individuals will join this opinion by experiencing actual problems.

prompt: Some parents feel that students should focus on all subjects equally. Others believe that students should concentrate more on the subjects they are interested in. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: There is no doubt that parents are concerned about the upbringing as well as the education of their toddlers more than ever before. Some hold the opinion that children should concentrate on the subjects of their interest while others believe that they should focus on all subjects.
