According to my, both benefits and drawbacks are at the same place which I will explain in the following paragraphs. Ċ In the beginning, prons will be disputed in this paragraph. First and foremost, in this fast life, masses have a hectic schedule and sometimes, they do not have enough time to make meals for their families, that's why they prefer to buy foods from restaurants which are the easiest or time-consuming way. Moreover, it is a good business to get profit because youngsters like to have western foods especially at birthday parties, functions, picnic and on get together as well. Ċ On the contrary side, it has many cons to have these meals. Firstly, these types of foods are very oily which are not good for health and could be the reason for some diseases like sneeze, cough and other neck or stomach problems. Furthermore, obesity is the most dangerous malady that could be happened by this meal. For instance, the bread and the burger are the main sources of fat. It has been searched that mostly, in the developed countries, individuals are used to taking fast foods for their daily routines which are not good for health. In spite of, this food has negative effects for pregnant lady, sick person etcetera. Ċ In the conclusion, no doubt, fast food is unhealthy that can create many complications in our body but still it is the most popular in every age persons. It is not bad if we are having in some occasions or festivals because it is good to change the taste.

prompt: IELTS task 2 Most of the world's poor live in countries where tourism is a growing industry. The issue is that tourism does not benefit the poorest. How can the income generated by tourism benefit the poor? And how can we ensure that tourism does not destroy traditional cultures and ways of life?  Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience
essay: Tourism is arguably a financial source for poverty in developing countries. Such growing industries have resulted from exploiting natural resources ranging from mountains to beaches and even mangrove forests to be successful in national income. However, this comes to two serious questions of the beneficial effects for poor people as well as the consequences on traditional cultures and ways of life. Ċ The general view has been that booming tourism in low-income countries play a crucial role in improvement of financial status. Reduction of unemployment rate, for example, is a primary result to help create jobs for under-privilege citizens. In addition, profitable income from this sector can enhance not only for education, but also for health care system and, in turn, it leads to contribution for higher standards of living of their citizens. Ċ Despite the fact that tourism attract loads of multicultural travelers, this can bring about an interesting situation of cultural merge and subsequently takes risk of loss their national identity. It is therefore essential for authorities to take responsibilities to encourage their people to make use of their culture and customs as an alternative way to achieve their tourism goal. In addition, the governments should promote their cultural values by mass media to maintain these precious things in their communities. Ċ To sum up, business tourism is of crucial importance of both increasing people's income and funding for other public sectors such as education and health care. On the other hand, loss of national identity should be highly considered so that the governments should not only represent their unique cultures as another source for tourist attraction, but also give priority to retain this national assets in the way of broadcasting.

prompt: Education is not a luxury, but a basic human right and as such should be free for everyone irrespective of personal wealth. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: In the present age, education has become one of the most prominent factors in every country across the world. Some people assert that it has to be free as it is the basic right of an individual. I agree with this notion that primary education has to be available for all children irrespective of their financial status .The upcoming paragraphs will analyze two factors that contribute to this affirmation, as well as my personal opinion. Ċ Firstly, education made available to each and every child will help the reduce child labour rate. This is because poor pupils cannot afford to pay hefty school fee, as a result, their children do not get educated and start working at a young age to help their parents. For instance, In India, villagers do not earn handsome wages to send their children to school, instead, they make them work to earn more money for home resulting in child labour. If the education is provided without cost, then these toddlers can attend school. So it could be stressed that making education free of cost can help the poverty class to get educated. Ċ Secondly, early education can help children to become to create a better society in the future. For example, if people are educated, then they will not perform or support the crime as they will be aware of the consequences which they would have studied in academic law books. In other words, education can simply help a person to become a responsible citizen of the country. Hence, observing such instances it could be said that free education can also lead to a civilized society. Ċ In conclusion, it is undeniable that education is the most effective weapon to make society safe and wealthy. Therefore, it can be said that making education free can certainly benefit the economy.

prompt: Some people think that women should not be allowed to work in the police force. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: There is no doubt that women are being employed in an increasing number in workplaces these days. However, some individuals still believe that women should not work in the police department. I do not agree with the statement, and will discuss about it in the essay. Ċ First of all, criminals can be either males or females, and it is better to employ female officers to catch female culprits. This is because many female offenders have accused the policemen of sexual harassment; thus, they feel more secure in the presence of woman personnel. A 2017 survey report conducted by an NGO in India suggested that 2 to 10% of female offenders complained of sexual harassment against male staff. Moreover, women are more comfortable with the same gender officers while taking driving tests. Ċ Another important point to consider in favour of the employment of the lady staff in law enforcement authorities is to promote the idea of women empowerment. In the countries like India, where the crime - rate against women is still higher, these measures could prove fruitful in the future. The reason is that these services involve physical training due to which they start feeling stronger, and their self-esteem would uplift. Therefore, the women should be empowered and should be given equal opportunity as men to work if they have essential qualification and skills, Ċ In conclusion, although there are different opinions of people regarding the lady personnel, steps like these would empower women and help them gain confidence to stand for their rights. I believe that it is vital to take such steps to support the idea of gender equality, and also strengthen the position of women in the society.

prompt: Increases in the production of consumer goods results in damage to the natural environment. Why is this the case? What can be done to solve this problem?
essay: In the modern world, the generation of products has been increasing with the demand of the growing population. It is believed that the rise in the creation of products leads to the destruction of the natural habitat. This essay will illustrate the solution to overcome this difficulty. Ċ First of all, The main reason for the damage is Global warming. Global warming can be controlled by decreasing pollution, like Air pollution, it is mostly caused by the release of harmful gases in the atmosphere from industries, and, by the gases released from vehicles. Moreover, Factories should not decompose their Industrial waste into the water which may affect the marine ecosystem. For example, To prevent water pollution Government of Hyderabad has banned the citizens from throwing harmful waste into any rivers, further, they even banned the idols from decomposing into lakes. Besides, this government is making a special site where they can decompose easily. By doing such activities, minor control over the damage can be done. Ċ On the other hand, As the population, has been increasing the demand for living and food is also growing. To fulfil their needs flora and fauna have been affected by them. Nowadays, humankind is cutting down the forest to build homes for the people in contrast to this animal life is also destroying. Many of the animals have become extinct due to deforestation. However, some of the forests have been destroyed by natural disasters, for instance, in Sydney and Turkey where the forest has caught fire and it goes on for several months which tends to cause damage to both flora and fauna. Ċ In conclusion, constitutions should build up certain rules and regulations which should be followed by every citizen of the country. Similarly, Human beings should limit the use of modern technology to prevent the devastation of living creatures and ozone layer depletion can occur which may ruin the human world.

prompt: In the last 20 years there have been significant development in the field of information technology (IT), for example the World Wide Web and communication by e-mail. However, future developments in IT are likely to have more negative effects than positive. To what extent do you agree with this view?
essay: The appearance of information technology (IT) in the last 20 years has brought about significant developments in life standard as well as work efficiency. However, it is believed that the evolution also proves to be detrimental. In my opinion, there is a likelihood that future developments in IT will put the users at their own expense. Ċ With the rapid developing pace, IT seems to have turned its users to its slaves. In the past, there used to be World Wide Web or e-mail, but the cyber world now varies form games, online TV shows to means of communication, and probably still keeps going. Such irrisistible temptations drift people from the real world to the unreal ones, resulting in their dependence on technical equipment. What is more, the lack of soft skills attained form outdoor activities will agitate the IT addict, therefore, staying inside with computer and mobile phone will always be the first alternative. Ċ Future IT has also aroused concern on health issues. The existence of Skype, Viber or Yahoo has notably reduced even the longest distance into one click. As a result, rarely do people go out of their comfot zone, provided with snack and air conditioner, to assemble with others in flesh. Needless to say, their action will make a beeline for obesity, short-sighted, diabetes and other heart-related problems. Ċ In conclusion, despite the contribution of IT to the society, its effect on the users' independence and prositution should not be out of concern. To my mind, there have to be some alterations before IT has more serious impact on each individual's life.

prompt: In many countries, more and more young people are leaving schools and unable to find jobs after graduation. What do you think youth unemployment will cause to the individual and the society? And make some suggestions.
essay: People born in the 1980s and 1990s, unlike the "baby boomers", are having a hard time finding employment after they graduate from universities due to the global financial crisis. For instance, less than 50% of the young people in Spain are employed, while their counterparts in Greece have even worse luck. Ċ The high youth unemployment creates trouble not only for the individuals but also for the society. For individuals, unemployment leads to lower self-esteem and increased mental stress, not to mention the financial difficulty unemployment brings. Furthermore, if young people cannot find jobs after they left school, they may feel lost and lose hope for their future. For society, mass youth unemployment places a heavy burden on the welfare system and can even lead to social unrest. Ċ I suggest three ways to battle youth unemployment. First, we should encourage companies to recruit more young graduates by giving them tax breaks incentive. For instance, the UK government has already introduced such rules that the companies are entitled to lower tax rate when they take on a certain number of young apprentice. Second, we should introduce more practical courses and even internships in schools where young people can horn their practical skills so that they become more attractive in the job market. Finally, we should keep encouraging young unemployed people to hunt for jobs and offer mock interview service so that they do not lose heart. Ċ Youth unemployment is a social problem, and we should do all we can to battle this problem.

prompt: Which extra-curriculum activity do you think is the best activity for students? Joining a sports team, b. participating in community activities, or traveling?
essay: The extra-curriculum activity is a regular part of students' life, which can prevent teenagers from falling into criminal or undesirable activities such as teenage-sex or drug-taking. While I accept that students have profited from community activities or travelling, I believe that taking part in a sports team is the best way for students. Ċ On the one hand, community activities and travelling have brought benefits to students. In community life, youngsters participate in a wide range of activities, ranging from the Christmas party to community services, which require students to communicate with neighbors and even organize activities. Thereby, youths obtain lots of opportunities to exercise interpersonal skills while playing and working. Furthermore, it has been proved that travelling can profoundly broaden adolescents' horizon. If a student have traveled to Japan, he or her can have a better understanding of what the Tokyo is like and how to communicate with Japanese, compared with simply studying in textbooks. Ċ However, I would argue that a sport team would bring about more benefits to participators. Firstly, adolescents can improve their physical fitness in sport games. For example, basketball is a physical activities highly require flexibility, response capabilities and coordination of mind and body, all of which are important capabilities outside the sport stadiums. In addition, sport can exercise youths' willpower and endurance. We have seen that students with strong these personalities are more likely to success because they can never be impeded by temporary failures. Lastly, sports can greatly foster youngsters' team spirit which is very importantly beneficial for youths as long as they are in group, no matter in school or society, Ċ In conclusion, it seems that joining in a sport team is the best activities outside class because it can enable students to increase fitness, exercise willpower and understand the importance of team spirit.

prompt: The prevention of health problems and illness is more important than treatment and medicine. Government funding should reflect this Ċ To what extent do you agree?
essay: To curb any illness, preventing it, is the first step. It is argued that the government should spend to take preventive measures . I totally agree with the statement because precautionary measures are more economical in improving the well being of public and these methods must be funded by the government. In this essay, the importance of funding preventive methods will be discussed. Ċ To begin with, prevention is better than cure and requires fewer finances to improve the health of the public. If the illness is contained without the need for expensive medications, a lot of people’s money could be saved which could be used to address the other issues of the nation. As a result, both the mass and the state benefit from it. For example, a study done by the University of Cambridge, England eludes that the authorities can save almost 7% of the funds by taking the precautions to avoid illnesses like Dengue and Malaria. Thus, averting is economical both for the state and citizens. Ċ Furthermore, the authorities must allocate funds for precautionary measures to alleviate the burden on health services. Prevention costs less than the treatment itself which is the most compelling reason to invest in it. Therefore, with little funding, a big chunk of the state’s budget could be saved. For instance, a survey conducted by the University of Oxford, United Kingdom shows that the government have to spend 10% more to treat the disease which could be prevented with just 2% of that amount. Hence, it is beneficial for the state to fund precautionary methods. Ċ In summary, prevention is better than medicine economically and the authority's funds must reflect their interest in it.

prompt: It is as important to teach children to protect the environment as it is to teach them to read and write. Ċ To what extent do you agree with this statement? Ċ Give reasons for your answers and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: It is argued nowadays whether to take lessons of protecting the environment as seriously as literary lessons on the young generation. I totally agree with the idea to put them of equal importance because many benefits can be seen on that. Ċ People who think highly of reading and writing skills may think they are essential for the development of the young population. As two fundamental tools, reading and writing are more likely to be used in academic learning as students skim, scan words for further thinking and then write down their thoughts as the output. What's more, every day we can't live without typing and reading messages in order to socialize with others, in which the two basic skills are all needed. However, if we don't spend time keeping in touch with our environment and ignore its needs and the harm it suffers, we may lose our home where we humans live. This seems to be more essential for all of us. Ċ Thus, teenagers should be taught and then be aware of the importance of environmental protection. Firstly, they should make themselves clear of what behaviours are beneficial to our living places. For example, litter classification was really a problem when it was first introduced in Shanghai. Citizens hadn't been taught any of the relevant knowledge in schools before so that it was truly hard for them to classify between recycled litter and litter for no use anymore. On the contrary, the Swiss people perform much better as everyone in the nation is told how to do so even as a child. Secondly, young scholars should know the results of doing harm to the earth. Many natural disasters actually are caused by humans' misbehaviours. For instance, we are now suffering more from extreme weather, which is led by global warming as a result of too much emission of greenhouse gases. The more we drive our cars powered by gases, the more we expose ourselves to dangers like floods, storms, dry, etc. Ċ In conclusion, protecting the global village where we and our generations in the future have to depend on is as necessary as other learning pathways. Measures should be taken to arouse people's awareness.

prompt: Many students find it difficult to learn subjects like mathematics and philosophy and hence they should be optional in schools. Do you agree or disagree with this statement? both Mathematics and Philosophy are useful subjects
essay: Learn by heart is the most common way for learning the many subjects, but, this method does not always go with maths and philosophy as these subjects mainly depend on logical thinking and broad understanding. This situation makes them more difficult and incomprehensible for many students. However, I strongly believe that making them optional in the school syllabus would not be a smart decision as at least the basic concepts of these subjects need to be learned to get on with the life. Ċ Firstly, Mathematics is one of the most important subjects which is frequently using in our day to day life, and most of the mathematical concepts can practically apply to several real-world problems. Similarly, knowledge in mathematics is crucial for several professional fields such as engineering and management, therefore lots of career opportunities available around the globe for people who have extensive knowledge of mathematics. Ċ Likewise, Philosophy also considered as one of the essential subjects for improving the logical thinking and inner qualities of a person. Unlike other subjects, philosophy not targets to any professional specific skills, but it helps to change the thinking style of the person to make an outstanding personality. Philosophy can improve discipline and leadership qualities which play an essential role in being a successful person. Ċ However, It is true that not everyone needs to be experts in mathematics or philosophy and the choice of selecting the future career is a personal choice. But from my point of view, making them mandatory in school level would not make any unfavorable influence on child's ambition, as they can choose preferred paths at the tertiary level education targeting their future career. Ċ In short, I tend to believe that the both Mathematics and Philosophy are kinds of useful subjects and every child should have at least basic knowledge about them.

prompt: Some people say that the experiences a child has before starting school have the most influence on their future life. Others say that experiences as a teenager, especially at school, are more influential. Discuss both views and give your own opinion?
essay: Humans will change by events they have gone over. Some people tell that students will be influenced by their experiences when they are a child. However, others say that experiences when they have grown up, especially at school, will affect them the most. In my point of view, both experiences have a huge influence on their lives. Ċ On the one hand, kids tend to repeat behaviors from other people. For example, if we treat our babies softly, they will act the way we did for them. By contrast, if kids see their parents altercate often, they will become a hot-tempered person. In addition, playing puzzle or any toys help them develop their brand to become smarter when they grow up. Finally, the habits of children also reflect their personality and interests. For instance, a kid who plays with car models tends to be big on cars and explore them a lot in the future. Ċ On the other hand, knowledge adolescent is taught at school play a very important role in their lives. Although teenagers were taught by their parents when they were children, however, they can develop in various ways. Therefore, school is where adolescents can be directed in the right way. At school, teachers create plenty of conditions to help improve their missing skills as well as develop their strong points. Ċ In conclusion, in my opinion, children need to be educated in the correct way during the period from a kid to an adult because all of those experiences will influence what kind of human they will be.

prompt: Difference between countries have become less evident so we can enjoy the same films,brands and TV program, to what extent do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantage?
essay: Currently, globalization has become a general tendency. The links between different countries and considerably close and cultures of various nations has become similar. Consequently, people over the worldwide can share the same books films, brands, books and TV programs. I believe that the disadvantages exceed the advantages. Ċ Admittedly, the same cultural input significantly contributes to remove the barriers for communication between different countries, which is an effective way to promote the understand and interaction between nations that are different culturally. As a result,base on the similar understanding , the tensions and conflicts caused by misunderstanding would decline. Nevertheless, under large extent, the same input results the similar output, which means no matter how far away a country may be geographically, no country is really differing. The world has become monotonous and boring, restricting people's vision. Meanwhile, there is a dramatic decrease in cultural diversity because of this. Ċ In addition, cultural assimilation id more likely to cause more server problems. The first one is the mainstream culture could quickly occupy the market.without hard efforts. As a sweep trend, a great number of people tend to follow it . Gradually , individuals' thinking pattern and living habits are changing due to the effect of mainstream culture. More worsely, many people especially the youngsters will lost the respect for traditional culture, and even be shame of the traditions. Therefore , it may largely erode the cultural and national identity,making traditional culture die out at last. Ċ In conclusion, although the assimilation improves the communication between different countries., it renders the world monotonous and cause the extinction of traditional culture, whose weaknesses outweigh the strengthenes.

prompt: Haven listened the advice of Introduction related to thesis statement and the length. Will this essay be better? THX~~ Universities should accept equal numbers of male and female students in every subject. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Confronted the situation that girls tend to learn arts while boys choose sciences considerably, educators begin to concern about the imbalance of male and female graduates in each major. In order to control this phenomenon, a suggestion that the number of every college class should be the same in gender has been put forward. Personally, I do not think it is a feasible plan-for two reasons. Ċ Scientific research has been proved that different gender has various personalities. In spite of several repetitions in identical work, female students could do patiently as usual. In contrast, males are fairly curious about everything around them, lacking perseverance to do the same thing. Therefore, dancing, for example, will be one of the most unwilling options among boys. If universities are required to have the same boys and girl through all subjects, the interest of learning would fade gradually as girls may be thought themselves as losers after being defeated several times by boys in physical or chemistry exams. Ċ In addition, the human right is granted man and woman to have equal right to accept education. No matter which subject it is, girls and boys are eligible to choose and be accepted. From college perspective, the choice of each student should be respected, regardless of the number of males and females. Only when the university could be student-oriented, could the college be named as the platform to cultivate the talented. Ċ Consequently, I take the view that universities could advocate the gender balance among majors, but should not implement rigidly and disobey the willingness of students.

prompt: Libraries are irrelevant in the age of the internet and should not be publicly funded. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is a fact that the internet is in an outstanding position as it used globally in this era of advanced technology. This has caused many people to think that funding the public libraries is inappropriate. In my opinion, I firmly disagree with the aspect to stop financing the public libraries because they are convenient and socially important for every community. Ċ First and foremost, libraries offer ease and comfort to the community. Although the internet has provided wide access to online materials from the comfort zone of home, some people still prefer to use libraries because they are technophobes and do not have good command to operate electronics equipment. In Viet Nam, for example, the majority of senior citizens prioritize libraries because, for them, it is uncomfortable to concentrate over mobile phones for longer hours and they could not operate advanced features of their mobile phones. Therefore, it seems to me that libraries should remain in existence and properly financed. Ċ Communication is another advantage that public libraries provide. These days the ubiquity of online platforms, particularly, social networking sites is prone to take people’s precious time, which may eventually lead to isolation from the society. Thus, public libraries would serve as a provision of gathering place for everyone in person. In other words, if citizens interact with each other who have the same interests, they will have a sense of community. Furthermore, it is likely that the youth can improve their social skills which will definitely help them this virtue to apply for a job by attending to the libraries instead of spending their whole time on the online platform. Ċ In conclusion, although there are some people who are of the opinion that libraries are not needed, I believe that libraries are an essential asset to provide resources which are trustworthy and to make people more sociable. Moreover, it is easier for some people to use libraries rather than innovative technology.

prompt: In general, people are living longer now than before. Discuss the causes of the recent increase in life expectancy. Use specific reasons and detail to develop your essay.
essay: With the development of medical technology and knowledge, people nowadays can live much longer than they used to. There are various reasons why the people's lifespan has prolonged and two of which will be listed below. Ċ Firstly, as the process of technology has contributed to the medical equipment and treatment in recent years, the medical standard in the society has leveled up gradually. Many diseases are no longer incurable. Diagnosed at earlier stage, some of terminal diseases like cancer are predictable under doctor's control. Moreover, current technology allows human beings' organs to be transformed from one body to another,which considerably decreasing the mortality of human beings. Ċ Secondly, it is true that the affairs related to elderly people are intensively taken into account by the government and the society facing the soaring rate of senior citizens' population. The welfare formulated by the authorities provides practical fundings to elderly people, such as sickness pay or annual subsidy, which financially assisting them a lot. Ċ In addition, many organizations and individuals in the society give a boost to the establishments of nursing homes. The proliferation of it in the society gives a big aid of taking care of senior citizens. The sound and suitable facilities and qualified staffers with medical knowhow in the nursing home help elders to live a life easierly in this well-prepared place. Ċ In conclusion, it is clear to see life expectancy is longer then the past. Advances in medication, officially welfare in funding and locally nursing houses are the explanations for this trend.

prompt: space exploration versus people problems on the earth Question: Some governments spend a lot of money on exploring space. Some feel that this investment is justified while others think that money should be spent on public services like healthcare and education. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: In the age of exploration, billions of dollars have been spent on space travels, services and equipment. However, many people claim that government is just squandering and they better invest in public services such as healthcare and education. In my opinion, improving citizens' life should be given more prioprity. Ċ On the one hand, people advocate for budget on public services because most of it comes from citizens' income and their life quality is great of importance. Inhabitants want to receive good healthcare system where they can obtain modern and effective treatment services. Besides, a thriving country comes form an outstanding education. If they invest more in constructing schools or developing future labor resources, the literacy will be increased. Therefore, the awareness of people are enhanced and the country is likely to develop at faster speed. Ċ On the other hand, space exploration assists people to keep track with information and contemporary world. Since the end of World War 2, every powerful country have tried their best to come first in term of space discovery or telegraph technology. As a result, budget on these areas is a necessary. However, it can not come before people's welfare. The major responsibility of a government is obviously facilitating it's inhabitants' life. Once this task is completed, then can it think about the another. Ċ In conclusion, space exploration takes up billions of dollars due to the competition of powerful countries, while budget on improving people's welfare is believed to lead to nation's growth. I suppose budget on space exploration comes after public services because of government's responsibility.

prompt: Today more and more people are using computers and electronic devices to access information. Thus, there is no need to print newspapers, books, or magazines anymore. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In the modern world, electronic apparatus plays an important role in human’s life. Nowadays, many people are using electronic gadgets and computers to read the information that is happening around them. It leads to the non-requirement of printed newspapers, magazines, and book. While I agree that the usage of mobile phones by adults increases enormously, still many old people prefer to read only printed papers. Ċ On the one hand, the young generation uses mobiles as their primary device for reading and to know the information that needs to understand. They can access all websites, and anything can be downloaded from them or can be read online. In addition, it is user friendly and easy to keep in pockets. For example, it can be carried anywhere easily wherever we go. Moreover, the waiting time is eliminated if someone wants to know the current affairs. As a result, the time saved. Ċ On the other hand, older people face issues in operating mobile phones as they prefer only printed papers. This is mainly because many are not educated and do not have an idea of how to operate it. In addition to this, some have visual difficulties, thus usage of electronic devices continuously may lead to irritation on their eyes. For instance, still many newspapers and magazines are being purchased by those people. Also, quite a lot of books are being ordered online. So, the older population never get affected by electronic devices. Ċ To conclude, although mobile phones are preferred by young people for reading and various purposes, it is showing that still, the part of the society continue to use the paper-based newspapers, magazines, and books. The technological development in electronic devices will not replace printed papers.

prompt: Some people think the main purpose of education is to make individuals useful to society; others say education helps them to achieve personal ambitions. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: In recent years, education had a significant role to enhance personal development, especially in terms of social contribution to the neighbourhood. Diametrically opposed to this, some opine that the benefit of attending formal lectures is only related to individuals' aims. In my opinion, however, all aspects that people learn from school contribute to social awareness improvement which can be implemented to address social issues in society. Ċ First and foremost, national education observers are concerned that the academy environment does not only provide students to alleviate their hard skills but also soft skills. In other words, pupils have the opportunity to absorb social skills from their extracurricular activities such as climate change clubs or student body organisations. For example, the youngster who has previously joined a volunteer programme at school are likely to conduct further community service when they come back to their local residents. This is because the level of empathy inside themselves has been developed significantly and bring up their interest in local issues. Ċ On the other hand, a number of the general public are considered that academic life will equip young people with essential abilities which only benefit for their personal future goals. Although they have obtained numerous insights from their teacher, they will absolutely prioritize their own objection like how to get a white-collar job and earn money. For instance, it is preferable for fresh graduates to find a proper occupation after they finished their higher studies rather than doing community service projects. If they do not start to make money as soon as possible, there will be no guarantee for them to survive in this capitalist system. Ċ To conclude then, sometimes people believe that schooling only generates individual benefit as pupils must focus on their own personal matters like their future financial circumstances or family problems. However, in my view, a multitude of new expertise they acquired during the formal learning process can be beneficial for society because they are used to practice their sympathy and empathy when it comes to public issues.

prompt: Nowadays people are working too hard. What is the reason for that. What should employers do in order to prevent employees from this.
essay: The average amount of time spent in the office has increased significantly in the past couple of years. In 2020 alone it was over 70 hours a week not to mention the overtime one has to undergo to finish their tasks. There are numerous reasons as to why human beings work longer hours as well as solutions to the problem of reducing the burden of employees. This is essay will be dealing with the causes as to why individuals work as hard as they do and a suggestion to employers to mitigate the issue. Ċ Firstly, the most common reason why people work tirelessly is to acquire greater benefits from the company. These can include things like extra vacation, higher bonuses and a higher chances of landing a promotion. A survey conducted by Alphabet incorporation which is the parent company of Google has stated that 97% of its employees were inspired to perform better after receiving higher pay in the form of bonuses in addition to paid leaves. To combat the problem, corporations must make use of tools with higher productivity to improve the efficiency of labourers. In short, workers spend way too much effort working with unproductive equipment and can spend less effort on provided they find better tools to enhance their productivity. Ċ Secondly, another reason why labourers spend so much effort on their career is to ensure job security. Nowadays people have become much more competitive than the previous generation. As a result, they have become more vulnerable to the loss of their positions. For example, more than 65% of workers have become unemployed in the past few years. Senior management must make sure that their employees have the assurance that they will not lose their jobs for a fixed period of time and must negotiate a contract. In summary, job security has become a reason as to why people have been working hard lately and if staff make sure that their workers don’t have to be afraid of the issue then the time spent on their profession will be reduced. Ċ In a nutshell, one has been spending too many hours on their jobs not only because of the added benefits but also due to the over competitiveness of individuals. This issue can be mitigated provided that efficient tools are provided for individuals as well as assured job security.

prompt: The media is increasing interest in famous people who have ordinary backgrounds. Why do you think people are interested in the lives of famous people? Do you think this is a good thing?
essay: The growing interest of the public to the celebrities without any outstanding backgrounds is being increasingly witnessed these days. In this essay, I shall discuss the main cause why this change has occurred and explain why I believe it could be a positive tendency once governments give proper guidance. Ċ There are numerous compelling reasons why this is happening and the prominent one is that people are always curious about how would successful individuals in various areas utilize their valuable time and maintain a work-life balance as some ideas and thoughts could be beneficial for the common people who wants to pursue a higher achievement in their life. For instance, a recent survey conducted in Japan has revealed that 80% of the people believe that paying attention on celebrity’s daily life enables them to keep themselves motivated because they want to be similar to the famous people. As a result, this tendency is currently increasing in recent years. Ċ Looking at this in a big picture, our society could be positively affected by this development. The crucial beneficial factor of this trend is that people with ordinary backgrounds can learn many valuable lessons from successful people, such as time management and improving productivity. Take myself for example, I have learnt many useful and beneficial skills, then find myself a real motivation to work harder in the future after knowing Jack Ma’s daily work schedule. As can be seen, this development has a profound impact on us. Ċ To sum up, the trend of people paying attention to famous people’s life is ubiquitous nowadays. This essay discussed the reason why it is happening and also explained why it could be a positive development for us.

prompt: In many countries students take a year off after finishing school and work or travel during this period. Should students take a gap year before attending universities? What are the advantages and disadvantages of it?
essay: In this ambitious world, migration for education is becoming a trend among younglings. Many nations government inspires youngsters to do job or tour annually after completion of schooling and before admitting in an academy. In the forthcoming paragraph, this essay would elaborate on both pros and cons and exemplify with lucid examples. Ċ To begin with, if the student does an internship in foreign countries, then he would gain communication skills. Due to which he acquires the ability to give seminars in university. For example, while working in an organisation he faces customers which reduces hesitation. Moreover, he would be familiar with the culture of the country. This is the fact that one can learn moral values. consequently, in the recent ,survey the persons who had participated in such duties are more punctual than others. Ċ However, candidates who had taken a gap in studies are more conscious to make money rather than academics. Due to this, the distraction they are not concentrating upon their subjects. For instance, in order to become economically ,stable they are failing in their careers. Furthermore, many students are not bothering about their families and enjoying their lives independently. In other words, it creates disputes in their relationship with their parents. Exemplar, they are breaking the hopes and expectations of their parents. Ċ To conclude, not only students should focus on financial growth but also it is essential for them to be responsive towards their relationship with their parents.

prompt: Some people feel that it is always wrong to keep animals in captivity, for instance in zoos. Other people say that there are benefits for the animals and for humans. Discuss both sides and give your personal view. zoos - fun for humans, harm for animals?
essay: Zoos are still the artificial environments where people visit to undergo the feeling of being in the short-term contact with the wildlife. While some people argue that it is cruel to keep them in such captivities, however, I believe that, it is beneficial for both the animals and the humans. Ċ On the one hand, zoos are considered as safe and peaceful places in some respects. In the wild, there are great probabilities that most animals can lose their natural habitat, or be killed by other animals. This is more beneficial particularly for endangered animals, which in turn can contribute to the ecosystem. Apart from this, as the natural places where animals can be very dangerous for the lives of human beings, most of us would not have the chance to encounter other living creatures without the presence of zoos. Ċ On the other hand, there are many who doubt the wholesomeness of the existence of zoos. As living in the limited space, the animals can suffer mentally and physically. For example, repetitive disorders and eating disorders seem in the zoo animals more frequently. Apart from not being healthy, some argue that zoos are unethical as they do not have the right to exploiting animals with the intention of making money. They also suggest that the best way to saving endangered animals is protecting their natural habitats. Ċ In conclusion, it seems to me that despite some negative sides, zoos have noticeable advantages for animals, as well as humans, as long as their rights and comforts are preserved.

prompt: Some people advocate death penalty for those who committed violent crimes. Others say that capital punishment is unacceptable in contemporary society. Ċ Describe advantages and disadvantages of death penalty and give your opinion.
essay: It is true that capital punishments can protect a vulnerable society from future crimes. While some people argue that death penalties are unfair towards other human beings, others insist that violent criminals should be sentenced to death. In this essay, I will discuss both sides of the argument and explain my support of the former view. Ċ In contemporary society, many countries have abolished capital punishments. The death penalty can be unsuitable punishment for several reasons. First of all, the strongest argument is - people should not decide who can live and who cannot. Secondly, sentenced individuals are not always criminals. Thus, an innocent person can die which is very unfair. Last but not least, a life sentence is a more relentless punishment rather than a death sentence. To illustrate, criminals would suffer more if they had to spend their whole lives in prisons. Some prisoners long for sooner death. Ċ Alternatively, violent criminals can be dangerous even in prison territories. One criminal can take the lives of several other people. Therefore, it would be more preferable to eliminate future crimes by issuing the death penalty. Moreover, people in prisons are maintained on the government budget. More specifically, taxpayers' money is spent on supporting the lives of prisoners. For instance, these funds could be spent on improving the infrastructure of cities. Ċ To sum up, both ideologies have relevant advantages and drawbacks. However, I tend to believe that one human being does not have the rights to take the life of the other.

prompt: Levels of youth crime are increasing rapidly in most cities around the world. What are the reasons for this, and suggest some solutions. youngsters breaking the law
essay: Recently, crimes committed by young ages have become topic of debates globally, bringing many concerns between government and society. The growing numbers have demonstrated the relevancy of this issue. Overall, this essay will point out reasons why the new generation are involved on this situation and provide some solutions. Ċ First and foremost, the main reason is clearly the freedom that children are growing up. Modern society allows young people to have more flexibility. For instance, while parents are working all day, their sons are being carried by other people such nannies or relatives, who in general neglected attention or have different ways to educate them. Therefore, young people, particularly teenagers are becoming far more independent to committ some crimes that they even are not aware of the consequences. Furthermore, a great solution to tackle this issue could be more presence of parent in children's daily life and also more discipline in their activities. Ċ The secondary reason for crime rates for early ages is the easy access to information. Media often have been showing videos, films and news explaining how people strategically performed in some kind of crimes such as violence and robbers. Moreover, it is encouraged by some groups on social media rapidly. A good idea it will be reinforce the time limit of children and teenagers on TV, internet or any budget, as a consequence less exposition and vulnerability. Ċ In conclusion, freedom and media access are main factors for problems with increased rates of crime in early ages. Parents are protagonist to solve this issue, who should be more present, monitoring the time and content available for their sons.

prompt: Some people believe that having interviews is the best way to find new employees for a company. Others say that there are better alternative ways to appoint employees. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
essay: While some people think that the best way to hire new employees for a company is an interview, others believe that there are some ways that are better. I will discuss both of these views and give my thoughts. Ċ To begin with, an interview has been used for many years when many companies want to find new employees. Some people think it is the best way possible. Additionally, it is also simple, does not take too much time, can be even less than an hour per candidate. Despite its simplicity, there are some drawbacks as well. For instance, many companies nowadays, especially in Thailand, just gather candidates’ information from their resumes. By this, some people can make up their profile to look good, so they can get hired by the company they want, hence a company may not get the best employees by only interviewing. Ċ On the other hand, some individuals argue that if employers want the best from their employees, there are better ways to do so and I agree. As far as I’m concerned, an interview might not be the best way to hire the right person for the job, some jobs may require more abilities than others, such as programming. Instead of interviewing, candidates should be given tasks to complete, which like what they have to do at the workplace, whoever can handle the task better will get the job. This might be one example, where the company should not rely only on traditional hiring methods. Ċ In conclusion, even though having interviews has been used to hire employees for decades and some people have been thinking that it is the most suitable for every job hiring process, there are other ways that might be better for some jobs as well. Executing a given task, for example, is one thing that can be done.

prompt: Crime rate in urban areas Prompt: Crime rate, in most countries, is often higher in urban areas than in rural areas. Why do you think that is? What can be done to reduce crime rate? Any advice or feedback would be appreciated.
essay: In recent decades, escalating crime rate in many places, especially in metropolitan areas, has been receiving a great deal of media attention, causing public controversy. Although there are many reasons leading to the increase of criminals in these areas compared with the rural ones, some plausible solutions are there to tackle this headache-provoking problem. Ċ Of many main causes of crime in urbanized areas, poverty and addiction are basically what to blame. First, it has long been asserted that crime is an evitable product of poverty. In fact, in order to make ends meet under tremendous pressure of urban markets, many people will, by hook or by crook, do whatever it takes to earn their living even committing crimes. Second, big cities are often full of people who are addicted to either alcohol or drugs. When these people are on their way to chase high feelings, the likelihood of them committing crimes, such as robbery or even murder, is very high, and virtually nothing could hold their steps. Ċ However, by adopting cutting-edge technologies and building DNA databases, the governments could reduce substantially crime rate in urban areas. First, deterrent technologies are proven effective in decreasing urban thefts. For example, robbery in California has become less severe after the local authority installed more police cameras throughout the state. In addition, DNA databases also do the governments a great favor in combating criminals in metropolitan areas. Statistically speaking, by building labs which can add DNA of offenders, Malaysian governments are able to find criminals faster and more cost-efficiently than they did in the past. Ċ In conclusion, although there are many reasons that result in higher crime rate in urban areas than in the countryside, governments can invest in state-of the-art technologies to ultimately maintain security in big cities.

prompt: In some societies, fashion is becoming more and more important in choosing clothes. Why is it the case? Do you think it is a positive or negative development?
essay: Some individuals argue that being more fashionable is important, particularly in choosing clothes. This is due to they put the appearance as a paramount value in their life. I personally believe that fashion leads people to positive way. Ċ In today society life, many people are undoubtedly spending their money for fashionable clothes. A host of dress styles created by designers and their works invite people to become trendy, stylish and good looking. In addition, some individuals even pay high cost a designer for a splendid dress which suit to their body for certain events such as wedding party and ceremony.  Thus, it is unquestionably true that choosing the best clothe is important for people's appearance. Ċ There are some positives effects of being fashionable in a daily life. Firstly, people will be more confidence by wearing their best dress in any occasion, for instance meeting up with a prominent person, attending birthday party and so forth. This is because they evidently comfort with their dress. Moreover, people will be braver showing in front of many people, especially for those who work as a motivator or public figure. As a result, people will experience their daily pursuit optimistically. Ċ In conclusion, fashion becomes more important in today's world. Wearing the best clothe in any occasion are able increasing a confidence value, therefore fashion is a positive development to foster people's personality.

prompt: Many people believe that a person's culture is defined by their country of origin., while others believe that it has only minor influence. discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: A group of people think that the personality of a person is merely dependsChange the verb formmerely dependsIt appears that the form of the verb depends does not work with is in this sentence. Ċ show examples upon their home country, whereas, a few other dissidents bring forward the notion that native places do not have much influence in their character formation. This essay explains both sides of this view, and why I think birthplaces have less role. Ċ People believe the birth nation has a huge role in setting an individual's culture, due to the following reasons. They believe that one's behaviour starts to develop when he/she is in the womb. Therefore, offsprings learn the culture, what they have experienced, even before they were born. People may have to travel abroad,however, they will obviously be connected to their roots, since they developed an emotional attachment with their birth place's culture. For example, Usha Uthup, a famous pop singer in India, even though, she spent most of her career journey in other nations, never lost her love towards India traditional attire. Due to these reasons, some believe that an individual's birthplace has a significant role in defining the culture. Ċ In the contrast to the above, others, including me, think that native location has solely a minor influence on behaviour development. To be precise, it has been evident that,humans are capable of adapting to nay different heritage easily. For instance, as a result of globalization, and the influence of western culture in local communities, cultural exchange is rapidly increasing, across the world. So, people are more likely to acquire foreign traditions, as they believe other nations' traditions aid them to gain global citizens' quality. Due to this trend in society, I believe native locations have less influence while defining the character of a person.

prompt: Some people believe that sport is an essential part of school life for children, while others feel it Ċ should be purely optional. Discuss these opposing views and give your own opinion. Ċ You should give reasons for your answer, and include ideas and examples from your own Ċ knowledge and experience.
essay: Sports has been an integral part of school life.While there are some who believe that it is a crucial aspect of students' lives, others contend that it is not important and should not be forced on learners. Although there are a few merits of making sports optional, I strongly believe that it should be a mandatory part of every child's school life. Ċ To begin with, playing games and participating in athletics keep young learners physically and mentally fit. Constant running and jumping not only improves their cardio-vascular strength but also their hand-eye coordination and balance. One need look no further than popular sports like football and basketball. Players of these embody qualities such as agility, nimbleness, stamina, quick thinking and acute focus on a particular task. These qualities have a spillover in academics as well.They are found to better and resilient students; great strategizers with a logical bent of mind. Ċ However, others believe that sports are just adding to the burden and hence should be made optional. They argue that since students are already occupied with studies , it should be left to them to choose their own extra-curricular activities. Pushing sports onto them when they hate is only going to be detrimental for them. For instance, a child with a musical bent of mind would like to devote more time to hone her musical skills rather than play any game. Forcing her to devote more time to sports at the expense of her training in music will only serve to waste her talent. Thus, it is the student's prerogative to decide which activity she should choose. Ċ To conclude, sports in school is a highly divisive issue. While both the sides make compelling arguments, I believe it is best if sports is kept as a compulsory subject as it will be beneficial for student's mental and physical health. If sports are removed from the curriculum, the students will be poorer for it.

prompt: Nowadays many people prefer to study or live in foreign countries. While studying and living abroad brings many benefits to individuals, it also has a number of disadvantages. What are the advantages and disadvantages of leaving your country to live or study abroad? Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: These days it is not unusual to witness an increasing number of people migrating to another country, either to study or to work. Most of them tend not to be hesitant to leave their comfort zones to immerse into another culture. From my own viewpoint, I believe that living abroad can be very challenging. Nevertheless, at the same time, it is a once-in-a-lifetime experience that ya person can bring with him in his next endeavour. Ċ To begin with, when moving to a foreign country,  one will find himself amazed by what its culture possesses to offer. This might be regardless if it is extremely dissimilar from what an individual is used to. Furthermore, it can be perceived in several ways, such as the different tourist attractions and its architecture, the way people socialize during gatherings and even in foods and delicacies. Undoubtedly, these can merely be the few concrete reasons why living overseas makes it fun and exciting. Another apparent advantage can be the fact that upon studying or working abroad, a person will be capable of improving his cross-cultural knowledge and skills. Consequently,  that could be a vital positive factor contributing to future job application, since most companies value international background and diversity to its employees. Ċ Turning to the other side of the argument, the particular thing that makes moving to an unfamiliar country terrible is the adaptation period. It is when expatriates face most of the challenges of living abroad including culture shock and homesickness. Some people might find it uncomfortable when being immersed in a completely unusual environment. A typical example of which is in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, where women are prohibited to mingle with people of the other gender especially with the locals. Looking at the other disadvantage, homesickness might represent a general struggle, but others might experience it regardless of the number of years of being away from his family. However, technology makes it easier to connect someone to their loved ones, through the help of today's social media platforms. Ċ To sum up, moving and living overseas demonstrate its constructive and negative sides. In my opinion, the negatives can be immensely outweighed by the positives. Ultimately, this can be possible when someone appreciated the beauty of distinctive cultures and its people, aside from the gains, which can be acquired through experiences.

prompt: Environmental problems are too great to be managed by individuals so real change can only be achieved at government level. To what extent do you agree or disagreee with this statement? support your point of view with reasons and/or examples from your own experience.
essay: Our Planet is facing more environment challenges like never before. This can be seen more in urban cites due to industrialisation and is having major impact on living condition. It is believed that goverments should start to enforce policies such that entities that are causing problem to enviroment are controlled and suggest alternative best practice, where ever necessary. The two major issues causing promblem to our eco system is air pollution and soil contamination. Ċ Most of us are aware on impact of air pollution , However there is very contribution made to control it. For example in vasty populated city like Delhi, All prefer to use individual car to work place. This significantly raises carbon emmission and thereby has negative impact on everyone. In this case, government has a major role to in introducing effective public and some strict policies enforced like car pooling which will reduced the pollution levels. Ċ The second major concern for environment is the soil contamination. In india for instance farmers are over using the fertilisers for returns. This is causing health issues with fertiliser chemicals getting into human intake. Governments should help farmer provide subsidiary for organic farming and provide loans to sustain this kind of farming. This will help reduce soil contamination and lead to health intake. Ċ After discussing the major issues causing environment , It can be concluded that government action has more positive impact in bring down the problem, ofcourse the people have there bit to make . IT is also suggested there should be people and governorment jointly run initiatives to reduce the impact on damage on environment for better living conditions.

prompt: who needs English, Chinese or Russian language? Some people say that the only reason for learning a foreign language is in order to travel to or work in a foreign country. Others say that these are not the only reasons why someone should learn a foreign language.Which point of view do you agree with?
essay: Learning a foreign language is becoming a trend worldwide.An increasing number of people suppose that people only learn foreign languages to work abroad and visit a foreign country.Others,however,argue that there are several other reasons explaining for this trend.In my opinion,i strongly agree with the later view. Ċ First and foremost,people learn foreign languages to satisfy their interest in linguistics.As we see,many people are passionate about languages.Therefore,they learn foreign languages as a way to pursue their passion.My father's case is a specific example.He has a great enthusiasm about languages and he has been learning four foreign languages. Ċ In addition,people learn foreign languages to broaden their knowledge.Learning foreign languages gives them opportunities to expose to different cultures,histories and traditions of other nations.As a result,they will gain useful information.For instance,when learning English,i can get knowledge about many things involving England such as English lifestyles or customs. Ċ I admit that many people learn foreign languages with a view to travel or work in foreign countries.However,it is only one reason among lots of reasons why someone should learn a foreign language. Ċ In conclusion,i believe that people learn foreign languages not only for traveling and working abroad but also for a lot of other reasons.People should take advantage of languages which they have learned to do other things rather than traveling and working.

prompt: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement ? Cars cause a lot of air pollution. Some people think drivers should pay an environmental tax to pay for the pollution caused by their cars.
essay: I strongly agree with the statement that drivers should pay an environmental tax to pay for the pollution caused by their cars. In my view, this payment is obviously their responsibility to pay for cleaning the environment and to support for environmental solutions research. Ċ One important problem with polluted environment is to purify it. This is encountering more and more difficulties, and ficancial problem is also among them. According to a 2007 survey by the TIMEs, due to car smoke, over 10 billion dollars must be paid for fixing pollution problems per a year, and this number is continuously raising. Therefore, people who use cars must to pay environmental tax in order to reduce this financial burden. Ċ In addtion, because serious pollution caused by cars smoke, researching for sollutions of environmental problems need to be intensified. This has also dealt with financial problems. There were much study of air pollution has stopped because of lacking research grant. Examples, Research of Air Pollution of Washington University, Research of Car Fumes of Japanese Pollution Organization and so on ... Of course, who can afford to drive a car should pay extra to support the research. Ċ To conclude, I completely approve people who drive cars should pay environmental tax to contribute to improving polluted environment, especially, in order for freshing the environment and supporting environment protection research.

prompt: In some cities, there is less control over the design and construction of new homes and office buildings. People can build in whatever style they like. Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: Nowadays, Urban population is increasing rapidly across many countries. Though this is a good indication of economic development, some people are violating rules while constructing houses.In my opinion, the negative effects are more when compared to benefits because of this situation. Ċ More individuals are migrating to cities for survival and this trend is growing quickly.Though older generation individuals are still working in the countryside, youth are moving to cities for earning money.For instance, recent stats prove that many farmers are gradually migrating to urban areas, since cultivation has become hard due to poor rainfall and lack of water.In addition, more homes are being built to meet the increasing demand for city living culture.People such as students and teenagers are biased towards urban culture for quality education and employment.For example, technology companies are hiring more freshers due to which literates are travelling to towns. Ċ However, lack of control over building new homes is causing serious problems such as air pollution and construction accidents. Although real estate supports the economic growth of any country, it is causing environmental problems. Many builders are cutting green trees while building houses, which is the major cause of increasing pollution. To illustrate, trees are removed in cities whenever there is no room for building new infrastructure.Moreover, buildings are getting collapsed since many builders are using poor quality raw materials for construction.To give a clear example, countries like are reporting more deaths due to the building collisions. Ċ To conclude, illegal constructions numbers are climbing in cities and towns nowadays.In my opinion, the disadvantages outweighs the advantages because of this situation.

prompt: Some people say that school children should be given individual class work, while others think that working in small groups is better for them. Discuss both approaches and include your own opinion.
essay: Undoubtedly, the education sector has observed a considerable uplift in its approach over recent years. This has enabled some people to believe that children should be assigned individual classwork while others entrust that working in micro-groups will be beneficial for them. I, however, strongly opine that a blended methodology will be in fact far more beneficial in lieu of either one of them. In this essay, we will discuss these various approaches along with some references supporting the argument. Ċ Firstly, the individual tasks are believed to enhance certain basic characteristics like concentration, memory-building, problem-solving and many more. For instance, a child working on a project single-mindedly will face a lesser amount of distraction in spite of group-based work, where students often get deflected. Therefore, parents are inclined towards the notion of separate assignments. Secondly, the aforementioned step will indeed assist in analysing an individual’s level of intellect thereby it will enable teachers to offer customized learning approach and better counselling and support. Also, I opine that this measure will yield more specific results as every student is different yet special in his or her attitude, hence the comparison needs to be done on an individual basis rather as a whole. Ċ On the other hand, group tasks empower children to build their own social network as these projects are intended to foster team-work and coordination. This, in my view, is an advantageous measure to promote co-dependency, which will prove favourable in future. For example, children jointly working in a crew will be more extrovert and socializing than the ones who operate solely. Furthermore, a pupil can identify the team’s strength as well as weakness besides can have multiple measures to resolve a single problem hence attaining a wider perception and becoming more adaptable. Ċ In conclusion, I would like to emphasize that although both the above-mentioned approaches work in their respective manner, still it is important for the academic curriculum to have a balance of both the measures. As either one of the aforementioned steps will not give adequate outcome rather will have partial-visibility.

prompt: IELTS: Nowadays, many secondary schools teach business and communication skills that help students get a job instead of traditional subjects such as history. Do you agree or disagree with this change?
essay: With the increasing unemployment rate, many parents prefer schools to provide lessons that are helpful for students to prepare for a future job, such as business or communication classes. As a result, the number of classes such as history and ethics are decreasing. It seems that this change needs to be considered due to the fact that traditional subjects also have their benefits as much as business classes do. Ċ It is true that more benefits exist when subjects related to students' potential occupations are introduced at the early stage. It provides a broader background that helps decide their future careers. It then allows them to make a better choice of a subject at a tertiary education. Furthermore, if an individual found an interest in such a class, they are more likely to study and develop the relevant skills earlier than others. It gives more opportunity to success in the filed they choose. Thus, such classes are preferably recommended. Ċ The importance of traditional classes, however, should not be neglected because they are also helpful for individuals' career. One benefit could be that it allows students to foster a better personality by learning moral values in ethics classes and experiencing ancestors' lessons in history classes. Also, a broader knowledge of such subjects will let students to solve problems in a variety of perspectives. These benefits are definitely a positive factor not only for their career but also for personal interaction skills and therefore such classes are as equally important as business classes are. Ċ In conclusion, even though there is a high demand for schools to have business or communication skill subjects, schools should not decrease the number of classes of traditional subjects. That is because students will also have benefits from learning history or ethics when it comes to the employment.

prompt: success is often measured by wealth and material belongings. Do you think wealth is the best measure of success? what makes a successful person.
essay: In today's materialistic world, it is commonly believed that prosperity and material possessions are the criteria of achievement. This essay will consider whether being prosperous are the indicator of attainment, or whether there are other factors which contribute to a person being achieved. Ċ While most people consider that wealthy people are successful, I strongly disagree with that viewpoint. This is because richness cannot bring a real sense of happiness while some might argue that money can satisfy their needs such as buying luxury items, travelling pricey trips or dining in a fine restaurant. However, these things are just contemporary enjoyment. A major reason is because people tend to leverage their quality of living according to their income. For that reason they are more likely to get depressed, stress about earning more money all the time which lead them unhappy life. Ċ Therefore, it is obvious that richness is not the only factor that contribute towards a happy and successful life. On the other hand, it is comprised of many elements to enable people attain their objective growth. Firstly, having healthy relationships can be a dominant incentive as nobody succeeds without the help of others. For example, many scientists, entrepreneurs can meet their goal because they have had teams behind them, support from family, friends or have read and researched the view of others. Furthermore, they must be in a good health and have passionate in what they are doing which I reckon that these factors enable to steer them towards accomplished journey. Ċ In conclusion, richness is unable the best measure of attainment since it cannot bring the real sense of fulfilment in a person's soul. In my opinion, people should place an importance on cultivating strong relationships, healthy habits and figure out our stimulating job. By doing this, we would find the true sense of satisfaction in life.

prompt: Most societies has its homeless people. Some people think that the best way to help them is to give them money. Ċ To what extent do you agree ?
essay: In the 21st century, people have seen numerous ups and downs. These oscillations of life have left many people homeless either because of loss in business or cause of debt. To help the homeless people, it is argued that giving them money will help them. I strongly stand against this notion. In this essay, why providing homeless people money, do nothing to encourage them to change their life and instead of helping them to earn on their on own do good will be discussed. Ċ To begin with, people without homes should be helped to get work and handing over the money should be avoided. Additionally, persons who lost their houses are generally in mild depression due to their situation. whilst offering them cash is a good deed, leaving no other motivating factor to improve their status quo. For instance, one who gets the capital out of empathy will not work for it and continuously seek others to give him fund thus, his situation remains unchanged. Therefore, helping the homeless by giving them money does not help to encourage them to transform their life. Ċ Furthermore, the money giving away to houseless one’s will be spent on socially unacceptable activities like gambling and consumption of alcohol due to their mental instability. Moreover, getting homeless is depressing in itself and if they get cash without any hard work will go in either gambling or drinking. Alternatively, they must be helped to earn their own bread and butter channelizing their mental stress positively. For example, homeless people who were rehabilitated into society by organisations lead a more productive life as compared to those who do not. Hence, people without a roof over their head should be helped to make an earning rather than giving away money. Ċ In summary, in my opinion, giving cash to homeless will do no better to them mentally and even they will dwell into the scenario due to alcoholism. However, they must be helped by other means to get back to normal lives.

prompt: In the last 20 years there have been significant developments in the field of information technology (IT), for example, the World Wide Web and communication by email. However, future developments in IT are likely to have more negative effects than positive. To what extent do you agree with this view?
essay: Decade after decade, every day, scientists discover magnificent devices in the field of IT, such as interactive boards, multicore computers and laptops, tablets, which have an incredible resolution and also mobile phones, which have the power of a computer. World Wide Web and communication via email are some of the positive sides of information technology, however, there are some negative aspects. Ċ Firstly, connecting people by email is easy and fast. In addition, World Wide Web offers humanity to access to information, which they want to know for less than 10 seconds. These are two of the benefits, why IT is useful. Ċ Besides, nowadays technology is entering into our society really quick and scientists develop robots, which help people cope with their problems or just invent coffee machines, engines with integrated computers and etc. For example, before centeries, there were not washing machines, which clean your clothes, while a person do another job. Ċ Secondly, there are some drawbacks about this issue. Scientists believe that one day people will face their developments, for instance robots, and they will not succeed to control them. All this inventions will try to take control of the Earth.
