Ċ In conclusion, I agree that IT discoveries are likely to have more disadvantages than benefits and people should know how to use their developments properly.

prompt: Many people are doing their shopping on the internet nowadays. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages if shopping online and give your opinion.
essay: It is undeniable that in today's techno-savvy era the use of technology is increasingly likely among the people. Therefore, these days the trend of purchasing things on the internet is immense. However, the trend brings both positive and negative aspects and I personally believe that the advantages of online shopping far outweigh its disadvantages. Ċ To begin with, there are numerous reasons why people prefer to buy things online portals. Firstly, there are the wide variety of products available on shopping websites from where people can choose goods which suits their budget and requirements. The convenience is an another point to be considered on the favour of an ordering stuffs by using technological devices. Because one can buy or order anything at any time without commuting to the shopping malls and ultimately it provides reliability to the buyers as they can certainly save their time immensely. Indeed, according to the report of Hindustan Times the 80% of people considered the Amazon an effective and efficient source of an online purchase. Thus, diversity in the collection of an item and comfortability makes this series of browsing internet for buying is an absolute imperative. Ċ Conversely, there are some drawbacks associated with the same which could not be ignored. For one point, shipping problems or delays in the delivery are worse situations that people often face when they choose certain websites or portals for the purchase. Also, sometimes people receive the parcels too late or an inappropriate things which are totally opposite to what they have ordered. In addition, return can be complicated in some cases because it is seen that buyers could get a wrong article and if they return it, then it is a big trouble. For example, there have been some recorded instances of people's bad experiences that hinder them to avoid the shopping websites. Overall, it is not as much convenient in terms of delivery arrangements and returning. Ċ In conclusion, an advent of technology allows the people to prefer shopping online rather than visiting the stores. Although online shopping has an incredible benefit to the people in this fast-paced environment, but its side effects should be overlooked. As far as I concerned, this trend should be positively accepted as it is far more advantageous than its negative consequences.

prompt: In many countries, teenagers are encouraged to do part-time jobs. What's the situation like in your country? What do yout think are the advantages and disvanatges of doing part-time jobs?
essay: The adolescent phase is the transition phase from a child to a young adult.In some parts of the world,teenagers are given permission to do part-time employment ,whereas some countries do not motivate them.This essay will discuss the advantages and disadvantages including why I believe that young adults should have a head start from the adolescent phase,using examples from recent studies to demonstrate points. Ċ On one hand,teenagers learn a lot during their part-time employment.They develop a sense of responsibility and become independent.Additionally,they learn financial management of their salary,which is an important life skill. For example,a recent study by the University of Columbia showed that many tech billionaires,who worked as employees during their graduation, had better business financial management skills compared to those who never attempted to work.Moreover,they have turned out to be risk-takers,achieving success in life.Therefore,employment from a young age instils a sense of responsibility. Ċ On the other hand,exposing children to monetary benefits may result in them deviating from the path of further education.Once teenagers start earning,they lose focus of their aims and goals in life.This will often cause them to get stuck in mediocre jobs throughout their lives.Furthermore, the salary earned by them could be misused for illegal purposes.In fact,it was noticed by many parents that their children started drinking alcohol and using drugs with their salary,often ending up in rehabilitation centres.These are the reasons why young adults should not be encouraged to work. Ċ To conclude,working from a young age has advantages as well as disadvantages.In my opinion,children should be allowed to work to make them more responsible and independent.

prompt: Some deem that job pleasure is more important than job society. In contrast ,others think thay having a stable job is better than enjoying the job. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Many claimes that relishing the jobs are more significant than job society. However,some people opine that remaining in a stable occupation is more effective than enjoying the works. From my point of,view, I believe that job pleasure is the most crucial thing for a person. Ċ Firstly ,in my opinion ,one of the conspicuous reasons that enjoyment is more important is advancing. For example, the people who set up their favourite business regularly are more successful in their jobs. It means that they usually could reach a staggering progressive in their paths in professions. This would create a noticeable advance in human lives besides jobs. This would definitely for delightful occupation. Therefore ,this makes it clear ,people who relish their works do not deviate from their original goals in addition they proceed to follow the significant items that are required to have without ceasing. Ċ By contrast,some believe that having a constant profession is more essential because this would be a need for a country. For instance ,there are multiple jobs that a country is required to have ,such as doctors , psychologists and nurses. It means that these persons claim that all people who want to choose an occupation should regard the society needs besides ignoring their favourable works . This would create a space where all needs of occupations in countries are provided without employing foreign workforces. As a result ,it becomes apparent ,for numerous humans around the world, the needs of the community are more necessary than personal choices. Ċ To summarise ,I personally believe that ,work enjoyment is more crucial than the requirements of the community. It is predicted that to continue personal pleasure for having a profession all the population around the world will accomplish to their cherish profession also will proceed to progressive.

prompt: Reading books keeps a person’s mind active, whereas watching films and television is passive and does not require a person to use their imagination. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: In the age of the film industry, many people prefer watching films to reading books because of the wonderful casts or the outstanding effects of CGI. However, it is undeniable that reading plays a crucial role in developing our imagination. I completely agree with this viewpoint due to some extents below. Ċ There are numerous positive reasons to prove that reading is a better way to keep our minds active than watching movies. While reading, it is vital to picture the scenario, the location, and the appearance of the characters from a few given words, which means that, imagination can be stimulated effortlessly through reading books. Moreover, the meanings of the stories broaden readers' literary horizons and develop useful literary appreciation skills in later life. For example, reading a story based on a real-life event that happened in Munich grants the readers information related to that event or the culture of Germany. Ċ By contrast, watching films and television is considered to be a dependant method of using one's brain. In particular, movies and shows had already had the situations, locations and characters, which limits audiences' imagination. Therefore, watching films requires nothing but concentration, without using the brain. Nevertheless, watching not only narrows the ability to picture but also results in several health problems such as diabetes or heart disease due to spending too much time in front of the screens. Ċ In conclusion, it is true that films, Tv shows are attractive in some ways but obviously, reading benefits our minds better. Thus, in their leisure time, people, especially youngsters, should spend more time reading books than wasting hours watching tv.

prompt: comments on the products and services to the cyberspace and its effect In the world of internet, people write about a product and its reviews as well as their opinion about the service. Is it a good thing or bad thing?
essay: In the internet world, people trend to post their reviews and opinion on any products and services to the cyberspace. In my view it is beneficial to both the buyer and seller. Ċ The prime reason for people to leave their comments to the net would be that for information sharing. And thus the sharing is crucial for other when they need to acquire goods or services they do not familiar with. By access to the reviews and opinions on the net, they will have sufficient information for them to make their purchasing decision. Hence I believe this is vitally important for the people to upload their comments about the products and services to the internet as of it weight on influencing the buying decision of any potential consumer. Ċ In fact this internet comment habit not only good for individual but also positively impacting the seller. Company who provide good services and products is rewarded by the most powerful advertising instrument in the world, that is the internet. Besides company nowadays, instead of waiting for the customer to sending feedback, is proactively seek for people with influencing power and providing them the free sample or trial service and encouraging them to sending reviews and opinions to the internet. These kind of advertisement had been proved by several researches that help generate more business than that of the traditional way, advertising thought the broadcasting media, for instance. Ċ In conclusion, it is the positive development for people who post comments on the products and services to the cyberspace as I believe that it is beneficial to both the individual and company as a whole.

prompt: Many people believe that individuals over 65 should not be allowed to continue working. Other think people should be allowed to work for as long as they choose. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: A significant number of people think that persons who are more than 65 years old should be panned from resuming work. In comparison, others believe that individuals should have the choice to continue working for the time period they want. This problem had much public debate recently among people in the community. From my point of view, citizens should continue their work as long as they want. This essay will discuss whether it is useful to let people decide their retirement age, or if there should be some limitations for employees' age. Ċ On the one hand, some countries are running up against high unemployment numbers among citizens, especially among the young generation. Therefore, banning older workers at a particular age could be the solution to this problem. For example, seniors are much more numerous than young people in Japan. Thus, the youngest citizens are obliged to travel to other countries in order to find jobs. While it is true that older individuals should have their jobs too, in order to live their life properly, it is fundamental to provide opportunities for those who are still hoping for one. Ċ On the other hand, the oldest generation has a great deal of experience and a high level of advanced skills. Consequently, they master their work and can be better than young people in different disciplines. For instance, in a significant number of employing applications, it is an obligation to have a higher level of education, a long period of experience, and advanced working skills. These always exist in older workers' CVs. Moreover, some companies find that investing in an older employee is worth more than training a new workforce. In contrast, there are other thoughts that young employers will be more creative and productive. Still, a lengthy experience is essential and fundamental. Ċ In conclusion, the benefit of age limitations has been discussed in this essay. The importance of investing in the knowledge of the oldest members of the workforce also has been mentioned. In my opinion, letting seniors decide when they want to retire is an obligation towards them and the community.

prompt: should ethnical identity of a country be preserved? Question: Some people believe that citizens should keep their cultural identity of their country, whereas others say that it is better for people to integrate themselves into new cultures. Discuss both views and give your opinion. Answer:
essay: It is believed that citizens should preserve their ethnical identity of their country. Nonetheless, others people think that integrating themselves into new cultures would be a better choice. From my point of view, fitting into new cultures will bring much advantages. Ċ On the one hand, the national identity of a country is the one and only, so that people need to know how to maintain and develop their cultural specificity of their country. A country without its identity will be assimilated by others countries. In addition to this, a cultural uniqueness is a big "pull" factor for travelers to visit a country. For this reason, citizens should conserve their culture to foster the tourism. Once the tourism is developed, the economics of that country will be raised either. Ċ On the other hand, integrating into new cultures will enrich and affirm one's own distinctiveness. This action will bring a wide range of benefits to the cultural identity, as people learn others countries' specificity and bring back to their country. For instance, the custom of celebrating Lunar New Year is derived from China, this comes to Vietnam and becomes the most significant and important festival of Vietnam. The subsequent explanation is when being exposed to not the same cultures, people will embrace and appreciate others that are different from them. The cultural misconception and racism will be effaced, then the world will be a better place. Ċ In conclusion, I prefer to integrate into new cultures rather than keep my cultural identity of my country. The reason is fitting into new cultures will bring you a perspective look of the world, which is crucial in the 21th century.

prompt: Sales companies should recruit people who are hungry for money as they will make the most dedicated workers. Ċ Do you think money is the driving force behind hard work? What factors should be taken into consideration when recruiting staff for sales positions?
essay: Recruitment of sales positions is quite different from other job positions. There are multiple view on the skills needed for this role. Many believe that the person should be money minded to perform well. I, however, do not completely agree with this view. According to me, there are multiple other factors as well, which determine the success of an employee in a sales role. Ċ The trigger point for a worker to work hard could vary from individual to individual. The main reason for some to believe that money minded people can be good for sales is the nature of the job. For instance, most of the companies provide variable pay to its employees. The more contracts are closed by the staff members, the more benefits they get. This can be a trigger point for many to work hard and perform well. Ċ Additionally, the factors such as interpersonal skills are important as well. As a part of the job, one needs to converse with multiple people and tell them about the product in a very interesting way. There is need of being persuasive as well, so that they can convince the prospective customers to buy the product. Other than monetary reasons, healthy and fun work environment is another major factor sales employee could be looking for. If recruiters target any person who is passionate about the task, then it can also prove good for the employer as it means the staff will feel motivated without greed and will perform well. Ċ To conclude, multiple people may have multiple trigger points to encourage them to perform better. Typecasting everyone in the sales sector to be a money mind is wrong. The recruiters should look for other details about them such as passion, interpersonal skills etc.

prompt: People nowad Ċ ays are not fit and active than people from the olden days. Discuss the causes for this situation and suggest some possible solutions.
essay: Humans today's modern world are not physically active and healthy as compared to past day's folks. The essay will first discuss the biggest cause of the aforementioned phenomenon is the availability of technological appliances and suggest the most effective solution exercise to keep them healthy and well with appropriate examples reaches to a logical conclusion. Ċ To begin with, the foremost cause of the given situation is the excess of appliances due to the high rate of the invention in the technical field then olden days. Additionally, people have all these kind of facilities in their homes to make their homework easy that effects on their daily activities and could throw them toward the laziness. Moreover, not being so active throughout the day could cause a person serious problems such as obesity, high blood pressure. For example, appliances like as, washing machines, dishwashers and robotic vacuum cleaners have reduced a lot of activities of a person at home however, these kind of facilities were not present in past days human used to do their house chores by themselves. Ċ Furthermore, a possible solution to the present problem would be to stay more active while working and staying at home as well. Even though people have more machines to help them at house chores, but still, they need to do some exercise to keep them physically fit. Nevertheless, an individual can stay physically fit although can makes their necessary distance from illness. For example, washing clothes by themselves is a sort of exercise that involves a lot of shoulders and arm movements. Ċ In conclusion, despite today's facilities made daily life easy, but reduce the quality of health too for people as comparison olden days, if there are a plethora of issues involved for unfit lifestyle ,therefore, there are many possible solutions to improve own wellbeing.

prompt: pros and cons of sponsoring education. Task 2: Children's education is expensive. In some countries, the government pay some of or all of the costs. Do the advantages outweigh its disadvantages?
essay: Nowadays. the tuition fees on children are expensive. In some nations. the government subsidise some of or all of the costs to help children have an access to learning. From my perspective, although this trend is not without disadvantages, the upsides will justify these. Ċ There are a number of drawbacks of this trend that will be mentioned . First, since government is willing to fun for education costs, it is likely to put more burden on national budgets. For example, other key fields, either economy or healthcare, is also needed much investment. When governments cover many aspects of education, they in turn force to impose more taxes on individuals, leading to put burden financial on low-income families. Second, it is likely to be unfair to childless people. This means, they incline to be unpleasant because they money is used not for their benefits. Ċ On the one hand, many benefits should be taken into account. First, funding for kids' education is of great benefit to families as well as society. In fact, in some case, parents are not able to afford the cost of education for their kids as their saving are meager. Therefore, this policies can open the opportunities of education for aspiring students, leading to enforce the quality of workforce in the long run. Second, by paying the tuition fees, parents can be released from the burden education fees, helping them have more budget to take goodcare of their kids in terms of food, clothes or medical care. Ċ In conclusion, with all convincing arguments mentioned above, it seems to me that the demerits will be overshadowed by merits.

prompt: Sending criminals to prison is not the best method of dealing with them. Education and job training are better ways to help them. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree? Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: Imprisonment is not a sensible way to treat offenders. Instead, the responsible way is to educate them and then train them for some kind of jobs. This essay completely disagrees with this and I intend to justify it in the following paragraphs. Ċ First and foremost, the purpose of imprisonment is not just to isolate the criminals. The offenders should also realise their mistakes before being released. So, they do not become a lawbreaker again, if encountered with a similar situation. For instance, studies show that 80% of the lawbreakers who completed their punishment did not indulge in any criminal activity after being released, because they knew the consequences of breaking a law. Ċ In addition to that, confinement of an offender also takes care of the fact that while being in prison he/she can not do any harm to the society. Furthermore, punishing an accused also serves the purpose of justice given to a victim. For example, one of my friend's father was murdered by some miscreants. He had to fight that case for 10 years to prove them of guilty. For him, the justice was delivered on the day when all of them were sentenced for 20 years of confinement. Ċ To conclude, imprisonment not only serves the purpose of a punishment for an offender it is also a way to deliver justice to a victim and his family. Moreover, it also gives an opportunity to the criminals to realise their mistakes while being in isolation. And at the same time, it also sets an example for others.

prompt: Global environment issues are the responsibilities of rich nations not of the poor nation. Do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay: In recent years, all countries in the world have been concerned to tackle the climate change problems. Some opine that the emergency of the global ecosystem should be solved by developed nations, rather than developing one. I personally agree with this notion as the industrial regions are playing a significant role in the current natural issues for the following reasons. Ċ First and foremost, history observers are considered that the western countries contribute to the production of a myriad of carbon emissions on earth that causes natural imbalance. For instance, in the early industrialisation period, there was a multitude of factory activities in several regions in Europe. This phenomenon led to the high amount of carbon dioxides and methane released into the atmosphere and resulted in the greenhouse. As a consequence, it is an absolutely huge responsibility of the wealthy state to come up with a strategic solution to address the catastrophic effects of environmental damage. Ċ Another point to consider is that the high-level economy territories in the world have the capability, in terms of money or technology, to assist greenhouse impacts. For example, when the last G7 meeting has been held in the UK, the representative of the UN has suggested all G7 members donate their resources such as funds and their high technology equipment to help South-East Asia nations solving deforestation cases, floods, pollutions, and others disaster events caused by ecosystem detriment. Ċ To conclude then, I personally agree that most of the states in western are the one who needs to responsible for the unprecedented events happens globally as a consequence of global warming, as they have a contribution on this event and supported by sufficient resources.

prompt: In many countries, traditional dress and costumes are considered effective ways of maintaining links with the past. How effective can traditional costumes be, in this sense? What other ways exist to help citizens connect with a country's past?
essay: Numerous states around the world would agree in case keep on traditional dress and costumes as a way to connect these time with the past. It might be true since traditional outfit and costume being utility to remind the history. Besides, keeping of traditional music exist also relate this generation with before. Both of these issues will be depicted in the following paragraphs. Ċ The first, the traditional outfit and costumes are eminent for society in case of preserve the culture which each of them has diversity of history. Most inhabitans ought to keen their history of their outfits, such as utilizing them for ritual or traditional events. Indeed, several parts of traditional outfit and costumes have certain value that depend on their belief it has to carry on. For instance, the costume of traditional ceremony in Bali, the participant has an obligation to dress white color up as an holy symbol. Ċ Furthermore, it is remarkably understanding the other way to keep the country's past handed down between generation, that is traditional music. Like in varieties population, tarditional music illustrates the story of life of ancient group of people, such as how they socialize in. Moreover, the traditional music has capability reminding the people about the assimilation of two or more cultures. For example, the traditonal music from Central Java, named Gendhing, which mixturing between the Hindu's traditional music intonation and Islam's messages. Ċ To sum up, recognizing the original culture through either traditional dress and costumes or music traditional music are substantial to connect this era with the past since the culture symbolize the charactheristic of the society.

prompt: Young people today are better qualified than they were in the past. Some people argue that this is because competition for jobs is greater that it used to be. Others say that people only continue their education because the opportunities exist for them to do so. Ċ Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: Nowadays, the younger generation tends to continue their education to higher levels. This grant them higher qualifications and opens more doors for them in the job market. While some argue that such trend is caused by the need sensed by them to become more and more desirable for a position, others believe people take part in such programs only because they privilege exists. I think the former argument has more weight. Ċ Looking at the unemployment rates, it is obvious that landing a rewarding career is in no way a simple task. Therefore, only had an individual obtained higher degree or professional certificate, they can qualify for their dream job. For instance, many recruiters are looking for tertiary graduates whom are specially trained. The level of skills developed under special training will determine the security of a beginner's career. In fact, the fear of inadequacy drives the potential employees to focus on gathering abilities which help them thrive in the future. Ċ But there's another side to this situation. In recent decades, a lot of educational facilities have been formed, which create the chance to steepen one's knowledge or set of skills. For example the existence of virtual universities enables versatility in the time and place in which the learner attends the class. As a result, these academies providing the learners with a more flexible environment, enable them to pursue their curiosity, whether it affects their occupation or not. Moreover, many who are currently employed would utilize this shot to advance. Ċ In conclusion, societies are faced with a wave of extremely competent youth. This is most definitely a reaction to a vastly competitive market, forcing the candidates to put more effort to better themselves. Although some believe that most of them are just taking advantage of an available opportunity.

prompt: Some people think that people who are over 60 years old should not work and should be made to retire. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: A major number of society thinks that it is not a good idea to make older people to work who are above 60. Instead, they should be retired. Although retirement is indispensable, I do not think they should be retired above the age of 60. This essay will discuss this issue using examples to support arguments and demonstrate it. Ċ On the one hand, there is plethora of individuals who are working over the age of 60 and also 65 and they do not care about their age because they think they are strong enough to earn. For example, in corporate companies there are people who work as an agent. Even though they are over 60 they still work to earn and live a happy life no matter what their age is. Therefore, companies should let them work until they are capable. Because they are fit and healthy. Ċ On the other hand, there are few people who are physically not fit for a job as a result of health problems. These people can be retired. For instance, There is a law, In few countries that people who are not mentally or physically fit for a particular profession should not be forced to work at all. Moreover, in such companies these people are made to retire and a pension amount is sent to their homes. Thus, before taking a decision of retirement one should know the concern about others. Ċ In conclusion, companies should encourage individuals who are willing to work even if their age is above 60. Furthermore, they should be made retired only if they have any health issues with them. In future, companies must make it clear who to retire.

prompt: Some people believe the best way to reduce the number of accidents on the road is to further limit the speed of the vehicle. Others think there are better ways to tackle this issue. Discuss both the views and give your opinion.
essay: Misfortunes on the boulevard are every day in the country, including minor and severe mishappenings. The mindset of many residents of society is to curb the speed of automobiles moving on the way to control road accidents; others believe that different measures effectively reduce the prevailing mishappenings, which is a seriously debated issue. This essay will discuss both aspects before my closing verdict. Ċ On the one hand, the idea of banning high-speed vehicles is relatively reasonable. The leading cause of casualty on the roads can be attributed to the drivers' negligence in speeding. In other words, many people, especially our younger generation, drive very fast, in the desire to do something courageous, with vehicle collisions on the roads becoming common. For instance, according to a survey conducted in Delhi, the leading cause of most route accidents is the high speed of automobiles. Therefore, it is imperative to pay attention to reducing the Overspeed of automobiles to save humanity from casualties. Ċ On the other hand, it is necessary to follow other measures instead of slowing down the vehicles of some dissidents living in the society also points to the very right thinking. It would be fair to say that speeding alone is not the only cause of tragic roadway calamity. Alternatively stated, some people use drugs like alcohol while driving, which causes us to have vehicle collisions too; as a result, people are very addicted and sometimes they have to lose their lives. Ergo, the government should show strictness on driving under the influence of alcohol. For example, the ministry has launched an instrument to measure drugs used by the public, and the quantity of alcohol present in human is assessable. Accordingly, the regime takes legal action, and fortunately, this initiative has decreased the tendency of everyone to drive while intoxicated. Similarly, the government should look into more traffic regulations and reduce the number of road accidents. Ċ To conclude, in my opinion, controlling the speed of vehicles is an effective measure to some extent. In addition, several laws need to be enacted with the government in mind, which can lead to complete control of road calamity, with paperwork and enforcement at the forefront.

prompt: Many people think that every individual is responsible for their happiness, but some people believe there are other external factors that influence us. Ċ Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: In the modern world, many individuals are willing to be a fortunate person. In this regard, although some people believe that happiness is a state of mind, others feel that external factors can influence on people. Personally, I reckon that if each individual satisfy with his/her well-being and health, they can reach a sense of fulfilment. Ċ To begin with, many individuals believe that reaching blessedness is impossible without satisfaction. In this reason, in many cases, people’s fortunate depends on many external factors, such as absence of economic hardship in the country. That is to say, citizens of wealthy countries can reach happiness, because they can realize their potential. A good illustration of this is Scandinavian countries. According to the World Happiness Report in 2018, the most happiest individuals on the planet live in this region. Ċ On the other hand, blessedness is considered to be the sole responsibility of an individual with many. This is because, every person should have the ability to take control of their emotions. In other words, they should not be stressed and disappointed, when they meet obstacles and challenges. Otherwise, they can earn some diseases, and reaching happiness is an arduous task for sick people. For instance, many people believe that they are lucky, because they have a good health. Ċ In conclusion, although many individuals believe that fortunate is a state of mind, and each person is responsible for one’s blessedness, others feel that external factors can influence on people. Personally, I reckon that the last option has a significant impact on people, and Scandinavian countries can be proofed for it.

prompt: Many people believe that modern technology has made people more sociable, while others think that it has isolated them. Discuss both ideas and give your own opinion.
essay: Although, a lot of folks think that the advent of advanced technology made the public more outgoing, others believe it created more gap on the already struggling human community. Even though the advent of modern technology opened endless access to meet people in distance land, in my opinion I think it reduced the frequency of face to face intreaction. Ċ On one hand, modren softwares has created limitless and cheap access to the international communites through social media such as: facebook. If this applications where unavaliable, many individuals might not have crossed paths and this bring us closer to world peace since all part of the world is becoming integrated. facebook for instance, enabled affordable communication between loved ones in far away places. Moreover the fact that these softwares can translate foreign languages makes easier to relate with foreigners. Ċ On the other hand, we have seen decline in the level of physical intreaction due to the enormous amount of time spent in front of the screen and this creates an isolation between an individual and his environment. Furthermore, most people spent the whole playing video games instead of attending social functions such as: weddings or a carnival at the local park which could have availed them the opportunity to make their neighbors. For example, according the recent study in the UK, the world is currently faced with a drastic decline on the turn up at an outdoor event when compared to the trend in the last century. Ċ To conclude, Even though technologies opened up communication channel to the distance land, it however, made people an island. This is not a good survival adaptation because human as a race relay on community effort to survive difficult times such as during Hurricane, so how will neighbours help either other? if they do not even know themselves. This is an error that needs to be corrected.

prompt: Some people say that modern buildings are ugly and are ruining our towns and cities, especially when these buildings are very different from those around them. Others say that they add variety and interest.  Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
essay: Nowadays high class buildings as a landmark for each city. As such, several people argue that having an impressive building around the city is becoming attracted and amazed, this is because the magnificent buildings in cities can anticipate economical problems. However, others believe that having it makes cities unhealthy, and this can cause flood and air pollution. Therefore, I would argue that have imposing buildings can make cities look more different than usual and also give income for the government. Ċ On the one hand, people argue that magnificent buildings make cities unhealthy because many green areas have altered by tall buildings. This action can cause flood and air pollution around the areas. Taking Jakarta as an example, many tall buildings have constructed, and this trend causes reducing absorption and green areas that could lead to flooding and air pollution. As a result, flooding in Jakarta always occurs seasonally in every year and automatically the air will contaminated. Ċ On the other hand, certainly impressive buildings have a meaning for each city, especially in develop areas. First, it is making easy for. Also, it makes cities more beautiful and wonderful. Besides that, imposing buildings can help economical per capita in every city because can attract people to travel in the place. Ċ In conclusion, it seems to me that there are many positive effects for cities and towns have impressive buildings. Thus, it is imperative that the government should support this trend and also must control magnificent buildings.

prompt: Topic: There are parents who decide to stay home and look after their families, mostly mothers. Some argue that the government should pay stay-at-home parents. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In order to improve the living standard of their families, both parents go to work everyday. However, there are some parents who make a decision to stay at home and take care of their families. Most of them are mothers. Some people believe that the government should pay those stay-at-home parents. In my opinion, I agree with this idea. Ċ Parents who stay at home have many household chores to do. Some people say that doing housework is harder than working in the office because housework is a boring and difficult job. Thus, all stay-at home parents should be paid as those who work in the office. Ċ Moreover, a family that has a stay-at-home parent generally has more happiness than a family that has both parents working. In fact, stay-at-home parents do not only provide warmth to their families, but also contribute to the society as well. To illustrate, children that have stay-at-home parents usually perform well in class and study hard as parents are great help in improving their children's education. In addition, when a child has a parent who stays at home, he or she generally has good manners and is advised to know what is right and what is wrong. Therefore, there is a decrease in the rate of juvenile delinquency, which occur because both parents are occupied in their work and the lack of interaction between children and parents. Furthermore, children are healthier if their parents stay at home with them. They can have nutritional food everyday and get treatment immediately if they have a particular illness. Ċ All things consider, I hold the view that the government ought to pay stay-at-home parents because those parents bring abundant advantages to both their families and society.

prompt: Some people think it is more important to spend money on roads and motorways than on public transport systems. To what extend do you agree?
essay: Investing in roads and motorways instead of public transport systems is a common idea for numerous citizens. I completely disagree with this opinion due to the advantages of spending budget on public transportation and the reasons are outlined below. Ċ Firstly, public transport helps reduce pollution. Subways and buses are the typical representatives of this transporting form. By switching from personal vehicles to underground or buses, the number of automobiles operating on roads at a time reduces significantly. This leads to a decrease in the amount of emission into the atmosphere and then improve air quality. For instance, numerous large European cities such as Paris or London have extremely complete public transport systems, which help them to limit the total of personal vehicles on the traffic network, helping the authorities to control the pollution level. Ċ Another reason to support the development of public transportation is originated from the financial benefits. Motivating citizens to switch from individual automobiles to shared ones can help reduce society's fuel costs. For example, a bus can replace a sum of vans in a defined route due to its large capacity for passengers. Therefore, rather than consuming a large amount of gasoline for several cars of passengers who are on the same way to their workplaces, the fuels are using economically by the bus system. Spending less money on gas means that the government possesses a better financial capacity to make other essential investments, which improve social living standards. Ċ In conclusion, while a number of people are interested in developing roads and motorways, I strongly believe that governments should spend budget on public transports, which can bring various benefits in both environmental and financial aspects.

prompt: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Childhood is the happiest time of a person's life.
essay: Everyone have happy moments during their life. These happy moments are both in their childhood and their adulthood. In my opinion , childhood is the happiest time of a person's life. Ċ First, in childhood most people are happier than in adulthood. They do not have to worry about bills , jobs , how would their life be in the future. They just worry about two things: to have fun, learn and be happy. A child's daily life is school, playing and sleeping. For example, when I was young I just came home from school and then I would took my bike or soccer ball and go out and play with my friends in my neighbourhood . Moreover , I did not have to worry about costs and other things , I just had fun and learned.Also, people are most creative when they were children , children imagine new things and games just to have fun and be happy. Ċ Second, childhood is the period where people go to school and learn. Therefore, school memories are one of the most memories in a person's life. There , you learn, find your first love, make new long-lasting friendships and of-course have a lot of fun. For example, my father's best moments in his life are in his school years. Moreover, he is still in-touch with some of his classmates and sometimes they get together and share their childhood memories. Ċ In other words , childhood is, indeed, the most happiest moments in a person's life. There is only one life and one childhood and people should live their childhood thoroughly.

prompt: Today more people are overweight than ever before. Ċ What is your opinion, are the primary causes of this? Ċ What are the main effects of this epidemic?
essay: Nowadays, one of the main problems people face is increased body weight, resulting in many associated risks. In my opinion, such an issue is primarily caused due to adoption of unhealthy eating habits. This essay will firstly examine various reasons that cause overweight, and secondly, its adverse effects will be discussed. Ċ To begin with, many youngsters are more inclined to unhealthy eating habits, and the possible reason is the advertisements shown in a compelling manner, urging the consumers to try them. Moreover, many youths follow their favourite celebrities blindly in the food product advertisement they appear in. For instance, a top model in India recently appeared in one of the aerated drink brands, and there was a considerable increase in its purchase which was not the case prior to this publicity. In addition to the above, many buy food packages looking at only the fancy key ingredients mentioned in the package; chances are these products may not be effective enough for health. Ċ On the other hand, if people today continue to consume junk meals, its consequence will be observed in the generations to come. To elaborate, consuming a less nutritional and high carbohydrate diet is responsible for excess body weight, which in turn causes some debilitating health hazards, sometimes leading to even death. For example, many youths consume street eateries loaded with unhealthy fats, leading to diarrhoea and vomiting. Furthermore, long term consumption of such meals can have devastating effects on the body, causing severe issues like cancer in the coming future. Ċ In conclusion, being overweight is one of the severe problems caused by factors like unhealthy eating habits. Its long-term effects can be seen in the form of deteriorating health leading to obesity and heart diseases.

prompt: With the development of technology and science, some people believe that there is no great value of artists such as musicians and painters. Ċ What are the things artists can do but the scientist cannot? Ċ Why should we encourage the art area?
essay: In this era of the digital world, traditional professions as musicians and painters not so popular as it was before. More and more people, even creative and talented, try to apply themselves into more technological areas. Nevertheless, there are certain things related to the artists, that are impossible to create in the technical laboratories by scientists. Certainly, the area of art must be encouraged both by governments and by the people. Ċ On the one hand, almost any product that can be made by the artist today, can be created by the engineers. Applications of the artificial intelligence in software and data science are able to do almost impossible. For example, all sorts of computer programs to analyse, create and produce on the output any kinds of digital products. However, in fact, they are able to reproduce or produce only the mix of already existed artworks which was given as an input. Therefore, any technology or a scientist needs someone who understands and feels the music and colours, someone who can contribute a new idea and feeling of the craft. Ċ On the other hand, despite how the science and world around us has developed, generally we are still human beings. As a human being we are still driven by the feelings first rather than computations and rapid analytics. Thus, when will we feel ourselves happy or what can motivate us? A piece of electronic device or a scientific research? Definitely, the answer is the art. In addition, even those devices which we can call a state of art are made by the artists. So there is no doubt, the world, especially now, is in need for the artists. Ċ In conclusion, the way of development of the artists is not apart from the development of technologies and science. We can say that the value of painters and musicians will never decrease, but in contrast, will develop as develop the tools by which they create their artworks.

prompt: Some people think old buildings should be destroyed and replaced with modern buildings. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Regarding whether traditional buildings should replaced by the contemporary buildings brings the negative and positive influence is much concerned to a point where a wide discussion has been aroused. Some people hold that it is necessary that the modern buildings are instead of the old. And to large extent, I am on the opposite side of this claim. Ċ First of all, not all the old houses are necessarily obsolete. In effect, some of them are the symbol of culture and history. The quadrangle dwellings, for example, have been going through the China History and it is such an awesome style that impresses the people around the world. Therefore, the government will not destroy them in order to protect our national art. Ċ In addition to this, a proportion of people are adapted to the old living surroundings and it seems not too easy to change that. If all the traditional buildings drop down, some people will lose their home. For instance, many elder people live in their apartment during their whole life, and they never think about moving out. Apparently, some people only want to live the original place and the new things like the modern buildings do not attract them. Ċ At last, the appearance of the modern buildings has never been equal to the inner value of the traditional buildings. Compared to the old buildings, the modern buildings do have the advantages, such as the function, the quality and the awareness in the environmental protection. Meanwhile, in terms of the macroscopic view, the construction of buildings reflects the flourish in the economy. However, if we live in a city with skyscrapers everywhere and cannot find a tiny culture around, it will be a pity for this city as the people live here are rejecting their civilization and losing the treasure which is the most important thing in the world. Ċ Overall, destroying all the old buildings or replacing them with the modern buildings is not a wise choice.

prompt: These days, people work in more than one job, and often change career several times during their life. What are the advantages and disadvantages of this?
essay: Nowadays, people tend to work in many different professions in the course of their lives. There are many benefits of this trend, also there are a number of drawbacks. Ċ On the one hand, changing the career path can be seen as beneficial in various ways. Firstly, working in different jobs often broadens the one's horizon. In other words, the person who chooses to change his or her job would have a chance to acquire new knowledge and meet new colleagues; as a result they will improve their expertise and expand their social circle, all of which are valuable life skills. Secondly, the new career might have a financial advantage over the prior one. People often chance their jobs to find better opportunities; therefore, they change to more financially satisfying jobs. Finally, by experiencing more jobs, the individual might eventually find out where his or her passion is, and which job are much suitable for them. Thus, they will be more creative and successful in their targeted jobs. Ċ On the other hand, not having a steady career could have several negative effects. There will be a suffering period in the beginning of every job transition is made. Because each time the worker will probably need to start from scratch again. In addition, blue-collar workers will probably not get justified promotions or hold important positions if they change their career contentiously. To be a CEO of an organization, for example, the employee needs to spend long time in the same company. Ċ In conclusion, doing more than one job during the life could have both pros and cons in the same measures.

prompt: In some countries, there is not enough recycling of waste materials (e.g. paper, glass, and cans). What are the reasons and solutions?
essay: It is quite notorious that some developed nations are not recycling waste materials such as paper, glass and cans. The reason behind this seems to be the lack of enforcement of legislation for the commerce sector. Should this be the origin of the problem, a simple solution would be to involve a neutral party to make sure these organisations abide by the law. Ċ It has been established some countries do not see recycling as a priority, therefore they do not have a clear plan to make sure their population is sorting out recyclable materials as needed, especially the commerce sector. For instance, businesses may see recycling as an unnecessary waste of money. Consequently, they have no interest in investing time and resources to dispose of their waste appropriately. Ċ To solve this issue, there should be a neutral agency auditing the trash disposal protocol of all the members of the commerce sector. For example, a non-governmental company monitors commercial waste to make sure private companies are following the rules and adhering to the legislation. The neutrality of this report would make it indisputable, hence business owners would have to change their behaviour. Ċ In conclusion, most of the waste not being recycled comes from the commerce sector of some countries. Despite legislation in place, these commerces choose not to recycle because it would impact their profit. Nevertheless, there is a clear solution to this problem, as simple as hiring a private company to inspect these businesses and to make suggestions where necessary. Although it seems like a simple solution, additional considerations should be made where countries do not have a trustworthy law enforcement agency.

prompt: Some say that is more important for employers to consider academic qualifications rather than personal experience and values when hiring an employee. Do you agree or disagree? What are positive and negative aspect of the issue?
essay: It is vivid that educated and specialists persons are more attractive and suitable for employers than others. But, there is an issue that which academic competence or personal life style is more valuable for hiring an employee, as both have pros and cons. These advantages and drawbacks will be investigated before a reasoned conclusion is drawn. Ċ On the one side, some crowds have all been the idea that the capability of employees should be valued by their academic qualifications when anointing them. They suppose that it could be provide a standard comparison between volunteers for the hiring. In addition, personal life understanding cannot measure in a form of short time interview. They believe if an individual has educational evidence, he/she would have its profession, immediately, and despite of that if a human has only a profession maybe she/he does not have its academic supplements. Ċ On another side, there are some populations who mention the experience in the human life is more justice criterion than college certificates. In their opinion, in many cases the property situation plays the main role in gaining academic certification. Some people because of their financial situation cannot continue their education, despite of their capabilities, and it is far from humanity the employers ignore their skills and life experiences. Ċ In addition, some humans have been educated only by force and do not have any proficiency in their fields of study. Ċ To sum up, following the analysis of both points of view, as far as I am concerned maybe proficiency is more crucial to consider while hiring than academic qualification, because of its reliability.

prompt: You should spend about 40 minutes on this task. Ċ Write about the following topic. Ċ Pollution of rivers, lakes and seas is a major concern for people who seek to protect the environment. Ċ What are the possible causes of water pollution, and what effects does this have on animal life and human society? Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. Ċ You should write at least 254 words.
essay: It is believed that the environmental protectors are alarmed concerning the overwhelming increased environmental pollution on streams, ponds and the oceans. I believe that environmental contamination brings adverse effects on aquatic wildlife and human social lives. This essay will shed light on the motives and their consequences providing evidence to prove the arguments. Ċ There are manifold causes for water contagion throughout the world. First and foremost, the scarcity of environmental regulations. In other words, the world has stricter laws to punish the factors and individuals who dispose of their waste in these natural environments. Yet the shortfall in controlling them makes these ecosystems vulnerable. Let us take, African nations as an example, the recent research from Unizambeze University pointed out that 70% of factors deposited their disposal materials in the near pond without any pre-treatment . As a result, the local naval ecosystem died, causing any alarming environmental pollution. Ċ Secondly, the sea poisoning vanished the local species. Because of grimed water coastal wildlife is under threat, it irradicated the majority of them such as birds, dolphins, whales, seals. For instance, the scientific investigation carried out by Oxford University last year, showcased that the seas and rivers epidemic vanished roughly 5000 aquatic specimens. Hence, human beings social lives are affected. Moreover, the men overdependence on fish and lamb will affect the human lifestyle in the near future. Ċ In conclusion, the rising in deep-sea ecosystem corruption is caused by human activities, especially the garbage from energy power plants, machinery factories, and other sources. It has undoubtedly adverse side effects on the local ecosystems and men life. Therefore urgent people's action is needed so that the remained species could survive and men life enhanced.

prompt: In many countries, more and more young people are leaving school and unable to find jobs after graduation. What problems do you think youth unemployment will cause to the individual and the society? Give reasons and make some suggestions.
essay: In contemporary society, increasing number of youths is exposed to unemployment, especially to those fresh graduates who burden much expectation by their parents and public. Ċ This thorny issue arouses the concern of the whole society since it affects the future of a society or even a nation. Ċ Originally, most students after graduating from universities or colleges can hunt decent jobs, but this is not the case now. Numerous employing entities, conversely, shut the door to graduates. For this abnormal phenomenon, there are many causes. First, a great many of older staff have not gotten the retirement age; therefore the young students cannot replace their positions. Second, population problem lead to the result that graduates outnumber positions. As a result, many graduates complete one position which mere is a work for an ordinary work. Final, there is not a suitable link between university and workplace. As a matter of fact, when students graduate from universities, most of them have not any practice experience, while it lead to companies cannot employ suitable individuals. Ċ Meanwhile, there also have some solutions to this thorny problem. On one hand, universities should immediately optimize their curriculums in order to supplying the demanding of student and workplace respectively. On the other hand, governments should encourage graduates become self-employed by fund and offering training free of charge. More importantly, companies should afford the opportunities for those youth unemployed, which is also a responsible to the whole society. Ċ In summary, I personally believe that, governments, companies and universities should cooperate together to deal with this severe issue. Likewise, students should improve their own skills, so as to avoid unemployment.

prompt: It has been proposed that citizens should only consume food and drink products that have been produced in their own countries. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The idea of consuming local food and beverage products from host countries because they correspond to local taste preferences. However, this resulting a scarcity of the foreign investors, particularly in food industry. Ċ The Citizen should eat local meal and drink because it is more suitable in taste than import it, thus it is necessary for residents to create their own food. Not only do they miss their family and home, but if they reside overseas, they also tend to make or find their own cuisine. In Singapore, there is community for Indians, and they eat and sell Indian food there like Makhani (butter chicken) and Chole (chickpea curry) because there will always be a meaningful for local cuisine. Ċ On the other hand, attracting international investors in the food business is quite difficult since they are constrained by rules that require them to consume only local food and beverages. What is the significance of this investment? if the number of customers is small, multinational restaurants such as KFC, Burger King, and Starbuck will not grow their company in a country that mostly citizens do not appreciate foreign cuisine. Finally, a reduction in the cost of capital for external investors has the effect to decrease wages and economic income, especially in food industry sector. Ċ In conclusion, I strongly believed that Investment in food sector is required to boost the national economy, so citizens need to consume other food than what they produced. It is suggested that local food is still sold in greater quantities than international food in supermarket, since more and more residents prefer consume large amounts of local food.

prompt: In many countries, people decide to have a child at a later age. Ċ Why is this? Do the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: Nowadays, it is suggested that a couple should have children at a later age. This essay will elucidate the reasons for this and although there are several drawbacks, they are dwarfed by the benefits. Ċ To start with, people choose to have children later because either they want to have a more stable financial status or to learn more skills of teaching a child. Firstly, thinking of having a child after some years of marriage would give them more time to focus on their career. Accordingly, they would accumulate more money, thereby spending them on better growing environments such as kindergartens or international primary schools. Secondly, these parents could also learn about how to teach a baby before having one. By acquiring certain knowledge in teaching their offsprings, they would be more confident when it comes to lecturing children. For instance, upbringing courses in Vietnam are increasing considerably to educate future parents about those skills before having sons or daughters. Ċ On the other hand, this could entail two disadvantages, namely the over-concentration on work and genetic disorders. Because the age from 35 to 40 is said to be the best time to make money and develop career paths, many parents have focused more on their jobs and hence their less care for their children. In fact, this has resulted in numerous arguments and divorces in many families, especially in Asian countries, where work is prioritized rather than children. Another demerit is that having a baby late would give rise to more chance of genetic disorders, in this case the Down syndrome. Research has shown that women after the age of 35 would be more likely to reproduce an infant with Down syndrome. This syndrome terribly affects on a child's life and all people suffer from it cannot live past sixteen years old. Ċ In conclusion, better financial status and background of upbringing are the reasons for this and because nowadays people are more caring about their offsprings the disadvantages much pale in comparison to the advantages.

prompt: Some people consider thinking about and planning for the future to be a waste of time. They argue that people should live in the moment. Do you agree or disagree
essay: It is considered by some people that further planning and thinking about the future is just a vain attempt and people ought to spend their life fully at the moment. I disagree with this notion and believe that planning and thinking are beneficial in terms of getting success and confronting plights in the forthcoming future. Ċ Firstly, the major positive factor in the favour of future plannings and considerations is that individuals can achieve success in their life. In other words, the level of competition is burgeoning at an alarming rate and to cope up with this, individuals need to make some strategies beforehand. For instance, if a person wants to run a business, he has to design some plans to reach the pinnacle by accomplishing their goals and targets at delivered timings. Therefore, masses can get name and fame through their action plans along with rational thinking. Ċ Secondly, the masses may face immense menaces in their life without pre considering their objectives and targets. To be more precise with, if one is not mentally prepared regarding the future challenges then there would be more chances to receive the worst consequences as well as failures in subsequent years. According to a survey, 70% of people manage to deal with the hurdles of every aspect of their lifespan by merely doing the organisation and arrangements. Ultimately, planned actions could be more fruitful for better survival rather the happiness of a single moment. Ċ In conclusion, I think that preprepared programs are lucrative in attaining the prosperity and quite helpful in facilitating the individuals with the ability to tackle with the hard circumstances of life instead of simply live the present moment for the sake of temporary happiness.

prompt: Some people agree that teachers should be strict with their students; others believe that teachers with friendly approach will achieve better results. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Teacher and student's relationship has always been in questions. At one side, there are the people who speak in the favour of a friendly approach of teaching the students whereas on the other side, some people believe that teachers must be strict and should not tolerate any negligence from the students. In rest of the essay, I shall analyse both sides of the arguments and present my opinion based on that. Ċ The commenters who prefer the strict approach of teaching for students often reason with the nature of human. They strongly believe that in order to teach something one has to impose the rules and majority of humans do not follow it until they are being strictly forced to act on it. For example, talking about students if teachers do not set deadline on the classwork or assignments, no student would do it. Moreover, the strict behaviour of a teacher causes the student to complete their work with attention. According to the people, strictness of a teacher is a key towards making the student valuable. Ċ On the other hand, however, the people who prefer teacher's lenience over strictness for students provide the reason of better learning in friendly environment. They believe that humans understand the language of love. The unnecessary strictness may divert a student's mind towards negative things. They argue that students learn more efficiently and quickly when they are not subjected under stress. A teacher's light and good sense of humour may help a student to learn even the most difficult parts of the subject. Furthermore, students feel more comfortable to the teachers. As a result, they ask questions without hesitation. Ċ To summarise, I believe that a mixed approach should be followed as both approaches are correct to a certain level.

prompt: Children today have more responsibilities than the past. Some people think it has positive effects than negative ones while others disagree. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: While it is often argued by some people that youngsters are more responsible in the current era, whereas others take the view that many young people are more attentive in the old days. My opinion is that it is better to hold much responsibility nowadays. Ċ On one side of the argument, there are people who hold the opinion that children grow with less responsibility. The major reason for believing this is that laziness. This is due to they spend more time with social media such as Facebook, Twitter and Tumbler. Furthermore, it urges them to check their cell phone frequently and this leads to lack of helping others. Another reason is that children's are really careless when they do daily activities For example, a child aged between 8 to 12 years are less attentive in their work. Ċ Despite the above arguments, I hold the position that young people are more responsible. Indeed, one reason why I take this position is that they are focused in the field of education. Since the education system in the modern era is highly competitive and they were facing many difficulties to study. However, it is my opinion that kids show respect to their elders in the family. To illustrate, the New York Times publishes an article about the responsibilities of children at a young age which surge from the year 2019 to 2020.As a result, the bonding between both are very strong and brings more happiness in the family. Ċ In conclusion, while both views are commonly held in society, I believe that youngsters show more responsibility. This is because education is most important and in addition to family bonding. Given this situation, it is recommended that the government around the world should think about implementing this form of encouragement through online media.

prompt: Some people say it is OK to use animals for our benefit, others say it is not good to exploit them. Discuss both points of view and give your opinion. Animals should serve the people
essay: Some individual believe that human should use animal for their personal benefit while other argues that this is a bad practice. This essay will discuss the both aspects of the argument. In my opinion, this is necessary to use animal for the scientific and security purpose other than this they should be allowed to live freely. Ċ One the one hand those who do not support animal exploitation is a good practice might argue that all animals are living being they should also have the liberty to live their life. The reason for this is people exploiting them dreadfully, they killing and eating them. For instance, In recent survey of New York time it is claimed that Beef eating has increased from 10 to 20% compared to last year analysis. Therefore, it is not a good idea to utilize them for human benefits. Ċ On the other hand, people who support utilization of animals might support the idea that it is for the betterment of society, scientist do have to perform the experiments and for this, animals are the best object. For example, all the medicines first tried and tested on animals and then on successful completion of experiment, these medicines get approval for the consumption of humans. As a result of this, animals are necessary for the new invention and improvement in medical facilities. Ċ In conclusion, although animals can be utilized for the scientific experiments and medical test, In my opinion, there is no deny in the fact that animals should to be exploited for the consumption of human beings.

prompt: Cohabitation is believed to bring huge advantages for young people since it enables them to fully understand each other before deciding to get married. Do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay: There is no doubt that living together is ,currently, so popular among youngsters. It is considered that by doing this the couple would get a better understanding of their partner. I completely agree with the statement because they can realise how compactable and realistic they are. Ċ Firstly, it is significant to know the compatibility between the potential couple. This is because the decision of getting married has a long impact on both individuals, this is expensive, involving other family members, friends and colleagues. For example, in many European countries,it is common to live together before the actual wedding takes place. Therefore, if anyone in the relationship feels that they cannot continue further, they can move apart without involving any legal case. Ċ Secondly, by staying for a long time under the same roof allows them to earn individual differences. This is crucial in a relationship, especially in marriage, otherwise, this can lead conflict in the latter part of life. There are many other factors, for instance, trust, mutual understanding and couple goals are must be matched perfectly. These all learning process can be taken during the stay, eventually, either they can proceed with the same person or leave away. Ċ In conclusion, Some people think that it is better to cohabit before getting married as this allows them to fully understand . I personally support this belief as which gives a clear picture of another individual, based this they could decide about the future. It is highly recommended to think twice before making choices.

prompt: Many of today's most urgent problems can only be solved through international cooperation. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Global collaboration can alleviate timely problems. In this essay, I will be discussing the reasons why I strongly agree that difficulties, which include the pandemic brought by the COVID-19 virus as well as depletion of resources, can be solved if the different countries cooperate with one another. Ċ A major reason is international partnerships can restore the balance in relationships. For example, the world is still continuously facing the struggles of the COVID-19 pandemic, even though there are already numerous vaccines made available. If developed countries donate these vaccines, the world could eventually reach the desired herd immunity at a faster rate. Consequently, bans and restrictions will be lifted and will make way for international travel once again. Ċ In addition, the separation between social statuses can be lessened resulting in the absence of dominance. For instance, there is an abundance of fish and other seafood in the Philippines because of its archipelagic state whereas oil reserves are difficult to obtain. On the other hand, the Middle East is a popular source of oil. If these nations communicate well, they will be able to distribute and eventually outsource their needs. It will be advantageous not only to the government but also to the locals who would benefit from the availability of the resources. Furthermore, there will be an equal distribution of resources. Ċ In conclusion, major dilemmas can be solved through worldwide cooperation. I strongly believe that these can not only make way for proper communication but also make people treat everyone equally.

prompt: Some people believe that the responsibility for the protection of the environment is by a transnational organization, rather than by each individual country. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In this day and age, environmental preservation is one of the most concerning problems in the world. Although some people argue that the duty of environmental conservation belongs to transnational organizations, while the opposite side believes that each individual nation should take responsibility for this problem. In my opinion, I partly agree with this point of view. Ċ On the one hand, each individual nations are the one who takes responsibility for the duty of protecting the surroundings because it directly affects human well-being. In other words, the environment has been destructed by anthropogenic activities. Global warming is the case in point. Every year, global temperature has increased due to human activities such as industrial and agricultural activities in the past. As a result, conserving the habitat is a serious project which not only benefits humankind in the current generation but also for the future generation. Ċ On the other hand, I also believe that transnational organizations play an important role in calling citizens all around the world lending a hand to save the surroundings from danger. It is undeniable that international organizations have the power to raise countries’ awareness to keep environmental safety. For example, Earth Hour is an event created by the World Wildlife Organization, which encourages residents from all around the world to turn off light to save the habitat. Therefore, the more inhabitants protect the environment, the better the environment is. Ċ To sum up, it is critical to protect the setting, thus not only transnational organizations but also each individual countries need to be environmentally conscious.

prompt: children's life was different in the past. In many parts of the world, children's lives were very different from today. What do you think were the advantages and disadvantages of life for children in the past?
essay: The lives of childs in today's society are changing so much comparing in the past because the world has changed. In the past, there were both advantages and disadvantages of children's living standards. Ċ There were a number of benefits of living in the past for the children. Firstly, they were probably happier than today because they had a simple life and they did not suffer stress from their parents for the scores in School. Secondly, they had more time with friends and families. They could learn life skills from their siblings when they played together. In addition, the kids exposed to the natural environment very soon therefore, they seemed to close to nature. Ċ However, in my view, the children's lives in the past also had several important disadvantages. The living standard of the kids was affected by war and poverty. There were a lot of children who could not go to the school, which were the reason for illiteracy. They even did not have enough food so they had to work to earn money very soon. Child abuse situations were found in many companies in the past. The parents could not take care of each child and gave them the best living condition. Ċ All in all, I believe that the disadvantages of children's lives in the past were greater than the advantages. The children's way of life in the past was happier but they were not always able to get big benefits from it because the world of children today has many differences.

prompt: Recent advances in technology have led to significant changes in today's world. Discuss the positive and negative effects of these technological changes.
essay: Technology has become more and more important to human's life. Therefore, advance in technology has tremendous changes on today's world. This essay will discuss the effects of these changes, focusing on positive and negative impacts. Ċ Technology impacts today's world positively by two main ways. First, it makes life more convenient and easier. With the help of technology, many works for example household chores can be done without human. An article of Buzzel.com states that time are saving thanks to the help of machines which could learn and complete task efficiently. Besides that, advanced technology can finish works which are dangerous for human like mining. Second, technology causes several influences on human's entertainment. Before the appearance of technology, human's form of entertainment was poor, but today's world own an enormous source of entertain.
