Ċ On the other hand, some people strongly oppose the high earning of top directors. It is probably because ordinary workers execute main parts of job while director are less aware of operation. For example, in power plant, electrical engineer is main person for operation of generating electricity, not directors since engineer know day-to-day function of factory. Moreover, ordinary could be distinguished from directors by their less ambitious character. Thereby some people believe that high salary should be paid to ambitious, less responsibly and talkative directors. Ċ In the conclusion, I am convinced that it would be Fairless if director's salary is equal to simple workers. Their earning must be higher than others because their knowledge, skills, practice and reputation are significant parts of corporation's growth and future.

prompt: Most countries are compared by their economic success. Do you think there are some other important factors that need to be taken into consideration? Give your opinion and relevant examples
essay: Economic is consider one of most important factor in the classification of the countries, I think nobody can deny or refuse this idea , but the peoples have many view points about assuming this factor, is this the only one to compare or there are another factors ? Ċ In the first place, there are al lot of people believe economic must be the only thing to decide which countries is the best, because the economic has a power to change financial live for people by give them many opportunity for jobs, beside this economic can far away the problems of unemployment such like grime etc ,and the poor countries can be good example for this relationship between unemployment and grime. Ċ But in second place, another people believes there are another factors must be put side by side with economic , like freedom, education, healthy and comfortable live for people. as example for this idea the second economic in the world I mean China have not enough freedom and many people in prison because their opinions while the best country for live is the Norway, and this country not in first or second even third in arrangement economic countries. Ċ as a result , I think as we modern society we should look for new standards to choose which is the best country and this standard must have different factors like economic, freedom, education, healthy also pollution level , and result for these we can decide which country is the best ,also by this way we can push countries to do the best to them citizens.

prompt: Advertising is now becoming more popular in modern society. While some people believe this is a positive development, others see it as a negative one. Discuss both these views and give your opinion.
essay: It is claimed that advertising has a vital role in our daily life. While there are strong arguments against advertisements, I still believe that advertising is beneficial to consumerism in various ways. Ċ On the one hand, there are several drawbacks of ads that should not be underestimated. One major negative is that advertising manipulates people. For example, advertisement stimulates communityCorrect article usagethe communityIt seems that there is an article usage problem here. Ċ show examples for impulsive buying by providing different promotional offers that lead to buying goods without function. Ads also create an artificial want, which persuades individuals to seek for what they don't really need. But through advertising, some companies provide exaggerated and unrealistic reviews of their products so people are cheated by such marketing tricks. Moreover, it only highlights the positive characteristics of a product and tries to hide its negative aspects Ċ On the other hand, I would agree with those who believe that advertising could bring us many advantages. One of the main purposes is that advertising is a key part of modern business. Advertising is an effective way of spreading awareness among people about the use of new and existing products. For instance, if a cloth store offers a discount on its items, consumers will know the deal through billboards or TV ads. Furthermore, it enables the customers to compare a product with other competitive products available in the market so that they decide whether a product is worth buying or not. In addition, for busy citizens that do not have time for shopping, advertising will help them to make their minds.

prompt: Earlier, people wore cloths which were related to their culture but now people people wear the same type of cloths all over the world. Is this a positive or negative development?
essay: The globalization has had a predominant impact on the people’s lives; especially for their attires. In the past, the people were used to wear their conventional cloths influenced by their culture; while in globalized village, the diversity in costumes has been faded. Such enhancement in fashion is beneficial to the mankind and the supporting arguments are discussed further. Ċ To begin with, the most lucrative side of the common types of cloths is that the discrimination among the people based on cast, religion, colour, wealth and nationality has been faded. Such revolutionary practice plays a vital role to build harmony in the society, which is the most essential element for the sustainable development. For instance, in the eighteenth century the dress code of a layman was decided based on the social taboo and religion, which was the clear violation of the human right. Thus, by wearing similar attire all over the world, the people are representing the global culture of the developed society. Ċ Moreover, the similar dressing sense of the people make them more comfortable with each other. The traveller in abroad could interact with the native people with an ease, if they have some common factor between them such as an attire, then they feel quite familiar with the situations. For example, the tourist in India can easily indulge with the local people due to common attire. Although people wear their traditional clothes in festivals and marriage ceremony, for their own rigorous and social beliefs. Thus, the culture can be preserved with the development of the society by avoiding radical practices in routine life. Ċ In conclusion, the advancement in the human being has changed the dressing sense of an individual dramatically. This change in fashion is a first step towards the bonding between the people and the social equality. The society is not only benefited due this practice, but also the future generations will have fruitful results.

prompt: Task2:Some say that learning to play a music instrument is a waste of time, agree or disagree?
essay: The role of musicians has brought many arguments in a society. One topic of discussion is the amount of time spent on learning musical instruments. Many people claim that it is just a waste of time, I firmly oppose to this statement. In this essay we will be discussing how teaching oneself discipline and gaining self-confidence as a result of learning to play an instrument could be beneficial to an individual. Ċ Learning an instrument is not as easy as it sounds. A person needs commitment and dedication to be successful .Thus, discipline is a key requirement to achieve good results. For instance, learning a guitar cannot be accomplished overnight, it is essential to spend at least two hours daily for your practice. This shows that you have taught to discipline yourself in the aspect of time management. Ċ Being able to play an instrument makes you feel better about yourself and it gives you a sense of belongingness. An example is heard from stories of most talent show candidates like America's Got Talent. In real life they are struggling their way for survival and they feel unworthy of themselves. But once they are on stage playing an instrument, it is like living a dream for them. This makes them feel special about themselves and thus they have gained self-confidence. Ċ Both aspects shown above clearly proves that learning a musical instrument brings positive results to oneself. Therefore, it is unrightful to claim that time spent on practicing an instrument is wasted. In fact, it is considered as an investment for self-improvement.

prompt: The movement of people from agricultural areas to cities to work can cause serious problems in both places. What are the serious problems? What measures can be used to solve these problems?
essay: In recent years, more and more people are migrating from rural areas to cities. This trend has detrimental effects on both agricultural as well as urban areas. This essay will discuss the problems associated with the movement of people and simultaneously suggest some measures to deal with the issues. Ċ To begin with, the relocation of people is having an adverse effect on both villages as well as cities. People moving out from crossroads is disturbing the agri-economy. This is causing a shortage of labour in agricultural fields, thus, affecting decreasing the agri-output of the country. Another problem associated with this migration is the degradation of natural resources. This is because land and water are overused as a result of a large number of people moving into the city. To illustrate, water quality in metropolitan cities like Toronto is reduced by 20% in the last few years. Therefore, the movement of people from small towns to developed areas is disadvantageous for both places. Ċ While the problems may seem intractable, there are measures that can be adapted to control them. Firstly, the reason for this migration is the job opportunities available in urban areas. Therefore, by providing equal job openings in the under-developed area can keep a check on this resettlement of individuals. For instance, the government can allocate subsidies to the industries to settle their plants in rural places and thus generating a job bank. Secondly, the development of public infrastructures like transport, shopping complexes, and health facilities could also refrain the people from moving. Ċ In conclusion, the migration of people is a complex problem to solve. This essay discussed a few of the drawbacks of this on the economy as well as natural resources. While issues are evidently clear, there are measures that can be taken to alleviate them.

prompt: Reducing global environment damage should be handled by governments rather than individuals. To what extent do you agree or disagree? responsibility for Reducing global environment damage
essay: Global environment is considered one of the most pressing problems of the 21st century. While some people believe that authorities have a paramount role to play in minimizing green issue . Even though, I strongly agree that the damage to the environment ought to be tackled by individual's attempt Ċ Firstly, the governments could make more attempts to reduce environmental damage. They can run factories and industries by introducing laws to limit the amount of emissions, so it will help to maintain and balance the ecological system . Moreover, authorities should take place "green campaign" programme for the purpose of raising awareness of our energy use . For example, Earth Hour is an annual global campaign that encourages people around the world to reduce global environmental hazards by switching off for at least one hour. Ċ On the other hand, nobody can deny the roles of individuals in the environmental protection process. The uncontrolled use of automobiles can caused global warming because it releases a wide range of polluted gases. Therefore, people can reduce harmful habits into environment by taking public transport instead of private cars. Furthermore, the citizens should join hands to deal with these issues by sorting the daily garbage , enhancing environmental awareness tree planting to yield a healthier atmosphere. Ċ In conclusion, if citizens do not to try to raise awareness of environment protection, we will give severe consequences. However, fully address the threat of global environmental damage; we must need a comprehensive combination of the government and individual.

prompt: Some people prefer activities and lifestyles in hot climates while others prefer living in cold climates. Ċ Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Some would argue that warm and sunny weather is better for living, while others believe that cold climate is perfect for doing activities and lifestyle. Although the freezing season produces different types of green vegetables which are beneficial for health, I personally believe that the summertime brings out the best of living because humans have emotions. Ċ On the one hand, winter is one of the best seasons when new vegetables and fruits grow tremendously. At this time healthy, leafy green vegetables such as broccoli, cauliflower, beans, and carrots become cheaper and poor people can effort them easily. Hence, This reduces the risk of becoming malnourished for nations. For example, in Bangladesh, in the winter season, farmers grow potatoes, broccoli, lemons, carrots and tomatoes and the price is almost ninety per cent less compared to the market value in other seasons. However, I personally think that cold,foggy and hazy environments do not bring the bright side of the human mood. Ċ On the other hand, whilst in the summer season individuals suffer from extreme sweating and use air conditioning, this time gives the best emotional state. On bright sunny days individuals do not need to stay inside, they can work out outside and can have a family picnic somewhere on a lovely beach. For instance, it has been seen that the number of visitors to the world largest sea beach Cox's Bazar is higher just after the winter and it show that people love to break the monotonous life of the cold period.Therefore, I am convinced that everybody wants to move freely and become active with their family members on a beautiful hot blue sunny day. Ċ In conclusion, a bright sunny day brings the best psychological sides of humans, while freezing haze produces healthy food and it is, thus, I choose hot weather to cold.

prompt: Many people believe that exploiting animals by humans unethical. However, another group of people think that to satisfy needs such as food & research is acceptable Ċ Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: Since the inception of life on earth, human beings have been utilizing animals to meet their requirements and this has been a controversial topic. Whilst some opine that it is immoral to do so, I would completely agree with those who deem that this approach is acceptable. This essay will discuss both sides, and explain my belief that it is completely justifiable to use animals. Ċ On one side, it is injustice to animals as their life is considered to be of less importance over human. In contrast, in many religions such as Hindu, and Buddhism animals are considered to be God because they are not things instead beings who can feel, touch and see. To exemplify, they can feel pain when medical experiments are conducted on them unsuccessfully and eventually could die of life-threatening diseases. Risking non-human life to benefit from it should not be permissible. Ċ Nevertheless, it is vital to deploy animals for human requirements of lab experiments and food resources. People could die early from illness, if animals were not used in scientific experiments to find the effective cures as there are no alternatives. Moreover, some animal products, for instance, milk does not harm animals, but are crucial for survival of human civilization. Consequently, it is imperative to depend on animals for health and diet reasons otherwise individuals would suffer and starve so it is worth the price paid. Ċ In conclusion, even though some think animals should not be eaten or used by researchers and considered equal to mankind, I completely concur with those who believe that animals are quintessential to satiate numerous societal needs. However, it should be permissible as long as animals are not tortured for entertainment and in unavoidable circumstances.

prompt: Topic: Some people think that government should spend money on other important subjects rather helping artists. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Nowadays, in order to save as much budget as possible and improve the economy of the country, every government around the world is seeking for some ways to spend wisely. Therefore, there is a suggestion that governments should not continue to fund the artists, but they ought to spend money on other necessary subjects such as medical research and space. In my view, I firmly disagree with this recommendation due to several reasons. Ċ The main reason why I believe artists should be funded is because art helps to improve the quality of our lives as well as attracting tourists. For example, monuments that represent each city do not only illustrate the city's history and culture, but also make the city more beautiful and an attractive place for tourists. In fact, some countries depend on tourism as their main source of revenue, thus, the governments should help arts because their work crafts are very necessary to boost the tourist industry. Ċ In addition, sculptures and paintings in the museums and art galleries generally reflect the culture and civilization of every generation. Therefore, culture and history of a country can be reserved and assured by art. Young people are also able to get more knowledge about their country's history and culture by observing various work crafts. Ċ Another reason why artists should be helped is because talent in art is extremely precious and should not be wasted. Indeed, not many people are blessed in the talent of paintings and work crafts. Hence, this type of talent has to be valued as other types of talents such as talent in science or literature. Ċ To sum up, art is a very valuable object for every country and the talent in this area cannot be discovered everywhere, so I think governments should help and encourage artists to continue their work.

prompt: Courses and general online study have recently become very popular. However, some people still prefer to attend classes in person. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: These days, a large number of people prefer to attend classes online rather than physically. However, there are still certain individuals who think that it is always better to take classes in person. I strongly believe that classes taken on the internet can bring numerous benefits to the masses. This essay will light shed on both sides and outline my view. Ċ On the one hand, it is irrefutable that online classes are inexpensive and convenient which one can take any time or from anywhere in the world. Also, these classes are recorded and one can repeat those lectures infinite times without any hassle. Besides, people can share content with their relatives, friends, and colleagues. This way poor and rich students can get education easily. For example, a recent survey conducted by the New York Times, that reveals, the number of students has increased drastically in Virtual University which offers all the courses online to students. By contrast, it is very much likely that students might get stuck at some point where they need technical assistance which only can be provided by a teacher. Ċ On the other hand, in this modern era, it has become difficult for students to attend traditional classes due to many factors. First and foremost, schooling costs are increased dramatically in schools, colleges, and universities. This is because of the education demand and expenses at these institutes. Secondly, conventional classes are on fixed times. Thus, it is compulsory for students to attend classes on a pre-defined timetable. Last but not least, pupils have to leave their hometown and settle in other countries or cities to get higher education. As a result, they started living in hostels. For instance, according to the education department in Pakistan, academic institutes charge huge fees for accommodation. Ċ To conclude and present my opinion, technology has a great influence on society. Therefore, an increasing number of people are fascinated by online education. This is because it invites lots of advantages to individuals. Whereas the traditional method is too expensive and inconvenient.

prompt: Some people feel that boarding schools (where students or pupils live at school during the term) are an excellent option for children, while other people disagree for a number of reasons. Consider both sides of this debate and reach a conclusion. benefit from staying at school
essay: Some people argued that children will benefit from staying at school, especially in today's fast-changing world. However, the issue is not entirely genuine and other arguments can also be made against the idea. This essay will elaborate both sides of the opinion and provide a conclusion. Ċ Those who supported the boarding school mention various advantages can bring to students. These range from building independent skills to learning how to discipline themselves. For example, children will form surviving skill by living far away from their home, and not depend on their parents. In addition, if children lived closely with their teachers, it would form the intensive relationship between them. Ċ Another argument is students who stay in school during the term led to several drawbacks. The example can be seen in major cities, where the cost of boarding school may be prohibitive. In addition, living with family, children will form family closeness between children and parents. For example, the parents able to see and control their children after school, and communicate more with them. Finally, it must be said that not all young people want to go to boarding school, because they have their own preferences, and if we forced them, it would be negative for their future because of learning without passion. For these children, boarding school should not be the suitable option. Ċ In conclusion, it seems advisable that the decision to enroll our children in boarding school should be based on both children and parents preferences only. It would appear that boarding school will lead to several benefits in terms of independent skill yet it not the only one solution for all parents.

prompt: TOEFL: A teacher's ability to relate well with students is more important than excellent knowledge of the subject being taught.
essay: I think that must be a little of the two things in balance, an ability for the teacher to relate well with students and good knowledge of the subject being taught. Ċ The teacher's ability to relate well with students can be useful when it focus on the course. And in both sides -teacher-student- must be some special qualities: teacher must be prepared in major of his topics and students must be eager, interested and responsible on classes. Then the relationship between a prepared teacher and an interested student can improve the dynamic of learning. Also if the student is participatory and have previous knowledge on class, he will be able to enrich the lectures or discussion, and encourage the teacher for going on. In this manner will probably exist empathy towards the course. Ċ However, this relationship can't always set and delve whereas for the teacher is a job and an obligation for the student, both working around the school interest. And as the matter of fact, exist an analogy of this relationship in game theory called ecology of the classroom, where a mathematical model of competition or predator-prey can be implemented in this dynamic. It should be mentioned that the teacher needs not only have an excellent knowledge of the subject being taught but also this knowledge must be part of their life, that leads to inspired curiosity and interest when attack the class problems. Ċ In conclusion we can say that both qualities (relate well with students and a good knowledge of the subject being taught) of the teacher are necessary insofar that exist respect, interest and balance from students and all focus on the subject to teach.

prompt: Some high school leavers think that they should work or travel for a period of time instead of entering university. To what extent do you agree or disagree with that. Write at least 250 words. Gap year for high school graduates
essay: It is naturally observed that some high school graduates think they should spend a certain amount of time working or traveling before going straight to the university. In reality, there is a greater liking for a gap time among students who intend it for multiple purposes. However, from my perspective, this route serves its both advantages and disadvantages. Ċ On the one hand, working and traveling would give the students a great opportunity to gain invaluable experience. First, they can mount some campaigns and raise funds to financially support the livings of the poor and elderly. Second, young adults will not only run into many kinds of people but also enlarge our relationship networks. And therefore, I personally believe this can be the deciding factor in equiping seniors with essential skills to manage people in our future career. Last, they are more likely to secure a decent job and help strengthen our community. Ċ On the other hand, not everyone thinks traveling from one place to another for a while suits them. As a matter of fact, some can not afford, for example, the plane tickets, food and accommodation while others are scared of taking risks. Many high school leavers may consider working in gap time simply as a means of earning money more quickly but that makes them less competitive compared with their peers. Consequently, it might be easier for them fall behind of the game when they apply for a position in the future. Ċ In conclusion, taking a gap year between high school and university for work or travel will be of immediate benefit providing that would-be undergraduates may accumulate experience and learn more about themselves to be certain of what next step would be towards the future success.

prompt: high number of rare or endangered species many species of animals and plants are in danger of becoming extinct. what are the causes of this problem, and what can be done to prevent it from happening?
essay: It is true that numerous plants and animals are becoming rare or endangered progressively with the pace of human society's growth and development. The disappearance of flora and fauna is alarming which results in imbalanced ecosystem. Once this system is disrupted it leads to disorder in the ecological food chain that effects every living creatures in it. For example, vultures are the scavengers that helps in maintaining hygiene of the wild life by consuming the dead bodies, which, otherwise would be infested by deadly bacteria, further leading to disease in other wild animals possibly. Ċ In order to find some effective solution to this serious issue, identification of the causes is necessary. To point out, there are three main reasons. Firstly, deforestation in the name of settlement expansion or trade of timbers that leads to destruction of animal and plant life. Secondly, trade of animal skin or rare plants that have medicinal value. Lastly, marine activities like over fishing. Ċ Needless to say that extinction of animal or plant species have adverse effect in the ecological order, possible measures needs to be taken to prevent or protect the endangered species. In regards to deforestation, council or state authorities should monitor this and punish if there is any fraudulent involvement of timber business. Considering the illegal trade of animal parts like leather boots, purse, and belts should be strictly prohibited from entering into the fashion industry. Other way of dealing with the issue also could be not using such materials. As far as marine activities are concerned, strict legal fishing limit should be maintained which then should be strictly monitored. Ċ Considering the causes of the problem, if the suggestion possible remedies are implemented than, world can be a better place to live with well-maintained ecology. As a result, this world will be like heaven with presence of varieties of flora and fauna.

prompt: Some people think that family is the most important influence on young adults. Other people Ċ think that friends are the most important influence on young adults. Which view do you agree with? Use examples to support your opinion. Ċ You should write at least 250 words.
essay: A number of people advocate that family has the most profound impact on adolescents. Others, however, claim the opposite, stating that friends outdo family members in this contribution. From my perspective, I voice approval of the latter, in that I believe peers play an indispensable role throughout one's stage of maturity. Ċ In the first place, it is undeniable that fellows generally come in closer contact with the young than do their parents or siblings. In other words, by spending most of their day at school, teenagers embrace the opportunities to get along with their schoolmates, thus fostering mutual trust and intimacy among them over time. Hence, their personality shapes under the influence of their friends, at the same time reflects whether or not it is a healthy friendship. For instance, a large number of juvenile delinquents are talked into committing crimes or taking drugs by bad companies, while the morally good ones flourish by gaining huge benefits from peer support and guidance. Ċ What is more, there exist many other reasons for the close bond between young adults and their companions on a variety of grounds. That is, those in the same age bracket tend to develop a sense of empathy when it comes to sharing or seeking advice from each other, which would not be the same for the relationship between adolescents and parents, which is sometimes hindered by the generation gap. Take, for example, the case for many teen Facebook users is that they are inclined to befriend their companions, while on the other hand ban their parents from following them. This could be hazardous at times as teenagers would easily go out of control. Ċ All things considered, fellows have proved their worth in having a significant influence on one's growth, be it mental or physical. Therefore, I am supportive of the latter, consequently placing emphasis on having trustworthy and true friends.

prompt: Over-reliance on modern technology means that people are failing to learn, or are forgetting many basic skills. To what extent this is true? Are people becoming so reliant on modern technology that they are no longer able to do some things without it?
essay: In the modern era, most people cannot get rid of technology. This brings effects to several inhabitants who they fail in the basic skills since they feel be easy with sophisticated device. While, this is true, I strongly believe that the technology can improve the skills of people. Yet, all depend on their personality. Ċ Technology is more likely to intervene in humans' problems. In this case, they feel comfortable if they can correlate to. Yet, this can lessen the capability of people who still in the first studying. As example, juveniles who still in processing to study mathematic, and they use calculator for helping them solve the math questions. This is a severe action because actually citizens cannot blame the calculator as the main issue formation of fundamental skills. In order to, the superintendence of elderly people is vital. Ċ Nevertheless, individuals use technology for solving their assignments. This is caused they state that technology has been a part of their necessity. But, in fact this statement is reverse. A recent study by Stanford University illustrates that average human being always check their smartphone every 6 minutes and they prefer to access it than sleep. This affects to the time for studying which they tend to be more focus on their entertainment. They should be able to separate the time between learning and playing. Ċ The aforementioned evidence reveals that technology has spread in all aspects even in the education. On the other hand, I reckon this is not threaten to the elementary skills. Indeed, they can improve their abilities and insight with sophisticated devices.

prompt: IELTS Writing task 2: "Nowadays travelling aborad is more convenient and cheap than ever. Do you think this is a good or bad development?
essay: In the past there were no so many opportunities for our ancestors to see foreign countries, because at first, it costed a lot of mayne and at second it was very hard , for instance, for health, to travel around the world. But these days it has became more convenient. To my mind this aspect has both good and bad sides. Ċ Firstly, I'd mention that person may get more versatile by travelling around the world. He learns new language, he makes acquaintances with new people , he sees a lot of monuments of culture - all of these make him become more erudite and smart. Furthermore, some countries have curative beaches or very good clinics, so that if you can't be given good healing in your country, it wouldn't cost for you much many to go abroad (but of course healing itself may be very pricy). Ċ But there are also bad effects of it on our society. For example, some rich people let their children go abroad and do there anyhing they want. There can be some very bad consequences , and the one I'd like to highlight is high possibility of joining bad company and taking bad experience from it. Because of this reason young folk may get worse and then after coming back to homeland , it may teach to other youngs bad ways of behaving. Ċ To sum up, I reckon that travelling aborad is very useful for people , trying to get more versatile and smart, besides there is a high likelihood of taking bad experience and bringing it back to fatherland

prompt: Some people think that schools do not do enough to teach young people about how to look after their health. To what extent do you agree or disagree
essay: People are considered to think that during studying at a school pupils do not get enough information on how to take care of their health. In my view, it seems to be false, because there are schools where well-qualified teachers learn looking after the health as well as solving mathematical problems. In addition, school education consists of various subjects which help to understand how a human being's organism is working. Ċ As soon as teachers are improving their pedagogical qualifications, they will study how to cope with basic life issues including being healthy. At first, the teacher is not only a person who teaches defined the subject. Actually, the teacher is the second parent who brings up pupils and educates them. For this reason, many modern schools oblige employees to take some courses which are about treating common diseases, for instance, treat sore throat. Ċ Furthermore, knowledge about processes in a human's body leads to realizing how to be healthy. Consequently, biology is an important subject that allows students to be aware of how to preserve different diseases. For example, biology explains why it is significant to sleep about eight hours every day because our brain recovers energy at night due to the hormone melatonin. Thus, during biology classes, young people can understand how to be healthy. Ċ To summarize, teachers, who finished additional courses, provide pupils with all the necessary information about a healthy lifestyle. Lastly, school education includes biology that learn students how to protect their organisms from different viruses and diseases.

prompt: As a result of growth in some urban centres, the environment in those cities is deteriorating. Ċ How could this issue be tackled by both the government and individuals?
essay: Environmental damage has become a serious issue for the whole world. Many people present the view that as every person gets impacted by it, and thus, the government should tackle this. However, some believe that individuals should take up this responsibility. Ċ To commence with, the government needs to deal with the issue of environment because only it can establish the plants for the renewable and clean energy sources. These plants will help in reducing the consumption of fossil fuels, which release harmful gases as by-products, when used. For example, the ministry of Gujrat, India, have planted multiple windmills for production of electricity, which reduces the use of fuels such as coal. This initiative has decreased the rate of degradation of the environment there. Furthermore, the administration needs to encourage and spread awareness among people, about the use of such energy sources. Ċ On the other hand, people must own up the responsibility of taking measures, because they are the actual entities who can take actions. It is the people who must abide by the laws for the protection of the habitat. For instance, every nation in this world has the law of keeping a check on the emissions from the vehicles. But, if the individual does not act accordingly, then it is harming the habitat. Moreover, small contributions from the individuals such as: using the reusable cloth bags instead of plastic bags etc., can prove to be very helpful. Ċ To conclude, both the administration and individuals need to tackle this problem together. The government must make laws and provide with the equipment to protect the environment, and people must abide by these laws and try to use cleaner energy.

prompt: When talking about success, we often think of people who are rich or famous. Ċ In your opinion, what are the qualities that characterize a successful person? Why do you think these should be the criteria? Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: Some people think that success is related to either high-income people or public figures. From my perspective, I believe that self-discipline and level of education are the primary values to anyone who wants to be a successful person. This is because those qualities are the key to grab the attention of your clients and build trust with them. Ċ To begin with, I am an ardent supporter of the idea of self-commitment in order to elevate your business. The primary reason is that this trait is an indication to many customers that the company is willing to fulfil their future obligations. Extra stores, for instance, is an excellent example of after-sales customer care for most of their products, which resulted in increasing the sales volume. Another worth-mention point is that higher level of study of those businessmen. This is because not only tertiary schooling is reflecting the way of thinking, but also it is broadening the knowledge of the business stakeholders. Ċ Consequently, the personality values mentioned above will increase the market share dramatically. The reason is that many clients are attracted to those qualities, which indeed increases the sales force. Another contributing point to mention is that people with this such qualities will build long relations with their clients, and by the time, this will build confidence between both parties. Microsoft group, for example, is built by the world-richest man, Bill Gates, who has the most significant shares in this company, and thanks to his personality, the company becomes of the leading influences in the IT field. Ċ In conclusion, I hold the notion that the quality of education along with keeping promises, what makes people successful. This will lead to strengthening the relationship and build confidence with clients and companies.

prompt: Some believe that the Olympic games help bring people from different nations together, while others claim that holding the Olympics wastes money which could be used for important issues. Ċ Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
essay: In recent days, the public has had various different views about the importance of the Olympic games event held annually by certain countries. Some groups of people think that the Olympic games are a means of bringing peace for many nations, while some others think that it is merely a wasting activity, and there are still many parts of human life that should be improved. The following paragraph will discuss both views, and convey my personal thought which I think money should be spent on other sectors, not on holding the event. Ċ On the one hand, for some individuals, there are some reasons why the Olympic Games could bring peace among nations in the world. Firstly, the Olympic Games are a vast affair participated by most of the countries in the world. This occasion gives space to the fella states to meet and commence communication. Secondly, this situation has been believed to provide numerous opportunities for each nation to meet and talk. For instance, prior to the games or the competitions started by the host country, all athletics are gathered in a hall to have dinner together. This moment is normally used by them to talk and have some communication to understand one another among participants. Therefore, it is believed it could unite different regions. Ċ However, other groups of populations think that this event is considered wasting money, whereas other parts of life should be put as a priority. The main reason behind this is that frequently there are still countries that participate in the competition, are still categorised as poor states. The worse condition is when a country should be hosting the affair. For example, according to a report, reported by BBC News 2020, Indonesia spent 40% of the annual income which is from the taxation allocated to succeed the event, whereas, a number of regions in Indonesia are still suffering from hunger. Thus, this affair does not bring benefit to the local people, yet this leads to poorer conditions. Ċ In conclusion, while several people argue that Olympic games are deemed beneficial which could bring distinct nations together, others believe that this is merely wasting numerous amounts of money. Both sides have their own opinions. I personally agree with the latter argument that this is merely wasting of funds.

prompt: Many people believe that film is a less important art than other forms such as literature and painting. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Movies are considered less significant as compared to other types of arts like literature and painting. I totally condemn the idea of giving less importance to films. In further, I will explain the cause of disagreement with the above statement and why movies should be given more attention. Ċ I firmly believe that there are many skills that are involved in making films. However, there are some people that still consider it of less value. Writing a good script is an art that contributes to the making of a movie. Moreover ,there are many artist that put their role in filmmaking. These all contributions of arts and artists result in a superhit film that we enjoy watching in the cinemas. For example, in many Hollywood picture nowadays there is the animation that portraits the whole scenes of a motion picture in a beautiful manner that they made the unreal and imaginative into a real image. These artists are visual painters that bring imaginations into moving virtual images. Ċ The film gives better entertainment in less time as compared to the composition, painting and other arts. Moreover, they are a good source of time passing, that can be watched anywhere and at any time. There are many institutes and universities that provide degrees in filmmaking. For instance, the first filmmaking institute started in 1919 in Moscow, after which it became a significant art that has been taught worldwide. It brings me to my point that with changing demands and interests of people the films and movies are getting more attention. Ċ All in all, the film was considered as of less value as compared to other arts like literature and painting by many people. Whereas, I totally condemn this idea, as I consider the movie as of more consequence in nowadays than any other form of art, because the picture itself is the combination of arts like literature, songs, acting, animation and much more.

prompt: Important truths begin as outrageous, or at least uncomfortable, attacks upon the accepted wisdom of the time. the painful truth
essay: As a human being, we have a tendency to avoid truth because most of the time truth is appalling and it has a history attacking the accepted wisdom. Truth as it seems so simple but it has a deep and convoluted meaning hidden in it. Truth is never mollifying, it always causes a deep turmoil in an individual. As time passes, an individual unravels more about truth and it gets acerbic with time. Ċ To illustrate let us look at an example, there are many famous theories on the existence of nasal lines. These are the lines which can only be seen from universe and it was made 2000 years ago. There is this one famous theory which claims that these lines was developed by aliens so that they can see these lines from universe and land there. As we go deep in these theories we will unravel bit by bit small truth about these line and which is outrageous and not comforting. Ċ As a human being, we have a predilection to not hear acerbic truth, because it make us uncomfortable. We try to escape from the truth and when we confront them in future it is pretty obvious we will be outrageous. Ċ In addition, important truth is not always outrageous and attacks upon the accepted wisdom. Sometime, they support the experience and make us feel good about the truth. Ċ In conclusion, most of the time truth is caustic and unpleasant to hear, but it is important, for our development, to have better understanding of right conscience of right and wrong. Escaping from truth is inevitable and one should not avoid truth just for his comfort, no matter how much uncomfortable truth is one must accept it.

prompt: Countries should restrict foreign companies from opening offices and factories in order to protect local businesses. Do you agree or disagree? Give reasons and specific examples to explain your answer
essay: It is argued that to protect domestic businesses, countries should limit the number of multinational companies. However, I completely disagree with this point of view. Ċ On the one hand, there are some reasons why foreign companies should be encouraged to open their branches in other nations. The first reason is the technological advantage. To put it another way, foreign companies will bring high technology to the host countries which saves time for local companies to own it and leads to increased productivity. As an illustration, some Japanese firms which have a reputation for state-of-the-art technological innovations in the world are regularly invited to Viet Nam to build their new branches, which improve the quality of production. The second reason is having more opportunities to deal with international partners. In other words, developing countries have a chance to export their local productions to a wide range of industrialized corporations. As a result, local manufactures might enjoy supercharged economic growth. Ċ On the other hand, the local economy might benefit from receiving foreign investment in many ways. Firstly, when foreign companies open their branches and offices in a country, they help generate several jobs. This gives a boost to the local economy. For example, the Samsung corporation provides jobs for 10000 people in Vietnam in 2017, reported by a VNexpress. Secondly, the competition in the local market will be increased by the arrival of new companies. This will lead to the fact that the local companies have to price their products competitively. Furthermore, the tough competition will make the quality of products and services improved. Thus, foreign investment will bring benefits for not only the country but also the consumers. Ċ In conclusion, for the reasons I have mentioned above, I strongly believe that encouraging foreign companies will bring many benefits to the host countries such as receiving modern technologies, having potential dealers, creating more jobs, and improving the quality of products and services as well.

prompt: Some people advocate death penalty for those who committed violent crimes. Others say that capital punishment is unacceptable in contemporary society. Ċ Describe advantages and disadvantages of death penalty and give your opinion.
essay: Many people believe that the death penalty is necessary to keep the security system efficient in the society. While there are some negative aspects of capitalism retribution, I agree with the view that without it we will become more vulnerable to violence. Ċ Death penalties can be considered unsuitable discipline for several reasons. The strongest argument is that we have no rights to kill other humans. Right to live is the basic right of any human being, and no one can infringe this right, irrespective of the person’s deeds. Moreover, innocent people can face wrongful execution. Such unfair sentences take away the lives of innocent people and make other citizens lose faith in law and justice. And besides, sometimes criminals repent of their acts. In this case they should be given a second chance to improve themselves. Ċ However, I believe that capital forfeiture is necessary in the society. Firstly, it is an effective deterrent of major crimes. The best method to prevent a person from committing crime is to show the consequences of his or her actions. For example, the government of Pakistan has controlled the rate of terrorism by enforcing death penalties for the members of terrorist organisations. Secondly, the governments spend large sums of national budget on maintenance of prisoners. Instead, this money can be used for the development of the society and welfare of the people. Ċ To conclude, although capital retribution has some disadvantages, I think that it proves to be the best way of controlling criminals, lessening governmental expenses and preventing other people from doing crimes.

prompt: You should spend about 40 minutes on this task. Ċ Modern communications mean that it’s no longer necessary to write papers. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement? Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. Ċ You should write at least 250 words.
essay: How much it was annoying to wait for letters for months until they arrived at their destinations? It is the perfect time to end this era. Technology helped humanity to build a communication bridge between all countries where services are instant, efficient and time-reducing. Therefore, I strongly believe that new communications are more significant than pieces of paper because they are productive and eco friendly. Ċ First of all, recent methods to communicate proved their ability to manage time and increase the exchanges between several communities. In fact, we can write a message for our foreign relatives , our employers and our favourite shop in a few seconds, and it delivers quickly without any restrictions. Time and money are the most important elements in the business where international companies aim to use emails, online conferences and social advertisements as very powerful weapons in the market in order to develop their profits. For instance, Zoom and Outlook are considered to be the top internet platforms where persons can interact and access easily with their interests. Ċ Secondly, protecting the environment is a global concern for governments and organizations all around the world. We all know that writing on paper will cost our nature many of its resources and raw materials such as wood, leaves, plastic and even animals. A simple electronic mail will be sent using only a small current of electricity that is already supplying the machine like a mobile phone or a computer. Another issue will be in the ink in pens which it fabricating process usually is destructive for the other living species. Ċ To conclude, it is vital in recent times to use modern communication tools in order to facilitate our social. I hope we will suspect more development and features in this domain because it was very helpful in the last decades.

prompt: It is commonly believed that nowadays main factors that affect a child's development are media, pop culture and friends. A different point of view is that family plays the most significant role. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: It is generally argued by some that external factors have several significant impacts on a child’s development; diametrically opposed to this, others propound the idea that the dedicated upbringing of parents plays an important role in children progression. Although both sides may advance equally compelling arguments in support of themselves, I personally incline towards the latter for the rationale that follows. Ċ On the one hand, it is a fact beyond dispute that there are a number of reasons why most of the child’s development is affected by technologies and their peers in the modern era. To begin with, the children are likely to copy the behaviour and catchphrases of their favourite personalities. For instance, more increasing of violent display and colloquial advertising is showed by the uncontrolled proliferation of media platforms, which negatively affects children progression. In addition, the young generation’s can be easily influenced by the digital world, trending fashion and peers. Because of the fast-paced technological innovation, children these days spend their time on the screen. Therefore, the young tend to immerse in different international cultures by the sharing of internet users and friends. Ċ On the other hand, there is no gainsaying that the training of parents is most significant to the development of the young age. The first point is that only parents can teach the children how to talk and behave toward others in accordance with the moral code. A further explanation worth mentioning is that parents are great friends for the pupil. Taking the typical example is that mom and dad can spend their spare time playing video games, do some outdoor activities or brainstorming ideas for homework at school after taking the school hours, which are extremely contributed to foster the family bonding. Ċ To conclude then, whilst there exist contrasting stances on the matter, it is taxing work to determine which may be more positive. Howbeit, in line with the previous discussion, I am convinced to assert that the parents’ guidance is a vital role in the successful development of the pupil.

prompt: Writing, reading and maths are the three recognized traditional subjects. Computer skill should also be the fourth largest branch. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is often argued that numbers, composition and assignment stand the pick up on trios of ancestral dependents. Computer mastery should similarly stand behind it in the sector. I tend to agree with this belief. I believe that because of the abilities of the device must be the next conventional content. Ideas articulated further in this discourse will support my stand and at the same time highlight certain contradictory views that others in this society might give birth to. Ċ Firstly, in this contemporary globe utmost of the individuals work depended on the computer because it is very convenient and straight. therefore, the dexterity of this device is very essential which may helpful for surviving in a faster-growing world. for instance, currently in the covid-19 pandemic, every individual must have done their work from home and it becomes possible because of this machine. Ċ On the other hand, there are selves in the society who are of the outlook that it can move toward to be an addiction for the amateurs and they claims that there are many detriments of this apparatus. if it pleases a productive subject then excessive use of it can lead to misdirection. for specimen, if an offspring reads up illicit activity like hacking hence it serves formidable for him, their parents and others. Ċ To conclude, that surely are those in the society who seem to be convinced with the fact that this machine is hazardous and they assumingly have all the right reasons to back their conviction. I, however, am of the firm opinion that computer has to be most precious subject and nowadays it is very essential for people.

prompt: Some people say that staying in a hotel in a foreign country when on holiday is not the best way to get to know about the country and its people. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: To some, staying at hotels when holidaying abroad is not the method to comprehend a nation and the people living in it. From my point of view, I consider myself in agreement with the statement. Ċ For a variety of reasons, it would be wrong to reckon that having an oversea holiday to learn about a country and its people is the best method. One of the main reasons is that hotels always offer tourists good and luxury services to confine them within the hotel zone to enjoy those services. It leads to the notion that quite a few tourists frequently be too lazy to discover the nation they are traveling just because of spending time on the services of the hotels. To make sense of that, for instance, quite a few hotels provide luxury meals and playing rooms to tourists so that they may take a whole day within the hotel zone. Ċ Another reason is that doing so causes tourists to fail to obtain the knowledge they want in an oversea country. Therefore, people cannot realize the local culture or even what happens outside the zone of the hotels when they are in that zone. Quite a few harmful impacts may place pressure on local tourism because of transferring the wrong information about the country by tourists. To several tourists, sharing wrongly the knowledge they know is frequently happen, because sometimes they do not realize the knowledge they obtained is the case or not. Ċ To conclude, my point is that if tourists want to comprehend more about a foreign country's culture and people, just go out of the comfortable zone and experience more so that they can know whatever they want. (281 words)

prompt: Health care should not be provided for free regardless of a person’s income. The health of a person is in their own hands and they should, therefore, be held accountable for that. Ċ Do you agree with this statement?
essay: Medical facilities to a person should not be provided for free irrespective of his financial status. The well-being of a person is in his own hands, so they should be taking care of themselves, entirely. However, I strongly disagree with this notion and believe that the audience living below the poverty line and government employees should be given free medical care. Ċ To begin with, the first and foremost reason to support my viewpoint is that the majority of the people in developing countries lie below the poverty line due to which they can not avail themselves of medications. The reason for this is they usually are uneducated and work on low wage jobs, as a result, they are unable to provide a nutritive diet and medical facilities to their family members. For instance, according to a survey by 'The Times', 30% of children in developing areas of Mumbai suffer from malnutrition as their parents have no money to feed them, therefore in that situation only government can provide a helping hand. Ċ Secondly, my opinion is further bolstered by the factor that the good health of working employees defines the growth of the nation as employment sectors are largely responsible for proliferating the economy of the country. In this modern and hectic lifestyle, individuals are working relentlessly in various sectors such as education, health, agriculture and information technology, as a consequence, the productivity of these areas leads to the development of the nation. Henceforth, to produce a healthy workforce for the betterment of the country it is important for the governing authorities to provide healthcare facilities. The free medical coverage for the native people of the USA serves as the best example of this approach. Ċ In conclusion, while everyone is responsible for keeping themselves fit, in my perspective, the provision of medical subsidies by the government is vital not only for the financially poor community but also for the working professionals to uplift the economy of the country.

prompt: Some people say that physical exercise should be a required part of every school day. Others believe that students should spend their whole day on academic studies. Discuss both the views and state your opinion?
essay: The significance of exercises as part of the school curriculum has been a debatable issue. Some folks argue that school students should enrol in physical exercises while others say that they should focus on their grades. This essay will delve into both these arguments before reaching an opinion. Ċ To begin with, sports activities at a young age can have many long term benefits like height, weight and good body shape. This has been a noticeable fact that the children involved in games have good physical health and are more confident. Moreover, participation in games can boost their memory and concentration. Therefore, this will automatically enhance their academic performance.Further, sporting also teaches team values and punctuality. Additionally, there is a good career opportunity in athletics these days. For instance, famous cricketers like MS Dhoni is among the most famous men. Ċ On the other hand, a group of people say that kids should give their 100% to academics so that they can have a good job in future. Academic excellence is required for a lucrative job. For example, a person should have good marks in order to have a white colour job like doctor, teacher or engineer. Researchers state that students not getting enough time for their studies and have so much mental stress. Ċ In the conclusion, Although studies are important, sports should not be overlooked. In my opinion, Physical activities are very essential to avoid health issues, improve mental strength. It builds a good personality by embedding leadership, team spirit and honesty.

prompt: Topic: Topic: In some countries, the population is a mix of people from different cultures and ethich groups. Why is this case ? Discuss benefits and disadvantages of this issue ?
essay: In some countries like American or Britain, the population is a combination of people from all walks of life with different cultural background.Some people belive that this is conducive to muti-cultural societies while others claim that more pains than gains behind this issue. My essay will shed light on reasons,pros and cons of this issues. Ċ One of the first contributors to this issue is that in order to secure job opportunities with high-paid salaries, people from poor countries tend to move to developed countries.Another reason is that Only by living in industrial nations can people receive better health care and education.That's why there is an increasing number of asian students seeking sholarships to pursue their passion at American universities.Finally,Countries having a stable economy and politic attract wokers and professionals who desire to avoid polictical conflicts. Ċ Advantages and disadvantages are noticeable. On one hand, living in different parts of the world enables people to expand their knowledge ceaselessly, deriving from learing different cultures and customs.As a result, mutural understanding can be nurtured. Equally important, No sooner have students from impoverished nations studied at high quality universities in developed ones than they are able to shake off poverty, climb the social lader and secure employment.Moreover, thanks to working with foreign experts for years, local people can learn good quintessence from punctuality, seriouness to pressure dealing.Howerver,owing to cultral shock,foreign studetns may feel isolated and depressed, causing their poor academic performance.Futhermore, without parental control, they can be lured into social evils. Another drawback is that To maximize their economic edge, bussinessmen who come to developed countries may pour a huge amount of money into the construction of industrial zones poor countries, which darkens the sky and results in healthy problems. Ċ In conclusion,there are pros and cons in living a country where people come from different culutures.I strongly believe that people should take actions to hamonize with others.

prompt: Nowadays, many people have to work longer time and they feel more stressful than before. What are the reasons? What can employers do to make their life easier?
essay: In this modern era, stress is a big problem today.While some stress is a normal part of the organisation, excessive tension can decrease the efficiency of the employee and can reduce their mental and physical health.This essay will discuss the reasons why this is happening and put forward several solutions for this issue. Ċ There are many causes of pressure in the workplace.Firstly, employers wants more work, so they give unrealistic deadlines to the company person to complete the projects.In Delhi, for example, in the year 2018 as per Time newspaper survey, the tension level has been drastically increased as compared to previous years.Moreover, lack of proper training and poor working relationship with the management is also one of the reasons.The Employee may feel bullied or harassed, if he is not given work as per his experience.For instance, in most of the startup companies of the world, no formal training is given to the employees because of limited budget of the company.Due to cut throat competition, employers are considered about their own work only and they do not care about the health of the employees Ċ While the problems may seem intractable, there are solutions available.Firstly, Employers can take steps to cope with the office stress.They should diagnose what is causing strain, as it would definitely affect their business directly.From time to time, they should monitor the workload.If overwork is causing tension in the business, then they should try to reduce people's workload.They should ensure their targets are challenging, but realistic.In addition to it, weekly games in the office, proper holiday entitlement and small perks fro the employer would definitely make the bond stronger among them.For example, if any, of the employee is sick, it is the responsibility of the management to get in touch.They should take a sympathetic approach towards their staff member. Ċ In conclusion, while the issues are evidently clear, there are measures that can be taken to alleviate them.Stress in the organisation is an issue of great concern.The Employer should check workload among his staff regularly and should take necessary action, as it can reduce the efficiency of the staff which is ultimately detrimental to the company.

prompt: in some cultures children are taught by their parents that they can achieve anything with hard work Ċ what are the advantages and disadvantages of this trend
essay: Parents, nowadays, are preaching their children to task hard and are also making them believe that everything can be gained in this way. While it is important to make children aware of the indispensable nature of hard effort in realising one's goals, laying over emphasis on it can have dangerous side effects. This essay will both advantages and disadvantages of this trend. Ċ As far as advantages are concerned, there is a myriad of these. Firstly, teaching children to task hard makes them more successful in life. To put it differently, there is no denying to the fact that being industrious, always pays and by making children to acknowledge the fact that being laborious is an inevitable step in the path of success parents are increasing their chances of becoming successful in life. For instance, people who learn the importance of the struggle, become greater leaders and entrepreneurs. Moreover, laying more stress on hard work also improves the personality of a person. To explain further, a person who himself is diligent, is always respectful of the efforts of others. Thus, making him humble and considerate of others. Ċ However, there are also a few disadvantages of this trend. The main disadvantage of this practice is its deceptive nature. This is to say, even though the struggle is the key to success, it is not the only thing which leads to victory. To explain, sometime other factors like luck and circumstances overpower all efforts. Hence, shattering the hopes of a person. For an illustration, a child may effort hard whole year to secure first rank in the annual exam, but may fall ill just a day before the examination, therefore resulting in unexpected failure. Ċ To conclude, although hard work is an essential lesson to be taught to the children by the parents, since it makes them more successful and a better human being, overemphasizing the fact that it can help achieve something is incorrect. Since victory depends upon many other factors too. As a result, the concept of hard endeavour should be introduced wisely to the younger generation, in order to protect them from the potential side effects.

prompt: Many people living in cities these days do not get enough physical exercise. Ċ What are the causes of this? Ċ What are the SOLUTIONS?
essay: Nowadays, a great number of residences of the urban areas are not engaging themselves in physical activities. This essay will discuss the reasons for the inactive lifestyle of city dwellers, such as busy metropolis life and inadequate spaces for doing exercise. Furthermore, this essay will also recommend solutions to the above problems, including reducing the working hour and establishing more fields and physical activities centres. Ċ To begin with, the hectic and stressful life of towns is one of the main causes for showing unwillingness of the citizens of the town for doing work-outs. Since residents of the metropolis have to work under tremendous pressure in their workplace and commute back to the home after facing a bottleneck situation, they do not retain much stamina and energy to participate in physical exercise. Secondly, almost all the metropolitans have fewer numbers of parks and fields. Consequently, the inhabitants do not find adequate areas for jogging, running, and walking. For instance, it is shown in a recent survey that only 4% of the total land area of Dhaka, the capital of Bangladesh, has been used for parks and amusement places. Thus, people of towns are devoid of having sufficient workout opportunities due to strenuous urban life and lack of free locations. Ċ In response to the above scenario, few steps can be taken to solve these problems. First and foremost, the government should take necessary steps to cut down the working time and traffic congestion in order to facilitate the city-dwellers with sufficient free time to maintain an active lifestyle. For example, In Sweden, working hours have been reduced to motivate its inhabitants to maintain a healthy lifestyle and a sound work-life balance. Another solution to these problems can be to build ample capacities and establishment for doing workout and physical exercises. Ċ In conclusion, arduous metropolis life and insufficient place for doing physical exercise are the major causes for the sedentary lifestyle of the urban population. Nevertheless, by lessening the work time and constructing more gymnasium and parks, the government can encourage them to remain physically active and fit.

prompt: Some people believe that students should be made to have unpaid jobs in their free time. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Due to the increasing prices of all goods, more and more people have started applying for jobs. A large number of the applicants who apply for jobs are students who have recently graduated from high school looking to pay off their student loans. Nonetheless, there are a small majority of individuals who strongly believe that students should not be paid while employed in their jobs. In my opinion, it is wrong to deny a paycheck to students who are working. After analysing the difficulties of students who are working to improve their financial situation as well as those who are looking to gain life skills while working in a job will prove this. Ċ Firstly, most pupils who are working in a job are often looking to make some money. The money they make is mostly used to pay off their student loans or to even help support their family. For instance, a survey conducted by the New York Times in 2017, has stated that 87% of those who are working a job are in need of some money to help pay for their college and this cash can help support them financially. Therefore, it is clear that denying students a paycheck even after working a job is wrong as they are exploited as free labour. Ċ Secondly, most students take up a job because they want to gain some knowledge and life skills. As a result, when companies offer unpaid internships in exchange experience, it seems attractive to these candidates. A study conducted by Singapore's ministry of manpower in 2018, has concluded that unpaid internships often lure applicants and use them as free labour. Furthermore, it is said that pupils can work on something worthwhile like either working on projects or attending seminars on their subjects of interest and gain knowledge in a better way. Hence, it is apparent that a few high school graduates are attracted by unpaid job offers that offer experience but in turn, need free labour. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that unpaid employment offers affect students in a negative way as it not only wastes their time by not providing them with the money they need to pay for their loans but also exploits them as free labour by convincing them they are providing valuable experience.

prompt: Some people think that strict punishment for driving offenses are the key to reduce traffic accidents. Other, however, believe that other measures could be more effective in improving road safety.  Discuss both views and give your own opinion. serious law enforcement for reckless drivers
essay: It is common believe that traffic lawbreakers should be sentenced to severe punishment is preferred solution to answer the high rank of traffic accidents. While other though said that constructing enchanted infrastructures to improve physical safety of road should exceed more positive impacts. I personally believe that bold decision to make proper punishment would be better to overcome this issue. Ċ It is general for highway to be equipped by traffic tools to ensure users are comfort and safe. For instance, it is an obligation for local authority providing sufficient numbers of traffic signs particularly in area where it has more risk to crash to occur. Those would be very helpful for public to be noticed when they are spotted in right place. In contrast, the warnings should cost much expense of budget while it continues to use in future because high numbers of signs do not identically reflect the success of traffic accidents reducing. Ċ On the other hand, user's attitude and behaviour would impact more benefits through serious law enforcement. This kind of measure could be executed by officers to sentence the offenders with equal punishment with no exception from all of groups. Furthermore, it would educate people to understand how essential the law is in daily life where it should accidentally build the sense of law awareness. When the awareness are maintaining, preferable attitude in driving would be being part of habitual tradition. Thus, citizens may contribute to create a harmony to each other and to lead a firm obedience of official rules. Ċ To sum up, traffic rules breaking which causes more accidents should be tackled by firmly practical regulation for those who offend. It is cost-effective and most suitable to vouch the rules would be obeyed by public.

prompt: Rich industrialised nations are responsible for global warming so it is their duty to find a remedy. Do you agree?
essay: There is no doubt that the global warming is currently a burning issue affecting adversely all nations in the world. It is said that the underlying causes of this problem are mainly addressed to the rich industrialized nations whose assumed responsibility is to seek to remedy. However, it leads to a debate of whether this onerous duty should be solely handled by a particular group of country or it is discharged by a whole world. In my perspective, it would probably be every country that must fulfill such fundamental responsibility. Ċ First and foremost, it is inevitable that this global issue results in rapid deterioration due to the industrial countries' excessive reliance on fossil fuels. The emission of carbon dioxide is concerned in the climate change, which is mainly generated from pollution-spewing factories of those nations exploiting fossil fuels as a valuable source. Taking China as an example, in 2008, it accounted for 23.5% of world's CO2 emission, whereby Chinese industry-based economy may not be prevented from consuming fossil fuels. Nevertheless, not only do the rich industrialized countries have to bear the forward consequences, but also other nations will soon face the results Ċ On the other hand, the responsibility should be shared between the countries due to their distinct uses of national resources . There are underdeveloped countries, developing countries and developed countries. Typically, underdeveloped and developing ones are unlikely to afford modern technology and have proper methodologies to create high-quality manufacturing infrastructure, resulting in the over-controlled emission of greenhouse gases affecting the climate. On the contrary, the developed countries or rich industrialized nations are currently using energy substitute to avoid letting the polluting gases into the atmosphere, but the consumption of fossil fuels is still remained. Ċ To sum up, in my view, the world should be in charge of finding a remedy towards this issue rather than solely a group of country bearing this significant duty.

prompt: Our cities are noisier than ever before. Why is this so, and what can be done about it? You should use your own ideas, knowledge and experience and support your arguments with examples and relevant evidence.
essay: Nowadays, it is believed that people live in a noisier environment than in the past. My view is that industrialization and pursuit of night life-style are the main causes. Also, it is the responsibility of both government and enterprise to clear up the problem. Ċ To begin with, due to the fast development of industrialization, a series of infrastructures have been build in order to satisfy resident's demand. In order to complete the projects before deadline, construction companies would prefer to choose continuously operation and apply heavy machines during day and night. Consequently, constantly loud sounds make people believe that their living environment has been damaged. Apart from the construction, chasing night lifestyle is another contribution. Working pressure and interpersonal relationship led individuals to join the night activities such as shopping and clubbing, to release the pressure. Therefore, shop owners would try to extend trade hours to attract more customers. This is why streets are full of people even in the late night.
