Ċ In terms of solving the problems, government can take the primary role by introducing law and regulation. For example, government could regulate the trade hours for shops and reduce the accessibility of night public transport thereby controlling people stay night outside. Furthermore, construction companies should also take corporate responsibilities by limiting heavy machines operation during the night, and massive fine should be applied if companies break the rules. Ċ To conclude, cities development and chasing night lifestyle are mainly responsible for noise in urban areas. But joint effort by government and enterprise could return a relatively peace environment to community.

prompt: There are many people who go to live in different countries. To what extent should people be allowed to move freely between countries and live where they choose? What are the benefits and drawbacks of this?
essay: Throughout all the times, many citizens ones' state has been migrating in different countries for various reasons. Therefore, the government most popular countries complicated relocation what has provoked outrage among some people who want freely migrate. Nevertheless, countries have not only benefited in immigration, such as fill most unpopular work area via foreigners, but also have a negative impact such as on crime or workplace parts. Ċ On the one hand, people cannot decline the fact what all immigrants are different, thereby they uncontrolled entry can worse situation in the country. Firstly, some perpetrators hide from the judging in other countries, however, there they do not forget their habits, thereby the crime level in such country increase. Likewise, different countries have various laws that complicate arrest and deportation after it. For example, for this reason is created the Interpol organisation that has always been searching such delinquents. Besides, foreigners relocate with different sickness, as a result, they or cannot work, or they help illness spread around the world that leads to ambiguous aftermath such as more spend from the country budgets or a pandemic outbreak. Ċ Although some people bring in the new country positive impact such as the new specialists in any unpopular work area. Since some people change homeland because want to expand their knowledge about their profession, and they can fill area their specialisation if the country there they go have scarcity such specialists. Furthermore, countries always have workplaces with small wages where citizens do not want work, nonetheless foreign, especially from the poor countries, work there willingly; as result, countries keep the balance of labour force via immigrants. Ċ To conclude, the government should strictly control the entry of immigrants for evading trouble in the future, even if they have a strong shortage of labour for an any reason. More importantly, people cannot freely move and live wherever they want due to it has ambiguous influence on the future of the country.

prompt: Nowadays , women as well as men work full time. Therefore, women and men should share household tasks equally. ( eg cleaning and looking after children ).To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In a fast-paced life men and ,women both are busy making their careers. Women are now becoming more prone towards building their careers instead of bounding themselves to household work. In my forthcoming ,essay I will discuss why both genders should be responsible for doing the tasks equally. Ċ Firstly, in modern-day ,life women are now more outgoing than previously. In past days men were allotedCorrect your spellingallowedIf you don’t want alloted to be marked as misspelled in the future, you can add it to your personal dictionary. Ċ to work to go outside and earn money. While ladies were more towards looking at kids and doing household chores at home. In the present-day ,situation it is a necessity for both men and women to work together whether it's outside or inside. Moreover, to strengthen the family economically it's essential for both of them to earn money. For instance, in the U.K. both genders work equally and they both work along by looking at their children at home. Ċ Secondly, there is a huge surge in inflation across the globe. It is too tough for a single parent to give better education and a better life for a large family. To give enough support as well as to alleviate the living standards of their family both genders across the globe performance together. Whether it's sports, music, film business or any other field. Women are doing great jobs and excelling in that area. Likewise, there are many developing countries too like India which has changed drastically in past few years. Furthermore, 70% of women in the total world population are involved in giving their valuable time and earning money. Ċ To conclude, nowadays working outside is not bound by being a woman. Giving privilege to ladies to work outside can not only boost the family growth while it also shows countries development. Thus, in my ,view men and women should definitely divide their tasks equally and endeavour side by side with each other.

prompt: Scandals are useful because they focus our attention on problems in ways that no speaker or reformer ever could. Write a response in which you discuss the extent to which you agree or disagree with the claim. In developing and supporting your position, be sure to address the most compelling reasons and/or examples that could be used to challenge your position.
essay: I strongly support the assertion that scandals are useful because they stir up all people in any level of social and education classification. Moreover scandals have some special properties which make them more useful than when a speaker or reformer wants to reveal such a wrong-doing, such as their high-speed spreading, subjects and persons which scandals are about, and the government responsibility about them. Ċ First of all, scandals are spreading between different people as quickly as possible, and nobody can stop them from traveling people to people. They do not need any resources such T.V. or billboard and do not need anyone to support or advocate them. Ċ Moreover, scandals are about famous people who have important role in societies. These types of people usually have many powers and influences so that no body has enough courage and power to reveal their wrong-doings. Scandals are the best way to make them known and destroy their specious character among all society. Ċ On the other hand, scandals usually are about important affairs which are crucial for all people's life. For example consider a senator who has used his power to possess a lot of lands and gardens. Or a bank boss who has paid a lot of loans to his relatives. These affairs are about financial resources which belong to all people and are important for all of them. Ċ Finally, when a scandal discloses a wrong-doing to all people in a community, the government has to deal with it properly. But, I think when a speaker or reformer tries to reveal such a wrong-doing or condemn an important person's action, governments tends to condone them or do not pay enough attention to them.

prompt: "Age discrimination occurs when a decision is made on the basis of a person's age. In the workplace, these are most often decisions about being employed in the first place, winning promotions or being unfairly dismissed. Should discrimination against older workers be made illegal. " too old for this job or not?
essay: Today, there are more and more age discrimination in the workpace, older workers are treated unfairly in a various ways. There are arguments about whether it is legal to discriminate older workers. As far as I am concerned, the country should set up law to make discrimination against older workers illegal. This essay will discuss about more details. Ċ It is usually true people may get sluggish when getting older. However, whether one is capable for a job depends more on his/her skill set, attitude and ability, rather than simply the one's age. For certain jobs, it is not required to be prompt physically, such as financial accounting and teacher. Ċ More over, older workers make great contribution to their company and are more experienced in their area. Firing older workers just because they are old is not wise. Experience is priceless, it can help the company to work better and can help new comers to grow rapidly. Lastly, age discrimination will cause negative effect on young workers, since they can forecast their unfair treatment in the future, they will lose passion on their job and become less dedicated. Ċ Taking considered measures, it is critial to establish laws to make age discrimination illegal in order to protect older workers, and promote competing fairly in workplace according to one's capability. By doing so it will help the older workers and encourage people to be more engaged in the work he/she is doing.

prompt: Some people think that it is better for children to read books and other materials that are educational. Other people think that children should be allowed to read whatever they like. Reading for children
essay: Books, which are saved knowledge, are very important to people, especially with students. Unfortunately, books aren't always useful, so some people believe that it is more advanced for young people read books and other material that is for training. Other people consider that youngsters should be let's read whatever they like. Ċ In the first view, It is more useful for students to read books and other materials that are for informative academic. Educational books are very good for young people but children need to discover which thing they really like, it is more important than just following an educational system. Studying book always be used in school so actually, young people read them every day. It is the reason make bore for studying. Those reasons can harm youngster's dream, it may destroy young people's future.So read educational books is useful but it is not enough. Ċ In other hand, people understand that children should be permitted to read whatever they want. This way is very good for students but has some negative effects.First of all, the content of some books may not appropriate to the age of youngsters. Secondly, a plot may consist of violent and aggressive scenes. As a consequence, such kind of books can damage children's mind and make them cruel.Those effects may damage youngsters' life.So in this opinion, it is very risky to allowed children read whatever they like. Ċ In my opinion, I believe that young people should read whatsoever their parents allowed. Adults have many experiences about life so they knew which books are useful for their sons and daughters. This way is compiled between allowing and preventing so teenagers can read what they interesting but we sure the books are safed. I think that children will develop completely and strongly by this solution.

prompt: Some people think sports in schools is a waste of time and resources, while other believe it is a vital part of education. Discuss both the view and give your opinion.
essay: It is considered by some that having physical education in an academy is not worth spending time and supplies, while there are others who think it is an essential portion of school curriculums. In my opinion, having exercise lessons in faculty has a very important role in offspring's health. Ċ On the one hand, a certain amount of people believe offspring should spend more time studying, not playing sport. While students are tested for their understanding level of basic subjects, such as math, literature, or science on the exams, the physical movement has less impact, or in some cases no impact at all, on the University entrance exam. They believe that institutions are meant to give their best in education, and if this does not happen, that leads admission and their parents to worry and get frustrated. They may be worried there will be a lack of time for learning math, literature, or science. On top of that, Distributing a budget for physical activity may reduce the amount of money that could have been used for other subjects stuff. Ċ On the other hand, there is a good deal of advantages of playing sport in institutions. To begin with, it is undeniable that physical enterprises are equally important as any other aspect of education. It is a good way to reduce scion's stress and relieve tensions from their bodies. Consequently, the heir is able to focus more on their studies after doing some exercises. According to some research, admission showed more concentration on study after they had some kind of exercise, compared to other children who did not have any moving activities while they are in the learning institutions. Furthermore, if it is a sport that involves team play, it is also a good opportunity to learn to work in a team and problem-solving skills. Ċ In conclusion, while there are some individuals who are concerned about having played in school lessons, I believe that it is essential for children to do some exercises between hours of studying, and it outweighs the drawbacks.

prompt: All over the world, the number of overweight people is growing. What do you feel are the main causes of this? What are the effects?
essay: The obesity rate around the world has increased by a whopping 60% over the decade. Due to the development of ,mankind we are subjected to various changes that directly are the causes of overweight. In this essay, I will be discussing my notes of the causes and their effects. Ċ Firstly, we live in a fast-paced world where people do not have time to cook for themselves. Most people rely on fast foods and ready-made meals. Although they are very convenient, it is certainly not healthy and causes direct health-related issues. For instance, normal human calorie consumption in a day should be around 2100 Kcal on average, whereas, one burger from a KFC is above 1700 calories. Studies show that in the USA there are five times more grab and go restaurants operating in comparison to their population. That shows the number of citizens opting for junk food. I believe this to be one of the main causes of overweight in today's generation. Ċ Secondly, Obesity causes severe health issues. Most people with this problem are immobilized. In addition to this, doctors have also reported heart problems as one of the common observations in obese individuals. As a result, the death rate has certainly increased in youngsters'. For example, a healthy person has a lifespan of 60 years, whereas, on the other hand, an overweighed man might just have half the time. Although, most of them are not considering switching their habits, some are understanding the severity of the situation and seeking help. This can be stated as one of the effects out of many. Ċ To conclude, It is a severe concern to mankind. It is our responsibility to understand and take care of healthy habits. Each and every single human deserves to live a happy and joyful life; however, situations like these are very concerning are need action to be taken immediately. Therefore, I believe educating people about the side effects and possibilities to overcome them may be useful.

prompt: Some people propose that smoking should be banned completely. What's your opinion? Give reasons to your answer and include any relevant examples from your own experience.  people's attitude toward smoking
essay: Recently, people's attitude toward smoking has significantly altered. The habit once considered elegant of high-end people is now regarded as a bad habit. I completely side with people who suggest that smoking should be strictly prohibited. Ċ First of all, smoking is proved to have links with lung cancer and other cardiac diseases. WHO has released a report indicating that smokers have noticeable shorter life span than those who do not smoke, approximately up to ten years, as they are more likely to experience fatal illness. Moreover, people who smoke get more chances of giving birth to children with deficiencies. It should also be noticed that not only smoking affects people who smoke, passive smokers, those inhale secondhand smoke suffer as well. It is evident that the rate of non-smokers suffering from smoking-related diseases is even higher than that of smokers. Ċ Secondly, strict prohibition of smoking can save up a large amount of money for the government and related authorities. Many people argue that tobacco industry is one of the key contributors to the national economy, as the taxes imposed on such industry is extremely high. However, the cost that the government has to pay to proceed medical research and to address problems arising from smoking is much greater than those collected. Ċ In conclusion, I advocate the opinion opposing of smoking and convinced that the government should completely ban smoking due to the hazardous consequences it might bring to human's well-being, as well as the fact it would gradually hurt the national economy.

prompt: Some people think that the crime among teenagers is increasing because of violent video games. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is often argued by some that playing aggressive video games have been causing more offence by young people in modern society. From my point of view, I partly agree with this opinion since apart from brutal plays, other factors could lead to the intense behaviour of young folks. In this essay, I will elaborate more on this in detail. Ċ On the one hand, playing video games that involves intense actions have negative impacts on large numbers of teenagers' behaviours. Firstly, they are easily influenced and get the wrong idea of attacking people and think it is okay to be violent. For example, many young folks imitate the way of violent characters in games as if it is cool. According to some research, people who have seen violent actions for a certain amount of time showed 70% more aggressive actions and facial expressions. Ċ On the other hand, there are other factors involved in the increased rate of juvenile wrongdoing apart from online playings. To illustrate this, some juveniles commit crimes because of some academic problems or conflicts with their parents. Some research shows that the percentage of committing a crime tend to be 60% higher when teenagers are facing some kind of difficulties in life compared to those who have no problems in the academic field or in a family. For instance, there was a male student who attacked an elder citizen in February 2022, and he was suffering from his educational difficulties. Ċ To conclude, although aggressive online activities have a negative impact on great numbers of juveniles, it is not the only reason causing youngsters' crimes. Other factors that are surrounded by them are also undeniable.

prompt: In the 20th century, contact between many different parts of the world has developed apidly through air travel and telecommunications. Ċ Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: These days, in the digital generation where technology is involved in almost every aspect of people's lives, the contact between populations in many sections of the world has rapidly grown through air travel and telecommunications. This movement contains both advantages and disadvantages, therefore, both of them will be discussed in detail in the following paragraphs before the conclusion is reached. Ċ It is undeniable that everything on earth always come with both pros and cons, including the idea that air travel and telecommunications have become extremely noticeable in the public. There are numerous disadvantages that can be noted, but one will be explained in this paragraph. With rapidly developed technology nowadays, society tends to forget how they used to live without them. For instance, after using too much air travel or telecommunications such as telephone or other electronic devices, a person may become too dependent on them and would not be able to do anything or solve their current problems. Ċ However, I believe the positive effects made by air travel and telecommunications actually outweigh the mentioned drawbacks. They make humans' life faster and easier. To exemplify this, my grandparents used to send letters to each other in the past in order to communicate as there was no other devices or any internet connection. As a result, it took more than a week for those letters to be delivered and some of their letters were lost during the delivery. Moreover, they needed to sail overseas back then, which took them a week to meet each other, because there was no other convenient transportation like air travel. They said life was more difficult during their time compared to now. Ċ In conclusion, although people can become too dependent on living the easy life with highly developed ways to contact others like air travel and telecommunications, I strongly believe their advantages far outweigh the disadvantages because they improve humans' lives by making things more convenient, comfortable, and suitable in today's digital world.

prompt: Some people believe that technology has made people’s lives easier while others think the opposite. Which do you believe and why? Give explanations and examples to support your opinion.
essay: The advancement in technology over the last century has been phenomenal, affecting the ways of life in several ways. While some opine that technology has made the life of people simple, others contradict. This essay will emphasize on my opinion on how the technological growth has aided in providing an easy lifestyle to the common man and elaborate on the same with supporting evidences. Ċ Firstly, I would like to explain how the improvement in telecommunication sector is revolutionizing the interaction among people on an everyday basis. Today, most of the communication happens over e-mails, phone calls, SMS, Whatsapp, etc. Because of these various advancements, it has become possible for everyone to reach out to their counterparts or business partners instantly and that saves a lot of time. For example, before the invention of emails, doing business was cumbersome and time-consuming because of heavy reliance on the uncertain postal system, whereas now all formal interactions happen seamlessly over emails and other methods. Ċ Let’s consider another major area of technological innovation, namely transportation. In current times, an individual can travel to any destination in any part of the World within 24 hours. Isn’t this truly a revolution? For instance, a journey from USA to India would have taken months, before the invention of aeroplanes. But fortunately, now it only takes 12 hours to reach India from USA by flight. The growth in transportation has brought upon a positive impact on the way people move around the World, promoting Economy and development. This sector has also led to the promotion of various other industries such as tourism, trade, etc. Ċ In conclusion, it can be inferred that technological development in various spheres such as travel, telecommunication, safety and security, has supported the mankind tremendously. Therefore, it is clear that our lives are made a lot easier, smooth and simple by technology. Further, it is recommended that the future innovations take into account the overall well-being of the society, ecology and environment, while providing comfort to the public.

prompt: As well as making money, businesses also have social responsibilities. Do you agree or disagree? growing company means more value for the community
essay: Entrepreneur activities as a vital part in the social development. Although emparking on market share to build up company is commitment of managers, it also is significant to mention about social responsibilities as one of requirements of business. There are some factories that are set up to places as a good direction to create more jobs for local people. Secondly, government have considered business expansion such a source to pay taxes for them investing others section. This kind of budget is a tool of government. With the development of country, enterprise tax can help the government to grow education system, strenghthen their policies or expanding highway. Ċ Enterprise blends into social responsibilites with the power to create change. By corporate sociable responsible activities, companies speak out their voice when raising awareness about environment protection. Local people consider this action as a characteristic of a good brand. It can attract customer by their commitment to environment of place. In addition, other activities such as donating for charity can make a huge impact on social innovation. It is required in investment funds as a condition to be invested. Many companies are doing these works effectively. By rebuilding house, creating education program or planning trees, companies play an integral part of social expansion. These activities can make a strong brand in customer mindset and make them believe in organisation in the future.

prompt: I would be grateful if you spare your time to correct and mark my essay Question: Some people think that newly built houses should follow the style of old houses in local areas. Others think that people should have freedom to buid houses of their own style. Do you agree or disagree with this view? imitating the local housing trend
essay: Opinions diverge greatly on whether or not newly errected buildings are forced to retain the similar architecture with the previous one. From my perspective, I would contend that house owners should feel free to design their accommodations in their own way. Ċ It is unequal for architects to obey the same style for quarters in a region. Copying merchanically ways of construction might be associated with obstructing their creative ability. This may be explained by the fact that designing a house is still considered as a genre of art which enables builders and designers to show off their asthetic capabilities. This means that each architect has their own method and distictly different criteria in assessing a quarter as being well-appointed. For instant, some tend to take a keen interest in blending between tradditional and modern styles while vintage designed housing becomes more favourable for others. In fact, what new accommodation are formulated to look indifferent with the old one disregard the appearance element. The beauty of the way housing being constructed, conversely, becomes one of the appealing part in visitors'eyes when they set their foot to the local area. This is because something outstanding and special seems to leave unforgetable memory. Ċ From all existing justification mentioned above, I am firmly of the opinion that imitating the housing trend might be superficial on account of the architect's creativity hinderance and tediousness in design.

prompt: It is usually foolish to get married before completing your studies and getting established in a good job. Do you agree or disagree? marriage vs diploma
essay: With the rapid development of the society more and more people are getting married before finishing studies and settling good job. Some are in favor of getting married before finishing studies is foolish, considering that there is no stable income source and the young students are not mature enough. But I disagree with that, in my opinion, by getting married in college the two people can benefit a lot from a range of measures, for example take responsibility, get closer and so on. Ċ It is usually true that students do not have good income source and depend on parents financially, but this should not be an issue for getting married in college. The marriage is more about live together happily instead of money. Students have a lot of time to study together, build common interests and so on, all these will help them to strengthen the connection. Ċ Moreover, getting married means the two people will take responsibility for each other and behave differently from before. Such change will get the couple to think and plan their future life and career more carefully, they can get mature during the process. The earlier the couple learn taking responsibility the better will they behave in the community, this in turn will benefit the society. And it is obvious nice having the two people study and discuss questions together, that can boost the efficiency of studying. Ċ Taking considered measures, getting married in college should be supported and encouraged by the society, since it can benefit not only the two students but also the whole society. With more happy and good marriages in college were our life and the society to be better.

prompt: More and more people think that there is no need for printed paper newspapers. To what extend do you agree or disagree.
essay: Since a few years ago, technology is changing too many things worldwide. Nowadays, printed paper newspapers are losing popularity because too many believe that they are not necessary anymore. I partially agree with the statement due to the environmental issues related to paper material. Yet, there exists some drawbacks that should be taken into account. Ċ On the one hand, diminishing the number of paper-based newspapers could be highly beneficial. For instance, some environmental advantages such as less water pollution and less paper waste are crucial. These days, readers have several options to find news. Electronic devices are solving individuals problems. So, having access to cellphones, iPadsCorrect your spellingiPodsThe word iPads is not in our dictionary. If you’re sure this spelling is correct, you can add it to your personal dictionary to prevent future alerts. Ċ or laptops is the main benefit. Also, some people are only interested in reading just one part of the material. Then, it is not necessary to purchase the entire product, using websites could solve this situation. However, some individuals can not buy technology items due to the high prices. Ċ On the other hand, some inhabitants are not familiar with some technological devices yet. For example, older people could not know how to search through the internet. They will need assistance to keep enjoying daily information. Some others could be afraid of using personal computers. Even some regions have poor internet access. So, interrupting the regular delivery of paper-based news in some cities could decrease dramatically the number of readers. Moreover, too many people are facing view problems. Therefore, reading with glasses throughout bright screens could be harmful to some of them. Ċ To conclude, more and more options are appearing to sustain reading habits. Although environmental advantages are essentials, a high number of readers are steel willing and well-using printed material. For those reasons, I can not completely say that newspaper printed format is not needed.

prompt: In the past when students did a university degree they tend to study in their own country. Nowaday they have more opportunity to study abroad. essay: Nowadays, more and more students dream to go abroad for getting a degree and looking the world in close aspects. Reality has proven this transforming is latent of merits concur with demerits. This phenomenon is called "bleeding grey matter". Ċ After analysing all the viewpoints, my opinion is steady that going abroad is a magnificent experience, students should go abroad to broaden their horizon, however, they ought to consider it carefully and have fully preparations.

prompt: Cutting down forests is a real environmental threat; yet, this is still happening at a great rate around the world. Why do you think forests are being destroyed? Are there any benefits from the destruction of forests?
essay: It is an undeniable fact that deforestation is occurring on a large scale in the whole world even though it is perilous. I personally opine that forests are being cut down to provide people with more space to live and the destruction of forests does not cause benefits but it leads to various other major issues. Ċ To begin with, due to the population explosion, people need more space to live, so they are changing forests into livable places. Everyone needs a house to live in. Moreover, with the advancement in technology, the government wants to provide modern facilities to its citizens for which they are transforming forests into huge malls and hospitals. For example, in the U.S. Almost 40% of the forest area has been changed into the hospital and residential areas. Ċ However, there are numerous problems which have been caused due to deforestation. Firstly, in this way we are destroying the natural habitat of the animals. As a result, some animals are on the brink of extinction because they are not getting a suitable environment to fulfil their needs. Secondly, it also leads to an increase in pollution levels. Since trees help in the conversion of gases which are harmful to the environment and purify the air. For instance, a recent survey report revealed that the pollution level has increased by 20% since 2016. Ċ In conclusion, although forest are being cleared to provide shelter to people, it has negative impacts on the environment. It is recommended that the government should take the necessary step to control deforestation and to maintain a healthy environment.

prompt: More and more companies are allowing employees to work at home. Do you think it is a positive or negative development?
essay: It is obvious that nowadays most employers are giving working from home opportunities to their jobholders. In my view, it is a positive development. In this essay, I will explain my support by analysing how this chance save the time of both and helps talent to reach out to a great company without the boundary of physical barrier. Ċ One of the most important merits of working from home is to be able to work more and spend less time on nonimportant things. This assist employee and employer to utilize that moment of preparing and riding. Additionally, if an engineer has to go to the office the preparation and commute to the location can be utilized to research the project. This would definitely help to increase productivity. Therefore, providing associate performing virtually has an affirmative effect on both parties' life. Ċ Furthermore, many talented people, as well as organizations who are searching for matching skills and assignments out there, will get an opportunity to work for each other. There are many talents who can not come physically due to long-distance but has strong interest and knowledge in that particular field, which they would like to exercise virtually. For example, this facility resolves the problem of en-suit work such as using information technology many computer-related tasks can be completed without presenting at the destination. Ċ In conclusion, I strongly believe that letting people finish their duty through a computer network is completely plus point which adds value to company and worker as well by keeping less second for the unproductive sector. Moreover, by doing so both of them will be able to find their best match a competent and intelligent manager for job provider and the best working environment for job seekers.

prompt: Many people choose to work or live abroad because of the higher standards of Ċ living they can find outside their home country. Ċ Do you think this brings more advantages or disadvantages to the people who follow this Ċ path?
essay: A rising number of people prefer to emigrate to foreign countries considering the improved lifestyle and standard of living these places offer. While, this might be true to some extent, I personally feel that every person should consider the pros and cons of the same and in my viewpoint the disadvantages far extend the advantages for people who prefer this. People are usually unaware of the cost of living in these countries and most of them ending up taking jobs that are below the qualifications they have acquired. Ċ Firstly, migration to a developed country comes with higher expenses that are often underestimated by people.They convert their income earning capacity based on the foreign currency and although this might be very close to their home currency, they get lured by the same. In some instances, the income earned might be significantly lower, which is further worsened if the person has taken leverage.So, effectively some end up with a lower standard of living. Ċ Secondly, in most countries the degrees that have been earned from one's universities are often not accepted. Furthermore, the work experiences earned from abroad are underrated which leads to many people taking a setback in their work life. For instance, some professional qualifications like accountants and doctors are forced to take up further studies which are often very expensive and forces people to further increase their debt obligations. Ċ In conclusion, one should carefully analyse immigration and the prospects carefully because it involves complete relocation to another country. It involves transferring of families, assets and being completely away from one's home.If the country you are planning to move does not provide you with a significant markup in terms of living standards, and does not recognize your hard earned qualification, then I am of the opinion that you should reconsider your decision.

prompt: 'Born' artist or the one who learned the arts Kindly assess my essay by giving a band. my score target is 6.5 Some people say that art (eg. Painting, music, poetry, etc...) can be made by everyone whereas others believe that it can only be made by those with special ability. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: One of the most controversial issues among people relates to practise of art. while some people consider that making art is a speciality, others take the view that everyone is able to carry out a certain number of art. In this essay, I am going to examine this question from both points of view. Ċ On one side of the argument, there are people who argue that by making art, they can find pleasure and practise a hobby. Many people choose playing sport, doing music or writing poetry because this allows them to enjoy their spare time although they are not professionals. One good illustration of this is painting our bedroom or apartment by ourselves can positively affect our mood which will provide us a sense of achievement. It is also possible to say that practising art is a manner to reach mental balance. Ċ On the other hand it is also possible to argue that in fact art has compulsorily to be made by those with high ability and capacity. People often have this opinion because art like : sport, painting and poetry are considered as professions and specialities that require perfection when exercising. In order to get a groundbreaking painting or an original peotry, most of people trust in reliable professionals. Ċ As we have seen, there are no easy answers to this question, on balance however, I tend to believe that everyone is allowed to practise the kind of art he likes since this permits him to follow his passion and makes him feel comfortable.

prompt: 1.	Some people believe that the most important aspect of their job is their salary. Others think that the job itself is the most important. What do you think is the most important aspect of a job? Include specific details and examples to support your choice.
essay: Individuals around the world have different considerations about how they are evaluating employment opportunities. While some would argue that financial rewarding is the standard, I agree with those who believe that other factors are more crucial. Ċ On the one hand, there are few justifications for people who choose the amount of wage over other jobs elements. Firstly, they could be focusing on securing themselves financially and hence, they need extra cash flow for that. Good-paying careers can provide a stable monetary resource for such people. For example, banks can offer saving plans for those with higher than average salaries and they pay profits for them. Additionally, some might consider jobs as an opportunity where it cannot be always yours. Because companies are always tending to find better-skilled personnel to run their business. Therefore, the wages people are getting is an important aspect to them. Ċ On the other hand, I would argue that the job itself is important because of two main reasons. The first reason can be the goals and aims of that position. There are some duties that can contribute positively to different international problems. For instance, staff who are working face environmental challenges and water scarcity problems. These roles have extremely benefited the world, regardless of the salaries offered for workers. Another factor can be the stability of the job. It would always be a better option for selecting a job especially if there are family obligations and responsibilities. As a result, it is prefered by some to consider stable jobs with goals that suit their background. Ċ To conclude, the aspect of looking for a certain job can vary from one person to another. Payment, stability, and job perspectives can all guide us to select a certain career. However, I do recommend looking to other factors and letting the financial rewarding be the last of our selection criteria.

prompt: Some people believe that too many resources and attention are devoted to the protection of wild animals and birds. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
essay: In the current times, one of the most trending topics is the future of wild beings. Few populaces think that animals and birds in the wild are given extreme importance through various means, and other people believe that this is not the case. I strongly assert that attention and benefits are provided to these habitants way more than required, and this essay will throw some light on the reasons for my opinion. Ċ At first, media plays an important role in sympathizing news pertaining to endangered species; however, the reality looks extremely diverse as the statistics provided by the news channels is not always true. Secondly, although hunting has been an integral part of our society for many centuries, it has been condemned only for the last few years. The reason for this is because of the involvement of some famous personalities in such events, and anything they do becomes a flash story for everyone to talk about. It has been observed that despite the percentage of hunting wild animals and birds by many Bollywood stars is minimal, they seem to have come under the radar way more than those who actually commit this act frequently. Ċ Furthermore, adoption and donation have started becoming popular, and many authorities availing these benefits are not fulfilling their responsibilities due to the cushion they have been provided. For instance, many individuals adopt wild species in the Zoo, and they take care of the entire expense that is incurred; nevertheless, the management of these wild parks collect the same entry fee from the public despite getting donations from people. It is noticed that this trend has come to popularity only in the last decade and more than 50% of Zoos are replicating this strategy to reap the benefits. Ċ In conclusion, I completely believe that humans have given extreme resources and attention to wild beings, either in the form of media hype or high net worth individuals donating money, and these things have been utilized incorrectly in many ways.

prompt: Many people think that the behavior of professional sportsmen off the field is not important as long as they are good players. To what extent do you agree or disagree with it?
essay: It is a common opinion nowadays that the behaviour of professional athletes outside the playground does not matter if they are performing great on the field. Even though some people favour this idea, there is a tremendous part of society that does not support the notion. In this essay, I will discuss and provide reasons why I completely disagree with such belief. Ċ Firstly, the main ground for my opinion is that great sportsmen are generally influencing and inspiring huge population masses starting from the youth ending with the elderly. For example, famous football players are known for their charity work. These individuals are of great benefit to society as they often visit kids with severe health conditions, such as cancer, thus encouraging them to fight for their lives. Furthermore, players like Messi and Ronaldo have demonstrated tremendous effort in encouraging youth football players to stick with the hobby and develop further. Ċ Secondly, being a nice person outside the game is crucial for the player’s career development as it attracts various companies who would like to conclude the promotion contracts with the athletes for advertisement purposes. For instance, a famous tennis player Maria Sharapova has drawn business entities begging her to advertise their products. Moreover, such income has allowed establishing a brand of her own. Upon completion of the athletic career, this will be a solid base for income. Ċ In conclusion, despite others think that lifestyle outside the field is insignificant, I strongly disagree with their point. In my view encouraging society, stimulating sports development and investment in future career are of tremendous importance for sportsmen across the world.

prompt: Some people believe that it is a good idea that older people continue to work if it is possible for them to do. Do you agree or disagree ?
essay: As an increase, the retirement age has escalated in recent years in developed countries. Whether the elderly residents should be empowered to continue with their occupation if it is still feasible for them. While there are admittedly several drawbacks to this perspective, I believe that the positive influences are more glaring. Ċ To begin with, it is understandable why some people are unlikely to subscribe to the view that senior citizens should not embark on their favourite jobs. First and foremost, people at the age of sixty and more regularly suffer from various health problems such as high blood pressure, stroke or heart attack. In light of this, some heavy workloads can take a toll on both their mental and physical health. Thus, instead of spending time competing at labour pains. They should be retired to enjoy the rest of life with their relatives. Finally, the influx of old people into the labour market is the primary driving force behind the rising youth unemployment. For example, many elderly candidates compete with younger ones for their jobs since they gained more hands-on experience than these young employees. As a result, a huge amount of young candidates must leave off the working environment. Ċ Nevertheless, despite the aforementioned drawbacks, I would convince that older employees can bring a host of benefits to their community. On the one hand, those who spend more time taking part in community services and volunteer work in their retirement support to alleviate government spending in some fields such as health care and environmental protections. Additionally, when working with satisfaction in these jobs, the elderly can avoid experiencing feelings of isolation and loneliness. On the other hand, a sheer number of older unemployment put heavy pressure on health systems and social care because they need more state funding for these problems. Therefore, if they can continue earning a living, the government responsibilities will decrease to focus on another important concern. Ċ In conclusion, I opined that old generation should be taken after by their family and also the government coffers. However, there is no right to limit our grandparents to enjoy their own life as maintaining their favourite career .

prompt: Many young people move out of their homes to live alone or to live with their friends. Some people think this is a good idea. Ċ Do you agree or disagree with this opinion? Ċ Give examples from your own knowledge or experience.

As they acquire a culture of that place then their personality also reaches the top level. prompt: protect the wildlife means protect ourselves. Zoos are often seen as important but poor alternatives to allowing animals to remain in their natural environmentm. Discuss the advangtages and disadvantages of keeping animals in captivity and then give your opinion.
essay: It is plausible that zoos has given the nature several positive impacts by preserve animals in capivity. prompt: Subject : Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
essay: Nowadays attending classes in universities is a very controversial issue that everybody has his own ideas about this matter. Some people might suggest that going to classes should not be mandatory, I personally believe that it should be obligatory for students.There are two main reasons why I think students should be required to attend classes. Ċ One of the reasons for this is that students learn better when they attend all classes. As a salient example for this is that students have the chance to ask their questions immediately to their teachers and it facilitates students learning. Secondly, while students spend a lot of time to comprehend subjects on their own, with teachers' help they can learn effective techniques to solve questions and to understand them. To my view, if students are obliged to attend classes, they can acquire information much eaisier and more effectively than studying alone. Ċ Secondly and more importantly,coming to classes improves students' social relations. Firstly, a student who comes to classes regularly can meet his classmates, have chats with them and share his happiness and sadness. Another example for this is that universities have lots of activities that students can join, enjoy their time and make new friends. Otherwise, when students study on their own and lock themselves in their rooms, making friends and having social relations become harder. In my opinion, it effects students' life in a good way in terms of having better relations with people. Ċ In short, for the reasons above, I once again restate my view that students should be obliged to attend classes on the grounds that they can learn excellently and have a better social life if they visit the university often.

prompt: Food standards in education Scientists agree that many people eat too much junk food and it is damaging their health. Some people think that this problem can be solved by educating people, while others believe that education will not work. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay: In recent years, there are a large number of people having obsessed with junk food, therefore, researchers believe that this phenomenon will result in health problems. Although some people argue that such issues can be addressed through education, others hold opposite perspective on it. In this essay, I will breakdown both thoughts and state my own view. Ċ Advocates state that inculcating consumers with healthy dietary style is undoubtedly the best solution because of raising concerns on nutritional values. It is their view that a large proportion of customers ignores the fact that these unhealthy food is invariably high in sugar and salt. Nonetheless, with modest education, understanding the consequences of consuming an excessive amount of junk food can help them realise the importance of forming a wholesome dietary habit. As a result, they believe that consumers will ultimately alter their diet patterns by decreasing the frequencies of purchasing such merchandise or increasing the intake of greenery vegetables. Ċ However, opponents think that it is impossible to reduce individual's addiction to junk food merely by education. They believe that the vast majority of consumers clearly know the detrimental effects on health, however, because of its convenience and low cost, they cannot help being a slave to such products. In addition, they also insist that education will only have negligible effects if related national policies do not regulate the advertisements and promotions on junk food. For instance, government can pose higher taxations on these products and limit the content of junk food advertising, so that fewer customers will be attracted by relatively low prices and appealing marketing strategies. Ċ In conclusion, although education plays a significant role in ceasing people from overconsuming junk food, I firmly believe that it is inevitably never enough to resolve the issues. Concreted efforts should also be executed by national administrations.

prompt: Some people believe that taxing companies, which cause it, is the best way to reduce industrial pollution while some suggest that there are several other ways to solve this trouble. Discuss both the views and give your opinion.
essay: In recent times, the hazardous waste emitted by organizations had a detrimental impact on the environment. To reduce this phenomenon few individuals believe that levying a high tax would help to combat this situation, whereas others argue that alternative methods should be adopted. This essay intends to discuss both perspectives. I, however, opine with the lateral view. Ċ To begin with, imposing heavy charges on corporations would help the government to have enough capital for cleaning up and reducing pollution. In addition, this amount collected from factories would help the governing authority to employ correct equipment for eradicating industrial waste. Following this, it would also put pressure on the industries to reduce perilous extracts to save themselves from paying a hefty tax. For example, studies suggest that companies imposed with ponderous taxes have later reduced emitting pollutant particles by 40%. Ċ On the contrary, the country's high authorities can mandate firms to set up effluent-treatment plants. Additionally, subsidies can be provided for such projects to motivate manufacturers. For instance, the water contamination caused by effluents from chemical industries is controlled to a great extent by implementing plans for treating the pollutants. Secondly, a law should be passed to plant several trees around these private operational bodies. As a result, plants help to reduce the dangerous gases in the air, thus, purifying it. As an example, in Singapore, strict rules of planting trees around every industry has helped them to be a pollution-free nation. Ċ To conclude, the benefit of taxation implied to overcome the exploitation of nature can be limited, moreover, the gains achieved by the substitutional measures such as tree plantation and subsidizing the pollutant-treatment project are overpowering.

prompt: shaping children's well-being Topic: For school children, their teachers have more influence on their intelligence and social development than their parents. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Children of young ages are easily affected by the adults around them, in terms of intelligence and social development. Although it is true that teachers have more significant impact on children's academic knowledge, I believe parents are more responsible for their socialization. Ċ The school teachers' job are meant to broaden the knowledge of children and enhance their abilities. All teachers must have gone through strict education and training, making them qualified enough to help their students to discover new horizons. In addition, teachers have indispensable skills in working with children, take care of their different individual needs and at the same time deal with unexpected situations, especially when it comes to young kids. Besides, the subjects students learn at school are theoretical knowledge that changes children's concept of the world. Certainly, teachers are the most suitable adults to orientate them. Ċ On the other hand, the role of improving children's social life is for their parents. It is undeniable that parents are the first people that kids reach out to when they encounter problems, as well as their initial role models. Children tend to imitate their parents' speech and behaviors. Moreover, compared to teachers, parents spend much more time with their own children - more time for kids to pick up good characteristics from their parents. The bond between them is extremely powerful and heartfelt, same as how strong parents' influence on children is. Ċ In conclusion, both parents and teachers hold vital positions in shaping children's well-being. While teachers role is leading them to the world of intellectual knowledge, parents are responsible for developing their social life.

prompt: International organizations have failed to help everyone who needs help so they should only focus on helping the poor people in their own countries. To what extent do you agree?
essay: With limited money, international organizations, indeed, could not manage to help every needed person. But it doesn't mean that the international community should only provide help to their own poverty-stricken citizens. From my perspective, International organizations have irreplaceable obligation to help the poor. Ċ The purpose of establishing international organizations is help. For example, the World Bank composed by affluent countries offers lower-interest loans to the poor countries. Through this way, the less wealthy countries have enough money to develop the infrastructure facilities, such as roads and pipeline, which could generate massive job opportunities. As more job vacancies will be provided, more lay-off workers in the poor countries could make a living by themselves. Therefore, the living standard of the local people could be apparently improved. Ċ Maybe it seems unfair to the wealthy countries which still have the poor people in their own countries. It is true that the action to help the poor in other countries will damage the interests of the taxpayers in the affluent countries. However, it isn't unfair if we consider the fact that hundreds of thousands of the poor are under starvation in other countries in contrast to fewer poor people in the wealthy countries. Ċ Even though the international organizations have failed to help every the needed, offering help will still make a difference in change the imbalance of fortune in the globe. Without international aid, a large number of poor people may die of starvation in the year to come. Further, the poor may take violent measures, such as stealing, to support their lives, which may drive up the crime rate and cause inability in the country as well. Ċ To conclude, international aid is necessary, despite a few countries will benefit. For the wealthy countries, they should give priority to the needed in their own countries before helping the poor in other countries.

prompt: Some people think that zoos are cruel and should be closed down. Others however believe that zoos can be useful in protecting wild animals. Discuss both opinions and give your own opinion.
essay: Many individuals have an opinion that the places where animals are kept should be shut down due to the vicious nature of them. while on the other hand, some contends that these wildlife centuries could be necessary to prevent the ecological balance or endangered species. I shall articulate my view in the next paragraphs. Ċ To commence with, the masses who suggest to wipe out the regions where livings are taken care of, often say that the aggressive nature of wildlife creatures act as a threat to human beings. To illustrate, a report by the education department demonstrates that the freedom of the animals to roam freely in the same area where populace visit to see them turns out to be dangerous for humans as in the Rajasthan zoo the man was killed by the destructive lion who was not controlled by care-takers. Moreover, in zoos, the wild structures might not able to grow in which they are kept under a cage which eventually makes them vicious beasts. Therefore, it is imperative to send them to forests where they belong which further ensures their survival and growth. Ċ On the contrary, this type of structures must be kept in wildlife centuries in which proper care may be given to them which conserve them from other predators. Furthermore, their presence could act as a benefit instead of a burden in which the creatures who might not able to control by masses will be monitored by these cruel species. For instance, the tiger (predator) hunt the black deers(prey) which are not controllable by the man in those situations their preservation is necessary to sustain flora and fauna. Ċ To conclude, meanwhile, it is indispensable for humans to free the habitat species from the zoo and transferred them to forests which provide protection to humans which also beneficial for such creatures to survive or adapt without restrictions.

prompt: Issue: The surest indicator of a great nation is not the achievements of its rulers, artists, or scientists, but the general well-being of all its people. the comfort of a regular citizen
essay: In general, Great is a term depicts the distinguishing qualities that make someone or something great. The statement denotes the cause to become a great nation, that depends on the comfort of general citizen.Indeed, the most plausible, significant basis of a great nation lies in the citizen's welfare. Ċ If common people get treated impartially, that is the indication of a great nation.In India, before the 21st century, there is a castism.The higher hierarchy people had been living in pleasure, while lower hierarchy people had been incurring.The nation had a wide gap between poor and rich, low class and high-class people. Higher class people were happy, in contrary lower class people suffered humiliation. In such circumstances, the nation cannot be called great. Ċ The citizen of the country plays a major role in development and advancement of the country.Each and everyone's contribution helps to regulate the country.For example, farmers provide food to us.The doctor treats people's illness.Teachers teaches people in order to aware them about the world. Everyone is special.The country becomes great with the support of these people. Ċ Many people in the country become worldwide personalities through their extraordinary achievements.Does that mean the country is great? In India, there are lots of actors with worldwide fame. Their achievements make them great.They are known as great people who belongs to India, not the people belong to the great nation.This makes a difference.The achievements of people are rather personal than national. Ċ Although scientist, artist, rulers help to enhance the development of the nation, the greatness of nation does not totally dependent on them.As a conclusion, with the every citizen of the nation, whether the citizen is an ordinary man or a famous person, the country will be a great nation by cherishing its people and take care of them.

prompt: It has been suggested that everyone in the world wants to own a car, a TV and a fridge. Do you think disadvantages of such a development outweigh advantages? the evolution of human needs
essay: The desire of having own items is human nature. With the boost of economic development and the growing number of advertisement, raise the desire of having more and more products. Whether owing a car, a TV, even a fridge is essential or not, I think the drawbacks are by far than the benefits for following reasons. Ċ First of all, these kinds of products are certainly not necessary. I suppose the first thing people should consider before purchasing is that are they must to have? Since people are easily manipulated by ubiquitous media, which persuade people to buy the goods they actually do not require. Moreover, some people consume beyond they can afford, inevitably causing the debt they have no ability to pay. Ċ The second reason for the negative influence of this development is that it widens the gap between rich and poor people. The encouragement of having own vehicle, entertainment and electronic appliances raise the desire which can only fulfill by the wealthy instead of the poor. Under such situation, jealousness, unfairness and anger emerge. Ċ Some people may argue that the purchasing stimulates the economic. It can be partial right, however, the reasonable consumption id limited in an affordable range, which means, the over-budget consumption generate the bad consequence, dragging the economic dramatically. Ċ To sum up, the over-chasing of owing products is not encouraged. People should evaluate their financial condition and think twice before action.

prompt: It is often said that the subjects taught in schools are too academic in orientation and that it would be more useful for children to learn about practical matters such as home management, work and interpersonal skills. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: The primary purpose of educational institutions is to produce well-versed employees capable of completing their work with efficacy. In this regard, urging schools to focus on the practical aspects of the work at hand is a laudable initiative. Nevertheless, this essay disagrees with this viewpoint because academic knowledge is of paramount importance in Specialty occupations and it helps students to deal with various circumstances in a systemic approach. Ċ To begin with, while some occupations, such as waitressing and barber, necessitate a little academic background, other fields of work such as law or medicine require a profound knowledge of the subject area. In the former situation, the know-how can easily be transmitted from the manager to the trainee. However, in the case of law and medicine, one individual is unlikely to retain such a vast amount of facts which can only be embedded in the books, explaining the years of academic studies which the student must spent before being permitted to practice. In the course of their career, modifications in law or health practices are likely to be common occurrences, requiring continuing education. As such, an academic learning is a must for certain professions. Ċ Furthermore, I personally believe that academic teaching favours the student by adopting a systemic approach which can be replicated across all situations. Practical experience often negatively biases certain students, for instance, a hairdressing trainee may only be tasked with a particular type of haircut since this is the only one demanded by the customers. Through academic teaching, school ensures that the student face all types of situation and document their material in such a way that students can easily review them at their own convenience. Ċ In conclusion, academic knowledge is of paramount importance for speciality occupations and it also provides students with approaches in all situations they may face when enter labour force. Therefore, the opinion that practical skills are more useful than academic ability cannot be supported. This essay argues that theory-based lessons should continue to be appreciated in school settings.

prompt: Some information in films, books and on the Internet has a negative influence on young people. Some people think that such information should be controlled. Give your opinion on both sides of view use your own experience and example.
essay: Nowadays, information travels across the globe in a matter of minutes on the Internet or any type of media thanks to globalization. Despite its' several benefits, on the wrong hand, it may be used to negatively persuade the young generation into the wrong path. Likewise, there is an argument whether the content on these publishing should be regulated or not. Evidently, I strongly disagree with the statement. Ċ First of all, it is undeniable that publishing is a powerful tool for exchanging ideas globally in the 21st century. It allows people to freely express their thought, opinions or even theories to the world without any restrictions. For example, in my experience, juveniles widely use Twitter to share their concern about the current political situation in Thailand because the main channel such as TV or websites is controlled by the state. Nevertheless, they are able to communicate and share information that they found about unfairness, news or wrongdoing from the government which is not available on the other platforms. Hence, without restriction, they are able to share the world their creative works without middlemen claiming ownership and selling their arts without permission. Ċ On the other hand, many argue that false data of harmful content is easily shared and spread out if there is no regulation from authorities. Therefore, juveniles are at risk of being exposed to false facts, claims or even business deals. For illustration, I found that social media such as Tiktok are used to trick kids to join suspicious businesses, participate in dangerous trends such as digesting powdered cinnamon and many were found choking from that or even Flat earth community which influence people to believe that the earth is actually flat. Certainly, without proper control from responsible ,bodies this can lead to dangerous situations and many adverse effects from crime, physical injury or even death can be expected. Ċ In conclusion, I disagree that governments should control all the content shared in the community as it restricts the human right of thought and freedom of speech. However, the data should be limited to certain levels such as criminal activities, unproven facts or news. Thus, users should be aware and filter news before sharing as well.

prompt: In recent years, tv has contributed most to changing people's quality of life. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: These days, television has shown a greater impact on society's way of living. It is agreed that the introduction of the digital box has become a revolution that totally redefined the quality of life. Analyzing the way it revolutionalized news and entertainment industries will prove this. Ċ To begin with, Before the 19th century, the announcements to reach every nook and corner of the world was a difficult feat to achieve. To illustrate, the two popular ways of being aware of news during that time period were by the spread of mouth which often gets corrupted and turns inefficient. Likewise, newspapers which would require enormous logistics are ineffective as well. The invention of TV quickly revolutionised the world by making it easy to spread the message in the most efficient manner. So, most communities were able to get accurate information from this digital box. Ċ In addition, Firstly, the digital device provides entertainment by various genres to viewers in today's world. Some of the most popular genres viewers prefer are arts, comedy, action and horror movies and series. Secondly, television has given lively hood to several people. To illustrate, my father who is a makeup artist earns his bread from this industry. Hence, it can be clearly stated that video station has enhanced the lives of many. Ċ To sum up, TV has impacted the lives of many. For some, it's merely a source of entertainment and news while for others, it's the livelihood. It can be completely agreed that the TV's contribution showed a positive impact on the lives of many people.

prompt: Nowadays, not enough students choose science subjects in university in many countries. What are the reasons for this problem? What are the effects on the society.
essay: It is impossible to disprove that fact to the number of science students was shrinking when compared to other discipline. This trend has been increasing and causing many problems. An upcoming paragraph will analyse some explanation for this reason. Ċ Firstly, to study a science subject requires hard work and patience. Many students around the world does not have those qualities due to this, they choose any easy stream (such as commerce and engineering) and these students indulge in leisure. In one instance, after completing four years in science, they require to do another two year course in any specific subject to become a specialist. Students have to devote their lives for 4 to 6 years in university and they want to have that passion about that subject since it will motivate them. Secondly, getting jobs for science students is very difficult in this competitive world, whereas other degree students having more number of opportunities Ċ As a result, there will be a shortage in a research field and this would bring more problem to our society. Science field is a very important subject in the earth because nowadays people do not care their health an account of this many of them affected by various kinds of disease. If students decreased in this area, then many innovative ideas which will come from mind would be disappeared and it will create more pressure on exciting practitioner. Ċ To conclude, although having many difficulties in science, it will give the best future for who worked hard. Moreover, the world needs their service to acquire a healthy life.

prompt: Some people believe that part time job can ensure better job opportunities in future. Others think job can easily distract students from study. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: It is a great debate between community members whether a part-time job may provide opportunities for a job or will hinder scholars from completing their studies effectively.As we see nowadays because of huge technological evolution, many individuals tend to have some tasks besides their studies, which I extremely agree with. Ċ One point is that some population think work may cause a distraction for juniors ,and decrease their application quality. such this public need pupils to focus more on their studies and learning process,for example, they just go to school and come back home to memorize and study their lectures. this point of view greatly emphasizes undergraduates .As a result, they will miss gradually a crucial part of social life, like meeting new folk and detecting some different cultures. Ċ On the other hand,working along with study helps them to gain new skills and experience ,irrespective to the field which they work in .for instance knowing how the world is ongoing ,in addition ,learning patience,hard-working and many other good characteristics furthermore they will be capable of gaining money to use it not only for buying their special items but also to go for picnics and journeys and enjoy life.so I think that a part-time career along with class is important from all perspectives. Ċ To conclude , there may be many attitudes and points of view towards the issue of having a part-time activity or being free for studying only.I see that if learners are working and studying at the same time ,this will open their minds and comprehension levels,hence it will have a better impact on their lives.

prompt: A nation should require all of its students to study the same national curriculum until they enter college. Write a response in which you discuss the extent to which you agree or disagree with the claim. In developing and supporting your position, be sure to address the most compelling reasons and/or examples that could be used to challenge your position.
essay: All students should study the same national carriculum at the school level is the main issue. when students study the same carriculum then they can be judged equally. Students are judged by a certain examination at the time of admission in the college. A examination is based on certain types of fact in the questions and the student can answere only if he/she can understand these facts. so if the all the students have study the same carriculum then they all are perform equally. Ċ for example, in India, IIT examnination held for admission in bechlor of technology(an engineering course). million of students appread in the examination. these students studied different-different course in their higher school carriculum. so students that studied the higher school in english medium can easily fight the examination and the students who are differernt background fight difficulties to clear the examination. And things does not end here, these students find more difficulty when they admitted in college and studied the same subjects which is difficult for other background students rather then english background students. Ċ Take a another example of GRE examination, students find it difficult to chase the examination as all the students have different backgrounds. Students whose mother tounge or native language is english they can easily clear the examination: and other nation whose native language is other then english find it quite difficult, though, they can chase the exam. Ċ at last, if the student studied the same nation carriculum then they can equally perform in all the field of test then the real meaning of the examination reflect. so, at my stand, all the students must study the same carriculum.

prompt: It is more important to have a good family than to have friends. Family can always compensate for absence of friendship. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is often believed that a good family provides better support when friends are not available. I entirely find the aforementioned statement to be logically sound as we live in a more comfortable environment and we can get financial help from our parents as compared to companions. Ċ Most importantly, one can feel convenient to share his problems with the family. The reason behind this fact is that a person has been lived with his family since birth; therefore, parents and other members are well aware of his behaviour as well as help out in various issues. Consequently, they may not only advise in an appropriate way but also present mental support to the individual whereas friends are not too mature to give advice to them. For instance, in the research done by University students, it is found that 80% of people prefer to ask for help in trouble from their immediate family members than mates. Ċ Besides feeling comfortable with family, one can get financial help from them than friends. This is due to his biological relationship with his parents; they have selfless love. Owing to which parents provide full monetary support to their children whenever they need it without expecting it back. On the other hand, friends can help with money to a certain extent only as they are not well grown to be economically sound. Hence, parents keep rolling until their children get settled in their life with jobs. To exemplify, had my friend’s father spent money on his education and fulfilling all his needs, he would not have been selected in a reputed company such as Amazon. Ċ In conclusion, since it is always satisfying and economically beneficial to be with family. I am convinced that family can have the upper hand rather than friends.

prompt: In many countries these days, the number of people continuing their education after school has increased,and the range of courses available at universities and colleges has also increased. Do you think this as a positive or negative development
essay: In today's modern world new developments can be cited in every field,education is no exemption. In recent years more and more number of people are seen persisting higher education, also a wide range of courses are now offered at universities and colleges. I perceive this as a positive advancement.
