Ċ Varoius reasons can be assigned to support this statement.Firstly, increase in number of persons with higher education have benefitedany country's overall progress,as they can earn more and eventually can pay more taxes.Also companies and employers can now have more employees who are trained and familiar with relevant job profile. Also as an individualit is never too late to study and hence by studing more one can develop as a knowlegable ,more cultured and more responsible person. Ċ Further, universities and colleges are now offeringa variety of courses alongwith the traditional courses.Even this aspect have optimistic effects. This wide range of courses helps a student to comply with his subject of interest. Also this leads a possibility of exploring new fields. It even helps in employment as many options can be available. Addition of some contemporary courses like music,art,acting have made people to see this fieldwith more respect and helped its perseveres professionaly. Ċ Hence to sumup, I believe that knowledge never goes waste hence it is a positve advancement that more number of people are opting to study after school and also the universities are now providing more diverse courses facilitating people to after school

prompt: huge salaries to sports stars? Some people believe that the salaries paid to professional sportspeople are too high, while others argue that sports salaries are fair. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: People have different views about the amount of money paid to top sportspeople. While there are some good arguments in favor of the idea that these athletes are overpaid, in my opinion they receive fair salaries. Ċ The main reason why many people might disapprove of high salaries of sportspeople is that they do not make much contribution to society despite their huge income. Many skilled athletes earn much more than workers in other professions, like teachers and doctors, even though their roles are not as vital as these workers. Barcelona superstar Lionel Messi, for example, took in $127 million from his salary, earnings and endorsements. By contrast, high school teachers in the United States made a median salary of $60,320 in 2018; the best-paid 25 percent made $77,720 that year. Most people believe that we should therefore value professionals such as nurses and teachers more highly. Ċ However, I believe that the best sportspeople deserve to earn a lot of money. Firstly, being a top sports player requires years of practice and hard-work, and in this regard athletes could set good examples for young people. Secondly, a sports star usually has millions of fans who are willing to pay to see him or her play. Finally, sport is a multi-million-dollar industry; there are many firms that want to use popular sportspeople for advertising purposes, by making considerable investment into advertising their products. In Lionel Messi's case, $37 million of his income came from endorsements. Ċ In conclusion, although there are good arguments against paying huge salaries to sports stars, I would argue that they deserve the money they earn.

prompt: When people need to complain about a product or poor service, some people to complain in writing and others prefer to complain in person. Which way do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
essay: Grievance is unsatisfaction about quality. Usually, folk complaint about goods and poor merit. There are two ways grievance likes writing or face to face. Actually, the both choose it similar purpose to accomplish a complaint. I prefer grievance by writing. Therefore, it is economical cost and waste time. Ċ Quality Assurance is guarantee about product quality, when customer gets defect product or poor service therefore QA receive about grievance client. In this case, customer sends complaint by writing because for thrifty cost. Sometimes, folk prefer writing because they have not tome for meeting face to face. So that, writing is alternative to complaint. There are two kinds send complaint by writing. Firstly. We send grievance by email which type writing prefer by almost people. Secondly, writing complaint by post. Usually, it grievance send document and things which relation with complaint. For instance. ADR group is company assembly oil filter. Everyday, it always receive writing about complaint defect filter and kinds of complaint writing and post. Because, almost people think send complaint by writing is saving cost. So, i prefer complaint by writing because saving cost. Ċ I prefer complaint by writing because we do not waste time. Usually, we need time for complaint to person. Because, we should have enough time meet person. So, complaint by writing is more comfortable than another method and waste time. For example, Mr. Anton is manager QA at PT. PJM which is customer PT. XXX. He has many activity at company. One day, he want to complaint about his product but Mr. Anton does not time for meet person. After that, he always send writing. Because, writing is saving time. So, if we complaint to meet person is waste time. Ċ In conclusion, complaint by writing more effective than meet person. Because, complaint by writing gives benefits such as economical cost and waste time.

prompt: Some people think that children should learn to read from traditional paper books, while others feel that it is fine to start the reading process on an e-reader (like a Kindle or iPad). Ċ Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
essay: Nowadays, young folk tend to study on e-book rather than old design paper books. Some people believe that they should start reading from the printed book than e-reader meanwhile other parties are the opposite. This essay will discuss both views and in last, I will give my personal opinion on this statement. Ċ On the first-hand side, juveniles should start learning to read from traditional paper the reason is that it is very convenient for them to catch information from textbooks. For example, manual books (some kinds of book special for children) has got big handwriting and quite a clear picture which make them take information quite easily and quickly. Furthermore, teenagers can retain visual information in their mind for a long period of time so it is undeniable fact that young people should start to learn reading from hard copies. Ċ On the other side of the coin, in fact, it is also undeniable that e-readers are very effective for learning not only for youngsters but for all age groups. Because of innovation in technology, nowadays electronic booklets are available in different versions such as video so if adolescents can see and hear at the same time it helps them learn even more quickly than papers or copy. But sometimes electronic gadgets might be very expensive so children from poor families can not take an advantage of this. Ċ In conclusion, this essay discussed the convenience of hard copies of text and the effectiveness of electronic editions. In my opinion, both books have their own value and similarly plays an important role in teenager's learning and reading process.

prompt: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The personal and work-related challenges that young people face today are not very different from the challenges their parents and grandparents faced in the past.
essay: I don't think that the personal and work-related challenges that young people face today are not very different from the challenges their parents and grandparents faced in the past for the following two reasons. Ċ Firstly, with communication style changed dramatically, we have to offer communication tools more cheaply. Nowadays, we can have a conversation with each other with cell phone, Skype, Facebook or Twitter anytime anywhere in the world. On the other hand, it was not easy even to meet someone at particular time and place because they didn't have cell phones and kept in touch. Therefore, they thought of making communication more easily and developed a personal computer and a cell phone. However, most people have a PC or a cell phone now, so we have to offer a variety services making people have fun or enriching people's lives at lower costs. Ċ Secondly, in Japan, many companies have been more globalized recently, and have to cooperate with other countries and compete with not only domestic companies but also global companies. Also, there are so many companies that enlarge their business into other countries, and seek someone who can speak English. But in the past, most companies didn't need to seek bilingual, and people can work even if they can speak English. Moreover, although they got promoted by their age because there was a seniority system, this has been breaking down and they are likely to be evaluated based on their merits now. Ċ In conclusion, as stated above two reasons, the changes of communication style and work conditions, I don't think the personal and work-related challenges that young people face today are not very different from the challenges their parents and grandparents faced in the past.

prompt: Prompt -  Should people be treated according to what they are capable of achieving instead of what they have actually done.
essay: "We don't reallk know what a person can so until he has done it". In a performance oriented world however society treats one's past deeds as glimpses of the future. The ground braking figures in society, literature or science up until the present day have all been and continue to be fostered by valueing the potential over past achievements. Ċ The man who lead the world to rediscover non-violence and peace in fact had not always been an achiever. Starting out as an amatuer barrister in South Africa, Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi was just another youngster in search of a secure livelihood. It was by chance that he decided to adopt the cause of equality, that too only upon his own humiliation. His beneficiaries: victims of aparthied, restrained from judging the novice and bolstered his attempts to gain liberty after seeing hints of his potential from the oppressive regime. Had they rejected him for the lack of past achievements, India wouldn't be the republic it is today. Ċ In the world famous play" Les Miserables" the sagacious Bishop discerns Jean Vilejeous chances of becoming a better man, while at the Bishop's house in a bid to escape fromt he police. Jean shows remorse for the sin he had committed in the past. Having faith in his own judgement, the wise Bishophelped the convict run away to Paris, so he could turn over a new leaf there. Ċ If the examples of Gandhi and the Bishop are too high in stature to connect with, an example from my experiences at my music school might perhaps be more convincing. Every student ranging from the senior most tenor voice to the meek soprano is treated well irrespective of their credits and awards. IMportance is given to those students however who show immense dedication to the art. Ċ Though past deeds or lack there of may project a precarious future the spark in the fireplace foretells how big the flames may be.

prompt: TOPIC:-  Some people believe the government should spend money on sport training for top players. While some people believe they should spend money on sports training for everyone. Discuss both the views and give your opinion. funds for a few sport stars or for every athete
essay: Sports play a major role in the overall growth and development of the individuals. Nowadays, a major chunk of the overall budget is allocated to the sports training. Some people think that the government should invest their funds in providing the sports training to their top players. However, there are a few who feel that the government funds should be utilized for imparting physical health education to the commoners. Ċ Some believe that the government should focus on all the individuals as compared to the top players, which are significantly lower in proportion. By utilizing the government funds in imparting sports training to all the individuals will make them fit and healthy and reduce the frequency of several hazardous diseases caused due to limited physical movement. Nowadays, people are leading a sedentary lifestyle, these physical health education sessions will encourage them to pursue a healthy living. This would further boost the overall economy of the country. Ċ However, there are a few who believe that the government should spend the money on providing fitness training to the elite players as compared to the entire nation. They feel these champions are the biggest asset of the country. As they bring pride and glory to the nation. By spending the government funds in providing them advanced and specialized sports training will further enhance their skills. As a result, while participating in a tournament, they will be more competitive and would have an edge over other participants. Ċ In my opinion, the government should follow a balanced approach in distributing the funds to provide sports education to the commoners and top players. As both these sections are equally important for the overall growth and success of the nation.

prompt: Topic: discuss the reasons that make a person, especially a teenager start using drugs and lead to addiction.
essay: One of the most urgent problems of modern times is teenagers using drugs, which goes so far as to addiction. It is a multi dimensional problem and experts search for its various reasons among which are emotional pressures and group acceptancance. Ċ With the difficulties brought about by the modern world, along with the adults, youngs began to have hard times. Because of the expectations of parents, abundance of exams and the decrease of communication between peers with the advance of technological devices, pressure on teens is increasing day by day. This situation leads them to express themselves by doing something extreme and harmful like using drugs. With the help of using drugs, they can get rid of these emotional pressures such as anger, stress and depression, and forget everything and relax. Ċ Besides, group acceptance is not commonly known but one of major reasons of using a drug. Considering that a teenager, who feels lonely and confused, wants to be a part of a group of his peers and if there is just one condition which is using a drug, it would be inevitable for him to do that. Also, there is another situation of group acceptance, for example, a guy may not like or want to use drugs but he may want to be part of the group of guys who fel depressive like him, soo he might imitate them and use drugs. Ċ Over all, for a problem that has such a scape there can be inevitably many reasons ,and emotional pressures and group acceptance seem to be the widely recognized ones. Using drug is a critical and vital issue which needs a solution urgently and it is the responsibility of all people.

prompt: When people need to complain about a product or poor service, some prefer to complain in writing and others prefer to complain in person. Which way do you prefer?Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
essay: In the contemporary world, the usage of corporate services and products is increasingly popular. Sometimes these many not satisfy individuals experience, where some people think to report it through a mail or a letter and others prefer to complain to management in person. I believe that the former would be efficient and practical , this essay explains the reasons with proper examples. Ċ The easiest way to send the feedback to an organization would be letter writing. Since everyone has access to technology, sending complaint emails is a piece of cake , which is mentioned on the products. Indeed, to acknowledge the unsatisfactory on gaint company products is laborious, as offices might be in different states. However, in this ,case feedback can be sent on a post, unless they won't provide a mail address. For instance, if one felt unhappy with a biscuit packet that cost five dollars, then it is not value for money to go to an office and report the complaint rather than text them a message. Ċ Also, it makes organizations pursuit easy to have followed up on unsatisfied service. Having a word with workers about the product defect, which they forget or not acknowledge to higher authorities; So, the paper-based complaint may help them to track and enhance the quality of service. Moreover, they can update the customers by reverting to the same mails. A good example is reporting glitches in google, whenever a bug is reported that would be escalated to the manager who is responsible to tag the issue with the concerned team. Thus, paper reporting helps to acknowledge the problem to the proper person. Ċ To summarize, I believe that written feedback would be effortless and help the organization to track the issue and take appropriate action.

prompt: Children in some part of the world have less responsibility compared to children in the past. Some people think this is as a positive change, however others think of it as a negative change. Difference in requirements for children
essay: In the past, children have several responsibilities to do, they do not only focus to study but also they must help their parents to earn money in order to fulfill their necessity. In contrast, children today do not have responsibility as much as they did in the past. In my point of view, this is a positive change as children will focuse to only study in their childhood. Ċ Ideally, children have responsibility to build up their knowledge when they were children. This is because they have to looking for their own self, in particular their strength and and weakness. By reducing responsibility, it will provide a wide time for them for finding their own interest and talent to improve in the next time. I will be emphasize that study is not just about learn in cognitive way, but also in psycomotoric and afective aspect too. Ċ Another reason regarding this, is relating the fact that reduction of children activity indicates that their parents have done their own responsibility for covering the necessary of their family in all aspect, either on financial, or social aspect. As such, It is true that this condition is a positive change for children. Ċ Taking everything into consideration, less responsibility of children can make student focuse to their study because they did not have any distrubtion to ignore their lesson. This also appears the fact that parent has done their job in a proper way. Moreover, student just use this chance to benefit their self by ensuring that they are realy study in the whole of time provided.

prompt: Many people patronize larger industries and ignore local shops because the big firms invest a lot into promotion and marketing. What can this cause to the local shops? What can be done to make people patronize the local shops?
essay: Nowadays, due to the effects of globalization, many companies tend to open their showroom across the globe. This has led to the majority of people think that bigger industries are better than local shops, because the big companies put their efforts in promoting and marketing. This has an impact on local shops and there are certain steps that can be implemented to make people patronize the local companies. Ċ To commence with, as big industries are expanding aggressively, they invest in promoting their goods, which has caused local shops their business. For example, companies in food and fashion industry has a tremendous impact on the buyer. Companies like MC Donalds have created adverts for younger children, which has caused 70% of the business to the local shops. In addition to the business impact, these big firms are also able to change the mindset of the people, that these products are localSuggestionlocally and not that durable. Ċ Educating people and making them aware about the benefits of local shops is the first step to patronize local shops. Secondly, educating people about the marketing gimmick and what impact does it has on the society and the country overall. For instance, a country like China has been successful in inculcating these values in their citizens. Because of this the country has been able to grow drastically. Moreover, government can give some benefits to the business to start manufacturing in-house. Due to this benefit, there will be more number of people who can open their local shops and succeed. Ċ In conclusion, although, big companies with marketing strategies are able to lure the customers, there are some countries which are able to manufacture products in-house. With the help of government and local leaders there are ways to help these local shops grow and prosper. This eventually brings prosperity back to the country.

prompt: Some people think that teenagers should follow the example of older people. Others think that it is natural for teenagers to challenge what older people say. Ċ Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: A highly controversial issue relates to whether elderly people should be listened by youngers or if it is common that their experience is not applicable for younger lives. In this essay, I will examine both points of view and explain why the arguments for accepting elderly advice are stronger. Ċ It is commonly believed that the elderly's experience should be used as a model by youths. The main reason for believing that is because they have the knowledge acquired through decades of life experience. Furthermore, they are a way mature, which allow them to know how to deal with drawbacks in life. Therefore, they are able to help teenagers avoid committing mistakes on their own. To illustrate, they already faced some challenging times that called for resilience such as war or economic crises that most parts of youngers nowadays will never have do deal with. Ċ On the other hand, some people claim that older's experience is not important for teenagers nowadays. This is mainly because youngers must to known how to deal with their own flaws, which can be used as an effective method for teenagers to flourish themselves. Thus, the world has extremely changed in the last decades, which turns older's concerns obsolete due to the new society's trends. For instance, having a family was the most important factor to be considered as a happy person for the ageing people, unlike nowadays which people rule out families and try to achieve the professional success that will make them cheerful. Ċ In conclusion, both arguments have their merits. On balance, however, I believe that the younger should definitely learn with their older ones in order to avoid mistakes that their parents or grandparents did in the past and also to help them to evaluate.

prompt: Here is the topic People have different job expectations for jobs. Some people prefer to do the same job for same company, while others prefer to change jobs frequently. Discuss both these view and give your own opinion. Here is my answer: reasons for changing work places
essay: Many workers change jobs frequently in these days and they think that changing jobs leads to more opportunities. Meanwhile, the other people believe that staying in the same jobs is a better choice. Ċ One of the benefits of staying in one job increases the job security because changing jobs always means losing the stable income or moving house. To stay in one job is also means that you can avoid these problems. Another benefit to not changing job is that you can gain more experience and also increase your salary. The company may increase the salary as a reward or even give the promotion. On the other hand, those people who often change jobs may do not have enough experience to get the same salary compared to the people who stay in the same job for a long time. Ċ However, there are also have some benefit of changing jobs. One of the benefits is that worker can learn more skill because working in the different company also means that learning more different kind of skills. Meanwhile, to change jobs can also bring some new challenge compared to not change the job, because new things can always enhance the people's motivation and keep the job flash. The last advantage is these kinds of people are seems as more confident and well-rounded because of facing the new things or learning the new skill. Ċ In my opinion, to change jobs once in a while it means more benefit and is also a way to keep the life flash, and it is also another opportunities to challenge myself and learn more skill through the job.

prompt: crimes in the media Topic: Some people suggest that there should be restrictions on a detailed description of crimes in the newspapers and on television. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In recent years, the question of whether or not officers should control the detailed description of crimes in the media has sparked a controversy. Although individuals have right to know what happened specifically, the details of offence should not be entirely public in the newspapers and on TV. Ċ Several reasons can be cited to explain why the information of crimes should be limited on the Internet. First, if polices made the details of crimes public, offenders and would-be ones could become more subtle in committing crimes. In fact, by gaining unlimited access to detailed description of previous crimes, they are able to apprehend process to work cases of polices and offend more perfectly, which creates difficulties for polices to solve down the road. Another reason is by revealing the details of offence, these articles can trigger victim's and their family's torment, which implies the information should be limited in the media as a way to protect them. This means that journalists and reporters will contact victims so as to exploit information, which makes them irritated and wretched when remembering again. Ċ The restrictions on a detailed description of crimes, particularly serious ones, on the Internet is reinforced by more supporting evidence below. Firstly, if whole information was revealed, this could shock many people, especially young children. For example, horrible sense of the blood and violent images will cause obsession to kids who are vulnerable in a long term, which implies this limitation is imperative. Secondly, in order to boost ratings, many newsrooms spare no expense in drawing public attention through currently hot crimes. This means that they can provide inaccurate information and exaggeration, which shows insensitivity and cause irritation among the masses. Ċ In conclusion, the description of crimes in the media should be strictly controlled. By considering the pros and cons of this suggestion, people can make best decisions for themselves.

prompt: Topic:-People prefer to use their own transport nowadays. What could society do to encourage people to use public transport?
essay: Utilization of private transportation is one of the major problems that the world is facing today. If immediate and consequences and measures are not taken to tackle this problem, the consequences would be unimaginable. However, in order to find right remedies firstly, the real reasons must be unearthed. Ċ There are several factors responsible for great usage of private transportation. The most important reason for this problem is, it is becoming like a passion. Mostly youngsters use their own vehicles to showoff. In the same vein, travel on private transportation is largely attributed to avoid the environmental effects. To escape from the sun powerful rays and the acid rains, People are using their own transportation to reach their exact destination. Daily, lacks of vehicles are bought by the people in the world. Ċ But how can this problem be countered? Firstly, I firmly believe that, government should increase the public transportation. Why because people may not have time to wait for the government vehicles. And also, People can travel by having a seat. On the same lines, it is strongly recommended that government should hike the petrol and diesel prices, and also reduce the prices of public transportation. By this, utilization of private vehicles will decrease and prefer public transportation. Ċ Unless concerted and war-footed efforts are made to address the malady of surge in private vehicles use, there will be more traffic jams and burgeon of global warming.

prompt: Some people believe that employment over the age of 60 is not right and creates lots of problems. So people should retire after 60 and not work. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: A popular belief is that employers who is over 60 years old is not inappropriate for the job and they make several mistakes in their workplace. Repercussions, authority should not be working with them and should be given evacuation. I totally agree with this statement. This essay will explore the positive and negative aspects of retiring at sixty years. Ċ On the one hand, there are certain advantages to retire at 60 years.Life is more important than job, leading a healthy life is also crucial. For example, the stress at endeavour can impact your physical and mental well being. The risks of diseases such as heart attack, and diabetes are quite high over fifty years and if one continues to task, it might be detrimental to their health. By getting retired people will not face this health problem. In addition, production stress can be compulsory them to make any mistakes because they will not have sufficient knowledge about advance technology and they will not be able to increase their knowledge as technology due to overage. For instance, one of my uncles work a private bank and he is in the mid sixties and he can’t do any technological work because he has no enough knowledge about it. The authority should have retired him. For this reason over 60 ages is not accurate to do any job, the government should bestow retire those types workers. Ċ On the other hand, there is a multitude of negative sites to retire at sixty ages. If government retire them, government will face financial problems due to a large amount of money have to pay pullout parson. To put it another way, retire person feels more isolated and socially inactive due to they do not effort anything and they always set home so they feel dull. A good illustration of this is Bangladesh don’t give retirement at sixty ages for removing financial crisis. Another disadvantage is that if bureaucrats provide withdrawal at 60s ages, they will not get better suggestions from elderly people. That’s why a common opinion is that authority should not give evacuation at sixty ages. Ċ In conclusion, this essay discussed good and bad sites about retirement for sixty ages. I completely agree with this statement because it is beneficial for employers and authorities.

prompt: Childhood obesity has become a serious problem in recent years. Ċ What are the primary causes of this? Ċ What measures should be taken to reduce childhood obesity?
essay: Children obesity has become a worrying topic in recent years. There are several reasons leading to this. Ċ There are a number of reasons for the rising levels of childhood obesity. First, since the eating habits of today’s children are more unhealthy than that of previous generations, they tend to consume too much fast food, candy, and sugary drinks. In fact, these foods are very high in fat and sugars, but low in vitamins and minerals, which can cause kids to gain weight quickly. Second, by having sedentary lifestyles, modern kids tend to watch TV, browse the internet or play computer games instead of playing outside or doing sport. As a consequence, they are becoming increasingly obese. Ċ There are several actions that could be taken to mitigate the problem mentioned above. Firstly, in order to ensure children have a healthy diet, parents are required to choose the daily foodstuffs carefully. For example, they should favour organic foods, like clean fruits, vegetables or meats, over-processed foods, which leads to a fit body for their kids. Secondly, if parents restrict the time their children spend on sedentary activities and encourage them to take regular exercise, they would help their kids have more chances to do sports and other social activities. This means that by burning excess calories that otherwise would be stored as fat, these physical activities would help them control their weight. Ċ In conclusion, there are various factors leading to the increase in child obesity and measures should be implemented to tackle this issue.

prompt: Topic: It is more important for schoolchildren to learn about local history than world history. To what extent do you agree or disagree ? (about 300 words) native and world history education
essay: It is argued that national history plays a more vital role than other countries' history and therefore students should focus on their native history. As far as I am concerned, while local history lessons are crucial to children's development, world history could also benefit them a lot. Ċ There are many reasons why children are made to learn their national history. Firstly, teenagers can understand their indigenous history carefully such as significant historical events and famous heroes who protected their countries, which helps them adjust their behavior to fit the society they live in. For example, by learning native history, schoolchildren will respect their ancestors as well as express their gratitude toward their parents and grandparents. Another reason why national history is mandatory in schools is young generations can draw lessons from the process of protecting and constructing their countries of their ancestors. Using this knowledge, youngsters can deter their nations from making similar mistakes in the past and also make their countries prosper by experience collected from the past. Ċ On the other hand, young people can also gain many benefits from learning world history. It is an inevitable fact that by studying history, learners can acquire more knowledge about other nations in various aspects. Due to the close relation between history and indigenous cultures, teenagers can have a deeper insight into customs and traditions of other areas. As a result, a deep understanding of historical situations and cultures can prevent students from offending local values when travelling to other nations. Furthermore, studying world history can provide young people with experience to develop their countries. For example, the underdeveloped nations can imitate other prosperous countries such as following their educational curriculum or strategies to make their own nations flourish in an effective way. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that native history and world history should be taught all over the world because they are of the same importance.

prompt: Learning english at school is often seen as more important than learning local languages. If these are not taught, many are at a risk of dying out.  In your opinion is it important for everyone to learn English? Should we try to ensure the survival of local languages, and if so, how?
essay: Nowadays, English is being taught as a first language in many schools in favour of the regional languages. Some fear that if these are not given equal representation in the curriculum, they might be forgotten entirely. I am of the opinion that an attempt to protect regional languages should be made in these communities. Ċ First off, I feel that any indigenous language in a particular region must be included in the coursework of every grade. In addition to that schools must conduct daily readings of the news in the morning assembly by the students in that language. This can be extended to yearly events that promote the literature or cultural background that comes with these local languages. The same can be done by non-academic institutions as well. This should inspire interest among students in finding out more about their community. Ċ Moreover, there are many endangered languages currently in the world, and a large number of ancient languages that we can barely decipher anymore. For example, the Persian language of one of the largest ancient empires is completely forgotten today. That said, we have also lost the ability to translate their texts accurately. Which leads to gaps in our knowledge of their society. Ideas and concepts that we could instead learn from are now shrouded in obscurity. Ċ Finally, English is certainly an important language to learn simply due to its global influence on science, commerce and academia. By no means does that indicate that we must allow a local language to fizzle out of existence especially when we can prevent it.

prompt: Nowadays, many people have to work longer time, and they feel more stressful than before. What are the reasons? What can employers do to make their life easier?
essay: In modern times, the issue of stress in today’s workplace has become highly controversial. It is nerve-wracking for the people who need to work for longer hours. Before offering any solution, it is important to discuss the root causes of the problem. Ċ To begin with, there are a plethora of causes of stress in the workplace. Firstly, this is due to excessive workloads with unrealistic deadlines resulting in anxiety among the workers. Added to this is the bullying or harassment by management for which staff member feel undervalued and it affects their self-esteem. For instance, a survey by Google revealed that 72% of employees who are criticized often become stressful and feel demotivated to do the job. Ċ Turning to possible solutions, perhaps the immediate step would be to reduce people’s workload. This could be done by ensuring that the workers are offered realistic tasks with target-related payments so that they feel encouraged to complete that task. A potential remedy for the ongoing torment of management may be to counsel and educate them to provide the employees with weekly performance reviews or appraisals in the meetings to motivate the workers. For example, a group of researchers studied and reported that employers who are counselled properly treat their employees with positivity and affection. Ċ To sum up, although people have stress due to work overloads and abuse, it can be overcome if the aforementioned solutions are adopted. In the future, employers will be taking precautions such as providing perks or financial rewards to the employees so that it results in job satisfaction.

prompt: Some people believe that residents are responsible for the place where they live to be clean and tidy. Others believe that government is the responsible. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: A place where we live-in requires actions to taking care of it. Some people think that the cleanness is the owner's duty, whereas others are willing to put the responsibility on the government. In this essay, I will discuss both view and state my opinion as a conclusion. Ċ Some people think that the responsibilities of the government include cleaning peoples's neighbourhood. The nation needs to provide either money as a maintenance spending or workers to clean all residential places around the country. For example, the state could hire one person for each neighbourhood to do cleaning service. As a matter of fact, the country has numerous number of workers to handle the cleanness of public infrastructures, yet not for personal assets. It is done due to the comfort of people while using the public infrastructures. Furthermore, the budget for it is huge as well as the budget for other essential services provided by the nation. That is why spending for personal matters is not a priority. Ċ For some other people, they do the maintenance of their house as they are the owner who understand that every activity regarding their possession is their responsibility. Moreover, citizens could do anything it takes to make their places comfortable for them to live-in. For instance, a person who has an artistic skill will treat their assets with a lot of abstract features. Conversely, farmers will plant fruits or vegetables around their property. Therefore, having a private place gives us freedom to use it as we want to. Regarding that matters, if there are activities that potentially harm the others, then the state will take an intervention. Ċ In conclusion, I convince that it is the owner's responsibility to keep their places clean, tidy, and treat it as they want. Having said that, it is the nation's job to protect the residents from disturbing each other.

prompt: ‘Because so much information is available on the internet today, traditional secondary schools and teachers are no longer necessary.’ Do you agree with this statement?
essay: Nowadays anyone can get information about anyone or anything online. Since the abundance of data available on the web, many people say that secondary schools and teachers are of less importance. I completely disagree with this and think schools and teachers are extremely necessary and play an important role in a students growth. Ċ On the one hand, I believe that attending school and learning from experienced people such as lecturers is the building foundation of a child's growth. In other words, when a child goes to a school, he meets different children and tends to learn from them and also involves various completions which they can not learn from the internet. Furthermore, reading information from the web can not make you understand it. For instance, you can copy a solution of maths equation from the websites but you could not understand the method to solve it. Hence schools and teachers are important. Ċ On the other hand, there can be several drawbacks of just reading information on the internet. Firstly, authenticity is the major concern of the data on the internet. Anyone can publish their thoughts on the web and there is no check on it. Secondly, being introvert is another aspect of not going to an academy. For example, one can gather as much material from the website and learn them but you have to be able to talk to people. But not going schools at an early age can make to an introvert. Ċ To conclude, I strongly believe that schools and teachers are important because it gives them the right knowledge and confidence to speak in public. Moreover, if a child skips school, it can affect their speaking abilities and lower their self-belief.

prompt: With growing populations in cities, more and more people live in homes with little or no outdoor space. Do you think this is a positive or negative development?
essay: Due to the ever-increasing population, many people today, not by choice, reside in apartments with no place for recreational activities. In my opinion, it is vital to have sufficient space for families. Ċ Firstly, the expansion of urban areas has led to deforestation and loss of farmlands, and to reduce the impact on farms and forests, humans have resorted to living in flats. A concept wherein an area is allotted to an individual within tall buildings. The carpet area is just enough to construct a living room, a kitchen, and one or two bedrooms with no room for anything else. In addition, it leads to nuclear families, which has its consequences. Connection with individuals in one's life is lost, causing seclusion and isolation. For instance, it can no longer be witnessed that one entire family comprising of different generations is living under one single roof. Ċ Secondly, these days youngsters do not have access to any playgrounds where they can enjoy playing sports with other children of their age. They tend to lose out on their precious time by staying inside the house, not socializing and spending time with their peers but instead forced to stay indoors and in front of the screen. With no physical activity, the impact is seen on the health of the youth as one tends to gain weight and become lazy in nature resulting in various health issues. For example, the youth these days spend the majority of their time playing computer games and not playing any sport. Ċ In conclusion, apartments and flats could be a possible solution to save the environment, but it has a downside. Populaces living in such places have health-related problems to deal with, be it physical or psychological, as fewer space results in lesser physical activities and social interactions even though humans are inherent to be social animals.

prompt: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Reading fiction (such as novels and short stories) is more enjoyable than watching movies. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
essay: In the past,people prefer reading books in the free time,it's a kind of enjoyable entertainment,however,according to the progress in society,people are attracted by the high definition motion pictures,which quality is much better than ever.Nonetheless,I would prefer reading books. Ċ Apparently,watching movie is an interesting diversion,which being shared with friends,it's the important factor of watching movies,additionally,such as those hazard and saga movies which bring us the visual stimulus.Vivid spectacle,clear picture,famed movie stars,these are the attractive factor to bring us into the world of movies.Did you find out the movies of "Harry Porter"is famed by the movies instead of it's novel. Ċ How about reading books? is it really tedious of reading the whole book than watching movies? actually,I don't think so.I believe most of students are poor to write a coherent essay even a complete paragraph,that's why I suggest you to read the novel,in that,you will learn how the author put the words and words together naturally,how they imagine and describe something they have not even experienced.Reading books can also improve our reading skill and writing skill at the same time,besides,it's a good chance to know some rare words that we have never heard. Ċ Last but not least,The obvious difference between watching movies and reading books is that we are being able to visualize and imagine the spectacle and ambience in the bookas by reading,throught reading,you may vicariously experience the story in the books such as you are actually there,this is the most attractive part of reading books. Ċ I like watching movies as well,but I always believe that reading books will be more intesting than you have though if you truly enjoy it.

prompt: Many companies offer their employees the opportunity to work from home. Ċ Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of working from home for the company. Ċ And give your own opinion
essay: Currently, with this pandemic ,situationAdd an article the situation a situationThe noun phrase situation seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article. Ċ show examples we are living in, several institutions had to rethink the way to get their job done. The home office seemed to be the only choice to control this rampant disease and continue working. There are upsides and downsides to it, however, I tend to believe is more advantageous to work from home as it is more affordable to everyone. Ċ On the one hand, the obvious argument in favour is the time consumed to get ready and commute to work. Take a physically impaired person as an example. They need more time to prepare themselves for work, like, showering, having breakfast, get in the car or public transport, all of these are time-consuming. Furthermore, you can save money from transportation fees or maintenance in case you have a car. Therefore, working from the comfort of their homes seems more appropriate. Ċ On the other hand, making your house a workplace can be challenging if you have children or pets. For instance, children can interrupt you because they are hungry, or have injured themselves, moreover, pets can easily distract you and make you lose the track of your work. Additionally, you will need proper equipment and use your own utilities during your time. Thus, the downsides of a home office are the distractions, interruptions and kind of costly. Ċ In conclusion, the positive side outweighs the negative. I believe that every job which can be done from home should be that way, as it is more affordable to everyone and can be a life-changer for people with movement restrictions.

prompt: The expression "Never, never give up" means to keep trying and never stop working for your goals. Do you agree or disagree with this statement? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer. going after our goals continually
essay: Our goals are what defines us through life. As a result, I agree with the statement "Never, never give up" that translated as we should never stop pursuing our goals through hard working. Working hard to reach our goal reveals our true identity as a hardworking person and how strong we are to reach our goals. Ċ Showing passion and endurance in our journey to reach our goals identify us as a hard working person. As a result, we can be proud of ourselves. For example, an athlete who practices months or even years to win a one-time competition defines himself as the best athlete in his field. He can claim himself a winner and show us this feature in reality. Additionally, not being tired illustrates that we value our goals which is an acclaimed personality. Therefore, people will respect us more and consider us a reliable person. Ċ At times, achieving a goal can be cumbersome. By trying hard and remaining on the track to reach our goals we can show how strong person we are. Researchers, for instance, spent many years to find out reasons behind some natural phenomenon. They do several field experiments and field observations until they could solve mysteries of life. Spending such a long time to understand reasons reveals that they are a strong person. Another good example would be Paralympic games athletes who despite their physical restrictions overcome their difficulties and stand on the winner's side in the competition. Ċ In brief, going after our goals continually is one thing that I have been agreeing to it all my life. It not only shows our passion and value for our goals but proves what a strong person we are. This is a trait that every individual should acquire it.

prompt: It's generally agreed that the amount of rubbish created by humans today is a worldwide problem. What do you think are the main causes of this situation? What measures can be used to tackle the problem
essay: It is known that the vast amount of litter produced by mankind is considered to be the main cause of the climate woes, degeneration of maritime zones and environment. Many scientists are concerned how to cope with this problem reducing the number of refuse, albeit, very few of us are inclined to spare a thought to the causes of our actions. Ċ From the point of my view, the majority of rubbish such as bottles and other non-biodegradable materials created by humankind can be seen on the surface of the oceans and seas. Virtually all of the rubbish is released owing to the human consumption, and most of them are non-biodegradable therefore man has no choice but to throw away them into the oceans, however, apart from degenerating the ocean, they debilitate the stability of the marine biodiversity that might be served as a dish to us. Ċ Nevertheless, professional approach when dealing with this issue is remarkably noteworthy in terms of human healthcare and stability of our "blue planet". It is crucial to reduce or avoid incorruptible materials when making products available to the public. Furthermore, paying attention when transporting fossil fuels overseas is also important since acidic substances are considered to be lethal. Ċ In conclusion, if we do our best in every action we do in terms of proficiency, the nature will take care of itself. In addition, we are supposed to recycle the unnecessary wastes, only in these ways, will there be not any ripple effects.

prompt: Men do most of the high-level jobs. Should the government encourage a certain percentage of these jobs to be reserved for women? What is your opinion on that? Use your own knowledge and experience and support your arguments with examples and relevant evidence.
essay: Discrimination of gender equalities are an ongoing process since the beginning of life. Regarding this ,issue government can play a vital role to keep balance. In my point of view, there are should keep some high paid salaries for qualified women. Following , an essay I will describe some of my knowledge and the arguments with the above topics. Ċ In spite of biological ,facts women are never behind men. Women have more qualities than men to keep a balance between work and family life. For ,instance motherhood is the most precious thing which female-only can feel. According to current surveys, it is proven that females can do any kind of job including the most highly qualified job besides man even after becoming mothers. Take as an example profession like a doctor, both gender has abilities to be the best doctor. Moreover, female patients feel more comfortable with women to discuss their issues. Therefore, governments should reserve certain vacancies for women. Ċ On the other hand, another reason to support my arguments is that the government should not underestimate the quality basis of gender. The country's population consist of together both men and women. If both genders are unable to contribute to the nation well being then the country itself will lose the value of its own. For instance, nowadays females also can work in NASA. Eailer no one even thinks of that female could able to that. There are more no of increasing the participation of different kinds of job both gender. I think its a matter of consideration Ċ To sum up, to right uses and developments for nations government should take measure for keeping the proper amount of reservation for women.

prompt: Many educators believe that it should be mandatory for all students to wear uniforms. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is true that more and more teachers think that wearing uniforms at educational establishments ought to be obligatory for all pupils. This essay completely agrees that making students wear the same uniforms brings a sense of unity and enables learners to focus on their studies. Ċ The key aspect of adopting a uniform in a school or college is equality that makes pupils look the same despite their social status. It is undeniable that if students are allowed to wear what they want, they tend to show-off themselves by having different trendy outfits on which might cause discrimination among students. For instance, the last survey conducted by Oxford revealed that more teenagers try to wear fashionable clothes to keep up with their peers. Therefore, schools must maintain the discipline of dress code among students, which makes students feel much better as their classmates. Ċ Another major factor why I completely agree with this view is that school outfits help schoolchildren concentrate on their studies instead of wasting their worthy time on choosing diverse clothes. It must be stated that more pupils spend too much time on what to wear, especially many girls as they follow the latest trends like their mothers. This can cause a lack of attention to their studies. For example, recent research held by Cambridge University showed that there are more high-achieving boys than girls at schools on average. Thus, it is better to have a uniform among students. Ċ In conclusion, there is an increasing number of teachers who would think that mandatory school uniforms is necessary, and I believe that it is a must since school outfits enable every student to have a sense of community and make them achieve their educational goals without distraction.

prompt: People in the community can buy cheaper products nowadays. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages? industrialization makes products cheaper
essay: It is obvious that consumers can buy products with lower price in this time and age thanks to the industrialization. While I accept that there are some drawbacks, I think that these are outweighed by the benefits. Ċ On the one hand, there are certainly some problems associated with buying cheaper products. It is clear that customers should take the quality of products into consideration. As a company have to balance the proportion of capital and profit they make, to manufacture low-priced products, they may used materials that are not guaranteed. If people use that kind of product in a long term, undoubtedly, they may suffer from some health problems such as cancer. Besides, along with the mass production, there will be more wastes and emissions disposed, which obviously exacerbate the environment pollution. Ċ On the other hand, I believe that the advantages will not be overshadowed by those drawbacks.The greatest advantage can be seen when people are provided cheaper products is that they could save a great deal of money spent on daily expenses and thus, they invest that saving amount on other important aspects such as education or housing. In addition, it is particularly favorable for low-income families as they will have a wide range of options to improve their living standards. Ċ Another benefit is that there will be a rising demand for purchasing commodities due to the fall of price. As a result, the more expenditure people spend, the faster the national economy grows. Not only are manufacturers beneficial but also other parts of a supply chain take advantage of this phenomenon. Ċ To sum up, it seems to me that the advantages for consumers and the economy of buying cheaper products these days have more than compensated for the downsides

prompt: Some people think that trial marriage is currently a positive trend for youngsters in order that they know each other better before marriage. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Nowadays, the rate of divorce surges to a great extend, and one of the reasons is, the life partners do not know each other properly or any of them is not able to satisfy physically, which make people think about that engaging in cohabitation is good or bad before the marriage. I partially agree with the above notion and the reasons for my inclination are articulated in the following paragraph. Ċ To commence with, the pre-married situations are a good to create a strong base to the relationship and there are many advantages of it. Firstly, both the partners can know each others good and bad habits and after knowing that, they can decide to marry. Secondly, they can easily identify the future skills or responsibilities require to be part of the family, which diminish the number disputes in the later life. Lastly, it provides a better mental health. For example, singles and divorced people are mentally disturbed; while happily married or pre-married couples are more satisfied with their life. Ċ On the flip side, the live in relationships is having many dangers, and one of them is the pregnancy, as the couple is not fully financially independent. Moreover, the only option for them is abortion, which is perilous for the health of a mother in the long run. Furthermore, if they decide to give birth, the child is not legal because parents are not officially married.In addition to that, pregnancy may become the reason for the divorce if any one of the partners is playing with another. For instance, if they give birth to child without planning, it might turn to the adverse conditions. Ċ To conclude, however cohabitation is advantageous as it not only provides the freedom to partners get familiar with each other, but also offers good mental health; it is having the major risk of becoming pregnant and immature parents, which negatively affect the growth of a child in the future.

prompt: It would be better for them to be outside playing sports and taking part in more traditional pastimes than spending all day indoors. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay: As technology is advancing in a rapid way, people are increasingly getting into the electronic entertainment world. The perspective of having more children following indoor activities rather than outdoors has to be discussed further. Ċ To start off with, children nowadays asks for computers or gadgets for their presents not a bike or a scooter. This is clear that kids are more interested in what best game to play or which console is perfect. Having children consuming their energy by sitting in front of a computer or on a sofa all day is not healthy at all. At a young age, they should not be left being lazy cause that will lead to health problems in their growing process. Ċ On the other hand, today one can find various outdoor activities that are good for children. Considering the large number of parks one can find nowadays, parents should take children to help them grow into physical activities and interaction with others. It is proven that communication skills between children of ages up to 5 years are better in those kids that play and communicate with other kids of same age. They learn how to share, how to talk and play with others that are not easily retrieved by staying inside playing on a computer. Ċ In conjunction to outdoor activities, any sort of sport is another subject that will help kids to be healthy and active. Swimming is a simple and inexpensive sport to introduce to children at an age of even 1 year old. It will increase the challenge, satisfaction and health in young children. Ċ To conclude, in my opinion, I think that teaching kids to be actively outside and limit the use of using electronic devices will help them balance between indoor and outdoor activities.

prompt: Question: If you could study a subject that you have never had the opportunity to study, what would you choose? Explain your choice, using specific reasons and details.
essay: Subject is area of knowledge studied in schools or boarders. If I would have opportunity to study a subject, I do not know yet. I think that I would choose to study religion more deep. I am very like about religion. I ever studied about it until bajuri book. However, I am interested to study more high again. Ċ I think it is very interesting to know knowledge about religion from bajuri, jannah, and om. It is book that give many knowledges about Islam law until root it. For example, it explains about married law. I think that every persons interested about it because each persons has wanted for getting married. However, some people have not many knowledges about responsibility establishing household. Ċ Another important for studying religion can know about cause of several matters that forbidden by Islam law such why we forbidden to eat pig and dog. I think that all forbidden there is because of it. That is all explained in om book. Hence, I am very curious about many becauses from forbidden. I want to know about it. Ċ In conclusion, I think that if time gave me self realization, it makes me to get more opportunities for reaching what I want. However, time never wait us. It always rotates on its axis. It makes us to forward because the world increasingly sophisticated. Therefore, we should study many skills that can compete with abroad.

prompt: Some people think that government should be responsible for crime prevention, while others believe it the responsibility of individual to protect themselves. Ċ Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay: According to some in order to deal with violations in the world authorities should have to come forward,whereas, others opin that it is everyone's own duty to talk care of themselves. I personally partially agree with both viewpoints and I will elaborate on both these viewpoints in the upcoming paragraphs. Ċ On one hand, the state is the main strength of any country as they make laws for the betterment of their citizens. If government make strict rules and punishments for the criminal and set an example so that the other Violent people learn something from that punishment and will later on not try to do the same crime then this problem can be resolved to a large extent.For example, Paris is the country where the rules are very strict for criminals, as a result,the crime rate over there is almost negligible. Ċ On the other hand, other people believe that everyone should have to be aware of their protection. As cops or other guards can't be around everyone all the time.There are some situations where folks have to work smartly to protect themselves. For example, the masses should have to learn some basic safety tricks and tricks to protect their own to become a victim of any crime and for this teachers, parents should have to teach their kids since from their childhood about their safety. Ċ In conclusion, although the government can take some necessary steps against the prevention of crimes, yet I personally believe that this situation can be resolved with the collaborative effort of the government, individuals and society on the whole.

prompt: You have just returned home from a holiday and have received photographs from a friend who was on holiday with you. Ċ Write to your frind thanking them for the photographs. You should include: Ċ -a description of the photos Ċ -the most memorable thing about the holiday Ċ -invite them to come and stay with you
essay: Hi Amy, Ċ How are you? I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to thank you for the photos and an unforgettable trip. Ċ I can not thank you enough for showing me your city and landmarks. Last week, I received the photos you've sent to me. Looking at the photos brings me so many happy memories of the time we spent together so vividly. I especially like the one we took in front of the zoo. I really enjoyed feeding koalas and kangaroos. That was such an amazing experience and I will never forget it. Australia is certainly a scenic country with remarkable landscapes and wildlife, particularly up in the north where you live. Ċ Next time, why don't you plan a holiday and stay with me in Japan next spring? The weather is great at that time of year and besides my husband and I will be celebrating our wedding anniversary. I could take you to see beautiful cherry blossoms and a famous castle. The scenery is spectacular. I'm sure you will love it. I'd be delighted if you could come and celebrate with us. Ċ Take care. And I'm looking forward to hearing from you soon.

prompt: Although more and more people are reading the news on the internet, most people still prefer reading the news in a newspaper. Ċ What are your views?
essay: Since, the popularity of the Internet has been inclined, a plethora of masses prefers the news on it, whereas there are still some who choose a magazine for reading the news rather than the online articles. In my opinion, though the internet has brought several benefits, especially, broadcasting news in the online media, the journal is incredibly beneficial in order to improve mental capacity and learning habits. Ċ On the one hand, it is undeniable fact that the internet has revolutionized the way of reading news. This is because it is convenient to study the news articles at any location and time with the help of the Internet. In this contemporary era, people use various social networking sites such as Facebook and Instragram, where millions of the news on different topics are uploaded on a regular basis. For instance, a recent survey reveals that over thousands of the online articles can be published every day. Furthermore, it is inexpensive, so that it not only saves the person's money, but also saves time to visit to market for purchasing the books. Ċ On the flip side, the number of people continues to utilise the journal to keep updating about what is happening across the world in order to develop regular studying habits and foster the relationship. In other words, people are busy in their hectic employment and it becomes challenging to manage time for developing the creativity and knowledge through reading news. Similarly, this practice not only assists to develop intellectual ability, but also helps to alleviate stress and work burden. Moreover, the older generation would rather unfamiliar with latest technological advancement or never want to change their traditional way of reading the news. Hence, they still prefer to embrace the current news through the magazines. For example, my grandfather always reads a newspaper in the morning with colleagues. Consequently, it builds the strong relationship with them and enhances their knowledge as well. Ċ In conclusion, even though reading news on the Internet could be convenient and the cheapest, the newspaper would be the best choice for the elderly as well as in the far away places where internet facilities would inaccessible in order to strength relationships and improve the learning habits.

prompt: Question: Private car ownership has grown grammatically in recent years. This has led to a rise in traffic congestion. What could governments and individuals do to reduce congestion?
essay: Growing car ownership has become a matter of great concern in the recent years. There are several effects caused by this adverse trend, one of them that interests quite a lot of government as well as people in society is traffic congestion. However, I believe, there are several measures to overcome this problem. Ċ In today's modern society, a person who own cars is not a considerable thing. Along with this, related issues can be anticipated. To tackle these problems, I think the most obvious solution would be that government could tax car at a high level. The advantage of this policy is that the one who would like to purchase a car will have to consider carefully before they spend a large amount of money on this. Ċ Another opinion is that government could make and ban enforces laws for these transport types. For example, we need to stipulate clearly that which streets the cars are or not allowed to run in. Besides, for the streets where the traffic jam is frequently take place, we might restrict an active time for these transports, especially, at rush hours. Ċ Furthermore, traffic congestion could be significantly declined if there are contributions from each individual in society. Besides seriously obeying the traffic laws, each person could reduce their dependence on cars, instead they can travel by the public transports such as buses, train, ect. Ċ In conclusion, various measures can be taken to combat the problems that are certain to arise as the ones who possess cars growing up quickly year after year.

prompt: Most people accept that we now live in a globalized world but not everyone agrees that this is beneficial. To what extent is globalization a positive or negative development?
essay: Globalization is everywhere now and so, while some people approve of it, there are others who do not accept that it would be a benefit. There are a variety of positive developments, nevertheless, this does have some negative developments that need to be considered. Ċ Firstly, globalization has led to many futuristic developments and has a great impact on society. Furthermore, it had opened up to free trade and communication with other nations and thus, have improved technology, education, health care and consumer goods worldwide. For example, one of the most delicious products that have been enjoyed in everywhere, Nutella, which gets its ingredients from several countries. Ċ On the other hand, globalization had, unfortunately, led to homogenous cultures, which unfortunately made the unique cultures and languages of each distinct country extinct. For instance, Sri Lanka has many languages with the most prominent being Sinhalese and Tamil but there is a risk of more people speaking English and other languages in the future due to further studies and job opportunities abroad. Another drawback is that, it has also given rise to certain environmental issues. Due to the increased consumption and production of products. As follows, due to the rising demands of wood for doors and furniture of new houses built for people moving in from another country, could in turn lead to large areas of trees cut down and consequently, causing deforestation. Ċ In conclusion, living in a globalized world, has improved technological innovations, consumer goods, as well as, educational-wise, nonetheless, it could lead to homogenous cultures and many stressful environmental problems due to drastic production and consumption. Considering the above reasons, the negative movement appears to overrule the positive movement.

prompt: Some people think that in order to deal with the problem of congestion in cities, privately owned vehicles should be banned in city centers, while others consider this to be an unrealistic solution. Ċ Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay: In recent decades, private vehicle ownership has boomed as car prices have started to go down, therefore allowing more individuals to purchase them. Some people believe that personal cars are the main reason city centres are congested, hence they should be prohibited, while others argue that this idea is impossible. My opinion is that city centres are too crowded and measures should be put in place to restrict access to personal vehicles. Ċ To begin with, many people think that an excellent solution for solving the overcrowding of town's centres would be to stop private automobiles from entering this area. That is because the air and noise pollution rates are really high, especially due to an enormous number of workplaces and business buildings. In other words, many employees live in the city’s outskirts and commute every day to the centre using their cars. Moreover, some city centres were built centuries ago and have small and narrow lanes, so traffic jams are more common here than in any other area. For instance, cities like Rome, London, or Paris have already introduced measures for banning private cars in order to stop traffic congestion. Ċ On the other hand, many individuals have the opinion that banning car owners to bring their cars into the city centre is an impossible solution due to a lot of difficulties citizens may face. One of the reasons is the fact that a lot of employees live in suburbs and a lot of them do not have public bus routes to use to go to work. Also, real estate is really expensive in city centres so some people cannot afford to buy or rent an apartment downtown. For instance, London rents are so expensive that people prefer to commute from nearby cities, like Winchester or Southampton, instead of renting a place there. However, these difficulties could be resolved if governments and councils introduced new bus services or lowered the high-speed railways' fees. Ċ To conclude, although many issues make banning privately owned vehicles a difficult measure, I believe that the authorities should create programs that would benefit both the commuters and the urban area’s infrastructure.

prompt: Many processed foods and ready-made meals contain preservatives and additives . what are advantages to this? Do you think advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay: Since a few years ago, too many people are busier than before. For that reason, many companies around the world are developing options to cover the nutrient necessities. Those options of food include a lot of products to endure longer in the fridge. This essay will discuss the advantages and disadvantages of ready-made males and fast food consumption. Ċ On the one hand, ready to serve food is faster and cheaper. Since some people have longer labour journeys, they do not have time to cook. Then, buying this type of product is saving several hours to develop another activity. For example, some may prefer to go to the gym while others would choose to read a book. Also, several individuals never skip lunch because they always have something to eat. Otherwise, some would only eat chips or chocolates which are usually more expensive. Ċ On the other hand, good nourishment is not secure due to the chemicals contained in these products. For instance, while some individuals are allergic to some natural components, it is known that a small percentage of users could present an allergic response. Moreover, most companies are using too many plastic products to store and sell their products. It is causing environmental problems that would be worse in the future if people sustain the consumption of it. Ċ To conclude, definitely more and more workers, parents and, students are solving economic and time problems by using this kind of nutrition. In my view, the advantages outweigh the disadvantages. However, responsible consumption is needed in order to diminish the increasing global warming.

prompt: organising the olympics Holding Olympic Games is an exciting event. Some people think it has positive effects while others argue that it is a waste of money. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: That whether a country should host the Olympic Games has aroused a considerable controversy. While some people deem that it could bring enormous advantages, others assume that the nation would squander a substantial amount of money on it. In my opinion, I partly agree with the former statement. Ċ On the one hand, there are some justifications why a handful of people contend that being the host nation is a waste of money. This is because the country have to squander a host of money on constructing the state-of-the-art facilities for Olympic Games. If the national government is unable to compensate for its crushing financial loss, the country will be burdened with enormous debts. For example, in 2004, the starry-eyed government of Greek spent huge amount of money investing on up-to-date facility without considering its long-term use, resulting in its debt crisis for over two decades. Ċ On the other hand, it should not be forgotten that organizing Olympic Games could exert profound effects on the host nation's economy. It is because the country cost nothing to be its image to the world during the time the Olympic Games takes place. This led to the rapid development of tourism as well as other pieces of work relating to this special event. For instance, the 1992 Olympic Games in Barcelona produced 88.7 percent of the city's decrease in unemployment. Ċ In conclusion, despite the fact that the country could suffer from financial damages, being the host of the Olympic Games would open up ample opportunities to stimulate its economic growth.

prompt: Too much money is wasted on repairing old buildings that should be used to knock them down and build new ones. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Nowadays there have been so much money spent to repair old buildings. But I think instead of repairing them, they should be broken & new buildings should be built. Ċ There is a clear evidence that day by day so many buildings are turning into abandoned wastages in city areas which are causing harm to the environment of the places. Moreover, many people are living in those old buildings & that is risking their life severely. To keep them risk-free at a minimum rate, the building owners are somehow initiating some construction works to repair those buildings. But such a temporary step can never be a perfect solution to the main problem. As there is a chance that outworn buildings might face major collapses anytime without giving any pre-notice. That will lead to a massive accident. Ċ Such an issue can be solved by building new ones rather than repairing the old ones. The repairing process of old buildings will waste a lot of money & cause huge environmental pollution as well. Mostly that step won't bring in any positive outcome.
