On the other hand, new buildings can provide enough security to the people living there. Furthermore, that will turn into a permanent solution to the dwelling situation of many people. Money will be properly utilized in that process too. Additionally, there have been so many modern architectural innovations taken place in the modern world. The new buildings can get the touch of such innovation & become a significant piece of beauty. Ċ To summarize, repairing old buildings instead of building new ones doesn't look like a good idea at all. Therefore, I personally believe building new ones are a better approach than repairing the old ones.

prompt: The average age for individuals to give birth is increasing. Some people think that it will have negative impact on family and country. What is your opinion about this?
essay: In this present era, pregnancy and deciding a baby has also become modern. In a few people's opinions, this will have an adverse effect on the family and society. However, in my point of view, it's totally the individual's decision to decide their child's delivery and it has no negative impact. The goals and passion towards their work may make the person decide it later. Also, the fear and the commitments they have to face after the birth of an infant can make people think upon pregnancy in a later point of their life. Ċ To begin with, every individual has a dream and running hard every day to achieve the same. Few people think that the kid's birth may ruin their life goals. For instance, when a woman gives childbirth and when she doesn't have much support from her family, subsequently she will be the one who gives up her job. Rather she would have a lot of personal and professional commitments to be fulfilled, which indeed would be collapsed due to the new responsibility. Consequently, it's good if a person fulfils their dream at least to some extent and plan their baby. Ċ Secondly, people are frightened to decide upon delivery as there will be many responsibilities after the delivery of the toddler from medicine to studies. Therefore, people are preferring to get settled financially rather getting committed into a family zone. For example, a person from a poor background cannot afford even the medicine and the post-vaccination charges offered by some private hospitals. Next comes the luxurious schools and studies, which fascinates both parents and students, but to get into such big schools cost a large amount of money. As a result, couples from this contemporary generation have become smarter and deciding their babies accordingly. Ċ In conclusion, the dream towards their work and the cost of living is making the individuals anxious to decide upon a kid. As highlighted earlier, it's a decision taken between a father and a mother and the society has nothing to do or comment in an individuals life. Hence, from the above statements, I claim that there is no negative impact on giving birth to a child after the average age.

prompt: Some educationalist argue that non-exam, art-based subjects such as music, drama, art and craft, should be compulsory in the secondary-school curriculum. They believe that activities such as these can improve overall academic performance. Art-Based Subjects and Student's Performance
essay: Curriculum is the important aspect in educational system. Some educational experts believe that non-exam, art-based curriculum have to be applied in secondary schools because it can increase student's performance in the class. Others, however, believe that non-scientific subject such as music, drama, art, and craft only improve student's art skills. In this case, I strongly claim that art-based curriculum in secondary school is very useful in increasing student's useful skills and their academic performance. Ċ To begin with, the art-based subjects teach several vital skills for students such as confidence, team work and leadership. Firstly, art subject like singing, forces student to have good confidence. They must sing in front of others and show their voice. Secondly, taking drama as instance, pupils have to interact with each other to conduct a role well, so that it builds their social skill. After they involve in team work, their leadership skill is also gradually developed. So that, it is clear that pupil's skills are increased by art-based subject. Ċ Furthermore, the improving of their skills supports on their performance in learning. Art-based subject contain many activities which cover all student learning style; for example, Painting covers visual learning-style, kinesthetic style is covered by dancing, and singing can cover the student who is auditory. D' Potter, an educational expert launching his quantum teaching method in 2001, succeeded on improving student academic performance. His method developed by art method such as dancing before learning, using colour in remembering theory. Moreover, his experimented result showed that student motivation is improved by 80%. Ċ Taking everything into consideration, i totally agree that art-based subject more effectively in supporting student on getting optimal performance in school rather than scientific subject. Student predominant social skills will be improved and it is helpful for them in their future. In my view, teacher should apply learning method which cover student's learning style

prompt: When cars and cyclists use the same roads, there are often problems. Ċ Why is this the case? Ċ What are the solutions?
essay: Nowadays, the amount of transport is growing very quickly, while trail infrastructure is remaining to be as it was constructed in past times. The more variety of vehicles, the more difficulties appear, especially when such types as cars and bicycles are on the route simultaneously.The only decision to abolish this is expanding lanes and building new ones. Ċ The main reason for problems on the lane which car drivers and cyclists experience is that the major pathway was constructed many years ago when there were fewer participants. As a result, driveways are narrow and their capacity is not sufficient for the current circumstances. It creates dangerous situations and threatens the lives of drivers. For instance, the width of highways in many old cities does not allow a car and a bicycle to move next to each other, they should drive one in front of the other which creates traffic conjunctions and hazardous conditions on the roadway. Ċ To rectify this problem the governments should fund the building of new lane and improve transport infrastructure. Moreover, while designing new track schemes it is necessary to take into account all the types of vehicles that people use in their country. It means, the separated lines for cycling ought to be developed, as well as extra places for parking should be planned. For example, when the new bridge was built in Kyiv which connects two coasts of the city there were created a line for bicycles and places for leaving cars. It has noticeably improved the traffic and decreased the number of accidents. Ċ In conclusion, there is a peril for people who drive a car and bicycle in the same place of roads because there is too little space to not hamper each other. If the officials paid more attention and funded more money to reengineer existing roads, this problem would be solved and people could drive safely.

prompt: An increasing number of professionals, such as doctors and teachers, are leaving their own poorer countries to work in developed countries. What problems does this cause? What can be done to deal with this situation?
essay: Country development depends upon how well professionals are growing and it is undeniable, that more and more health workers and educators are migrating to other countries and leaving their undeveloped provincial behind. This essay will discuss the two main causes and solutions in detail with examples based on that. Ċ To begin, moving abroad for work is popular among experienced workers because of unsatisfactory jobs such as low wages. To explain further, qualified people like doctors and teachers don't get paid that much in their native place because of the poor economy. For example, Doctors who get their degree in 5 years and spent another 1 year in training will receive a poor amount of money as their salary and no incentive will have low satisfaction as compared to foreign individuals who get handsome money for their skills. Moreover, fewer career opportunities in poorer parts of the world is another reason for migration. So to conclude, lack of money and decrease in career growth makes some people travel to different places. Ċ Despite, many reasons are there to leave undeveloped nations and migrate.These problems can be resolved by increasing salary. In addition , introducing good governmental schemes for skilled jobs like teaching and medicine which will result in financial growth. For instance, 60% of the nurses move to other countries because of their high salary packages and incentives along with good pension schemes. To sum up, drifting of polished employees could be reduced by making enhancing annual income and giving bonus all over the year. Ċ In conclusion, growth and learning is a part of human development and some folks get settled abroad for bread and butter especially, medical people and educations trainers leaving their own place because of low income and lack of future options which can be solved by increment and acknowledgement at the workplace. This will surely help in future development.

prompt: Some people believe that elderly parents ought to live at senior homes. Other believe that they should 	live with family members. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: In the present age, there has been much discussion revolving around the issue of whether elderly people should live with their families or at senior homes. Many persons argue that it is better for them to spend their days at the retirement homes, while others believe that old parents always should be with their children. Personally, I am in favour of the latter view and I feel this way because of two reasons which I explain in the following essay. Ċ To begin with, the primary reason we have to take into consideration is that old people have many valuable experiences that are really beneficial for young individuals to know them. Furthermore, grandparents are able to share their successes and failures and give important advice to the next generations. For instance, they can speak to their grandchildren about life in the past and also the challenges that they will face in the future.  Ċ The second reason that is worth pointing out is that parents spend many years to grow their children in a good condition so it is not fair to leave them in a retirement house when they need more caring and attention. Moreover, all individuals have a responsibility to looking after their old parents and do not hurt their feelings. For example, if persons have tried to make a big family and do many things for them during the years, they will expect to spend their difficult days within their family. Ċ To sum up, I would like to say that I strongly disagree with the statement that old individuals ought to live at senior places. The main factor that we have to take into consideration is that there are advantages both for parents and kids. In fact, if they live with family members, will not feel lonely and in addition, they can provide much useable advice for young generations.

prompt: Some people think that the best way to increase road safety is to increase the minimum legal age for driving cars and riding motorbikes. Ċ To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In the present day, the security of roads and streets has been a substantial problem of public security. Governments have been created laws and awareness campaigns to alert people and; therefore, some adults believe increase the minimum legal age is the best solution to solve this problem and I totally agree with this assumption. This essay will explain why governments should think of this alternative and I will explain my point of view in detail. Ċ Although some individuals do not agree with the modification on the legal age for driving, these people should discuss more this topic since youngers do not have a complete awareness about their actions which leads to more accidents among this population. Otherwise, these people claim the act of driving so earlier is a sign of freedom whereas youngers would have more independence without the supervision of the adult. For instance, a sixteen-year-old boy driving could assume in parts the control of his life. In addition, the culture of teaching a son drives is an ingrained habit in many families. Ċ In some parts of North America, the legal age for driving is sixteen but according to some international research in this moment of life, teenagers are just starting to think about current issues on the planet, their concerns are innocent yet. For example, younger drivers around sixteen years are completely immature to assume a substantial responsibility such as the control of the car, the concerns with other lives in the traffic. Furthermore, they do not have control over alcohol drinks while they are driving, which leads to dangerous and serious accidents. The less age, the more inconsequential acts. For these reasons, I totally agree with the increase in the limit age to become a driver so that roads can be safer. Ċ In conclusion, governments and society should carefully think about the rules to become a driver, since the number of accidents has been increasingly present among youngers. This essay discoursed why authorities should discuss the full legal age and I explained my opinion.

prompt: The main reason people go to work is to earn money. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Some people think work is just a way of maintenance, and a job is as well paid as its salary is. In this essay I'm going to discuss why I disagree with the thought that having a job is only for making money. Ċ One of the arguments used to defend that position is that without a job you can't earn money, and money is neccessary to live. Though I agree at some point with this view, above all when it comes to families with no other way to survive, we can observe in our socienty a lot of examples of people working for no remuneration. Volunteers, charities and non-paid interships. Some of them feel they are paid enough with the wellness obtained from contributing to make a better world and to help other people. In the case of interns, they make their job very often without any grant or fellowship, just for the pleasure of learning or gaining some experience. But there are other little gorup of people with patrimony big enough to live their whole lives without having a job, but even then, they work for different reasons: to feel useful people, to mantein all the efforts their ancestor did, or to fill in their artistic ambitions. Ċ The other main argument is that salary is a good tester of success and one of the most important criteria for people when the choose a job. But I think other factors as working near your home, schedules, prospective promotion, and good working enviroment are as important as salary and play an important role when making a decision. It's known there are fields (as researching, for example) where people develope a very important role not so well-paind. Ċ In conclussion, there are a lot of motivations for people to work, not only money although in same cases this is the imperative reason.

prompt: Tobacco is a kind of drug. People have been free to use it. Some people think that it should be illegal to use it comparing with other drugs. To what extent do you agree or disagree? What is your opinion?
essay: There are various kinds of drugs and Tobacco is one of them and there is no restriction to the people to use it. There is an argument that compared with other drugs such as Heroine and Pathedrine, tobacco should be banned. This essay totally disagrees with this view because nicotine has a different impact on human than other drugs and it can be used for health treatment. In my opinion, it is better to make a new regulation than banning. Ċ People have been smoking for a long time and it has been seen that its impact on health and society is different than other drugs. Alcohol, Heroine, Marijuana, Cocaine taking person behave a different way, such as they lose control over themselves, use slang language or start fight to an unknown issue. For example, there was a study at the University of New South Wales on domestic violence where alcoholic persons are more keen to involve in a violent activity than smokers. Moreover, smoking cigarettes help people to have a short relief from their stress and anxiety. People smoke because they take it as a self medication. Therefore, banning tobacco products will create a social chaos where these smokers will go anywhere to buy their cigarettes. Ċ Smoking has lots of negative effects on healths such as lung cancer, heart disease, tuberculosis, but it might be used for good health products. Researchers have found that Marijuana can be used for the treatment of Alzimer sickness. Similarly nicotine can be used for other disease and making tobacco illegal will not give any chance to have more research. However, Governments need to have a clear law on producing tobacco and its related products where the companies will have to act and follow the regulation. In addition to this, banning smoking in a public place should be the first priority because it harms passive smokers. Ċ In conclusion, individuals have been smoking for a long time and there was no banning on it because it does not have an immediate impact like other drugs. Sometimes people smoke to release mental pressure and it could be used for future medication. It is predicted that, there will be global rules for smoking tobacco.

prompt: Topic Show the similarities and differences in the ways that two cultures celebrate an important event, such as a birthday, wedding, or funeral.
essay: All countries in the world are unique. Obviously, countries are different from one another in location, size, language, climate, lifestyles and culture. Vietnam and America are also in this cycle. Due to the tremendously differences in culture, they have their very own ways to celebrate their wedding. Ċ The significant similarity between American weddings and Vietnamese weddings is that event is a milestone in everyone's life. It marks their maturity as the bride and groom are going to build their own family with a lot of responsibilities. In addition, it is a time when family, relatives and close friends reunite to congratulate on their new life and bless the brides and grooms. Ċ However, Vietnamese weddings and American weddings are various in location, time, and how they hold the ceremony. While American people, who believe in God, often arrange their wedding in church, Vietnamese weddings usually take place at home or in a luxurious hotel. Another difference is the way they conduct the wedding. In America, after the brides walk through the aisles, everyone will listen to the toasts given by the best men or bridesmaids. Then the bride and groom will make their vows, put the rings on one another finger and share a kiss. After the ceremony, the American newly-wed couples will go on a honeymoon. On the contrary, the most fundamental etiquette in Vietnamese weddings is praising their ancestors. Afterwards, the bride will be taken to groom's house for the other similar etiquette. Unlike weddings in America, which often last for few hours, Vietnamese weddings may take place in one or even two days. Ċ Although Vietnam and America have something in common, there are remarkable differences that make each country unique and creative. That is what make the world extraordinary.

prompt: Many keep pets in their home; however they do not take care of the well being of the pet animals. How can you keep the pets while attending their well being also. Discuss?
essay: From time immemorial human beings trained animals and kept as pets for hunting, as messenger, security, for transportation and in order to get rescued. Dominent pet animals are Dogs, Cats, Horses, Birds, Horses, fishes etc. Often these animals are under captivity and are unattended therefore leading to an unconscious cruelty towards the animals. Ċ Lack of technical knowledge about the animals habitat will leads the animal's life in a terrible risk. Particularly exotic animals of a different habitat required food of their own habitat. Lack of knowledge about their habitat will lead the animal into its slaughter house. Thought animals can be trained in the long run initially they have to be well treated. Ċ Nowadays fish tanks are decorative items in most of the visiting rooms. Sometimes these fish tanks are becoming death chambers. Feeding habits, pH value, temperature, salinity are some of the remarkable reasons behind it. Ċ Fishes are categorised as lower lying and upper lying fishes based on their movement in water. If the feeding has done only in the upper areas of the fish tank the lower lying fishes won't survive for long. PH value determines the acid alkali ratio of the water. Acid and alkali concentration also has to be taken into account and should be maintained. Temperature and salinity also plays a major role in the survival of fishes. Ċ If properly attended pets will show its loyalty, gratitude and reciprocation towards their master. The lethargic attitude that human beings show towards their pets always threatens the animal's life. Vetenary doctors and trainers are guides to take care of the pets. Internet also provides vital information regarding the exotic breeds of animals and their habitats.

prompt: "some people choose a career according to the social status and salary it will give them. Others choose a career according to whether they will enjoy the work." Which do you think is best way to choose a career? Give reasons for your answer and include relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. The Best Ways of Selecting a Professional Career
essay: Selecting a career path is one of the most critical choices in one's life. However, the reasons of which people are selecting their careers upon are varied from one person to another. Although contested by many, it is argued that selecting a career that you enjoy working with is more beneficial. This can be proven by analyzing how it can help improve both productivity and happiness among people. Ċ When people do something because they like it, they usually product better by bringing new ideas and working harder to produce the perfect product. A research took place at Osmania University in India three years ago, showed that people who like their jobs are never late and never leave early. Moreover, they take a minimum time for lunch break. In fact most of them have lunch while working. As this example shows, better productivity is attributed to selecting a career that you enjoy. Ċ In addition, people feel happier in their life when they like their work. For instance, one of my friends who works as a doctor and is picking up a huge salary, complains all the time about his work and the pressure that he is facing. While his brother who is a painter is very happy with his work, even when his income is much smaller than his brother's. it is clear that people get happy when they work in a field that they enjoy. Ċ In a nutshell, I can confidently say that choosing a career that you enjoy working with makes you both a better worker in the society and happier. Hence, I hope that people consider what work they like to do more than anything else.

prompt: Countries are becoming more and more similar because people are able to buy the same products anywhere in the world. Do you think this is a positive or negative development? country losing its identity by selling foreign products
essay: In today's world, people can purchase goods from another country with just one click or phone call. There are people who think that this is a bad incident because it will change the countries to become more look alike. It is a controversial discussion and thinks it is a negative progress. I am going to talk about it in more details in following paragraphs. Ċ On one hand, each country has its own unique culture that fits best for their people. The culture includes of how they dress and what they use. For example, the culture in my country is to wear hijab, it is a way of dressing and it is specific to here. I think foreign clothes are not the best choice here, but they are available and affecting the way people dress directly. In my opinion, a country that loses its traditions will be left with nothing the future. Ċ On the other hand, there are a few countries in the world that have strong industries, when people buy everything from other countries, it certainly going to help these countries economy. Instead, it will kill the local industries, because they can not compete against countries like China. For instance, in a period in my country, it was trending to use foreign products instead of our own goods. It led to a huge disaster in the economy and lots of companies became broke. Ċ In conclusion, two ideas were presented in this essay. Overall, I think using foreign products can have bad effects on the countries. The country will both lose their identity and economy.

prompt: Some people think that in order to prevent illness and disease, governments should make efforts in reducing environmental pollution and housing problems To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statements?
essay: Many individuals think that reducing environmental pollution and also housing problems can be one of the most viable solutions in order to prevent illness and disease. In my opinion, although many diseases that are related to environmental issues can be prevented by reducing pollution, personally housing problems should be considered in a wider view. The aim of this essay is to discuss the argument and it will represent relevant examples. Ċ To begin with, it is important to bear in mind that environmental pollution can have many serious detrimental impacts on the human body. For example, it should be considered that lung cancers are more common amongst people who have been living in the industrial region due to air pollution. Furthermore, even noise pollution can cause adverse effects on people’s health conditions mentally. Consequently, doubtlessly considerable effort should be spent by the authorities in order to provide a better healthy environment to their societies. Ċ Secondly, the lack of housing rights in conjunction with the absence of the other fundamental rights such as accessibility of clean water and paid employment, are able to cause rampant consequence on individuals’ health. The improvement of people's condition should be provided by the government however the sole effort on housing problems can not be beneficial in order to prevent illness. Hence, to create a healthier society, the government should make efforts on the fundamental right of people in a wider view instead of only solving housing problems. Ċ To conclude, many individuals thought that efforts should be made by the government for reducing pollution and housing problem in order to prevent illness and disease. Environmental pollution has the potential to cause an adverse impact on humans health situations nevertheless this essay thought that only solving the housing problem should not be an adequate solution to prevent diseases, therefore it should be dealt with in a larger perspective.

prompt: Many people are treating pets as their own family member. What are the problems and their solutions? getting too emotionally attached with pets
essay: Parents in numerous families consider domestic animals, as their own children. This essay will discuss about the fundamental issue associated with such ubiquitous way of behaving pets as family and suggest its relevant solution. Ċ People definitely will have atrocious psychological effect after the loss of their loved ones. In a similar way, people with great attachment toward their pets are expected to have same effect. People often keep pets for the good companionship and eventually, end up being too emotionally attached with them. The lifespan of most common pets, particularly of dogs and cats, is considerably less than that of humans. It is therefore, most likely that people will face the loss of their pet in their lifespan. As a result, people tend to suffer from different mental illness and even lack acumen in doing general work. For instance, many psychologists are having regular patients frequently suffering mentally from the death of their pets. Ċ The principal solution to this harmful problem may be keeping more than one pet at a time or preferably of different genders of same breed. This not only can have opportunity of having young ones if different sexes were allowed to mate but also help people to cope with the situation when one of the pets sadly dies. People, these days, are practicing of having 3 or 4 pets, mostly of different breeds or species to have better security of fellowship. Ċ Therefore, getting too emotionally attached with pets is the main problem of treating them as family, which can be solved by having more pets than having only one pet. Hence, it is somewhat innocuous solution to the problem which otherwise can have violent effect on one's psychological state..

prompt: Some think Government spending on Infrastructure (Transport, Housing etc) is considered the most important for a nation. While others believe that Education, Health and HR values to be more important areas for government expenditure. Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay: Although many would argue that the expenditure on developmental activities is more significant, others and I feel that funds utilised on public welfare healthcare, education because of people are more essential for a state than developmental activities. This essay discusses both sides' arguments followed by my opinion on public welfare. Ċ It is clear that public well-being should be at the highest priority to any state as these are very basic and essential for everyone. Providing better healthcare to the public will enable them to keep healthy which will have a positive effect on their lifestyle and also contribute to the GDP of a nation through their work produced in any sector. Likewise, education plays an important role in nation-building. It enables more folk to acquire knowledge and skills in a particular field which ultimately have a positive effort on their productivity and have a good lifestyle. it is therefore agreed that funding for the welfare of the public is a very worthwhile decision. For example, a person who graduates from a university with good skills and is employed in any sector indirectly contribute to the development of that sector. Ċ However, many disagree and feel that developmental movement such as infrastructure, transportation, housing will enable the public to have a good environment, easy access to places or can travel without any connectivity issue and good facilities to the community etc. But, it will significantly raise the borrowings of the government, which ultimately have more negative effects on the public like higher tax collection, security issues and this essay disagrees investing in development action is more crucial than the former one. Thus, it is always good to build a nation from what we have rather than borrowing from other sources. For instance, if a region is fully facilitated of amenities thru debt but the basic needs related facilities are not for the public which converts into a hard condition to live there. Ċ In conclusion, while the benefits of public prosperity, particularly health and education, allow better returns in the manner of overall development of individuals, some still feel that society should be wary of this investment and not allow it, though ,as long as it is essential to keep in mind the importance of funding in public benefit, the educational and healthcare benefits are clearly positive.

prompt: Individuals can do nothing to change society.Any new developments can only be brought about by governments and large institutions. How far do you agree or disagree?
essay: A great number of changes or new developments were brought about by big organizations or governments in the past history.This led a great many of people to believe that individuals are not able to change the society. Ċ Take the amazing industrial achievement of former Soviet Russia as an example.The whole nation achieved 90 per cent of industrialization within ten years by the incorporation of industrial factories.This made it possible for different factories to get the highest production because the advantages were combined together .Government policies were also the key factor contributed to the rise of Soviet Russia.The economy developed in a short time for the reason that official policies adjusted the nation's development pattern,boosting all the people to contribute and work hard for their motherland. Ċ Although a lot of historical evidence like I mentioned above could be found to support the fact that the new developments are always brought about by big organizations,individuals are still proved to be able to make contribution to the whole society.For instance,physics developed a lot after the discovery of gravity.It is on the base of gravity that physics scientists could be able to put up with various theories and explore universe.This discovery,however,is found by an individual named Newton.As a result ,we can know that individuals can also bring about new and beneficial developments to change the society. Ċ To sum up,I don't think that individuals cannot bring influences or changes to society.They,like governments and large organizations ,are also the part of society.Therefore.they can also do something to change society.

prompt: Some people believe that the government should take care of old people and provide financial support after they retire. Other say individuals should save during their working years to fund their own retirement. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: Certain individuals declare that granting the economic assistance and caring of the old population to be catered by the state, while others object this notion, saying that it is the responsibility of the person to preserve the money for their retirement during the youth. My personal perspective is although it is a burden, the authority should fund the elderly crowd because the state has an obligation to do so. Ċ To begin with, arranging the financial assistance and looking after the whole elderly community is an extremely difficult task for the government. This is because, the ruling authorities have a plethora of other domains such as health, education to develop, and deploying a large sum for funding the elderly can compromise other sectors. For an instance, recently, Sri Lanka restricted the large annual budget, which was devoted to granting living allowances the elderly, and diverted this budget to the sector of education to be more benefited and productive. However, I disagree with this notion because disregarding the older population is ethically incorrect. Ċ On the other hand, implementing strategies to comfort the life of old people is an obligation of the government. In fact, these people productively contributed to the nation during their youth through involving the workforce, and neglecting them in their old age is morally unacceptable. Hence, the country should facilitate their life during the old age. For an example, recently in India, people have protested against the ruling party and compelled to give a pension to all retired individuals because they have served and contributed to the country during their youth. Therefore, I agree with this school of thoughts because the state is responsible for the every category of people in the community. Ċ In conclusion, national policies should be established to care and fund the elderly population. This is because, the nation has a strong accountability to safeguard these people, who work for the country, despite the fact that devoting a large budget for the elderly is a great hardship for the ruling party.

prompt: In countries all over the world, the volume of road traffic is increasing at a faster rate than new roads are built. What are the causes of this problem? What are some potential solutions?
essay: Nowadays, all over the world transport congestion is oscillating in a tremendously than the new road are constructed. This essay will discuss about the possible incentives for these trends as well as some mitigate which can be procrastinate to get rid of issues. Ċ One of the main reasons for travel jam is overpopulation. As the number of people all over the globe is escalating day by day, their demand of vehicles for transportation is mushrooming. For instance, a recent investigation concluded that around the globe every year, 5% people are rocketing which demanding more vehicles every year. Moreover, the private vehicle such as car, bike and other vehicles are rocketing each year due to the demand for individuals working or survey purposes giving a hand in traffic issues. To exemplify, nowadays people prefer private vehicles to go to work as class as it's convenient and comfortable for them. For example, people have to travel far from your hometown and public bus, take a long time to reach their so if they have to go to subject or work it's very difficult for them. So, they prefer private vehicles which cause traffic jam. Hence, overpopulation as well as increase private vehicles increasing service problem. Ċ In order to alleviate the above problem government have to play a key role. If they give more prominence on the public transportation like bus with a reasonable cost and comfy it will assist to reduce the problem because it will decrease in number of vehicles. Furthermore, private vehicles need to be banned for office time. This timetable rule should be made by the government to reduce no of vehicles. For instance, in office time hrs if private vehicle is not allowed to drive, then only public transport will be there and there will be a decrease in travel jam. Therefore, Government strict rule and focus on public transport is necessary. Ċ To sum up, although overpopulation and private vehicles have become major causes of transportation congestion, it can be mitigated by the strict rules and regulation of the authority with more priority in public vehicles.

prompt: some people think that the best way to solve the problem of poverty in many countries is to set up businesses and improve trade links with rich countries. cooperation with richer, developed states is beneficial
essay: Establishing new companies in poor countries and rising trade with developed countries is interesting idea to deal with the poverty. Ċ The connection between poor and rich countries help their business is easier.For example, the international companies can help poor countries by contruct a factory to provide jobs for citizen and taxes for goverment build up their countries.In addition,trade links with rich coutries bring to poor coutries many benefits from technology, it can help them solve power resources, industry or medical,such as new modern technical construction can help developing nation decreasing a lot of time build up the facilities. Ċ In my experience,base on the knowledge of rich countries, poor countries can learn a lot of helpful policy in training their people.For instance, if people are taught reading,writing and mathematics,they can improve their own live without outside help.Moreover,they can set up their own small businesses making local goods such as furniture and then they can be sold for export. Ċ In conclusion,maybe poor countries can solve their trouble, but it will be solved quickly and easily by connect with developed nation. Increasing trade links and establishing businesses with rich countries is the best way to improve the financial and economy in many countries.

prompt: In many countries these days, the number of people continuing their education after school has decreased, and the range of courses available at universities and colleges has also increased. Do you think this is a positive of negative development?
essay: Nowadays, education plays a vital role in our life, from the moment we start going to school, till the day we find the job of our dreams. But, in the past few years, more and more people choose not to achieve higher education, while universities have significantly increased their courses. But, do the pros outweigh the cons in this situation? In my opinion, not continuing in higher schooling has a mixture of positive and negative aspects, and in this essay I will discuss why. Ċ Firstly, most individuals do not continue their learning since they want to start earning money and become independent. This is a result of our over consumptive society, and it is unavoidable. Consequently, job positions that otherwise would not be preferred are getting filled up, prospering some undervalued sectors of our economy. To illustrate, the Greek government, issued a study in 2010 which proved that, due to the lack of students going to University the Farming sector had seen a rise of more than 12%. On the other hand, the lack of further learning in the general population, results in a significant decrease in our education level, with consequences in our society’s future. Ċ Regarding the increase in course range, this has two opposite outcomes. On the one hand, it gives students the opportunity to pick exactly what they wish to pursue, rather than something they did not really desire. On the other hand, it makes it more difficult for some students that are not sure for their future to decide, possibly leading them into quitting study. For example, from my own experience as a student, because of the hundreds of options I had to choose from, and my insecurities about pursuing what I liked, I led myself to leaving school and started working in a restaurant. Lastly, it must be noted that, the effects of the huge range of courses are different for every student. Ċ Taking everything into consideration, there are pros and cons, regarding people not attending University. But, it’s my firm belief that, individuals must plan ahead and have the appropriate help from home, in order to take the best possible decision for themselves.

prompt: Some people think that strict punishments for driving offences are the key to reducing traffic accidents. Others, however, believe that other measures would be more effective in improving road safety. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion
essay: In recent times, the number of car accidents is increasing widely. There are a few solutions to lessen traffic accidents; Some argue that we should take stiff punishments like suspending driver’s license while others think that there are better acts suchlike educate folk to drive carefully. I believe the second opinion has a better outcome for making roads safer and declining car accidents. Ċ The primary reason people think stiff punishments are vital is that they believe these penalties can act as a deterrent, meaning that they directly affect careless driving styles, and, therefore, folk avoid repeating the same offence. There are various ways for direct punishment like ceasing a driver’s license, monetary fines, or even prison sentences. All of these methods have psychological effects and cause fear, so people try to obey the law to avoid trouble. For instance, last month police officer fined me 100$ for high-speed driving, and after that, I always pay attention to driving at a low and safe speed. Ċ On the other hand, I believe that safe driving can be promoted indirectly, which has better results. Firstly, it is pivotal to educate individuals properly before they are allowed to drive; this could be done in schools or even in the courses people take before driving tests. Secondly, governments or local councils could increase road safety by investing in better ways, such as installing more road signs to warn folks or speed bumps can be added to calm traffics. Finally, using public transport systems positively reduces car crashes because fewer folks travel by their cars. Ċ In conclusion, while direct penalties are helpful to prevent dangerous driving, I firmly believe that other measures should also be considered.

prompt: Too much money is spent on looking after and repairing old bulidings. Some people think money should be spent on buliding new modern buildings. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this view? new architecture at the expense of historic and cultural values?
essay: Nowadays, the rising brand new high buildings were filled in the cities, and the old ones be paid enough attention as well. Recently, there is a debet among the public that if it's worthy to spend more social resources on the new constructions. Ċ Those supporters regard that it would highly accord to a overall city program when we divided the areas with its fuction,such as commercial center, fitness center, with which provide more facilities to the citzens in their daily life. Besides, more new flats could alleviate the pressure of the house renting that urbanization brings. Meanwhile, it may be more atrractive to those investors. Ċ However, the new ones, in some way, have less historic and cultural values when campared to the buildings that withstand times, for countless museum were fund by this reason . Whats more, what we may paid in the new constractions is expensive, such as the environmental pollution and resource waste. Ċ In a word, In my opinion, making new buildings by destroying the old ones cannot resolve all the problems of urbanization. But the coexist may be a win-win choice.

prompt: TOPIC:  Some people argue that there is no point in persevering old buildings when land is so valuable in our cities. Others believe that old buildings are important part of our heritage and should be preserved  Discuss both these views and state your opinion.
essay: The preservation of old buildings always is a large question for governments because conflict between the issues of housing for citizens and the protection of our culture. In my opinion, all of the old building which contribute to our sense of culture should be conserved. Ċ There are different reasons which persuade that people should not restore old buildings. As a result of the rapid urbanization process, in which rural people must go to urban centers to look for job opportunities, the question of the preservation of old buildings has become more pressing. Because of that need, governments can construct more accommodation instead of preserving old buildings. Besides that, the preservation is very expensive because all components of old buildings have historical values. Ċ Old buildings are an essential part of history. Tourist often decide to discover the culture of a country when they visit through those old buildings. Therefore, managers of cities can earn more money from the attraction provided by old buildings and that amount can be spent on their conservation. Furthermore, the preservation of old buildings is also a ways to conserve our culture and everyone can learn much from them. Old buildings should be used as the culture museums and provide accommodation with more convenient for people who live there. . Many cities have development strategies as a city contains both unique and modern beauty, and that preservation help to finish half of work. Ċ Overall, both of those view have strong arguments: the need for housing or the expense of restoration contrast with our desire to conserve culture and attract tourism. So I think we should restore those building because old buildings process the most outstanding feature of areas which contain them.

prompt: Nowadays for many people the Internet is replacing regular books. What do you think will happen in the future and what is your opinion about this trend?
essay: With the rapid pace in technological development, the internet has been widely used in various aspects of our lives. For instance, it is very prevalent today for people to read books in the internet compared with decades ago. It is believed that the network development will continually impact people's reading habit, as will be now discussed. Ċ Firstly, it is not doubt that people can assess the books they like online in a convenient manner. The internet has been gradually replacing the physical existence of books. As a result, books publishers has developed electronic books for their customers to satisfy people's changing reading styles. Ċ In addition, libraries are losing their meaning since people rather read books online. Therefore, it is believed that traditional libraries will ultimately be forced to transform to online facilities. People can then assess the online reading materials using their memberships. Ċ Undoubtedly, the convenience of online reading does benefit us in certain ways. Due to the pace advancement in electronic devices, people can read everywhere, just like they are holding a real book. However, I personally prefer reading a real book over a virtual book. The reason is that I can keep my favorite books as collections on my bookshelf which cannot be done by electronic books. For health consideration, concentrating on a monitor for too long will result in detrimental effect on eyes, such as eyesight problem. Ċ All in all, it is for sure that the internet will substitute books in the future. this trend is beneficial to human being as the convenience of online reading is undeniable.

prompt: Some people argue that space exploration has had more to do with national pride than international effort. To what extent do you agree with this? How do you think space exploration will change in the future?
essay: Since 20th century, some countries have started exploring the space as this aims international effort. While it is utterly unacceptable since majority countries carry out this occasion only for their pride, I would argue in the future people will leave behind this program and concern in people's welfare. Ċ With concern in making their countries superior, some of governments do their best in space exploration albeit countries' income should be cut off. Anhar Gonggong, a well-known Indonesian historian, states that all developed countries compete in order to achieve a title as the most powerful country in this world. Taking cold war as sample, between 1947 and 1991, two fascinating countries which were America and Uni soviet performed their latest modern space breakthrough with aims to leave behind each other. This results in America being a well-known as the superpower country which had successfully landed in the moon. From such occasion, I believe this notion only brings benefit for national pride than international scale. Ċ Money is the main problem for such exploration. Wasting a great number of budgets is a pivotal consideration why worldwide governments have to think twice funding annual project. Norm Augustine, team leader of President Barack Obama's staff for space exploration, said NASA experiencing budget problems. In Forthcoming era, I believe people over the world tend to spend their countries' income through communities' welfare than carrying out space exploration. Ċ In conclusion, countries which explore the space only bring the prestigious awards for their nation rather than international importance. In any case, people will be bound to leave their dream in space exploration because of money needed.

prompt: The number of animals disappearing is increasing at an alarming rate . This essay will discuss several main factors that cause this situation and suggest some solutions.
essay: In my opinion, the growing rate of animal extinction was due to both on land and in sea reasons. Ċ First of all, on the ground, cutting down an enormous rain forest area leads to damage to wildlife habits. Therefore, animals will be put at a higher risk because they can not find home and face numerous difficulties adapting to the new living environment. Another factor that puts animals on the verge of extinction is that various human activities result in adverse impacts adversely on the marine environment. For example, waste discharged from factories and residents' houses and oil spills during extraction contaminate water, which poses a serious threat to marine species. Ċ Solving these problems requires the collaboration of Government, Business Company, and Residents. First of all, stricter punishment should be imposed on illegal logging, overexploitation, deforestation, and overfishing. Next, Businesses and Companies should install proper waste treatment systems to freshen wastewater before discharging it to land, river, and ocean. The government should also provide financial support to organizations fighting for environmental rights and action to run the campaign to raise people's environmental awareness. And lastly, the educational program should be adjusted to include more knowledge about the harmful consequence of the pollution for animals' existence. Ċ In conclusion, if there are no proper solutions, animals will suffer from a higher risk of extinction, which results in undesirable negative effects on the ecosystem.

prompt: Some people prefer to take a position in a company and work for the company. Other people think is better to go into business for themselves.Which do you think is better?
essay: There are many kinds of jobs in society. Some of them are done by companies that related to government, and some of them are done by privet companies. Although both companies have their advantages and disadvantages, I woud prefer to work for myself, and have my own business.There are many benefits when people work for themselves rather than work for the others. Ċ In the first place, there are a large number of opportunities in privet works that you cannot find them when you work for the others. In your job you can be boss of yourself; however, in the other jobs someone else are your boss. You always have to be responsible for your task, and it make a stressful situation that I never like it. Ċ What is more, when people work for themselves they make more profit for themselves, but in the other jobs you make profits for the other such as your manager. Unfortunately nowadays most of them pick up this profit without sharing a small sum of it with their workers, and from my point of view it is unfair. Ċ Finally, there are some authorities in privet jobs that workers are always looking for them while they are working for the others. when you work for yourself you can punch in and punch out whenever you want. Sometimes some occasions happen to people for example a disease, sticking in a traffic jam and sometime going on a vacation. For all of them we have to ask for a permission, and most of the time we are not allowed. Ċ There is no doubt that working for the other have some advantages, too, but I imagine people that have their own business are more comfortable. They have more opportunities, profits, and authorities.

prompt: International tourism is now more common than ever before. Some feel that this is a positive trend, while others do not. What are your opinions on this? Give reasons for you answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experiences.
essay: Over the last decades, international tourism has become even more prosperity than ever before. Although it contributes thousands of job opportunities and benefits related industries. The ramifications cannot be ignored. In the following essay I will target on this issue along with causes behind the successfulness of tourism industry. Ċ Although interchange different cultural value flourish people's perspective for both visitors and host residents, yet, certain negative behavior might have comes along with hard currency. While the destination becomes a playground by the affluent one, problems such as prostitution as well as alcoholism and substance abuse may have also been imported. This particularly happened in developing or undeveloped countries such as Thailand, Indonesia. In addition, young people of the host countries might give up schools in order to improve family income which could lead them to be exploited as cheap labors. In the long term, these un-well educated people's career opportunities still restricted on low wage, low skill and menial services. Ċ Another significant effect is environment degradation by the influx of tourists and excessively reclamation for exclusively to meet the demand of vast visitors. Immense areas of trees have been cut down in order to build villages. Vast amount of infrastructure development reduce the habitats of wildlife. Countless wastes and filth has been left by travelers which cause the pollution of river, ocean, mountain and any elsewhere. Ċ In conclusion, in a commercialize today it seems anything against the profit will be left behind even it is harm for human kind future. However, earth is our only home, balances between environment and economic development should be sought to sustain all the lives on this planet.

prompt: Some people have the opinion that big shopping malls are expensive places as they offer high costs for the products which can be bought at much cheaper prices from local shops. On the other hand, some people think that such malls are absolutely the best places to visit for shopping. Ċ Discuss both the opinions and give your own opinion. Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay: Certain people believe that shopping centre charges extensively than the small trader, while others advocate that these big retail outlets are the finest places to purchase anything. This essay will discuss both ideals and establishes my preference. Ċ To being with, shopping malls are expensive locations to buy anything, while regional vendors have the same products at its lesser prices. This is because the tax levied on the products is not applicable to individual sellers. For instance, the iPhone purchased from a big store can be of a higher price, while the same phone bought from the local shop is inexpensive. Ċ On the other hand, most people prefer buying the material from these huge retail complexes. This is because they give good quality products with proper bills and receipts, they even have a 30 day return policy, so if the customer is not satisfied with their services they items can be returned. Moreover, these centres would have varied facilities that provoke families to come together and buy goods. For example, most of these places have centralized air conditioning along with the food court and a kids zone. Hence the family feels relaxed and joyous to come to these places. Ċ In conclusion, many people believe that large shopping areas have costly products in comparison to the individual shops, while others argue that they find malls an exciting place to visit. In my opinion, these enormous retailers have extended the facilities like trial policy, discount, and return policy in addition to the comfort a customer gets while shopping is prominent. Thus, I think that going to these places is the best activity for buying things.

prompt: pollution and other environmental damage is caused mainly by developing countries which helps them become richer. To what extent do you agree with this opinion?
essay: Environmental issues are the greatest concern of every human living in this world. Developing countries are focused to earn more money, and causing damaging effects to the environment in various factors pollution is one of them. I totally agree with this statement because, Every developing country is trying hard to build better economies. This essay will support my opinion with relevant examples. Ċ To begin with, Many developing countries are seriously competing with developed countries in order to reach their level, So most of them are producing their own goods to earn more profits in the world trading. But, unfortunately, they are neglecting the fact that how excessive wastage they are produced by their manufacturing factories. For example, India is the largest producer and supplier of the clothing materials, which requires many factories for manufacturing. Rather than disposing the wastage properly, It is dumped into the ocean without any concern. Due to this water contamination problem is becoming one of the serious risks to the environment. Ċ Another point to be noted, Developing countries always wanted to save money so they barely take part to save the environment. As they believe in the present development, and not thinking about the future generations and mother nature. Firstly, pollution is causing global warming with a high speed which is the major concern in the world. For instance, According to the environmental research institute, 60 percent of the pollution is produced by developing countries which is the main reason behind global warming as a result. Secondly, poor nations do not have much expertise and guidance, While they are creating detrimental effects to the environment. Therefore, If developed nations step in to help such countries for providing a better guiding path, This can protect the environment more feasibly. Ċ In conclusion, most developing countries are blamed for destroying the environment because their main intention is to become rich. I strongly agree with the above statement because, I feel their main concern is to develop their economy.

prompt: opinion essay ( ielts writing task 2) a large number of parents and students think that the current college entrance examination should be abolished altogether. what do you think? write about 300 words to support your position.
essay: In this day and age, the majority of parents and pupils persist on completely rejecting the college entrance exam while the others are in the opposite point of view. From my perspectives, I firmly believe that the university entrance test should be continuously maintained for these following reasons. Ċ To begin with, through entrance examination, the student's capacity will be assessed in an accurate way to classify base on their levels of the score. Therefore, the learner with great outstanding academic performance is likely to enrol at the prestigious institution with the aim to have better access to challenging learning resources and exposure to other peers at the same level. In addition, the lecturer may find it easier to train their students. To be more specific, it is obvious that class that is appropriately graded with the students at the same ability will be taught a relevant way with suitable goals rather than a disorganised one. Ċ Furthermore, the entrance exam has an immense value of understanding development as it contains a chain of wide-ranging knowledge from almost essential subjects, hence it provides learners with the chance to broaden their horizon. They need to review the understanding of specific subjects like Math, English or Literature to prepare well for their performances and compete with other peers. What's more, after taking the exam, the learners will realize where they are standing at the crowd and have the indispensable betterments for their own studies. Consequently, there is a high likelihood that each student's education level and comprehensive development will be enhanced and completed quickly. Ċ In conclusion, it is my view that the college entrance exam needs remaining currently due to its great value of education on the basis of my analyses and explanations.

prompt: More renewable energy sources are harnessed to generate electricity these days. What are disadvantages and advantages of this trend?
essay: Nowadays, society tends to use an alternative resource such as renewable energy to produce electricity. This trend can save the fossil fuel usage for several years to come, it also requires a huge cost. Ċ In the future, people can keep fossils fuel from extinction. This is due to the fact that society switches to use alternative energy as their main source to produce electricity. For example, a current survey carried out by the Japanese Government in 2013 released that using an alternative resource such a solar panel can push the rate of fossil fuel by 40%. Consequently, energy will be collected by the alternative resource to generate electricity gives a long-term effect on their circumstances. Ċ However, citizen needs a lot of money to build up cutting-edge technology tools to generate electricity from alternative resource. The reason for this the equipment is hard to find out, even include rare items. Besides, only a few person can understand about making this tools. A great example for this is coming from Energy and Mineral Resources Ministry of China released the result of survey in 2014 that showed roughly 10% of people using alternative energy in their atmosphere. Therefore, it is true that only a few people who use alternative resource as main resource in their home. Ċ Overall, this essay explained about benefit and drawback in usage alternative resource. The benefit of this trend is fossil fuels reserves for a longtime later, while for the drawback is the high charge to build up sophisticated tools to produce electricity.

prompt: Some people think that children should be homeschooled when they are very young whioe others think it is better for them to attend a kindergarten. Which do you think is better? Ċ Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
essay: Few people consider those teaching children in the home when they are young will be a good decision where remaining think that attending kindergarten would be better. In my opinion, both perspectives have their own pros and cons, which will be discussed briefly in the upcoming paragraphs. Ċ On the one hand, some Parents feel like teaching their younger ones in their lap will be the perfect solution to avoid school fear in them from a very young age. In addition to that, mother's can take care of them while working on household chores where kids also enjoy learning in a fun way from the well known first teacher which is their mother. For Instance, Young babies when they attend their lower education in school, they become panic because of the new environment, friends and teachers which takes lots of time to get used to the crowd around them. Moreover, being away from parents for the first time make them stressed. Ċ On the other hand, by sending their newborns to kindergarten, mothers and fathers become relaxed and will be getting free time to spend for themselves. Mother can concentrate on her work like shopping, buying vegetables and some other house related stuff. However, children get used to schooling and managing things likes books, pencils and bags on their own which in turn help in recognising things from the early stage of their lives. For example, kids who attend classes from a very young age spend time engaging with new friends, playing with toys that make them active, clever and thoughtful. Ċ I would like to conclude by saying that attending kindergarten or learning from parents in homeschool, both have their own benefits, in order to, develop young people mind and activities.

prompt: Young people these days tend to be less polite and respectful than in the past. What are the causes and give your solutions?
essay: Nowadays, young people are often being taught to believe in themselves. It might lead to a problem that they may show less respect for others. In this essay, the causes of the problem will be discussed and some possible solutions will be provided. Ċ The main issue of this behaviour may come from being overconfident. In fact, youngsters are often being told that they should believe in what they are doing and also their abilities. However, this may cause a reverse effect that young people may not easily open to suggestions but always think that their thought is correct. Since they are young and lack of experience, this characteristic may not change if they have never encountered any failure in their life. Ċ There are many solutions to this problem and one of them should be to educate students about the value of each individual. For instance, young people need to be able to value different opinions and understand that they are not about being personal but rather constructive since others may only want to help. Furthermore, the ability to listen to other people's thought and analyse them is also important to be developed. Thus, with some changes to education systems, young people should be encouraged to believe in what they can do as well as respect other people's abilities. Ċ To conclude, it is true that young people may need to learn how to communicate with others with politeness and respect. It may need to start with the education which provided for them by teaching them to listen to other ideas and thought.

prompt: In the past, when students did a university degree, they tended to study their own country. Ċ Nowadays, they have more opportunity to study abroad. Ċ What are the advantages and disadvantages of this development? Ċ you should use your own ideas, knowledge and experience and support your arguments with examples and relevant evidence.
essay: In the olden days, the majority of the students pursued their tertiary education in their native nation. However, the trend has been changed. Nowadays, number of students are in an urge to study in foreign countries, because of the cultural and technological exposure. In this essay, we will go through it's positives and negatives. Ċ Firstly, we are not limited to a minimum number of courses as we did in our past. Indeed, the subjects that, are being taught now are becoming more specific and relevant to the major that, we tend to learn. Moreover, students are very clear in what they wish to study, and don't want any other irrelevant things to go through. For instance, in the foreign universities, an individual has his own liberty to learn things that, he desperately needs to. So this apparent facility has led students to go to abroad for college education. Thus, it is evident that, it is because of the distinct amenities, which attracts the students all over the world. Ċ Secondly, when individuals move to another country for education majority of them stay there till the end of their lives. Because of the attractive salary, and the kind of sophistication they accustomed to it. Furthermore, the family bonding, and the lifestyle changes completely, which would result in the disruption of generation, and their life cycle. For example, when a person migrates from his own country, and spends his whole life in another country, it creates abrupt discontinuity in his culture, transportation, he is not able to teach his own home language, and rituals to the future generations. Therefore, it is so bad to forget a civilization. Ċ In conclusion, after analysing both the sides, it is very clear that, the prospects of a better life are high on foreign countries. In the meantime, as a responsible parent, we must take care of our heritage too.

prompt: Many people find it difficult to speak in front of and to present to an audience. It is believed that this skill should be taught in school. Why is this important? To what extent do you agree or disagree with it?
essay: Many individuals find it challenging to present themselves in front of people. It is considered that schools should be responsible for teaching public speaking. It is important as almost every field of study requires a demonstration of projects in one way or the other. I completely agree with this notion for two reasons; it helps students in giving job interviews along with giving a boost to the confidence at the very early stage of their life. Ċ Firstly, being able to speak persuasively and confidently is an essential skill for almost everyone. For such reason, a good deal of this expertise is required in a professional career. Although schools may find it difficult to indulge this skill in the course outline at the beginning, they will not regret it in the future as a clear and confident voice fosters self-esteem and personal assurance of the students. For example, it can be illustrated by the fact that 80% of the world's leaders have influenced their audiences verbally. Therefore, I believe that it should definitely be part of the curriculum. Ċ Secondly, this skill plays a vital role when students are interviewedSuggestioninterview for a job post. Because of having an ability to explain and justify the degrees, one can easily get the desired position in the workplace. For instance, surveys at the University of Manchester have revealed that 90% of the people are rejected in the interview session due to poor communication skills. Thus, it's high time that schools take oratory skills as seriously as any other basic skills. Ċ In conclusion, many people struggle while speaking in front of the audience. I agree that teaching the art of public speaking should be mandatory in schools. It has been discussed in this essay how good communication skills can help in overcoming the fear of public speaking and uplifting confidence.

prompt: Some people feel that the primary function of a university should be to prepare students for the working world. Others argue that the purpose of university education is to provide knowledge for knowledge’s sake. Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
essay: It is often believed that universities should prepare the students for the complete job whereas others think that colleges have a responsibility of giving them education only. Furthermore, It helps them to crack the competitive exam for jobs in the initial stage itself. Consequently, immediately after passing the university,they could able to do the work and earn their living on their own. Although, without basic studies, children cannot survive because from the subjects like mathematics or data structure they cannot perform the programming. On the other side, they must have knowledge of their shortcuts to clear the entrance exam. So in my opinion, both the basic and competitive education is necessary because if one cannot earn after gaining higher education, then there is no use of passing the degree. It would really help the students to get knowledge as well as jAdd an articlea It appears that an article is missing before the word job. Consider adding the article. prompt: The prevention of health problems and health illness is more important than treatment and medicine. Government funding should reflect this. To what extent do you agree.
essay: There are a plethora of health issues these days, avoidance of this is vital rather than curing with a remedy or therapy. Government must disburse the finances toward it. I strongly agree with this statement and will elaborate on my views on this in the following essay. Ċ To embark on, healing and restoring health conditions is always followed by the doctors since the beginning, but not all illnesses can be cured. There are a lot of viruses that cannot be cured instead they spread widely without knowing costing many lives. This has increased nowadays, and scientists or medical researchers found it difficult to stop. For example, there was a spread of the Ebola virus in the North-American region where doctors could not figure out the proper medication for it which costed many lives. It may be more difficult in future to prohibit these diseases. Ċ In addition to it, there is a lack of required vaccine for immunity that can protect an individual from these diseases. However, it is expensive if in case it is available somewhere else where an average person could not afford it. Moreover, these vaccines are not effective to withstand a virus or a disease that can spread easily. Governments should focus on preventing individuals rather than affording too much on the remedies which could cure a person. This can be only done if excessive funds are released for this prevention. For instance, if the vaccines are provided for free or at a low cost, everyone can take them. Thus, one can be prevented by these illnesses. I strongly agree that this should happen rapidly to avoid major losses or sudden deaths because of these health issues. Ċ In conclusion, It is agreeable that government should release a plethora of funds for vaccination to prevent one from these diseases or viruses rather than concentrating on therapies or medication. It is recommended that this should be followed in an organized way so that everyone would have access to it.

prompt: "It is better to be underrated by people than to be overrated by them."  What are your thoughts on the above statement? Overrated things
essay: are misleading and particularly annoying for people who are not impressed by the superficial things in life. While people may fall for the golden exterior we build around things, nobody really sticks around once they find the bottle half empty. Ċ Nothing is worse than standing in line for the opening of a grand restaurant that has been shamelessly advertising on every television channel, only to walk out with pasta that tastes like plastic. Perhaps if you had gone to the shabby little café down on main street that apparently made really good pizza, you may have ended up with a happier stomach. Ċ However, we cannot blame our attraction to glorified materials. It is human nature for us to be left awe-struck after walking past a limo parked in front of a fancy hotel. And it is not our fault when we peek inside, hoping that a famous stranger, we know nothing about, is staring straight back at us. It is our nature to be fooled by such superficial things and even though it may sound like humanity's tragic tale, we all know it is true. Ċ When things are underrated, we allow room for improvement. We allow ourselves to make the journey to greatness and achieve all that we desire to achieve. But when we glorify things that need not be glorified, we envelop them in a falsehood, shielding their true nature from the world. Ċ The question, alas, we must ask ourselves is, would I rather be loved for the imperfect person that I am, or for the amazing qualities I don't have? And when we build relationships around falsehoods like that, how long do these bonds between us last?

prompt: Some people think saving money is good, but others think that spending money is a better way to enjoy life.Discuss both views and give your own opinion. Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own experience or knowledge.
essay: These days, a number of nations assume that saving expenses for a rainy day are an incredible solution, however, many citizens have an opposite opinion, and they think consuming costs and satisfying from their lives is better than saving cash. In this essay, I will be explained both arguments and express my view. Ċ On the one hand, some nations argue that saving wealth is the best choice they have. Firstly, all families have allocated some budget for a month, and they have to estimate their expenses. My point is, people have predicted all expenses namely, their rents, equipment, and children’s needs. Secondly, all expenditures have inflation, and they ought to balance the books and save for a rainy day. Consequently, citizens think to save money and evaluate all costs are significant these days.
