prompt: It is inevitable that as technology advances, traditional cultures will be lost. It seems that we cannot have these two things together. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Nowadays, technology has been developing significantly, impacting many aspects of our life. While there is belief that technology advances means a lost in traditional cultures, I would argue that although the affect of technology on culture is undeniable, it has also contributed to the preservation of traditonal culture Ċ Thanks to modern technology, our life has been improved with many gadgets. The invention of mobile phone and internet has changed our traditional ways of communicating as well as working, it has also been much less labourous than in the pass with the assistance of electrical machineries. However, these newfangled practices has replaced many old traditional ones. For instance, factories equipped with new and highly-productive system has replaced old handmade products, the exchange of letters among friends is so hard to be seen as we have had emails and social network instead, new video games has superseded the old-physical ones. Many old traditionally cultural things have long gone as a result of modern technology. Ċ However, despite the drawback mentioned above, technology has also made some contributions to the maintenance and study of traditional cultures in some ways. Internet has aided to assess the young generations to the cultural identity of many nations from all around the world. With the help of advanced methods, many art masterpiece has been well restorated and well preserved. Modern devices also assist the scientists to study the ancient societies much more deeply, hence discovering more cultural traces. Ċ To give a brief conclusion, Modern technogy has impacted the traditional cultures in both negative and positive ways.

prompt: Increasingly, many young people are deciding to work or study in other countries. Ċ What are the causes of this phenomenon? Ċ Do you think it is a positive or negative situation?
essay: There is an increase in the rate of youth seeking employment or studies in foreign places. I think this is entirely bad for the sending places but good for receiving ones. This essay discusses this position as well as the causes of this phenomenon. Ċ First and foremost, many young people choose to go out because there are no jobs at home and as well as to get better educational opportunities abroad. When local governments do not create employment, it is easier for youthful populations to opt to go out, as in the case of Zimbabwe where unemployment stands at 95 per cent. Secondly, some go out to seek better qualifications, in educational institutions ranked highly in the world. For example, doing a Master's degree in Europe guarantees one a valuable certificate and transcript which can be used to search for rewarding careers. Ċ I think this scenario is totally positive for the receiving nations because they gain skilled talents (in the case of work immigrants), for example, Australia, Canada and New Zealand which have always announced shortages in certain skills. They also gain an improved status for receiving foreigners (in the case of both students and workers). For instance, many universities abroad raise their rankings when they increase the number of international learners. On the other hand, however, it is extremely negative for the sending countries who lose present and future human resources and skills. These foreigners could have developed their own motherlands but were stifled by limited opportunities and went on to be assets for other lands. Ċ In summary, therefore, both pull and push factors are active as causes of migration for young people. I find this outflow of the youth to be both positive, especially for destination areas, and negative, especially for sending societies. This position has been justified in the essay above.

prompt: You should spend about 40 minutes on this task. Ċ Write about the following topic. Ċ It is now possible for scientists and tourists to travel to remote natural Ċ environment, such as the South Pole. Ċ What are advantages and disadvantages of this development? Ċ Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own Ċ knowledge or experience. Ċ You should write at least 250 words.
essay: Once, travelling to remote natural environments was not possible because of different difficulties associated with transportation, communications and knowledge. However, technological advances have made it possible for people to travel to remote places in the world, such as the South Pole. Ċ First of all, new and cheaper means of transportation have made the South Pole more accessible both to scientists and tourists. Thus, this accessibility carries some disadvantages for the surroundings itself. In fact, the South Pole is a remote, harsh and delicate environment, which has been preserved during centuries thanks to its natural and isolated conditions. Any Increase in the number of visitors of any kind carries out different threats to the ecosystem. For example, the more tourists arrive, the more litter is likely to be thrown in this status. Also, the environment itself has to be altered in order to receive more people. Buildings have to be constructed to foster people coming to visit the South Pole, which implies a disturbance of the biodiversity of this particular ecosystem. Ċ On the contrary, History has shown also that development can bring more benefits than disadvantages when carried out properly. For scientists, being able to investigate remote natural environments, like the South Pole, means that knowledge is expanded. It will help new scientific discoveries to be made and thus broaden our understanding of the world. This development is also a major breakthrough because tourists can visit natural ecosystems that were once only reserved for scientists. It helps them to learn the importance of that particular environment and thus will increase the possibility of taking care of it in the future. Ċ In conclusion, development in travel to remote natural environments has different perspectives and consequences in the ecosystem as a whole. It should be addressed carefully so that no major negative impacts will affect it. Development is crucial for understanding the world we live in, and the way we can protect it for future generations to come.

prompt: Schooling is no more necessary, since more and more information are accessible on the Internet, and student can study just as well at home. To what extent, do you agree or disagree?
essay: Online learning is becoming increasingly popular. A number of the community, believe that the education centre is not important; because a vast variety of research material is available on the websites. So, the students can be educated at their living places as well. In my opinion I completely agree that it is essential for children to learn in education centres rather than browsing on the internet.This essay will discuss why learning in institute is far more effective than doing at home. Ċ To start with, a plethora of people says that learning centres are not essential because e-learning is easily accessible and cost effective. Technology has been flourishing by leaps and bound and provides new avenues while keeping ourselves up-to-date with the latest information. For example, iPad and laptop are easy to carry everywhere around the World and a student can study from different places without going to the school. On the other hand, it is pocket friendly as well, because a parent has the tuition fee only rather than annual academic charges which are mandatory in an academy. Moreover, the children are safer at home. To illustrate this, in this pandemic situation all around the Globe a majority of the children are learning through the distance learning system which is effective and safe for them. Ċ However, there are those that believe to the contrary. They say that education centre is more important and reliable when it comes about application, because many young children are not aware with the pros and cons of an internet. First and the foremost, if the instructor is physically available, they can teach well with expressions and understand how much a child absorbs through their expressions. Therefore, there will be no lack of human empathy. Secondly, these institutes are better in terms of the physical act. For instance, in the COVID-19 pandemic, due to e-learning they are gaining weight by sitting at home. So, as a result chances of obesity will be increased. Ċ In conclusion, this essay discussed the reasons that why using an internet is not more effective than on campus research because of lack of human empathy, no physical activity, and no interaction with the others. In my opinion, I also agree that schooling is far better than learning through the internet because of the above mentioned factors.

prompt: plentiful financial provision for trained sportsmen Some people believe that the salaries paid to professional sportspeople are too high, while others argue that sports salaries are fair. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: There is a widely held belief that specialized sport players' income is far too heavily invested in. Others opine that their salary is adequate. Personally, I would argue that both of these stances have their own plus and minus sides. Ċ On the one hand, to some extent, some sportspeople are paid more than what they deserve. Undoubtedly, sports are not the only occupation which requires high payments. Other professions indeed assert sufficient commissions as well, since they make as vital contributions to the society as sports do. Such people as meteorologists, astronomers and researchers all need ample funding to maintain their work conditions. Were sports to be prioritized in investment, other fields would not obtain their satisfactory budget. Hence, the society would suffer from fewer findings and discoveries. Ċ On the other hand, I believe the uplifted salaries spent on experts in sports are justifiable. To begin with, this line of work is a physically demanding and exhausting job. Footballers, boxers,.. are all in need of high salaries in compensation for all the protracted practice and endurance they experience. In addition, intensive sporting is unfailingly involved with occasional injuries. In order to make amends for these sprains as well as hospital cost implications, sport specialists are undoubtedly longing for superb paying conditions. Therefore, the high expenditure on expert sportdoers is understandable. Ċ All in all, I am in favor of the viewpoint that the plentiful financial provision for trained sportsmen is plausible due to their suffering from harsh physical compulsions and frequent body bruises.

prompt: Do you think that a bad student has a bad teacher? Personally, I think the major cause of that problem is a result of a less - than effective teacher. In my essay, I will set out my reasons to explain why. Bad Teacher => Bad Student?
essay: First, pupils are disinterested in school because their teacher cannot get through to them, also is said that, they do not have enough expert knowledge or cannot find an effective way to teach them. Therefore, they gradually brown off, and do not want to do the exercises or learn anything anymore. That makes their scores decrease and the students are underperforming. Ċ Second, when students have to put up with a bad - tempered teacher or they are received offensive remarks from their teachers that lead to emotional disorder. Children live in anxiety that someone will abuse school teacher's power to make them hurt when they go to school resulted in that they are afraid of school and teachers there. They may talk that: "I hate school", "I do not want to go to school" - there are sign that they have a bad teacher. Ċ However, it is not always true in every circumstance. There are many reasons to make a student worse. A good example of this would be they are lazy to do tasks or assignment, or they are becoming to be a computer addiction. And I believe that a seduce from friends is a big problem that children must be conscious. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that a bad teacher can make students ineffectively than they are used to be. Whatever causes there are, parents and society must pay attention to children and supply them with a well education because children are taking the future into their own hands.

prompt: accepting only well-qualified students to universities? Topic: Many people say that universities should only offer to young students with high marks, others say that they should accept people of all ages, even if they did not do well. Discuss both views and give your own opinions.
essay: A major debate in the field of taking parts in universities revolves around the issue of whether educational institutes should accept well-qualified students or scholars of all ages without assessing their current academic levels. This essay will delve into both viewpoints and voice my personal opinions. Ċ On the one hand, it is admitted that students with decent marks should be trained by reputed universities. Intellectual personnel such as doctors, lawyers, etc are feted in their countries these days. In addition, these people are lucrative sources of the national budget. American conglomerates exemplify perfectly in this case. Renowned companies have stimulated highly qualified IT workers by attractive salary policies with the aim of competing other firms. Therefore, intellectual students not only benefit their own countries by accelerating national GDP rate but also shelter their families from monetary burdens. Consequently, it is vital for educational authorities to encourage well-performed scholars to pursue higher education. Ċ On the other hand, people should be given the freedom to do what they desire and embarking on universities is not an exception. It is absurd to say that education plays no useful role in the adulthood. The country would extremely benefit if it's citizens decide to learn in universities despite their ages. However, senior learners must be applied to certain training programs provided appropriately by universities. Ċ To conclude, I believe that everyone can freely broaden knowledge by applying to a university in conformity with his or her financial conditions. Notwithstanding, students who capable of affording universities' courses, should not be profitable from national funding for education.

prompt: Nowadays, people get information through news and papers, but meanwhile are uncertain about the truth of these news. Should we believe the journalists?  What qualities should a good journalist or correspondent have? Legit and fake stories
essay: Today, mass media provide a lot of information for society through newspapers and electronic news yet the validity is still doubted. This essay will discuss about how far people can trust the journalists and what credibility a journalist should have. Ċ It is undeniable that journalism activity has delivered a vast information to society. However, people should not totally believe the information or news that is delivered by journalists. It is because today there are a lot of competition among those journalistic workers to reach the best rating view or to be the fastest to provide news. Because of the competition, they then tend to do everything including manipulating the data to make the information sound more sensational or delivering the information as fast as they can without doing deep observation and interview to ensure the validity of the data. It results in the invalidity of the data and information they spread to people. Ċ Every kind of profession requires certain qualities, so does journalism. The fundamental characteristics that journalists should have are being neutral and independent. Journalistic workers should be neutral and should not take a side of any group. By doing so, they can cover both sides and looking at any angles of a phenomenon before presenting it into the news form. Moreover, they should be independent from any pressure and interest of any group so they can be free to report any occurance and fact as it is without intervense from any party. Ċ To conclude, people should clarify the rightness of an information and should not totally trust what journalists report. Furthermore, a good correspondent should have independency and neutrality in accomplishing their task.

prompt: It is more important for a building to serve a purpose than to look beautiful. Architects should not worry about producing building as a work of art. Do you agree or disagree ?
essay: It is commonly believed that buildings should be of utilitarian nature rather than just look appealing to the eyes. However, I believe that in addition, to meeting the prime purpose which is its functionality, high rises ought to be attractive as well. If both approaches go hand with hand, we can reap the benefits of both. Ċ We usually build a high rise in order to accommodate a lot of people. To achieve this, we must utilize the space effectively and make it more secure so that it can resist the natural calamities. For instance, nowadays, most of the architecture in my country must have to pass various mandatory engineering tests, including the capacity to resist strong winds and minor earthquakes, in order to qualify for residential building. Thus, residential buildings must make use of available space efficiently and must be safe for the tenants. Ċ On the other hand, architecture is very important in modern society because it attracts a lot of visitors . In order to become commercially viable, a hotel must appeal to a lot of potential clients. For example, State of the art architectural designs in Dubai, such as Burj Khalifa, are attracting millions of customers every year. Therefore, commercial structures should exhibit modern art and unique designs in order to stimulate the interest of visitors. Ċ To conclude, while it is believed that modern buildings should be constructed on the principle of utilitarianism, I believed that the outlook of the high rise also plays an important part. I suggest that residential towers should focus more on functionality, but commercial buildings should come up with unique ideas and designs because art and beauty attract the human mind.

prompt: Many people are doing their shopping online on the internet nowadays. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of online shopping.
essay: some groups of humans believe that there is no relation between study and success because they think there are plenty of people who are successful without studying. While this makes sense in some situations, I would argue that the better way lead us to brilliant achievement is learning. Ċ On the one hand, it is possible that talented men can gain good results. Specifically, if you are gifted in a certain field, you can do it well and acquire flying colours, and sometimes it is better than you expected. To illustrate, Bill Gates dropped out of college to pursued his passion. He was interested in computers when he was thirteen and earned his own money by writing COBOL which is a computer programming language, then published his own company by establishing Microsoft and became a millionaire from 1995 to 2014. Ċ On the other hand, I believe that it is more beneficial for everybody to chase their studying then turn into success. Firstly, academic qualifications are required in many occupations. For instance, it is impossible to be a doctor, nurse or lawyer in the absence of having the relevant degree. Therefore, students who graduate from university have access to better professional opportunities than others who with fewer certificates. Secondly, the job market is becoming increasingly competitive. In some cases, there are dozens of applicants apply for one position in a company. Individuals  who do not have qualifications from college will not be able to compete. Ċ To sum up, it is possible that people can acquire flying colours if they are gifted in an area of expertise. However, it is undeniable that study is an important route to success.

prompt: It is right that university graduates should earn more money than less well educated people, but they should pay the full cost of their education. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: When university graduates enter the job market, they expect to be paid more money on average than less educated people. While I believe that graduates deserve good salaries, I disagree with the idea that they should pay the full tuition for their degree courses. Ċ In my opinion, the level of education is the most important contributing factor to the amount of money people earn at work. Educated people have invested time and effort into gaining their qualifications, and are therefore more prepared for work that relies chiefly on knowledge. More importantly, university students develop qualities that will go beyond their specialized knowledge. For example, better educated people are mentally and physically healthier, and they tend to be more productive with better interpersonal skills than those without formal education, making them great assets to the society as whole. I believe that these qualifications will certainly benefit the prospective employers both inside and outside work context. Ċ I would also argue that students should not pay all the cost of university education. Education will be expensive and many young people, especially those from poorer backgrounds, might find it more difficult to go to university if they have to pay. I doubt that student loans could help to overcome this problem, because many students might not like the idea of graduating and having to worry about repaying large loans. Graduates clearly directly receive many benefits form having a university education, higher income being one of them. This means that they will almost certainly pay more income taxes than non-graduates, contributing more to the education of the next generation. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that government should lower the cost of education for all people, and that graduates deserve higher rates of remuneration.

prompt: Some people believe that educational qualifications will always bring success in life. Other people say that educational qualifications do not necessarily bring success. Ċ Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay: The opinion on whether the educational qualifications bring success in life is divided. Some believe that they definitely do while others think in the opposite way. In my opinion, outstanding results are not likely to be achieved without a decent level of education and this essay will discuss both views. Ċ At first, I would like to consider the opinion I agree with: believing that fundamental learning is crucial in order to become successful. More and more employers are looking for workers who are well-trained and have a wide range of skills. For example, to be employed in leading IT companies, candidates have to go through serious tests which require being proficient in mathematical analysis, statistics, programming, and, surprisingly, creative thinking. So, it is definitely hard to pursue better career opportunities without a solid academic background. Ċ Secondly, let's talk about another side of the argument which says that people do not need certain qualifications to get to success. Of course, some people became wealthy even without finishing school or college, so we can look through their biography to learn how to do that. For instance, many influential entrepreneurs and investors were starting with absolutely nothing using only their own thought up strategies at the beginning. Although educational qualifications strongly affect our results, some different approaches and abilities also should be taken into account. Ċ In conclusion, some people say that everyone should be well-educated to reach ambitious goals, some would say that it is not necessary. I would personally say that special persons will have been learning for all their life and obtain as much intelligence as they can do.

prompt: Many cities around the world these days are becoming more and more polluted. Ċ Why is this happening? What solutions can you suggest?
essay: It is clear that with the rapid industrialization of modern society, pollution is becoming a major concern. With the predominant exploitation of industrial inventions in metropolises, intellectuals opine that the urban environment is becoming more polluted now than ever. The essay will provide detailed arguments and my own suggestions. Ċ To begin, it is evident that the overdependence on personal vehicles contributes significantly to the increase in pollutants in cities. More vehicles in traffic would result in a higher amount of carbon dioxide exhaust, thus having detrimental effects on the urban atmosphere. Furthermore, littering should also be put under equal consideration since it has the potential to cause massive damage. Decomposing organic waste could generate a terrible smell, degrading the quality of life significantly. To clarify, the To Lich river was once a spot for locals to dispose of their waste. As a result, the smell became unbearable, decreasing property value as well as the quality of life. Ċ On the other hand, there still exist numerous solutions in which education is the most optimal. Having a common awareness about the hazardous effects of pollution, citizens would less likely to commit acts such as littering. Moreover, governments should encourage the public to utilize public transports or taxing personal vehicles in order to reduce the number of transports in traffic, thus reducing emissions. Ċ In conclusion, the polluted environment of most cities globally has become a major problem. People should be educated and aware of the possible negative impacts and the state should pass certain laws to be able to limit pollution.

prompt: In some countries, citizens must pay a lot of money in taxes, but education and healthcare are free. Do the advantages of this situation outweigh the disadvantage?
essay: Taxing citizens for socio-economic benefits has been an age-old debate. In a number of countries, society has to incur taxes in return for free healthcare and education. This essay will highlight why this is a viable approach. Ċ To begin with, there is a school of thought that people should not be taxed for education and medical benefits. This is because ,in many countries, the government-run hospitals and education institutions lack the basic infrastructure and the technology required to provide the necessary services. For example, in a developing country like India, primary schools and state-run medical centres are not world-class, and therefore, people prefer themselves being treated at private hospitals and enrol their children in international schools. Hence, not being equipped with state of the art facilities, constitute a major obstacle to such a tax-benefit system. Ċ On the other hand, many believe that every child deserves elementary schooling free of cost irrespective of their financial status. Thus, charging citizens universally for providing their children with quality education, has been one of the major lucrative socio-economic policies that have been adopted by the government in developed countries across the world. Furthermore, with an ever-increasing cost of health expenses, it becomes crucial that government provides its citizens with a sense of security by covering the cost of their well-being. For instance, countries like Canada and Germany that rank high on the human development index have done this. Thus, the right to universal education and a sense of social security is required for all and must be incurred by the government expenditure without any bias. Ċ To conclude, I strongly believe that the benefits of a tax system that provides free education and healthcare for all, far outweigh the drawbacks and is a feasible modus operandi that all developing nations should look at eventually.

prompt: Topic: some people argue that immigrants should adopt the local culture when immigrating to a new country. An alternative view is that they can adapt to a new environment by establishing a minority community. Discuss these two views and give your opinion.
essay: Globalization has incurred the high mobility of population from one country to another. Those new migrants are at a crossroad whether to blend themselves into the mainstream environment or to establish a ghetto which bears their own flavor. In this essay, the merits of these two options will be explored. Ċ When an immigrant steps on a foreign land, the first priority is to seek a job to secure his survival. Immerging himself into local environment will enhance the employability. Although the majority of the migrants are well educated in their motherland, the level of their English remains the level of international English. They still have difficulties in comprehending the implied meanings of local residents. However, Frequent interactions with the local residents help newcomers learn more about the local values and thinking patterns, thus, expand the social network and increase the likelihood of being employed. Ċ Blending into local society is not only conducive to maintain the competitive edge of immigrants, but also preserve the psychological wellbeing of them. Migrants tend to feel alienated if they are marginalized by the mainstream community. So many unintentional and unnecessary frictions or even conflicts that those migrants become depressed and unmotivated, which would exert a negative effect on their study or work. Ċ However, setting up a minority group which only embraces people of the same nationality or even ethical backgrounds would boost the self- identity. Living in those ghettos, those immigrants feel at ease and a sense of belonging instead of being repelled. Through contacts with compatriots, those new comers could alleviate the depression that caused by cultural shock. Ċ In a nutshell, integrating into local communities would secure an immigrant' employment and maintain the psychological well-being. Meanwhile, establishing a minority group would encourage them to retrieve self-identity and therefore, these two approached are advisable.

prompt: Some people like to do only what they already do well. Other people prefer to try new things and take risks. Which do prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
essay: Personally, I prefer to try new things and take risks. I think that all people want to success in life. They must work hard and gain knowledge and experience. Moreover, when people do things they already do well, they must improve their knowledge.. I base my statement on the following points. Ċ Some of people who want to be success must constant to improve their knowledge and get good experience. Furthermore, they must try to do the best at their job. Therefore, they need to try new things, take risks sometimes and work hard. It is impossible to live without trying new things. For example, I want to drive motorcycle but I cannot to do it. So, I must learn methods of use motorcycle and must now about driving rules. Ċ Additionally, I people need changes make our lives more beautiful and exiting. We find out new things, learn new things and dream to know other things. People need challenges because can make to become stronger. Ċ To sum up, I believe that people is aspiration for learning new things. It is the main reason the way we live now. People make many discoveries and inventions that make our lives easier, happier and longer.

prompt: Advertising encourages consumers to buy in quantity rather than promoting quality. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
essay: In today’s world, the advertisement industry holds a significant place in the marketing world. I completely agree with the notion that these commercials compelled buyers to purchase in large amounts instead of focusing on its features. Ċ In this social media era, every person consumes content and wants to buy goods that his or her favourite Instagram influencer is using. Consequently, brands target these creators to do publicity for them and provide massive discounts on purchases. These Instagrammers request their followers to necessarily buy that particular thing as it is a great deal. Pupils get trapped in these offers and bought products without checking their quality. For example, a friend of mine is a huge fan of a YouTuber. This creator recommended a particular shampoo on his channel. As she was facing a hair loss problem, she bought it. When she uses it, the shampoo has an adverse effect on her hair. Ċ Moreover, these advertisers always come with the idea of bumper sales and provide a great deal if it exceeds a certain monetary limit. These limits forced individuals to do shopping in excess even if they don’t need that item. Furthermore, this can create a habit of unnecessary purchasing in people. For instance, I bought one jacket extra so that I can have an additional off on my purchase. Nevertheless, it has an advantage if you want to have menial goods like handkerchiefs, face wipes, hand towels, etc. at a considerable price. Ċ To conclude, I would like to reiterate my opinion that these advertisements need to do a fact-check when commercializing their commodity. They should remain more focused on its characteristics than advertising an offer on it.

prompt: An increasing number of professionals such as doctors and teachers are leaving their own poorer countries to work in developed countries. Ċ What problems does this cause? Ċ What can be done to deal with this situation?
essay: A large number of Skilled workers such as doctors and teachers from poor nations are relocating to wealthy nations for employment. This essay will discuss the challenges associated with the mass exodus of experts and also expatiate on the ways to mitigate this issue. Ċ To begin, there are some challenges associated with professionals migrating to wealthier nations to work. Firstly, it results in brain drain. In other words, there is a shortage of manpower to carry out tasks in the organization. This is because there is not enough workforce in these parastatals again leading to exhaustion of the individuals remaining. Secondly, the workers are stressed. The staff of the organization will easily come down with sickness as they are overwhelmed with work and not having enough rest. Prolonged exposure to stressors could lead to the development of chronic diseases like hypertension and diabetes. Ċ However, these above problems associated with the migration of professionals can be mitigated in a variety of ways. One major way of tackling this issue is to increase remuneration. That is, the salaries of these professionals should be raised. This will give them a reason to remain in their country. Another way is to make the working condition of the hospital and classroom favourable, reducing the stressors. Doing this will further dissuade the experts to remain in their home country. Ċ In conclusion, brain drain and exposure to stressors are some of the issues militating against skilled workers' migration and these challenges can be eradicated if the salaries are increased and the working environment is conducive. Therefore, it is important that the relevant authorities take steps towards ensuring that these problems are properly tackled.

prompt: Some people prefer the same job for a same company, but others like to change jobs frequently. Discuss the both side and give your own preference.
essay: With the economic growth in recent years, while some employees intend to commit the same position in one organisation for a long time, others are keen to explore their possibilities in different enterprises. Generally speaking, the latter practice is more desirable than the former one in the modern society. 49 Ċ It is accepted that individuals who committing an unchanged job for a relatively long period of time gain some benefits. One is that it increases their chances of international promotion. Unlike job-hoppers, loyal employees are usually deemed as the highly skilled and experienced human talent because of their comprehensive understanding of their businesses' operations and administrations. Secondly, staff could obtain a sense of security through a long term service. The reason for this is that they are likely to receive the priority when comes to salary package review and employment contract renewal. 92 Ċ However, there are arguments in favour of changing job regularly. Firstly, job-hopping maximises a higher remuneration possibility and brings a more promising career prospect. Sports professionals, for instance, frequently transfer the clubs they are playing for is an ideal strategy to obtain more opportunities to present in a number of international and well-known competitions. Moreover, if the jobs the candidates are engaging with currently suits neither their personality nor skills or qualification they hold, trying other types of opportunities is a preferred change. As a result, the circumstance destructs their mental soundness and their potentials in other areas. 98 Ċ In conclusion, it is convincing that non job-hoppers enjoy some benefits from long term employment. However, the merits of changing job regularly could be beneficial for employees to maintain a positive career orientation and health well-being.

prompt: Topic: "Many university students live with their families while others need to live away from home because their universities are in different cities. What are the advantages and disadvantages in both situations? Give your opinion"
essay: Recent statistics shows that there has been a swift ramp-up in the total number of students opting for travelling to foreign universities for pursuing higher education. Unveiling such statistics had raised a matter of concerns among people. Some people think that studying from foreign universities is indispensible for a perfect career. However, others may contend that adolescents staying away from their families during the immature age for a year or two could have detrimental effects on them. Ċ It is no secret that that staying independently allows with an opportunity to experience the real world. In addition, it also imparts many imperative qualities. For instances, one can learn ways to overcome their problems independently or to tackle the complicated situations maturely. Furthermore, it also helps in boosting their confidence level to face the world full-of-challenges. Ċ Moreover, residing in a different country could also provide with an opportunity to explore other's cultures, principles and dogma. Every culture holds its own unique morals and ethics. One can inherit such qualities to become a good human-being. Ċ On the other hand, sending children to a different country can be costly to pocket, which only richer section of the society can afford. For instance, one needs to spend huge money on accommodation, food and travelling plus the costly universities fees. In addition, the fact that parent holds no control on their children due to their independent lifestyle, may provoke children to lose focus from their path and indulge in un-ethical activities or bad habits. Ċ To sum up, I would conclude that benefits of staying in foreign countries to pursue higher education outweigh its disadvantages. Not to neglect that with proper guidance and practising constant touch with their children, parents can make sure that their children stay focus to their goals and mission.

prompt: topic: some people believe that a lot of scientific research is a waste of time and money. to what extend do you agree or disagree?
essay: Some are of the opinion that it is pointless investing time and means in the science industry as most outcomes are improbable. From my perspective, I strongly disagree with this view and will further elaborate in this essay. Ċ It is undeniable that scientific research is counterproductive. Vague as the purposes might be, scientists dedicate themselves to these studies. Some of these research projects may take years to be proven right; however, there is no certainty that a breakthrough will be produced. Moreover, self-proclaimed scientists, whose sole desire is recognition, are inventing impractical products, namely the umbrella shoes or the walking sleeping bag. Ċ Having said that, the science industry has made remarkable progress in unveiling mysteries around the world, which has contributed to enlarge human's understanding. Breakthrough can be elucidated with the supplied knowledge obtained from scientific research; hence an encouragement to allocate for the industry. To illustrate the case, the invention of Kepler Space Telescope has allowed us to broaden our knowledge of the outer space with the confirmation of over 2700 exoplanets. Ċ Furthermore, scientific breakthoughs help facilitating human's life. Over the past few centuries, some discoveries and inventions have marked noteworthy milestones; therefore have made immense contribution in uplifting human society. Without science, treatments to fatal diseases like plague or cancer would not be found and we might never have chance to access the Internet. As a prime example for the case, new avenues to preventing the spread of HIV have been opened thanks to scientists' dedicated studies. Ċ In conclusion, I believe that there are more reason to encourage the allocation of time and funds for the promotion of scientific research. It is predicted that science will continue to play an irreplaceable role in human's quest for knowledge.

prompt: Governments spend millions of dollars each year on their space programmes.Most recently, Mars is the focus of scientists' attention. Some people think this money would be better spent on dealing with problems closer to home. Do you agree or disagree?
essay: Although developing the space programmes indicates that the country which is concerned to space is rich, the government may help people as many as possible if having much money. I agree with the idea that the money should be better spent on dealing with problems closer to home. Ċ Some people argue that the government should use money for welfare. This is because the difference between rich and poor is extending, so it is hard for poor to live in daily life and the power of nation is declining. Administration has the obligation that the difference shrinks and every people can enjoy their life. The United States and the USSR face deficit because of spending money for their space programs too much. Ċ On the other hand, the opponent argue that the government ought to promote developing space programmes. Exploitation is meaningful for people to be rich in the future. In fact, mobile phone is available all over the world because there is satellite in space. Achieving space programmes is helping our daily life. However, the government have to spend money noticing the balance between space programmes and welfare. Ċ In conclusion, I believe it is useful for many people to be spent on dealing with welfare and medical care. Governments should tackle with their space programmes with energy to spare.

prompt: Topic:  In many countries around the world, life expectancy is increasing. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this situation and give your own opinions.
essay: Nowadays, people evolved in a positive way. Many countries witnessed a rise in the human lifespan. Although some advantages of this trend could be seen, in my viewpoint, they are outweighed by the considerable drawbacks. Ċ On the one hand, the growth in life expectancy brings some clear benefits for individuals. Firstly, people who live longer have opportunities to stay with their families and enjoy their relaxed life after many years working hard. They become grandparents and could take care of their children. As a matter of fact, almost children having grandparents be together are better than others at life skills thanks to their experiences gained from the elderly. Moreover, old people could promote relationships among their family members. They are usually considered as family moderator. Ċ On the other hand, lifespan increasing caused many issues for social. One negative effects of rise human lifespans is an aging population that puts burdens on healthcare services such as hospitals and nursing home. These places might face a manpower shortage or run out of money because the elderly often require more frequent and long-term health care. Another disadvantage of this trend is that young people will access less job opportunities due to the people retiring later. If this condition persists, it will lead to more serious consequences. For instance, there are more jobless people preventing the economy growth. Ċ To sum up, there re many benefits that could be seen from the increased human lifespans but the negative effects of this trend, in my perspective,definitely eclipse these benefits.

prompt: The education of young people is highly prioritized in many countries. However, educating adults who cannot write or read is even more important and governments should spend more money on this. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: It is arguable that the overwhelming majority of nations favour the children apprenticeship rather than mature individuals who are believed that the ruling powers should squander public funds on them. Personally, I strongly disagree with the view since the national future relies on youngsters. Albeit, adults play their role in regional development. This essay will shed light on both sides of the view and provide anecdotal evidence to prove the arguments. Ċ On the one hand, the advancement of a nation depends on how the future generation is trained. In other words, this investment in them is a must since they are the future doctors, engineers, and teachers. For instance, the recent research carried out by the University Zambeze pointed out that the most successful nations throughout the world are those which frittered a significant amount of money on Boys and Girls. As a result, vital regional sectors are equipped with specialized personnel, which helps communities. Furthermore, the best way to guarantee the nation's advancement is undoubtedly through education on children. Ċ On the other hand, adults are also part of the republic's development. The role is to transmit the experience to the younger generation in different spheres of knowledge such as education, pharmaceutical, industry, and security. Moreover, it is their duty to secure a peaceful transition from one generation to another. For example, in African countries, despite the majority of local adults being illiterate, they are vitally transmitting their past livings to young ones. Consequently, Boys and Girls are prepared in an earlier stage to take charge tomorrow. Ċ In conclusion, notwithstanding the pivotal role mature people play in society, it is meaningless to spend a huge amount of money on them. However, equal action on children is justified because they are guarantors of the country's amelioration. Therefore, I still strongly disagree with the statement.

prompt: Education is of great importance to the development of individuals and well-being of the societies. What should education consist of to fulfill these functions?
essay: As we all know, education is significant to an individual's future career and will benefit the societies. Therefore, what fundamental aspects that education should include to fulfill these functions is worth discussing. Ċ In my opinion, the very basic aspect of education is academic knowledge. For instance, the reading comprehension ability is of vital importance through out a person's life, especially in this modern society. If can not read, one may be cheated by some false news that one heard of. Even though an individual can read, but if can not understand the reading materials correctly, he may misinterperate the information which is very important to his daily life. So lacking of reading ability may cause inconvenience to individuals' life. Ċ Another basic aspect of education is social skills. After leaving schools, good social skills may benefit a person in their working life. Because good social skills give a person the ability to know what to say in any situition and be a type of person others love to be around. Thus, a person may find less difficult in working with others especially those who are not very easy-going and more effective when in a cooperation for he or she can do a very good interaction with his or her partners. Ċ On top of that, there are still several other fundamental components of education. For example, appreciation of art and literature which can make a person's life more colorful; a perfect skill to get a good job with a good pay; citizenship and community responsibility which everybody should take; physical and emotional health which provide a person with fit body to live and work, etc.. Ċ All in all, education should contain a variety of contents to produce educated people. And with a number of well educated people, our social development will become better and better.

prompt: Topic :  A lot of entertainment stars have had the problem of drug dependency before they become famous. Do you think that those people have bad effects on children?
essay: Many media celebrities , who have been seriously involved in drug dependency , allegedly exert negative implications on youth generation , especially adolescent fans . Personally ,I am out of accord with the aforementioned conception and will attempt to investigate both negative and positive influences of notable individuals in this essay. Ċ Foremost , there are ample evidence indicate the negative effects . In the contemporary society , young people normally show propensity to imitate significantly the famous individuals without any consideration about their history . These over-reverence could be precursor for these immature fans to change their pattern of lifestyle or trend of fashion so as to be alike with idols .Thus,the prominent repercussions worth mentioning are propagating the adolescents with negative drug scandals or misled,biased information about drugs . Under several circumstances , these celebrities , hence , would be predominant culprits,which catalyse rising incidences of drugs dealers , and facilitate this debatable crimes burgeon.If it wasn't for any mechanism supported from parents and authority, they would encounter numerous obstacles to cope with this issues. Ċ In contrast , majority of notable individuals have outperformed after being involved in drug dependency . These people not only help regulatory bodies to eradicate rampant spread of drugs but also host indispensable position in diffusing right perspective . Celebrities , who have suffered from drugs detrimental effects , would make more appealing speech about the health deterioration , exponential hazards rooted from drug usage . Moreover , they could bring more pragmatic value and absolutely be a great role models for youth generation to imitate . Ċ As outlined previously , there are myriad of factors potentially contribute to the affection ,both associated benefits and considerable drawbacks need to be brought into consideration.

prompt: Some people prefer to get up early in the morning and start the day’s work. Others prefer to get up later in the day and work until late at night. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
essay: The majority of the masses choose to wake up before the usual time and begin the daily work. While others adopt to get up late opportunity in the day and be at work until midnight. In my opinion, I opt for the regular working hours as it is beneficial to strength and wealth. In the forthcoming paragraphs, I shall explain my point of view. Ċ On the one hand, the prevailing habits from many years followed traditionally. Although a portion of people had been following to wake up early in early hours from the bed, intending to markup their day's activities. As a result, it produces a plethora of well-being benefits. Besides that, they are always active for the remaining day as had enough sleep for the day during normal hours. For example, in the rural areas, usually, formers wake up at 5 am in the morning, preparing food for lunchtime. Moreover, they will be doing forming the corp during the sunlight, thus, formers having D Vitamin naturally without spending money. Ċ On the other hand, traditional cultures have been ruled out by the current generation as living in the digital world. In order to, young people spend a vast amount of time at midnight, which causes sleeping disorders to intend to sleep over midnight. Consequently, getting up from bed at mid-day, it affecting their fitness, daily meeting schedules. Therefore, sometimes they are sick without a valid reason. For instance, a recent survey conducted by the Directory of health on people sleeping patterns, report says who had followed the sleep regular times, are hospitalization ratio quite lower than those who aren't. In addition, earning more profits in a year without spending on inevitable expenses. Ċ In conclusion, it was proven that lack of sleep causes illness to the well-being, sometimes it would lead to death. Finally, maintaining a proper healthy diet leads to stronger and strengthy life.

prompt: Many people today spend most of their free time at home watching TV series or movies instead of going out. Do You think this is right or wrong ?
essay: With the advancement in technology, most people barely get time to hang out or to visit nearby places. So, the trend to watch TV at home has been increased by leaps and bound to pass their leisure time. I think that there are both sides of arguments for this fact. In the subsequent paragraphs, I will discuss my belief with relevant examples. Ċ Firstly, in today's modern era, people need to work as possible to survive in this cut-throat competitive market. Hence, they become more workaholic then in past and because of it they hardly get time for outdoor activities, resultantly they turn towards handy items at home like watching TV or playing games on the mobile, etcetera. For example, the person works for 13 to 14 hours including to and fro commuting to the office on weekdays. Certainly, he gets tired of his hectic schedule then how can he think of an outdoor picnic with family on weekends. Ċ Secondly, absolutely it is wrong to seat ideal against TV. There are a plethora of ways to keep individual stamina intake to work an entire week for extended hours. With the enhancement in technology, people become health conscious and they can learn how to maintain work-life balance online. For instance, one gives time to himself or herself for at least an hour per day and utilize this time to do yoga and exercise, he does not need to watch TV for entertainment because daily exercise is the best stress buster. Ċ To conclude, there is a necessity to watch TV in the present time by dint of individual busy schedule. To use the short time for watching TV in free time is helpful but to pass entire free time for it is completely worst. So, I opine that individual should cope correctly with their daily routine and make a schedule for their leisure time intelligently.

prompt: What historical event in your country has had a major effect on your country? Chinese Civil War influence on the Taiwanese people
essay: Major historical events have powerful impact to people. These events change the direction of things originally might be, affecting families, causing injuries and deaths, producing happiness and sadness. To me, Chinese Civil War in 1949 had most immense affection of People in Taiwan. There are several reasons I feel this way. Ċ First, the war separated Republic of China (Taiwan) and PRC. The dispute of which country can represent "China" continued until PRC successfully replaced ROC's position in UN in 1979. Till now, the tension between two sides and the unclear status of ROC (Taiwan) trouble foreign and economic policy in Taiwan. For example, former President Ma Ying Jio had formed an economic development policy and ease tension in order to facilitate the trade exchange on both sides. However, his predecessor, President Tsai Ying Wen, tried to keep Taiwan's independence, and develop the "Southern Development Policy," which tried to reconstruct the relations with Southeast Asia countries. Politics is not always predictable, but the vague status of Taiwan worsen the situation. Ċ Second, the war kept people in PRC and Taiwan separated and leaded different life. PRC is a communism country, while Taiwan is capitalism; PRC is Autocratic, while Taiwan is democracy. Some soilders followed the KMT army flee to Taiwan in 1949, but they never thought they couldn't go back their homeland again. Most of them get married again, and raised their children like an exiled person. For example, my grandfather is one of these old soilders. When I was a kid, I often see him sit silent and look out of the window, sapping with tears. He told me he misses his family in Mainland. The war not only affect my grandfather, according to the statics from Taiwan government, there are over 5,000,000 KMT soilders moved into Taiwan because of the war. Ċ War itself is a tragedy. We are lucky persons to live in a peace time. Hope this kind of historical event would not happen once again.

prompt: Cycling is more environmentally friendly than other forms of transport. However, it is longer the main form of transport. What are the reasons? What could be done to encourage the use of bicycles among the wider population?
essay: There is no doubt that while cycling is one of the most environmentally friendly means of transport than others, it is, unfortunately, not still a dominant travelling mode. This essay will explore a number of possible factors behind this and suggest some ideas to make this transport widely come into play among popularities. Ċ Of all the various components which lead to the less use of the bicycle, one is its weaknesses in mobility compared to most modern transports. For instance, travelling much faster with moto vehicles and metros are is more convenient for trips within cities while fast-speed trams, planes are more time-saving for long-distance journeys. Furthermore, if people use bikes for main communication vehicles, it may be impossible due to physical health requirements. Ċ In order to promote cycling, the provision of cyclist-friendly facilities might be the first and foremost step to make people make a change. For example, paving cycling lanes on main roads and cycling tracks in public parks is likely to deal with cyclists' safety while they are going through fast-moving vehicles. The second proposition could be the raise of citizens' awareness about the benefits of cycling. For more details, governments can take some healthy policies into account, or frequently hold local or international cycling competitions around the country. As a result, the citizen will gradually decide to adopt this kind of means. Ċ In conclusion, although time-efficiency, conveniences might contribute to the less prevalence of bicycles, safety, and the encouragement of authorities can persuade people to adapt with bicycles.

prompt: International marketing is sometimes seen as invasive and an intrusion into the country in question. Others argue that it is a necessary and economical form of education in addition to spreading ideas, language and culture. Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay: In the recent decade, the debate regarding international marketing has been raised. Some people see that multicultural marketing is an invasive method in our community. However, Other people claim that it is an essential part of our society in order to gain new ideas, language and culture. I believe that international marketing is an innovation tool and its pros outweigh the cons. Ċ Firstly, some people argue that the new marketing methodology is destroying our society values. As a consequence, we can see more and more teenagers are trying to mimic the western lifestyle. For Example, they are trying to buy the same clothes and shoes, and pay too much attention to materialistic things. In addition, the new international marketing is not considering our national interests. Consider the example of marketing for products that are competitive to our national products. Ċ On the other hand, some people view global marketing as a tool to understand other people cultures and languages. As a result, we will learn more knowledge and skills. Furthermore, we can learn new ideas and innovations in order to implement them in our country. This will enrich our economy. For instance, we can learn more about new construction solutions available in the world market then implement them in our region. Ċ In conclusion, global marketing is a great new marketing strategy, that has a great benefit to our economy. As it gives us an innovative idea to implement in our homeland. Despite, other people claim that it is a threat to our national products as well as to our social values. I believe that international marketing has advantages more than its disadvantages.

prompt: Motorised flight is the greatest invention in the modern world. No other invention has influenced our lives more significantly. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: Motorised fight, indeed, is an essential invention in recent society. But when people add it a precise title-the greatest invention-in order to emphasis its importance. I wonder that a large majority of opponents will put on a question mark at the end of the title like me. Ċ Time-saving must be an obvious advantage, popping into people's mind. As the accelerated development of the modern world, that time is money has been viewed as one of the golden principles. When the disaster, such as earthquake, takes place, rescuers from home and abroad come to the first site within an hour. Without motorised flight, more lives will pass away when the rescuers struggle in the way. Therefore, it is reasonable for us to admit the importance of motorised flight in the modern world. Ċ On the other hand, we can illustrate lots of inventions that have significantly influenced our lives. Computer should be in the list. We can stay at home and grasp the changeable information in every minute because of Internet. In addition, distance education provides a whole new way of study, breaking the geographical constraint for all kinds of citizens. This change is huge compared with the previous time when a piece of envelop will take up to two weeks to deliver. Ċ To conclude, computer is just an example. So many inventions can be named as the crucial inventions in the modern world as they dramatically change our lives in every minute in terms of study, work and urgent events. It is hard to judge which one is the greatest although there are different degrees among them. But each of them will make difference in various situations. Thus I take the view that it is meaningless to compare the importance of inventions as no one is more superior than the other.

prompt: Nowadays e-books have become widely spread. Some people claim that e-books are bound to oust conventional ones, while others believe that traditional printed books will never be a thing of the past. Discuss both views and express your opinion.
essay: With the advancement of the digital world, e-books become more popular among readers while many still believe the traditional way of reading will not be replaced. In my opinion, while print books have certain attractiveness, digital books will become dominant. Ċ Many people still prefer reading on printed materials because the feeling of reading on papers is much better comparing to doing so on screens. For instance, focusing on monitors for a long time may negatively affect viewers because the blue rays of the screens may make their eyes and brain feel tired. However, when reading on paper, human's eyes do not affect by that so readers may be able to read for a longer period. Furthermore, collecting printed books is a hobby of many because they believe in the long-term value of books. As a result, there is a large number of traditional book readers because they enjoy reading and collecting physic books. Ċ E-books, on the other hand, have some clear benefits when it comes to convenience. Firstly, digital devices like computers, tablets and phones may hold hundreds of books at the same time which makes it much easier for book lovers to read their books anywhere they want. For example, they may enjoy reading while travelling on public transit without having to carry heavy books. Secondly, prices of e-books are much cheaper comparing to physical ones, so owning them cost less. It is because print books need to be produced in many steps. Finally, owning digital books may also make a great impact on the environment as fewer trees are needed to produce print books. Ċ To conclude, both reading physical or digital books have advantages and disadvantages. I believe e-books will be more popular than printed ones in near future because of its great advantages on price and ease of access.

prompt: Topic: Little has been done to prevent animals and plants from dying out, although people have been aware of this problem for a long time. why have people done so little about it? how can we solve this peoblem.
essay: There is a widely held perception in many parts of the world today that biological diversity is in decline. Oddly, though, very few actions have been taken by people to stem this tide. In this essay, I intend to explore the sources of this vicious circle along with some viable solutions to it. Ċ Clearly, the most serious problem problems of endangered species extinction are often felt in rural areas. As a result of over cultivation & deforestation, natural habitats for plants and animals are increasingly axed. Little wonder, they become dying out. Moreover, some famer still hunt endangered animals for money (e.g. selling their fur, organs, bones etc.). Ironically, on one hand, people criticize poor farmers' illicit behaviors. On the other hand, they aspire things like shark fins, ivories. In addition, many endangered species seriously serve no useful purpose to human beings, thus some people simply do not believe we need to protect them. Ċ In order to save endangered species from extinction, I believe we must first address its root causes. Perhaps the most effective method of doing this would be for government to provide financial incentives to rural dwellers, who willingly sacrifice certain farmlands and converting them to suitable habitats for plants and animals. Admittedly, such incentives would probably not fully compensate farmers for the lose income. However, this would at least soften the hardship of living in a shrunken land resources. One further measure would to promote educational campaigns warning people about the seriousness of the reducing biological diversity. Ċ In reality, of course, the challenges that presented in saving endangered species are numerous and complex. Although they are by no means insurmountable, it is highly unlikely that they will be reserved in the foreseeable future.

prompt: Teenagers face a lot of difficulties at home and at school. Why are they facing these problems? What can be done to solve them?
essay: It is observed that teenagers are facing a lot of problems at their homes and educational institutes also. They are facing these difficulties because of their unbalanced lifestyle and communication gap with their parents and teachers. These causes can be solved by guardian and government take different steps. Ċ Young kids are facing multiple problems in their educational life and social life also. These problems are generating due to communication gap or giving extra priority to something. Usually, parents are busy in their work-life and they do not give proper time to kids. Therefore, children keep them busy in other activities which are not good for their physical and mental health. For example, it is noticed that in Asian countries majority children have mental issues by playing online games like Pub G ,GTA and so on. In addition, in schools teachers are given more concentration to frontbenchers or those who good in results they are not interested in weak students. Thus, weaker students face the difficulties to understand the things and they also show a lack of their interest in their studies. Ċ These problems can be solved by different measures which should be taken by parents, school authorities. Firstly, parents should have to do proper check balance of their kids and give them proper time and try to make friendly relation because by this relation young generation share their activities with their parents than it is easy to counsel them for their wrong activities. For instance, Pakistan bans multiple websites and applications which spread negativity among teenagers. Furthermore, schools management should introduce awareness campaigns to help teachers to understand pupil nature and treat them accordingly. Ċ To summarize, teenagers are the future of every country and it is the responsibility of parents and also teachers to guide them in the right way. Do proper checks balance on their activities and spend more time with them. Also, solve their difficulties by sharing their thoughts.

prompt: Social media sites like Facebook and Twiter have more negative effects than possitive effects. How much you agree with this opinion and why?
essay: It is often said that the adverse influence of digital networking is more than positive effects. It would seem that they are harmful. From my point of view ,I completely agree with this idea. I'm going to explain some of the reasons below. Ċ Firstly ,one of the main reasons for this argument is the impact on the human brain. For example ,in today modern world most of the population are exploiting these kinds of applications all the time. They habitually sleep after midnight. This could cause multiple problems that have a negative impact on our brain these troubles are insomnia and the lack of hormones on the brain. This would probably create a dire situation for people who exert these programmes. Therefore ,this makes it clear why social media such as Facebook and Twitter have many detrimental effects on our healthy lifestyle. Ċ Secondly ,another conspicuous problem is suffering from some psycho illnesses that are definitely dangerous for us. For instance ,the community these days are comparing their personal lives to others constantly. This means they decide to have a lifestyle like their followers.This decision could destroy all rules in a person life. There is no denying that if humans couldn't become successful in this way they become isolated and depressed which are the most common mental disorders in 21 century. As a result ,it becomes apparent there are noticeable negative reasons behind each enjoyment. Ċ To summarise ,I strongly agree digital networking and online applications are the most hazardous things on the globe nowadays. Additionally ,the use of them should be reduced. It is predicted that to continue utilizing these applications the population in the world will suffer from incurable mental disorders in the near future.

prompt: Finding job satisfaction is considered to be a luxury in many countries. Why do you think that is? Do you think job satisfaction is important?
essay: Although there is no doubt that job satisfaction is a crucial factor in any company, it is important to consider what is the impact of such a benefit. there are abundant people who think that elating your employees are an inevitable function. Personally, I am a vehement backer of providing the best work environment to employees. Ċ Undoubtedly, the higher employees happiness, the higher revenue companies can earn. This is an advantage because many workers feel that they are getting the appreciation they deserve for their jobs. For instance, according to The Time, 56 % of workers who get appreciated tend to be more productive than others. In other words, staff at the company will be happy and more dedicated to their tasks if they feel that they are working in a healthy atmosphere at the company. Additionally, these luxurious benefits can readily push them to think out of the box, which can lead to sophisticated strategies helping organizations to grow. Ċ Furthermore, corporations should start working and dedicating their budgets to improve their workplaces to seek the best from their employees. For example, Google which is one of the most leading companies aims to satisfy its employees. This happens because they know that the best investment they can do is enriching your workplace, thus you can get enormous results. In contrast, it is obvious that providing a poor work environment, lack of support and lack of listening to your workers can lead to unforeseen results, which definitely will cause a massive loss. Ċ To sum up, there is a numerous plethora of vantage for any company to invest and raise their level of employees' satisfaction. In my opinion, I wholeheartedly agree that it should be a compulsory function in any organization.

prompt: Some people find visiting museums boring as a form of entertainment, while others believe that the role of museums is to educate people, not entertain. Discuss, what is your opinion?
essay: In our world today, there is a wide variety of museums where people can travel to and see differently interesting things. Some people state that visiting museums is only a form of recreation; others disagree, arguing that museums play a role in education. In fact, each of these arguments has its own validity. Ċ Firstly, museums such as art and music can offer people with a wide range of entertainment activities. For example, they often organise traditional music events performed by local or other famous artists that people can attend to and enjoy to some extent. Another point is that many visitors nowadays may choose to come to museums just for pleasure or as one of the activities that they take part in their holiday trips. This, therefore, makes museums a place to entertain in people leisure time. Ċ On the other hand, the establishment of a particular museum like history, science, or oceanography is usually attached to educational purposes. As can be seen, school and university students and teachers are always the guests of museums because the places are where they can discover and obtain a large amount of information related to their studies and teaching. In addition, there are a number of seminars and conferences held at museums that are informative and necessary for scholars and experts in their fields of research. In this way, museums prove the supporting role in human education. Ċ In conclusion, visiting museums is clearly seen as both means of entertainment and education. However, from my viewpoint, people should perceive the value of museums in enhancing their own knowledge about the world they live in.

prompt: Millions of dollars are spent on space research every year. Some people argue that money should be spent on improving living standards on Earth. Do you agree or disagree ? ( In the future, it seems more difficult to live on the Earth. Some people think more money should be spent on other planets to live on, such as Mars. To what extent do you agree or disagree ? )
essay: There is a controversial perspective heating a debate over the fact that whether a wave of money should be allocated in researching the universe or other fields that enhance people’s living standards. From my point of view, I am well convinced that the budget should be divided equally for both aspects. Ċ It is irrefutable that space travelling acts as a precursor to people’s lives. Obviously, the investment in cutting-edge spacecraft along with exploring the galaxy may play a paramount significant role in preventing fatal situations. The breakthrough in satellite design, which may precisely anticipate extreme natural disasters namely the tsunami or earthquake, can be cited as a viable instance. As a result, people may be well-prepared and avoid unmeasured loss of lives and properties. Moreover, it is an undeniable fact that the Earth is constantly running out of resources in order to meet the ever-growing demand of greedy humans. Therefore, by studying space, the scientists accompanied by the astronauts may discover other cosmos such as Mars for the future generations to reside in case the current globe is completely demolished. Ċ However, besides the tremendous redeeming features of funding space learning, it is vital to put money on for others’ aspects, especially education and healthcare. It is a common norm to state that people are settling in a knowledge-based society where degrees are cherished, which means education is one of the immense determinants to one nations’ flourishing. Hence, investing a budget in this category by reducing tuition fees and providing scholarships for children may efficiently produce qualified workforces for a country. What’s more, medical care systems should also be emphasized. Due to the fact that health is one of the measurements deciding a nation’s prosperity, splurging money on buying top-notch machinery for medical purposes may bring a wealth of benefits to people's health conditions. Ċ To sum up, I am of the opinion that not only probing the milky way but other practical fields namely tutoring and medical-related systems should be spent a large amount of coffer on.

prompt: Today increasing number of people, in particular children and teenagers, play video games for fun. In your opinion, do the drawbacks of video games outweigh the benefits? MY ANSWER
essay: Nowadays, more and more people, especially the younger generation tend to spend their leisure time on video games. My view is that this trend can bring more drawbacks than the benefits. Ċ First of all, playing video games makes people stay indoors for a longer time in their daily life. They prefer sitting in front of a screen rather to do sports outside, which is harmful for both their eyesight and physical posture. This unhealthy lifestyle also prevents people from going out with their friends and reduces their non-virtue communication, which is more likely to make people self-centered and lonely. Ċ For young students who are addicted to video games, there is another extreme drawback that it has an adverse impact on their study. Children and teenagers are thought to be less self-controlled, which means that they may spend too much time on the games after school instead of focusing on their homework. Consequently, there can be a drop of their grades. Some teenagers may even lose the opportunity to enter a better university for being distracted their attention by video games. Ċ However, it is true that video games can make people relax, particularly when they are under great pressure of work or study. Living in a modern society, many people have too limited time and energy to go for a concert or read a classical book to relax themselves. By contrast, video games can release their stress in a shorter time and easier way. Ċ Overall, although video games can be a good choice of entertainment, I believe that people are affected by its disadvantages more. They may form an unhealthy lifestyle or get distracted from study when they are young.
